verses.sanskrit: अग्रे बर्हन्नुषसामूर्ध्वो अस्थान निर्जगन्वान तमसोज्योतिषागात अग्निर्भानुना रुशता सवङग आ जातोविश्वा सद्मान्यप्राः |||
verses.transliteration: aghre bṛhannuṣasāmūrdhvo asthān nirjaghanvān tamasojyotiṣāghāt aghnirbhānunā ruśatā svaṅgha ā jātoviśvā sadmānyaprāḥ

translations.griffith: HIGH hath the Mighty risen before the dawning, and come to us with light from out the darkness.  Fair-shapen Agni with white-shining splendour hath filled at birth all human habitations.

verses.sanskrit: स जातो गर्भो असि रोदस्योरग्ने चारुर्विभ्र्त ओषधीषु चित्रः शिशुः परि तमांस्यक्तून पर मात्र्भ्यो अधिकनिक्रदत गाः |||
verses.transliteration: sa jāto gharbho asi rodasyoraghne cārurvibhṛta oṣadhīṣu citraḥ śiśuḥ pari tamāṃsyaktūn pra mātṛbhyo adhikanikradat ghāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, being born, art Child of Earth and Heaven, parted among the plants in beauty, Agni!  The glooms of night thou, Brilliant Babe, subduest, and art come forth, loud roaring, from thy Mothers.

verses.sanskrit: विष्णुरित्था परममस्य विद्वाञ जातो बर्हन्नभि पातित्र्तीयम आसा यदस्य पयो अक्रत सवं सचेतसो अभ्यर्चन्त्यत्र |||
verses.transliteration: viṣṇuritthā paramamasya vidvāñ jāto bṛhannabhi pātitṛtīyam āsā yadasya payo akrata svaṃ sacetaso abhyarcantyatra

translations.griffith: Here, being manifested, lofty Viṣṇu, full wise, protects his own supremest station.  When they have offered in his mouth their sweet milk, to him with one accord they sing forth praises.

verses.sanskrit: अत उ तवा पितुभ्र्तो जनित्रीरन्नाव्र्धं परति चरन्त्यन्नैः ता ईं परत्येषि पुनरन्यरूपा असि तवं विक्षुमानुषीषु होता |||
verses.transliteration: ata u tvā pitubhṛto janitrīrannāvṛdhaṃ prati carantyannaiḥ tā īṃ pratyeṣi punaranyarūpā asi tvaṃ vikṣumānuṣīṣu hotā

translations.griffith: Thence bearing food the Mothers come to meet thee, with food for thee who givest food its increase.  These in their altered form again thou meetest. Thou art Invoking Priest in homes of mortals.

verses.sanskrit: होतारं चित्ररथमध्वरस्य यज्ञस्य-यज्ञस्य केतुंरुशन्तम परत्यर्धिं देवस्य-देवस्य मह्ना शरिया तवग्निमतिथिं जनानाम |||
verses.transliteration: hotāraṃ citrarathamadhvarasya yajñasya-yajñasya ketuṃruśantam pratyardhiṃ devasya-devasya mahnā śriyā tvaghnimatithiṃ janānām

translations.griffith: Priest of the holy rite, with car that glitters, refulgent Banner of each act of worship,  Sharinging every God through might and glory, even Agni Guest of men I summon hither.

verses.sanskrit: स तु वस्त्राण्यध पेशनानि वसानो अग्निर्नाभाप्र्थिव्याः अरुषो जातः पद इळायाः पुरोहितो राजन्यक्षीह देवान |||
verses.transliteration: sa tu vastrāṇyadha peśanāni vasāno aghnirnābhāpṛthivyāḥ aruṣo jātaḥ pada iḷāyāḥ purohito rājanyakṣīha devān

translations.griffith: So Agni stands on earth's most central station, invested in well-decorated garments.  Born, red of hue, where men pour out libations, O King, as great High Priest bring the Gods hither.

verses.sanskrit: आ हि दयावाप्र्थिवी अग्न उभे सदा पुत्रो न मातराततन्थ पर याह्यछोशतो यविष्ठाथा वह सहस्येहदेवान |||
verses.transliteration: ā hi dyāvāpṛthivī aghna ubhe sadā putro na mātarātatantha pra yāhyachośato yaviṣṭhāthā vaha sahasyehadevān

translations.griffith: Over the earth and over heaven, O Agni, thou, Son, hast ever spread above thy Parents.  Come, Youthfullest! to those who long to meet thee, and hither bring the Gods, O Mighty Victor.

verses.sanskrit: पिप्रीहि देवानुशतो यविष्ठ विद्वान रतून्रतुपतेयजेह ये दैव्या रत्विजस्तेभिरग्ने तवं होतॄणामस्यायजिष्ठः |||
verses.transliteration: piprīhi devānuśato yaviṣṭha vidvān ṛtūnrtupateyajeha ye daivyā ṛtvijastebhiraghne tvaṃ hotṝṇāmasyāyajiṣṭhaḥ

translations.griffith: GLADDEN the yearning Gods, O thou Most Youthful: bring them, O Lord of Seasons, knowing seasons,  With all the Priests Celestial, O Agni. Best worshipper art thou of all Invokers.

verses.sanskrit: वेषि होत्रमुत पोत्रं जनानां मन्धातासि दरविणोदार्तावा सवाहा वयं कर्णवामा हवींषि देवो देवान्यजत्वग्निरर्हन |||
verses.transliteration: veṣi hotramuta potraṃ janānāṃ mandhātāsi draviṇodāṛtāvā svāhā vayaṃ kṛṇavāmā havīṃṣi devo devānyajatvaghnirarhan

translations.griffith: Thine is the Herald's, thine the Cleanser's office, thinker art thou, wealth-giver, true to Order.  Let us with Svāhā offer up oblations, and Agni, worthy God, pay the Gods worship.

verses.sanskrit: आ देवानामपि पन्थामगन्म यच्छक्नवाम तदनुप्रवोळुम अग्निर्विद्वान स यजात सेदु होता सो अध्वरांस रतून कल्पयाति |||
verses.transliteration: ā devānāmapi panthāmaghanma yacchaknavāma tadanupravoḷum aghnirvidvān sa yajāt sedu hotā so adhvarāṃsa ṛtūn kalpayāti

translations.griffith: To the Gods’ pathway have we travelled, ready to execute what work we may accomplish.  Let Agni, for he knows, complete the worship. He is the Priest: let him fix rites and seasons.

verses.sanskrit: यद वो वयं परमिनाम वरतानि विदुषं देवाविदुष्टरासः अग्निष टद विश्वमा पर्णाति विद्वान्येभिर्देवान रतुभिः कल्पयाति |||
verses.transliteration: yad vo vayaṃ pramināma vratāni viduṣaṃ devāaviduṣṭarāsaḥ aghniṣ ṭad viśvamā pṛṇāti vidvānyebhirdevān ṛtubhiḥ kalpayāti

translations.griffith: When we most ignorant neglect the statutes of you, O Deities with whom is knowledge,  Wise Agni shall correct our faults and failings, skilled to assign each God his fitting season.

verses.sanskrit: यत पाकत्रा मनसा दीनदक्षा न यज्ञस्य मन्वतेमर्त्यासः अग्निष टद धोता करतुविद विजानन्यजिष्ठो देवान रतुशो यजाति |||
verses.transliteration: yat pākatrā manasā dīnadakṣā na yajñasya manvatemartyāsaḥ aghniṣ ṭad dhotā kratuvid vijānanyajiṣṭho devān ṛtuśo yajāti

translations.griffith: When, weak in mind, of feeble understanding, mortals bethink them not of sacrificing,  Then shall the prudent and discerning Agni worship the Gods, best worshipper, in season.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वेषां हयध्वराणामनीकं चित्रं केतुं जनितात्वा जजान स आ यजस्व नर्वतीरनु कषा सपार्हािषः कषुमतीर्विश्वजन्याः |||
verses.transliteration: viśveṣāṃ hyadhvarāṇāmanīkaṃ citraṃ ketuṃ janitātvā jajāna sa ā yajasva nṛvatīranu kṣā spārhāiṣaḥ kṣumatīrviśvajanyāḥ

translations.griffith: Because the Father hath produced thee, Leader of all our solemn rites, their brilliant Banner:  So win by worship pleasant homes abounding in heroes, and rich food to nourish all men.

verses.sanskrit: यं तवा दयावाप्र्थिवी यं तवापस्त्वष्टा यं तवासुजनिमा जजान पन्थामनु परविद्वान्पित्र्याणं दयुमदग्ने समिधानो वि भाहि |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ tvā dyāvāpṛthivī yaṃ tvāpastvaṣṭā yaṃ tvāsujanimā jajāna panthāmanu pravidvānpitṛyāṇaṃ dyumadaghne samidhāno vi bhāhi

translations.griffith: Thou whom the Heaven and Earth, thou whom the Waters, and Tvaṣṭar, maker of fair things, created,  Well knowing, all along the Fathers' pathway, shine with resplendent light, enkindled, Agni.

verses.sanskrit: इनो राजन्नरतिः समिद्धो रौद्रो दक्षाय सुषुमानदर्शि चिकिद वि भाति भासा बर्हतासिक्नीमेति रुशतीमपाजन |||
verses.transliteration: ino rājannaratiḥ samiddho raudro dakṣāya suṣumānadarśi cikid vi bhāti bhāsā bṛhatāsiknīmeti ruśatīmapājan

translations.griffith: O KING, the potent and terrific envoy, kindled for strength, is manifest in beauty.  He shines, all-knowing, with his lotty splendour: chasing black Night he comes with white-rayed Morning.

verses.sanskrit: कर्ष्णां यदेनीमभि वर्पसा भूज्जनयन योषाम्ब्र्हतः पितुर्जाम ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सूर्यस्य सतभायन्दिवो वसुभिररतिर्वि भाति |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṣṇāṃ yadenīmabhi varpasā bhūjjanayan yoṣāmbṛhataḥ piturjām ūrdhvaṃ bhānuṃ sūryasya stabhāyandivo vasubhiraratirvi bhāti

translations.griffith: Having o’ercome the glimmering Black with beauty, and bringing forth the dame the Great Sire's Daughter,  Holding aloft the radiant light of Sūrya, as messenger of heaven he shines with treasures.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रो भद्रया सचमान आगात सवसारं जारो अभ्येतिपश्चात सुप्रकेतैर्द्युभिरग्निर्वितिष्ठन रुशद्भिर्वर्णैरभि राममस्थात |||
verses.transliteration: bhadro bhadrayā sacamāna āghāt svasāraṃ jāro abhyetipaścāt supraketairdyubhiraghnirvitiṣṭhan ruśadbhirvarṇairabhi rāmamasthāt

translations.griffith: Attendant on the Blessed Dame the Blessed hath come: the Lover followeth his Sister.  Agni, far-spreading with conspicuous lustre, hath compassed Night with whitelyshining garments.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य यामासो बर्हतो न वग्नूनिन्धाना अग्नेः सख्युःशिवस्य इड्यस्य वर्ष्णो बर्हतः सवासो भामासो यामन्नक्तवश्चिकित्रे |||
verses.transliteration: asya yāmāso bṛhato na vaghnūnindhānā aghneḥ sakhyuḥśivasya iḍyasya vṛṣṇo bṛhataḥ svāso bhāmāso yāmannaktavaścikitre

translations.griffith: His goings-forth kindle as ’twere high voices the goings of the auspicious Friend of Agni.  The rays, the bright beams of the strong-jawed, mighty, adorable Steer are visible as he cometh.

verses.sanskrit: सवना न यस्य भामासः पवन्ते रोचमानस्य बर्हतःसुदिवः जयेष्ठेभिर्यस्तेजिष्ठैः करीळुमद्भिर्वर्षिष्ठेभिर्भानुभिर्नक्षति दयाम |||
verses.transliteration: svanā na yasya bhāmāsaḥ pavante rocamānasya bṛhataḥsudivaḥ jyeṣṭhebhiryastejiṣṭhaiḥ krīḷumadbhirvarṣiṣṭhebhirbhānubhirnakṣati dyām

translations.griffith: Whose radiant splendours flow, like sounds, about us, his who is lofty, brilliant, and effulgent,  Who reaches heaven with best and brightest lustres, sportive and piercing even to the summit.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य शुष्मासो दद्र्शानपवेर्जेहमानस्य सवनयन नियुद्भिः परत्नेभिर्यो रुशद्भिर्देवतमो वि रेभद्भिररतिर्भाति विभ्वा |||
verses.transliteration: asya śuṣmāso dadṛśānapaverjehamānasya svanayan niyudbhiḥ pratnebhiryo ruśadbhirdevatamo vi rebhadbhiraratirbhāti vibhvā

translations.griffith: His powers, whose chariot fellies gleam and glitter have loudly roared while, as with teams, he hasted.  He, the most Godlike, far-extending envoy, shines with flames ancient, resonant, whitely-shining.

verses.sanskrit: स आ वक्षि महि न आ च सत्सि दिवस्प्र्थिव्योररतिर्युवत्योः अग्निः सुतुकः सुतुकेभिरश्वै रभस्वद्भीरभस्वानेह गम्याः |||
verses.transliteration: sa ā vakṣi mahi na ā ca satsi divaspṛthivyoraratiryuvatyoḥ aghniḥ sutukaḥ sutukebhiraśvai rabhasvadbhīrabhasvāneha ghamyāḥ

translations.griffith: So bring us ample wealth: seat thee as envoy of the two youthful Matrons, Earth and Heaven.  Let Agni rapid with his rapid, horses, impetuous with impetuous Steeds, come hither.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते यक्षि पर त इयर्मि मन्म भुवो यथा वन्द्यो नोहवेषु धन्वन्निव परपा असि तवमग्न इयक्षवे पूरवेप्रत्न राजन |||
verses.transliteration: pra te yakṣi pra ta iyarmi manma bhuvo yathā vandyo nohaveṣu dhanvanniva prapā asi tvamaghna iyakṣave pūravepratna rājan

translations.griffith: To thee will send praise and bring oblation, as thou hast merited lauds when we invoked thee.  A fountain in the desert art thou, Agni, O Ancient King, to man who fain would worship,

verses.sanskrit: यं तवा जनासो अभि संचरन्ति गाव उष्णमिव वरजंयविष्ठ दूतो देवानामसि मर्त्यानामन्तर्महांश्चरसि रोचनेन |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ tvā janāso abhi saṃcaranti ghāva uṣṇamiva vrajaṃyaviṣṭha dūto devānāmasi martyānāmantarmahāṃścarasi rocanena

translations.griffith: Thou unto whom resort the gathered people, as the kine seek the warm stall, O Most Youthful.  Thou art the messenger of Gods and mortals, and goest glorious with thy light between them.

verses.sanskrit: शिशुं न तवा जेन्यं वर्धयन्ती माता बिभर्तिसचनस्यमाना धनोरधि परवता यासि हर्यञ जिगीषसेपशुरिवावस्र्ष्टः |||
verses.transliteration: śiśuṃ na tvā jenyaṃ vardhayantī mātā bibhartisacanasyamānā dhanoradhi pravatā yāsi haryañ jighīṣasepaśurivāvasṛṣṭaḥ

translations.griffith: Making thee grow as ’twere some noble infant, thy Mother nurtures thee with sweet affection.  Over the desert slopes thou passest longing, and seekest, like some beast set free, thy fodder.

verses.sanskrit: मूरा अमूर न वयं चिकित्वो महित्वमग्ने तवमङग वित्से शये वव्रिश्चरति जिह्वयादन रेरिह्यते युवतिंविश्पतिः सन |||
verses.transliteration: mūrā amūra na vayaṃ cikitvo mahitvamaghne tvamaṅgha vitse śaye vavriścarati jihvayādan rerihyate yuvatiṃviśpatiḥ san

translations.griffith: Foolish are we, O Wise and free from error: verily, Agni, thou dost know thy grandeur.  There lies the form: he moves and licks, and swallows, and, as House-Lord, kisses the Youthful Maiden.

verses.sanskrit: कूचिज्जायते सनयासु नव्यो वने तस्थौ पलितो धूमकेतुः अस्नातापो वर्षभो न पर वेति सचेतसो यं पर्णयन्तमर्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: kūcijjāyate sanayāsu navyo vane tasthau palito dhūmaketuḥ asnātāpo vṛṣabho na pra veti sacetaso yaṃ parṇayantamartāḥ

translations.griffith: He rises ever fresh in ancient fuel: smoke-bannered, gray, he makes the wood his dwelling.  No swimmer, Steer, he presses through the waters, and to his place accordant mortals bear him.

verses.sanskrit: तनूत्यजेव तस्करा वनर्गु रशनाभिर्दशभिरभ्यधीताम इयं ते अग्ने नव्यसी मनीषा युक्ष्वा रथंन शुचयद्भिरङगैः |||
verses.transliteration: tanūtyajeva taskarā vanarghu raśanābhirdaśabhirabhyadhītām iyaṃ te aghne navyasī manīṣā yukṣvā rathaṃna śucayadbhiraṅghaiḥ

translations.griffith: Like thieves who risk their lives and haunt the forest, the twain with their ten girdles have secured him.  This is a new hymn meant for thee, O Agni: yoke as it were thy car with parts that glitter.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्म च ते जातवेदो नमश्चेयं च गीः सदमिद्वर्धनी भूत रक्षा णो अग्ने तनयानि तोका रक्षोत नस्तन्वो अप्रयुछन |||
verses.transliteration: brahma ca te jātavedo namaśceyaṃ ca ghīḥ sadamidvardhanī bhūt rakṣā ṇo aghne tanayāni tokā rakṣota nastanvo aprayuchan

translations.griffith: Homage and prayer are thine, O Jātavedas, and this my song shall evermore exalt thee.  Agni, protect our children and descendants, and guard with ever-watcliful care our bodies.

verses.sanskrit: एकः समुद्रो धरुणो रयीणामस्मद धर्दो भूरिजन्मा विचष्टे सिषक्त्यूधर्निण्योरुपस्थ उत्सस्य मध्येनिहितं पदं वेः |||
verses.transliteration: ekaḥ samudro dharuṇo rayīṇāmasmad dhṛdo bhūrijanmā vicaṣṭe siṣaktyūdharniṇyorupastha utsasya madhyenihitaṃ padaṃ veḥ

translations.griffith: HE only is the Sea, holder of treasures: born many a time he views the hearts within us.  He hides him in the secret couple's bosom. The Bird dwells in the middle of the fountain.

verses.sanskrit: समानं नीळं वर्षणो वसानाः सं जग्मिरे महिषार्वतीभिः रतस्य पदं कवयो नि पान्ति गुहा नामानिदधिरे पराणि |||
verses.transliteration: samānaṃ nīḷaṃ vṛṣaṇo vasānāḥ saṃ jaghmire mahiṣāarvatībhiḥ ṛtasya padaṃ kavayo ni pānti ghuhā nāmānidadhire parāṇi

translations.griffith: Inhabiting one dwelling-place in common, strong Stallions and the Mares have come together.  The sages guard the seat of Holy Order, and keep the highest names concealed within them.

verses.sanskrit: रतायिनी मायिनी सं दधाते मित्वा शिशुं जज्ञतुर्वर्धयन्ती विश्वस्य नाभिं चरतो धरुवस्य कवेश्चित्तन्तुं मनसा वियन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtāyinī māyinī saṃ dadhāte mitvā śiśuṃ jajñaturvardhayantī viśvasya nābhiṃ carato dhruvasya kaveścittantuṃ manasā viyantaḥ

translations.griffith: The Holy Pair, of wondrous power, have coupled: they formed the Infant, they who bred produced him.  The central point of all that moves and moves not, the while they wove the Sage's thread with insight

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य हि वर्तनयः सुजातमिषो वाजाय परदिवःसचन्ते अधीवासं रोदसी वावसाने घर्तैरन्नैर्वाव्र्धाते मधूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya hi vartanayaḥ sujātamiṣo vājāya pradivaḥsacante adhīvāsaṃ rodasī vāvasāne ghṛtairannairvāvṛdhāte madhūnām

translations.griffith: For tracks of Order and refreshing viands attend from ancient times the goodly Infant.  Wearing him as a mantle, Earth and Heaven grow strong by food of pleasant drink and fatness.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त सवसॄररुषीर्वावशानो विद्वान मध्व उज्जभाराद्र्शे कम अन्तर्येमे अन्तरिक्षे पुराजा इछन वव्रिमविदत्पूषणस्य |||
verses.transliteration: sapta svasṝraruṣīrvāvaśāno vidvān madhva ujjabhārādṛśe kam antaryeme antarikṣe purājā ichan vavrimavidatpūṣaṇasya

translations.griffith: He, calling loudly to the Seven red Sisters, hath, skilled in sweet drink, brought them to be looked on.  He, born of old, in middle air hath halted, and sought and found the covering robe of Pūṣan.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त मर्यादाः कवयस्ततक्षुस्तासामेकामिदभ्यंहुरो गात आयोर्ह सकम्भ उपमस्य नीळे पथांविसर्गे धरुणेषु तस्थौ |||
verses.transliteration: sapta maryādāḥ kavayastatakṣustāsāmekāmidabhyaṃhuro ghāt āyorha skambha upamasya nīḷe pathāṃvisarghe dharuṇeṣu tasthau

translations.griffith: Seven are the pathways which the wise have fashioned; to one of these may come the troubled mortal.  He standeth in the dwelling of the Highest, a Pillar, on sure ground where paths are parted.

verses.sanskrit: असच्च सच्च परमे वयोमन दक्षस्य जन्मन्नदितेरुपस्थे अग्निर्ह नः पर थमजा रतस्य पूर्व आयुनि वर्षभश्चधेनुः |||
verses.transliteration: asacca sacca parame vyoman dakṣasya janmannaditerupasthe aghnirha naḥ pra thamajā ṛtasya pūrva āyuni vṛṣabhaścadhenuḥ

translations.griffith: Not Being, Being in the highest heaven, in Aditi's bosom and in Dakṣa's birthplace,  Is Agni, our first-born of Holy Order, the Milch-cow and the Bull in life's beginning.

verses.sanskrit: अयं स यस्य शर्मन्नवोभिरग्नेरेधते जरिताभिष्टौ जयेष्ठेभिर्यो भानुभिरषूणां पर्येति परिवीतोविभावा |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ sa yasya śarmannavobhiraghneredhate jaritābhiṣṭau jyeṣṭhebhiryo bhānubhirṣūṇāṃ paryeti parivītovibhāvā

translations.griffith: THIS is that Agni, he by whose protection, favour, and help. the singer is successful;  Who with the noblest flames of glowing fuel comes forth encompassed with far-spreading lustre.

verses.sanskrit: यो भनुभिर्विभावा विभात्यग्निर्देवेभिरतावाजस्रः आ यो विवाय सख्या सखिभ्यो.अपरिह्व्र्तो अत्यो न सप्तिः |||
verses.transliteration: yo bhanubhirvibhāvā vibhātyaghnirdevebhirtāvājasraḥ ā yo vivāya sakhyā sakhibhyo.aparihvṛto atyo na saptiḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, the Holy One, the everlasting, who shines far beaming with celestial splendours;  He who hath come unto his friends with friendship, like a fleet steed who never trips or stumbles.

verses.sanskrit: ईशे यो विश्वस्या देववीतेरीशे विश्वायुरुषसोव्युष्टौ आ यस्मिन मना हवींष्यग्नावरिष्टरथस्कभ्नाति शूषैः |||
verses.transliteration: īśe yo viśvasyā devavīterīśe viśvāyuruṣasovyuṣṭau ā yasmin manā havīṃṣyaghnāvariṣṭarathaskabhnāti śūṣaiḥ

translations.griffith: He who is Lord of all divine oblation, shared by all living men at break of morning,  Agni to whom our offerings are devoted, in whom rests he whose car, through might, is scatheless.

verses.sanskrit: शूषेभिर्व्र्धो जुषाणो अर्कैर्देवानछा रघुपत्वाजिगाति मन्द्रो होता स जुह्वा यजिष्ठः सम्मिश्लो अग्निरा जिघर्ति देवान |||
verses.transliteration: śūṣebhirvṛdho juṣāṇo arkairdevānachā raghupatvājighāti mandro hotā sa juhvā yajiṣṭhaḥ sammiślo aghnirā jigharti devān

translations.griffith: Increasing by his strength. while lauds content him, with easy flight unto the Gods he travels.  Agni the cheerful Priest, best Sacrificer, balms with his tongue the Gods with whom he mingles.

verses.sanskrit: तमुस्रामिन्द्रं न रेजमानमग्निं गीर्भिर्नमोभिराक्र्णुध्वम आ यं विप्रासो मतिभिर्ग्र्णन्ति जातवेदसंजुह्वं सहानाम |||
verses.transliteration: tamusrāmindraṃ na rejamānamaghniṃ ghīrbhirnamobhirākṛṇudhvam ā yaṃ viprāso matibhirghṛṇanti jātavedasaṃjuhvaṃ sahānām

translations.griffith: With songs and adorations bring ye hither Agni who stirs himself at dawn like Indra,  Whom sages laud with hymns as Jātavedas of those who wield the sacrificial ladle.

verses.sanskrit: सं यस्मिन विश्वा वसूनि जग्मुर्वाजे नाश्वाःसप्तीवन्त एवैः अस्मे ऊतीरिन्द्रवाततमा अर्वाचीनाग्न आ कर्णुष्व |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yasmin viśvā vasūni jaghmurvāje nāśvāḥsaptīvanta evaiḥ asme ūtīrindravātatamā arvācīnāaghna ā kṛṇuṣva

translations.griffith: In whom all goodly treasures meet together, even as steeds and riders for the booty.  Inclining hither bring us help, O Agni, even assistance most desired by Indra.

verses.sanskrit: अधा हयग्ने मह्ना निषद्या सद्यो जज्ञानो हव्यो बभूथ तं ते देवासो अनु केतमायन्नधावर्धन्त परथमासूमाः |||
verses.transliteration: adhā hyaghne mahnā niṣadyā sadyo jajñāno havyo babhūtha taṃ te devāso anu ketamāyannadhāvardhanta prathamāsaūmāḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, at thy birth, when thou hadst sat in glory, thou, Agni, wast the aim of invocations.  The Gods came near, obedient to thy sunimons, and thus attained their rank as chief Protectors.

verses.sanskrit: सवस्ति नो दिवो अग्ने पर्थिव्या विश्वायुर्धेहि यजथाय देव सचेमहि तव दस्म परकेतैरुरुष्या ण उरुभिर्देवशंसैः |||
verses.transliteration: svasti no divo aghne pṛthivyā viśvāyurdhehi yajathāya deva sacemahi tava dasma praketairuruṣyā ṇa urubhirdevaśaṃsaiḥ

translations.griffith: O AGNI, shared by all men living bring us good luck for sacrifice from earth and heaven.  With us be thine intelligence, WonderWorker! Protect us, God, with thy far-reaching blessings.

verses.sanskrit: इमा अग्ने मतयस्तुभ्यं जाता गोभिरश्वैरभि गर्णन्तिरधः यदा ते मर्तो अनु भोगमानड वसो दधानोमतिभिः सुजात |||
verses.transliteration: imā aghne matayastubhyaṃ jātā ghobhiraśvairabhi ghṛṇantiradhaḥ yadā te marto anu bhoghamānaḍ vaso dadhānomatibhiḥ sujāta

translations.griffith: These hymns brought forth for thee, O Agni, laud thee for bounteous gifts, with cattle and with horses.  Good Lord, when man from thee hath gained enjoyment, by hymns, O noblyborn, hath he obtained it.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं मन्ये पितरमग्निमापिमग्निं भरातरं सदमित्सखायम अग्नेरनीकं बर्हतः सपर्यं दिवि शुक्रंयजतं सूर्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ manye pitaramaghnimāpimaghniṃ bhrātaraṃ sadamitsakhāyam aghneranīkaṃ bṛhataḥ saparyaṃ divi śukraṃyajataṃ sūryasya

translations.griffith: Agni I deem my Kinsman and my Father, count him my Brother and my Friend for ever.  I honour as the face of lofty Agni in heaven the bright and holy light of Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: सिध्रा अग्ने धियो अस्मे सनुत्रीर्यं तरायसे दम आनित्यहोता रतवा स रोहिदश्वः पुरुक्षुर्द्युभिरस्माहभिर्वाममस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: sidhrā aghne dhiyo asme sanutrīryaṃ trāyase dama ānityahotā ṛtavā sa rohidaśvaḥ purukṣurdyubhirasmāahabhirvāmamastu

translations.griffith: Effectual, Agni, are our prayers for profit. He whom, at home thou, Priest for ever, guardest  Is rich in food, drawn by red steeds, and holy: by day and night to him shall all be pleasant.

verses.sanskrit: दयुभिर्हितं मित्रमिव परयोगं परत्नं रत्विजमध्वरस्यजारम बाहुभ्यामग्निमायवो.अजनन्त विक्षु होतारं नयसादयन्त |||
verses.transliteration: dyubhirhitaṃ mitramiva prayoghaṃ pratnaṃ ṛtvijamadhvarasyajāram bāhubhyāmaghnimāyavo.ajananta vikṣu hotāraṃ nyasādayanta

translations.griffith: Men with their arms have generated Agni, helpful as some kind friend, adorned with splendours,  And stablished as Invoker mid the people the ancient Priest the sacrifice's lover.

verses.sanskrit: सवयं यजस्व दिवि देव देवान किं ते पाकः कर्णवदप्रचेताः यथायज रतुभिर्देव देवानेवा यजस्वतन्वं सुजात |||
verses.transliteration: svayaṃ yajasva divi deva devān kiṃ te pākaḥ kṛṇavadapracetāḥ yathāyaja ṛtubhirdeva devānevā yajasvatanvaṃ sujāta

translations.griffith: Worship, thyself, O God, the Gods in heaven: what, void of knowledge, shall the fool avail thee?  As thou, O God, hast worshipped Gods by seasons, so, nobly-born! to thine own self pay worship.

verses.sanskrit: भवा नो अग्ने.अवितोत गोपा भवा वयस्क्र्दुत नोवयोधाः रास्वा च नः सुमहो हव्यदातिं तरास्वोत नस्तन्वो अप्रयुछन |||
verses.transliteration: bhavā no aghne.avitota ghopā bhavā vayaskṛduta novayodhāḥ rāsvā ca naḥ sumaho havyadātiṃ trāsvota nastanvo aprayuchan

translations.griffith: Agni, be thou our Guardian and Protector bestow upon us life and vital vigour.  Accept, O Mighty One, the gifts we offer, and with unceasing care protect our bodies.

verses.sanskrit: पर केतुना बर्हता यात्यग्निरा रोदसी वर्षभो रोरवीति दिवश्चिदन्तानुपमानुदानळ अपामुपस्थे महिषोववर्ध |||
verses.transliteration: pra ketunā bṛhatā yātyaghnirā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti divaścidantānupamānudānaḷ apāmupasthe mahiṣovavardha

translations.griffith: AGNI advances with his lofty banner: the Bull is bellowing to the earth and heavens.  He hath attained the sky's supremest limits. the Steer hath waxen in the lap of waters.

verses.sanskrit: मुमोद गर्भो वर्षभः ककुद्मानस्रेमा वत्सः शिमीवानरावीत स देवतात्युद्यतानि कर्ण्वन सवेषु कषयेषुप्रथमो जिगाति |||
verses.transliteration: mumoda gharbho vṛṣabhaḥ kakudmānasremā vatsaḥ śimīvānarāvīt sa devatātyudyatāni kṛṇvan sveṣu kṣayeṣuprathamo jighāti

translations.griffith: The Bull, the youngling with the hump, hath frolicked, the strong and never-ceasing Calf hath bellowed.  Bringing our offerings to the God's assembly, he moves as Chief in his own dwelling-places.

verses.sanskrit: आ यो मूर्धानं पित्रोररब्ध नयध्वरे दधिरे सूरोर्णः अस्य पत्मन्नरुषीरश्वभुध्ना रतस्य योनौतन्वो जुषन्त |||
verses.transliteration: ā yo mūrdhānaṃ pitrorarabdha nyadhvare dadhire sūroarṇaḥ asya patmannaruṣīraśvabhudhnā ṛtasya yonautanvo juṣanta

translations.griffith: Him who hath grasped his Parents' head, they stablished at sacrifice a wave of heavenly lustre.  In his swift flight the red Dawns borne by horses refresh their bodies in the home of Order.

verses.sanskrit: उष-उषो हि वसो अग्रमेषि तवं यमयोरभवो विभावा रताय सप्त दधिषे पदानि जनयन मित्रं तन्वे सवायै |||
verses.transliteration: uṣa-uṣo hi vaso aghrameṣi tvaṃ yamayorabhavo vibhāvā ṛtāya sapta dadhiṣe padāni janayan mitraṃ tanve svāyai

translations.griffith: For, Vasu thou precedest every Morning, and still hast been the Twins' illuminator.  For sacrifice, seven places thou retainest while for thine own self thou engenderest Mitra.

verses.sanskrit: भुवश्चक्षुर्मह रतस्य गोपा भुवो वरुणो यद रतायवेषि भुवो अपां नपाज्जातवेदो भुवो दूतो यस्यहव्यं जुजोषः |||
verses.transliteration: bhuvaścakṣurmaha ṛtasya ghopā bhuvo varuṇo yad ṛtāyaveṣi bhuvo apāṃ napājjātavedo bhuvo dūto yasyahavyaṃ jujoṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou art the Eye and Guard of mighty Order, and Varuṇa when to sacrifice thou comest.  Thou art the Waters’ Child O Jātavedas, envoy of him whose offering thou acceptest.

verses.sanskrit: भुवो यज्ञस्य रजसश्च नेता यत्रा नियुद्भिः सचसेशिवाभिः दिवि मूर्धानं दधिषे सवर्षां जिह्वामग्नेचक्र्षे हव्यवाहम |||
verses.transliteration: bhuvo yajñasya rajasaśca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacaseśivābhiḥ divi mūrdhānaṃ dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ jihvāmaghnecakṛṣe havyavāham

translations.griffith: Thou art the Leader of the rite and region, to which with thine auspicious teams thou teadest,  Thy light-bestowing head to heaven thou liftest, making thy tongue the oblationbearer, Agni.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य तरितः करतुना वव्रे अन्तरिछन धीतिं पितुरेवैःपरस्य सचस्यमानः पित्रोरुपस्थे जामि बरुवाणायुधानि वेति |||
verses.transliteration: asya tritaḥ kratunā vavre antarichan dhītiṃ piturevaiḥparasya sacasyamānaḥ pitrorupasthe jāmi bruvāṇaāyudhāni veti

translations.griffith: Through his wise insight Trita in the cavern, seeking as ever the Chief Sire's intention,  Carefully tended in his Parents' bosom, calling the weapons kin, goes forth to combat.

verses.sanskrit: स पित्र्याण्यायुधनि विद्वनिन्द्रेषित आप्त्यो अभ्ययुध्यत तरिशीर्षाणं सप्तरश्मिं जघन्वान तवाष्ट्रस्य चिन्निः सस्र्जे तरितो गाः |||
verses.transliteration: sa pitryāṇyāyudhani vidvanindreṣita āptyo abhyayudhyat triśīrṣāṇaṃ saptaraśmiṃ jaghanvān tvāṣṭrasya cinniḥ sasṛje trito ghāḥ

translations.griffith: Well-skilled to use the weapons of his Father, Āptya, urged on by Indra, fought the battle.  Then Trita slew the foe seven-rayed, three-headed, and freed the cattle of the Son of Tvaṣṭar.

verses.sanskrit: भूरीदिन्द्र उदिनक्षन्तमोजो.अवाभिनत सत्पतिर्मन्यमानम तवाष्ट्रस्य चिद विश्वरूपस्य गोनामाचक्रणस्त्रीणि शीर्षा परा वर्क |||
verses.transliteration: bhūrīdindra udinakṣantamojo.avābhinat satpatirmanyamānam tvāṣṭrasya cid viśvarūpasya ghonāmācakraṇastrīṇi śīrṣā parā vark

translations.griffith: Lord of the brave, Indra cleft him in pieces who sought to gain much strength and deemed him mighty.  He smote his three heads from his body, seizing the cattle of the oniniform Son of Tvaṣṭar.

verses.sanskrit: आपो हि षठा मयोभुवस्ता न ऊर्जे दधातन महेरणाय चक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: āpo hi ṣṭhā mayobhuvastā na ūrje dadhātana maheraṇāya cakṣase

translations.griffith: YE, Waters, are beneficent: so help ye us to energy  That we may look on great delight.

verses.sanskrit: यो वः शिवतमो रसस्तस्य भजयतेह नः उशतीरिवमातरः |||
verses.transliteration: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasastasya bhajayateha naḥ uśatīrivamātaraḥ

translations.griffith: Give us a portion of the sap, the most auspicious that ye have,  Like mothers in their longing love.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मा अरं गमाम वो यस्य कषयाय जिन्वथ आपोजनयथा च नः |||
verses.transliteration: tasmā araṃ ghamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha āpojanayathā ca naḥ

translations.griffith: To you we gladly come for him to whose abode ye send us on;  And, Waters, give us procreant strength.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो देवीरभिष्टय आपो भवन्तु पीतये शं योरभि सरवन्तु नः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no devīrabhiṣṭaya āpo bhavantu pītaye śaṃ yorabhi sravantu naḥ

translations.griffith: The Waters. be to us for drink, Goddesses for our aid and bliss:  Let them stream to us health and strength.

verses.sanskrit: ईशाना वार्याणां कषयन्तीश्चर्षणीनाम अपोयाचामि भेषजम |||
verses.transliteration: īśānā vāryāṇāṃ kṣayantīścarṣaṇīnām apoyācāmi bheṣajam

translations.griffith: 1 beg the Floods to give us balm, these Queens who rule o’er precious things,  And have supreme control of men.

verses.sanskrit: अप्सु मे सोमो अब्रवीदन्तर्विश्वानि भेषजा अग्निं चविश्वशम्भुवम |||
verses.transliteration: apsu me somo abravīdantarviśvāni bheṣajā aghniṃ caviśvaśambhuvam

translations.griffith: Within the Waters-Soma thus hath told me-dwell all balms that heal,  And Agni, he who blesseth all.

verses.sanskrit: आपः पर्णीत भेषजां वरूथं तन्वे मम जयोक चसूर्यं दर्शे |||
verses.transliteration: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajāṃ varūthaṃ tanve mama jyok casūryaṃ dṛśe

translations.griffith: O Waters, teem with medicine to keep my body safe from harm,  So that I long may see the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: इदमापः पर वहत यत किं च दुरितं मयि यद वाहमभिदुद्रोह यद व शेप उतान्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: idamāpaḥ pra vahata yat kiṃ ca duritaṃ mayi yad vāhamabhidudroha yad va śepa utānṛtam

translations.griffith: Whatever sin is found in me, whatever evil I have wrought,  If I have lied or falsely sworn, Waters, remove it far from me.

verses.sanskrit: आपो अद्यान्वचारिषं रसेन समगस्महि पयस्वानग्ना गहि तं मा सं सर्ज वर्चसा |||
verses.transliteration: āpo adyānvacāriṣaṃ rasena samaghasmahi payasvānaghnaā ghahi taṃ mā saṃ sṛja varcasā

translations.griffith: The Waters I this day have sought, and to their moisture have we come:  O Agni, rich in milk, come thou, and with thy splendour cover me.

verses.sanskrit: ओ चित सखायं सख्या वव्र्त्यां तिरः पुरू चिदर्णवंजगन्वन पितुर्नपातमा दधीत वेधा अधि कषमिप्रतरं दिध्यानः |||
verses.transliteration: o cit sakhāyaṃ sakhyā vavṛtyāṃ tiraḥ purū cidarṇavaṃjaghanvan piturnapātamā dadhīta vedhā adhi kṣamiprataraṃ didhyānaḥ

translations.griffith: FAIN would I win my friend to kindly friendship. So may the Sage, come through the air's wide ocean,  Remembering the earth and days to follow, obtain a son, the issue of his father.

verses.sanskrit: न ते सखा सख्यं वष्ट्येतत सलक्ष्मा यद विषुरूपाभवाति महस पुत्रसो असुरस्य वीरा दिवो धर्तारौर्विया परि खयन |||
verses.transliteration: na te sakhā sakhyaṃ vaṣṭyetat salakṣmā yad viṣurūpābhavāti mahas putraso asurasya vīrā divo dhartāraurviyā pari khyan

translations.griffith: Thy friend loves not the friendship which considers her who is near in kindred as stranger.  Sons of the mighty Asura, the Heroes, supporters of the heavens, see far around them.

verses.sanskrit: उशन्ति घा ते अम्र्तास एतदेकस्य चित तयजसं मर्त्यस्य नि ते मनो मनसि धाय्यस्मे जन्युः पतिस्तन्वमाविविश्याः |||
verses.transliteration: uśanti ghā te amṛtāsa etadekasya cit tyajasaṃ martyasya ni te mano manasi dhāyyasme janyuḥ patistanvamāviviśyāḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, this the Immortals seek of thee with longing, progeny of the sole existing mortal.  Then let thy soul and mine be knit together, and as a loving husband take thy consort.

verses.sanskrit: न यत पुरा चक्र्मा कद ध नूनं रता वदन्तो अन्र्तंरपेम गन्धर्वो अप्स्वप्या च योषा सा नो नाभिःपरमं जामि तन नौ |||
verses.transliteration: na yat purā cakṛmā kad dha nūnaṃ ṛtā vadanto anṛtaṃrapema ghandharvo apsvapyā ca yoṣā sā no nābhiḥparamaṃ jāmi tan nau

translations.griffith: Shall we do now what we ne’er did aforetime? we who spake righteously now talk impurely?  Gandharva in the floods, the Dame of Waters-such is our bond, such our most lofty kinship.

verses.sanskrit: गर्भे नु नौ जनिता दम्पती कर्देवास्त्वष्टा सविताविश्वरूपः नाकिरस्य पर मिनन्ति वरतानि वेद नावस्यप्र्थिवि उत दयौः |||
verses.transliteration: gharbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kardevāstvaṣṭā savitāviśvarūpaḥ nākirasya pra minanti vratāni veda nāvasyapṛthivi uta dyauḥ

translations.griffith: Even in the womb God Tvaṣṭar, Vivifier, shaping all forms, Creator, made us consorts.  None violates his holy ordinances: that we are his the heavens and earth acknowledge.

verses.sanskrit: को अस्य वेद परथमस्याह्नः क ईं ददर्श क इह परवोचत बर्हन मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम कदु बरव आहनोवीच्या नॄन |||
verses.transliteration: ko asya veda prathamasyāhnaḥ ka īṃ dadarśa ka iha pravocat bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kadu brava āhanovīcyā nṝn

translations.griffith: Who knows that earliest day whereof thou speakest? Who hatb beheld it? Who can here declare it?  Great is the Law of Varuṇa and Mitra. What, wanton! wilt thou say to men to tempt them?

verses.sanskrit: यमस्य मा यम्यं काम आगन समाने योनौ सहशेय्याय जायेव पत्ये तन्वं रिरिच्यां वि चिद वर्हेव रथ्येव चक्रा |||
verses.transliteration: yamasya mā yamyaṃ kāma āghan samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya jāyeva patye tanvaṃ riricyāṃ vi cid vṛheva rathyeva cakrā

translations.griffith: I, Yami, am possessed by love of Yama, that I may rest on the same couch beside him.  I as a wife would yield me to my husband. Like car-wheels let us speed to meet each other.

verses.sanskrit: न तिष्ठन्ति न नि मिषन्त्येते देवानां सपश इह येचरन्ति अन्येन मदाहनो याहि तुयं तेन वि वर्ह रथ्येवचक्रा |||
verses.transliteration: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣantyete devānāṃ spaśa iha yecaranti anyena madāhano yāhi tuyaṃ tena vi vṛha rathyevacakrā

translations.griffith: They stand not still, they never close their eyelids, those sentinels of Gods who wander round us.  Not me-go quickly, wanton, with another, and hasten like a chariot wheel to meet him.

verses.sanskrit: रात्रीभिरस्मा अहभिर्दशस्येत सूर्यस्य चक्षुर्मुहुरुन्मिमीयात दिवा पर्थिव्या मिथुना सबन्धू यमीर्यमस्यबिभ्र्यादजामि |||
verses.transliteration: rātrībhirasmā ahabhirdaśasyet sūryasya cakṣurmuhurunmimīyāt divā pṛthivyā mithunā sabandhū yamīryamasyabibhṛyādajāmi

translations.griffith: May Sūrya's eye with days and nights endow him, and ever may his light spread out before him.  In heaven and earth the kindred Pair commingle. On Yam! be the unbrotherly act of Yama.

verses.sanskrit: आ घा ता गछानुत्तरा युगानि यत्र जामयः कर्णवन्नजामि उप बर्ब्र्हि वर्षभाय बाहुमन्यमिछस्व सुभगेपतिं मत |||
verses.transliteration: ā ghā tā ghachānuttarā yughāni yatra jāmayaḥ kṛṇavannajāmi upa barbṛhi vṛṣabhāya bāhumanyamichasva subhaghepatiṃ mat

translations.griffith: Sure there will come succeeding times when brothers and sisters will do acts unmeet for kinsfolk.  Not me, O fair one,—seek another husband, and make thine arm a pillow for thy consort.

verses.sanskrit: किं भरतासद यदनाथं भवाति किमु सवसा यन निरतिर्निगछत काममूता बह्वेतद रपामि तन्वा मे तन्वं सम्पिप्र्ग्धि |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ bhratāsad yadanāthaṃ bhavāti kimu svasā yan nirtirnighachat kāmamūtā bahvetad rapāmi tanvā me tanvaṃ sampipṛghdhi

translations.griffith: Is he a brother when no lord is left her? Is she a sister when Destruction cometh?  Forced by my love these many words I utter. Come near, and hold me in thy close embraces.

verses.sanskrit: न वा उ ते तन्वा तन्वं सं पप्र्च्यां पापमाहुर्यःस्वसारं निगछात अन्येन मत परमुदः कल्पयस्व न तेभ्रात सुभगे वष्ट्येतत |||
verses.transliteration: na vā u te tanvā tanvaṃ saṃ papṛcyāṃ pāpamāhuryaḥsvasāraṃ nighachāt anyena mat pramudaḥ kalpayasva na tebhrāta subhaghe vaṣṭyetat

translations.griffith: I will not fold mine arms about thy body: they call it sin when one comes near his sister.  Not me,—prepare thy pleasures with another: thy brother seeks not this from thee, O fair one.

verses.sanskrit: बतो बतसि यम नैव ते मनो हर्दयं चाविदाम अन्या किलत्वां कक्ष्येव युक्तं परि षवजाते लिबुजेव वर्क्षम |||
verses.transliteration: bato batasi yama naiva te mano hṛdayaṃ cāvidāma anyā kilatvāṃ kakṣyeva yuktaṃ pari ṣvajāte libujeva vṛkṣam

translations.griffith: Alas! thou art indeed a weakling, Yama we find in thee no trace of heart or spirit.  As round the tree the woodbine clings, another will cling albout thee girt as with a girdle.

verses.sanskrit: अन्यमू षु तवं यम्यन्य उ तवां परि षवजाते लिबुजेवव्र्क्षम तस्य वा तवं मन इछा स वा तवाधा कर्णुष्वसंविदं सुभद्राम |||
verses.transliteration: anyamū ṣu tvaṃ yamyanya u tvāṃ pari ṣvajāte libujevavṛkṣam tasya vā tvaṃ mana ichā sa vā tavādhā kṛṇuṣvasaṃvidaṃ subhadrām

translations.griffith: Embrace another, Yami; let another, even as the woodbine rings the tree, enfold thee.  Win thou his heart and let him win thy fancy, and he shall form with thee a blest alliance.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा वर्ष्णे दुदुहे दोहसा दिवः पयांसि यह्वो अदितेरदाभ्यः विश्वं स वेद वरुणो यथा धिया सयज्ञियो यजतु यज्ञियान रतून |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvo aditeradābhyaḥ viśvaṃ sa veda varuṇo yathā dhiyā sayajñiyo yajatu yajñiyān ṛtūn

translations.griffith: THE Bull hath yielded for the Bull the milk of heaven: the Son of Aditi can never be deceived.  According to his wisdom Varuṇa knoweth all: may he, the Holy, hallow times for sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: रपद गन्धर्वीरप्या च योषणा नदस्य नादे परि पातुमे मनः इष्टस्य मध्ये अदितिर्नि धातु नो भराता नोज्येष्ठः परथमो वि वोचति |||
verses.transliteration: rapad ghandharvīrapyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātume manaḥ iṣṭasya madhye aditirni dhātu no bhrātā nojyeṣṭhaḥ prathamo vi vocati

translations.griffith: Gandharvi spake: may she, the Lady of the flood, amid the river's roaring leave my heart untouched.  May Aditi accomplish all that we desire, and may our eldest Brother tell us this as Chief.

verses.sanskrit: सो चिन नु भद्रा कषुमती यशस्वत्युषा उवास मनवेस्वर्वती यदीमुशन्तमुशतामनु करतुमग्निंहोतारं विदथाय जीजनन |||
verses.transliteration: so cin nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvatyuṣā uvāsa manavesvarvatī yadīmuśantamuśatāmanu kratumaghniṃhotāraṃ vidathāya jījanan

translations.griffith: Yea, even this blessed Morning, rich in store of food, splendid, with heavenly lustre, hath shone out for man,  Since they, as was the wish of yearning Gods, brought forth that yearning Agni for the assembly as the Priest.

verses.sanskrit: अध तयं दरप्सं विभ्वं विचक्षणं विराभरदिषितः शयेनो अध्वरे यदी विशो वर्णते दस्ममार्याग्निं होतारमध धीरजायत |||
verses.transliteration: adha tyaṃ drapsaṃ vibhvaṃ vicakṣaṇaṃ virābharadiṣitaḥ śyeno adhvare yadī viśo vṛṇate dasmamāryāaghniṃ hotāramadha dhīrajāyata

translations.griffith: And the fleet Falcon brought for sacrifice from afar this flowing Drop most excellent and keen of sight,  Then when the Āryan tribes chose as Invoking Priest Agni the Wonder-Worker, and the hymn rose up.

verses.sanskrit: सदासि रण्वो यवसेव पुष्यते होत्राभिरग्ने मनुषःस्वध्वरः विप्रस्य वा यच्छशमान उक्थ्यं वाजंससवानुपयासि भूरिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sadāsi raṇvo yavaseva puṣyate hotrābhiraghne manuṣaḥsvadhvaraḥ viprasya vā yacchaśamāna ukthyaṃ vājaṃsasavānupayāsi bhūribhiḥ

translations.griffith: Still art thou kind to him who feeds thee as with grass, and, skilled in sacrifice, offers thee holy gifts.  When thou, having received the sage's strengthening food with lauds, after long toil, cornest with many more.

verses.sanskrit: उदीरय पितरा जार आ भगमियक्षति हर्यतो हर्त्तैष्यति विवक्ति वह्निः सवपस्यते मखस्तविष्यते असुरोवेपते मती |||
verses.transliteration: udīraya pitarā jāra ā bhaghamiyakṣati haryato hṛttaiṣyati vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhastaviṣyate asurovepate matī

translations.griffith: Urge thou thy Parents, as a lover ' to delight: the Lovely One desires and craves it from his heart.  The priest calls out, the sacrificer shows his skill, the Asura tries his strength, and with the hymn is stirred.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते अग्ने सुमतिं मर्तो अक्षत सहसः सूनो अति स परश्र्ण्वे इषं दधानो वहमानो अश्वैरा स दयुमानमवान भूषति दयून |||
verses.transliteration: yaste aghne sumatiṃ marto akṣat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa praśṛṇve iṣaṃ dadhāno vahamāno aśvairā sa dyumānamavān bhūṣati dyūn

translations.griffith: Far-famed is he, the mortal man, O Agni, thou Son of Strength, who hath obtained thy favour.  He, gathering power, borne onward by his horses, makes his days lovely in his might and splendour.

verses.sanskrit: यदग्न एषा समितिर्भवाति देवी देवेषु यजता यजत्र रत्ना च यद विभजासि सवधावो भागं नो अत्र वसुमन्तंवीतात |||
verses.transliteration: yadaghna eṣā samitirbhavāti devī deveṣu yajatā yajatra ratnā ca yad vibhajāsi svadhāvo bhāghaṃ no atra vasumantaṃvītāt

translations.griffith: When, Holy Agni, the divine assembly, the sacred synod mid the Gods, is gathered,  And when thou, Godlike One, dealest forth treasures, vouchsafe us, too, our portion of the riches.

verses.sanskrit: शरुधी नो अग्ने सदने सधस्थे युक्ष्वा रथमम्र्तस्यद्रवित्नुम आ नो वह रोदसी देवपुत्रे माकिर्देवानामपभूरिह सयाः |||
verses.transliteration: śrudhī no aghne sadane sadhasthe yukṣvā rathamamṛtasyadravitnum ā no vaha rodasī devaputre mākirdevānāmapabhūriha syāḥ

translations.griffith: Hear us, O Agni, in your common dwelling: harness thy rapid car of Amṛta.  Bring Heaven and Earth, the Deities' Parents, hither: stay with us here, nor from the Gods be distant.

verses.sanskrit: दयावा ह कषामा परथमे रतेनाभिश्रावे भवतःसत्यवाचा देवो यन मर्तान यजथाय कर्ण्वन सीदद्धोता परत्यं सवमसुं यन |||
verses.transliteration: dyāvā ha kṣāmā prathame ṛtenābhiśrāve bhavataḥsatyavācā devo yan martān yajathāya kṛṇvan sīdaddhotā pratyaṃ svamasuṃ yan

translations.griffith: HEAVEN and Earth, first by everlasting Order, speakers of truth, are near enough to hear us,  When the God, urging men to worship. sitteth as Priest, assuming all his vital vigour.

verses.sanskrit: देवो देवान परिभूरतेन वहा नो हव्यं परथमश्चिकित्वान धूमकेतुः समिधा भार्जीको मन्द्रो होता नित्योवाचा यजीयान |||
verses.transliteration: devo devān paribhūrtena vahā no havyaṃ prathamaścikitvān dhūmaketuḥ samidhā bhāṛjīko mandro hotā nityovācā yajīyān

translations.griffith: As God comprising Gods by Law Eternal, bear, as the Chief who knoweth, our oblation,  Smoke-bannered with the fuel, radiant, joyous, better to praise and worship, Priest for ever.

verses.sanskrit: सवाव्र्ग देवस्याम्र्तं यदी गोरतो जातासो धारयन्तौर्वी विश्वे देवा अनु तत ते यजुर्गुर्दुहे यदेनीदिव्यं घर्तं वाः |||
verses.transliteration: svāvṛgh devasyāmṛtaṃ yadī ghorato jātāso dhārayantaurvī viśve devā anu tat te yajurghurduhe yadenīdivyaṃ ghṛtaṃ vāḥ

translations.griffith: When the cow's nectar wins the God completely, men here below are heaven's sustainers.  All the Gods came to this thy heavenly Yajus which from the motley Pair milked oil and water.

verses.sanskrit: अर्चामि वां वर्धायापो घर्तस्नू दयावाभूमी शर्णुतंरोदसी मे अहा यद दयावो.असुनीतिमयन मध्वा नो अत्रपितरा शिशीताम |||
verses.transliteration: arcāmi vāṃ vardhāyāpo ghṛtasnū dyāvābhūmī śṛṇutaṃrodasī me ahā yad dyāvo.asunītimayan madhvā no atrapitarā śiśītām

translations.griffith: 1 praise your work that ye may make me prosper: hear, Heaven and Earth, Twain Worlds that drop with fatness.  While days and nights go to the world of spirits, here let the Parents with sweet meath refresh us

verses.sanskrit: किं सविन नो राजा जग्र्हे कदस्याति वरतं चक्र्मा को विवेद मित्रश्चिद धि षमा जुहुराणो देवाञ्छ्लोको नयातामपि वाजो अस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ svin no rājā jaghṛhe kadasyāti vrataṃ cakṛmā ko viveda mitraścid dhi ṣmā juhurāṇo devāñchloko nayātāmapi vājo asti

translations.griffith: Hath the King siezed us? How have we offended against his holy ordinance? Who knoweth?  For even Mitra mid the Gods is angry there are both song and strength for those who come not.

verses.sanskrit: दुर्मन्त्वत्राम्र्तस्य नाम सलक्ष्मा यद विषुरूपाभवाति यमस्य यो मनवते सुमन्त्वग्ने तं रष्व पाह्यप्रयुछन |||
verses.transliteration: durmantvatrāmṛtasya nāma salakṣmā yad viṣurūpābhavāti yamasya yo manavate sumantvaghne taṃ ṛṣva pāhyaprayuchan

translations.griffith: ’Tis hard to understand the Immortal's nature, where she who is akin becomes astranger.  Guard ceaselessly, great Agni, him who ponders Yama's name, easy to be comprehended.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मिन देवा विदथे मादयन्ते विवस्वतः सदने धारयन्ते सूर्ये जयोतिरदधुर्मास्यक्तून परि दयोतनिं चरतोजस्रा |||
verses.transliteration: yasmin devā vidathe mādayante vivasvataḥ sadane dhārayante sūrye jyotiradadhurmāsyaktūn pari dyotaniṃ caratoajasrā

translations.griffith: They in the synod where the Gods rejoice them, where they are seated in Vivasvān's dwelling,  Have given the Moon his beams, the Sun his splendour-the Two unweariedly maintain their brightness.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मिन देवा मन्मनि संचरन्त्यपीच्ये न वयमस्य विद्म मित्रो नो अत्रादितिरनागान सविता देवो वरुणाय वोचत |||
verses.transliteration: yasmin devā manmani saṃcarantyapīcye na vayamasya vidma mitro no atrāditiranāghān savitā devo varuṇāya vocat

translations.griffith: The counsel which the Gods meet to consider, their secret plan,—of that we have no knowledge.  There let God Savitar, Aditi, and Mitra proclaim to Varuṇa that we are sinless.

verses.sanskrit: शरुधी नो अग्ने सदने सधस्थे युक्ष्वा ... ||
verses.transliteration: śrudhī no aghne sadane sadhasthe yukṣvā ...

translations.griffith: Hear us, O Agni, in your comninn dwell ing: harness thy rapid car, the car of Amṛta.  Bring Heaven and Earth, the Deities' Parents, hither: stay with us here, nor from the Gods be distant.

verses.sanskrit: युजे वां बरह्म पूर्व्यं नमोभिर्वि शलोक एतु पथ्येवसूरेः शर्ण्वन्तु विश्वे अम्र्तस्य पुत्रा आ ये धामानिदिव्यानि तस्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: yuje vāṃ brahma pūrvyaṃ namobhirvi śloka etu pathyevasūreḥ śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtasya putrā ā ye dhāmānidivyāni tasthuḥ

translations.griffith: I YOKE with prayer your ancient inspiration: may the laud rise as on the prince's pathway.  All Sons of Immortality shall hear it, all the possessors of celestial natures.

verses.sanskrit: यमे इव यतमाने यदैतं पर वां भरन मानुषादेवयन्तः आ सीदतं सवमु लोकं विदाने सवासस्थेभवतमिन्दवे नः |||
verses.transliteration: yame iva yatamāne yadaitaṃ pra vāṃ bharan mānuṣādevayantaḥ ā sīdataṃ svamu lokaṃ vidāne svāsasthebhavatamindave naḥ

translations.griffith: When speeding ye came nigh us like twin sisters, religious-hearted votaries brought you forward.  Take your place, ye who know your proper station: be near, be very near unto our Soma.

verses.sanskrit: पञ्च पदानि रुपो अन्वरोहं चतुष्पदीमन्वेमि वरतेन अक्षरेण परति मिम एतां रतस्य नाभावधि सं पुनामि |||
verses.transliteration: pañca padāni rupo anvarohaṃ catuṣpadīmanvemi vratena akṣareṇa prati mima etāṃ ṛtasya nābhāvadhi saṃ punāmi

translations.griffith: Five paces have I risen from Earth. I follow her who hath four feet with devout observance.  This by the Sacred Syllable have I measured: I purify in the central place of Order,

verses.sanskrit: देवेभ्यः कमव्र्णीत मर्त्युं परजायै कमम्र्तंनाव्र्णीत बर्हस्पतिं यज्ञमक्र्ण्वत रषिं परियांयमस्तन्वं परारिरेचीत |||
verses.transliteration: devebhyaḥ kamavṛṇīta mṛtyuṃ prajāyai kamamṛtaṃnāvṛṇīta bṛhaspatiṃ yajñamakṛṇvata ṛṣiṃ priyāṃyamastanvaṃ prārirecīt

translations.griffith: He, for God's sake, chose death to be his portion. He chose not, for men's good, a life eternal  They sacrificed Bṛhaspati the Ṛṣi. Yama delivered up his own dear body.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त कषरन्ति शिशवे मरुत्वते पित्रे पुत्रासो अप्यवीवतन्न्र्तम उभे इदस्योभयस्य राजत उभे यतेते उभयस्यपुष्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: sapta kṣaranti śiśave marutvate pitre putrāso apyavīvatannṛtam ubhe idasyobhayasya rājata ubhe yatete ubhayasyapuṣyataḥ

translations.griffith: The Seven flow to the Youth on whom the Maruts wait: the Sons unto the Father brought the sacrifice.  Both these are his, as his they are the Lords of both: both toil; belonging unto both they prosper well.

verses.sanskrit: परेयिवांसं परवतो महीरनु बहुभ्यः पन्थामनुपस्पशनम वैवस्वतं संगमनं जनानां यमंराजानं हविषा दुवस्य |||
verses.transliteration: pareyivāṃsaṃ pravato mahīranu bahubhyaḥ panthāmanupaspaśanam vaivasvataṃ saṃghamanaṃ janānāṃ yamaṃrājānaṃ haviṣā duvasya

translations.griffith: HONOUR the King with thine oblations, Yama, Vivasvān's Son, who gathers men together,  Who travelled to the lofty heights above us, who searcbes out and shows the path to many.

verses.sanskrit: यमो नो गातुं परथमो विवेद नैष गव्यूतिरपभर्तवा उ यत्रा नः पूर्वे पितरः परेयुरेना जज्ञानाःपथ्या अनु सवाः |||
verses.transliteration: yamo no ghātuṃ prathamo viveda naiṣa ghavyūtirapabhartavā u yatrā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pareyurenā jajñānāḥpathyā anu svāḥ

translations.griffith: Yama first found for us a place to dwell in: this pasture never can be taken from  Us.  Men born on earth tread their own paths that lead them whither our ancient Fathers have departed.

verses.sanskrit: मातली कव्यैर्यमो अङगिरोभिर्ब्र्हस्पतिरकवभिर्वाव्र्धानः यांश्च देवा वाव्र्धुर्ये च देवांस्वाहान्ये सवधयान्ये मदन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: mātalī kavyairyamo aṅghirobhirbṛhaspatirkvabhirvāvṛdhānaḥ yāṃśca devā vāvṛdhurye ca devāṃsvāhānye svadhayānye madanti

translations.griffith: Mitali prospers there with Kavyas, Yama with Aṅgiras' sons, Bṛhaspati with Rkvans:  Exalters of the Gods, by Gods exalted, some joy in praise and some in our oblation.

verses.sanskrit: इमं यम परस्तरमा हि सीदाङगिरोभिः पित्र्भिःसंविदानः आ तवा मन्त्राः कविशस्ता वहन्त्वेना राजन्हविषा मादयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ yama prastaramā hi sīdāṅghirobhiḥ pitṛbhiḥsaṃvidānaḥ ā tvā mantrāḥ kaviśastā vahantvenā rājanhaviṣā mādayasva

translations.griffith: Come, seat thee on this bed of grass, O Yama, in company with Aṅgirases and Fathers.  Let texts recited by the sages bring thee O King, let this oblation make thee joyful.

verses.sanskrit: अङगिरोभिरा गहि यज्ञियेभिर्यम वैरूपैरिह मादयस्व विवस्वन्तं हुवे यः पिता ते.अस्मिन यज्ञे बर्हिष्यानिषद्य |||
verses.transliteration: aṅghirobhirā ghahi yajñiyebhiryama vairūpairiha mādayasva vivasvantaṃ huve yaḥ pitā te.asmin yajñe barhiṣyāniṣadya

translations.griffith: Come, Yama, with the Aṅgirases the Holy, rejoice thee here with children of Virūpa.  To sit on sacred grass at this our worship, I call Vivasvān, too, thy Father hither.

verses.sanskrit: अङगिरसो नः पितरो नवग्वा अथर्वाणो भर्गवः सोम्यासः तेषां वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियानामपि भद्रे सौमनसेस्याम |||
verses.transliteration: aṅghiraso naḥ pitaro navaghvā atharvāṇo bhṛghavaḥ somyāsaḥ teṣāṃ vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyānāmapi bhadre saumanasesyāma

translations.griffith: Our Fathers are Aṅgirases, Navagvas, Atharvans, Bhṛgus who deserve the Soma.  May these, the Holy, look on us with favour, may we enjoy their gracious loving-kindness.

verses.sanskrit: परेहि परेहि पथिभिः पूर्व्येभिर्यत्रा नः पूर्वे पितरःपरेयुः उभा राजाना सवधया मदन्ता यमं पश्यासिवरुणं च देवम |||
verses.transliteration: prehi prehi pathibhiḥ pūrvyebhiryatrā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥpareyuḥ ubhā rājānā svadhayā madantā yamaṃ paśyāsivaruṇaṃ ca devam

translations.griffith: Go forth, go forth upon the ancient pathways whereon our sires of old have gone before us.  'Mere shalt thou look on both the Kings enjoying their sacred food, God Varuṇa and Yama.

verses.sanskrit: सं गछस्व पित्र्भिः सं यमेनेष्टापूर्तेन परमेव्योमन हित्वायावद्यं पुनरस्तमेहि सं गछस्व तन्वासुवर्चाः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ ghachasva pitṛbhiḥ saṃ yameneṣṭāpūrtena paramevyoman hitvāyāvadyaṃ punarastamehi saṃ ghachasva tanvāsuvarcāḥ

translations.griffith: Meet Yama, meet the Fathers, meet the merit of free or ordered acts, in highest heaven.  Leave sin and evil, seek anew thy dwelling, and bright with glory wear another body.

verses.sanskrit: अपेत वीत वि च सर्पतातो.अस्मा एतं पितरो लोकमक्रन अहोभिरद्भिरक्तुभिर्व्यक्तं यमो ददात्यवसानमस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: apeta vīta vi ca sarpatāto.asmā etaṃ pitaro lokamakran ahobhiradbhiraktubhirvyaktaṃ yamo dadātyavasānamasmai

translations.griffith: Go hence, depart ye, fly in all directions: this place for him the Fathers have provided.  Yama bestows on him a place to rest in adorned with days and beams of light and waters.

verses.sanskrit: अति दरव सारमेयौ शवानौ चतुरक्षौ शबलौ साधुनापथा अथा पितॄन सुविदत्रानुपेहि यमेन ये सधमादम्मदन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ati drava sārameyau śvānau caturakṣau śabalau sādhunāpathā athā pitṝn suvidatrānupehi yamena ye sadhamādammadanti

translations.griffith: Run and outspeed the two dogs, Saramā's offspring, brindled, four-eyed, upon thy happy pathway.  Draw nigh then to the gracious-minded Fathers where they rejoice in company with Yama.

verses.sanskrit: यौ ते शवानौ यम रक्षितारौ चतुरक्षौ पथिरक्षीन्र्चक्षसौ ताभ्यामेनं परि देहि राजन सवस्ति चास्मानमीवं च धेहि |||
verses.transliteration: yau te śvānau yama rakṣitārau caturakṣau pathirakṣīnṛcakṣasau tābhyāmenaṃ pari dehi rājan svasti cāsmāanamīvaṃ ca dhehi

translations.griffith: And those two dogs of thine, Yama, the watchers, four-eyed, who look on men and guard the pathway,—  Entrust this man, O King, to their protection, and with prosperity and health endow him.

verses.sanskrit: उरूणसावसुत्र्पा उदुम्बलौ यमस्य दूतौ चरतो जनाननु तावस्मभ्यं दर्शये सूर्याय पुनर्दातामसुमद्येह भद्रम |||
verses.transliteration: urūṇasāvasutṛpā udumbalau yamasya dūtau carato janānanu tāvasmabhyaṃ dṛśaye sūryāya punardātāmasumadyeha bhadram

translations.griffith: Dark-hued, insatiate, with distended nostrils, Yama's two envoys roam among the People;  May they restore to us a fair existence here and to-day, that we may see the sunlight.

verses.sanskrit: यमाय सोमं सुनुत यमय जुहुता हविः यमं ह यज्ञोगछत्यग्निदूतो अरंक्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: yamāya somaṃ sunuta yamaya juhutā haviḥ yamaṃ ha yajñoghachatyaghnidūto araṃkṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: To Yama pour the Soma, bring to Yama consecrated gifts:  To Yama sacrifice prepared and heralded by Agni goes.

verses.sanskrit: यमाय घर्तवद धविर्जुहोत पर च तिष्ठत स नोदेवेष्वा यमद दीर्घमायुः पर जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: yamāya ghṛtavad dhavirjuhota pra ca tiṣṭhata sa nodeveṣvā yamad dīrghamāyuḥ pra jīvase

translations.griffith: Offer to Yama holy gifts enriched with butter, and draw near:  So may he grant that we may live long days of life among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: यमाय मधुमत्तमं राज्ञे हव्यं जुहोतन इदं नमर्षिभ्यः पूर्वजेभ्यः पूर्वेभ्यः पथिक्र्द्भ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: yamāya madhumattamaṃ rājñe havyaṃ juhotana idaṃ namaṛṣibhyaḥ pūrvajebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Offer to Yama, to the King, oblation very rich in meath:  Bow down before the Ṛṣis of the ancient times, who made this path in days of old.

verses.sanskrit: तरिकद्रुकेभिः पतति षळ उर्वीरेकमिद बर्हत तरिष्टुब्गायत्री छन्दांसि सर्वा ता यम आहिता |||
verses.transliteration: trikadrukebhiḥ patati ṣaḷ urvīrekamid bṛhat triṣṭubghāyatrī chandāṃsi sarvā tā yama āhitā

translations.griffith: Into the six Expanses flies the Great One in Trkadrukas.  The Gāyatrī, the Tṛṣṭup, all metres in Yama are contained.

verses.sanskrit: उदीरतामवर उत परास उन मध्यमाः पितरःसोम्यासः असुं य ईयुरव्र्का रतज्ञास्ते नो.अवन्तुपितरो हवेषु |||
verses.transliteration: udīratāmavara ut parāsa un madhyamāḥ pitaraḥsomyāsaḥ asuṃ ya īyuravṛkā ṛtajñāste no.avantupitaro haveṣu

translations.griffith: MAY they ascend, the lowest, highest, midmost, the Fathers who deserve a share of Soma-  May they who have attained the life of spirits, gentle and righteous, aid us when we call them.

verses.sanskrit: इदं पित्र्भ्यो नमो अस्त्वद्य ये पूर्वासो य उपरास ईयुः ये पार्थिवे रजस्या निषत्ता ये वा नूनं सुव्र्जनासुविक्षु |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ pitṛbhyo namo astvadya ye pūrvāso ya uparāsa īyuḥ ye pārthive rajasyā niṣattā ye vā nūnaṃ suvṛjanāsuvikṣu

translations.griffith: Now let us pay this homage to the Fathers, to those who passed of old and those who followed,  Those who have rested in the earthly region, and those who dwell among the Mighty Races.

verses.sanskrit: आहं पितॄन सुविदत्रानवित्सि नपातं च विक्रमणं चविष्णोः बर्हिषदो ये सवधया सुतस्य भजन्त पित्वस्तैहागमिष्ठाः |||
verses.transliteration: āhaṃ pitṝn suvidatrānavitsi napātaṃ ca vikramaṇaṃ caviṣṇoḥ barhiṣado ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvastaihāghamiṣṭhāḥ

translations.griffith: 1 have attained the gracious-minded Fathers, I have gained son and progeny from Viṣṇu.  They who enjoy pressed juices with oblation seated on sacred grass, come oftenest hither.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हिषदः पितर ऊत्यर्वागिमा वो हव्या चक्र्मा जुषध्वम त आ गतावसा शन्तमेनाथा नः शं योररपोदधात |||
verses.transliteration: barhiṣadaḥ pitara ūtyarvāghimā vo havyā cakṛmā juṣadhvam ta ā ghatāvasā śantamenāthā naḥ śaṃ yorarapodadhāta

translations.griffith: Fathers who sit on sacred grass, come, help us: these offerings have we made for you; accept them.  So come to us with most auspicious favour, and give us health and strength without a trouble.

verses.sanskrit: उपहूताः पितरः सोम्यासो बर्हिष्येषु निधिषु परियेषु त आ गमन्तु त इह शरुवन्त्वधि बरुवन्तु ते.अवन्त्वस्मान |||
verses.transliteration: upahūtāḥ pitaraḥ somyāso barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu ta ā ghamantu ta iha śruvantvadhi bruvantu te.avantvasmān

translations.griffith: May they, the Fathers, worthy of the Soma, invited to their favourite oblations.  Laid on the sacred grass, come nigh and listen: may they be gracious unto us and bless us.

verses.sanskrit: आच्या जानु दक्षिणतो निषद्येमं यज्ञमभि गर्णीतविश्वे मा हिंसिष्ट पितरः केन चिन नो यद व आगःपुरुषता कराम |||
verses.transliteration: ācyā jānu dakṣiṇato niṣadyemaṃ yajñamabhi ghṛṇītaviśve mā hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cin no yad va āghaḥpuruṣatā karāma

translations.griffith: Bowing your bended knees and seated southward, accept this sacrifice of ours with favour.  Punish us not for any sin, O Fathers, which we through human frailty have committed.

verses.sanskrit: आसीनासो अरुणीनामुपस्थे रयिं धत्त दाशुषे मर्त्याय पुत्रेभ्यः पितरस्तस्य वस्वः पर यछत त इहोर्जन्दधात |||
verses.transliteration: āsīnāso aruṇīnāmupasthe rayiṃ dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya putrebhyaḥ pitarastasya vasvaḥ pra yachata ta ihorjandadhāta

translations.griffith: Lapped in the bosom of the purple Mornings, give riches to the man who brings oblations.  Grant to your sons a portion of that treasure, and, present, give them energy, ye Fathers.

verses.sanskrit: ये नः पूर्वे पितरः सोम्यासो.अनूहिरे सोमपीथंवसिष्ठाः तेभिर्यमः संरराणो हवींष्युशन्नुशद्भिः परतिकाममत्तु |||
verses.transliteration: ye naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ somyāso.anūhire somapīthaṃvasiṣṭhāḥ tebhiryamaḥ saṃrarāṇo havīṃṣyuśannuśadbhiḥ pratikāmamattu

translations.griffith: Our ancient Fathers who deserve the Soma, who came, most noble, to our Soma banquet,—  With these let Yama, yearning with the yearning, rejoicing eat our offerings at his pleasure.

verses.sanskrit: ये तात्र्षुर्देवत्रा जेहमाना होत्राविद सतोमतष्टासोर्कैः आग्ने याहि सुविदत्रेभिरर्वां सत्यैः कव्यैःपित्र्भिर्घर्मसद्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: ye tātṛṣurdevatrā jehamānā hotrāvida stomataṣṭāsoarkaiḥ āghne yāhi suvidatrebhirarvāṃ satyaiḥ kavyaiḥpitṛbhirgharmasadbhiḥ

translations.griffith: Come to us, Agni, with the gracioug Fathers who dwell in glowing light, the very Kavyas,  Who thirsted mid the Gods, who hasten hither, oblation winners, theme of singers' praises.

verses.sanskrit: ये सत्यासो हविरदो हविष्पा इद्रेण देवैः सरथन्दधानाः आग्ने याहि सहस्रं देववन्दैः परैःपूर्वैः पित्र्भिर्घर्मसद्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: ye satyāso havirado haviṣpā idreṇa devaiḥ sarathandadhānāḥ āghne yāhi sahasraṃ devavandaiḥ paraiḥpūrvaiḥ pitṛbhirgharmasadbhiḥ

translations.griffith: Come, Agni, come with countless ancient Fathers, dwellers in light, primeval, God-adorers,  Eaters and drinkers of oblations, truthful, who travel with the Deities and Indra.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निष्वात्ताः पितर एह गछत सदः-सदः सदतसुप्रणीतयः अत्ता हवींषि परयतानि बर्हिष्यथारयिं सर्ववीरं दधातन |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṣvāttāḥ pitara eha ghachata sadaḥ-sadaḥ sadatasupraṇītayaḥ attā havīṃṣi prayatāni barhiṣyathārayiṃ sarvavīraṃ dadhātana

translations.griffith: Fathers whom Agni's flames have tasted, come ye nigh: ye kindly leaders, take ye each your proper place.  Eat sacrificial food presented on the grass: grant riches with a multitude of hero sons.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्न ईळितो जातवेदो.अवाड ढव्यानि सुरभीणिक्र्त्वी परादाः पित्र्भ्यः सवधया ते अक्षन्नद्धि तवन्देव परयता हवींषि |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghna īḷito jātavedo.avāḍ ḍhavyāni surabhīṇikṛtvī prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣannaddhi tvandeva prayatā havīṃṣi

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni Jātavedas, when entreated, didst bear the offerings which thou madest fragrant,  And give them to the Fathers who did cat them with Svadha. Eat, thou God, the gifts we bring thee.

verses.sanskrit: ये चेह पितरो ये च नेह यांश्च विद्म यानु च नप्रविद्म तवं वेत्थ यति ते जातवेदः सवधाभिर्यज्ञं सुक्र्तं जुषस्व |||
verses.transliteration: ye ceha pitaro ye ca neha yāṃśca vidma yānu ca napravidma tvaṃ vettha yati te jātavedaḥ svadhābhiryajñaṃ sukṛtaṃ juṣasva

translations.griffith: Thou, Jātavedas, knowest well the number of Fathers who are here and who are absent,  Of Fathers whom we know and whom we know not: accept the sacrifice wellprepared with portions.

verses.sanskrit: ये अग्निदग्धा ये अनग्निदग्धा मध्ये दिवः सवधयामादयन्ते तेभिः सवराळ असुनीतिमेतां यथावशन्तन्वं कल्पयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: ye aghnidaghdhā ye anaghnidaghdhā madhye divaḥ svadhayāmādayante tebhiḥ svarāḷ asunītimetāṃ yathāvaśantanvaṃ kalpayasva

translations.griffith: They who, consumed by fire or not cremated, joy in their offering in the midst of heaven,—  Grant them, O Sovran Lord, the world of spirits and their own body, as thy pleasure wills it.

verses.sanskrit: मैनमग्ने वि दहो माभि शोचो मास्य तवचं चिक्षिपो माशरीरम यदा शर्तं कर्णवो जातवेदो.अथेमेनं परहिणुतात पित्र्भ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: mainamaghne vi daho mābhi śoco māsya tvacaṃ cikṣipo māśarīram yadā śṛtaṃ kṛṇavo jātavedo.athemenaṃ prahiṇutāt pitṛbhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Burn him not up, nor quite consume him, Agni: let not his body or his skin be scattered.  O Jātavedas, when thou hast matured him, then send him on his way unto the Fathers.

verses.sanskrit: शर्तं यदा करसि जातवेदो.अथेमेनं परि दत्तात्पित्र्भ्यः यदा गछात्यसुनीतिमेतामथा देवानांवशनीर्भवाति |||
verses.transliteration: śṛtaṃ yadā karasi jātavedo.athemenaṃ pari dattātpitṛbhyaḥ yadā ghachātyasunītimetāmathā devānāṃvaśanīrbhavāti

translations.griffith: When thou hast made him ready, Jātavedas, then do thou give him over to the Fathers.  When he attains unto the life that waits him, he shall become the Deities' controller.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्यं चक्षुर्गछतु वातमात्मा दयां च गछप्र्थिवीं च धर्मणा अपो वा गछ यदि तत्र ते हितमोषधीषु परति तिष्ठा शरीरैः |||
verses.transliteration: sūryaṃ cakṣurghachatu vātamātmā dyāṃ ca ghachapṛthivīṃ ca dharmaṇā apo vā ghacha yadi tatra te hitamoṣadhīṣu prati tiṣṭhā śarīraiḥ

translations.griffith: The Sun receive thine eye, tne Wind thy spirit; go, as thy merit is, to earth or heaven.  Go, if it be thy lot, unto the waters; go, make thine home in plants with all thy members.

verses.sanskrit: अजो भागस्तपसा तं तपस्व तं ते शोचिस्तपतु तं तेर्चिः यास्ते शिवास्तन्वो जातवेदस्ताभिर्वहैनंसुक्र्तामु लोकम |||
verses.transliteration: ajo bhāghastapasā taṃ tapasva taṃ te śocistapatu taṃ tearciḥ yāste śivāstanvo jātavedastābhirvahainaṃsukṛtāmu lokam

translations.griffith: Thy portion is the goat: with heat consume him: let thy fierce flame, thy glowing splendour, burn him  With thine auspicious forms, o Jātavedas, bear this man to the region of the pious.

verses.sanskrit: अव सर्ज पुनरग्ने पित्र्भ्यो यस्त आहुतश्चरतिस्वधाभिः अयुर्वसान उप वेतु शेषः सं गछतान्तन्वा जातवेदः |||
verses.transliteration: ava sṛja punaraghne pitṛbhyo yasta āhutaścaratisvadhābhiḥ ayurvasāna upa vetu śeṣaḥ saṃ ghachatāntanvā jātavedaḥ

translations.griffith: Again, O Agni, to the Fathers send him who, offered in thee, goes with our oblations.  Wearing new life let him increase his offspring: let him rejoin a body, Jātavedas.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते कर्ष्णः शकुन आतुतोद पिपीलः सर्प उत वाश्वापदः अग्निष टद विश्वादगदं कर्णोतु सोमश्च योब्राह्मणानाविवेश |||
verses.transliteration: yat te kṛṣṇaḥ śakuna ātutoda pipīlaḥ sarpa uta vāśvāpadaḥ aghniṣ ṭad viśvādaghadaṃ kṛṇotu somaśca yobrāhmaṇānāviveśa

translations.griffith: What wound soe’er the dark bird hath inflicted, the emmet, or the serpent, or the jackal,  May Agni who devoureth all things heal it and Soma who hath passed into the Brahmans.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नेर्वर्म परि गोभिर्व्ययस्व सं परोर्णुष्व पीवसामेदसा च नेत तवा धर्ष्णुर्हरसा जर्ह्र्षाणो दध्र्ग्विधक्ष्यन पर्यङखयाते |||
verses.transliteration: aghnervarma pari ghobhirvyayasva saṃ prorṇuṣva pīvasāmedasā ca net tvā dhṛṣṇurharasā jarhṛṣāṇo dadhṛghvidhakṣyan paryaṅkhayāte

translations.griffith: Shield thee with flesh against the flames of Agni, encompass thee about with fat and marrow,  So will the Bold One, eager to attack thee with fierce glow fail to girdle and consume thee.

verses.sanskrit: इममग्ने चमसं मा वि जिह्वरः परियो देवानामुतसोम्यानाम एष यश्चमसो देवपानस्तस्मिन देवा अम्र्तामादयन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: imamaghne camasaṃ mā vi jihvaraḥ priyo devānāmutasomyānām eṣa yaścamaso devapānastasmin devā amṛtāmādayante

translations.griffith: Forbear, O Agni, to upset this ladle: the Gods and they who merit Soma love it.  This ladle, this which serves the Gods to drink from, in this the Immortal Deities rejoice them.

verses.sanskrit: करव्यादमग्निं पर हिणोमि दूरं यमराज्ञो गछतुरिप्रवाहः इहैवायमितरो जातवेदा देवेभ्यो हव्यंवहतु परजानन |||
verses.transliteration: kravyādamaghniṃ pra hiṇomi dūraṃ yamarājño ghachaturipravāhaḥ ihaivāyamitaro jātavedā devebhyo havyaṃvahatu prajānan

translations.griffith: 1 send afar flesh eating Agni, bearing off stains may he depart to Yama's subjects.  But let this other Jātavedas carry oblation to the Gods, for he is skilful.

verses.sanskrit: यो अग्निः करव्यात परविवेश वो गर्हमिमं पश्यन्नितरंजातवेदसम तं हरामि पित्र्यज्ञाय देवं स घर्ममिन्वात परमे सधस्थे |||
verses.transliteration: yo aghniḥ kravyāt praviveśa vo ghṛhamimaṃ paśyannitaraṃjātavedasam taṃ harāmi pitṛyajñāya devaṃ sa gharmaminvāt parame sadhasthe

translations.griffith: I choose as God for Father-worship Agni, flesh-eater, who hath past within your dwelling,  While looking on this other Jātavedas. Let him light flames in the supreme assembly.

verses.sanskrit: यो अग्निः करव्यवाहनः पितॄन यक्षद रताव्र्धः परेदुहव्यानि वोचति देवेभ्यश्च पित्र्भ्य आ |||
verses.transliteration: yo aghniḥ kravyavāhanaḥ pitṝn yakṣad ṛtāvṛdhaḥ preduhavyāni vocati devebhyaśca pitṛbhya ā

translations.griffith: With offerings meet let Agni bring the Fathers who support the Law.  Let him announce oblations paid to Fathers and to Deities.

verses.sanskrit: उशन्तस्त्वा नि धीमह्युशन्तः समिधीमहि उशन्नुशत आ वह पितॄन हविषे अत्तवे |||
verses.transliteration: uśantastvā ni dhīmahyuśantaḥ samidhīmahi uśannuśata ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave

translations.griffith: Right gladly would we set thee down, right gladly make thee burn and glow.  Gladly bring yearning Fathers nigh to cat the food of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: यं तवमग्ने समदहस्तमु निर्वापया पुनः कियाम्ब्वत्र रोहतु पाकदूर्वा वयल्कशा |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ tvamaghne samadahastamu nirvāpayā punaḥ kiyāmbvatra rohatu pākadūrvā vyalkaśā

translations.griffith: Cool, Agni, and again refresh the spot which thou hast scorched and burnt.  Here let the water-lily grow, and tender grass and leafy herb.

verses.sanskrit: शीतिके शीतिकावति हलादिके हलादिकावति मण्डूक्या सुसं गम इमं सवग्निं हर्षय |||
verses.transliteration: śītike śītikāvati hlādike hlādikāvati maṇḍūkyā susaṃ ghama imaṃ svaghniṃ harṣaya

translations.griffith: O full of coolness, thou cool Plant, full of fresh moisture, freshening Herb,  Come hither with the female frog: fill with delight this Agni here.

verses.sanskrit: तवष्टा दुहित्रे वहतुं कर्णोतीतीदं विश्वं भुवनंसमेति यमस्य माता पर्युह्यमाना महो जाया विवस्वतोननाश |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatuṃ kṛṇotītīdaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃsameti yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā maho jāyā vivasvatonanāśa

translations.griffith: TVASTAR prepares the bridal of his Daughter: all the world hears the tidings and assembles.  But Yama's Mother, Spouse of great Vivasvān, vanished as she was carried to her dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: अपागूहन्नम्र्तां मर्त्येभ्यः कर्त्वी सवर्णामददुर्विवस्वते उताश्विनावभरद यत तदसीदजहादु दवामिथुना सरण्यूः |||
verses.transliteration: apāghūhannamṛtāṃ martyebhyaḥ kṛtvī savarṇāmadadurvivasvate utāśvināvabharad yat tadasīdajahādu dvāmithunā saraṇyūḥ

translations.griffith: From mortal men they hid the Immortal Lady, made one like her and gave her to Vivasvān.  Saranyu brought to him the Aśvin brothers, and then deserted both twinned pairs of children.

verses.sanskrit: पूषा तवेतश्च्यावयतु पर विद्वाननष्टपशुर्भुवनस्य गोपाः स तवैतेभ्यः परि ददत पित्र्भ्यो.अग्निर्देवेभ्यः सुविदत्रियेभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣā tvetaścyāvayatu pra vidvānanaṣṭapaśurbhuvanasya ghopāḥ sa tvaitebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyo.aghnirdevebhyaḥ suvidatriyebhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Guard of the world, whose cattle ne’er are injured, may Pūṣan bear thee hence, for he hath knowledge.  May he consign thee to these Fathers' keeping, and to the gracious Gods let Agni give thee.

verses.sanskrit: आयुर्विश्वायुः परि पासति तवा पूषा तवा पातु परपथेपुरस्तात यत्रसते सुक्र्तो यत्र ते ययुस्तत्र तवादेवः सविता दधातु |||
verses.transliteration: āyurviśvāyuḥ pari pāsati tvā pūṣā tvā pātu prapathepurastāt yatrasate sukṛto yatra te yayustatra tvādevaḥ savitā dadhātu

translations.griffith: May Āyu, giver of all life, protect thee, and bear thee forward on the distant pathway.  Thither let Savitar the God transport thee, where dwell the pious who have passed-before thee.

verses.sanskrit: पूषेमा आशा अनु वेद सर्वाः सो अस्मानभयतमेननेषत सवस्तिदा आघ्र्णिः सर्ववीरो.अप्रयुछन पुर एतुप्रजानन |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣemā āśā anu veda sarvāḥ so asmānabhayatamenaneṣat svastidā āghṛṇiḥ sarvavīro.aprayuchan pura etuprajānan

translations.griffith: Pūṣan knows all these realms: may he conduct us by ways that are most free from fear and danger.  Giver of blessings, glowing, all-heroic, may he, thewise and watchful, go before us.

verses.sanskrit: परपथे पथमजनिष्ट पूषा परपथे दिवः परपथेप्र्थिव्याः उभे अभि परियतमे सधस्थे आ च परा चचरति परजानन |||
verses.transliteration: prapathe pathamajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathepṛthivyāḥ ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā cacarati prajānan

translations.griffith: Pūṣan was born to move on distant pathways, on the road far from earth and far from heaven.  To both most wonted places of assembly he travels and returns with perfect knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: सरस्वतीं देवयन्तो हवन्ते सरस्वतीमध्वरे तायमाने सरस्वतीं सुक्र्तो अह्वयन्त सरस्वती दाशुषे वार्यं दात |||
verses.transliteration: sarasvatīṃ devayanto havante sarasvatīmadhvare tāyamāne sarasvatīṃ sukṛto ahvayanta sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryaṃ dāt

translations.griffith: The pious call Sarasvatī, they worship Sarasvatī while sacrifice proceedeth.  The pious called Sarasvatī aforetime. Sarasvatī send bliss to him who giveth.

verses.sanskrit: सरस्वति या सरथं ययथ सवधाभिर्देवि पित्र्भिर्मदन्ती आसद्यास्मिन बर्हिषि मादयस्वानमीवा इष आधेह्यस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: sarasvati yā sarathaṃ yayatha svadhābhirdevi pitṛbhirmadantī āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayasvānamīvā iṣa ādhehyasme

translations.griffith: Sarasvatī, who camest with the Fathers, with them rejoicing thee in our oblations,  Seated upon this sacred grass be joyful, and give us strengthening food that brings no sickness.

verses.sanskrit: सरस्वतीं यां पितरो हवन्ते दक्षिणा यज्ञमभिनक्षमाणाः सहस्रार्घमिळो अत्र भागं रायस्पोषं यजमानेषु धेहि |||
verses.transliteration: sarasvatīṃ yāṃ pitaro havante dakṣiṇā yajñamabhinakṣamāṇāḥ sahasrārghamiḷo atra bhāghaṃ rāyaspoṣaṃ yajamāneṣu dhehi

translations.griffith: Thou, called on as Sarasvatī by Fathers who come right forward to our solemn service,  Give food and wealth to present sacrificers, a portion, worth a thousand, of refreshment.

verses.sanskrit: अपो अस्मान मातरः शुन्धयन्तु घर्तेन नो घर्तप्वः पुनन्तु विश्वं हि रिप्रं परवहन्ति देविरुदिदाभ्यः शुचिरापूत एमि |||
verses.transliteration: apo asmān mātaraḥ śundhayantu ghṛtena no ghṛtapvaḥ punantu viśvaṃ hi ripraṃ pravahanti devirudidābhyaḥ śucirāpūta emi

translations.griffith: The Mother Floods shall make us bright and shining, cleansers of holy oil, with oil shall cleanse us:  For, Goddesses, they bear off all defilement: I, rise up from them purified and brightened.

verses.sanskrit: दरप्सश्चस्कन्द परथमाननु दयूनिमं च योनिमनु यश्च पुर्वः समानं योनिमनु संचरन्तं दरप्सं जुहोम्यनु सप्त होत्राः |||
verses.transliteration: drapsaścaskanda prathamānanu dyūnimaṃ ca yonimanu yaśca purvaḥ samānaṃ yonimanu saṃcarantaṃ drapsaṃ juhomyanu sapta hotrāḥ

translations.griffith: Through days of earliest date the Drop descended on this place and on that which was before it.  I offer up, throughout the seven oblations, the Drop which still to one same place is moving.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते दरप्स सकन्दति यस्ते अंशुर्बाहुच्युतो धिषणायाुपस्थात अध्वर्योर्वा परि वा यः पवित्रात तं ते जुहोमिमनसा वषट्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yaste drapsa skandati yaste aṃśurbāhucyuto dhiṣaṇāyāupasthāt adhvaryorvā pari vā yaḥ pavitrāt taṃ te juhomimanasā vaṣaṭkṛtam

translations.griffith: The Drop that falls, thy stalk which arms have shaken, which from the bosom of the press hath fallen,  Or from the Adhvaryu's purifying filter, I offer thee with heart and cry of Vaṣaṭ!

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते दरप्स सकन्नो यस्ते अंशुरवश्च यः परःस्रुचा अयं देवो बर्हस्पतिः सं तं सिञ्चतु राधसे |||
verses.transliteration: yaste drapsa skanno yaste aṃśuravaśca yaḥ paraḥsrucā ayaṃ devo bṛhaspatiḥ saṃ taṃ siñcatu rādhase

translations.griffith: That fallen Drop of thine, the stalk which from the ladle fell away,  This present God Bṛhaspati shall pour it forth to make us rich.

verses.sanskrit: पयस्वतीरोषधयः पयस्वन मामकं वचः अपाम्पयस्वदित पयस्तेन मा सह शुन्धत |||
verses.transliteration: payasvatīroṣadhayaḥ payasvan māmakaṃ vacaḥ apāmpayasvadit payastena mā saha śundhata

translations.griffith: The plants of earth are rich in milk, and rich in milk is this my speech;  And rich in milk the essence of the Waters: make me pure therewith.

verses.sanskrit: परं मर्त्यो अनु परेहि पन्थां यस्ते सव इतरो देवयानात चक्षुष्मते शर्ण्वते ते बरवीमि मा नः परजां रीरिषोमोत वीरान |||
verses.transliteration: paraṃ mṛtyo anu parehi panthāṃ yaste sva itaro devayānāt cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi mā naḥ prajāṃ rīriṣomota vīrān

translations.griffith: Go hence, O Death, pursue thy special pathway apart from that which Gods are wont to travel.  To thee I say it who hast eyes and hearest: Touch not our offspring, injure not our heroes.

verses.sanskrit: मर्त्योः पदं योपयन्तो यदैत दराघीय आयुः परतरन्दधानाः आप्यायमानाः परजया धनेन शुद्धाःपूता भवत यज्ञियासः |||
verses.transliteration: mṛtyoḥ padaṃ yopayanto yadaita drāghīya āyuḥ pratarandadhānāḥ āpyāyamānāḥ prajayā dhanena śuddhāḥpūtā bhavata yajñiyāsaḥ

translations.griffith: As ye have come effacing Mrtyu's footstep, to further times prolonging your existence,  May ye be rich in children and possessions. cleansed, purified, and meet for sacrificing.

verses.sanskrit: इमे जीवा वि मर्तैरावव्र्त्रन्नभूद भद्रा देवहूतिर्नोद्य पराञ्चो अगाम नर्तये हसाय दराघीय आयुःप्रतरं दधानाः |||
verses.transliteration: ime jīvā vi mṛtairāvavṛtrannabhūd bhadrā devahūtirnoadya prāñco aghāma nṛtaye hasāya drāghīya āyuḥprataraṃ dadhānāḥ

translations.griffith: Divided from the dead are these, the living: now be our calling on the Gods successful.  We have gone forth for dancing and for laughter, tofurther times prolonging our existence.

verses.sanskrit: इमं जीवेभ्यः परिधिं दधामि मैषां नु गादपरोर्थमेतम शतं जीवन्तु शरदः पुरूचीरन्तर्म्र्त्युं दधतां पर्वतेन |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ jīvebhyaḥ paridhiṃ dadhāmi maiṣāṃ nu ghādaparoarthametam śataṃ jīvantu śaradaḥ purūcīrantarmṛtyuṃ dadhatāṃ parvatena

translations.griffith: Here I erect this rampart for the living; let none of these, none other, reach this limit.  May they survive a hundred lengthened autumns, and may they bury Death beneath this mountain.

verses.sanskrit: यथाहान्यनुपूर्वं भवन्ति यथ रतव रतुभिर्यन्तिसाधु यथा न पूर्वमपरो जहात्येवा धातरायूंषि कल्पयैषाम |||
verses.transliteration: yathāhānyanupūrvaṃ bhavanti yatha ṛtava ṛtubhiryantisādhu yathā na pūrvamaparo jahātyevā dhātarāyūṃṣi kalpayaiṣām

translations.griffith: As the days follow days in close succession, as with the seasons duly come the seasons,  As each successor fails not his foregoer, so form the lives of these, O great Ordainer.

verses.sanskrit: आ रोहतायुर्जरसं वर्णाना अनुपूर्वं यतमाना यतिष्ठ इह तवष्टा सुजनिमा सजोषा दीर्घमायुःकरति जीवसे वः |||
verses.transliteration: ā rohatāyurjarasaṃ vṛṇānā anupūrvaṃ yatamānā yatiṣṭha iha tvaṣṭā sujanimā sajoṣā dīrghamāyuḥkarati jīvase vaḥ

translations.griffith: Live your full lives ap! find old age delightful, all of you striving one behind the other.  May Tvaṣṭar, maker of fair things, be gracious and lengthen out the days of your existence.

verses.sanskrit: इमा नारीरविधवाः सुपत्नीराञ्जनेन सर्पिषा संविशन्तु अनश्रवो.अनमीवाः सुरत्ना आ रोहन्तु जनयोयोनिमग्रे |||
verses.transliteration: imā nārīravidhavāḥ supatnīrāñjanena sarpiṣā saṃviśantu anaśravo.anamīvāḥ suratnā ā rohantu janayoyonimaghre

translations.griffith: Let these unwidowed dames with noble husbands adorn themselves with fragrant balm and unguent.  Decked with fair jewels, tearless, free from sorrow, first let the dames go up to where he lieth.

verses.sanskrit: उदीर्ष्व नार्यभि जीवलोकं गतासुमेतमुप शेष एहि हस्तग्राभस्य दिधिषोस्तवेदं पत्युर्जनित्वमभि सम्बभूथ |||
verses.transliteration: udīrṣva nāryabhi jīvalokaṃ ghatāsumetamupa śeṣa ehi hastaghrābhasya didhiṣostavedaṃ patyurjanitvamabhi sambabhūtha

translations.griffith: Rise, come unto the world of life, O woman: come, he is lifeless by whose side thou liest.  Wifehood with this thy husband was thy portion, who took thy hand and wooed thee as a lover.

verses.sanskrit: धनुर्हस्तादाददानो मर्तस्यास्मे कषत्राय वर्चसेबलाय अत्रैव तवमिह वयं सुवीरा विश्वा सप्र्धोभिमातीर्जयेम |||
verses.transliteration: dhanurhastādādadāno mṛtasyāsme kṣatrāya varcasebalāya atraiva tvamiha vayaṃ suvīrā viśvā spṛdhoabhimātīrjayema

translations.griffith: From his dead hand I take the bow be carried, that it may be our power and might and glory.  There art thou, there; and here with noble heroes may we o’ercome all hosts that fight against us.

verses.sanskrit: उप सर्प मातरं भूमिमेतामुरुव्यचसं पर्थिवींसुशेवाम ऊर्णम्रदा युवतिर्दक्षिणावत एषा तवा पातुनिरतेरुपस्थात |||
verses.transliteration: upa sarpa mātaraṃ bhūmimetāmuruvyacasaṃ pṛthivīṃsuśevām ūrṇamradā yuvatirdakṣiṇāvata eṣā tvā pātunirterupasthāt

translations.griffith: Betake thee to the Iap of Earth the Mother, of Earth far-spreading, very kind and gracious.  Young Dame, wool-soft unto the guerdongiver, may she preserve thee from Destruction's bosom.

verses.sanskrit: उच्छ्वञ्चस्व पर्थिवि मा नि बाधथाः सूपायनास्मै भवसूपवञ्चना माता पुत्रं यथा सिचाभ्येनं भूमूर्णुहि |||
verses.transliteration: ucchvañcasva pṛthivi mā ni bādhathāḥ sūpāyanāsmai bhavasūpavañcanā mātā putraṃ yathā sicābhyenaṃ bhūmaūrṇuhi

translations.griffith: Heave thyself, Earth, nor press thee downward heavily: afford him easy access, gently tending him.  Cover him, as a mother wraps her skirt about her child, O Earth.

verses.sanskrit: उच्छ्वञ्चमाना पर्थिवी सु तिष्ठतु सहस्रं मित उप हिश्रयन्ताम ते गर्हासो घर्तश्चुतो भवन्तु विश्वाहास्मैशरणाः सन्त्वत्र |||
verses.transliteration: ucchvañcamānā pṛthivī su tiṣṭhatu sahasraṃ mita upa hiśrayantām te ghṛhāso ghṛtaścuto bhavantu viśvāhāsmaiśaraṇāḥ santvatra

translations.griffith: Now let the heaving earth be free from motion: yea,—let a thousand clods remain above him.  Be they to him a home distilling fatness, here let them ever be his place of refuge.

verses.sanskrit: उत ते सतभ्नामि पर्थिवीं तवत परीमं लोगं निदधन मोहं रिषम एतां सथूणां पितरो धारयन्तु ते.अत्रायमः सादना ते मिनोतु |||
