verses.transliteration: ut te stabhnāmi pṛthivīṃ tvat parīmaṃ loghaṃ nidadhan moahaṃ riṣam etāṃ sthūṇāṃ pitaro dhārayantu te.atrāyamaḥ sādanā te minotu

translations.griffith: I stay the earth from thee, while over thee I place this piece of earth. May I be free from injury.  Here let the Fathers keep this pillar firm for thee, and there let Yama make thee an abiding-place.

verses.sanskrit: परतीचीने मामहनीष्वाः पर्णमिवा दधुः परतीचीं जग्रभा वाचमश्वं रशनया यथा |||
verses.transliteration: pratīcīne māmahanīṣvāḥ parṇamivā dadhuḥ pratīcīṃ jaghrabhā vācamaśvaṃ raśanayā yathā

translations.griffith: Even as an arrow's feathers, they have set me on a fitting day.  The fit word have I caught and held as ’twere a courser with the rein.

verses.sanskrit: नि वर्तध्वं मानु गातास्मान सिषक्त रेवतीः अग्नीषोमापुनर्वसू अस्मे धारयतं रयिम |||
verses.transliteration: ni vartadhvaṃ mānu ghātāsmān siṣakta revatīḥ aghnīṣomāpunarvasū asme dhārayataṃ rayim

translations.griffith: TURN, go not farther on your way: visit us, O ye Wealthy Ones.  Agni and Soma, ye who bring riches again, secure us wealth.

verses.sanskrit: पुनरेना नि वर्तय पुनरेना नया कुरु इन्द्र एणा नियछत्वग्निरेना उपाजतु |||
verses.transliteration: punarenā ni vartaya punarenā nyā kuru indra eṇā niyachatvaghnirenā upājatu

translations.griffith: Make these return to us again, bring them beside us once again.  May. Indra give them back to us, and Agni drive them hither-ward.

verses.sanskrit: पुनरेता नि वर्तन्तामस्मिन पुष्यन्तु गोपतौ इहैवाग्नेनि धारयेह तिष्ठतु या रयिः |||
verses.transliteration: punaretā ni vartantāmasmin puṣyantu ghopatau ihaivāghneni dhārayeha tiṣṭhatu yā rayiḥ

translations.griffith: Let them return to us again: under this herdsman let them feed.  Do thou, O Agni, keep them here, and let the wealth we have remain.

verses.sanskrit: यन नियानं नययनं संज्ञानं यत परायणम आवर्तनं निवर्तनं यो गोपा अपि तं हुवे |||
verses.transliteration: yan niyānaṃ nyayanaṃ saṃjñānaṃ yat parāyaṇam āvartanaṃ nivartanaṃ yo ghopā api taṃ huve

translations.griffith: 1 call upon their herdsman, him who knoweth well their coming nigh,  Their parting and their home-return, and watcheth their approach and rest.

verses.sanskrit: य उदानड वययनं य उदानट परायणम आवर्तनंनिवर्तनमपि गोपा नि वर्तताम |||
verses.transliteration: ya udānaḍ vyayanaṃ ya udānaṭ parāyaṇam āvartanaṃnivartanamapi ghopā ni vartatām

translations.griffith: Yea, let the herdsman, too, return, who marketh well their driving-forth;  Marketh their wandering away, their turning back and coming home.

verses.sanskrit: आ निवर्त नि वर्तय पुनर्न इन्द्र गा देहि जीवाभिर्भुनजामहै |||
verses.transliteration: ā nivarta ni vartaya punarna indra ghā dehi jīvābhirbhunajāmahai

translations.griffith: Home-leader, lead them home to us; Indra, restore to us our kine:  We will rejoice in them alive.

verses.sanskrit: परि वो विश्वतो दध ऊर्जा घर्तेन पयसा ये देवाः केच यज्ञियास्ते रय्या सं सर्जन्तु नः |||
verses.transliteration: pari vo viśvato dadha ūrjā ghṛtena payasā ye devāḥ keca yajñiyāste rayyā saṃ sṛjantu naḥ

translations.griffith: 1 offer you on every side butter and milk and strengthening food.  May all the Holy Deities pour down on us a flood of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: आ निवर्तन वर्तय नि निवर्तन वर्तय भूम्याश्चतस्रःप्रदिशस्ताभ्य एना नि वर्तय |||
verses.transliteration: ā nivartana vartaya ni nivartana vartaya bhūmyāścatasraḥpradiśastābhya enā ni vartaya

translations.griffith: O thou Home-leader, lead them home, restore them thou who bringest home.  Four are the quarters of the earth; from these bring back to us our kine,

verses.sanskrit: भद्रं नो अपि वातय मनः ||
verses.transliteration: bhadraṃ no api vātaya manaḥ

translations.griffith: SEND unto us a good and happy mind.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निमीळे भुजां यविष्ठं शासा मित्रं दुर्धरीतुम यस्य धर्मन सवरेनीः सपर्यन्ति मातुरूधः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnimīḷe bhujāṃ yaviṣṭhaṃ śāsā mitraṃ durdharītum yasya dharman svarenīḥ saparyanti māturūdhaḥ

translations.griffith: 1 worship Agni, Youthfullest of Gods, resistless, Friend of laws;  Under whose guard and heavenly light the Spotted seek the Mother's breast:

verses.sanskrit: यमासा कर्पनीळं भासाकेतुं वर्धयन्ति भराजतेश्रेणिदन |||
verses.transliteration: yamāsā kṛpanīḷaṃ bhāsāketuṃ vardhayanti bhrājateśreṇidan

translations.griffith: Whom with their mouth they magnify, bannered with flame and homed in light.  He glitters with his row of teeth.

verses.sanskrit: अर्यो विशां गातुरेति पर यदानड दिवो अन्तान कविरभ्रं दिद्यानः |||
verses.transliteration: aryo viśāṃ ghātureti pra yadānaḍ divo antān kavirabhraṃ didyānaḥ

translations.griffith: Kind, Furtherer of men, he comes, when he hath reached the ends of heaven,  Sage, giving splendour to the clouds.

verses.sanskrit: जुषद धव्या मानुषस्योर्ध्वस्तस्थाव रभ्वा यज्ञे मिन्वन सद्म पुर एति |||
verses.transliteration: juṣad dhavyā mānuṣasyordhvastasthāv ṛbhvā yajñe minvan sadma pura eti

translations.griffith: To taste man's offerings, he, the Strong, hath risen erect at sacrifice:  Fixing his dwelling he proceeds.

verses.sanskrit: स हि कषेमो हविर्यज्ञः शरुष्टीदस्य गातुरेति अग्निं देवा वाशीमन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi kṣemo haviryajñaḥ śruṣṭīdasya ghātureti aghniṃ devā vāśīmantam

translations.griffith: Here are oblation, worship, rest: rapidly comes his furtherance.  To sword-armed Agni come the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञासाहं दुव इषे.अग्निं पूर्वस्य शेवस्य अद्रेःसूनुमायुमाहुः |||
verses.transliteration: yajñāsāhaṃ duva iṣe.aghniṃ pūrvasya śevasya adreḥsūnumāyumāhuḥ

translations.griffith: With service for chief bliss I seek the Lord of Sacrifice, Agni, whom  They call the Living, Son of Cloud.

verses.sanskrit: नरो ये के चास्मदा विश्वेत ते वाम आ सयुः अग्निंहविषा वर्धन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: naro ye ke cāsmadā viśvet te vāma ā syuḥ aghniṃhaviṣā vardhantaḥ

translations.griffith: Blest evermore be all the men who come from us, who magnify  Agni with sacrificial gifts.

verses.sanskrit: कर्ष्णः शवेतो.अरुषो यामो अस्य बरध्न रज्र उत शोणोयशस्वान हिरण्यरूपं जनिता जजान |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṣṇaḥ śveto.aruṣo yāmo asya bradhna ṛjra uta śoṇoyaśasvān hiraṇyarūpaṃ janitā jajāna

translations.griffith: The path he treads is black and white and red, and striped, and brown, crimson, and glorious.  His sire begat him bright with hues of gold.

verses.sanskrit: एवा ते अग्ने विमदो मनीषामूर्जो नपादम्र्तेभिःसजोषाः गिर आ वक्षत सुमतीरियान इषमूर्जंसुक्षितिं विश्वमाभाः |||
verses.transliteration: evā te aghne vimado manīṣāmūrjo napādamṛtebhiḥsajoṣāḥ ghira ā vakṣat sumatīriyāna iṣamūrjaṃsukṣitiṃ viśvamābhāḥ

translations.griffith: Thus with his thoughts, O Son of Strength, O Agni, hath Vimada, accordant with the Immortals,  Offered thee hymns, soliciting thy favour. Thou hast brought all food, strength, a prosperous dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: आग्निं न सवव्र्क्तिभिर्होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे यज्ञायस्तीर्णबर्हिषे वि वो मदे शीरं पावकशोचिषंविवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: āghniṃ na svavṛktibhirhotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe yajñāyastīrṇabarhiṣe vi vo made śīraṃ pāvakaśociṣaṃvivakṣase

translations.griffith: WITH offerings of our own we choose thee, Agni, as Invoking Priest,  For sacrifice with trimmed grass,—at your glad carouse-piercing and brightly shining. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: तवामु ते सवाभुवः शुम्भन्त्यश्वराधसः वेति तवामुपसेचनी वि वो मद रजीतिरग्न आहुतिर्विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmu te svābhuvaḥ śumbhantyaśvarādhasaḥ veti tvāmupasecanī vi vo mada ṛjītiraghna āhutirvivakṣase

translations.griffith: The wealthy ones adorn thee, they who bring us horses as their gift:  The sprinkling ladle, Agni,—at your glad carouse -and glowing offering taste thee. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: तवे धर्माण आसते जुहूभिः सिञ्चतीरिव कर्ष्णारूपाण्यर्जुना वि वो मदे विश्वा अधि शरियो धिषेविवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: tve dharmāṇa āsate juhūbhiḥ siñcatīriva kṛṣṇārūpāṇyarjunā vi vo made viśvā adhi śriyo dhiṣevivakṣase

translations.griffith: The holy statutes rest by thee, as ’twere with ladles that o’erflow.  Black and white-gleaming colours,—at your glad carouse-all glories thou assurnest. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: यमग्ने मन्यसे रयिं सहसावन्नमर्त्य तमा नोवाजसातये वि वो मदे यज्ञेषु चित्रमा भरा विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: yamaghne manyase rayiṃ sahasāvannamartya tamā novājasātaye vi vo made yajñeṣu citramā bharā vivakṣase

translations.griffith: O Agni, what thou deemest wealth, Victorious and Immortal One!  Bring thou to give us vigour,—at your glad carouse -splendid at sacrifices. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्जातो अथर्वणा विदद विश्वानि काव्या भुवद दूतोविवस्वतो वि वो मदे परियो यमस्य काम्यो विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirjāto atharvaṇā vidad viśvāni kāvyā bhuvad dūtovivasvato vi vo made priyo yamasya kāmyo vivakṣase

translations.griffith: Skilled in all lore is Agni, he whom erst Atharvan brought to life.  He was Vivasvān's envoy, at your glad carouse-the weIl-loved friend of Yama, Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: तवां यज्ञेष्वीळते.अग्ने परयत्यध्वरे तवं वसूनिकाम्या वि वो मदे विश्वा दधासि दाशुषे विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ yajñeṣvīḷate.aghne prayatyadhvare tvaṃ vasūnikāmyā vi vo made viśvā dadhāsi dāśuṣe vivakṣase

translations.griffith: At sacrifices they adore thee, Agni, when the rite proceeds.  All fair and lovely treasures-at your glad carouse-thou givest him who offers. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: तवां यज्ञेष्व रत्विजं चारुमग्ने नि षेदिरे घर्तप्रतीकं मनुषो वि वो मदे शुक्रं चेतिष्ठमक्षभिर्विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ yajñeṣv ṛtvijaṃ cārumaghne ni ṣedire ghṛtapratīkaṃ manuṣo vi vo made śukraṃ cetiṣṭhamakṣabhirvivakṣase

translations.griffith: Men, Agni, have established thee as welcome Priest at holy rites,  Thee whose face shines with butter,—at your glad carouse-bright, with eyes most observant. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने शुक्रेण शोचिषोरु परथयसे बर्हत अभिक्रन्दन्व्र्षायसे वि वो मदे गर्भं दधासि जामिषु विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: aghne śukreṇa śociṣoru prathayase bṛhat abhikrandanvṛṣāyase vi vo made gharbhaṃ dadhāsi jāmiṣu vivakṣase

translations.griffith: Wide and aloft thou spreadest thee, O Agni, with thy brilliant flame.  A Bull art thou when bellowing,—at your glad carouse-thou dost impregn the Sisters. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: कुह शरुत इन्द्रः कस्मिन्नद्य जने मित्रो न शरुयते रषीणां वा यः कषये गुहा व चर्क्र्षे गिर |||
verses.transliteration: kuha śruta indraḥ kasminnadya jane mitro na śruyate ṛṣīṇāṃ vā yaḥ kṣaye ghuhā va carkṛṣe ghira

translations.griffith: WHERE is famed Indra heard of? With what folk is he renowned to-day as Mitra is,—  Who in the home of Ṛṣis and in secret is extolled with song?

verses.sanskrit: इह शरुत इन्द्रो अस्मे अद्य सतवे वज्र्य रचीषमः मित्रो नयो जनेष्वा यशश्चक्रे असाम्या |||
verses.transliteration: iha śruta indro asme adya stave vajry ṛcīṣamaḥ mitro nayo janeṣvā yaśaścakre asāmyā

translations.griffith: Even here is Indra famed, and among us this day the glorious Thunderer is praised,  He who like Mitra mid the folk hath won complete and full renown.

verses.sanskrit: महो यस पतिः शवसो असाम्या महो नर्म्णस्य तूतुजिः भर्ता वज्रस्य धर्ष्णोः पिता पुत्रमिव परियम |||
verses.transliteration: maho yas patiḥ śavaso asāmyā maho nṛmṇasya tūtujiḥ bhartā vajrasya dhṛṣṇoḥ pitā putramiva priyam

translations.griffith: He who is Sovran Lord of great and perfect strength, exerter of heroic might,  Who bears the fearless thunder as a father bears his darling son.

verses.sanskrit: युजानो अश्व वातस्य धुनी देवो देवस्य वज्रिवः सयन्तपथा विरुक्मता सर्जान सतोष्यध्वनः |||
verses.transliteration: yujāno aśva vātasya dhunī devo devasya vajrivaḥ syantapathā virukmatā sṛjāna stoṣyadhvanaḥ

translations.griffith: Harnessing to thy car, as God, two blustering Steeds Of the Wind-God, O Thunderer,  That speed along the shining path, thou making ways art glorified.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तया चिद वातस्याश्वागा रज्रा तमना वहध्यै ययोर्देवो न मर्त्यो यन्ता नकिर्विदाय्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tyā cid vātasyāśvāghā ṛjrā tmanā vahadhyai yayordevo na martyo yantā nakirvidāyyaḥ

translations.griffith: Even to these dark Steeds of Wind thou of thyself hast come to ride,  Of which no driver may be found, none, be he God or mortal man.

verses.sanskrit: अध गमन्तोशना पर्छते वां कदर्था न आ गर्हम आजग्मथुः पराकाद दिवश्च गमश्च मर्त्यम |||
verses.transliteration: adha ghmantośanā pṛchate vāṃ kadarthā na ā ghṛham ājaghmathuḥ parākād divaśca ghmaśca martyam

translations.griffith: When ye approach, men ask you, thee and Uśanā: Why come ye to our dwelling-place?  Why are ye come to mortal man from distant realms of eapth and heaven?

verses.sanskrit: आ न इन्द्र पर्क्षसे.अस्माकं बरह्मोद्यतम तत तवायाचामहे.अवः शुष्णं यद धन्नमानुषम |||
verses.transliteration: ā na indra pṛkṣase.asmākaṃ brahmodyatam tat tvāyācāmahe.avaḥ śuṣṇaṃ yad dhannamānuṣam

translations.griffith: O Indra, thou shalt speak us fair: our holy prayer is offered up.  We pray to thee for help as thou didst strike the monster Śuṣṇa dead.

verses.sanskrit: अकर्मा दस्युरभि नो अमन्तुरन्यव्रतो अमानुषः तवन्तस्यामित्रहन वधर्दासस्य दम्भय |||
verses.transliteration: akarmā dasyurabhi no amanturanyavrato amānuṣaḥ tvantasyāmitrahan vadhardāsasya dambhaya

translations.griffith: Around us is the Dasyu, riteless, void of sense, inhuman, keeping alien laws.  Baffle, thou Slayer of the foe, the weapon which this Dāsa wields.

verses.sanskrit: तवं न इन्द्र शूर शूरैरुत तवोतासो बर्हणा पुरुत्राते वि पूर्तयो नवन्त कषोणयो यथा |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indra śūra śūrairuta tvotāso barhaṇā purutrāte vi pūrtayo navanta kṣoṇayo yathā

translations.griffith: Hero with Heroes, thou art ours: yea, strong are they whom thou dost help.  In many a place are thy full gifts, and men, like vassals, sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तान वर्त्रहत्ये चोदयो नॄन कार्पाणे शूर वज्रिवः गुहा यदी कवीनां विशां नक्षत्रशवसाम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tān vṛtrahatye codayo nṝn kārpāṇe śūra vajrivaḥ ghuhā yadī kavīnāṃ viśāṃ nakṣatraśavasām

translations.griffith: Urge thou these heroes on to slay the enemy, brave Thunderer! in the fight with swords.  Even when hid among the tribes of Sages numerous as stars.

verses.sanskrit: मक्षू ता त इन्द्र दानाप्नस आक्षाणे शूर वज्रिवः यद ध शुष्णस्य दम्भयो जातं विश्वं सयावभिः |||
verses.transliteration: makṣū tā ta indra dānāpnasa ākṣāṇe śūra vajrivaḥ yad dha śuṣṇasya dambhayo jātaṃ viśvaṃ sayāvabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Swift come those gifts of thine whose hand is prompt to rend and burn, O Hero Thunder-armed:  As thou with thy Companions didst destroy the whole of SuSnia's brood.

verses.sanskrit: माकुध्र्यगिन्द्र शूर वस्वीरस्मे भूवन्नभिष्टयः वयं-वयं त आसां सुम्ने सयाम वज्रिवः |||
verses.transliteration: mākudhryaghindra śūra vasvīrasme bhūvannabhiṣṭayaḥ vayaṃ-vayaṃ ta āsāṃ sumne syāma vajrivaḥ

translations.griffith: Let not thine excellent assistance come to us, O Hero Indra, profitless.  May we, may we enjoy the bliss of these thy favours, Thunderer!

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे ता त इन्द्र सन्तु सत्याहिंसन्तीरुपस्प्र्शः विद्यामयासां भुजो धेनूनां न वज्रिवः |||
verses.transliteration: asme tā ta indra santu satyāhiṃsantīrupaspṛśaḥ vidyāmayāsāṃ bhujo dhenūnāṃ na vajrivaḥ

translations.griffith: May those soft impulses of thine, O Indra, be fruitful and innocent to us.  May we know these whose treasures are like those of milch-kine, Thunderer!

verses.sanskrit: अहस्ता यदपदी वर्धत कषाः शचीभिर्वेद्यानाम शुष्णं परि परदक्षिणिद विश्वायवे नि शिश्नथः |||
verses.transliteration: ahastā yadapadī vardhata kṣāḥ śacībhirvedyānām śuṣṇaṃ pari pradakṣiṇid viśvāyave ni śiśnathaḥ

translations.griffith: That Earth, through power of knowing things that may be known, handless and footless yet might thrive,  Thou slewest, turning to the right, gu;na for every living man.

verses.sanskrit: पिबा-पिबेदिन्द्र शूर सोमं मा रिषण्यो वसवान वसुःसन उत तरायस्व गर्णतो मघोनो महश्च रायो रेवतस्क्र्धी नः |||
verses.transliteration: pibā-pibedindra śūra somaṃ mā riṣaṇyo vasavāna vasuḥsan uta trāyasva ghṛṇato maghono mahaśca rāyo revataskṛdhī naḥ

translations.griffith: Drink, drink the Soma, Hero Indra; be not withheld as thou art good, O Treasure-giver.  Preserve the singers and our liberal princes, and make us wealthy with abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit: यजामह इन्द्रं वज्रदक्षिणं हरीणां रथ्यंविव्रतानाम पर शमश्रु दोधुवदूर्ध्वथा भूद विसेनाभिर्दयमानो वि राधसा |||
verses.transliteration: yajāmaha indraṃ vajradakṣiṇaṃ harīṇāṃ rathyaṃvivratānām pra śmaśru dodhuvadūrdhvathā bhūd visenābhirdayamāno vi rādhasā

translations.griffith: INDRA, whose right hand wields the bolt, we worship, driver of Bay Steeds seeking sundered courses.  Shaking his beard with might he hath arisen, casting his weapons forth and dealing bounties.

verses.sanskrit: हरी नवस्य या वने विदे वस्विन्द्रो मघैर्मघवाव्र्त्रहा भुवत रभुर्वाज रभुक्षाः पत्यते शवो.अवक्ष्णौमि दासस्य नाम चित |||
verses.transliteration: harī nvasya yā vane vide vasvindro maghairmaghavāvṛtrahā bhuvat ṛbhurvāja ṛbhukṣāḥ patyate śavo.avakṣṇaumi dāsasya nāma cit

translations.griffith: The treasure which his Bay Steeds found at sacrifice,—this wealth made opulent Indra slayer of the foe.  Ṛbhu, Ṛbhukṣan, Vāja-he is Lord of Might. The Dāsa's very name I utterly destroy.

verses.sanskrit: यदा वज्रं हिरण्यमिदथा रथं हरी यमस्यवहतो वि सूरिभिः आ तिष्ठति मघवा सनश्रुत इन्द्रोवाजस्य दीर्घश्रवसस पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: yadā vajraṃ hiraṇyamidathā rathaṃ harī yamasyavahato vi sūribhiḥ ā tiṣṭhati maghavā sanaśruta indrovājasya dīrghaśravasas patiḥ

translations.griffith: When, with the Princes, Maghavari, famed of old, comes nigh the thunderbolt of gold, and the Controller's car  Which his two Tawny Coursers draw, then Indra is the Sovran Lord of power whose glory spreads afar.

verses.sanskrit: सो चिन नु वर्ष्टिर्यूथ्या सवा सचानिन्द्रः शमश्रूणिहरिताभि परुष्णुते अव वेति सुक्षयं सुते मधूदिद्धूनोति वातो यथा वनम |||
verses.transliteration: so cin nu vṛṣṭiryūthyā svā sacānindraḥ śmaśrūṇiharitābhi pruṣṇute ava veti sukṣayaṃ sute madhūdiddhūnoti vāto yathā vanam

translations.griffith: With him too is this rain of his that comes like herds: Indra throws drops of moisture on his yellow beard.  When the sweet juice is shed he seeks the pleasant place, and stirs the worshipper as wind disturbs the wood.

verses.sanskrit: यो वाचा विवाचो मर्ध्रवाचः पुरू सहस्राशिवा जघान तत-तदिदस्य पौंस्यं गर्णीमसि पितेव यस्तविषींवाव्र्धे शवः |||
verses.transliteration: yo vācā vivāco mṛdhravācaḥ purū sahasrāśivā jaghāna tat-tadidasya pauṃsyaṃ ghṛṇīmasi piteva yastaviṣīṃvāvṛdhe śavaḥ

translations.griffith: We laud and praise his several deeds of valour who, fatherlike, with power hath made us stronger;  Who with his voice slew many thousand wicked ones who spake in varied manners with contemptuous cries.

verses.sanskrit: सतोमं त इन्द्र विमदा अजीजनन्नपूर्व्यं पुरुतमंसुदानवे विद्मा हयस्य भोजनमिनस्य यदा पशुं नगोपाः करामहे |||
verses.transliteration: stomaṃ ta indra vimadā ajījanannapūrvyaṃ purutamaṃsudānave vidmā hyasya bhojanaminasya yadā paśuṃ naghopāḥ karāmahe

translations.griffith: Indra, the Vimadas have formed for thee a laud, copious, unparalleled, for thee Most Bountiful.  We know the good we gain from him the Mighty One when we attract him as a herdsman calls the kine.

verses.sanskrit: माकिर्न एना सख्या वि यौशुस्तव चेन्द्र विमदस्य चर्शेः विद्मा हि ते परमतिं देव जामिवदस्मे ते सन्तुसख्या शिवानि |||
verses.transliteration: mākirna enā sakhyā vi yauśustava cendra vimadasya caṛśeḥ vidmā hi te pramatiṃ deva jāmivadasme te santusakhyā śivāni

translations.griffith: Ne’er may this bond of friendship be dissevered, the Ṛṣi Vimada's and thine, O Indra.  We know thou carest for us as a brother with us, O God, be thine auspicious friendship.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र सोममिमं पिब मधुमन्तं चमू सुतम अस्मे रयिंनि धारय वि वो मदे सहस्रिणं पुरूवसो विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: indra somamimaṃ piba madhumantaṃ camū sutam asme rayiṃni dhāraya vi vo made sahasriṇaṃ purūvaso vivakṣase

translations.griffith: O INDRA, drink this Soma, pressed out in the mortar, full of sweets.  Send down to us great riches,—at your glad carouse-in thousands, O Most healthy. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: तवां यज्ञेभिरुक्थैरुप हव्येभिरीमहे शचीपतेशचीनां वि वो मदे शरेष्ठं नो धेहि वार्यं विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ yajñebhirukthairupa havyebhirīmahe śacīpateśacīnāṃ vi vo made śreṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vāryaṃ vivakṣase

translations.griffith: To thee with sacrifices, with oblations, and with lauds we come.  Lord of all strength and power, grant-at your glad carouse-the best choiceworthy treasure. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: यस पतिर्वार्याणामसि रध्रस्य चोदिता इन्द्रस्तोतॄणामविता वि वो मदे दविषो नः पाह्यंहसोविवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: yas patirvāryāṇāmasi radhrasya coditā indrastotṝṇāmavitā vi vo made dviṣo naḥ pāhyaṃhasovivakṣase

translations.griffith: Thou who art Lord of precious boons, inciter even of the churl.  Guardian of singers, Indra,—at your glad carouse-save us from woe and hatred. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: युवं शक्रा मायाविना समीची नीरमन्थतम विमदेनयदिळित नसत्य निरमन्थतम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ śakrā māyāvinā samīcī nīramanthatam vimadenayadiḷita nasatya niramanthatam

translations.griffith: Strong, Lords of Magic power, ye Twain churned the united worlds apart,  When ye, implored by Vimada, Nāsatyas, forced apart the pair.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवा अक्र्पन्त समिच्योर्निष्पतन्त्योः नसत्यवब्रुवन्देवः पुनरा वहतदिति |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devā akṛpanta samicyorniṣpatantyoḥ nasatyavabruvandevaḥ punarā vahataditi

translations.griffith: When the united pair were rent asunder all the Gods complained.  The Gods to the Nāsatyas cried, Bring these together once again.

verses.sanskrit: मधुमन मे परायणं मधुमत पुनरयनम त नो देवदेवतय युवं मधुमतस कर्तम |||
verses.transliteration: madhuman me parāyaṇaṃ madhumat punarayanam ta no devadevataya yuvaṃ madhumatas kṛtam

translations.griffith: Sweet be my going forth, and rich in sweets be my approach to home.  So, through your Deity, both Gods, enrich us with all pleasantness.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रं नो अपि वातय मनो दक्षमुत करतुम अधा तेसख्ये अन्धसो वि वो मदे रणन गवो न यवसे विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: bhadraṃ no api vātaya mano dakṣamuta kratum adhā tesakhye andhaso vi vo made raṇan ghavo na yavase vivakṣase

translations.griffith: SEND us a good and happy mind, send energy and mental power.  Then-at your glad carouse-let men joy in thy love, Sweet juice! as kine in pasture. Thou. art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: हर्दिस्प्र्शस्त असते विश्वेषु सोम ध मसु अधा कामा इमेमम वि वो मदे वि तिष्ठन्ते वसूयवो विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: hṛdispṛśasta asate viśveṣu soma dha masu adhā kāmā imemama vi vo made vi tiṣṭhante vasūyavo vivakṣase

translations.griffith: rn all thy forms, O Soma, rest thy powers that influence the heart.  So also these my longings-at your glad carouse-spread themselves seeking riches. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: उत वरतनि सोम ते परहं मिनामि पाक्या अधा पितेवसूनवे वि वो मदे मर्ळ नो अभि चिद वधाद विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: uta vratani soma te prahaṃ mināmi pākyā adhā pitevasūnave vi vo made mṛḷa no abhi cid vadhād vivakṣase

translations.griffith: Even if, O Soma, I neglect thy laws through my simplicity,  Be gracious-at your glad carouse-as sire to son. Preserve us even from slaughter. T'hou. art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: समु पर यन्ति धीतयः सर्गासो.अवतानिव करतुं नःसोम जिवसे वि वो मदे धरया चमसानिव विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: samu pra yanti dhītayaḥ sarghāso.avatāniva kratuṃ naḥsoma jivase vi vo made dharayā camasāniva vivakṣase

translations.griffith: Our songs in concert go to thee as streams of water to the wells.  Soma, that we may live, grant-at your glad carouse-full powers of mind, like beakers. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: तव तये सोम शक्तिभिर्निकामासो वय रण्विरे गर्त्सस्यधिरस्तवसो वि वो मदे वरजं गोमन्तमश्विनं विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: tava tye soma śaktibhirnikāmāso vy ṛṇvire ghṛtsasyadhirastavaso vi vo made vrajaṃ ghomantamaśvinaṃ vivakṣase

translations.griffith: O Soma, through thy might who art skilful and strong, these longing men,  These sages, have thrown open-at your glad carouse-the stall of kine and horses. Thou art waxing great

verses.sanskrit: पशुं नः सोम रक्षसि पुरुत्र विष्ठितं जगत समाक्र्णोषि जीवसे वि वो मदे विश्वा सम्पश्यन भुवनविवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: paśuṃ naḥ soma rakṣasi purutra viṣṭhitaṃ jaghat samākṛṇoṣi jīvase vi vo made viśvā sampaśyan bhuvanavivakṣase

translations.griffith: Our herds thou guardest, Soma, and the moving world spread far and wide.  Thou fittest them for living,—at your glad carouse-looking upon all beings. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नः सोम विश्वतो गोप अदभ्यो भव सेध राजन्नपस्रिधो वि वो मदे म नो दुः शंस ईशता विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato ghopa adabhyo bhava sedha rājannapasridho vi vo made ma no duḥ śaṃsa īśatā vivakṣase

translations.griffith: On all sides, Soma, be to us a Guardian ne’er to be deceived.  King, drive away our foemen-at your glad carouse:—let not the wicked rule us. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नः सोम सुक्रतुर्व योधेयाय जाग्र्हि कषेत्रवित्तरोमनुषो वि वो मदे दरुहो नः पाह्यंहसो विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ soma sukraturva yodheyāya jāghṛhi kṣetravittaromanuṣo vi vo made druho naḥ pāhyaṃhaso vivakṣase

translations.griffith: Be watchful, Soma, passing wise, to give us store of vital strength.  More skilled than man to guide us,—at your glad carouse-save us from harm and sorrow. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो वर्त्र हन्तमेन्द्रस्येन्दो शिवः सखा यत सिंहवन्ते समिथे वि वो मदे युध्यमनस्तोकसातौविवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no vṛtra hantamendrasyendo śivaḥ sakhā yat siṃhavante samithe vi vo made yudhyamanastokasātauvivakṣase

translations.griffith: Chief slayer of our foemen, thou, Indu, art Indra's gracious Friend,  When warriors invoke him-at your glad carouse -in fight, to win them offspring. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: अयं घ स तुरो मद इन्द्रस्य वर्धत परियः अयंकक्षीवतो महो वि वो मदे मतिं विप्रस्य वर्धयद्विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ gha sa turo mada indrasya vardhata priyaḥ ayaṃkakṣīvato maho vi vo made matiṃ viprasya vardhayadvivakṣase

translations.griffith: Victorious is this gladdening drink: to Indra dear it grows in strength.  This-at your glad carouse -enhanced the mighty hymn of the great sage Kakṣīvān. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: अयं विप्रय दशुषे वजनियर्ति गोमतः अयंसप्तभ्य आ वरं वि वो मदे परन्धं शरोणं चतरिषद विवक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vipraya daśuṣe vajaniyarti ghomataḥ ayaṃsaptabhya ā varaṃ vi vo made prandhaṃ śroṇaṃ catariṣad vivakṣase

translations.griffith: This to the sage who offers gifts brings power that comes from wealth in kine.  This, better than the seven, hath-at your glad carouse-furthered the blind, the cripple. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit: पर हयछा मनीषा सपार्ह यन्ति नियुतः पर दस्रानियुद्रथः पूषा अविष्टु माहिनः |||
verses.transliteration: pra hyachā manīṣā spārha yanti niyutaḥ pra dasrāniyudrathaḥ pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ

translations.griffith: FORWARD upon their way proceed the ready teams, the lovely songs.  Further them glorious Pūṣan with yoked chariot, and the Mighty Twain!

verses.sanskrit: यस्य तयन महित्वं वताप्यमयं जनः विप्र आ वंसद्धीतिभिश्चिकेत सुष्टुतीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: yasya tyan mahitvaṃ vatāpyamayaṃ janaḥ vipra ā vaṃsaddhītibhiściketa suṣṭutīnām

translations.griffith: With sacred hymns let this man here, this singer, win the God to whom  Belong this majesty and might. He hath observed our eulogies.

verses.sanskrit: स वेद सुष्टुतीनामिन्दुर्न पूष वर्षा अभि पसुरःप्रुषायति वरजं न आ परुषायति |||
verses.transliteration: sa veda suṣṭutīnāmindurna pūṣa vṛṣā abhi psuraḥpruṣāyati vrajaṃ na ā pruṣāyati

translations.griffith: Pūṣan the Strong hath knowledge of sweet praises even as Indu hath.  He dews our corn with moisture, he bedews the pasture of our kine.

verses.sanskrit: मंसीमहि तवा वयमस्माकं देव पूषन मत्मां चसाधनं विप्राणां चाधवम |||
verses.transliteration: maṃsīmahi tvā vayamasmākaṃ deva pūṣan matmāṃ casādhanaṃ viprāṇāṃ cādhavam

translations.griffith: We will bethink ourselves of thee, O Pūṣan, O thou God, as One.  Who brings fulfilment of our hymns, and stirs the singer and the sage.

verses.sanskrit: परत्यर्धिर्यज्ञनामश्वहयो रथानाम रषिः स योमनुर्हितो विप्रस्य यावयत्सखः |||
verses.transliteration: pratyardhiryajñanāmaśvahayo rathānām ṛṣiḥ sa yomanurhito viprasya yāvayatsakhaḥ

translations.griffith: joint-sharer of each sacrifice, the driver of the chariot steeds;  The Ṛṣi who is good to man, the singer's Friend and faithful Guard.

verses.sanskrit: अधीषमाणायाः पतिः शुचायाश्च शुचस्य च वासोवयो.अवीनामा वासांसि मर्म्र्जत |||
verses.transliteration: adhīṣamāṇāyāḥ patiḥ śucāyāśca śucasya ca vāsovayo.avīnāmā vāsāṃsi marmṛjat

translations.griffith: One who is Lord of Suca, Lord of Suca caring for herself:  Weaving the raiment of the sheep and making raiment beautiful.

verses.sanskrit: इनो वाजानां पतिरिनः पुष्टीनं सख पर शमश्रुहर्यतो दूधोद वि वर्थ यो अदाभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: ino vājānāṃ patirinaḥ puṣṭīnaṃ sakha pra śmaśruharyato dūdhod vi vṛtha yo adābhyaḥ

translations.griffith: The mighty Lord of spoil and wealth, Strong Friend of all prosperity;  He with light movement shakes his beard, lovely and ne’er to be deceived.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते रथस्य पूषन्नजा धुरं वव्र्त्युः विश्वस्यार्थिनः सखा सनोजा अनपच्युतः |||
verses.transliteration: ā te rathasya pūṣannajā dhuraṃ vavṛtyuḥ viśvasyārthinaḥ sakhā sanojā anapacyutaḥ

translations.griffith: O Pūṣan, may those goats of thine turn hitherward thy chariot-pole.  Friend of all suppliants; art thou, born in old time, and arm and sure.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मकमुर्जा रथं पूषा अविष्टु माहिनः भुवद्वजनां वर्ध इमं नः शर्णवद धवम |||
verses.transliteration: asmakamurjā rathaṃ pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ bhuvadvajanāṃ vṛdha imaṃ naḥ śṛṇavad dhavam

translations.griffith: May the majestic Pūṣan speed our chariot with his power and might.  May he increase our store of wealth and listen to this call of ours.

verses.sanskrit: असत सु मे जरितः साभिवेगो यत सुन्वते यजमनय शिक्षम अनाशीर्दामहमस्मि परहन्ता सत्यध्व्र्तं वर्जिनायन्तमाभुम |||
verses.transliteration: asat su me jaritaḥ sābhivegho yat sunvate yajamanaya śikṣam anāśīrdāmahamasmi prahantā satyadhvṛtaṃ vṛjināyantamābhum

translations.griffith: THIS, singer, is my firm determination, to aid the worshipper who pours the Soma.  I slay the man who brings no milkoblation, unrighteous, powerful, the truth's perverter.

verses.sanskrit: यदीदहं युधये संनयान्यदेवयून तन्वाशूशुजानान अमा ते तुम्रं वर्षभं पचानि तीव्रंसुतं पञ्चदशं नि षिञ्चम |||
verses.transliteration: yadīdahaṃ yudhaye saṃnayānyadevayūn tanvāśūśujānān amā te tumraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ pacāni tīvraṃsutaṃ pañcadaśaṃ ni ṣiñcam

translations.griffith: Then Will I, when I lead my friends to battle against the radiant persons of the godless,  Prepare for thee at home a vigorous bullock, and pour for thee the fifteen-fold strong juices.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं तं वेद य इति बरवीत्यदेवयून समरणेजघन्वान यदावाख्यत समरणं रघावदादिद ध मेव्र्षभा पर बरुवन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: nāhaṃ taṃ veda ya iti bravītyadevayūn samaraṇejaghanvān yadāvākhyat samaraṇaṃ ṛghāvadādid dha mevṛṣabhā pra bruvanti

translations.griffith: I know not him who sayeth and declareth that he hath slain the godless in the battle.  Soon as they see the furious combat raging, men speak forth praises of my vigorous horses.

verses.sanskrit: यदज्ञातेषु वर्जनेष्वासं विश्वे सतो मघवानो मासन जिनामि वेत कषेम आ सन्तमाभुं पर तंक्षिणां पर्वते पादग्र्ह्य |||
verses.transliteration: yadajñāteṣu vṛjaneṣvāsaṃ viśve sato maghavāno maāsan jināmi vet kṣema ā santamābhuṃ pra taṃkṣiṇāṃ parvate pādaghṛhya

translations.griffith: While yet my deeds of might were unrecorded, all passed for Maghavans though I existed.  The potent one who dwelt in peace I conquered, grasped by the foot and slew him on the mountain.

verses.sanskrit: न वा उ मां वर्जने वारयन्ते न पर्वतासो यदहम्मनस्ये मम सवनात कर्धुकर्णो भयात एवेदनु दयून्किरणः समेजात |||
verses.transliteration: na vā u māṃ vṛjane vārayante na parvatāso yadahammanasye mama svanāt kṛdhukarṇo bhayāta evedanu dyūnkiraṇaḥ samejāt

translations.griffith: None hinder me in mine heroic exploits, no, not the mountains when I will and purpose.  Even the deaf will tremble at my roaring, and every day will dust be agitated.

verses.sanskrit: दर्शन नवत्र शर्तपाननिन्द्रान बाहुक्षदः शरवेपत्यमानान घर्षुं वा ये निनिदुः सखायमध्यू नवेषु पवयो वव्र्त्युः |||
verses.transliteration: darśan nvatra śṛtapānanindrān bāhukṣadaḥ śaravepatyamānān ghṛṣuṃ vā ye niniduḥ sakhāyamadhyū nveṣu pavayo vavṛtyuḥ

translations.griffith: To see the Indraless oblation-drinkers, mean offerers, o’ertaken by destruction!  Then shall the fellies of my car pass over those who have blamed my joyous Friend and scorned him.

verses.sanskrit: अभूर्वौक्षीर्व्यु आयुरानड दर्षन नु पूर्वो अपरोनु दर्षत दवे पवस्ते परि तं न भूतो यो अस्य पारेरजसो विवेष |||
verses.transliteration: abhūrvaukṣīrvyu āyurānaḍ darṣan nu pūrvo aparonu darṣat dve pavaste pari taṃ na bhūto yo asya pārerajaso viveṣa

translations.griffith: Thou wast, thou grewest to full vital vigour: an earlier saw, a later one shall see thee.  Two canopies, as ’twere, are round about him who reacheth to the limit of this region.

verses.sanskrit: गावो यवं परयुता अर्यो अक्षन ता अपश्यं सहगोपाश्चरन्तीः हवा इदर्यो अभितः समायन कियदासुस्वपतिश्छन्दयाते |||
verses.transliteration: ghāvo yavaṃ prayutā aryo akṣan tā apaśyaṃ sahaghopāścarantīḥ havā idaryo abhitaḥ samāyan kiyadāsusvapatiśchandayāte

translations.griffith: The freed kine eat the barley of the pious. 1 saw them as they wandered with the herdsman.  The calling of the pious rang around them. What portion will these kine afford their owner?

verses.sanskrit: सं यद वयं यवसादो जनानामहं यवाद उर्वज्रेन्तः अत्रा युक्तो.अवसातारमिछादथो अयुक्तं युनजद्ववन्वान |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yad vayaṃ yavasādo janānāmahaṃ yavāda urvajreantaḥ atrā yukto.avasātāramichādatho ayuktaṃ yunajadvavanvān

translations.griffith: When we who cat the grass of men are gathered I am with barley-eaters in the corn-land.  There shall the captor yoke the yokeless bullock, and he who hath been yoked seek one to loose him.

verses.sanskrit: अत्रेदु मे मंससे सत्यमुक्तं दविपाच्च यच्चतुष्पात्संस्र्जानि सत्रीभिर्यो अत्र वर्षणं पर्तन्यादयुद्धोस्य वि भजानि वेदः |||
verses.transliteration: atredu me maṃsase satyamuktaṃ dvipācca yaccatuṣpātsaṃsṛjāni strībhiryo atra vṛṣaṇaṃ pṛtanyādayuddhoasya vi bhajāni vedaḥ

translations.griffith: There wilt thou hold as true my spoken purpose, to bring together quadrupeds. and bipeds.  I will divide, without a fight, his riches who warreth here, against the Bull, with women.

verses.sanskrit: यस्यानक्षा दुहिता जात्वास कस्तां विद्वानभिमन्याते अन्धाम कतरो मेनिं परति तं मुचाते य ईंवहाते य ईं वा वरेयात |||
verses.transliteration: yasyānakṣā duhitā jātvāsa kastāṃ vidvānabhimanyāte andhām kataro meniṃ prati taṃ mucāte ya īṃvahāte ya īṃ vā vareyāt

translations.griffith: When a man's daughter hath been ever eyeless, who, knowing, will be wroth with her for blindness?  Which of the two will loose on him his anger-the man who leads her home or he who woos her?

verses.sanskrit: कियती योषा मर्यतो वधूयोः परिप्रीता पन्यसावार्येण भद्रा वधूर्भवति यत सुपेशाः सवयं सामित्रं वनुते जने चित |||
verses.transliteration: kiyatī yoṣā maryato vadhūyoḥ pariprītā panyasāvāryeṇa bhadrā vadhūrbhavati yat supeśāḥ svayaṃ sāmitraṃ vanute jane cit

translations.griffith: How many a maid is pleasing to the suitor who fain would marry for her splendid riches?  If the girl be both good and fair of feature, she finds, herself, a friend among the people.

verses.sanskrit: पत्तो जगार परत्यञ्चमत्ति शीर्ष्णा शिरः परति दधौवरूथम आसीन ऊर्ध्वामुपसि कषिणाति नयंं उत्तानामन्वेति भूमिम |||
verses.transliteration: patto jaghāra pratyañcamatti śīrṣṇā śiraḥ prati dadhauvarūtham āsīna ūrdhvāmupasi kṣiṇāti nyaṃṃ uttānāmanveti bhūmim

translations.griffith: His feet have grasped: he eats the man who meets him. Around his head he sets the head for shelter.  Sitting anear and right above he smites us, and follows earth that lies spread out beneath him.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हन्नछायो अपलाशो अर्वा तस्थौ माता विषितो अत्तिगर्भः अन्यस्या वत्सं रिहती मिमाय कया भुवा निदधे धेनुरूधः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhannachāyo apalāśo arvā tasthau mātā viṣito attigharbhaḥ anyasyā vatsaṃ rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā nidadhe dhenurūdhaḥ

translations.griffith: High, leafless, shadowless, and swift is Heaven: the Mother stands, the Youngling, loosed, is feeding.  Loud hath she lowed, licking Another's offspring. In what world hath the Cow laid down her udder?

verses.sanskrit: सप्त वीरासो अधरादुदायन्नष्टोत्तरात्तात समजग्मिरन ते नव पश्चातात सथिविमन्त आयन दश पराक्सानु वि तिरन्त्यश्नः |||
verses.transliteration: sapta vīrāso adharādudāyannaṣṭottarāttāt samajaghmiran te nava paścātāt sthivimanta āyan daśa prāksānu vi tirantyaśnaḥ

translations.griffith: Seven heroes from the nether part ascended, and from the upper part came eight together.  Nine from behind came armed with winnowing-baskets: ten from the front pressed o’er the rock's high ridges.

verses.sanskrit: दशानामेकं कपिलं समानं तं हिन्वन्ति करतवेपार्याय गर्भं माता सुधितं वक्षणास्ववेनन्तन्तुषयन्ती बिभर्ति |||
verses.transliteration: daśānāmekaṃ kapilaṃ samānaṃ taṃ hinvanti kratavepāryāya gharbhaṃ mātā sudhitaṃ vakṣaṇāsvavenantantuṣayantī bibharti

translations.griffith: One of the ten, the tawny, shared in common, they send to execute their final purpose.  The Mother carries on her breast the Infant of noble form and soothes it while it knows not.

verses.sanskrit: पीवानं मेषमपचन्त वीरा नयुप्ता अक्षा अनु दीवासन दवा धनुं बर्हतीमप्स्वन्तः पवित्रवन्ता चरतःपुनन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: pīvānaṃ meṣamapacanta vīrā nyuptā akṣā anu dīvaāsan dvā dhanuṃ bṛhatīmapsvantaḥ pavitravantā carataḥpunantā

translations.griffith: The Heroes dressed with fire the fatted wether: the dice were thrown by way of sport and gaming.  Two reach the plain amid the heavenly waters, hallowing and with means of purifying.

verses.sanskrit: वि करोशनासो विष्वञ्च आयन पचाति नेमो नहि पक्षदर्धः अयं मे देवः सविता तदाह दर्वन्न इद वनवत्सर्पिरन्नः |||
verses.transliteration: vi krośanāso viṣvañca āyan pacāti nemo nahi pakṣadardhaḥ ayaṃ me devaḥ savitā tadāha drvanna id vanavatsarpirannaḥ

translations.griffith: Crying aloud they ran in all directions: One half of them will cook, and not the other.  To me hath Savitar, this God, declared it: He will perform, whose food is wood and butter.

verses.sanskrit: अपश्यं गरामं वहमानमारादचक्रया सवधयावर्तमानम सिषक्त्यर्यः पर युगा जनानां सद्यःशिश्ना परमिनानो नवीयान |||
verses.transliteration: apaśyaṃ ghrāmaṃ vahamānamārādacakrayā svadhayāvartamānam siṣaktyaryaḥ pra yughā janānāṃ sadyaḥśiśnā pramināno navīyān

translations.griffith: I saw a troop advancing from the distance moved, not by wheels but their own God-like nature.  The Friendly One seeks human generations, destroying, still new bands of evil beings.

verses.sanskrit: एतौ मे गावौ परमरस्य युक्तौ मो षु पर सेधीर्मुहुरिन्ममन्धि आपश्चिदस्य वि नशन्त्यर्थं सूरश्च मर्कौपरो बभूवान |||
verses.transliteration: etau me ghāvau pramarasya yuktau mo ṣu pra sedhīrmuhurinmamandhi āpaścidasya vi naśantyarthaṃ sūraśca markauparo babhūvān

translations.griffith: These my two Bulls, even Pramara's, are harnessed: drive them not far; here let them often linger.  The waters even shall aid him to his object, and the all-cleansing Sun who is above us.

verses.sanskrit: अयं यो वज्रः पुरुधा विव्र्त्तो.अवः सूर्यस्य बर्हतःपुरीषात शरव इदेना परो अन्यदस्ति तदव्यथीजरिमाणस्तरन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ yo vajraḥ purudhā vivṛtto.avaḥ sūryasya bṛhataḥpurīṣāt śrava idenā paro anyadasti tadavyathījarimāṇastaranti

translations.griffith: This is the thunderbolt which often whirleth down from the lofty misty realm of Sūrya.  Beyond this realm there is another glory so through old age they pass and feel no sorrow.

verses.sanskrit: वर्क्षे-वर्क्षे नियता मीमयद गौस्ततो वयः पर पतान्पुरुषादः अथेदं विश्वं भुवनं भयात इद्रायसुन्वद रषये च शिक्षत |||
verses.transliteration: vṛkṣe-vṛkṣe niyatā mīmayad ghaustato vayaḥ pra patānpuruṣādaḥ athedaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ bhayāta idrāyasunvad ṛṣaye ca śikṣat

translations.griffith: Bound fast to,every tree the cow is lowing, and thence the man-consuming birds are flying,  Then all this world, though pressing juice for Indra and strengthening the Ṛṣi, is affrighted.

verses.sanskrit: देवानां माने परथमा अतिष्ठन कर्न्तत्रदेषमुपर उदायन तरयस्तपन्ति पर्थिविमनूप दव बर्बूकं वहतःपुरीषम |||
verses.transliteration: devānāṃ māne prathamā atiṣṭhan kṛntatradeṣamupara udāyan trayastapanti pṛthivimanūpa dva bṛbūkaṃ vahataḥpurīṣam

translations.griffith: In the Gods’ mansion stood the first-created, and from their separation came the later.  Three warm the Earth while holding stores of water, and Two of these convey the murmuring moisture.

verses.sanskrit: सा ते जीवातुरुत तस्य विद्धि म समैताद्र्गप गूहःसमर्ये अविः सवः कर्णुते गूहते बुसं स पादुरस्यनिर्णिजो न मुच्यते |||
verses.transliteration: sā te jīvāturuta tasya viddhi ma smaitādṛghapa ghūhaḥsamarye aviḥ svaḥ kṛṇute ghūhate busaṃ sa pādurasyanirṇijo na mucyate

translations.griffith: This is thy life: and do thou mark and know it. As such, hide not thyself in time of battle.  He manifests the light and hides the vapour: his foot is never free from robes that veil it.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वो हयन्यो अरिराजगाम ममेदह शवशुरो न जगाम जक्षीयाद धना उत सोमं पपीयात सवाशितः पुनरस्तं जगायात |||
verses.transliteration: viśvo hyanyo arirājaghāma mamedaha śvaśuro na jaghāma jakṣīyād dhanā uta somaṃ papīyāt svāśitaḥ punarastaṃ jaghāyāt

translations.griffith: Now all my other friends are here assembled: my Sire-in-law alone hath not come hither.  So might he eat the grain and drink the Soma, and, satisfied, return unto; his dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: स रोरुवद वर्षभस्तिग्मश्र्न्गो वर्ष्मन तस्थाु वरिमन्नाप्र्थिव्याः विश्वेष्वेनं वर्जनेषु पामि यो मे कुक्षिसुतसोमः पर्णाति |||
verses.transliteration: sa roruvad vṛṣabhastighmaśṛngho varṣman tasthāu varimannāpṛthivyāḥ viśveṣvenaṃ vṛjaneṣu pāmi yo me kukṣisutasomaḥ pṛṇāti

translations.griffith: Loud belloweth the Bull whose horns are sharpened: upon the height above earth's breadth he standeth.  That man I guard and save in all his troubles who fills my flanks when he hath shed the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: अद्रिणा ते मन्दिन इन्द्र तूयान सुन्वन्ति सोमान पिबसि तवमेशाम पचन्ति ते वर्षभानत्सि तेषां पर्क्षेण यन्मघवन हूयमानः |||
verses.transliteration: adriṇā te mandina indra tūyān sunvanti somān pibasi tvameśām pacanti te vṛṣabhānatsi teṣāṃ pṛkṣeṇa yanmaghavan hūyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: Men with the stone press out for thee, O Indra, strong, gladdening Soma, and thereof thou drinkest.  Bulls they dress for thee, and of these thou eatest when, Maghavan, with food thou art invited.

verses.sanskrit: इदं सु मे जरितरा चिकिद्धि परतीपं शापं नद्योवहन्ति लोपाशः सिंहं परत्यञ्चमत्साः करोष्टावराहं निरतक्त कक्षात |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ su me jaritarā cikiddhi pratīpaṃ śāpaṃ nadyovahanti lopāśaḥ siṃhaṃ pratyañcamatsāḥ kroṣṭāvarāhaṃ niratakta kakṣāt

translations.griffith: Resolve for me, O singer, this my riddle: The rivers send their swelling water backward:  The fox steals up to the approaching lion: the jackal drives the wild-boar from the brushwood.

verses.sanskrit: कथ त एतदहमा चिकेतं गर्त्सस्य पाकस्तवसोमनीषाम तवं नो विद्वान रतुथा वि वोचो यमर्धं तेमघवन कषेम्या धूः |||
verses.transliteration: katha ta etadahamā ciketaṃ ghṛtsasya pākastavasomanīṣām tvaṃ no vidvān ṛtuthā vi voco yamardhaṃ temaghavan kṣemyā dhūḥ

translations.griffith: How shall I solve this riddle, I, the simple, declare the thought of thee the Wise and Mighty?  Tell us, well knowing, as befits the season: Whitherward is thy prosperous car advancing?

verses.sanskrit: एवा हि मां तवसं वर्धयन्ति दिवश्चिन मे बर्हतौत्तरा धुः पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशामि साकमशत्रुंहि म जनिता जजान |||
verses.transliteration: evā hi māṃ tavasaṃ vardhayanti divaścin me bṛhatauttarā dhuḥ purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi sākamaśatruṃhi ma janitā jajāna

translations.griffith: Thus do they magnify me, me the mighty higher than even high heaven is my car-pole.  I all at once demolish many thousands: my Sire begot me with no foe to match me.

verses.sanskrit: एवा हि मां तवसं जज्ञुरुग्रं कर्मन-कर्मन वर्षणमिन्द्र देवाः वधीं वर्त्रं वज्रेण मन्दसनो.अप वरजम्महिना दाशुषे वम |||
verses.transliteration: evā hi māṃ tavasaṃ jajñurughraṃ karman-karman vṛṣaṇamindra devāḥ vadhīṃ vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasano.apa vrajammahinā dāśuṣe vam

translations.griffith: Yea, and the Gods have known me also, Indra, as mighty, fierce and strong in every exploit.  Exulting with the bolt I slaughtered Vṛtra, and for the offerer oped with might the cow-stall.

verses.sanskrit: देवास आयन परशून्रबिभ्रन वना वर्श्चन्तो अभि विड्भिरायन नि सुद्र्वं दधतो वक्षणासु यत्रा कर्पीटमनुतद दहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: devāsa āyan paraśūnrabibhran vanā vṛścanto abhi viḍbhirāyan ni sudrvaṃ dadhato vakṣaṇāsu yatrā kṛpīṭamanutad dahanti

translations.griffith: The Deities approached, they carried axes; splitting the wood they came with their attendants.  They laid good timber in the fire-receivers, and burnt the grass up where they found it growing.

verses.sanskrit: शशः कषुरं परत्यञ्चं जगाराद्रिं लोगेन वयभेदमारात बर्हन्तं चिद रहते रन्धयानि वयद वत्सो वर्षभंशूशुवानः |||
verses.transliteration: śaśaḥ kṣuraṃ pratyañcaṃ jaghārādriṃ loghena vyabhedamārāt bṛhantaṃ cid ṛhate randhayāni vayad vatso vṛṣabhaṃśūśuvānaḥ

translations.griffith: The hare hath swallowed up the opposing razor: I sundered with a clod the distant mountain.  The great will I make subject to the little: the calf shall wax in strength and cat the bullock.

verses.sanskrit: सुपर्ण इत्था नखमा सिषायावरुद्धः परिपदं नसिंहः निरुद्धश्चिन महिषस्तर्ष्यावान गोधा तस्मायथं कर्षदेतत |||
verses.transliteration: suparṇa itthā nakhamā siṣāyāvaruddhaḥ paripadaṃ nasiṃhaḥ niruddhaścin mahiṣastarṣyāvān ghodhā tasmāayathaṃ karṣadetat

translations.griffith: There hath the strong-winged eagle left his talon, as a snared lion leaves the trap that caught him.  Even the wild steer in his thirst is captured: the leather strap still holds his foot entangled.

verses.sanskrit: तेभ्यो गोधा अयथं कर्षदेतद ये बरह्मणः परतिपियन्त्यन्नैः सिम उक्ष्णो.अवस्र्ष्टानदन्ति सवयं बलानितन्वः शर्णानाः |||
verses.transliteration: tebhyo ghodhā ayathaṃ karṣadetad ye brahmaṇaḥ pratipiyantyannaiḥ sima ukṣṇo.avasṛṣṭānadanti svayaṃ balānitanvaḥ śṛṇānāḥ

translations.griffith: So may the leather strap their foot entangle who fatten on the viands of the Brahman.  They all devour the bulls set free to wander, while they themselves destroy their bodies' vigour.

verses.sanskrit: एते शमीभिः सुशमी अभूवन ये हिन्विरे तन्वः सोमौक्थैः नर्वद वदन्नुप नो माहि वाजान दिवि शरवोदधिषे नाम वीरः |||
verses.transliteration: ete śamībhiḥ suśamī abhūvan ye hinvire tanvaḥ somaukthaiḥ nṛvad vadannupa no māhi vājān divi śravodadhiṣe nāma vīraḥ

translations.griffith: They were well occupied with holy duties who sped in person with their lauds to Soma.  Speaking like man, mete to us wealth and booty: in heaven thou hast the name and fame of Hero.

verses.sanskrit: वने न वा यो नयधायि चाकञ्छुचिर्वां सतोमो भुरणावजीगः यस्येदिन्द्रः पुरुदिनेषु होता नर्णां नर्योन्र्तमः कषपावान |||
verses.transliteration: vane na vā yo nyadhāyi cākañchucirvāṃ stomo bhuraṇāvajīghaḥ yasyedindraḥ purudineṣu hotā nṛṇāṃ naryonṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān

translations.griffith: As sits the young bird on the tree rejoicing, ye, swift Pair, have been roused by clear laudation,  Whose Herald-Priest through many days is Indra, earth's Guardian, Friend of men, the best of Heroes.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते अस्या उषसः परापरस्या नर्तौ सयाम नर्तमस्यन्र्णाम अनु तरिशोकः शतमावहन नॄन कुत्सेन रथो योसत ससवान |||
verses.transliteration: pra te asyā uṣasaḥ prāparasyā nṛtau syāma nṛtamasyanṛṇām anu triśokaḥ śatamāvahan nṝn kutsena ratho yoasat sasavān

translations.griffith: May we, when this Dawn and the next dance hither, be thy best servants, most heroic Hero!  Let the victorious car with triple splendour bring hitherward the hundred chiefs with Kutsa.

verses.sanskrit: कस्ते मद इन्द्र रन्त्यो भूद दुरो गिरो अभ्युग्रो वि धाव कद वाहो अर्वागुप मा मनीषा आ तवा शक्यमुपमंराधो अन्नैः |||
verses.transliteration: kaste mada indra rantyo bhūd duro ghiro abhyughro vi dhāva kad vāho arvāghupa mā manīṣā ā tvā śakyamupamaṃrādho annaiḥ

translations.griffith: What was the gladdening draught that pleased thee, Indra? Speed through our doors to songs, for thou art mighty.  Why comest thou to me, what gift attracts thee? Fain would I bring thee food most meet to offer.

verses.sanskrit: कदु दयुम्नमिन्द्र तवावतो नॄन कया धिया करसे कन नागन मित्रो न सत्य उरुगाय भर्त्या अन्ने समस्य यदसन्मनीषाः |||
verses.transliteration: kadu dyumnamindra tvāvato nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kan naāghan mitro na satya urughāya bhṛtyā anne samasya yadasanmanīṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, what fame hath one like thee mid heroes? With what plan wilt thou act? Why hast thou sought us?  As a true Friend, Wide-Strider! to sustain us, since food absorbs the thought of each among us.

verses.sanskrit: परेरय सूरो अर्थं न पारं ये अस्य कामं जनिधा इवग्मन गिरश्च ये ते तुविजात पूर्वीर्नर इन्द्रप्रतिशिक्षन्त्यन्नैः |||
verses.transliteration: preraya sūro arthaṃ na pāraṃ ye asya kāmaṃ janidhā ivaghman ghiraśca ye te tuvijāta pūrvīrnara indrapratiśikṣantyannaiḥ

translations.griffith: Speed happily those, as Sūrya ends his journey, who meet his wish as bridegrooms meet their spouses;  Men who present, O Indra strong by nature, with food the many songs that tell thy praises.

verses.sanskrit: मात्रे नु ते सुमिते इन्द्र पूर्वी दयौर्मज्मना पर्थिवीकाव्येन वराय ते घर्तवन्तः सुतासः सवाद्मन भवन्तुपीतये मधूनि |||
verses.transliteration: mātre nu te sumite indra pūrvī dyaurmajmanā pṛthivīkāvyena varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādman bhavantupītaye madhūni

translations.griffith: Thine are two measures, Indra, wide-wellmeted, heaven for thy majesty, earth for thy wisdom.  Here for thy choice are Somas mixed with butter: may the sweet meath be pleasant for thy drinking.

verses.sanskrit: आ मध्वो अस्मा असिचन्नमत्रमिन्द्राय पूर्णं स हिसत्यराधाः स वाव्र्धे वरिमन्ना पर्थिव्या अभि करत्वानर्यः पौंस्यैश्च |||
verses.transliteration: ā madhvo asmā asicannamatramindrāya pūrṇaṃ sa hisatyarādhāḥ sa vāvṛdhe varimannā pṛthivyā abhi kratvānaryaḥ pauṃsyaiśca

translations.griffith: They have poured out a bowl to him, to Indra, full of sweet juice, for faithful is his bounty.  O'er earth's expanse hath he grown great by wisdom, the Friend of man, and by heroic exploits.

verses.sanskrit: वयानळ इन्द्रः पर्तनाः सवोजा आस्मै यतन्ते सख्यायपूर्वीः आ समा रथं न पर्तनासु तिष्ठ यं भद्रयासुमत्या चोदयासे |||
verses.transliteration: vyānaḷ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā āsmai yatante sakhyāyapūrvīḥ ā smā rathaṃ na pṛtanāsu tiṣṭha yaṃ bhadrayāsumatyā codayāse

translations.griffith: Indra hath conquered in his wars, the Mighty: men strive in multitudes to win his friendship.  Ascend thy chariot as it were in battle, which thou shalt drive to us with gracious favour.

verses.sanskrit: पर देवत्रा बराह्मणे गातुरेत्वपो अछा मनसो नप्रयुक्ति महीं मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धासिं पर्थुज्रयसेरीरधा सुव्र्क्तिम |||
verses.transliteration: pra devatrā brāhmaṇe ghāturetvapo achā manaso naprayukti mahīṃ mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsiṃ pṛthujrayaserīradhā suvṛktim

translations.griffith: As ’twere with swift exertion of the spirit, let the priest speed to the celestial Waters,  The glorious food of Varuṇa and Mitra. To him who spreadeth far this laud I offer.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो हविष्मन्तो हि भूताछाप इतोशतीरुशन्तः अव याश्चष्टे अरुणः सुपर्णस्तमास्यध्वमूर्मिमद्या सुहस्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo haviṣmanto hi bhūtāchāpa itośatīruśantaḥ ava yāścaṣṭe aruṇaḥ suparṇastamāsyadhvamūrmimadyā suhastāḥ

translations.griffith: Adhvaryus, he ye ready with oblations,, and come with longing to the longing Waters,  Down on which looks the. purple-tinted Eagle. Pour ye that flowing wave this day, deft-handed.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो.अप इता समुद्रमपां नपातं हविषा यजध्वम स वो दददूर्मिमद्या सुपूतं तस्मै सोमं मधुमन्तंसुनोत |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo.apa itā samudramapāṃ napātaṃ haviṣā yajadhvam sa vo dadadūrmimadyā supūtaṃ tasmai somaṃ madhumantaṃsunota

translations.griffith: Go to the reservoir, O ye Adhvaryus worship the Waters’ Child with your oblations.  A consecrated wave he now will give you, so press for him the Soma rich in sweetness.

verses.sanskrit: यो अनिध्मो दीदयदप्स्वन्तर्यं विप्रास ईळतेध्वरेषु अपां नपान मधुमतीरपो दा याभिरिन्द्रोवाव्र्धे वीर्याय |||
verses.transliteration: yo anidhmo dīdayadapsvantaryaṃ viprāsa īḷateadhvareṣu apāṃ napān madhumatīrapo dā yābhirindrovāvṛdhe vīryāya

translations.griffith: He who shines bright in floods, unfed with fuel, whom sages worship at their sacrifices:  Give waters rich in sweets, Child of the Waters, even those which gave heroic might to Indra:

verses.sanskrit: याभिः सोमो मोदते हर्षते च कल्याणीभिर्युवतिभिर्नमर्यः ता अध्वर्यो अपो अछा परेहि यदासिञ्चाोषधीभिः पुनीतात |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ somo modate harṣate ca kalyāṇībhiryuvatibhirnamaryaḥ tā adhvaryo apo achā parehi yadāsiñcāoṣadhībhiḥ punītāt

translations.griffith: Those in which Soma joys and is delighted, as a young man with fair and pleasant damsels.  Go thou unto those Waters, O Adhvaryu, and purify with herbs what thou infusest.

verses.sanskrit: एवेद यूने युवतयो नमन्त यदीमुशन्नुशतीरेत्यछ सं जानते मनसा सं चिकित्रे.अध्वर्यवो धिषणापश्चदेवीः |||
verses.transliteration: eved yūne yuvatayo namanta yadīmuśannuśatīretyacha saṃ jānate manasā saṃ cikitre.adhvaryavo dhiṣaṇāpaścadevīḥ

translations.griffith: So maidens bow before the youthful gallant who comes with love to them who yearn to meet him.  In heart accordant and in wish one-minded are the Adhvaryus and the heavenly Waters.

verses.sanskrit: यो वो वर्ताभ्यो अक्र्णोदु लोकं यो वो मह्या अभिशस्तेरमुञ्चत तस्मा इन्द्राय मधुमन्तमूर्मिं देवमादनम्प्र हिणोतनापः |||
verses.transliteration: yo vo vṛtābhyo akṛṇodu lokaṃ yo vo mahyā abhiśasteramuñcat tasmā indrāya madhumantamūrmiṃ devamādanampra hiṇotanāpaḥ

translations.griffith: He who made room for you when fast imprisoned, who freed you from the mighty imprecation,—  Even to that Indra send the meath-rich current, the wave that gratifies the Gods, O Waters.

verses.sanskrit: परास्मै हिनोत मधुमन्तमूर्मिं गर्भो यो वः सिन्धवोमध्व उत्सः घर्तप्र्ष्ठमीड्यमध्वरेष्वापो रेवतीःश्र्णुता हवं मे |||
verses.transliteration: prāsmai hinota madhumantamūrmiṃ gharbho yo vaḥ sindhavomadhva utsaḥ ghṛtapṛṣṭhamīḍyamadhvareṣvāpo revatīḥśṛṇutā havaṃ me

translations.griffith: Send forth to him the meath-rich wave, O Rivers, which is your offspring and a well of sweetness,  Oil-balmed, to be implored at sacrifices. Ye wealthy Waters, hear mine invocation.

verses.sanskrit: तं सिन्धवो मत्सरमिन्द्रपानमूर्मिं पर हेत य उभेियर्ति मदच्युतमौशानं नभोजां परि तरितन्तुंविचरन्तमुत्सम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ sindhavo matsaramindrapānamūrmiṃ pra heta ya ubheiyarti madacyutamauśānaṃ nabhojāṃ pari tritantuṃvicarantamutsam

translations.griffith: Send forth the rapture-giving wave, O Rivers, which Indra drinks, which sets the Twain in motion;  The well that springeth from the clouds, desirous, that wandereth triple-formed, distilling transport.

verses.sanskrit: आवर्व्र्ततीरध नु दविधारा गोषुयुधो न नियवंचरन्तीः रषे जनित्रीर्भुवनस्य पत्नीरपो वन्दस्वसव्र्धः सयोनीः |||
verses.transliteration: āvarvṛtatīradha nu dvidhārā ghoṣuyudho na niyavaṃcarantīḥ ṛṣe janitrīrbhuvanasya patnīrapo vandasvasavṛdhaḥ sayonīḥ

translations.griffith: These winding Streams which with their double current, like cattle-raiders, seek the lower pastures,—  Waters which dwell together, thrive together, Queens, Mothers of the world, these, Ṛṣi, honour.

verses.sanskrit: हिनोता नो अध्वरं देवयज्या हिनोत बरह्म सनयेधनानाम रतस्य योगे वि शयध्वमूधः शरुष्टीवरीर्भूतनास्मभ्यमापः |||
verses.transliteration: hinotā no adhvaraṃ devayajyā hinota brahma sanayedhanānām ṛtasya yoghe vi śyadhvamūdhaḥ śruṣṭīvarīrbhūtanāsmabhyamāpaḥ

translations.griffith: Send forth our sacrifice with holy worship send forth the hymn and prayer for gain of riches.  For need of sacrifice disclose the udder. Give gracious hearing to our call, O Waters.

verses.sanskrit: आपो रेवतीः कषयथा हि वस्वः करतुं च भद्रम्बिभ्र्थाम्र्तं च रायश्च सथ सवपत्यस्य पत्नीःसरस्वती तद गर्णते वयो धात |||
verses.transliteration: āpo revatīḥ kṣayathā hi vasvaḥ kratuṃ ca bhadrambibhṛthāmṛtaṃ ca rāyaśca stha svapatyasya patnīḥsarasvatī tad ghṛṇate vayo dhāt

translations.griffith: For, wealthy Waters, ye control all treasures: ye bring auspicious intellect and Amṛta.  Ye are the Queens of independent riches Sarasvatī give full life to the singer!

verses.sanskrit: परति यदापो अद्र्श्रमायतीर्घ्र्तं पयांसि बिभ्रतीर्मधूनि अध्वर्युभिर्मनसा संविदाना इन्द्राय सोमंसुषुतं भरन्तीः |||
verses.transliteration: prati yadāpo adṛśramāyatīrghṛtaṃ payāṃsi bibhratīrmadhūni adhvaryubhirmanasā saṃvidānā indrāya somaṃsuṣutaṃ bharantīḥ

translations.griffith: When I behold the Waters coming hither, carrying with them milk and mcath and butter,  Bearing the well-pressed Soma juice to Indra, they harmonize in spirit with Adhvaryus.

verses.sanskrit: एमा अग्मन रेवतीर्जीवधन्या अध्वर्यवः सादयतासखायः नि बर्हिषि धत्तन सोम्यासो.अपां नप्त्रासंविदानास एनाः |||
verses.transliteration: emā aghman revatīrjīvadhanyā adhvaryavaḥ sādayatāsakhāyaḥ ni barhiṣi dhattana somyāso.apāṃ naptrāsaṃvidānāsa enāḥ

translations.griffith: Rich, they are come with wealth for living beings, O friends, Adhvaryus, seat them in their places.  Seat them on holy grass, ye Soma-bringers in harmony with the Offspring of the Waters.

verses.sanskrit: आग्मन्नाप उशतीर्बर्हिरेदं नयध्वरे असदन्देवयन्तीः अध्वर्यवः सुनुतेन्द्राय सोममभूदु वःसुशका देवयज्या |||
verses.transliteration: āghmannāpa uśatīrbarhiredaṃ nyadhvare asadandevayantīḥ adhvaryavaḥ sunutendrāya somamabhūdu vaḥsuśakā devayajyā

translations.griffith: Now to this grass are come the longing Waters: the Pious Ones are seated at our worship.  Adbvaryus, press the Soma juice for Indra so will the service of the Gods be easy.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो देवानामुप वेतु शंसो विश्वेभिस्तुरैरवसेयजत्रः तेभिर्वयं सुषखायो भवेम तरन्तो विश्वादुरिता सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no devānāmupa vetu śaṃso viśvebhisturairavaseyajatraḥ tebhirvayaṃ suṣakhāyo bhavema taranto viśvāduritā syāma

translations.griffith: MAY benediction of the Gods approach us, holy, to aid us with all rapid succours.  Therewith may we be happily befriended, and pass triumphant over all our troubles.

verses.sanskrit: परि चिन मर्तो दरविणं ममन्याद रतस्य पथा नमसाविवासेत अत सवेन करतुना सं वदेत शरेयांसन्दक्षं मनसा जग्र्भ्यात |||
verses.transliteration: pari cin marto draviṇaṃ mamanyād ṛtasya pathā namasāvivāset ata svena kratunā saṃ vadeta śreyāṃsandakṣaṃ manasā jaghṛbhyāt

translations.griffith: A man should think on wealth and strive to win it by adoration on the path of Order,  Counsel himself with his own mental insight, and grasp still nobler vigour with his spirit.

verses.sanskrit: अधायि धीतिरसस्र्ग्रमंशास्तीर्थे न दस्ममुपयन्त्युमाः अभ्यानश्म सुवितस्य शूषं नवेदसोम्र्तानामभूम |||
verses.transliteration: adhāyi dhītirasasṛghramaṃśāstīrthe na dasmamupayantyumāḥ abhyānaśma suvitasya śūṣaṃ navedasoamṛtānāmabhūma

translations.griffith: The hymn is formed, poured are the allotted portions: as to a ford friends come unto the Wondrous.  We have obtained the power of case and comfort, we haVe become acquainted, with Immortals.

verses.sanskrit: नित्यश्चाकन्यात सवपतिर्दामूना यस्मा उ देवः सवितजजान भगो वा गोभिरर्यमेमनज्यात सो अस्मै चरुश्छदयदुत सयात |||
verses.transliteration: nityaścākanyāt svapatirdāmūnā yasmā u devaḥ savitajajāna bhagho vā ghobhiraryamemanajyāt so asmai caruśchadayaduta syāt

translations.griffith: Pleased be the Eternal Lord who loves the household with this man whom God Savitar created.  May Bhaga Aryaman grace him with cattle: may he appear to him, and be, delightful.

verses.sanskrit: इयं सा भूया उषसामिव कष यद ध कषुमन्तःशवसा समायन अस्य सतुतिं जरितुर्भिक्षमाणा आनः शग्मास उप यन्तु वाजाः |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ sā bhūyā uṣasāmiva kṣa yad dha kṣumantaḥśavasā samāyan asya stutiṃ jariturbhikṣamāṇā ānaḥ śaghmāsa upa yantu vājāḥ

translations.griffith: Like the Dawns' dwelling-place be this assembly, where in their might men rich in food have gathered.  Striving to share the praises of this singer. To us come strengthening and effectual riches!

verses.sanskrit: अस्येदेषा सुमतिः पप्रथानाभवत पूर्व्या भुमनागौः अस्य सनीळा असुरस्य योनौ समान आ भरणेबिभ्रमाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: asyedeṣā sumatiḥ paprathānābhavat pūrvyā bhumanāghauḥ asya sanīḷā asurasya yonau samāna ā bharaṇebibhramāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: This Bull's most gracious far-extended favour existed first of all in full abundance.  By his support they are maintained in common who in the Asura's mansion dwell together.

verses.sanskrit: किं सविद वनं क उ स वर्क्ष आस यतो दयावाप्र्थिवीनिष्टतक्षुः सन्तस्थाने अजरे इतूती अहानि पूर्वीरुषसो जरन्त |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivīniṣṭatakṣuḥ santasthāne ajare itaūtī ahāni pūrvīruṣaso jaranta

translations.griffith: What was the tree, what wood, in sooth, produced it, from which they fashioned forth the Earth and Heaven?  These Twain stand fast and wax not old for ever: these have sung praise to many a day and morning.

verses.sanskrit: नैतावदेना परो अन्यदस्त्युक्षा स दयावाप्र्थिवीबिभर्ति तवदं पवित्रं कर्णुत सवधावान यदींसूर्यं न हरितो वहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: naitāvadenā paro anyadastyukṣā sa dyāvāpṛthivībibharti tvadaṃ pavitraṃ kṛṇuta svadhāvān yadīṃsūryaṃ na harito vahanti

translations.griffith: Not only here is this: more is beyond us. He is the Bull, the Heaven's and Earth's supporter.  With power divine he makes his skin a filter, when the Bay Coursers bear him on as Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: सतेगो न कषामत्येति पर्थ्वीं मिहं न वातो वि हवाति भूम मित्रो यत्र वरुणो अज्यमानो.अग्निर्वने न वयस्र्ष्ट शोकम |||
verses.transliteration: stegho na kṣāmatyeti pṛthvīṃ mihaṃ na vāto vi havāti bhūma mitro yatra varuṇo ajyamāno.aghnirvane na vyasṛṣṭa śokam

translations.griffith: He passes o’er the broad earth like a Stega: he penetrates the world as Wind the mist-cloud.  He, balmed with oil, near Varuṇa and Mitra, like Agni in the wood, hath shot forth splendour.

verses.sanskrit: सतरीर्यत सूत सद्यो अज्यमाना वयथिरव्यथिः कर्णुतस्वगोपा पुत्रो यत पुर्वः पित्रोर्जनिष्ट शम्यां गौर्जगार यद ध पर्छान |||
verses.transliteration: starīryat sūta sadyo ajyamānā vyathiravyathiḥ kṛṇutasvaghopā putro yat purvaḥ pitrorjaniṣṭa śamyāṃ ghaurjaghāra yad dha pṛchān

translations.griffith: When suddenly called the cow that erst was barren, she, self-protected, ended all her troubles.  Earth, when the first son sprang from sire and mother, cast up the gami, that which men were seeking.

verses.sanskrit: उत कण्वं नर्षदः पुत्रमाहुरुत शयावो धनमादत्तवाजि पर कर्ष्णाय रुशदपिन्वतोधरतमत्र नकिरस्मा अपीपेत |||
verses.transliteration: uta kaṇvaṃ nṛṣadaḥ putramāhuruta śyāvo dhanamādattavāji pra kṛṣṇāya ruśadapinvatodhartamatra nakirasmā apīpet

translations.griffith: To Nṛṣad's son they gave the name of Kainva, and he the brown-hued courser won the treasure.  For him dark-coloured streamed the shining udder: none made it swell for him. Thus Order willed it.

verses.sanskrit: पर सु गमन्ता धियसानस्य सक्षणि वरेभिर्वरानभिषु परसीदतः अस्माकमिन्द्र उभयं जुजोषति यत्सोम्यस्यान्धसो बुबोधति |||
verses.transliteration: pra su ghmantā dhiyasānasya sakṣaṇi varebhirvarānabhiṣu prasīdataḥ asmākamindra ubhayaṃ jujoṣati yatsomyasyāndhaso bubodhati

translations.griffith: FORTH speed the Pair to bring the meditating God, benevolent with boons sent in return for boons.  May Indra graciously accept both gifts from us, when he hath knowledge of the flowing Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: वीन्द्र यासि दिव्यानि रोचना वि पार्थिवानि रजसापुरुष्टुत ये तवा वहन्ति मुहुरध्वरानुप ते सुवन्वन्तु वग्यनानराधसः |||
verses.transliteration: vīndra yāsi divyāni rocanā vi pārthivāni rajasāpuruṣṭuta ye tvā vahanti muhuradhvarānupa te suvanvantu vaghyanānarādhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou wanderest far, O Indra, through the spheres of light and realms of earth, the region, thou whom many praise!  Let those who often bring their solemn rites conquer the noisy babblers who present no gifts.

verses.sanskrit: तदिन मे छन्त्सत वपुषो वपुष्टरं पुत्रो यज्जानम्पित्रोरधीयति जाया पतिं वहति वग्नुना सुमत पुंसैद भद्रो वहतुः परिष्क्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: tadin me chantsat vapuṣo vapuṣṭaraṃ putro yajjānampitroradhīyati jāyā patiṃ vahati vaghnunā sumat puṃsaid bhadro vahatuḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: More beautiful than beauty must this seem to me, when the son duly careth for his parents' line.  The wife attracts the husband: with a shout of joy the man's auspicious marriage is performed aright.

verses.sanskrit: तदित सधस्थमभि चारु दीधय गावो यच्छासन्वहतुं न धेनवः माता यन मन्तुर्यूथस्यपूर्व्याभि वाणस्य सप्तधातुरिज्जनः |||
verses.transliteration: tadit sadhasthamabhi cāru dīdhaya ghāvo yacchāsanvahatuṃ na dhenavaḥ mātā yan manturyūthasyapūrvyābhi vāṇasya saptadhāturijjanaḥ

translations.griffith: This beauteous place of meeting have I looked upon, where, like milch-cows, the kine order the marriage train;  Where the Herd's Mother counts as first and best of all, and round her are the seven-toned people of the choir.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो.अछा रिरिचे देवयुष पदमेको रुद्रेभिर्यातितुर्वणिः जरा वा येष्वम्र्तेषु दावने परि वूमेभ्यः सिञ्चता मधु |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo.achā ririce devayuṣ padameko rudrebhiryātiturvaṇiḥ jarā vā yeṣvamṛteṣu dāvane pari vaūmebhyaḥ siñcatā madhu

translations.griffith: The Pious One hath reached your place before the rest: One only moves victorious with the Rudras' band.  To these your helpers pour our meath, Immortal Gods, with whom your song of praise hath power to win their gifts.

verses.sanskrit: निधीयमानमपगूळमप्सु पर मे देवानां वरतपाुवाच इन्द्रो विद्वाननु हि तवा चचक्ष तेनाहमग्नेनुशिष्ट आगाम |||
verses.transliteration: nidhīyamānamapaghūḷamapsu pra me devānāṃ vratapāuvāca indro vidvānanu hi tvā cacakṣa tenāhamaghneanuśiṣṭa āghām

translations.griffith: He who maintains the Laws of God informed me that thou wast lying hidden in the waters.  Indra, who knoweth well, beheld and showed thee. By him instructed am I come, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षेत्रवित कषेत्रविदं हयप्राट स परैतिक्षेत्रविदानुशिष्टः एतद वै भद्रमनुशासनोस्योतस्रुतिं विन्दत्यञ्जसीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: akṣetravit kṣetravidaṃ hyaprāṭ sa praitikṣetravidānuśiṣṭaḥ etad vai bhadramanuśāsanosyotasrutiṃ vindatyañjasīnām

translations.griffith: The stranger asks the way of him who knows it: taught by the skilful guide he travels onward.  This is, in truth, the blessing of instruction: he finds the path that leads directly forward.

verses.sanskrit: अद्येदु पराणीदममन्निमाहापीव्र्तो अधयन मातुरूधः एमेनमाप जरिमा युवानमहेळन वसुः सुमनाबभूव |||
verses.transliteration: adyedu prāṇīdamamannimāhāpīvṛto adhayan māturūdhaḥ emenamāpa jarimā yuvānamaheḷan vasuḥ sumanābabhūva

translations.griffith: Even now he breathed: these days hath he remembered. Concealed, he sucked the bosom of his Mother.  Yet in his youth old age hath come upon him: he hath grown gracious, good, and free from anger.

verses.sanskrit: एतानि भद्रा कलश करियाम कुरुश्रवण ददतो मघानि दान इद वो मघवानः सो अस्त्वयं च सोमो हर्दि यम्बिभर्मि |||
verses.transliteration: etāni bhadrā kalaśa kriyāma kuruśravaṇa dadato maghāni dāna id vo maghavānaḥ so astvayaṃ ca somo hṛdi yambibharmi

translations.griffith: O Kalasa, all these blessings will we bring them, O Kurusravana, who give rich presents.  May he, O wealthy princes, and this Soma which I am bearing in my heart, reward you.

verses.sanskrit: पर मा युयुज्रे परयुजो जनानां वहामि सम पुषणमन्तरेण विश्वे देवासो अध मामरक्षन दुःशासुरागादिति घोष आसीत |||
verses.transliteration: pra mā yuyujre prayujo janānāṃ vahāmi sma puṣaṇamantareṇa viśve devāso adha māmarakṣan duḥśāsurāghāditi ghoṣa āsīt

translations.griffith: THE urgings of the people have impelled me, and by,the nearest way I bring you Pūṣan.  The Universal Gods have brought me safely. The cry was heard, Behold, Dubsasu cometh!

verses.sanskrit: सं मा तपन्त्यभितः सपत्नीरिव पर्शवः नि बाधतेमतिर्नग्नता जसुर्वेर्न वेवीयते मतिः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ mā tapantyabhitaḥ sapatnīriva parśavaḥ ni bādhateamatirnaghnatā jasurverna vevīyate matiḥ

translations.griffith: The ribs that compass me give pain and trouble me like rival wives.  Indigence, nakedness, exhaustion press me sore: my mind is fluttering like a bird's.

verses.sanskrit: मूषो न शिश्ना वयदन्ति माध्य सतोतारं ते शतक्रतो सक्र्त सु नो मघवन्निन्द्र मर्ळयाधा पितेव नो भव |||
verses.transliteration: mūṣo na śiśnā vyadanti mādhya stotāraṃ te śatakrato sakṛt su no maghavannindra mṛḷayādhā piteva no bhava

translations.griffith: As rats eat weavers' threads, cares are consuming me, thy singer, gatakratu, me.  Have mercy on us once, O Indra, Bounteous Lord: be thou a Father unto us.

verses.sanskrit: कुरुश्रवणमाव्र्णि राजानं तरासदस्यवम मंहिष्ठंवाघतां रषिः |||
verses.transliteration: kuruśravaṇamāvṛṇi rājānaṃ trāsadasyavam maṃhiṣṭhaṃvāghatāṃ ṛṣiḥ

translations.griffith: I the priests' Ṛṣi chose as prince most liberal Kurusravana,  The son of Trasadasyu's son,

verses.sanskrit: यस्य मा हरितो रथे तिस्रो वहन्ति साधुया सतवैसहस्रदक्षिणे |||
verses.transliteration: yasya mā harito rathe tisro vahanti sādhuyā stavaisahasradakṣiṇe

translations.griffith: Whose three bays harnessed to the car bear me straight onward: I will laud  The giver of a thousand meeds,

verses.sanskrit: यस्य परस्वादसो गिर उपमश्रवसः पितुः कषेत्रं नरण्वमूचुषे |||
verses.transliteration: yasya prasvādaso ghira upamaśravasaḥ pituḥ kṣetraṃ naraṇvamūcuṣe

translations.griffith: The sire of Upamasravas, even him whose words were passing sweet,  As a fair field is to its lord.

verses.sanskrit: अधि पुत्रोपमश्रवो नपान मित्रातिथेरिहि पितुष टे अस्मिवन्दिता |||
verses.transliteration: adhi putropamaśravo napān mitrātitherihi pituṣ ṭe asmivanditā

translations.griffith: Mark, Upamasravas, his son, mark, grandson of Mitratithi:  I am thy father's eulogist.

verses.sanskrit: यदीशीयाम्र्तानामुत वा मर्त्यानाम जीवेदिन्मघवा मम |||
verses.transliteration: yadīśīyāmṛtānāmuta vā martyānām jīvedinmaghavā mama

translations.griffith: If I controlled Immortal Gods, yea, even were I Lord of men,  My liberal prince were living still.

verses.sanskrit: न देवानामति वरतं शतात्मा चन जीवति तथायुजा वि वाव्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: na devānāmati vrataṃ śatātmā cana jīvati tathāyujā vi vāvṛte

translations.griffith: None lives, even had he hundred lives, beyond the statute of the Gods  So am I parted from my friend.

verses.sanskrit: परावेपा मा बर्हतो मादयन्ति परवातेजा इरिणे वर्व्र्तानाः सोमस्येव मौजवतस्य भक्षो विभीदको जाग्र्विर्मह्यमछान |||
verses.transliteration: prāvepā mā bṛhato mādayanti pravātejā iriṇe varvṛtānāḥ somasyeva maujavatasya bhakṣo vibhīdako jāghṛvirmahyamachān

translations.griffith: SPRUNG from tall trees on windy heights, these rollers transport me as they turn upon the table.  Dearer to me the die that never slumbers than the deep draught of Mujavan's own Soma.

verses.sanskrit: न मा मिमेथ न जिहीळ एषा शिवा सखिभ्य उत मह्यमासीत अक्षस्याहमेकपरस्य हेतोरनुव्रतामप जायामरोधम |||
verses.transliteration: na mā mimetha na jihīḷa eṣā śivā sakhibhya uta mahyamāsīt akṣasyāhamekaparasya hetoranuvratāmapa jāyāmarodham

translations.griffith: She never vexed me nor was angry with me, but to my friends and me was ever gracious.  For the die's sake, whose single point is final, mine own devoted wife I alienated.

verses.sanskrit: दवेष्टि शवश्रूरप जाया रुणद्धि न नाथितो विन्दतेमर्डितारम अश्वस्येव जरतो वस्न्यस्य नाहं विन्दामिकितवस्य भोगम |||
verses.transliteration: dveṣṭi śvaśrūrapa jāyā ruṇaddhi na nāthito vindatemarḍitāram aśvasyeva jarato vasnyasya nāhaṃ vindāmikitavasya bhogham

translations.griffith: My wife holds me aloof, her mother hates me: the wretched man finds none to give him comfort.  As of a costly horse grown old and feeble, I find not any profit of the gamester.

verses.sanskrit: अन्ये जायां परि मर्शन्त्यस्य यस्याग्र्धद वेदने वाज्यक्षः पिता मता भरातर एनमाहुर्न जानीमो नयताबद्धमेतम |||
verses.transliteration: anye jāyāṃ pari mṛśantyasya yasyāghṛdhad vedane vājyakṣaḥ pitā matā bhrātara enamāhurna jānīmo nayatābaddhametam

translations.griffith: Others caress the wife of him whose riches the die hath coveted, that rapid courser:  Of him speak father, mother, brothers saying, We know him not: bind him and take him with you.

verses.sanskrit: यदादीध्ये न दविषाण्येभिः परायद्भ्यो.अव हीयेसखिभ्यः नयुप्ताश्च बभ्रवो वाचमक्रतनेमीदेषां निष्क्र्तं जारिणीव |||
verses.transliteration: yadādīdhye na daviṣāṇyebhiḥ parāyadbhyo.ava hīyesakhibhyaḥ nyuptāśca babhravo vācamakratanemīdeṣāṃ niṣkṛtaṃ jāriṇīva

translations.griffith: When I resolve to play with these no longer, my friends depart from me and leave me lonely.  When the brown dice, thrown on the board, have rattled, like a fond girl I seek the place of meeting.

verses.sanskrit: सभामेति कितवः पर्छमानो जेष्यामीति तन्वाशूशुजानः अक्षासो अस्य वि तिरन्ति कामं परतिदीव्नेदधत आ कर्तानि |||
verses.transliteration: sabhāmeti kitavaḥ pṛchamāno jeṣyāmīti tanvāśūśujānaḥ akṣāso asya vi tiranti kāmaṃ pratidīvnedadhata ā kṛtāni

translations.griffith: The gamester seeks the gambling-house, and wonders, his body all afire, Shall I be lucky?  Still do the dice extend his eager longing, staking his gains against his adversary.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षास इदनकुशिनो नितोदिनो निक्र्त्वानस्तपनास्तापयिष्णवः कुमारदेष्णा जयतः पुनर्हणो मध्वासम्प्र्क्ताः कितवस्य बर्हणा |||
verses.transliteration: akṣāsa idankuśino nitodino nikṛtvānastapanāstāpayiṣṇavaḥ kumāradeṣṇā jayataḥ punarhaṇo madhvāsampṛktāḥ kitavasya barhaṇā

translations.griffith: Dice, verily, are armed with goads and driving-hooks, deceiving and tormenting, causing grievous woe.  They give frail gifts and then destroy the man who wins, thickly anointed with the player's fairest good.

verses.sanskrit: तरिपञ्चाशः करीळति वरात एषां देव इव सवितासत्यधर्मा उग्रस्य चिन मन्यवे ना नमन्ते राजा चिदेभ्योनम इत कर्णोति |||
verses.transliteration: tripañcāśaḥ krīḷati vrāta eṣāṃ deva iva savitāsatyadharmā ughrasya cin manyave nā namante rājā cidebhyonama it kṛṇoti

translations.griffith: Merrily sports their troop, the three-and-fifty, like Savitar the God whose ways are faithful.  They bend not even to the mighty's anger: the King himself pays homage and reveres them.

verses.sanskrit: नीचा वर्तन्त उपरि सफुरन्त्यहस्तासो हस्तवन्तं सहन्ते दिव्या अङगारा इरिणे नयुप्ताः शीताः सन्तो हर्दयंनिर्दहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: nīcā vartanta upari sphurantyahastāso hastavantaṃ sahante divyā aṅghārā iriṇe nyuptāḥ śītāḥ santo hṛdayaṃnirdahanti

translations.griffith: Downward they roll, and then spring quickly upward, and, handless, force the man with hands to serve them.  Cast on the board, like lumps of magic charcoal, though cold themselves they burn the heart to ashes.

verses.sanskrit: जाया तप्यते कितवस्य हीना माता पुत्रस्य चरतः कवस्वित रणावा बिभ्यद धनमिछमानो.अन्येषामस्तमुपनक्तमेति |||
verses.transliteration: jāyā tapyate kitavasya hīnā mātā putrasya carataḥ kvasvit ṛṇāvā bibhyad dhanamichamāno.anyeṣāmastamupanaktameti

translations.griffith: The gambler's wife is left forlorn and wretched: the mother mourns the son who wanders homeless.  In constant fear, in debt, and seeking riches, he goes by night unto the home of others.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रियं दर्ष्ट्वाय कितवं ततापान्येषां जायांसुक्र्तं च योनिम पूर्वाह्णे अश्वान युयुजे हि बभ्रून सोग्नेरन्ते वर्षलः पपाद |||
verses.transliteration: striyaṃ dṛṣṭvāya kitavaṃ tatāpānyeṣāṃ jāyāṃsukṛtaṃ ca yonim pūrvāhṇe aśvān yuyuje hi babhrūn soaghnerante vṛṣalaḥ papāda

translations.griffith: Sad is the gambler when he sees a matron, another's wife, and his well-ordered dwelling.  He yokes the brown steeds in the early morning, and when the fire is cold sinks down an outcast.

verses.sanskrit: यो वः सेनानीर्महतो गणस्य राजा वरातस्य परथमोबभूव तस्मै कर्णोमि न धना रुणध्मि दशाहम्प्राचीस्तद रतं वदामि |||
verses.transliteration: yo vaḥ senānīrmahato ghaṇasya rājā vrātasya prathamobabhūva tasmai kṛṇomi na dhanā ruṇadhmi daśāhamprācīstad ṛtaṃ vadāmi

translations.griffith: To the great captain of your mighty army, who hath become the host's imperial leader,  To him I show my ten extended fingers: I speak the truth. No wealth am I withholding.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षैर्मा दीव्यः कर्षिमित कर्षस्व वित्ते रमस्व बहुमन्यमानः तत्र गावः कितव तत्र जाया तन मे विचष्टे सवितायमर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: akṣairmā dīvyaḥ kṛṣimit kṛṣasva vitte ramasva bahumanyamānaḥ tatra ghāvaḥ kitava tatra jāyā tan me vicaṣṭe savitāyamaryaḥ

translations.griffith: Play not with dice: no, cultivate thy corn-land. Enjoy the gain, and deem that wealth sufficient.  There are thy cattle there thy wife, O gambler. So this good Savitar himself hath told me.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रं कर्णुध्वं खलु मर्लता नो मा नो घोरेण चरताभिध्र्ष्णु नि वो नु मन्युर्विशतामरातिरन्यो बभ्रूणाम्प्रसितौ नवस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: mitraṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ khalu mṛlatā no mā no ghoreṇa caratābhidhṛṣṇu ni vo nu manyurviśatāmarātiranyo babhrūṇāmprasitau nvastu

translations.griffith: Make me your friend: show us some little mercy. Assail us not with your terrific fierceness.  Appeased be your malignity and anger, and let the brown dice snare some other captive.

verses.sanskrit: अबुध्रमु तय इन्द्रवन्तो अग्नयो जयोतिर्भरन्त उषसोव्युष्टिषु मही दयावाप्र्थिवी चेततामपो.अद्यादेवानामव आ वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: abudhramu tya indravanto aghnayo jyotirbharanta uṣasovyuṣṭiṣu mahī dyāvāpṛthivī cetatāmapo.adyādevānāmava ā vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: THESE fires associate with Indra are awake, bringing their light when first the Dawn begins to shine.  May Heaven and Earth, great Pair, observe our holy work. We claim for us this day the favour of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: दिवस्प्र्थिव्योरव आ वर्णीमहे मातॄन सिन्धून पर्वताञ्छर्यणावतः अनागास्त्वं सूर्यमुषासमीमहे भद्रंसोमः सुवानो अद्या कर्णोतु नः |||
verses.transliteration: divaspṛthivyorava ā vṛṇīmahe mātṝn sindhūn parvatāñcharyaṇāvataḥ anāghāstvaṃ sūryamuṣāsamīmahe bhadraṃsomaḥ suvāno adyā kṛṇotu naḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, for ourselves we claim the grace of Heaven and Earth, of Śaryaṇāvān, of the Hills and Mother Streams.  For innocence we pray to Sūrya and to Dawn. So may the flowing Soma bring us bliss to-day.

verses.sanskrit: दयावा नो अद्य पर्थिवी अनागसो मही तरायेतां सुवितायमातरा उषा उछन्त्यप बाधतामघं सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: dyāvā no adya pṛthivī anāghaso mahī trāyetāṃ suvitāyamātarā uṣā uchantyapa bādhatāmaghaṃ svastyaghniṃsamidhānamīmahe

translations.griffith: May the great Twain, the Mothers, Heaven and Earth, this day preserve us free from sin for peace and happiness.  May Morning sending forth her light drive sin afar. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit: इयं न उस्रा परथमा सुदेव्यं रेवत सनिभ्यो रेवती वयुछतु आरे मन्युं दुर्विदत्रस्य धीमहि सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ na usrā prathamā sudevyaṃ revat sanibhyo revatī vyuchatu āre manyuṃ durvidatrasya dhīmahi svastyaghniṃsamidhānamīmahe

translations.griffith: May this first Dawn bring us the host of gracious Gods: rich, may it richly shine for us who strive for wealth.  The wrath of the malignant may we keep afar. We pray to kindled Agni for feilicity.

verses.sanskrit: पर याः सिस्रते सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिर्ज्योतिर्भरन्तीरुषसो वयुष्टिषु भद्रा नो अद्य शरवसे वयुछत सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: pra yāḥ sisrate sūryasya raśmibhirjyotirbharantīruṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu bhadrā no adya śravase vyuchata svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe
