translations.griffith: Dawns, who come forward with the bright beams of the Sun, and at your earliest flushing bring to us the light,  Shine ye on us to-day auspicious, for renown. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit: अनमीवा उषस आ चरन्तु न उदग्नयो जिहतां जयोतिषाब्र्हत आयुक्षातामश्विना तूतुजिं रथं सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: anamīvā uṣasa ā carantu na udaghnayo jihatāṃ jyotiṣābṛhat āyukṣātāmaśvinā tūtujiṃ rathaṃ svastyaghniṃsamidhānamīmahe

translations.griffith: Free from all sickness may the Mornings come to us, and let our fires mount upward with a lofty blaze.  The Aśvin Pair have harnessed their swift-moving car. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit: शरेष्ठं नो अद्य सवितर्वरेण्यं भागमा सुव स हिरत्नधा असि रायो जनित्रीं धिषणामुप बरुवे सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: śreṣṭhaṃ no adya savitarvareṇyaṃ bhāghamā suva sa hiratnadhā asi rāyo janitrīṃ dhiṣaṇāmupa bruve svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe

translations.griffith: Send us to-day a portion choice and excellent, O Savitar, for thou art he who dealeth wealth.  I cry to Dhiṣaṇā, Mother of opulence. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit: पिपर्तु मा तद रतस्य परवाचनं देवानां यन मनुष्यामन्महि विश्वा इदुस्रा सपळ उदेति सूर्यः सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: pipartu mā tad ṛtasya pravācanaṃ devānāṃ yan manuṣyāamanmahi viśvā idusrā spaḷ udeti sūryaḥ svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe

translations.griffith: Further me this declaring of Eternal Law, the Law of Gods, as we mortals acknowledge it!  The Sun goes up beholding all the rays of morn. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit: अद्वेषो अद्य बर्हिष सतरीमणि गराव्णां योगे मन्मनःसाध ईमहे आदित्यानां शर्मणि सथा भुरण्यसि सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: adveṣo adya barhiṣa starīmaṇi ghrāvṇāṃ yoghe manmanaḥsādha īmahe ādityānāṃ śarmaṇi sthā bhuraṇyasi svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe

translations.griffith: This day we pray with innocence in strewing grass, adjusting pressing-stones, and perfecting the hymn.  Thou in the Ādityas’ keeping movest restlessly. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो बर्हिः सधमादे बर्हद दिवि देवानीळे सादयासप्त होतॄन इन्द्रं मित्रं वरुणं सातये भगं सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: ā no barhiḥ sadhamāde bṛhad divi devānīḷe sādayāsapta hotṝn indraṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sātaye bhaghaṃ svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe

translations.griffith: To our great holy grass I bid the Gods at morn to banquet, and will seat them as the seven priests,—  Varuṇa, Indra, Mitra, Bhaga for our gain. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit: त आदित्या आ गता सर्वतातये वर्धे नो यज्ञमवतासजोषसः बर्हस्पतिं पूषणमश्विना भगं सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: ta ādityā ā ghatā sarvatātaye vṛdhe no yajñamavatāsajoṣasaḥ bṛhaspatiṃ pūṣaṇamaśvinā bhaghaṃ svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe

translations.griffith: Come hither, O Ādityas, for our perfect weal: accordant help our sacrifice that we may thrive.  Pūṣan, Bṛhaspati, Bhaga, both Aśvins, and enkindled Agni we implore for happiness.

verses.sanskrit: तन नो देवा यछत सुप्रवाचनं छर्दिरादित्याः सुभरंन्र्पाय्यम पश्वे तोकाय तनयाय जीवसे सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: tan no devā yachata supravācanaṃ chardirādityāḥ subharaṃnṛpāyyam paśve tokāya tanayāya jīvase svastyaghniṃsamidhānamīmahe

translations.griffith: Ādityas, Gods, vouchsafe that this our home may be praise-worthy, prosperous, our heroes' sure defence,  For cattle, for our sons, for progeny, for life. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे अद्य मरुतो विश्व ऊती विश्वे भवन्त्वग्नयःसमिद्धाः विश्वे नो देवा अवसा गमन्तु विश्वमस्तुद्रविणं वाजो अस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: viśve adya maruto viśva ūtī viśve bhavantvaghnayaḥsamiddhāḥ viśve no devā avasā ghamantu viśvamastudraviṇaṃ vājo asme

translations.griffith: This day may all the Maruts, all he near us with aid: may all our fires be well enkindled.  May all Gods come to us with gracious favour. May spoil and wealth he ours, and all possessions.

verses.sanskrit: यं देवासो.अवथ वाजसातौ यं तरायध्वे यं पिप्र्थात्यंहः यो वो गोपीथे न भयस्य वेद ते सयामदेववीतये तुरासः |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ devāso.avatha vājasātau yaṃ trāyadhve yaṃ pipṛthātyaṃhaḥ yo vo ghopīthe na bhayasya veda te syāmadevavītaye turāsaḥ

translations.griffith: He whom ye aid, O Deities, in battle, whom ye protect and rescue from affliction,  Who fears no danger at your milk-libation, -such may we be to feast the Gods, ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: उषासानक्ता बर्हती सुपेशसा दयावाक्षामा वरुणोमित्रो अर्यमा इन्द्रं हुवे मरुतः पर्वतानप आदित्यान्द्यावाप्र्थिवी अपः सवः |||
verses.transliteration: uṣāsānaktā bṛhatī supeśasā dyāvākṣāmā varuṇomitro aryamā indraṃ huve marutaḥ parvatānapa ādityāndyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ

translations.griffith: THERE are the Dawn and Night, the grand and beauteous Pair, Earth, Heaven, and Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman.  Indra I call, the Maruts, Mountains, and the Floods, Ādityas, Heaven and Earth, the Waters, and the Sky.

verses.sanskrit: दयौश्च नः पर्थिवी च परचेतस रतावरी रक्षतामंहसोरिषः मा दुर्विदत्रा निरतिर्न ईशत तद देवानामवोद्या वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: dyauśca naḥ pṛthivī ca pracetasa ṛtāvarī rakṣatāmaṃhasoriṣaḥ mā durvidatrā nirtirna īśata tad devānāmavoadyā vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: May Dyaus and Prthivi, wise, true to Holy Law, keep us in safety from distress and injury.  Let not malignant Nirrti rule over us. We crave to-day this gracious favour of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वस्मान नो अदितिः पात्वंहसो माता मित्रस्य वरुणस्यरेवतः सवर्वज्ज्योतिरव्र्कं नशीमहि तद देवानां ... |||
verses.transliteration: viśvasmān no aditiḥ pātvaṃhaso mātā mitrasya varuṇasyarevataḥ svarvajjyotiravṛkaṃ naśīmahi tad devānāṃ ...

translations.griffith: Mother of Mitra and of opulent Varuṇa, may Aditi preserve us safe from all distress.  May we obtain the light of heaven without a foe. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit: गरावा वदन्नप रक्षांसि सेधतु दुष्वप्न्यं निरतिंविश्वमत्रिणम आदित्यं शर्म मरुतामशीमहि तद्देवानां ... |||
verses.transliteration: ghrāvā vadannapa rakṣāṃsi sedhatu duṣvapnyaṃ nirtiṃviśvamatriṇam ādityaṃ śarma marutāmaśīmahi taddevānāṃ ...

translations.griffith: May ringing press-stones keep the Rākṣasas afar, ill dream, and Nirrti, and each voracious fiend.  May the Ādityas and the Maruts shelter us. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit: एन्द्रो बर्हिः सीदतु पिन्वतामिळा बर्हस्पतिः सामभिरकवो अर्चतु सुप्रकेतं जीवसे मन्म धीमहि तद्देवानां ... |||
verses.transliteration: endro barhiḥ sīdatu pinvatāmiḷā bṛhaspatiḥ sāmabhirkvo arcatu supraketaṃ jīvase manma dhīmahi taddevānāṃ ...

translations.griffith: Full flow libations; on our grass let Indra sit; Bṛhaspati the singer laud with Sāma hymns!  Wise be our hearts' imaginings that we may live. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit: दिविस्प्र्शं यज्ञमस्माकमश्विना जीराध्वरं कर्णुतंसुम्नमिष्टये पराचीनरश्मिमाहुतं घर्तेन तद्देवानां ... |||
verses.transliteration: divispṛśaṃ yajñamasmākamaśvinā jīrādhvaraṃ kṛṇutaṃsumnamiṣṭaye prācīnaraśmimāhutaṃ ghṛtena taddevānāṃ ...

translations.griffith: Ye Aśvins, make our sacrifice ascend to heaven, and animate the rite that it may send us bliss,  Offered with holy oil, with forward-speeding rein. We crave the gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit: उप हवये सुहवं मारुतं गणं पावकं रष्वं सख्यायशम्भुवम रायस पोषं सौश्रवसाय धीमहि तद्देवानां ... |||
verses.transliteration: upa hvaye suhavaṃ mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ pāvakaṃ ṛṣvaṃ sakhyāyaśambhuvam rāyas poṣaṃ sauśravasāya dhīmahi taddevānāṃ ...

translations.griffith: Hither I call the band of Maruts, swift to hear, great, purifying, bringing bliss, to he our Friends.  May we increase our wealth to glorify our name. We crave this graciousfavour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit: अपां पेरुं जीवधन्यं भरामहे देवाव्यं सुहवमध्वरश्रियम सुरश्मिं सोममिन्द्रियं यमीमहि तद्देवानां ... |||
verses.transliteration: apāṃ peruṃ jīvadhanyaṃ bharāmahe devāvyaṃ suhavamadhvaraśriyam suraśmiṃ somamindriyaṃ yamīmahi taddevānāṃ ...

translations.griffith: We bring the Stay of Life, who makes the waters swell, swift-hearing, Friend of Gods, who waits on sacrifice.  May we control that Power, Soma whose rays are bright. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit: सनेम तत सुसनिता सनित्वभिर्वयं जीवा जीवपुत्रानागसः बरह्मद्विषो विष्वगेनो भरेरत तद्देवानां ... |||
verses.transliteration: sanema tat susanitā sanitvabhirvayaṃ jīvā jīvaputrāanāghasaḥ brahmadviṣo viṣvagheno bharerata taddevānāṃ ...

translations.griffith: Alive ourselves, with living sons, devoid of guilt, may we win this with winners by fair means to win.  Let the prayer-haters bear our sin to every side. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit: ये सथा मनोर्यज्ञियास्ते शर्णोतन यद वो देवा ईमहेतद ददातन जैत्रं करतुं रयिमद वीरवद यशस्तद्देवानां ... |||
verses.transliteration: ye sthā manoryajñiyāste śṛṇotana yad vo devā īmahetad dadātana jaitraṃ kratuṃ rayimad vīravad yaśastaddevānāṃ ...

translations.griffith: Hear us, O ye who claim the worship of mankind, and give us, O ye Gods, the gift for which we pray,  Victorious wisdom, fame with heroes and with wealth. We crave to-day this gracious favour of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: महदद्य महतामा वर्णीमहे.अवो देवानां बर्हतामनर्वणाम यथा वसु वीरजातं नशामहै तद्देवानां ... |||
verses.transliteration: mahadadya mahatāmā vṛṇīmahe.avo devānāṃ bṛhatāmanarvaṇām yathā vasu vīrajātaṃ naśāmahai taddevānāṃ ...

translations.griffith: We crave the gracious favour of the Gods to-day, great favour of great Gods, sublime and free from foes,  That we may gain rich treasure sprung from hero sons. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit: महो अग्नेः समिधानस्य शर्मण्यनागा मित्रे वरुणेस्वस्तये शरेष्ठे सयाम सवितुः सवीमनि तद्देवानां ... |||
verses.transliteration: maho aghneḥ samidhānasya śarmaṇyanāghā mitre varuṇesvastaye śreṣṭhe syāma savituḥ savīmani taddevānāṃ ...

translations.griffith: In great enkindled Agni's keeping, and, for bliss, free from all sin before Mitra and Varuṇa.  May we share Savitar's best animating help. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit: ये सवितुः सत्यसवस्य विश्वे मित्रस्य वरते वरुणस्यदेवाः ते सौभगं वीरवद गोमदप्नो दधातनद्रविणं चित्रमस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: ye savituḥ satyasavasya viśve mitrasya vrate varuṇasyadevāḥ te saubhaghaṃ vīravad ghomadapno dadhātanadraviṇaṃ citramasme

translations.griffith: All ye, the Gods whom Savitar the Father of truth, and Varuṇa and Mitra govern,  Give us prosperity with hero children, and opulence in kine and various treasure.

verses.sanskrit: सविता पश्चातात सविता पुरस्तात सवितोत्तरात्तात्सविताधरात्तात सविता नः सुवतु सर्वतातिं सविता नोरासतां दीर्घमयुः |||
verses.transliteration: savitā paścātāt savitā purastāt savitottarāttātsavitādharāttāt savitā naḥ suvatu sarvatātiṃ savitā norāsatāṃ dīrghamayuḥ

translations.griffith: Savitar, Savitar from cast and westward, Savitar, Savitar from north and southward,  Savitar send us perfect health and comfort, Savitar let our days of life be lengthened!

verses.sanskrit: नमो मित्रस्य वरुणस्य चक्षसे महो देवाय तद रतंसपर्यत दूरेद्र्शे देवजाताय केतवे दिवस पुत्रायसूर्याय शंसत |||
verses.transliteration: namo mitrasya varuṇasya cakṣase maho devāya tad ṛtaṃsaparyata dūredṛśe devajātāya ketave divas putrāyasūryāya śaṃsata

translations.griffith: Do homage unto Varuṇa's and Mitra's Eye: offer this solemn worship to the Mighty God,  Who seeth far away, the Ensign, born of Gods. Sing praises unto Sūrya, to the Son of Dyaus.

verses.sanskrit: सा मा सत्योक्तिः परि पातु विश्वतो दयावा च यत्रततनन्नहानि च विश्वमन्यन नि विशते यदेजतिविश्वाहापो विश्वाहोदेति सूर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sā mā satyoktiḥ pari pātu viśvato dyāvā ca yatratatanannahāni ca viśvamanyan ni viśate yadejativiśvāhāpo viśvāhodeti sūryaḥ

translations.griffith: May this my truthful speech guard me on every side wherever heaven and earth and days are spread abroad.  All else that is in motion finds a place of rest: the waters ever flow and ever mounts the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: न ते अदेवः परदिवो नि वासते यदेतशेभिः पतरैरथर्यसि पराचीनमन्यदनु वर्तते रज उदन्येनज्योतिषा यासि सूर्य |||
verses.transliteration: na te adevaḥ pradivo ni vāsate yadetaśebhiḥ patarairatharyasi prācīnamanyadanu vartate raja udanyenajyotiṣā yāsi sūrya

translations.griffith: No godless man from time remotest draws thee down when thou art driving forth with winged dappled Steeds.  One lustre waits upon thee moving to the cast, and, Sūrya, thou arisest with a different light.

verses.sanskrit: येन सूर्य जयोतिषा बाधसे तमो जगच्च विश्वमुदियर्षिभानुना तेनास्मद विश्वामनिरामनाहुतिमपामीवामप दुष्वप्न्यं सुव |||
verses.transliteration: yena sūrya jyotiṣā bādhase tamo jaghacca viśvamudiyarṣibhānunā tenāsmad viśvāmanirāmanāhutimapāmīvāmapa duṣvapnyaṃ suva

translations.griffith: O Sūrya, with the light whereby thou scatterest gloom, and with thy ray impellest every moving thing,  Keep far from us all feeble, worthless sacrifice, and drive away disease and every evil dream.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वस्य हि परेषितो रक्षसि वरतमहेळयन्नुच्चरसिस्वधा अनु यदद्य तवा सूर्योपब्रवामहै तं नो देवानु मंसीरत करतुम |||
verses.transliteration: viśvasya hi preṣito rakṣasi vratamaheḷayannuccarasisvadhā anu yadadya tvā sūryopabravāmahai taṃ no devāanu maṃsīrata kratum

translations.griffith: Sent forth thou guardest well the Universe's law, and in thy wonted way arisest free from wrath.  When Sūrya, we address our prayers to thee to-day, may the Gods favour this our purpose and desire.

verses.sanskrit: तं नो दयावाप्र्थिवी तन न आप इन्द्रः शर्ण्वन्तु मरुतोहवं वचः मा शूने भूम सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्शिभद्रं जीवन्तो जरणामशीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī tan na āpa indraḥ śṛṇvantu marutohavaṃ vacaḥ mā śūne bhūma sūryasya sandṛśibhadraṃ jīvanto jaraṇāmaśīmahi

translations.griffith: This invocation, these our words may Heaven and Earth, and Indra and the Waters and the Maruts hear.  Ne’er may we suffer want in presence of the Sun, and, living happy lives, may we attain old age.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वाहा तवा सुमनसः सुचक्षसः परजावन्तो अनमीवानागसः उद्यन्तं तवा मित्रमहो दिवे-दिवे जयोग जीवाःप्रति पश्येम सूर्य |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāhā tvā sumanasaḥ sucakṣasaḥ prajāvanto anamīvāanāghasaḥ udyantaṃ tvā mitramaho dive-dive jyogh jīvāḥprati paśyema sūrya

translations.griffith: Cheerful in spirit, evermore, and keen of sight, with store of children, free from sickness and from sin,  Long-living, may we look, O Sūrya, upon thee uprising day by day, thou great as Mitra is!

verses.sanskrit: महि जयोतिर्बिभ्रतं तवा विचक्षण भास्वन्तं चक्षुषे चक्षुषे मयः आरोहन्तं बर्हतः पाजसस परि वयंजीवाः परति पश्येम सूर्य |||
verses.transliteration: mahi jyotirbibhrataṃ tvā vicakṣaṇa bhāsvantaṃ cakṣuṣe cakṣuṣe mayaḥ ārohantaṃ bṛhataḥ pājasas pari vayaṃjīvāḥ prati paśyema sūrya

translations.griffith: Sūrya, may we live long and look upon thee still, thee, O Far-seeing One, bringing the glorious light,  The radiant God, the spring of joy to every eye, as thou art mounting up o’er the high shining flood.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य ते विश्वा भुवनानि केतुना पर चेरते नि च विशन्तेक्तुभिः अनागास्त्वेन हरिकेश सूर्याह्नाह्ना नोवस्यसा-वस्यसोदिहि |||
verses.transliteration: yasya te viśvā bhuvanāni ketunā pra cerate ni ca viśanteaktubhiḥ anāghāstvena harikeśa sūryāhnāhnā novasyasā-vasyasodihi

translations.griffith: Thou by whose lustre all the world of life comes forth, and by thy beams again returns unto its rest,  O Sūrya with the golden hair, ascend for us day after day, still bringing purer innocence.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो भव चक्षसा शं नो अह्ना शं भानुना शंहिमा शं घर्णेन यथा शमध्वञ्छमसद दुरोणेतत सूर्य दरविणं धेहि चित्रम |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no bhava cakṣasā śaṃ no ahnā śaṃ bhānunā śaṃhimā śaṃ ghṛṇena yathā śamadhvañchamasad duroṇetat sūrya draviṇaṃ dhehi citram

translations.griffith: Bless us with shine, bless us with perfect daylight, bless us with cold, with fervent heat and lustre.  Bestow on us, O Sūrya, varied riches, to bless us in our home and when we travel.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकं देवा उभयाय जन्मने शर्म यछत दविपदेचतुष्पदे अदत पिबदूर्जयमानमाशितं तदस्मेशं योररपो दधातन |||
verses.transliteration: asmākaṃ devā ubhayāya janmane śarma yachata dvipadecatuṣpade adat pibadūrjayamānamāśitaṃ tadasmeśaṃ yorarapo dadhātana

translations.griffith: Gods, to our living creatures of both kinds vouchsafe protection, both to bipeds and to quadrupeds,  That they may drink and eat invigorating food. So grant us health and strength and perfect innocence.

verses.sanskrit: यद वो देवाश्चक्र्म जिह्वया गुरु मनसो वा परयुतीदेवहेळनम अरावा यो नो अभि दुछुनायते तस्मिन तदेनोवसवो नि धेतन |||
verses.transliteration: yad vo devāścakṛma jihvayā ghuru manaso vā prayutīdevaheḷanam arāvā yo no abhi duchunāyate tasmin tadenovasavo ni dhetana

translations.griffith: If by some grievous sin we have provoked the Gods, O Deities, with the tongue or thoughtlessness of heart,  That guilt, O Vasus, lay upon the Evil One, on him who ever leads us into deep distress.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मिन न इन्द्र पर्त्सुतौ यशस्वति शिमीवति करन्दसि परावसातये यत्र गोषाता धर्षितेषु खादिषु विष्वक्पतन्ति दिद्यवो नर्षाह्ये |||
verses.transliteration: asmin na indra pṛtsutau yaśasvati śimīvati krandasi prāvasātaye yatra ghoṣātā dhṛṣiteṣu khādiṣu viṣvakpatanti didyavo nṛṣāhye

translations.griffith: O INDRA, in this battle great and glorious, in this loud din of war help us to victory,  Where in the strife for kine among bold ring-decked men arrows fly all around and heroes are subdued.

verses.sanskrit: स नः कषुमन्तं सदने वयूर्णुहि गोर्णसं रयिमिन्द्रश्रवाय्यम सयाम ते जयतः शक्र मेदिनो यथा वयमुश्मसि तद वसो कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ kṣumantaṃ sadane vyūrṇuhi ghoarṇasaṃ rayimindraśravāyyam syāma te jayataḥ śakra medino yathā vayamuśmasi tad vaso kṛdhi

translations.griffith: At home disclose to us opulence rich in food, streaming with milk, O Indra, meet to be renowned.  Śakra, may we be thine, the friendly Conqueror's: even as we desire, O Vasu, so do thou.

verses.sanskrit: यो नो दास आर्यो वा पुरुष्टुतादेव इन्द्र युधये चिकेतति अस्माभिष टे सुषहाः सन्तु शत्रवस्त्वया वयं तान्वनुयाम संगमे |||
verses.transliteration: yo no dāsa āryo vā puruṣṭutādeva indra yudhaye ciketati asmābhiṣ ṭe suṣahāḥ santu śatravastvayā vayaṃ tānvanuyāma saṃghame

translations.griffith: The godless man, much-lauded Indra, whether he be Dāsa or be Ārya, who would war with us,—  Easy to conquer he for thee, with us, these foes: with thee may we subdue them in the clash of fight.

verses.sanskrit: यो दभ्रेभिर्हव्यो यश्च भूरिभिर्यो अभीके वरिवोविन्न्र्षाह्ये तं विखादे सस्निमद्य शरुतं नरमर्वाञ्चमिन्द्रमवसे करामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yo dabhrebhirhavyo yaśca bhūribhiryo abhīke varivovinnṛṣāhye taṃ vikhāde sasnimadya śrutaṃ naramarvāñcamindramavase karāmahe

translations.griffith: Him who must be invoked by many and by few, who standeth nigh with comfort in the war of men,  Indra, famed Hero, winner in the deadly strife, let us bring hitherward to-day to favour us.

verses.sanskrit: सवव्र्जं हि तवामहमिन्द्र शुश्रवानानुदं वर्षभरध्रचोदनम पर मुञ्चस्व परि कुत्सादिहा गहि किमुत्वावान मुष्कयोर्बद्ध आसते |||
verses.transliteration: svavṛjaṃ hi tvāmahamindra śuśravānānudaṃ vṛṣabharadhracodanam pra muñcasva pari kutsādihā ghahi kimutvāvān muṣkayorbaddha āsate

translations.griffith: For, Indra, I have heard thee called Self. capturer, One, Steer! who never yields, who urges even the churl.  Release thyself from Kutsa and come hither. How shall one like thee sit still bound that he may not move?

verses.sanskrit: यो वां परिज्मा सुव्र्दश्विना रथो दोषामुषासो हव्योहविष्मता शश्वत्तमासस्तमु वामिदं वयं पितुर्ननाम सुहवं हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāṃ parijmā suvṛdaśvinā ratho doṣāmuṣāso havyohaviṣmatā śaśvattamāsastamu vāmidaṃ vayaṃ piturnanāma suhavaṃ havāmahe

translations.griffith: As ’twere the name of father, easy to invoke, we all assembled here invoke this Car of yours,  Aśvins, your swiftly-rolling circumambient Car which he who worships must invoke at eve and dawn.

verses.sanskrit: चोदयतं सून्र्ताः पिन्वतं धिय उत पुरन्धीरीरयतन्तदुश्मसि यशसं भागं कर्णुतं नो अश्विना सोमं नचारुं मघवत्सु नस कर्तम |||
verses.transliteration: codayataṃ sūnṛtāḥ pinvataṃ dhiya ut purandhīrīrayatantaduśmasi yaśasaṃ bhāghaṃ kṛṇutaṃ no aśvinā somaṃ nacāruṃ maghavatsu nas kṛtam

translations.griffith: Awake all pleasant strains and let the hymns flow forth: raise up abundant fulness: this is our desire.  Aśvins, bestow on us a glorious heritage, and give our princes treasure fair as Soma is.

verses.sanskrit: अमाजुरश्चिद भवथो युवं भगो.अनाशोश्चिदवितारापमस्य चित अन्धस्य चिन नासत्या कर्शस्य चिद युवामिदाहुर्भिषजा रुतस्य चित |||
verses.transliteration: amājuraścid bhavatho yuvaṃ bhagho.anāśościdavitārāpamasya cit andhasya cin nāsatyā kṛśasya cid yuvāmidāhurbhiṣajā rutasya cit

translations.griffith: Ye are the bliss of her who groweth old at home, and helpers of the slow although he linger last.  Men call you too, Nāsatyas, healers of the blind, the thin and feeble, and the man with broken bones.

verses.sanskrit: युवं चयवानं सनयं यथा रथं पुनर्युवानंचरथाय तक्षथुः निष टौग्र्यमूहथुरद्भ्यस परिविश्वेत ता वां सवनेषु परवाच्या |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ cyavānaṃ sanayaṃ yathā rathaṃ punaryuvānaṃcarathāya takṣathuḥ niṣ ṭaughryamūhathuradbhyas pariviśvet tā vāṃ savaneṣu pravācyā

translations.griffith: Ye made Cyavāna, weak and worn with length of days, young again, like a car, that he had power to move.  Ye lifted up the son of Tugra from the floods. At our libations must all these your acts be praised.

verses.sanskrit: पुराणा वां वीर्या पर बरवा जने.अथो हासथुर्भिषजामयोभुवा ता वां नु नव्याववसे करामहे.अयंनासत्या शरदरिर्यथा दधत |||
verses.transliteration: purāṇā vāṃ vīryā pra bravā jane.atho hāsathurbhiṣajāmayobhuvā tā vāṃ nu navyāvavase karāmahe.ayaṃnāsatyā śradariryathā dadhat

translations.griffith: We will declare among the folk your ancient deeds heroic; yea, ye were Physicians bringing health.  You, you who must be lauded, will we bring for aid, so that this foe of ours, O Aśvins, may believe.

verses.sanskrit: इयं वामह्वे शर्णुतं मे अश्विना पुत्रायेव पितरा मह्यंशिक्षतम अनापिरज्ञा असजात्यामतिः पुरा तस्याभिशस्तेरव सप्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ vāmahve śṛṇutaṃ me aśvinā putrāyeva pitarā mahyaṃśikṣatam anāpirajñā asajātyāmatiḥ purā tasyāabhiśasterava spṛtam

translations.griffith: Listen to me, O Aśvins; I have cried to you. Give me-your aid as sire and mother aid their son.  Poor, without kin or friend or ties of blood am I. Save me before it be too late, from this my curse.

verses.sanskrit: युवं रथेन विमदाय शुन्ध्युवं नयूहथुः पुरुमित्रस्ययोषणाम युवं हवं वध्रिमत्या अगछतं युवंसुषुतिं चक्रथुः पुरन्धये |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ rathena vimadāya śundhyuvaṃ nyūhathuḥ purumitrasyayoṣaṇām yuvaṃ havaṃ vadhrimatyā aghachataṃ yuvaṃsuṣutiṃ cakrathuḥ purandhaye

translations.griffith: Ye, mounted on your chariot brought to Vimada the comely maid of Purumitra as a bride.  Ye, came unto the calling of the weakling's dame, and granted noble offspring to the happy wife.

verses.sanskrit: युवं विप्रस्य जरणामुपेयुषः पुनः कलेरक्र्णुतंयुवद वयः युवं वन्दनं रश्यदादुदूपथुर्युवंसद्यो विश्पलामेतवे कर्थः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ viprasya jaraṇāmupeyuṣaḥ punaḥ kalerakṛṇutaṃyuvad vayaḥ yuvaṃ vandanaṃ ṛśyadādudūpathuryuvaṃsadyo viśpalāmetave kṛthaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye gave a ain the vigour of his youthful life to tge sage Kali when old age was coming nigh.  Ye rescued Vandana and raised him from the pit, and in a moment gave Viśpalā power to move.

verses.sanskrit: युवं ह रेभं वर्षणा गुहा हितमुदैरयतम्मम्र्वांसमश्विना युवं रबीसमुत तप्तमत्रयोमन्वन्तं चक्रथुः सप्तवध्रये |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ ha rebhaṃ vṛṣaṇā ghuhā hitamudairayatammamṛvāṃsamaśvinā yuvaṃ ṛbīsamuta taptamatrayaomanvantaṃ cakrathuḥ saptavadhraye

translations.griffith: Ye Aśvins Twain, endowed with manly strength, brought forth Reblia when hidden in the cave and well-nigh dead,  Freed Saptavadliri, and for Atri caused the pit heated with fire to be a pleasant resting-place.

verses.sanskrit: युवं शवेतं पेदवे.अश्विनाश्वं नवभिर्वाजैर्नवतीच वाजिनम चर्क्र्त्यं ददथुर्द्रावयत्सखं भगं नन्र्भ्यो हव्यं मयोभुबम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ śvetaṃ pedave.aśvināśvaṃ navabhirvājairnavatīca vājinam carkṛtyaṃ dadathurdrāvayatsakhaṃ bhaghaṃ nanṛbhyo havyaṃ mayobhubam

translations.griffith: On Pedu ye bestowed, Aśvins, a courser white, mighty with nine-and-ninety varied gifts of strength,  A horse to be renowned, who bore his friend at speed, joy-giving, Bhaga-like to be invoked of men.

verses.sanskrit: न तं राजानावदिते कुतश्चन नांहो अश्नोति दुरितंनकिर्भयम यमश्विना सुहवा रुद्रवर्तनी पुरोरथंक्र्णुथः पत्न्या सह |||
verses.transliteration: na taṃ rājānāvadite kutaścana nāṃho aśnoti duritaṃnakirbhayam yamaśvinā suhavā rudravartanī purorathaṃkṛṇuthaḥ patnyā saha

translations.griffith: From no side, ye Two Kings whom none may check or stay, doth grief, distress, or danger come u on the man  Whom, Aśvins swift to hear, borne on your glowing path, ye with your Consort make the foremost in the race.

verses.sanskrit: आ तेन यातं मनसो जवीयसा रथं यं वां रभवश्चक्रुरश्विना यस्य योगे दुहिता जायते दिव उभे अहनीसुदिने विवस्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: ā tena yātaṃ manaso javīyasā rathaṃ yaṃ vāṃ ṛbhavaścakruraśvinā yasya yoghe duhitā jāyate diva ubhe ahanīsudine vivasvataḥ

translations.griffith: Come on that Chariot which the Ṛbhus wrought for you, the Chariot, Aśvins, that is speedier than thought,  At harnessing whereof Heaven's Daughter springs to birth, and from Vivasvān come auspicious Night and Day.

verses.sanskrit: ता वर्तिर्यातं जयुषा वि पर्वतमपिन्वतं शयवेधेनुमश्विना वर्कस्य चिद वर्तिकामन्तरास्याद युवंशचीभिर्ग्रसिताममुञ्चतम |||
verses.transliteration: tā vartiryātaṃ jayuṣā vi parvatamapinvataṃ śayavedhenumaśvinā vṛkasya cid vartikāmantarāsyād yuvaṃśacībhirghrasitāmamuñcatam

translations.griffith: Come, Conquerors of the sundered mountain, to our home, Aśvins who made the cow stream milk for Śayu's sake,  Ye who delivered even from the wolf's deep throat and set again at liberty the swallowed quail.

verses.sanskrit: एतं वां सतोममश्विनावकर्मातक्षाम भर्गवो न रथम नयम्र्क्षाम योषणां न मर्ये नित्यं न सूनुन्तनयं दधानाः |||
verses.transliteration: etaṃ vāṃ stomamaśvināvakarmātakṣāma bhṛghavo na ratham nyamṛkṣāma yoṣaṇāṃ na marye nityaṃ na sūnuntanayaṃ dadhānāḥ

translations.griffith: We have prepared this laud for you, O Aśvins, and, like the Bhṛgus, as a car have framed it,  Have decked it as a maid to meet the bridegroom, and brought it as a son, our stay for ever.

verses.sanskrit: रथं यान्तं कुह को ह वां नरा परति दयुमन्तंसुविताय भूषति परातर्यावाणं विभ्वं विशे-विशेवस्तोर वस्तोर्वहमानं धिया शमि |||
verses.transliteration: rathaṃ yāntaṃ kuha ko ha vāṃ narā prati dyumantaṃsuvitāya bhūṣati prātaryāvāṇaṃ vibhvaṃ viśe-viśevastor vastorvahamānaṃ dhiyā śami

translations.griffith: YOUR radiant Chariot-whither goes it on its way?-who decks it for you, Heroes, for its happy course,  Starting at daybreak, visiting each morning every house, borne hitherward through prayer unto the sacrifice?

verses.sanskrit: कुह सविद दोषा कुह वस्तोरश्विना कुहाभिपित्वं करतःकुहोषतुः को वां शयुत्रा विधवेव देवरं मर्यं नयोषा कर्णुते सधस्थ आ |||
verses.transliteration: kuha svid doṣā kuha vastoraśvinā kuhābhipitvaṃ karataḥkuhoṣatuḥ ko vāṃ śayutrā vidhaveva devaraṃ maryaṃ nayoṣā kṛṇute sadhastha ā

translations.griffith: Where are ye, Aśvins, in the evening, where at morn? Where is your haltingplace, where rest ye for the night?  Who brings you homeward, as the widow bedward draws her husband's brother, as the bride attracts the groom?

verses.sanskrit: परातर्जरेथे जरणेव कापया वस्तोर-वस्तोर्यजता गछथोग्र्हम कस्य धवस्रा भवथः कस्य वा नरा राजपुत्रेवसवनाव गछथः |||
verses.transliteration: prātarjarethe jaraṇeva kāpayā vastor-vastoryajatā ghachathoghṛham kasya dhvasrā bhavathaḥ kasya vā narā rājaputrevasavanāva ghachathaḥ

translations.griffith: Early ye sing forth praise as with a herald's voice, and, meet for worship, go each morning to the house.  Whom do ye ever bring to ruin? Unto whose libations come ye, Heroes, like two Sons of Kings?

verses.sanskrit: युवां मर्गेव वारणा मर्गण्यवो दोषा वस्तोर्हविषा निह्वयामहे युवं होत्रां रतुथा जुह्वते नरेषं जनायवहथः शुभस पती |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāṃ mṛgheva vāraṇā mṛghaṇyavo doṣā vastorhaviṣā nihvayāmahe yuvaṃ hotrāṃ ṛtuthā juhvate nareṣaṃ janāyavahathaḥ śubhas patī

translations.griffith: Even as hunters follow two wild elephants, we with oblations call you down at morn and eve.  To folk who pay you offierings at appointed times, Chiefs, Lords of splendour, ye bring food to strengthen them.

verses.sanskrit: युवां ह घोषा पर्यश्विना यती राज्ञ ऊचे दुहिताप्र्छे वां नरा भूतं मे अह्न उत भूतमक्तवेऽशवावते रथिने शक्तमर्वते |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāṃ ha ghoṣā paryaśvinā yatī rājña ūce duhitāpṛche vāṃ narā bhūtaṃ me ahna uta bhūtamaktave'śvāvate rathine śaktamarvate

translations.griffith: To you, O Aśvins, came the daughter of a King, Ghoṣā, and said, O Heroes, this I beg of you:  Be near me in the day, he near me in the night: help me to gain a car-borne chieftain rich in steeds.

verses.sanskrit: युवं कवी षठः पर्यश्विना रथं विशो न कुत्सोजरितुर्नशायथः युवोर्ह मक्षा पर्यश्विना मध्वासा भरत निष्क्र्तं न योषणा |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ kavī ṣṭhaḥ paryaśvinā rathaṃ viśo na kutsojariturnaśāyathaḥ yuvorha makṣā paryaśvinā madhvāsā bharata niṣkṛtaṃ na yoṣaṇā

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, ye are wise: as Kutsa comes to men, bring your car nigh the folk of him who sings your praise.  The bee, O Aśvins, bears your honey in her mouth, as the maid carries it purified in her hand.

verses.sanskrit: युवं ह भुज्युं युवमश्विना वशं युवं शिञ्जारमुशनामुपारथुः युवो ररावा परि सख्यमासते युवोरहमवसा सुम्नमा चके |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ ha bhujyuṃ yuvamaśvinā vaśaṃ yuvaṃ śiñjāramuśanāmupārathuḥ yuvo rarāvā pari sakhyamāsate yuvorahamavasā sumnamā cake

translations.griffith: To Bhujyu and to Vaśa ye come near with help, O Aśvins, to Sinjara and to Uśanā.  Your worshipper secures your friendship for himself. Through your protection I desire felicity.

verses.sanskrit: युवं ह कर्शं युवमश्विना शयुं युवं विधन्तंविधवामुरुष्यथः युवं सनिभ्य सतनयन्तमश्विनापव्रजमूर्णुथः सप्तास्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ ha kṛśaṃ yuvamaśvinā śayuṃ yuvaṃ vidhantaṃvidhavāmuruṣyathaḥ yuvaṃ sanibhya stanayantamaśvināpavrajamūrṇuthaḥ saptāsyam

translations.griffith: Krsa and Śayu ye protect, ye Aśvins Twain: ye Two assist the widow and the worshipper;  And ye throw open, Aśvins, unto those who win the cattle-stall that thunders with its serenfold mouth.

verses.sanskrit: जनिष्ट योषा पतयत कनीनको वि चारुहन वीरुधोदंसना अनु आस्मै रीयन्ते निवनेव सिन्धवो.अस्मा अह्नेभवति तत पतित्वनम |||
verses.transliteration: janiṣṭa yoṣā patayat kanīnako vi cāruhan vīrudhodaṃsanā anu āsmai rīyante nivaneva sindhavo.asmā ahnebhavati tat patitvanam

translations.griffith: The Woman hath brought forth, the Infant hath appeared, the plants of wondrous beauty straightway have sprung up.  To him the rivers run as down a deep descent, and he this day becomes their master and their lord.

verses.sanskrit: जीवं रुदन्ति वि मयन्ते अध्वरे दीर्घामनु परसितिन्दीधियुर्नरः वामं पित्र्भ्यो य इदं समेरिरे मयःपतिभ्यो जनयः परिष्वजे |||
verses.transliteration: jīvaṃ rudanti vi mayante adhvare dīrghāmanu prasitindīdhiyurnaraḥ vāmaṃ pitṛbhyo ya idaṃ samerire mayaḥpatibhyo janayaḥ pariṣvaje

translations.griffith: They mourn the living, cry aloud, at sacrifice: the men have set their thoughts upon a distant cast.  A lovely thing for fathers who have gathered here,—a joy to husbands,—are the wives their arms shall clasp

verses.sanskrit: न तस्य विद्म तदु षु पर वोचत युवा ह यद युवत्याःक्षेति योनिषु परियोस्रियस्य वर्षभस्य रेतिनो गर्हंगमेमाश्विना तदुश्मसि |||
verses.transliteration: na tasya vidma tadu ṣu pra vocata yuvā ha yad yuvatyāḥkṣeti yoniṣu priyosriyasya vṛṣabhasya retino ghṛhaṃghamemāśvinā taduśmasi

translations.griffith: Of this we have no knowledge. Tall it forth to us, now the youth rests within the chambers of the bride.  Fain would we reach the dwelling of the vigorous Steer who loves the kine, O Aśvins: this is our desire.

verses.sanskrit: आ वामगन सुमतिर्वाजिनीवसू नयश्विना हर्त्सु कामायंसत अभूतं गोपा मिथुना शुभस पती परियार्यम्णो दुर्यानशीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāmaghan sumatirvājinīvasū nyaśvinā hṛtsu kāmāayaṃsata abhūtaṃ ghopā mithunā śubhas patī priyāaryamṇo duryānaśīmahi

translations.griffith: Your favouring grace hath come, ye Lords of ample wealth: Aśvins, our longings are stored up within your hearts.  Ye, Lords of splendour, have become our twofold guard: may we as welcome friends reach Aryaman's abode.

verses.sanskrit: ता मन्दसाना मनुषो दुरोण आ धत्तं रयिं सहवीरंवचस्यवे कर्तं तीर्थं सुप्रपाणं शुभस पतीस्थाणुं पथेष्ठामप दुर्मतिं हतम |||
verses.transliteration: tā mandasānā manuṣo duroṇa ā dhattaṃ rayiṃ sahavīraṃvacasyave kṛtaṃ tīrthaṃ suprapāṇaṃ śubhas patīsthāṇuṃ patheṣṭhāmapa durmatiṃ hatam

translations.griffith: Even so, rejoicing in the dwelling-place of man, give hero sons and riches to the eloquent.  Make a ford, Lords of splendour, where men well may drink: remove the spiteful tree-stump standing in the path.

verses.sanskrit: कव सविदद्य कतमास्वश्विना विक्षु दस्रा मादयेतेशुभस पती क ईं नि येमे कतमस्य जग्मतुर्विप्रस्य वायजमानस्य वा गर्हम |||
verses.transliteration: kva svidadya katamāsvaśvinā vikṣu dasrā mādayeteśubhas patī ka īṃ ni yeme katamasya jaghmaturviprasya vāyajamānasya vā ghṛham

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, Wonder-Workers, Lords of lustre, where and with what folk do ye delight yourselves to-day?  Who hath detained them with him? Whither are they gone? Unto what sage's or what worshipper's abode?

verses.sanskrit: समानमु तयं पुरुहूतमुक्थ्यं रथं तरिचक्रं सवनागनिग्मतम परिज्मानं विदथ्यं सुव्र्क्तिभिर्वयंव्युष्टा उषसो हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: samānamu tyaṃ puruhūtamukthyaṃ rathaṃ tricakraṃ savanāghanighmatam parijmānaṃ vidathyaṃ suvṛktibhirvayaṃvyuṣṭā uṣaso havāmahe

translations.griffith: THAT general Car of yours, invoked by many a man, that comes to our libations, three-wheeled, meet for lauds,  That circumambient Car, worthy of sacrifice, we call with our pure hymns at earliest flush of dawn.

verses.sanskrit: परातर्युजं नासत्याधि तिष्ठथः परातर्यावाणम्मधुवाहनं रथम विशो येन गछथो यज्वरीर्नराकीरेश्चिद यज्ञं होत्र्मन्तमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: prātaryujaṃ nāsatyādhi tiṣṭhathaḥ prātaryāvāṇammadhuvāhanaṃ ratham viśo yena ghachatho yajvarīrnarākīreścid yajñaṃ hotṛmantamaśvinā

translations.griffith: Ye, O Nāsatyas, mount that early-harnessed Car, that travels early, laden with its freight of balm,  Wherewith ye, Heroes, visit clans who sacrifice, even the poor man's worship where the priest attends.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्युं वा मधुपाणिं सुहस्त्यमग्निधं वाध्र्तदक्षं दमूनसम विप्रस्य वा यत सवननि गछथोऽत आ यातं मधुपेयमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryuṃ vā madhupāṇiṃ suhastyamaghnidhaṃ vādhṛtadakṣaṃ damūnasam viprasya vā yat savanani ghachatho'ta ā yātaṃ madhupeyamaśvinā

translations.griffith: If to the deft Adhvaryu with the meath in hand, or to the Kindler firm in strength, the household friend,  Or to the sage's poured libations ye approach, come thence, O Aśvins, now to drink the offered meath.

verses.sanskrit: अस्तेव सु परतरं लायमस्यन भूषन्निव पर भरास्तोममस्मै वाचा विप्रास्तरत वाचमर्यो नि रामयजरितः सोम इन्द्रम |||
verses.transliteration: asteva su prataraṃ lāyamasyan bhūṣanniva pra bharāstomamasmai vācā viprāstarata vācamaryo ni rāmayajaritaḥ soma indram

translations.griffith: EVEN as an archer shoots afar his arrow, offer the laud to him with meet adornment.  Quell with your voice the wicked's voice, O sages. Singer, make Indra rest beside the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: दोहेन गामुप शिक्षा सखायं पर बोधय जरितर्जारमिन्द्रम कोशं न पूर्णं वसुना नय्र्ष्टमा चयावयमघदेयाय शूरम |||
verses.transliteration: dohena ghāmupa śikṣā sakhāyaṃ pra bodhaya jaritarjāramindram kośaṃ na pūrṇaṃ vasunā nyṛṣṭamā cyāvayamaghadeyāya śūram

translations.griffith: Draw thy Friend to thee like a cow at milking: O Singer, wake up Indra as a lover.  Make thou the Hero haste to give us riches even as a vessel filled brimful with treasure.

verses.sanskrit: किमङग तवा मघवन भोजमाहुः शिशीहि मा शिशयन्त्वा शर्णोमि अप्नस्वती मम धीरस्तु शक्र वसुविदम्भगमिन्द्रा भरा नः |||
verses.transliteration: kimaṅgha tvā maghavan bhojamāhuḥ śiśīhi mā śiśayantvā śṛṇomi apnasvatī mama dhīrastu śakra vasuvidambhaghamindrā bharā naḥ

translations.griffith: Why, Maghavan, do they call thee Bounteous; Giver? Quicken me: thou, I hear, art he who quickens.  Śakra, let my intelligence be active, and bring us luck that finds great wealth, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: तवां जना ममसत्येष्विन्द्र सन्तस्थाना वि हवयन्तेसमीके अत्रा युजं कर्णुते यो हविष्मान नासुन्वतासख्यं वष्टि शूरः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ janā mamasatyeṣvindra santasthānā vi hvayantesamīke atrā yujaṃ kṛṇute yo haviṣmān nāsunvatāsakhyaṃ vaṣṭi śūraḥ

translations.griffith: Standing, in battle for their rights, together, the people, Indra, in the fray invoke thee.  Him who brings gifts the Hero makes his comrade: with him who pours no juice he seeks not friendship.

verses.sanskrit: धनं न सयन्द्रं बहुलं यो अस्मै तीव्रान सोमानासुनोतिप्रयस्वान तस्मै शत्रून सुतुकान परातरह्नो निस्वष्ट्रान युवति हन्ति वर्त्रम |||
verses.transliteration: dhanaṃ na syandraṃ bahulaṃ yo asmai tīvrān somānāsunotiprayasvān tasmai śatrūn sutukān prātarahno nisvaṣṭrān yuvati hanti vṛtram

translations.griffith: Whoso with plenteous food for him expresses strong Somas as much quickly-coming treasure,  For him he overthrows in early morning his swift well-weaponed foes, and slays the tyrant.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मिन वयं दधिमा शंसमिन्द्रे यः शिश्राय मघवाकाममस्मे आराच्चित सन भयतामस्य शत्रुर्न्यस्मैद्युम्ना जन्या नमन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: yasmin vayaṃ dadhimā śaṃsamindre yaḥ śiśrāya maghavākāmamasme ārāccit san bhayatāmasya śatrurnyasmaidyumnā janyā namantām

translations.griffith: He unto whom we offer praises, Indra, Maghavan, who hath joined to ours his wishes,—  Before him even afar the foe must tremble: low before him must bow all human glories.

verses.sanskrit: आराच्छत्रुमप बाधस्व दूरमुग्रो यः शम्बःपुरुहूत तेन अस्मे धेहि यवमद गोमदिन्द्र कर्धी धियंजरित्रे वाजरत्नाम |||
verses.transliteration: ārācchatrumapa bādhasva dūramughro yaḥ śambaḥpuruhūta tena asme dhehi yavamad ghomadindra kṛdhī dhiyaṃjaritre vājaratnām

translations.griffith: With thy fierce bolt, O God invoked of many, drive to a distance from afar the foeman.  O Indra, give us wealth in corn and cattle, and make thy singer's prayer gain strength and riches.

verses.sanskrit: पर यमन्तर्व्र्षसवासो अग्मन तीव्राः सोमा बहुलान्तासैन्द्रम नाह दामानं मघवा नि यंसन नि सुन्वते वहतिभूरि वामम |||
verses.transliteration: pra yamantarvṛṣasavāso aghman tīvrāḥ somā bahulāntāsaindram nāha dāmānaṃ maghavā ni yaṃsan ni sunvate vahatibhūri vāmam

translations.griffith: Indra, the swallower of strong libations rich in the boons they bring, the potent Somas,  He, Maghavan, will not restrict his bounty he brings much wealth unto the Soma-presser.

verses.sanskrit: उत परहामतिदीव्या जयाति कर्तं यच्छ्वघ्नी विचिनोतिकाले यो देवकामो न धना रुणद्धि समित तं रायास्र्जति सवधावान |||
verses.transliteration: uta prahāmatidīvyā jayāti kṛtaṃ yacchvaghnī vicinotikāle yo devakāmo na dhanā ruṇaddhi samit taṃ rāyāsṛjati svadhāvān

translations.griffith: Yea, by superior play he wins advantage, when he, a gambler, piles his gains in season.  Celestial-natured, he o’erwhelms with riches the devotee who keeps not back his treasure.

verses.sanskrit: गोभिष टरेमामतिं दुरेवां यवेन कषुधं पुरुहूतविश्वाम वयं राजभिः परथमा धनान्यस्माकेनव्र्जनेना जयेम |||
verses.transliteration: ghobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ durevāṃ yavena kṣudhaṃ puruhūtaviśvām vayaṃ rājabhiḥ prathamā dhanānyasmākenavṛjanenā jayema

translations.griffith: O Much-invoked, may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle.  May we allied, as first in rank, with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पतिर्नः परि पातु पश्चादुतोत्तरस्मादधरादघायोः इद्रः पुरस्तादुत मध्यतो नः सखा सखिभ्योवरिवः कर्णोतु |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspatirnaḥ pari pātu paścādutottarasmādadharādaghāyoḥ idraḥ purastāduta madhyato naḥ sakhā sakhibhyovarivaḥ kṛṇotu

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners!  May Indra from the front, and from the centre, as Friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit: अछा म इन्द्रं मतयः सवर्विदः सध्रीचीर्विश्वाुशतीरनूषत परि षवजन्ते जनयो यथा पतिं मर्यंन शुन्ध्युं मघवानमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: achā ma indraṃ matayaḥ svarvidaḥ sadhrīcīrviśvāuśatīranūṣata pari ṣvajante janayo yathā patiṃ maryaṃna śundhyuṃ maghavānamūtaye

translations.griffith: IN perfect unison all yearning hymns of mine that find the light of heaven have sung forth Indra's praise.  As wives embrace their lord, the comely bridegroom, so they compass Maghavan about that he may help.

verses.sanskrit: न घा तवद्रिगप वेति मे मनस्त्वे इत कामं पुरुहूतशिश्रय राजेव दस्म नि षदो.अधि बर्हिष्यस्मिन सु सोमेऽवपानमस्तु ते |||
verses.transliteration: na ghā tvadrighapa veti me manastve it kāmaṃ puruhūtaśiśraya rājeva dasma ni ṣado.adhi barhiṣyasmin su some'vapānamastu te

translations.griffith: Directed unto thee my spirit never strays, for I have set my hopes on thee, O Much-invoked!  Sit, Wonderful! as King upon the sacred grass, and let thy drinking-place be by the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: विषूव्र्दिन्द्रो अमतेरुत कषुधः स इद रायो मघवावस्व ईशते तस्येदिमे परवणे सप्त सिन्धवो वयोवर्धन्ति वर्षभस्य शुष्मिणः |||
verses.transliteration: viṣūvṛdindro amateruta kṣudhaḥ sa id rāyo maghavāvasva īśate tasyedime pravaṇe sapta sindhavo vayovardhanti vṛṣabhasya śuṣmiṇaḥ

translations.griffith: From indigence and hunger Indra turns away: Maghavan hath dominion over precious wealth.  These the Seven Rivers flowing on their downward path increase the vital vigour of the potent Steer.

verses.sanskrit: वयो न वर्क्षं सुपलाशमासदन सोमास इन्द्रं मन्दिनश्चमूषदः परैषामनीकं शवसा दविद्युतद विदत्स्वर्मनवे जयोतिरार्यम |||
verses.transliteration: vayo na vṛkṣaṃ supalāśamāsadan somāsa indraṃ mandinaścamūṣadaḥ praiṣāmanīkaṃ śavasā davidyutad vidatsvarmanave jyotirāryam

translations.griffith: As on the fair-leafed tree rest birds, to Indra flow the gladdening Soma juices that the bowls contain.  Their face that glows with splendour through their mighty power hath found the shine of heaven for man, the Āryas' light.

verses.sanskrit: कर्तं न शवघ्नी वि चिनोति देवने संवर्गं यन मघवासूर्यं जयत न तत ते अन्यो अनु वीर्यं शकन नपुराणो मघवन नोत नूतनः |||
verses.transliteration: kṛtaṃ na śvaghnī vi cinoti devane saṃvarghaṃ yan maghavāsūryaṃ jayat na tat te anyo anu vīryaṃ śakan napurāṇo maghavan nota nūtanaḥ

translations.griffith: As in the game a gambler piles his winnings, so Maghavan, sweeping all together, gained the Sun  This mighty deed of thine none other could achieve, none, Maghavan, before thee, none in recent time.

verses.sanskrit: विशं-विशं मघवा पर्यशायत जनानां धेनावचाकशद वर्षा यस्याह शक्रः सवनेषु रण्यति सतीव्रैः सोमैः सहते पर्तन्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: viśaṃ-viśaṃ maghavā paryaśāyata janānāṃ dhenāavacākaśad vṛṣā yasyāha śakraḥ savaneṣu raṇyati satīvraiḥ somaiḥ sahate pṛtanyataḥ

translations.griffith: Maghavan came by turns to all the tribes of men: the Steer took notice of the people's songs of praise.  The man in whose libations Śakra hath delight by means of potent Somas vanquisheth his foes.

verses.sanskrit: आपो न सिन्धुमभि यत समक्षरन सोमास इन्द्रं कुल्यािव हरदम वर्धन्ति विप्रा महो अस्य सादने यवं नव्र्ष्टिर्दिव्येन दानुना |||
verses.transliteration: āpo na sindhumabhi yat samakṣaran somāsa indraṃ kulyāiva hradam vardhanti viprā maho asya sādane yavaṃ navṛṣṭirdivyena dānunā

translations.griffith: When Soma streams together unto Indra flow like waters to the river, rivulets to the lake,  In place of sacrifice sages exalt his might, as the rain swells the corn by moisture sent from heaven.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा न करुद्धः पतयद रजस्स्वा यो अर्यपत्नीरक्र्णोदिमा अपः स सुन्वते मघवा जीरदानवे.अविन्दज्ज्योतिर्मनवे हविष्मते |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā na kruddhaḥ patayad rajassvā yo aryapatnīrakṛṇodimā apaḥ sa sunvate maghavā jīradānave.avindajjyotirmanave haviṣmate

translations.griffith: He rushes through the region like a furious Bull, he who hath made these floods the dames of worthy lords.  This Maghavan hath found light for the man who brings oblation, sheds the juice, and promptly pours his gifts.

verses.sanskrit: उज्जायतां परशुर्ज्योतिषा सह भूया रतस्य सुदुघापुराणवत वि रोचतामरुषो भानुना शुचिः सवर्णशुक्रं शुशुचीत सत्पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: ujjāyatāṃ paraśurjyotiṣā saha bhūyā ṛtasya sudughāpurāṇavat vi rocatāmaruṣo bhānunā śuciḥ svarṇaśukraṃ śuśucīta satpatiḥ

translations.griffith: Let the keen axe come forth together with the light: here be,.as erst, the teeming cow of sacrifice.  Let the Red God shine bright with his refulgent ray, and let the Lord of heroes glow like heaven's clear sheen.

verses.sanskrit: गोभिष टरेमामतिं ... ||
verses.transliteration: ghobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ ...

translations.griffith: O Much-invoked, may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle.  May we allied, as first in rank, with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पतिर्नः परि ... ||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspatirnaḥ pari ...

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners.  May Indra from the front, and from the centre, as Friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit: आ यात्विन्द्रः सवपतिर्मदाय यो धर्मणा तूतुजानस्तुविष्मान परत्वक्षाणो अति विश्वा सहांस्यपारेणमहता वर्ष्ण्येन |||
verses.transliteration: ā yātvindraḥ svapatirmadāya yo dharmaṇā tūtujānastuviṣmān pratvakṣāṇo ati viśvā sahāṃsyapāreṇamahatā vṛṣṇyena

translations.griffith: MAY Sovran Indra come to the carousal, he who by Holy Law is strong and active,  The overcomer of all conquering forces with his great steer-like power that hath no limit.

verses.sanskrit: सुष्ठामा रथः सुयमा हरी ते मिम्यक्ष वज्रो नर्पतेगभस्तौ शीभं राजन सुपथा याह्यर्वां वर्धामते पपुषो वर्ष्ण्यानि |||
verses.transliteration: suṣṭhāmā rathaḥ suyamā harī te mimyakṣa vajro nṛpateghabhastau śībhaṃ rājan supathā yāhyarvāṃ vardhāmate papuṣo vṛṣṇyāni

translations.griffith: Firm-seated is thy car, thy Steeds are docile; thy hand, O King, holds, firmly grasped, the thunder.  On thy fair path, O Lord of men, come quickly: we will increase thy powers when thou hast drunken.

verses.sanskrit: एन्द्रवाहो नर्पतिं वज्रबाहुमुग्रमुग्रासस्तविषास एनम परत्वक्षसं वर्षभं सत्यशुष्ममेमस्मत्रा सधमादोवहन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: endravāho nṛpatiṃ vajrabāhumughramughrāsastaviṣāsa enam pratvakṣasaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ satyaśuṣmamemasmatrā sadhamādovahantu

translations.griffith: Let strong and mighty Steeds who bear this Mighty Indra, the Lord of men, whose arm wields thunder,  Bring unto us, as sharers of our banquet, the Steer of conquering might, of real vigour.

verses.sanskrit: एवा पतिं दरोणसाचं सचेतसमूर्ज सकम्भं धरुणा वर्षायसे ओजः कर्ष्व सं गर्भाय तवे अप्यसो यथाकेनिपानामिनो वर्धे |||
verses.transliteration: evā patiṃ droṇasācaṃ sacetasamūrja skambhaṃ dharuṇaā vṛṣāyase ojaḥ kṛṣva saṃ ghṛbhāya tve apyaso yathākenipānāmino vṛdhe

translations.griffith: So like a Bull thou rushest to the Lord who loves the trough, the Sage, the prop of vigour, in the vat,  Prepare thine energies, collect them in thyself: be for our profit as the Master of the wise.

verses.sanskrit: गमन्नस्मे वसून्या हि शंसिषं सवाशिषं भरमायाहि सोमिनः तवमीशिषे सास्मिन्ना सत्सि बर्हिष्यनाध्र्ष्या तव पात्राणि धर्मणा |||
verses.transliteration: ghamannasme vasūnyā hi śaṃsiṣaṃ svāśiṣaṃ bharamāyāhi sominaḥ tvamīśiṣe sāsminnā satsi barhiṣyanādhṛṣyā tava pātrāṇi dharmaṇā

translations.griffith: May precious treasures come to us-so will I pray. Come to the votary's gift offered with beauteous laud.  Thou art the Lord, as such sit on this holy grass: thy vessels are inviolate as Law commands.

verses.sanskrit: पर्थक परायन परथमा देवहूतयो.अक्र्ण्वत शरवस्यानिदुष्टरा न ये शेकुर्यज्ञियां नावमारुहमीर्मैवते नयविशन्त केपयः |||
verses.transliteration: pṛthak prāyan prathamā devahūtayo.akṛṇvata śravasyāniduṣṭarā na ye śekuryajñiyāṃ nāvamāruhamīrmaivate nyaviśanta kepayaḥ

translations.griffith: Far went our earlist invocation of the Gods, and won us glories that can never be surpassed.  They who could not ascend the ship of sacrifice, sink down in desolation, trembling with alarm.

verses.sanskrit: एवैवापागपरे सन्तु दूढ्यो.अश्वा येषां दुर्युजायुयुज्रे इत्था ये परागुपरे सन्ति दावने पुरूणियत्र वयुनानि भोजना |||
verses.transliteration: evaivāpāghapare santu dūḍhyo.aśvā yeṣāṃ duryujaāyuyujre itthā ye prāghupare santi dāvane purūṇiyatra vayunāni bhojanā

translations.griffith: So be the others, evil-hearted, far away, whose horses, difficult to harness, have been yoked.  Here in advance men stand anear to offer gifts, by whom full many a work that brings reward is done.

verses.sanskrit: गिरीन्रज्रान रेजमानानधारयद दयौः करन्ददन्तरिक्षाणि कोपयत समीचीने धिषणे वि षकभायतिव्र्ष्णः पीत्वा मद उक्थानि शंसति |||
verses.transliteration: ghirīnrajrān rejamānānadhārayad dyauḥ krandadantarikṣāṇi kopayat samīcīne dhiṣaṇe vi ṣkabhāyativṛṣṇaḥ pītvā mada ukthāni śaṃsati

translations.griffith: He firmly fixed the plains and mountains as they shook. Dyaus thundered forth and made the air's mid-region quake.  He stays apart the two confronting bowls; he sings lauds in the potent Soma's joy when he hath drunk.

verses.sanskrit: इमं बिभर्मि सुक्र्तं ते अङकुशं येनारुजासि मघवञ्छफारुजः अस्मिन सु ते सवने अस्त्वोक्यं सुत इष्टौमघवन बोध्याभगः |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ bibharmi sukṛtaṃ te aṅkuśaṃ yenārujāsi maghavañchaphārujaḥ asmin su te savane astvokyaṃ suta iṣṭaumaghavan bodhyābhaghaḥ

translations.griffith: I bear this deftly-fashioned goad of thine, wherewith thou, Maghavan, shalt break the strikers with the hoof.  At this libation mayst thou be well satisfied. Partake the juice, partake the worship, Maghavan.

verses.sanskrit: गोभिष टरेमामतिं ... ||
verses.transliteration: ghobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ ...

translations.griffith: O Much-invoked, may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle.  May we allied, as first in rank, with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पतिर्नः परि ... ||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspatirnaḥ pari ...

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners.  May Indra from the front and from the centre, as Friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit: दिवस परि परथमं जज्ञे अग्निरस्मद दवितीयं परिजातवेदाः तर्तीयमप्सु नर्मणा अजस्रमिन्धान एनंजरते सवाधीः |||
verses.transliteration: divas pari prathamaṃ jajñe aghnirasmad dvitīyaṃ parijātavedāḥ tṛtīyamapsu nṛmaṇā ajasramindhāna enaṃjarate svādhīḥ

translations.griffith: FIRST Agni sprang to life from out of Heaven: the second time from us came Jātavedas.  Thirdly the Manly-souled was in the waters. The pious lauds and kindles him the Eternal.

verses.sanskrit: विद्मा ते अग्ने तरेधा तरयाणि विद्मा ते धाम विभ्र्तापुरुत्रा विद्मा ते नाम परमं गुहा यद विद्मा तमुत्सं यत आजगन्थ |||
verses.transliteration: vidmā te aghne tredhā trayāṇi vidmā te dhāma vibhṛtāpurutrā vidmā te nāma paramaṃ ghuhā yad vidmā tamutsaṃ yata ājaghantha

translations.griffith: Agni, we know thy three powers in three stations, we know thy forms in many a place divided.  We know what name supreme thou hast in secret: we know the source from which thou hast proceeded.

verses.sanskrit: समुद्रे तवा नर्मणा अप्स्वन्तर्न्र्चक्षा ईधे दिवो अग्नूधन तर्तीये तवा रजसि तस्थिवांसमपामुपस्थेमहिषा अवर्धन |||
verses.transliteration: samudre tvā nṛmaṇā apsvantarnṛcakṣā īdhe divo aghnaūdhan tṛtīye tvā rajasi tasthivāṃsamapāmupasthemahiṣā avardhan

translations.griffith: The Manly-souled lit thee in sea and waters, man's Viewer lit thee in the breast of heaven,  There as thou stoodest in the third high region the Steers increased thee in the water's bosom.

verses.sanskrit: अक्रन्ददग्नि सतनयन्निव दयौः कषामा रेरिहद वीरुधःसमञ्जन सद्यो जज्ञानो वि हीमिद्धो अख्यदा रोदसीभानुना भात्यन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: akrandadaghni stanayanniva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihad vīrudhaḥsamañjan sadyo jajñāno vi hīmiddho akhyadā rodasībhānunā bhātyantaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni roared out, like Dyaus what time he thunders: he licked the ground about the plants he flickered.  At once, when born, he looked around enkindled, and lightened heaven and earth within with splendour.

verses.sanskrit: शरीणामुदारो धरुणो रयीणां मनीषाणाम्प्रार्पणः सोमगोपाः वसुः सूनुः सहसो अप्सु राजावि भात्यग्र उषसामिधानः |||
verses.transliteration: śrīṇāmudāro dharuṇo rayīṇāṃ manīṣāṇāmprārpaṇaḥ somaghopāḥ vasuḥ sūnuḥ sahaso apsu rājāvi bhātyaghra uṣasāmidhānaḥ

translations.griffith: The spring of glories and support of riches, rouser of thoughts and guardian of the Soma,  Good Son of Strength, a King amid the waters, in forefront of the Dawns he shines enkindled.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वस्य केतुर्भुवनस्य गर्भ आ रोदसी अप्र्णाज्जायमानः वीळुं चिदद्रिमभिनत परायञ जना यदग्निमयजन्त पञ्च |||
verses.transliteration: viśvasya keturbhuvanasya gharbha ā rodasī apṛṇājjāyamānaḥ vīḷuṃ cidadrimabhinat parāyañ janā yadaghnimayajanta pañca

translations.griffith: Germ of the world, ensign of all creation, be sprang to life and filled the earth and heavens.  Even the firm rock he cleft when passing over, when the Five Tribes brought sacrifice to Agni.

verses.sanskrit: उशिक पावको अरतिः सुमेधा मर्तेष्वग्निरम्र्तो नि धायि इयर्ति धूममरुषं भरिभ्रदुच्छुक्रेण शोचिषाद्या इनक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: uśik pāvako aratiḥ sumedhā marteṣvaghniramṛto ni dhāyi iyarti dhūmamaruṣaṃ bharibhraducchukreṇa śociṣādyā inakṣan

translations.griffith: So among mortals was Immortal Agni stablished as holy wise and willing envoy.  He waves the red smoke that he lifts above him, striving to reach the heavens with radiant lustre.

verses.sanskrit: दर्शानो रुक्म उर्विया वयद्यौद दुर्मर्षमायुः शरियेरुचानः अग्निरम्र्तो अभवद वयोभिर्यदेनं दयौर्जनयत सुरेताः |||
verses.transliteration: dṛśāno rukma urviyā vyadyaud durmarṣamāyuḥ śriyerucānaḥ aghniramṛto abhavad vayobhiryadenaṃ dyaurjanayat suretāḥ

translations.griffith: Like gold to look on, far he shone refulgent, beaming imperishable life for glory,  Agni by vital powers became immortal when his prolific Father Dyaus begat him.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते अद्य कर्णवद भद्रशोचे.अपूपं देव घर्तवन्तमग्ने पर तं नय परतरं वस्यो अछाभि सुम्नं देवभक्तंयविष्ठ |||
verses.transliteration: yaste adya kṛṇavad bhadraśoce.apūpaṃ deva ghṛtavantamaghne pra taṃ naya prataraṃ vasyo achābhi sumnaṃ devabhaktaṃyaviṣṭha

translations.griffith: Whoso this day, O God whose flames are lovely, prepares a cake, O Agni, mixt with butter,  Lead thou and further him to higher fortune, to bliss bestowed by Gods, O thou Most Youthful.

verses.sanskrit: आ तं भज सौश्रवसेष्वग्न उक्थौक्थ आ भज शस्यमाने परियः सूर्ये परियो अग्ना भवात्युज्जातेन भिनददुज्जनित्वैः |||
verses.transliteration: ā taṃ bhaja sauśravaseṣvaghna ukthauktha ā bhaja śasyamāne priyaḥ sūrye priyo aghnā bhavātyujjātena bhinadadujjanitvaiḥ

translations.griffith: Endow him, Agni, with a share of glory, at every song of praise sung forth enrich him.  Dear let him be to Sūrya, dear to Agni, preeminent with son and children's children.

verses.sanskrit: तवामग्ने यजमाना अनु दयून विश्वा वसु दधिरे वार्याणि तवया सह दरविणमिछमाना वरजं गोमन्तमुशिजो विवव्रुः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmaghne yajamānā anu dyūn viśvā vasu dadhire vāryāṇi tvayā saha draviṇamichamānā vrajaṃ ghomantamuśijo vivavruḥ

translations.griffith: While, Agni, day by day men pay thee worship they win themselves all treasures worth the wishing.  Allied with thee, eager and craving riches, they have disclosed the stable filled with cattle.

verses.sanskrit: अस्ताव्यग्निर्नरां सुशेवो वैश्वानर रषिभिःसोमगोपाः अद्वेषे दयावाप्र्थिवी हुवेम देवा धत्त रयिमस्मे सुवीरम |||
verses.transliteration: astāvyaghnirnarāṃ suśevo vaiśvānara ṛṣibhiḥsomaghopāḥ adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayimasme suvīram

translations.griffith: Agni, the Friend of men, the Soma's keeper, Vaiśvānara, hath been lauded by the Ṛṣis.  We will invoke benignant Earth and Heaven: ye Deities, give us wealth with hero children.

verses.sanskrit: पर होता जातो महान नभोविन नर्षद्वा सीददपामुपस्थे दधिर्यो धायि स ते वयांसि यन्ता वसूनि विधतेतनूपाः |||
verses.transliteration: pra hotā jāto mahān nabhovin nṛṣadvā sīdadapāmupasthe dadhiryo dhāyi sa te vayāṃsi yantā vasūni vidhatetanūpāḥ

translations.griffith: STABLISHED for thee, to lend thee vital forces, Giver of wealth, Guard of his servant's body.  The Great Priest, born, who knows the clouds, Abider with men, is seated in the lap of waters.

verses.sanskrit: इमं विधन्तो अपां सधस्थे पशुं न नष्टं पदैरनु गमन गुहा चतन्तमुशिजो नमोभिरिछन्तो धीराभ्र्गवो.अविन्दन |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ vidhanto apāṃ sadhasthe paśuṃ na naṣṭaṃ padairanu ghman ghuhā catantamuśijo namobhirichanto dhīrābhṛghavo.avindan

translations.griffith: Worshipping, seeking him with adoration like some lost creature followed by its footprints,  Wise Bhṛgus, yearning in their hearts, pursued him, and found him lurking where the floods are gathered.

verses.sanskrit: इमं तरितो भूर्यविन्ददिछन वैभूवसो मूर्धन्यघ्न्यायाः स शेव्र्धो जात आ हर्म्येषु नाभिर्युवाभवति रोचनस्य |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ trito bhūryavindadichan vaibhūvaso mūrdhanyaghnyāyāḥ sa śevṛdho jāta ā harmyeṣu nābhiryuvābhavati rocanasya

translations.griffith: On the Cow's forehead, with laborious searching, Trita, the offspring of Vibhiavas, found him.  Born in our houses, Youthful, joy-bestower, he now becomes the central point of brightness.

verses.sanskrit: मन्द्रं होतारमुशिजो नमोभिः पराञ्चं यज्ञं नेतारमध्वराणाम विशामक्र्ण्वन्नरतिं पावकं हव्यवाहन्दधतो मानुषेषु |||
verses.transliteration: mandraṃ hotāramuśijo namobhiḥ prāñcaṃ yajñaṃ netāramadhvarāṇām viśāmakṛṇvannaratiṃ pāvakaṃ havyavāhandadhato mānuṣeṣu

translations.griffith: Yearning, with homage, they have set and made him blithe Priest among mankind, oblation-bearer,  Leader of rites and Purifier, envoy of men, as sacrifice that still advances.

verses.sanskrit: पर भूर्जयन्तं महां विपोधां मूरा अमूरं पुरान्दर्माणम नयन्तो गर्भं वनां धियं धुर्हिरिश्मश्रुं नार्वाणं धनर्चम |||
verses.transliteration: pra bhūrjayantaṃ mahāṃ vipodhāṃ mūrā amūraṃ purāndarmāṇam nayanto gharbhaṃ vanāṃ dhiyaṃ dhurhiriśmaśruṃ nārvāṇaṃ dhanarcam

translations.griffith: The foolish brought the ne’er-bewildered forward, great, Victor, Song-inspirer, Fort-destroyer.  Leading the Youth gold-bearded, like a courser gleaming with wealth, they turned their hymn to profit.

verses.sanskrit: नि पस्त्यासु तरित सतभूयन परिवीतो योनौ सीददन्तः अतः संग्र्भ्या विशां दमूना विधर्मणायन्त्रैरीयतेनॄन |||
verses.transliteration: ni pastyāsu trita stabhūyan parivīto yonau sīdadantaḥ ataḥ saṃghṛbhyā viśāṃ damūnā vidharmaṇāyantrairīyatenṝn

translations.griffith: Holding his station firmly in the houses, Trita sat down within his home surrounded  Thence, as Law bids, departs the Tribes' Companion having collected men with no compulsion.

verses.sanskrit: अस्याजरासो दमामरित्रा अर्चद्धूमासो अग्नयः पावकाः शवितीचयः शवात्रासो भुरण्यवो वनर्षदो वायवो नसोमाः |||
verses.transliteration: asyājarāso damāmaritrā arcaddhūmāso aghnayaḥ pāvakāḥ śvitīcayaḥ śvātrāso bhuraṇyavo vanarṣado vāyavo nasomāḥ

translations.griffith: His are the fires, eternal, purifying, that make the houses move, whose smoke is shining,  White, waxing in their strength, for ever stirring, and sitting in the wood; like winds are Somas.

verses.sanskrit: पर जिह्वया भरते वेपो अग्निः पर वयुनानि चेतसाप्र्थिव्याः तमायवः शुचयन्तं पावकं मन्द्रंहोतारं दधिरे यजिष्ठम |||
verses.transliteration: pra jihvayā bharate vepo aghniḥ pra vayunāni cetasāpṛthivyāḥ tamāyavaḥ śucayantaṃ pāvakaṃ mandraṃhotāraṃ dadhire yajiṣṭham

translations.griffith: The tongue of Agni bears away the praisesong, and, through his care for Earth, her operations.  Him, bright and radiant, living men have stablished as their blithe Priest, the Chief of Sacrificers.

verses.sanskrit: दयावा यमग्निं पर्थिवी जनिष्टामापस्त्वष्टा भर्गवोयं सहोभिः ईळेन्यं परथमं मातरिश्वा देवास्ततक्षुर्मनवे यजत्रम |||
verses.transliteration: dyāvā yamaghniṃ pṛthivī janiṣṭāmāpastvaṣṭā bhṛghavoyaṃ sahobhiḥ īḷenyaṃ prathamaṃ mātariśvā devāstatakṣurmanave yajatram

translations.griffith: That Agni, him whom Heaven and Earth engendered, the Waters. Tvaṣṭar, and with might, the Bhṛgus,  Him Mātariśvan and the Gods have fashioned holy for man and first to be entreated.

verses.sanskrit: यं तवा देवा दधिरे हव्यवाहं पुरुस्प्र्हो मानुषासोयजत्रम स यामन्नग्ने सतुवते वयो धाः पर देवयन्यशसः सं हि पूर्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ tvā devā dadhire havyavāhaṃ puruspṛho mānuṣāsoyajatram sa yāmannaghne stuvate vayo dhāḥ pra devayanyaśasaḥ saṃ hi pūrvīḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, whom Gods have made oblationbearer, and much-desiring men regard as holy,  Give life to him who lauds thee when he worships, and then shall glorious men in troops adore thee.

verses.sanskrit: जग्र्भ्मा ते दक्षिणमिन्द्र हस्तं वसूयवो वसुपतेवसूनाम विद्मा हि तवा गोपतिं शूर गोनामस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः |||
verses.transliteration: jaghṛbhmā te dakṣiṇamindra hastaṃ vasūyavo vasupatevasūnām vidmā hi tvā ghopatiṃ śūra ghonāmasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: THY right hand have we grasped in ours, O Indra, longing for treasure, Treasure-Lord of treasures!  Because we know thee, Hero, Lord of cattle: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit: सवायुधं सववसं सुनीथं चतुःसमुद्रं धरुनंरयीणाम चर्क्र्त्यं शंस्यं भूरिवारमस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः |||
verses.transliteration: svāyudhaṃ svavasaṃ sunīthaṃ catuḥsamudraṃ dharunaṃrayīṇām carkṛtyaṃ śaṃsyaṃ bhūrivāramasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: Wealth, fully armed, good guard and kind protector, sprung from four seas, the prop and stay of treasures,  Fraught with great bounties, meet for praise and glory; vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit: सुब्रह्माणं देववन्तं बर्हन्तमुरुं गभीरं पर्थुबुध्नमिन्द्र शरुतर्षिमुग्रमभिमातिषाहमस्मभ्यं चित्रंव्र्षणं रयिं दाः |||
verses.transliteration: subrahmāṇaṃ devavantaṃ bṛhantamuruṃ ghabhīraṃ pṛthubudhnamindra śrutaṛṣimughramabhimātiṣāhamasmabhyaṃ citraṃvṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: Wealth, with good Brahmans, Indra! God-attended, high, wide, and deep, arid based on broad foundations,  Strong, with famed Ṛṣis, conquering our foemen: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit: सनद्वाजं विप्रवीरं तरुत्रं धनस्प्र्तं शूशुवांसंसुदक्षम दस्युहनं पूर्भिदमिन्द्र सत्यमस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः |||
verses.transliteration: sanadvājaṃ vipravīraṃ tarutraṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ śūśuvāṃsaṃsudakṣam dasyuhanaṃ pūrbhidamindra satyamasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: Victorious, winning strength, with hero sages, confirmed in power, most useful, wealth-attracting,  True, Indra! crushing forts and slaying Dasyus: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वावन्तं रथिनं वीरवन्तं सहस्रिणं शतिनंवाजमिन्द्र भद्रव्रातं विप्रवीरं सवर्षामस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvāvantaṃ rathinaṃ vīravantaṃ sahasriṇaṃ śatinaṃvājamindra bhadravrātaṃ vipravīraṃ svarṣāmasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: Wealthy in heroes and in cars and horses, strength hundredfold and thousandfold, O Indra,  With manly sages, happy troops, Iight-winning: vouchsafe us mighty and resplentdent riches.

verses.sanskrit: पर सप्तगुं रतधीतिं सुमेधां बर्हस्पतिं मतिरछाजिगाति य आङगिरसो नमसोपसद्यो.अस्मभ्यं चित्रंव्र्षणं रयिं दाः |||
verses.transliteration: pra saptaghuṃ ṛtadhītiṃ sumedhāṃ bṛhaspatiṃ matirachājighāti ya āṅghiraso namasopasadyo.asmabhyaṃ citraṃvṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: To Saptagu the sage, the holy-minded, to him, Bṛhaspati, the song approaches,  Aṅgiras' Son who must be met with homage: vouchsafe us mighty and reslendent riches.

verses.sanskrit: वनीवानो मम दूतास इन्द्रं सतोमाश्चरन्ति सुमतीरियानाः हर्दिस्प्र्शो मनसा वच्यमाना अस्मभ्यं चित्रंव्र्षणं रयिं दाः |||
verses.transliteration: vanīvāno mama dūtāsa indraṃ stomāścaranti sumatīriyānāḥ hṛdispṛśo manasā vacyamānā asmabhyaṃ citraṃvṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: My lauds, like envoys, craving loving-kindness, go forth to Indra with their strong entreaty,  Moving his heart and uttered by my spirit: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit: यत तवा यामि दद्धि तन न इन्द्र बर्हन्तं कषयमसमंजनानाम अभि तद दयावाप्र्थिवी गर्णीतामस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः |||
verses.transliteration: yat tvā yāmi daddhi tan na indra bṛhantaṃ kṣayamasamaṃjanānām abhi tad dyāvāpṛthivī ghṛṇītāmasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: Grant us the boon for which I pray, O Indra, a spacious home unmatched among the people.  To this may Heaven and Earth accord approval: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit: अहं भुवं वसुनः पूर्व्यस पतिरहं धनानि संजयामि शश्वतः मां हवन्ते पितरं न जन्तवो.अहन्दाशुषे वि भजामि भोजनम |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ bhuvaṃ vasunaḥ pūrvyas patirahaṃ dhanāni saṃjayāmi śaśvataḥ māṃ havante pitaraṃ na jantavo.ahandāśuṣe vi bhajāmi bhojanam

translations.griffith: I WAS the first possessor of all precious gear: the wealth of every man I win and gather up.  On me as on a Father living creatures call; I deal enjoyment to tho. man who offers gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अहमिन्द्रो रोधो वक्षो अथर्वणस्त्रिताय गा अजनयमहेरधि अहं दस्युभ्यः परि नर्म्णमा ददे गोत्रा शिक्षन्दधीचे मातरिश्वने |||
verses.transliteration: ahamindro rodho vakṣo atharvaṇastritāya ghā ajanayamaheradhi ahaṃ dasyubhyaḥ pari nṛmṇamā dade ghotrā śikṣandadhīce mātariśvane

translations.griffith: I, Indra, am Atharvan's stay and firm support: I brought forth kine to Trita from the Dragon's grasp.  I stripped the Dasyus of their manly might, and gave the cattle-stalls to Matarigvan and Dadhyac.

verses.sanskrit: मह्यं तवष्टा वज्रमतक्षदायसं मयि देवासो.अव्र्जन्नपि करतुम ममानीकं सूर्यस्येव दुष्टरं मामार्यन्तिक्र्तेन कर्त्वेन च |||
verses.transliteration: mahyaṃ tvaṣṭā vajramatakṣadāyasaṃ mayi devāso.avṛjannapi kratum mamānīkaṃ sūryasyeva duṣṭaraṃ māmāryantikṛtena kartvena ca

translations.griffith: For me hath Tvaṣṭar forged the iron thunderbolt: in me the Gods have centred intellectual power.  My sheen is like the Sun's insufferably bright: men honour me as Lord for past and future deeds.

verses.sanskrit: अहमेतं गव्ययमश्व्यं पशुं पुरीषिणं सायकेनाहिरण्ययम पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशामि दाशुषे यन मासोमास उक्थिनो अमन्दिषुः |||
verses.transliteration: ahametaṃ ghavyayamaśvyaṃ paśuṃ purīṣiṇaṃ sāyakenāhiraṇyayam purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi dāśuṣe yan māsomāsa ukthino amandiṣuḥ

translations.griffith: I won myself these herdi of cattle, steeds and kine, and gold in ample store, with my destructive bolt.  I give full many a thousand to the worshipper, what time the Somas and the lauds have made me glad.

verses.sanskrit: अहमिन्द्रो न परा जिग्य इद धनं न मर्त्यवे.अव तस्थेकदा चन सोममिन मा सुन्वन्तो याचता वसु न मेपूरवः सख्ये रिषाथन |||
verses.transliteration: ahamindro na parā jighya id dhanaṃ na mṛtyave.ava tasthekadā cana somamin mā sunvanto yācatā vasu na mepūravaḥ sakhye riṣāthana

translations.griffith: Indra am I none ever wins my wealth from me never at any time am I a thrall to death.  Pressing the Soma, ask riches from me alone: ye, Pūrus, in my friendship shall not suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: अहमेताञ्छाश्वसतो दवा-दवेन्द्रं ये वज्रं युधयेऽकर्ण्वत आह्वयमानानव हन्मनाहनं दर्ळा वदन्ननमस्युर्नमस्विनः |||
verses.transliteration: ahametāñchāśvasato dvā-dvendraṃ ye vajraṃ yudhaye'kṛṇvata āhvayamānānava hanmanāhanaṃ dṛḷā vadannanamasyurnamasvinaḥ

translations.griffith: These, breathing loud in fury, two and two, who caused Indra to bring his bolt of thunder to the fray,  The challengers, I struck with deadly weapon down: firm stand what words the God speaks to his worshippers.

verses.sanskrit: अभीदमेकमेको अस्मि निष्षाळ अभी दवा किमु तरयःकरन्ति खले न पर्षान परति हन्मि भूरि किं मा निन्दन्तिशत्रवो.अनिन्द्राः |||
verses.transliteration: abhīdamekameko asmi niṣṣāḷ abhī dvā kimu trayaḥkaranti khale na parṣān prati hanmi bhūri kiṃ mā nindantiśatravo.anindrāḥ

translations.griffith: This One by stronger might I conquered singly; yea, also two: shall three prevail against me?  Like many sheaves upon the floor I thrash them. How can my foes, the Indraless, revile me?

verses.sanskrit: अहं गुङगुभ्यो अतिथिग्वमिष्करमिषं न वर्त्रतुरंविक्षु धारयम यत पर्णयघ्न उत वा करञ्जहे पराहम्महे वर्त्रहत्ये अशुश्रवि |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ ghuṅghubhyo atithighvamiṣkaramiṣaṃ na vṛtraturaṃvikṣu dhārayam yat parṇayaghna uta vā karañjahe prāhammahe vṛtrahatye aśuśravi

translations.griffith: Against the Gungus I made Atithigva strong, and kept him mid the folk like Vṛtra-conquering strength,  When I won glory in the great foe-slaying fight, in battle where Karanja fell, and Parṇaya.

verses.sanskrit: पर मे नमी साप्य इषे भुजे भूद गवामेषे सख्याक्र्णुत दविता दिद्युं यदस्य समिथेषु मंहयमादिदेनं शंस्यमुक्थ्यं करम |||
verses.transliteration: pra me namī sāpya iṣe bhuje bhūd ghavāmeṣe sakhyākṛṇuta dvitā didyuṃ yadasya samitheṣu maṃhayamādidenaṃ śaṃsyamukthyaṃ karam

translations.griffith: With food for mine enjoyment Sapya Nami came: he joined me as a friend of old in search of kine.  As I bestowed on him an arrow for the fight I made him worthy of the song apd hymn of praise.

verses.sanskrit: पर नेमस्मिन दद्र्शे सोमो अन्तर्गोपा नेममाविरस्थाक्र्णोति स तिग्मश्र्ङगं वर्षभं युयुत्सन दरुहस्तस्थौबहुले बद्धो अन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: pra nemasmin dadṛśe somo antarghopā nemamāvirasthākṛṇoti sa tighmaśṛṅghaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yuyutsan druhastasthaubahule baddho antaḥ

translations.griffith: One of the two hath Soma, seen within it; the Herdsman with the bone shows forth the other.  He, fain to fight the Bull whose horns were sharpened, stood fettered in the demon's ample region.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्यानां वसूनां रुद्रियाणां देवो देवानां नमिनामि धाम ते मा भद्राय शवसे ततक्षुरपराजितमस्त्र्तमषाळम |||
verses.transliteration: ādityānāṃ vasūnāṃ rudriyāṇāṃ devo devānāṃ namināmi dhāma te mā bhadrāya śavase tatakṣuraparājitamastṛtamaṣāḷam

translations.griffith: I, as a God, ne’er violate the statutes of Gods, of Vasus, Rudriyas, Ādityas.  These Gods have formed me for auspicious vigour, unconquered and invincible for ever.

verses.sanskrit: अहं दां गर्णते पूर्व्यं वस्वहं बरह्म कर्णवं मह्यंवर्धनम अहं भुवं यजमानस्य चोदितायज्वनः साक्षिविश्वस्मिन भरे |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ dāṃ ghṛṇate pūrvyaṃ vasvahaṃ brahma kṛṇavaṃ mahyaṃvardhanam ahaṃ bhuvaṃ yajamānasya coditāyajvanaḥ sākṣiviśvasmin bhare

translations.griffith: I HAVE enriched the singer with surpassing wealth; I have allowed the holy hymn to strengthen me.  I, furtherer of him who offers sacrifice, have conquered in each fight the men who worship not.

verses.sanskrit: मां धुरिन्द्रं नाम देवता दिवश्च गमश्चापां चजन्तवः अहं हरी वर्षणा विव्रता रघू अहंवज्रं शवसे धर्ष्ण्वा ददे |||
verses.transliteration: māṃ dhurindraṃ nāma devatā divaśca ghmaścāpāṃ cajantavaḥ ahaṃ harī vṛṣaṇā vivratā raghū ahaṃvajraṃ śavase dhṛṣṇvā dade

translations.griffith: The People of the heavens, the waters, and the earth have stablished me among the Gods with Indra's name.  I took unto myself the two swift vigorous Bays that speed on divers paths, and the fierce bolt for strength.

verses.sanskrit: अहमत्कं कवये शिश्नथं हथैरहं कुत्समावमाभिरूतिभिः अहं शुष्णस्य शनथिता वधर्यमंन यो रर आर्यं नाम दस्यवे |||
verses.transliteration: ahamatkaṃ kavaye śiśnathaṃ hathairahaṃ kutsamāvamābhirūtibhiḥ ahaṃ śuṣṇasya śnathitā vadharyamaṃna yo rara āryaṃ nāma dasyave

translations.griffith: With deadly blows I smote Atka for Kavi's sake; I guarded Kutsa well with these saving helps.  As Śuṣṇa's slayer I brandished the dart of death: I gave not up the Āryan name to Dasyu foes.

verses.sanskrit: अहं पितेव वेतसून्रभिष्टये तुग्रं कुत्साय समदिभंच रन्धयम अहं भुवं यजमानस्य राजनि पर यद भरेतुजये न परियाध्र्षे |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ piteva vetasūnrabhiṣṭaye tughraṃ kutsāya smadibhaṃca randhayam ahaṃ bhuvaṃ yajamānasya rājani pra yad bharetujaye na priyādhṛṣe

translations.griffith: Smadibha, Tugra, and the Vetasus I gave as prey to Kutsa, father-like, to succour him.  I was a worthy King to rule the worshipper, when I gave Tuji dear inviolable gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अहं रन्धयं मर्गयं शरुतर्वणे यन माजिहीत वयुनाचनानुषक अहं वेशं नम्रमायवे.अकरमहंसव्याय पड्ग्र्भिमरन्धयम |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ randhayaṃ mṛghayaṃ śrutarvaṇe yan mājihīta vayunācanānuṣak ahaṃ veśaṃ namramāyave.akaramahaṃsavyāya paḍghṛbhimarandhayam

translations.griffith: I gave up Mṛgaya to Srutarvan as his prey because he ever followed me and kept my laws.  For Āyu's sake I caused Veta to bend and bow, and into Savya's hand delivered Padgrbhi.

verses.sanskrit: अहं स यो नववास्त्वं बर्हद्रथं सं वर्त्रेव दासंव्र्त्रहारुजम यद वर्धयन्तं परथयन्तमानुषग दूरेपारे रजसो रोचनाकरम |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ sa yo navavāstvaṃ bṛhadrathaṃ saṃ vṛtreva dāsaṃvṛtrahārujam yad vardhayantaṃ prathayantamānuṣagh dūrepāre rajaso rocanākaram

translations.griffith: 1, I crushed Navavāstva of the lofty car, the Dāsa, as the Vṛtra-slayer kills the fiends;  When straightway on the region's farthest edge I brought the God who makes the lights to broaden and increase.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सूर्यस्य परि याम्याशुभिः परैतशेभिर्वहमानोजसा यन मा सावो मनुष आह निर्णिज रधक कर्षेदासं कर्त्व्यं हथैः |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ sūryasya pari yāmyāśubhiḥ praitaśebhirvahamānaojasā yan mā sāvo manuṣa āha nirṇija ṛdhak kṛṣedāsaṃ kṛtvyaṃ hathaiḥ

translations.griffith: I travel round about borne onward in my might by the fleet-footed dappled Horses of the Sun.  When man's libation calls me to the robe of state I soon repel the powerful Dasyu with my blows.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सप्तहा नहुषो नहुष्टरः पराश्राव यं शवसातुर्वशं यदुम अहं नयन्यं सहसा सहस करं नवव्राधतो नवतिं च वक्षयम |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ saptahā nahuṣo nahuṣṭaraḥ prāśrāva yaṃ śavasāturvaśaṃ yadum ahaṃ nyanyaṃ sahasā sahas karaṃ navavrādhato navatiṃ ca vakṣayam

translations.griffith: Stronger am I than Nabus, I who slew the seven: I glorified with might Yadu and Turvaga.  I brought another low, with strength I bent his strength: I let the mighty nine-and-ninety wax in power.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सप्त सरवतो धारयं वर्षा दरवित्न्वः पर्थिव्यांसीरा अधि अहमर्णांसि वि तिरामि सुक्रतुर्युधा विदम्मनवे गातुमिष्टये |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ sapta sravato dhārayaṃ vṛṣā dravitnvaḥ pṛthivyāṃsīrā adhi ahamarṇāṃsi vi tirāmi sukraturyudhā vidammanave ghātumiṣṭaye

translations.griffith: Bull over all the streams that flow along the earth, I took the Seven Rivers as mine own domain.  I, gifted with great wisdom, spread the floods abroad: by war I found for man the way to high success.

verses.sanskrit: अहं तदासु धारयं यदासु न देवश्चनत्वष्टाधारयद रुशत सपार्हं गवामूधस्सुवक्षणास्वा मधोर्मधु शवात्र्यं सोममाशिरम |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ tadāsu dhārayaṃ yadāsu na devaścanatvaṣṭādhārayad ruśat spārhaṃ ghavāmūdhassuvakṣaṇāsvā madhormadhu śvātryaṃ somamāśiram

translations.griffith: I set within these cows the white milk which no God, not even Tvaṣṭar's self, had there deposited,—  Much-longed-for, in the breasts, the udders of the kine, the savoury sweets of meath, the milk and Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: एवा देवानिन्द्रो विव्ये नॄन पर चयौत्नेन मघवासत्यराधाः विश्वेत ता ते हरिवः शचीवो.अभितुरासः सवयशो गर्णन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: evā devānindro vivye nṝn pra cyautnena maghavāsatyarādhāḥ viśvet tā te harivaḥ śacīvo.abhiturāsaḥ svayaśo ghṛṇanti

translations.griffith: Even thus hath Indra Maghavan, truly bounteous, sped Gods and men with mighty operation.  The pious glorify all these thine exploits, Lord of Bay Coursers, Strong, and Selfresplendent.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो महे मन्दमानायान्धसो.अर्चा विश्वानरायविश्वाभुवे इन्द्रस्य यस्य सुमखं सहो महि शरवोन्र्म्णं च रोदसी सपर्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo mahe mandamānāyāndhaso.arcā viśvānarāyaviśvābhuve indrasya yasya sumakhaṃ saho mahi śravonṛmṇaṃ ca rodasī saparyataḥ

translations.griffith: I LAUD your Mighty One who joyeth in the juice, him who is shared by all men, who created all;  Indra, whose conquering strength is powerful in war, whose fame and manly vigour Heaven and Earth revere.

verses.sanskrit: सो चिन नु सख्या नर्य इन सतुतश्चर्क्र्त्य इन्द्रो मावतेनरे विश्वासु धूर्षु वाजक्र्त्येषु सत्पते वर्त्रे वाप्स्वभि शूर मन्दसे |||
verses.transliteration: so cin nu sakhyā narya ina stutaścarkṛtya indro māvatenare viśvāsu dhūrṣu vājakṛtyeṣu satpate vṛtre vāpsvabhi śūra mandase

translations.griffith: He with his friend is active, lauded, good to man, Indra who must be glorified by one like me.  Hero, Lord of the brave, all cars are thy delight, warring with Vṛtra, or for waters, or for spoil.

verses.sanskrit: के ते नर इन्द्र ये त इषे ये ते सुम्नं सधन्यमियक्षान के ते वाजायासुर्याय हिन्विरे के अप्सु सवासूर्वरासुपौंस्ये |||
verses.transliteration: ke te nara indra ye ta iṣe ye te sumnaṃ sadhanyamiyakṣān ke te vājāyāsuryāya hinvire ke apsu svāsūrvarāsupauṃsye

translations.griffith: Who are the men whom thou wilt further, Indra, who strive to win thy bliss allied with riches?  Who urged thee forward to exert thy power divine, to valour, in the war for waters on their fields?

verses.sanskrit: भुवस्त्वमिन्द्र बरह्मणा महान भुवो विश्वेषु सवनेषुयज्ञियः भुवो नॄंश्च्यौत्नो विश्वस्मिन भरेज्येष्ठश्च मन्त्रो विश्वचर्षणे |||
verses.transliteration: bhuvastvamindra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvo viśveṣu savaneṣuyajñiyaḥ bhuvo nṝṃścyautno viśvasmin bharejyeṣṭhaśca mantro viśvacarṣaṇe

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, through the holy prayer art mighty, worthy of sacrifice at all libations.  In every fight thou castest heroes on the ground: thou art the noblest song, O Lord of all the folk.

verses.sanskrit: अवा नु कं जयायान यज्ञवनसो महीं त ओमात्रांक्र्ष्टयो विदुः असो नु कमजरो वर्धाश्च विश्वेदेतासवना तूतुमा कर्षे |||
verses.transliteration: avā nu kaṃ jyāyān yajñavanaso mahīṃ ta omātrāṃkṛṣṭayo viduḥ aso nu kamajaro vardhāśca viśvedetāsavanā tūtumā kṛṣe

translations.griffith: Help now, as Highest, those who toil at sacrifice: well do the people know thy great protecting might.  Thou shalt be Everlasing, Giver of success yea, on all these libations thou bestowest strength.

verses.sanskrit: एता विश्वा सवना तूतुमाक्र्षे सवयं सूनो सहसो यानिदधिषे वराय ते पात्रं धर्मणे तना यज्ञो मन्त्रोब्रह्मोद्यतं वचः |||
verses.transliteration: etā viśvā savanā tūtumākṛṣe svayaṃ sūno sahaso yānidadhiṣe varāya te pātraṃ dharmaṇe tanā yajño mantrobrahmodyataṃ vacaḥ

translations.griffith: All these libations thou makest effectual, of which thou art thyself supporter, Son of Power.  Therefore thy vessel is to be esteemed the best, sacrifice, holy text, prayer, and exalted speech.

verses.sanskrit: ये ते विप्र बरह्मक्र्तः सुते सचा वसूनां च वसुनश्चदावने पर ते सुम्नस्य मनसा पथा भुवन मदे सुतस्यसोम्यस्यान्धसः |||
verses.transliteration: ye te vipra brahmakṛtaḥ sute sacā vasūnāṃ ca vasunaścadāvane pra te sumnasya manasā pathā bhuvan made sutasyasomyasyāndhasaḥ

translations.griffith: They who with flowing Soma pray to thee, O Sage, to pour on them thy gifts of opulence and wealth,  May they come forward, through their spirit, on the path of bliss, in the wild joy of Soma juice effused.

verses.sanskrit: महत तदुल्बं सथविरं तदासीद येनाविष्टितःप्रविवेशिथापः विश्वा अपश्यद बहुधा ते अग्ने जातवेदस्तन्वो देव एकः |||
