verses.transliteration: mahat tadulbaṃ sthaviraṃ tadāsīd yenāviṣṭitaḥpraviveśithāpaḥ viśvā apaśyad bahudhā te aghne jātavedastanvo deva ekaḥ

translations.griffith: LARGE was that covering, and firm of texture, folded wherein thou enteredst the waters.  One Deity alone, O Jātavedas Agni, saw all thy forms in sundry places.

verses.sanskrit: को मा ददर्श कतमः स देवो यो मे तन्वो बहुधापर्यपश्यत कवाह मित्रावरुणा कषियन्त्यग्नेर्विस्वाःसमिधो देवयानीः |||
verses.transliteration: ko mā dadarśa katamaḥ sa devo yo me tanvo bahudhāparyapaśyat kvāha mitrāvaruṇā kṣiyantyaghnervisvāḥsamidho devayānīḥ

translations.griffith: What God hath seen me? Who of all their number clearly beheld my forms in many places?  Where lie, then, all the sacred logs of Agni that lead him God-ward, Varuṇa and Mitra?

verses.sanskrit: ऐछाम तवा बहुधा जातवेदः परविष्टमग्ने अप्स्वोषधीषु तं तवा यमो अचिकेच्चित्रभानो दशान्तरुष्यादतिरोचमानम |||
verses.transliteration: aichāma tvā bahudhā jātavedaḥ praviṣṭamaghne apsvoṣadhīṣu taṃ tvā yamo acikeccitrabhāno daśāntaruṣyādatirocamānam

translations.griffith: In many places, Agni Jātavedas, we sought thee hidden in the plants and waters.  Then Yama marked thee, God of wondrous splendour! effulgent from thy tenfold secret dwelling,

verses.sanskrit: होत्रादहं वरुण बिभ्यदायं नेदेव मा युनजन्नत्रदेवाः तस्य मे तन्वो बहुधा निविष्टा एतमर्थं नचिकेताहमग्निः |||
verses.transliteration: hotrādahaṃ varuṇa bibhyadāyaṃ nedeva mā yunajannatradevāḥ tasya me tanvo bahudhā niviṣṭā etamarthaṃ naciketāhamaghniḥ

translations.griffith: I fled in fear from sacrificial worship, Varuṇa, lest the Gods should thus engage me.  Thus were my forms laid down in many places. This, as my goal, I Agni saw before me.

verses.sanskrit: एहि मनुर्देवयुर्यज्ञकामो.अरंक्र्त्या तमसि कषेष्यग्ने सुगान पथः कर्णुहि देवयानान वह हव्यानिसुमनस्यमानः |||
verses.transliteration: ehi manurdevayuryajñakāmo.araṃkṛtyā tamasi kṣeṣyaghne sughān pathaḥ kṛṇuhi devayānān vaha havyānisumanasyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: Come; man is pious and would fain do worship, he waits prepared: in gloom thou, Agni, dwellest.  Make pathways leading God-ward clear and easy, and bear oblations with a kindly spirit.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नेः पूर्वे भरातरो अर्थमेतं रथीवाध्वानमन्वावरीवुः तस्माद भिया वरुण दूरमायं गौरो नक्षेप्नोरविजे जयायाः |||
verses.transliteration: aghneḥ pūrve bhrātaro arthametaṃ rathīvādhvānamanvāvarīvuḥ tasmād bhiyā varuṇa dūramāyaṃ ghauro nakṣepnoravije jyāyāḥ

translations.griffith: This goal mine elder brothers erst selected, as he who drives a car the way to travel.  So,Varuṇa, I fled afar through terror, as flies the wild-bull from an archer's bowstring.

verses.sanskrit: कुर्मस्त आयुरजरं यदग्ने यथा युक्तो जातवेदो नरिष्याः अथा वहासि सुमनस्यमानो भागं देवेभ्योहविषः सुजात |||
verses.transliteration: kurmasta āyurajaraṃ yadaghne yathā yukto jātavedo nariṣyāḥ athā vahāsi sumanasyamāno bhāghaṃ devebhyohaviṣaḥ sujāta

translations.griffith: We give thee life unwasting, Jātavedas, so that, employed, thou never shalt be injured.  So, nobly born! shalt thou with kindly spirit bear to the Gods their share of men's oblations.

verses.sanskrit: परयाजान मे अनुयाजांश्च केवलानूर्जस्वन्तं हविषोदत्त भागम घर्तं चापां पुरुषं चौषधीनामग्नेश्च दीर्घमायुरस्तु देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: prayājān me anuyājāṃśca kevalānūrjasvantaṃ haviṣodatta bhāgham ghṛtaṃ cāpāṃ puruṣaṃ cauṣadhīnāmaghneśca dīrghamāyurastu devāḥ

translations.griffith: Grant me the first oblations and the latter, entire, my forceful shares of holy presents,  The soul of plants, the fatness of the waters, and let there be long life, ye Gods, to Agni.

verses.sanskrit: तव परयाजा अनुयाजाश्च केवल ऊर्जस्वन्तो हविषः सन्तुभागाः तवाग्ने यज्ञो.अयमस्तु सर्वस्तुभ्यं नमन्ताम्प्रदिशश्चतस्रः |||
verses.transliteration: tava prayājā anuyājāśca kevala ūrjasvanto haviṣaḥ santubhāghāḥ tavāghne yajño.ayamastu sarvastubhyaṃ namantāmpradiśaścatasraḥ

translations.griffith: Thine be the first oblations and the latter, entire, thy forceful shares of holy presents.  Let all this sacrifice be thine, O Agni, and let the world's four regions how before thee.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवाः शास्तन मा यथेह होता वर्तो मनवै यन्निषद्य पर मे बरूत भागधेयं यथा वो येन पथाहव्यमा वो वहानि |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devāḥ śāstana mā yatheha hotā vṛto manavai yanniṣadya pra me brūta bhāghadheyaṃ yathā vo yena pathāhavyamā vo vahāni

translations.griffith: INSTRUCT me, all ye Gods, how I, elected your Priest, must seat me here, and how address you.  Instruct me how to deal to each his portion, and by what ' path to bring you man's oblation.

verses.sanskrit: अहं होता नयसीदं यजीयान विश्वे देवा मरुतो माजुनन्ति अहर-अहरश्विनाध्वर्यवं वां बरह्मा समिद भवतिसाहुतिर्वाम |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ hotā nyasīdaṃ yajīyān viśve devā maruto mājunanti ahar-aharaśvinādhvaryavaṃ vāṃ brahmā samid bhavatisāhutirvām

translations.griffith: I sit as Priest most skilled in sacrificing: the Maruts and all Deities impel me.  Aśvins, each day yours is the Adhvaryu's duty: Brahman and wood are here: ’tis yours to offer.

verses.sanskrit: अयं यो होता किरु स यमस्य कमप्यूहे यत समञ्जन्तिदेवाः अहर-अहर्जायते मासि-मास्यथा देवा दधिरेहव्यवाहम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ yo hotā kiru sa yamasya kamapyūhe yat samañjantidevāḥ ahar-aharjāyate māsi-māsyathā devā dadhirehavyavāham

translations.griffith: Who is the Priest? Is he the Priest of Yama? On whom is thrust this God-appointed honour?  He springs to life each month, each day that passes; so Gods have made him their oblation-bearer.

verses.sanskrit: मां देवा दधिरे हव्यवाहमपम्लुक्तं बहु कर्छ्राचरन्तम अग्निर्विद्वान यज्ञं नः कल्पयाति पञ्चयामन्त्रिव्र्तं सप्ततन्तुम |||
verses.transliteration: māṃ devā dadhire havyavāhamapamluktaṃ bahu kṛchrācarantam aghnirvidvān yajñaṃ naḥ kalpayāti pañcayāmantrivṛtaṃ saptatantum

translations.griffith: The Gods have made me bearer of oblations, who slipped away and passed through many troubles.  Wise Agni shall ordain for us the worship, whether five-wayed, threefold, or seven-threaded.

verses.sanskrit: आ वो यक्ष्यम्र्तत्वं सुवीरं यथा वो देवा वरिवःकराणि आ बाह्वोर्वज्रमिन्द्रस्य धेयामथेमाविश्वाः पर्तना जयाति |||
verses.transliteration: ā vo yakṣyamṛtatvaṃ suvīraṃ yathā vo devā varivaḥkarāṇi ā bāhvorvajramindrasya dheyāmathemāviśvāḥ pṛtanā jayāti

translations.griffith: So will I win you strength and life for ever. O Gods, that I may give you room and freedom.  To Indra's arms would I consign the thunder; in all these battles shall he then be victor.

verses.sanskrit: तरीणि शता तरी सहस्राण्यग्निं तरिंशच्च देवा नवचासपर्यन औक्षन घर्तैरस्त्र्णन बर्हिरस्मा आदिद्धोतारं नयसादयन्त |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇyaghniṃ triṃśacca devā navacāsaparyan aukṣan ghṛtairastṛṇan barhirasmā ādiddhotāraṃ nyasādayanta

translations.griffith: The Deities three hundred and thirty-nine, have served and honoured Agni,  Strewn sacred grass, anointed him with butter, and seated him as Priest, the Gods’ Invoker.

verses.sanskrit: यमैछाम मनसा सो.अयमागाद यज्ञस्य विद्वान्परुषश्चिकित्वान स नो यक्षद देवताता यजीयान नि हिषत्सदन्तरः पूर्वो अस्मत |||
verses.transliteration: yamaichāma manasā so.ayamāghād yajñasya vidvānparuṣaścikitvān sa no yakṣad devatātā yajīyān ni hiṣatsadantaraḥ pūrvo asmat

translations.griffith: HE hath arrived, he whom we sought with longing, who skilled in sacrifice well knows its courses.  Let him discharge his sacrificial duties: let him sit down as Friend who was before  Us.

verses.sanskrit: अराधि होता निषदा यजीयनभि परयांसि सुधितानि हिख्यत यजामहै यज्ञियान हन्त देवानीळामहाीड्यानाज्येन |||
verses.transliteration: arādhi hotā niṣadā yajīyanabhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hikhyat yajāmahai yajñiyān hanta devānīḷāmahāīḍyānājyena

translations.griffith: Best Priest, he hath been won by being seated, for he hath looked on the well-ordered viands.  Come, let usworship Gods who must be worshipped, and pouring oil, laud those who should be lauded.

verses.sanskrit: साध्वीमकर्देववीतिं नो अद्य यज्ञस्य जिह्वामविदामगुह्याम स आयुरागात सुरभिर्वसानो भद्रामकर्देवहूतिं नो अद्य |||
verses.transliteration: sādhvīmakardevavītiṃ no adya yajñasya jihvāmavidāmaghuhyām sa āyurāghāt surabhirvasāno bhadrāmakardevahūtiṃ no adya

translations.griffith: Now hath he made the feast of Gods effective: now have we found the secret tongue of worship.  Now hath he come, sweet, robed in vital vigour, and made our calling on the Gods effective.

verses.sanskrit: तदद्य वाचः परथमं मसीय येनासुरानभि देवासाम ऊर्जाद उत यज्ञियसः पञ्च जना मम होत्रंजुषध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: tadadya vācaḥ prathamaṃ masīya yenāsurānabhi devāasāma ūrjāda uta yajñiyasaḥ pañca janā mama hotraṃjuṣadhvam

translations.griffith: This prelude of my speech I now will utter, whereby we Gods may quell our Asura foemen.  Eaters of strengthening food who merit worship, O ye Five Tribes, be pleased with mine oblation.

verses.sanskrit: पञ्च जना मम होत्रं जुषन्तां गोजाता उत येयज्ञियासः पर्थिवी नः पार्थिवात पात्वंअसोऽनतरिक्षं दिव्यात पात्वस्मान |||
verses.transliteration: pañca janā mama hotraṃ juṣantāṃ ghojātā uta yeyajñiyāsaḥ pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātvaṃaso'ntarikṣaṃ divyāt pātvasmān

translations.griffith: May the Five Tribes be pleased with mine oblation, and the Cow's Sons and all who merit worship.  From earthly trouble may the earth protect us, and air's mid realm from woe that comes from heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तन्तुं तन्वन रजसो भानुमन्विहि जयोतिष्मतः पथोरक्ष धिया कर्तान अनुल्बणं वयत जोगुवामपो मनुर्भव जनया दैव्यं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: tantuṃ tanvan rajaso bhānumanvihi jyotiṣmataḥ pathorakṣa dhiyā kṛtān anulbaṇaṃ vayata joghuvāmapo manurbhava janayā daivyaṃ janam

translations.griffith: Spinning the thread, follow the region's splendid light: guard thou the path ways well which wisdom hath prepared.  Weave ye the knotless labour of the bards who sing: be Manu thou, and bring the Heavenly People forth.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षानहो नह्यतनोत सोम्या इष्क्र्णुध्वं रशना ओतपिंशत अष्टावन्धुरं वहताभितो रथं येन देवासोनयन्नभि परियम |||
verses.transliteration: akṣānaho nahyatanota somyā iṣkṛṇudhvaṃ raśanā otapiṃśata aṣṭāvandhuraṃ vahatābhito rathaṃ yena devāsoanayannabhi priyam

translations.griffith: Lovers of Soma, bind the chariot traces fast: set ye the reins in order and embellish them.  Bring hitherward the car with seats where eight may sit, whereon the Gods have brought the treasure that we love.

verses.sanskrit: अश्मन्वती रीयते सं रभध्वमुत तिष्ठत पर तरतासखायः अत्रा जहाम ये असन्नशेवाः शिवान वयमुत्तरेमाभि वाजान |||
verses.transliteration: aśmanvatī rīyate saṃ rabhadhvamut tiṣṭhata pra taratāsakhāyaḥ atrā jahāma ye asannaśevāḥ śivān vayamuttaremābhi vājān

translations.griffith: Here flows Asmanvati: hold fast each other, keep yourselves up, and pass, my friends, the river.  There let us leave the Powers that brought no profit, and cross the flood to Powers that are auspicious.

verses.sanskrit: तवष्टा माया वेदपसामपस्तमो बिभ्रत पात्रादेवपानानि शन्तमा शिशीते नूनं परशुं सवायसंयेन वर्श्चादेतशो बरह्मणस पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṣṭā māyā vedapasāmapastamo bibhrat pātrādevapānāni śantamā śiśīte nūnaṃ paraśuṃ svāyasaṃyena vṛścādetaśo brahmaṇas patiḥ

translations.griffith: Tvaṣṭar, most deft of workmen, knew each magic art, bringing most blessed bowls that hold the drink of Gods.  His axe, wrought of good metal, he is sharpening now, wherewith the radiant Brahmaṇaspati will cut.

verses.sanskrit: सतो नूनं कवयः सं शिशीत वाशीभिर्याभिरम्र्ताय तक्षथ विद्वांसः पदा गुह्यानि कर्तन येनदेवासो अम्र्तत्वमानशुः |||
verses.transliteration: sato nūnaṃ kavayaḥ saṃ śiśīta vāśībhiryābhiramṛtāya takṣatha vidvāṃsaḥ padā ghuhyāni kartana yenadevāso amṛtatvamānaśuḥ

translations.griffith: Now, O ye Sapient Ones, make ye the axes sharp wherewith ye fashion bowls to hold the Amṛta.  Knowing the secret places make ye ready that whereby the Gods have gotten immortality.

verses.sanskrit: गर्भे योषामदधुर्वत्समासन्यपीच्येन मनसोतजिह्वया स विश्वाहा सुमना योग्या अभि सिषासनिर्वनतेकार इज्जितिम |||
verses.transliteration: gharbhe yoṣāmadadhurvatsamāsanyapīcyena manasotajihvayā sa viśvāhā sumanā yoghyā abhi siṣāsanirvanatekāra ijjitim

translations.griffith: Ye with a secret tongue and dark intention laid the maiden deep within, the calf within the mouth.  They evermore are near us with their gracious help: successful is the song that strives for victory.

verses.sanskrit: तां सु ते कीर्तिं मघवन महित्वा यत तवा भीते रोदसीह्वयेताम परावो देवानातिरो दासमोजः परजायैत्वस्यै यदशिक्ष इन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: tāṃ su te kīrtiṃ maghavan mahitvā yat tvā bhīte rodasīahvayetām prāvo devānātiro dāsamojaḥ prajāyaitvasyai yadaśikṣa indra

translations.griffith: I SING thy fame that, Maghavan, through thy Greatness the heavens and earth invoked thee in their terror,  Thou, aiding Gods, didst quell the power of Dāsas, what time thou holpest many a race, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यदचरस्तन्वा वाव्र्धानो बलानीन्द्र परब्रुवाणो जनेषु मायेत सा ते यानि युद्धान्याहुर्नाद्य शत्रुं ननुपुरा विवित्से |||
verses.transliteration: yadacarastanvā vāvṛdhāno balānīndra prabruvāṇo janeṣu māyet sā te yāni yuddhānyāhurnādya śatruṃ nanupurā vivitse

translations.griffith: When thou wast roaming, waxen strong in body, telling thy might, Indra, among the people,  All that men called thy battles was illusion: no foe hast thou to-day, nor erst hast found one.

verses.sanskrit: क उ नु ते महिमनः समस्यास्मत पूर्व रषयो.अन्तमापुः यन मातरं च पितरं च साकमजनयथास्तन्वःस्वायाः |||
verses.transliteration: ka u nu te mahimanaḥ samasyāsmat pūrva ṛṣayo.antamāpuḥ yan mātaraṃ ca pitaraṃ ca sākamajanayathāstanvaḥsvāyāḥ

translations.griffith: Who are the Ṛṣis, then, who comprehended before our time the bounds of all thy greatness?  For from thy body thou hast generated at the same time the Mother and the Father.

verses.sanskrit: चत्वारि ते असुर्याणि नामादाभ्यानि महिषस्य सन्ति तवमङग तानि विश्वानि वित्से येभिः कर्माणि मघवञ्चकर्थ |||
verses.transliteration: catvāri te asuryāṇi nāmādābhyāni mahiṣasya santi tvamaṅgha tāni viśvāni vitse yebhiḥ karmāṇi maghavañcakartha

translations.griffith: Thou, Mighty Steer, hast four supremest natures, Asura natures that may ne’er be injured.  All these, O Maghavan, thou surely knowest, wherewith thou hast performed thy great achievements.

verses.sanskrit: तवं विश्वा दधिषे केवलानि यान्याविर्या च गुहावसूनि काममिन मे मघवन मा वि तारीस्त्वमाज्ञातात्वमिन्द्रासि दाता |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ viśvā dadhiṣe kevalāni yānyāviryā ca ghuhāvasūni kāmamin me maghavan mā vi tārīstvamājñātātvamindrāsi dātā

translations.griffith: Thou hast all treasures in thy sole possession, treasures made manifest and treasures hidden.  Defer not thou, O Maghavan, my longing: thou, art Director, Indra, thou art Giver.

verses.sanskrit: यो अदधाज्ज्योतिषि जयोतिरन्तर्यो अस्र्जन मधुना सम्मधूनि अध परियं शूषमिन्द्राय मन्म बरह्मक्र्तोब्र्हदुक्थादवाचि |||
verses.transliteration: yo adadhājjyotiṣi jyotirantaryo asṛjan madhunā sammadhūni adha priyaṃ śūṣamindrāya manma brahmakṛtobṛhadukthādavāci

translations.griffith: To him who set the light in things of splendour, and with all sweetness blent essential sweetness,  To Indra hath this welcome hymn that strengthens been uttered by the votary Bṛhaduktha.

verses.sanskrit: दूरे तन नाम गुह्यं पराचैर्यत तवा भीते अह्वयेतांवयोधै उदस्तभ्नाः पर्थिवीं दयामभीके भरातुःपुत्रान मघवन तित्विषाणः |||
verses.transliteration: dūre tan nāma ghuhyaṃ parācairyat tvā bhīte ahvayetāṃvayodhai udastabhnāḥ pṛthivīṃ dyāmabhīke bhrātuḥputrān maghavan titviṣāṇaḥ

translations.griffith: FAR is that secret name by which, in terror, the worlds invoked thee and thou gavest vigour  The earth and heaven thou settest near each other, and Maghavan, madest bright thy Brother's Children.

verses.sanskrit: महत तन नाम गुह्यं पुरुस्प्र्ग येन भूतं जनयो येनभव्यम परत्नं जातं जयोतिर्यदस्य परियं परियाः समविशन्त पञ्च |||
verses.transliteration: mahat tan nāma ghuhyaṃ puruspṛgh yena bhūtaṃ janayo yenabhavyam pratnaṃ jātaṃ jyotiryadasya priyaṃ priyāḥ samaviśanta pañca

translations.griffith: Great is that secret name and far-extending, whereby thou madest all that is and shall be.  The Five Tribes whom he loveth well have entered the light he loveth that was made aforetime.

verses.sanskrit: आ रोदसी अप्र्णादोत मध्यं पञ्च देवान रतुशः सप्त सप्त चतुस्त्रिंशता पुरुधा वि चष्टे सरूपेण जयोतिषाविव्रतेन |||
verses.transliteration: ā rodasī apṛṇādota madhyaṃ pañca devān ṛtuśaḥ sapta sapta catustriṃśatā purudhā vi caṣṭe sarūpeṇa jyotiṣāvivratena

translations.griffith: He filled the heaven and earth and all between them, Gods five times sevenfold in their proper seasons.  With four-and-thirty lights he looks around him, lights of one colour though their ways are divers.

verses.sanskrit: यदुष औछः परथमा विभानामजनयो येन पुष्टस्यपुष्टम यत ते जामित्वमवरं परस्या महन महत्यासुरत्वमेकम |||
verses.transliteration: yaduṣa auchaḥ prathamā vibhānāmajanayo yena puṣṭasyapuṣṭam yat te jāmitvamavaraṃ parasyā mahan mahatyāasuratvamekam

translations.griffith: As first among the lights, O Dawn, thou shonest, whereby thou broughtest forth the Stay of Increase,  Great art thou, matchless is thine Asura nature, who, high above, art kin to those beneath thee.

verses.sanskrit: विधुं दद्राणं समने बहूनां युवानं सन्तं पलितोजगार देवस्य पश्य काव्यं महित्वाद्या ममार स हयःसमान |||
verses.transliteration: vidhuṃ dadrāṇaṃ samane bahūnāṃ yuvānaṃ santaṃ palitojaghāra devasya paśya kāvyaṃ mahitvādyā mamāra sa hyaḥsamāna

translations.griffith: The old hath waked the young Moon from his slumber who runs his circling course with many round him.  Behold the Gods’ high wisdom in its greatness: he who died yesterday to-day is living.

verses.sanskrit: शाक्मना शाको अरुणः सुपर्ण आ यो महः शूरःसनादनीळः यच्चिकेत सत्यमित तन न मोघं वसुस्पार्हमुत जेतोत दाता |||
verses.transliteration: śākmanā śāko aruṇaḥ suparṇa ā yo mahaḥ śūraḥsanādanīḷaḥ yacciketa satyamit tan na moghaṃ vasuspārhamuta jetota dātā

translations.griffith: Strong is the Red Bird in his strength, great Hero, who from of old hath had no nest to dwell in.  That which he knows is truth and never idle: he wins and gives the wealth desired of many.

verses.sanskrit: ऐभिर्ददे वर्ष्ण्या पौंस्यानि येभिरौक्षद वर्त्रहत्यायवज्री ये कर्मणः करियमाणस्य मह्न रतेकर्ममुदजायन्त देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: aibhirdade vṛṣṇyā pauṃsyāni yebhiraukṣad vṛtrahatyāyavajrī ye karmaṇaḥ kriyamāṇasya mahna ṛtekarmamudajāyanta devāḥ

translations.griffith: Through these the Thunderer gained strong manly vigour, through whom he waxed in power to smite down Vṛtra,—  Who through the might of Indra's operation came forth as Gods in course of Law and Order.

verses.sanskrit: युजा कर्माणि जनयन विश्वौजा अशस्तिथा विश्वमनास्तुराषाट पीत्वी सोमस्य दिव आ वर्धानः शूरो निर्युधाधमद दस्यून |||
verses.transliteration: yujā karmāṇi janayan viśvaujā aśastithā viśvamanāsturāṣāṭ pītvī somasya diva ā vṛdhānaḥ śūro niryudhādhamad dasyūn

translations.griffith: All-strong, performing works with his companion, All-marking, rapid Victor, Curse-averter,  The Hero, waxing, after draughts of Soma, blew far from heaven the Dasyus with his weapon.

verses.sanskrit: इदं त एकं पर ऊ त एकं तर्तीयेन जयोतिषा संविशस्व संवेशने तन्वश्चारुरेधि परियो देवानाम्परमे जनित्रे |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ ta ekaṃ para ū ta ekaṃ tṛtīyena jyotiṣā saṃviśasva saṃveśane tanvaścāruredhi priyo devānāmparame janitre

translations.griffith: HERE is one light for thee, another yonder: enter the third and he therewith united.  Uniting with a body be thou welcome, dear to the Gods in their sublimest birthplace.

verses.sanskrit: तनूष टे वाजिन तन्वं नयन्ती वाममस्मभ्यं धातुशर्म तुभ्यम अह्रुतो महो धरुणाय देवान दिवीवज्योतिः सवमा मिमीयाः |||
verses.transliteration: tanūṣ ṭe vājin tanvaṃ nayantī vāmamasmabhyaṃ dhātuśarma tubhyam ahruto maho dharuṇāya devān divīvajyotiḥ svamā mimīyāḥ

translations.griffith: Bearing thy body, Vajin, may thy body afford us blessing and thyself protection.  Unswerving, stablish as it were in heaven thine own light as the mighty God's supporter.

verses.sanskrit: वाज्यसि वाजिनेना सुवेनीः सुवित सतोमं सुवितो दिवंगाः सुवितो धर्म परथमानु सत्या सुवितो देवान सुवितोऽनु पत्म |||
verses.transliteration: vājyasi vājinenā suvenīḥ suvita stomaṃ suvito divaṃghāḥ suvito dharma prathamānu satyā suvito devān suvito'nu patma

translations.griffith: Strong Steed art thou: go to the yearning Maidens with vigour, happily go to heaven and praises:  Fly happily to the Gods with easy passage, according to the first and faithful statutes.

verses.sanskrit: महिम्न एषां पितरश्चनेशिरे देवा देवेष्वदधुरपिक्रतुम समविव्यचुरुत यान्यत्विषुरैषां तनूषु निविविशुः पुनः |||
verses.transliteration: mahimna eṣāṃ pitaraścaneśire devā deveṣvadadhurapikratum samavivyacuruta yānyatviṣuraiṣāṃ tanūṣu niviviśuḥ punaḥ

translations.griffith: Part of their grandeur have the Fathers also gained: the Gods have seated mental power in them as Gods.  They have embraced within themselves all energies, which, issuing forth, again into their bodies pass.

verses.sanskrit: सहोभिर्विश्वं परि चक्रमू रजः पूर्वा धामान्यमितामिमानाः तनूषु विश्वा भुवना नि येमिरे परासारयन्तपुरुध परजा अनु |||
verses.transliteration: sahobhirviśvaṃ pari cakramū rajaḥ pūrvā dhāmānyamitāmimānāḥ tanūṣu viśvā bhuvanā ni yemire prāsārayantapurudha prajā anu

translations.griffith: They strode through all the region with victorious might, establishing the old immeasurable laws.  They compassed in their bodies all existing things, and streamed forth offipring in many successive forms.

verses.sanskrit: दविधा सूनवो.असुरं सवर्विदमास्थापयन्त तर्तीयेनकर्मणा सवां परजां पितरः पित्र्यं सह आवरेष्वदधुस्तन्तुमाततम |||
verses.transliteration: dvidhā sūnavo.asuraṃ svarvidamāsthāpayanta tṛtīyenakarmaṇā svāṃ prajāṃ pitaraḥ pitryaṃ saha āvareṣvadadhustantumātatam

translations.griffith: In two ways have the sons established in his place the Asura who finds the light, by the third act,  As fathers, they have set their heritage on earth, their offspring, as a thread continuously spun out.

verses.sanskrit: नावा न कषोदः परदिशः पर्थिव्याः सवस्तिभिरतिदुर्गाणि विश्वा सवां परजां बर्हदुक्थो महित्वावरेष्वदधादा परेषु |||
verses.transliteration: nāvā na kṣodaḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyāḥ svastibhiratidurghāṇi viśvā svāṃ prajāṃ bṛhaduktho mahitvāvareṣvadadhādā pareṣu

translations.griffith: As in a ship through billows, so through regions of air, with blessings, through toils and troubles  Hath Bṛhaduktha brought his seed with glory, and placed it here and in the realms beyond us.

verses.sanskrit: मा पर गाम पथो वयं मा यज्ञादिन्द्र सोमिनः मान्त सथुर्नो अरातयः |||
verses.transliteration: mā pra ghāma patho vayaṃ mā yajñādindra sominaḥ mānta sthurno arātayaḥ

translations.griffith: LET us not, Indra, leave the path, the Soma-presser's sacrifice:  Let no malignity dwell with us.

verses.sanskrit: यो यज्ञस्य परसाधनस्तन्तुर्देवेष्वाततः तमाहुतं नशीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: yo yajñasya prasādhanastanturdeveṣvātataḥ tamāhutaṃ naśīmahi

translations.griffith: May we obtain, completely wrought, the thread spun out to reach the Gods,  That perfecteth the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: मनो नवा हुवामहे नाराशंसेन सोमेन पितॄणां चमन्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: mano nvā huvāmahe nārāśaṃsena somena pitṝṇāṃ camanmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: We call the spirit hither with the Soma of our parted sires,  Yea, with the Fathers' holy hymns.

verses.sanskrit: आ त एतु मनः पुनः करत्वे दक्षाय जीवसे जयोक चसूर्यं दर्शे |||
verses.transliteration: ā ta etu manaḥ punaḥ kratve dakṣāya jīvase jyok casūryaṃ dṛśe

translations.griffith: Thy spirit come to thee again for wisdom, energy, and lire,  That thou mayst long behold the sun!

verses.sanskrit: पुनर्नः पितरो मनो ददातु दैव्यो जनः जीवं वरातंसचेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: punarnaḥ pitaro mano dadātu daivyo janaḥ jīvaṃ vrātaṃsacemahi

translations.griffith: O Fathers, may the Heavenly Folk give us our spirit once again,  That we may be with those who live.

verses.sanskrit: वयं सोम वरते तव मनस्तनूषु बिभ्रतः परजावन्तः सचेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ soma vrate tava manastanūṣu bibhrataḥ prajāvantaḥ sacemahi

translations.griffith: O Soma with the spirit still within us, blest with progeny,  May we be busied in the law.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते यमं वैवस्वतं मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त आवर्तयामसीह कषयाय जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: yat te yamaṃ vaivasvataṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta āvartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase

translations.griffith: THY spirit, that went far away to Yama to Vivasvān's Son,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते दिवं यत पर्थिवीं मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त ... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te divaṃ yat pṛthivīṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta ...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away, that passed away to earth and heaven,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते भूमिं चतुर्भ्र्ष्टिं मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te bhūmiṃ caturbhṛṣṭiṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away, away to the four-cornered earth,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते चतस्रः परदिशो मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त ... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te catasraḥ pradiśo mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta ...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away to the four quarters of the world,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते समुद्रमर्णवं मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त ... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te samudramarṇavaṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta ...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away, away unto the billowy sea,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते मरीचीः परवतो मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त ... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te marīcīḥ pravato mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta ...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away to beams of light that flash and flow,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते अपो यदोषधीर्मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त ... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te apo yadoṣadhīrmano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta ...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away, went to the waters and the plants,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते सूर्यं यदुषसं मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त ... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te sūryaṃ yaduṣasaṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta ...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away, that visited the Sun and Dawn.  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते पर्वतान बर्हतो मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त ... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te parvatān bṛhato mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta ...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away, away to lofty mountain heights,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते विश्वमिदं जगन मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त ... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te viśvamidaṃ jaghan mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta ...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away into this All, that lives and moves,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते पराः परावतो मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त ... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te parāḥ parāvato mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta ...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away to distant realms beyond our ken,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते भूतं च भव्यं च मनो जगाम दूरकम तत त... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te bhūtaṃ ca bhavyaṃ ca mano jaghāma dūrakam tat ta...

translations.griffith: Thy spirit, that went far away to all that is and is to be,  We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn heie.

verses.sanskrit: पर तार्यायुः परतरं नवीय सथातारेव करतुमतारथस्य अध चयवान उत तवीत्यर्थं परातरं सग़्म |||
verses.transliteration: pra tāryāyuḥ prataraṃ navīya sthātāreva kratumatārathasya adha cyavāna ut tavītyarthaṃ parātaraṃ sm

translations.griffith: His life hath been renewed and carried forward as two men, car-borne, by the skilful driver.  One falls, then seeks the goal with quickened vigour. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

verses.sanskrit: सामन नु राये निधिमन नवन्नं करामहे सु पुरुधश्रवांसि ता नो विश्वानि जरिता ममत्तु परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम |||
verses.transliteration: sāman nu rāye nidhiman nvannaṃ karāmahe su purudhaśravāṃsi tā no viśvāni jaritā mamattu parātaraṃ sunirtirjihītām

translations.griffith: Here is the psalm for wealth, and food, in plenty: let us do many deeds to bring us glory.  All these our doings shall delight the singer. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

verses.sanskrit: अभी षवर्यः पौंस्यैर्भवेम दयौर्न भूमिं गिरयोनाज्रन ता नो विश्वानि जरिता चिकेत परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम |||
verses.transliteration: abhī ṣvaryaḥ pauṃsyairbhavema dyaurna bhūmiṃ ghirayonājran tā no viśvāni jaritā ciketa parātaraṃ sunirtirjihītām

translations.griffith: May we o’ercome our foes with acts of valour, as heaven is over earth, hills over lowlands.  All these our deeds the singer hath considered. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

verses.sanskrit: मो षु णः सोम मर्त्यवे परा दाः पश्येम नु सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम दयुभिर्हितो जरिमा सू नो अस्तु परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम |||
verses.transliteration: mo ṣu ṇaḥ soma mṛtyave parā dāḥ paśyema nu sūryamuccarantam dyubhirhito jarimā sū no astu parātaraṃ sunirtirjihītām

translations.griffith: Give us not up as prey to death, O Soma still let us look upon the Sun arising.  Let our old age with passing days be kindly. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

verses.sanskrit: असुनीते मनो अस्मासु धारय जीवातवे सु पर तिरा नायुः रारन्धि नः सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्शि घर्तेन तवन्तन्वं वर्धयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: asunīte mano asmāsu dhāraya jīvātave su pra tirā naāyuḥ rārandhi naḥ sūryasya sandṛśi ghṛtena tvantanvaṃ vardhayasva

translations.griffith: O Asuniti, keep the soul within us, and make the days we have to live yet longer.  Grant that we still may look upon the sunlight: strengthen thy body with the oil we bring thee.

verses.sanskrit: असुनीते पुनरस्मासु चक्षुः पुनः पराणमिह नो धेहिभोगम जयोक पश्येम सूर्यमुच्चरन्तमनुमते मर्ळया नह्स्वस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: asunīte punarasmāsu cakṣuḥ punaḥ prāṇamiha no dhehibhogham jyok paśyema sūryamuccarantamanumate mṛḷayā nahsvasti

translations.griffith: Give us our sight again, O Asuniti, give us again our breath and our enjoyment.  Long may we look upon the Sun uprising; O Anumati, favour thou and bless us.

verses.sanskrit: पुनर्नो असुं पर्थिवी ददातु पुनर्द्यौर्देवी पुनरन्तरिक्षम पुनर्नः सोमस्तन्वं ददातु पुनः पूषापथ्यां या सवस्तिः |||
verses.transliteration: punarno asuṃ pṛthivī dadātu punardyaurdevī punarantarikṣam punarnaḥ somastanvaṃ dadātu punaḥ pūṣāpathyāṃ yā svastiḥ

translations.griffith: May Earth restore to us our vital spirit, may Heaven the Goddess and mid-air restore it.  May Soma give us once again our body, and Pūṣan show the Path of peace and comfort.

verses.sanskrit: शं रोदसी सुबन्धवे यह्वी रतस्य मातरा भरतामप यद रपो दयौः पर्थिवि कषमा रपो मो षु ते किंचनाममत |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ rodasī subandhave yahvī ṛtasya mātarā bharatāmapa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapo mo ṣu te kiṃcanāmamat

translations.griffith: May both Worlds bless Subandhu, young Mothers of everlasting Law.  May Heaven and Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

verses.sanskrit: अव दवके अव तरिका दिवश्चरन्ति भेषजा कषमाचरिष्ण्वेककं भरतामप यद रपो दयौः पर्थिवि कषमारपो मो षु ते किं चनाममत |||
verses.transliteration: ava dvake ava trikā divaścaranti bheṣajā kṣamācariṣṇvekakaṃ bharatāmapa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamārapo mo ṣu te kiṃ canāmamat

translations.griffith: Health-giving medicines descend sent down from heaven in twos and threes,  Or wandering singly on the earth. May Heaven and Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

verses.sanskrit: समिन्द्रेरय गामनड्वाहं य आवहदुशीनराण्यानः भरतामप यद रपो दयौः पर्थिवि कषमा रपो मोषु ते किं चनाममत |||
verses.transliteration: samindreraya ghāmanaḍvāhaṃ ya āvahaduśīnarāṇyāanaḥ bharatāmapa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapo moṣu te kiṃ canāmamat

translations.griffith: Drive forward thou the wagon-ox, O Indra, which brought Usinarani's wagon hither.  May Heaven and Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

verses.sanskrit: आ जनं तवेषसन्द्र्शं माहीनानामुपस्तुतम अगन्मबिभ्रतो नमः |||
verses.transliteration: ā janaṃ tveṣasandṛśaṃ māhīnānāmupastutam aghanmabibhrato namaḥ

translations.griffith: BRINGING our homage we have come to one magnificent in look.  Glorified of the mighty Gods

verses.sanskrit: असमातिं नितोशनं तवेषं निययिनं रथम भजेरथस्य सत्पतिम |||
verses.transliteration: asamātiṃ nitośanaṃ tveṣaṃ niyayinaṃ ratham bhajerathasya satpatim

translations.griffith: To Asamati, spring of gifts, lord of the brave, a radiant car,  The conqueror of Bhajeratha

verses.sanskrit: यो जनान महिषानिवातितस्थौ पवीरवान उतापवीरवान्युधा |||
verses.transliteration: yo janān mahiṣānivātitasthau pavīravān utāpavīravānyudhā

translations.griffith: Who, when the spear hath armed his hand, or even weaponless o’erthrows  Men strong as buffaloes in fight;

verses.sanskrit: यस्येक्ष्वाकुरुप वरते रेवान मराय्येधते दिवीवपञ्च कर्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: yasyekṣvākurupa vrate revān marāyyedhate divīvapañca kṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Him in whose service flourishes Iksvaku, rich and dazzling-bright.  As the Five Tribes that are in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र कषत्रासमातिषु रथप्रोष्ठेषु धारय दिवीवसूर्यं दर्शे |||
verses.transliteration: indra kṣatrāsamātiṣu rathaproṣṭheṣu dhāraya divīvasūryaṃ dṛśe

translations.griffith: Indra, support the princely power of Rathaprosthas matched by none,  Even as the Sun for all to see.

verses.sanskrit: अगस्त्यस्य नद्भ्यः सप्ती युनक्षि रोहिता पणीन नयक्रमीरभि विश्वान राजन्नराधसः |||
verses.transliteration: aghastyasya nadbhyaḥ saptī yunakṣi rohitā paṇīn nyakramīrabhi viśvān rājannarādhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou for Agastya's sister's sons yokest thy pair of ruddy steeds.  Thou troddest niggards under foot, all those, O King, who brought no gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अयं मातायं पितायं जीवातुरागमत इदं तवप्रसर्पणं सुबन्धवेहि निरिहि |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ mātāyaṃ pitāyaṃ jīvāturāghamat idaṃ tavaprasarpaṇaṃ subandhavehi nirihi

translations.griffith: This is the mother, this the sire, this one hath come to be thy life.  What brings thee forth is even this. Now come, Subandhu, get thee forth.

verses.sanskrit: यथा युगं वरत्रया नह्यन्ति धरुणाय कम एवादाधार ते मनो जीवातवे न मर्त्यवे.अथो अरिष्टतातये |||
verses.transliteration: yathā yughaṃ varatrayā nahyanti dharuṇāya kam evādādhāra te mano jīvātave na mṛtyave.atho ariṣṭatātaye

translations.griffith: As with the leather thong they bind the chariot yoke to hold it fast,  So have I held thy spirit fast, held it for life and not for death, held it for thy security.

verses.sanskrit: यथेयं पर्थिवी मही दाधारेमान वनस्पतीन एवादाधार ते मनो जीवातवे न मर्त्यवे.अथो अरिष्टतातये |||
verses.transliteration: yatheyaṃ pṛthivī mahī dādhāremān vanaspatīn evādādhāra te mano jīvātave na mṛtyave.atho ariṣṭatātaye

translations.griffith: Even as this earth, the mighty earth, holds fast the monarchs of the wood.  So have I held thy spirit fast, held it for life and not for death, held it for thy security.

verses.sanskrit: यमादहं वैवस्वतात सुबन्धोर्मन आभरम जीवातवेन मर्त्यवे.अथो अरिष्टतातये |||
verses.transliteration: yamādahaṃ vaivasvatāt subandhormana ābharam jīvātavena mṛtyave.atho ariṣṭatātaye

translations.griffith: Subandlin's spirit I have brought from Yarna, from Vivasvān's Son,  Brought it for life and not for death, yea, brought it for security.

verses.sanskrit: नयग वातो.अव वाति नयक तपति सूर्यः नीचीनमघ्न्यादुहे नयग भवतु ते रपः |||
verses.transliteration: nyagh vāto.ava vāti nyak tapati sūryaḥ nīcīnamaghnyāduhe nyagh bhavatu te rapaḥ

translations.griffith: The wind blows downward from on high, downward the Sun-God sends his heat,  Downward the milch-cow pours her milk: so downward go thy pain and grief.

verses.sanskrit: अयं मे हस्तो भगवानयं मे भगवत्तरः अयं मेविश्वभेषजो.अयं शिवाभिमर्शनः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ me hasto bhaghavānayaṃ me bhaghavattaraḥ ayaṃ meviśvabheṣajo.ayaṃ śivābhimarśanaḥ

translations.griffith: Felicitous is this mine hand, yet more felicitous is this.  This hand contains all healing balms, and this makes whole with gentle touch.

verses.sanskrit: इदमित्था रौद्रं गूर्तवचा बरह्म करत्वा शच्यामन्तराजौ कराणा यदस्य पितरा मंहनेष्ठाः पर्षत्पक्थे अहन्ना सप्त होतॄन |||
verses.transliteration: idamitthā raudraṃ ghūrtavacā brahma kratvā śacyāmantarājau krāṇā yadasya pitarā maṃhaneṣṭhāḥ parṣatpakthe ahannā sapta hotṝn

translations.griffith: THE welcome speaker in the storm of battle uttered with might this prayer to win the Aśvins,  When the most liberal God, for Paktha, rescued his parents, and assailed the seven Hotras.

verses.sanskrit: स इद दानाय दभ्याय वन्वञ्च्यवानः सूदैरमिमीतवेदिम तूर्वयाणो गूर्तवचस्तमः कषोदो न रेत इतूतिसिञ्चत |||
verses.transliteration: sa id dānāya dabhyāya vanvañcyavānaḥ sūdairamimītavedim tūrvayāṇo ghūrtavacastamaḥ kṣodo na reta itaūtisiñcat

translations.griffith: Cyavāna, purposing deceptive presents, with all ingredients, made the altar ready.  Most sweet-voiced Tūrvayāṇa poured oblations like floods of widely fertilizing water.

verses.sanskrit: मनो न येषु हवनेषु तिग्मं विपः शच्या वनुथोद्रवन्ता आ यः शर्यभिस्तुविन्र्म्णोस्याश्रीणीतादिशं गभस्तौ |||
verses.transliteration: mano na yeṣu havaneṣu tighmaṃ vipaḥ śacyā vanuthodravantā ā yaḥ śaryabhistuvinṛmṇoasyāśrīṇītādiśaṃ ghabhastau

translations.griffith: To his oblations, swift as thought, ye hurried, and welcomed eagerly the prayers he offered.  With arrows in his hand the Very Mighty forced from him all obedience of a servant.

verses.sanskrit: कर्ष्णा यद गोष्वरुणीषु सीदद दिवो नपाताश्विनाहुवे वाम वीतं मे यज्ञमा गतं मे अन्नं ववन्वांसानेषमस्म्र्तध्रू |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṣṇā yad ghoṣvaruṇīṣu sīdad divo napātāśvināhuve vām vītaṃ me yajñamā ghataṃ me annaṃ vavanvāṃsāneṣamasmṛtadhrū

translations.griffith: I call on you the Sons of Dyaus, the Aśvins, that a dark cow to my red kine be added.  Enjoy my sacrifice, come to my viands contented, not deceiving expectation. '

verses.sanskrit: परथिष्ट यस्य वीरकर्ममिष्णदनुष्ठितं नु नर्योपौहत पुनस्तदा वर्हति यत कनाया दुहितुरानुभ्र्तमनर्वा |||
verses.transliteration: prathiṣṭa yasya vīrakarmamiṣṇadanuṣṭhitaṃ nu naryoapauhat punastadā vṛhati yat kanāyā duhiturāanubhṛtamanarvā

translations.griffith: Membrum suum virile, quod vrotentum fuerat, mas ille retraxit. Rursus illud quod in juvenem filiam sublatum fuerat, non aggressurus, ad se rerahit.

verses.sanskrit: मध्या यत कर्त्वमभवदभीके कामं कर्ण्वाणेपितरि युवत्याम मनानग रेतो जहतुर्वियन्ता सानौनिषिक्तं सुक्र्तस्य योनौ |||
verses.transliteration: madhyā yat kartvamabhavadabhīke kāmaṃ kṛṇvāṇepitari yuvatyām manānagh reto jahaturviyantā sānauniṣiktaṃ sukṛtasya yonau

translations.griffith: Quum jam in medio connessu, semiperfecto opere, amorem in puellam pater impleverat, ambo discedentes seminis paulum in terrae superficiem sacrorum sede effusum emiserunt.

verses.sanskrit: पिता यत सवां दुहितरमधिष्कन कष्मया रेतःसंजग्मानो नि षिञ्चत सवाध्यो.अजनयन बरह्म देवावास्तोष पतिं वरतपां निरतक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: pitā yat svāṃ duhitaramadhiṣkan kṣmayā retaḥsaṃjaghmāno ni ṣiñcat svādhyo.ajanayan brahma devāvāstoṣ patiṃ vratapāṃ niratakṣan

translations.griffith: Quum pater suam nilam adiverat, cum eā congressus suum semen supra  viram  effudit. Tum Dii benigni precem (brahma)  progenuerunt  , et Vastoshpatim, legum sacrarum custodem, formaverunt.

verses.sanskrit: स ईं वर्षा न फेनमस्यदाजौ समदा परैदपदभ्रचेताः सरत पदा न दक्षिणा पराव्रं न ता नुमे पर्शन्यो जग्र्भ्रे |||
verses.transliteration: sa īṃ vṛṣā na phenamasyadājau smadā paraidapadabhracetāḥ sarat padā na dakṣiṇā parāvṛṃ na tā nume pṛśanyo jaghṛbhre

translations.griffith: Ille tauro similis spumam in certamine jactavit, tunc discedens pusillaximis huc profectus est. Quasi dextro pede claudus processit, "inutiles fuerunt illi mei complexus," ita locutus.

verses.sanskrit: मक्षू न वह्निः परजाया उपब्दिरग्निं न नग्न उपसीददूधः सनितेध्मं सनितोत वाजं स धर्ताजज्ञे सहसा यवीयुत |||
verses.transliteration: makṣū na vahniḥ prajāyā upabdiraghniṃ na naghna upasīdadūdhaḥ sanitedhmaṃ sanitota vājaṃ sa dhartājajñe sahasā yavīyut

translations.griffith: 'The fire, burning the people, does not approach quickly (by day): the naked (  Rākṣasas  approach) not Agni by night; the giver of fuel, and the giver of food, he, the upholder (of the rite), is born, overcoming enemies by his might.'

verses.sanskrit: मक्षू कनायाः सख्यं नवग्वा रतं वदन्त रतयुक्तिमग्मन दविबर्हसो य उप गोपमागुरदक्षिणासो अच्युतादुदुक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: makṣū kanāyāḥ sakhyaṃ navaghvā ṛtaṃ vadanta ṛtayuktimaghman dvibarhaso ya upa ghopamāghuradakṣiṇāso acyutādudukṣan

translations.griffith: Uttering praise to suit the rite Navagvas came speedily to win the damsel's friendship.  They who approached the twice-strong stable's keeper, meedless would milk the rocks that naught had shaken.

verses.sanskrit: मक्षू कनायाः सख्यं नवीयो राधो न रेत रतमित्तुरण्यन शुचि यत ते रेक्ण आयजन्त सबर्दुघायाः पयौस्रियायाः |||
verses.transliteration: makṣū kanāyāḥ sakhyaṃ navīyo rādho na reta ṛtamitturaṇyan śuci yat te rekṇa āyajanta sabardughāyāḥ payausriyāyāḥ

translations.griffith: Swift was new friendship with the maid they quickly accepted it as genuine seed and bounty.  Milk which the cow Sabardughā had yielded was the bright heritage which to thee they offered.

verses.sanskrit: पश्वा यत पश्चा वियुता बुधन्तेति बरवीति वक्तरीरराणः वसोर्वसुत्वा कारवो.अनेहा विश्वं विवेष्टिद्रविणमुप कषु |||
verses.transliteration: paśvā yat paścā viyutā budhanteti bravīti vaktarīrarāṇaḥ vasorvasutvā kāravo.anehā viśvaṃ viveṣṭidraviṇamupa kṣu

translations.griffith: When afterwards they woke and missed the cattle, the speaker thus in joyful mood addressed them:  Matchless are singers through the Vasu's nature; he bringeth them all food and all possessions.

verses.sanskrit: तदिन नवस्य परिषद्वानो अग्मन पुरू सदन्तो नार्षदम्बिभित्सन वि शुष्णस्य संग्रथितमनर्वा विदत्पुरुप्रजातस्य गुहा यत |||
verses.transliteration: tadin nvasya pariṣadvāno aghman purū sadanto nārṣadambibhitsan vi śuṣṇasya saṃghrathitamanarvā vidatpuruprajātasya ghuhā yat

translations.griffith: His followers then who dwelt in sundry places came and desired too slay the son of Nṛṣad.  Resistless foe, be found the hidden treasure of Śuṣṇa multiplied in numerous offspring.

verses.sanskrit: भर्गो ह नामोत यस्य देवाः सवर्ण ये तरिषधस्थेनिषेदुः अग्निर्ह नामोत जातवेदाः शरुधी नो होतरतस्य होताध्रुक |||
verses.transliteration: bhargho ha nāmota yasya devāḥ svarṇa ye triṣadhastheniṣeduḥ aghnirha nāmota jātavedāḥ śrudhī no hotartasya hotādhruk

translations.griffith: Thou, called Effulgence, in whose threefold dwelling, as in the light of heaven, the Gods are sitting,  Thou who art called Agni or Jātavedas, Priest, hear us, guileless Priest of holy worship.

verses.sanskrit: उत तया मे रौद्रावर्चिमन्ता नासत्याविन्द्र गूर्तयेयजध्यै मनुष्वद वर्क्तबर्हिषे रराणा मन्दूहितप्रयसा विक्षु यज्यू |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyā me raudrāvarcimantā nāsatyāvindra ghūrtayeyajadhyai manuṣvad vṛktabarhiṣe rarāṇā mandūhitaprayasā vikṣu yajyū

translations.griffith: And, Indra, bring, that I may laud and serve them, those Two resplendent glorious Nāsatyas,  Blithe, bounteous, man-like, to the sacrificer, honoured among our men with offered viands.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सतुतो राजा वन्दि वेधा अपश व विप्रस्तरतिस्वसेतुः स कक्षीवन्तं रेजयत सो अग्निं नेमिं नचक्रमर्वतो रघुद्रु |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ stuto rājā vandi vedhā apaś va viprastaratisvasetuḥ sa kakṣīvantaṃ rejayat so aghniṃ nemiṃ nacakramarvato raghudru

translations.griffith: This King is praised and honoured as Ordainer: himself the bridge, the Sage speeds o’er the waters.  He hath stirred up Kakṣīvān, stirred up Agni, as the steed's swift wheel drives the felly onward.

verses.sanskrit: स दविबन्धुर्वैतरणो यष्टा सबर्धुं धेनुमस्वन्दुहध्यै सं यन मित्रावरुणा वर्ञ्ज उक्थैर्ज्येष्ठेभिरर्यमणं वरूथैः |||
verses.transliteration: sa dvibandhurvaitaraṇo yaṣṭā sabardhuṃ dhenumasvanduhadhyai saṃ yan mitrāvaruṇā vṛñja ukthairjyeṣṭhebhiraryamaṇaṃ varūthaiḥ

translations.griffith: Vaitarana, doubly kinsman, sacrificer, shall milk the cow who ne’er hath calved, Sabardhu,  When I encompass Varuṇa and Mitra with lauds, and Aryaman in safest shelter.

verses.sanskrit: तद्बन्धुः सूरिर्दिवि ते धियन्धा नाभानेदिष्ठो रपतिप्र वेनन सा नो नाभिः परमास्य वा घाहं तत्पश्चा कतिथश्चिदास |||
verses.transliteration: tadbandhuḥ sūrirdivi te dhiyandhā nābhānediṣṭho rapatipra venan sā no nābhiḥ paramāsya vā ghāhaṃ tatpaścā katithaścidāsa

translations.griffith: Their kin, the Prince in heaven, thy nearest kinsman, turning his thought to thee thus speaks in kindness:  This is our highest bond: I am his offspring. How many others came ere I succeeded?

verses.sanskrit: इयं मे नाभिरिह मे सधस्थमिमे मे देवा अयमस्मिसर्वः दविजा अह परथमजा रतस्येदं धेनुरदुहज्जायमाना |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ me nābhiriha me sadhasthamime me devā ayamasmisarvaḥ dvijā aha prathamajā ṛtasyedaṃ dhenuraduhajjāyamānā

translations.griffith: Here is my kinship, here the place I dwell in: these are my Gods; I in full strength am present.  Twice-born am I, the first-born Son of Order: the Cow milked this when first she had her being.

verses.sanskrit: अधासु मन्द्रो अरतिर्विभावाव सयति दविवर्तनिर्वनेषाट ऊर्ध्वा यच्छ्रेणिर्न शिशुर्दन मक्षू सथिरंशेव्र्धं सूत माता |||
verses.transliteration: adhāsu mandro aratirvibhāvāva syati dvivartanirvaneṣāṭ ūrdhvā yacchreṇirna śiśurdan makṣū sthiraṃśevṛdhaṃ sūta mātā

translations.griffith: So mid these tribes he rests, the friendly envoy, borne on two paths, refulgent Lord of fuel.  When, like a line, the Babe springs up erectly, his Mother straight hath borne him strong to bless us.

verses.sanskrit: अधा गाव उपमातिं कनाया अनु शवान्तस्य कस्य चित्परेयुः शरुधि तवं सुद्रविणो नस्त्वं याळ आश्वघ्नस्यववर्धे सून्र्ताभिः |||
verses.transliteration: adhā ghāva upamātiṃ kanāyā anu śvāntasya kasya citpareyuḥ śrudhi tvaṃ sudraviṇo nastvaṃ yāḷ āśvaghnasyavavṛdhe sūnṛtābhiḥ

translations.griffith: Then went the milch-kine forth to please the damsel, and for the good of every man that liveth.  Hear us, O wealthy Lord; begin our worship. Thou hast grown mighty through Āśvaghna's virtues.

verses.sanskrit: अध तवमिन्द्र विद्ध्यस्मान महो राये नर्पते वज्रबाहुः रक्षा च नो मघोनह पाहि सूरीननेहसस्ते हरिवोभिष्टौ |||
verses.transliteration: adha tvamindra viddhyasmān maho rāye nṛpate vajrabāhuḥ rakṣā ca no maghonah pāhi sūrīnanehasaste harivoabhiṣṭau

translations.griffith: And take thou notice of us also, Indra, for ample riches, King whose arm wields thunder!  Protect our wealthy nobles, guard our princes unmenaced near thee, Lord of Tawny Coursers.

verses.sanskrit: अध यद राजाना गविष्टौ सरत सरण्युः कारवेजरण्युः विप्रः परेष्ठः स हयेषां बभूव परा चवक्षदुत पर्षदेनान |||
verses.transliteration: adha yad rājānā ghaviṣṭau sarat saraṇyuḥ kāravejaraṇyuḥ vipraḥ preṣṭhaḥ sa hyeṣāṃ babhūva parā cavakṣaduta parṣadenān

translations.griffith: When he goes forth, ye Pair of Kings, for booty, speeding to war and praise to please the singer,—  I was the dearest sage of those about him,—let him lead these away and bring them safely.

verses.sanskrit: अधा नवस्य जेन्यस्य पुष्टौ वर्था रेभन्त ईमहे तदूनु सरण्युरस्य सूनुरश्वो विप्रश्चासि शरवसश्चसातौ |||
verses.transliteration: adhā nvasya jenyasya puṣṭau vṛthā rebhanta īmahe tadūnu saraṇyurasya sūnuraśvo vipraścāsi śravasaścasātau

translations.griffith: Now for this noble man's support and comfort, singing with easy voice we thus implore thee:  Impetuous be his son and fleet his courser: and may I be his priest to win him glory.

verses.sanskrit: युवोर्यदि सख्यायास्मे शर्धाय सतोमं जुजुषे नमस्वान्विश्वत्र यस्मिन्ना गिरः समीचीः पूर्वीव गतूर्दाशत सून्र्तायै ||
verses.transliteration: yuvoryadi sakhyāyāsme śardhāya stomaṃ jujuṣe namasvānviśvatra yasminnā ghiraḥ samīcīḥ pūrvīva ghatūrdāśat sūnṛtāyai

translations.griffith: If, for our strength, the priest with adoration to win your friendship made the laud accepted,  That laud shall be a branching road to virtue for every one to whom the songs are suited.

verses.sanskrit: स गर्णानो अद्भिर्देववानिति सुबन्धुर्नमसा सूक्तैः वर्धदुक्थैर्वचोभिरा हि नूनं वयध्वैति पयसौस्रियायाः |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghṛṇāno adbhirdevavāniti subandhurnamasā sūktaiḥ vardhadukthairvacobhirā hi nūnaṃ vyadhvaiti payasausriyāyāḥ

translations.griffith: Glorified thus, with holy hymns and homage:—Of noble race, with Waters, God-attended—  May he enrich us for our prayers and praises: now can the cow be milked; the path is open.

verses.sanskrit: त ऊ षु णो महो यजत्रा भूत देवास ऊतये सजोषाः ये वाजाननयता वियन्तो ये सथा निचेतारो अमूराः |||
verses.transliteration: ta ū ṣu ṇo maho yajatrā bhūta devāsa ūtaye sajoṣāḥ ye vājānanayatā viyanto ye sthā nicetāro amūrāḥ

translations.griffith: Be to us, then, ye Gods who merit worship, be ye of one accord our strong protection,  Who went on various ways and brought us vigour, ye who are undeceivable explorers.

verses.sanskrit: ये यज्ञेन दक्षिणया समक्ता इन्द्रस्य सख्यमम्र्तत्वमानश तेभ्यो भद्रमङगिरसो वो अस्तु परति गर्भ्णीतमानवं सुमेधसः |||
verses.transliteration: ye yajñena dakṣiṇayā samaktā indrasya sakhyamamṛtatvamānaśa tebhyo bhadramaṅghiraso vo astu prati ghṛbhṇītamānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ

translations.griffith: YE, who, adorned with guerdon through the sacrifice, have won you Indra's friendship and eternal life,  Even to you be happiness, Aṅgirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

verses.sanskrit: य उदाजन पितरो गोमयं वस्व रतेनाभिन्दन परिवत्सरेवलम दीर्घायुत्वमङगिरसो वो अस्तु परति गर्भ्णीतमानवं सुमेधसः |||
verses.transliteration: ya udājan pitaro ghomayaṃ vasv ṛtenābhindan parivatsarevalam dīrghāyutvamaṅghiraso vo astu prati ghṛbhṇītamānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ

translations.griffith: The Fathers, who drave forth the wealth in cattle, have in the year's courses cleft Vala by Eternal Law:  A lengthened life be yours, O ye Aṅgirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

verses.sanskrit: य रतेन सूर्यमारोहयन दिव्यप्रथयन पर्थिवीं मातरंवि सुप्रजास्त्वमङगिरसो वो अस्तु परति गर्भ्णीत मानवंसुमेधसः |||
verses.transliteration: ya ṛtena sūryamārohayan divyaprathayan pṛthivīṃ mātaraṃvi suprajāstvamaṅghiraso vo astu prati ghṛbhṇīta mānavaṃsumedhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye raised the Sun to heaven by everlasting Law, and spread broad earth, the Mother, out on every side.  Fair wealth of progeny be yours, Aṅgirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

verses.sanskrit: अयं नाभा वदति वल्गु वो गर्हे देवपुत्रा रषयस्तच्छ्र्णोतन सुब्रह्मण्यमङगिरसो वो अस्तु परति गर्भ्णीतमानवं सुमेधसः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ nābhā vadati valghu vo ghṛhe devaputrā ṛṣayastacchṛṇotana subrahmaṇyamaṅghiraso vo astu prati ghṛbhṇītamānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ

translations.griffith: This kinsman in your dwellingplace speaks pleasant words: give car to this, ye Ṛṣis, children of the Gods.  High Brahman dignity be yours, Aṅgirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

verses.sanskrit: विरूपास इद रषयस्त इद गम्भीरवेपसः ते अङगिरसःसूनवस्ते अग्नेः परि जज्ञिरे |||
verses.transliteration: virūpāsa id ṛṣayasta id ghambhīravepasaḥ te aṅghirasaḥsūnavaste aghneḥ pari jajñire

translations.griffith: Distinguished by their varied form, these Ṛṣis have been deeply moved.  These are the sons of Aṅgirases: from Agni have they sprung to life.

verses.sanskrit: ये अग्नेः परि जज्ञिरे विरूपासो दिवस परि नवग्वो नुदशग्वो अङगिरस्तमो सचा देवेषु मंअते |||
verses.transliteration: ye aghneḥ pari jajñire virūpāso divas pari navaghvo nudaśaghvo aṅghirastamo sacā deveṣu maṃate

translations.griffith: Distinguished by their varied form, they sprang from Agni, from the sky.  Navagva and Daśagva, noblest Aṅgiras, he giveth bounty with the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रेण युजा निः सर्जन्त वाघतो वरजं गोमन्तमश्विनम सहस्रं मे ददतो अष्टकर्ण्यः शरवो देवेष्वक्रत |||
verses.transliteration: indreṇa yujā niḥ sṛjanta vāghato vrajaṃ ghomantamaśvinam sahasraṃ me dadato aṣṭakarṇyaḥ śravo deveṣvakrata

translations.griffith: With Indra for associate the priests have cleared the stable full of steeds and kine,  Giving to me a thousand with their eightmarked cars, they gained renown among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: पर नूनं जायतामयं मनुस्तोक्मेव रोहतु यः सहस्रंशताश्वं सद्यो दानाय मंहते |||
verses.transliteration: pra nūnaṃ jāyatāmayaṃ manustokmeva rohatu yaḥ sahasraṃśatāśvaṃ sadyo dānāya maṃhate

translations.griffith: May this man's sons be multiplied; like springing corn may Manu grow,  Who gives at once in bounteous gift a thousand kine, a hundred steeds.

verses.sanskrit: न तमश्नोति कश्चन दिव इव सान्वारभम सावर्ण्यस्य दक्षिणा वि सिन्धुरिव पप्रथे |||
verses.transliteration: na tamaśnoti kaścana diva iva sānvārabham sāvarṇyasya dakṣiṇā vi sindhuriva paprathe

translations.griffith: No one attains to him, as though a man would grasp the heights of heaven.  Savarnya's sacrificial meed hath broadened like an ample flood.

verses.sanskrit: उत दासा परिविषे समद्दिष्टी गोपरीणसा यदुस्तुर्वश्च मामहे |||
verses.transliteration: uta dāsā pariviṣe smaddiṣṭī ghoparīṇasā yadusturvaśca māmahe

translations.griffith: Yadu and Turva, too, have given two Dāsas, well-disposed, to serve,  Together with great store of kine.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रदा गरामणीर्मा रिषन मनुः सूर्येणास्ययतमानैतु दक्षिणा सावर्णेर्देवाः पर तिरन्त्वायुर्यस्मिन्नश्रान्ता असनाम वाजम |||
verses.transliteration: sahasradā ghrāmaṇīrmā riṣan manuḥ sūryeṇāsyayatamānaitu dakṣiṇā sāvarṇerdevāḥ pra tirantvāyuryasminnaśrāntā asanāma vājam

translations.griffith: Blest be the hamlet's chief, most liberal Manu, and may his bounty rival that of Sūrya.  May the God let Ssvarni's life be leng  thened, with whom, unwearied, we have lived and prospered.

verses.sanskrit: परावतो ये दिधिषन्त आप्यं मनुप्रीतासो जनिमाविवस्वतः ययातेर्ये नहुष्यस्य बर्हिषि देवा आसते तेधि बरुवन्तु नः |||
verses.transliteration: parāvato ye didhiṣanta āpyaṃ manuprītāso janimāvivasvataḥ yayāterye nahuṣyasya barhiṣi devā āsate teadhi bruvantu naḥ

translations.griffith: MAY they who would assume kinship from far away, Vivasvān's generations, dearly loved of men,  Even the Gods who sit upon the sacred grass of Nahuṣa's son Yayāti, bless and comfort us.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वा हि वो नमस्यानि वन्द्या नामानि देवा उत यज्ञियानिवः ये सथ जाता अदितेरब्ध्यस परि ये पर्थिव्यास्तेम इह शरुता हवम |||
verses.transliteration: viśvā hi vo namasyāni vandyā nāmāni devā uta yajñiyānivaḥ ye stha jātā aditerabdhyas pari ye pṛthivyāstema iha śrutā havam

translations.griffith: For worthy of obeisance, Gods, are all your names, worthy of adoration and of sacrifice.  Ye who were born from waters, and from Aditi, and from the earth, do ye here listen to my call.

verses.sanskrit: येभ्यो माता मधुमत पिन्वते पयः पीयूषं दयौरदितिरद्रिबर्हाः उक्थशुष्मान वर्षभरान सवप्नसस्तानादित्याननु मदा सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: yebhyo mātā madhumat pinvate payaḥ pīyūṣaṃ dyauraditiradribarhāḥ ukthaśuṣmān vṛṣabharān svapnasastānādityānanu madā svastaye

translations.griffith: I will rejoice in these Ādityas for my weal, for whom the Mother pours forth water rich in balm,  And Dyaus the Infinite, firm as a rock, sweet milk,—Gods active, strong through lauds, whose might the Bull upholds.

verses.sanskrit: नर्चक्षसो अनिमिषन्तो अर्हणा बर्हद देवासो अम्र्तत्वमानशुः जयोतीरथा अहिमाया अनागसो दिवो वर्ष्माणंवसते सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: nṛcakṣaso animiṣanto arhaṇā bṛhad devāso amṛtatvamānaśuḥ jyotīrathā ahimāyā anāghaso divo varṣmāṇaṃvasate svastaye

translations.griffith: Looking on men, ne’er slumbering, they by their deserts attained as Gods to lofty immortality.  Borne on refulgent cars, sinless, with serpents' powers, they robe them, for our welfare, in the height of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सम्राजो ये सुव्र्धो यज्ञमाययुरपरिह्व्र्ता दधिरे दिविक्षयम ताना विवास नमसा सुव्र्क्तिभिर्महो आदित्यानदितिं सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: samrājo ye suvṛdho yajñamāyayuraparihvṛtā dadhire divikṣayam tānā vivāsa namasā suvṛktibhirmaho ādityānaditiṃ svastaye

translations.griffith: Great Kings who bless us, who have come to sacrifice, who, ne’er assailed, have set their mansion in the sky,—  These I invite with adoration and with hymns, mighty Ādityas, Aditi, for happiness.

verses.sanskrit: को व सतोमं राधति यं जुजोषथ विश्वे देवासो मनुषोयति षठन को वो.अध्वरं तुविजाता अरं करद यो नःपर्षदत्यंहः सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: ko va stomaṃ rādhati yaṃ jujoṣatha viśve devāso manuṣoyati ṣṭhana ko vo.adhvaraṃ tuvijātā araṃ karad yo naḥparṣadatyaṃhaḥ svastaye

translations.griffith: Who offereth to you the laud that ye accept, O ye All-Gods of Manu, many as ye are?  Who, Mighty Ones, will prepare for you the sacrifice to bear us over trouble to felicity?

verses.sanskrit: येभ्यो होत्रां परथमामायेजे मनुः समिद्धाग्निर्मनसासप्त होत्र्भिः त आदित्या अभयं शर्म यछत सुगा नःकर्त सुपथा सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: yebhyo hotrāṃ prathamāmāyeje manuḥ samiddhāghnirmanasāsapta hotṛbhiḥ ta ādityā abhayaṃ śarma yachata sughā naḥkarta supathā svastaye

translations.griffith: Ye to whom Manu, by seven priests, with kindled fire, offered the first oblation with his heart and soul,  Vouchsafe us, ye Ādityas, sheitcr free from fear, and make us good and easy paths to happiness.

verses.sanskrit: य ईशिरे भुवनस्य परचेतसो विश्वस्य सथातुर्जगतश्चमन्तवः ते नः कर्तादक्र्तादेनसस पर्यद्या देवासःपिप्र्ता सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: ya īśire bhuvanasya pracetaso viśvasya sthāturjaghataścamantavaḥ te naḥ kṛtādakṛtādenasas paryadyā devāsaḥpipṛtā svastaye

translations.griffith: Wise Deities, who have dominion o’er the world, ye thinkers over all that moves not and that moves,  Save us from uncommitted and committed sin, preserve us from all sin to-day for happiness.

verses.sanskrit: भरेष्विन्द्रं सुहवं हवामहे.अंहोमुचं सुक्र्तन्दैव्यं जनम अग्निं मित्रं वरुणं सातये भगन्द्यावाप्र्थिवी मरुतः सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: bhareṣvindraṃ suhavaṃ havāmahe.aṃhomucaṃ sukṛtandaivyaṃ janam aghniṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sātaye bhaghandyāvāpṛthivī marutaḥ svastaye

translations.griffith: In battles we invoke Indra still swift to hear, and all the holy Host of Heaven who banish grief,  Agni, Mitra, and Varuṇa that we may gain, Dyays, Bhaga, Maruts, Prthivi for happiness:

verses.sanskrit: सुत्रामाणं पर्थिवीं दयामनेहसं सुशर्माणमदितिंसुप्रणीतिम दैवीं नावं सवरित्रामनागसमस्रवन्तीमा रुहेमा सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: sutrāmāṇaṃ pṛthivīṃ dyāmanehasaṃ suśarmāṇamaditiṃsupraṇītim daivīṃ nāvaṃ svaritrāmanāghasamasravantīmā ruhemā svastaye

translations.griffith: Mightily-saving Earth, incomparable Heaven the good guide Aditi who gives secure defence  The well-oared heavenly Ship that lets no waters in, free from defect, will we ascend for happiness.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे यजत्रा अधि वोचतोतये तरायध्वं नो दुरेवायाभिह्रुतः सत्यया वो देवहूत्या हुवेम शर्ण्वतो देवावसे सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: viśve yajatrā adhi vocatotaye trāyadhvaṃ no durevāyāabhihrutaḥ satyayā vo devahūtyā huvema śṛṇvato devāavase svastaye

translations.griffith: Bless us, all Holy Ones, that we may have your help, guard and protect us from malignant injury.  With fruitful invocation may we call on you, Gods, who give ear to us for grace, for happiness.

verses.sanskrit: अपामीवामप विश्वामनाहुतिमपारातिं दुर्विदत्रामघायतः आरे देवा दवेषो अस्मद युयोतनोरु णः शर्मयछता सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: apāmīvāmapa viśvāmanāhutimapārātiṃ durvidatrāmaghāyataḥ āre devā dveṣo asmad yuyotanoru ṇaḥ śarmayachatā svastaye

translations.griffith: Keep all disease afar and sordid sacrifice, keep off the wicked man's malicious enmity.  Keep far away from us all hatred, O ye Gods, and give us ample shelter for our happiness.

verses.sanskrit: अरिष्टः स मर्तो विश्व एधते पर परजाभिर्जायतेधर्मणस परि यमादित्यासो नयथा सुनीतिभिरतिविश्वानि दुरिता सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: ariṣṭaḥ sa marto viśva edhate pra prajābhirjāyatedharmaṇas pari yamādityāso nayathā sunītibhirativiśvāni duritā svastaye

translations.griffith: Untouched by any evil, every mortal thrives, and, following the Law, spreads in his progeny.  Whom ye with your good guidance, O Ādityas, lead safely through all his pain and grief to happiness.

verses.sanskrit: यं देवासो.अवथ वाजसातौ यं शूरसाता मरुतो हितेधने परातर्यावाणं रथमिन्द्र सानसिमरिष्यन्तमारुहेमा सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ devāso.avatha vājasātau yaṃ śūrasātā maruto hitedhane prātaryāvāṇaṃ rathamindra sānasimariṣyantamāruhemā svastaye

translations.griffith: That which ye guard and grace in battle, O ye Gods, ye Maruts, where the prize is wealth, where heroes win,  That conquering Car, O Indra, that sets forth at dawn, that never breaks, may we ascend for happiness.

verses.sanskrit: सवस्ति नः पथ्यासु धन्वसु सवस्त्यप्सु वर्जने सवर्वति सवस्ति नः पुत्रक्र्थेषु योनिषु सवस्ति राये मरुतो दधातन |||
verses.transliteration: svasti naḥ pathyāsu dhanvasu svastyapsu vṛjane svarvati svasti naḥ putrakṛtheṣu yoniṣu svasti rāye maruto dadhātana

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe us blessing in our paths and desert tracts, blessing in waters and in battle, for the light;  Blessing upon the wombs that bring male children forth, and blessing, O ye Maruts, for the gain of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: सवस्तिरिद धि परपथे शरेष्ठा रेक्णस्वत्यभि यावाममेति सा नो अमा सो अरणे नि पातु सवावेशा भवतुदेवगोपा |||
verses.transliteration: svastirid dhi prapathe śreṣṭhā rekṇasvatyabhi yāvāmameti sā no amā so araṇe ni pātu svāveśā bhavatudevaghopā

translations.griffith: The noblest Svasti with abundant riches, who comes to what is good by distant pathway,—  May she at home and far away preserve us, and dwell with us under the Gods’ protection

verses.sanskrit: एवा पलतेः सूनुरवीव्र्धद वो विश्व आदित्या अदितेमनीषी ईशानासो नरो अमर्त्येनास्तावि जनो दिव्योगयेन |||
verses.transliteration: evā plateḥ sūnuravīvṛdhad vo viśva ādityā aditemanīṣī īśānāso naro amartyenāstāvi jano divyoghayena

translations.griffith: Thus hatb the thoughtful sage, the son of Plati, praised you, O Aditi and all Ādityas,  Men are made rich by those who are Immortal: the Heavenly Folk have been extolled by Gaya.

verses.sanskrit: कथा देवानां कतमस्य यामनि सुमन्तु नाम शर्ण्वताम्मनामहे को मर्ळाति कतमो नो मयस करत कतम ऊती अभ्या ववर्तति |||
verses.transliteration: kathā devānāṃ katamasya yāmani sumantu nāma śṛṇvatāmmanāmahe ko mṛḷāti katamo no mayas karat katama ūtī abhyā vavartati

translations.griffith: WHAT God, of those who hear, is he whose well-praised name we may record in this our sacrifice; and how?  Who will be gracious? Who of many give us bliss? Who out of all the Host will come to lend us aid?

verses.sanskrit: करतूयन्ति करतवो हर्त्सु धीतयो वेनन्ति वेनाः पतयन्त्या दिशः न मर्डिता विद्यते अन्य एभ्यो देवेषु मे अधिकामा अयंसत |||
verses.transliteration: kratūyanti kratavo hṛtsu dhītayo venanti venāḥ patayantyā diśaḥ na marḍitā vidyate anya ebhyo deveṣu me adhikāmā ayaṃsata

translations.griffith: The will and thoughts within my breast exert their power: they yearn with love, and fly to all the regions round.  None other comforter is found save only these: my longings and my hopes are fixt upon the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: नरा वा शंसं पूषणमगोह्यमग्निं देवेद्धमभ्यर्चसे गिरा सूर्यामासा चन्द्रमसा यमं दिवि तरितंवातमुषसमक्तुमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: narā vā śaṃsaṃ pūṣaṇamaghohyamaghniṃ deveddhamabhyarcase ghirā sūryāmāsā candramasā yamaṃ divi tritaṃvātamuṣasamaktumaśvinā

translations.griffith: To Narāśaṁsa and to Pūṣan I sing forth, unconcealable Agni kindied by the Gods.  To Sun and Moon, two Moons, to Yama in the heaven, to Trita, Vāta, Dawn, Night, and the Atvins Twain.

verses.sanskrit: कथा कविस्तुवीरवान कया गिरा बर्हस्पतिर्वाव्र्धतेसुव्र्क्तिभिः अज एकपात सुहवेभिरकवभिरहिः शर्णोतुबुध्न्यो हवीमनि |||
verses.transliteration: kathā kavistuvīravān kayā ghirā bṛhaspatirvāvṛdhatesuvṛktibhiḥ aja ekapāt suhavebhirkvabhirahiḥ śṛṇotubudhnyo havīmani

translations.griffith: How is the Sage extolled whom the loud singers praise? What voice, what hymn is used to laud Bṛhaspati?  May Aja-Ekapād with Rkvans swift to hear, and Ahi of the Deep listen unto our call.

verses.sanskrit: दक्षस्य वादिते जन्मनि वरते राजाना मित्रावरुणाविवाससि अतूर्तपन्थाः पुरुरथो अर्यमा सप्तहोताविषुरूपेषु जन्मसु |||
verses.transliteration: dakṣasya vādite janmani vrate rājānā mitrāvaruṇāvivāsasi atūrtapanthāḥ pururatho aryamā saptahotāviṣurūpeṣu janmasu

translations.griffith: Aditi, to the birth of Dakṣa and the vow thou summonest the Kings Mitra and Varuṇa.  With course unchecked, with many chariots Aryaman comes with the seven priests to tribes of varied sort.

verses.sanskrit: ते नो अर्वन्तो हवनश्रुतो हवं विश्वे शर्ण्वन्तु वाजिनोमितद्रवः सहस्रसा मेधसाताविव तमना महो येधनं समिथेषु जभ्रिरे |||
verses.transliteration: te no arvanto havanaśruto havaṃ viśve śṛṇvantu vājinomitadravaḥ sahasrasā medhasātāviva tmanā maho yedhanaṃ samitheṣu jabhrire

translations.griffith: May all those vigorous Coursers listen to our cry, hearers of invocation, speeding on their way;  Winners of thousands where the priestly meed is won, who gather of themselves great wealth in every race.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो वायुं रथयुजं पुरन्धिं सतोमैः कर्णुध्वंसख्याय पूषणम ते हि देवस्य सवितुः सवीमनिक्रतुं सचन्ते सचितः सचेतसः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo vāyuṃ rathayujaṃ purandhiṃ stomaiḥ kṛṇudhvaṃsakhyāya pūṣaṇam te hi devasya savituḥ savīmanikratuṃ sacante sacitaḥ sacetasaḥ

translations.griffith: Bring ye Purandbi, bring Vāyu who yokes his steeds, for friendship bring ye Pūṣan with your songs of praise:  They with one mind, one thought attend the sacrifice, urged by the favouring aid of Savitar the God.

verses.sanskrit: तरिः सप्त सस्रा नद्यो महीरपो वनस्पतीन पर्वतानग्निमूतये कर्शानुमस्तॄन तिष्यं सधस्थ आ रुद्रंरुद्रेषु रुद्रियं हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: triḥ sapta sasrā nadyo mahīrapo vanaspatīn parvatānaghnimūtaye kṛśānumastṝn tiṣyaṃ sadhastha ā rudraṃrudreṣu rudriyaṃ havāmahe

translations.griffith: The thrice-seven wandering Rivers, yea, the mighty floods, the forest trees, the mountains, Agni to our aid,  Kṛśānu, Tisya, archers to our gathering-place, and Rudra strong amid the Rudras we invoke.

verses.sanskrit: सरस्वती सरयुः सिन्धुरूर्मिभिर्महो महीरवसा यन्तुवक्षणीः देवीरापो मातरः सूदयित्न्वो घर्तवत पयोमधुमन नो अर्चत |||
verses.transliteration: sarasvatī sarayuḥ sindhurūrmibhirmaho mahīravasā yantuvakṣaṇīḥ devīrāpo mātaraḥ sūdayitnvo ghṛtavat payomadhuman no arcata

translations.griffith: Let the great Streams come hither with their mighty help, Sindhu, Sarasvatī, and Sarayu with waves.  Ye Goddess Floods, ye Mothers, animating all, promise us water rich in fatness and in balm.

verses.sanskrit: उत माता बर्हद्दिवा शर्णोतु नस्त्वष्टा देवेभिर्जनिभिःपिता वचः रभुक्षा वाजो रथस्पतिर्भगो रण्वःशण्सः शशमानस्य पातु नः |||
verses.transliteration: uta mātā bṛhaddivā śṛṇotu nastvaṣṭā devebhirjanibhiḥpitā vacaḥ ṛbhukṣā vājo rathaspatirbhagho raṇvaḥśaṇsaḥ śaśamānasya pātu naḥ

translations.griffith: And let Brhaddiva, the Mother, hear our call, and Tvaṣṭar, Father, with the Goddesses and Dames.  Ṛbhukṣan, Vāja, Bhaga, and Rathaspati, and the sweet speech of him who labours guard us well!

verses.sanskrit: रण्वः सन्द्र्ष्टौ पितुमानिव कषयो भद्रा रुद्राणाम्मरुतामुपस्तुतिः गोभिः षयाम यशसो जनेष्वा सदादेवास इळया सचेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: raṇvaḥ sandṛṣṭau pitumāniva kṣayo bhadrā rudrāṇāmmarutāmupastutiḥ ghobhiḥ ṣyāma yaśaso janeṣvā sadādevāsa iḷayā sacemahi

translations.griffith: Pleasant to look on as a dwelling rich in food is the blest favour of the Maruts, Rudra's Sons.  May we be famed among the folk for wealth in kine. and ever come to you, ye Gods, with sacred food.

verses.sanskrit: यां मे धियं मरुत इन्द्र देवा अददात वरुण मित्र यूयम तां पीपयत पयसेव धेनुं कुविद गिरो अधि रथेवहाथ |||
verses.transliteration: yāṃ me dhiyaṃ maruta indra devā adadāta varuṇa mitra yūyam tāṃ pīpayata payaseva dhenuṃ kuvid ghiro adhi rathevahātha

translations.griffith: The thought which ye, O Maruts, Indra and ye Gods have given to me, and ye, Mitra and Varuṇa,—  Cause this to grow and swell like a milchcow with milk. Will ye not bear away my songs upon your car?

verses.sanskrit: कुविदङग परति यथा चिदस्य नः सजात्यस्य मरुतोबुबोधथ नाभा यत्र परथमं संनशामहे तत्रजामित्वमदितिर्दधातु नः |||
verses.transliteration: kuvidaṅgha prati yathā cidasya naḥ sajātyasya marutobubodhatha nābhā yatra prathamaṃ saṃnaśāmahe tatrajāmitvamaditirdadhātu naḥ

translations.griffith: O Maruts, do ye never, never recollect and call again to mind this our relationship?  When next we meet together at the central point, even there shall Aditi confirm our brotherhood.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि दयावाप्र्थिवी मातरा मही देवी देवाञ जन्मनायज्ञिये इतः उभे बिभ्र्त उभयं भरीमभिः पुरूरेतांसि पित्र्भिश्च सिञ्चतः |||
verses.transliteration: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī mātarā mahī devī devāñ janmanāyajñiye itaḥ ubhe bibhṛta ubhayaṃ bharīmabhiḥ purūretāṃsi pitṛbhiśca siñcataḥ

translations.griffith: The Mothers, Heaven and Earth, those mighty Goddesses, worthy of sacrifice, ecune with the race of Gods.  These Two with their support uphold both Gods and men, and with the Fathers pour the copious genial stream.

verses.sanskrit: वि षा होत्रा विश्वमश्नोति वार्यं बर्हस्पतिररमतिःपनीयसी गरावा यत्र मधुषुदुच्यते बर्हदवीवशन्तमतिभिर्मनीषिणः |||
verses.transliteration: vi ṣā hotrā viśvamaśnoti vāryaṃ bṛhaspatiraramatiḥpanīyasī ghrāvā yatra madhuṣuducyate bṛhadavīvaśantamatibhirmanīṣiṇaḥ

translations.griffith: This invocation wins all good that we desire Bṛhaspati, highly-praised Aramati, are here,  Even where the stone that presses meath rings loudly out, and where the sages make their voices heard with hymns.

verses.sanskrit: एवा कविस्तुवीरवान रतज्ञा दरविणस्युर्द्रविणसश्चकानः उक्थेभिरत्र मतिभिश्च विप्रो.अपीपयद गयोदिव्यानि जन्म |||
verses.transliteration: evā kavistuvīravān ṛtajñā draviṇasyurdraviṇasaścakānaḥ ukthebhiratra matibhiśca vipro.apīpayad ghayodivyāni janma

translations.griffith: Thus hath the sage, skilled in loud singers' duties, desiring riches, yearning after treasure,  Gaya, the priestly singer, with his praises and hymns contented the Celestial people.

verses.sanskrit: एवा पलतेः सूनुर... ||
verses.transliteration: evā plateḥ sūnur...

translations.griffith: Thus hath the thoughtful sage the son of Plati, praised you, O Aaiti and all Ādityas.  Men are made rich by those who are Immortal: the Heavenly Folk have been extolled by Gaya.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निरिन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा वायुः पूषा सरस्वतीसजोषसः आदित्या विष्णुर्मरुतः सवर्ब्र्हत सोमो रुद्रोदितिर्ब्रह्मणस पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirindro varuṇo mitro aryamā vāyuḥ pūṣā sarasvatīsajoṣasaḥ ādityā viṣṇurmarutaḥ svarbṛhat somo rudroaditirbrahmaṇas patiḥ

translations.griffith: MAY Agni, Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa consent, Aryaman, Vāyu, Pūṣan, and Sarasvatī,  Ādityas, Maruts, Viṣṇu, Soma, lofty Sky, Rudra and Aditi, and Brahmaṇaspati.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहत्येषु सत्पती मिथो हिन्वाना तन्वासमोकसा अन्तरिक्षं मह्या पप्रुरोजसा सोमो घर्तश्रीर्महिमानमीरयन |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī vṛtrahatyeṣu satpatī mitho hinvānā tanvāsamokasā antarikṣaṃ mahyā paprurojasā somo ghṛtaśrīrmahimānamīrayan

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, Hero-lords when Vṛtra fell, dwelling together, speeding emulously on,  And Soma blent with oil, putting his greatness forth, have with their power filled full the mighty firmament.

verses.sanskrit: तेषां हि मह्ना महतामनर्वणां सतोमानियर्म्य्र्तज्ञा रताव्र्धाम ये अप्सवमर्णवं चित्रराधसस्तेनो रासन्तां महये सुमित्र्याः |||
verses.transliteration: teṣāṃ hi mahnā mahatāmanarvaṇāṃ stomāniyarmyṛtajñā ṛtāvṛdhām ye apsavamarṇavaṃ citrarādhasasteno rāsantāṃ mahaye sumitryāḥ

translations.griffith: Skilled in the Law I lift the hymn of praise to these, Law-strengtheners, unassailed, and great in majesty.  These in their wondrous bounty send the watery sea: may they as kindly Friends send gifts to make us great.

verses.sanskrit: सवर्णरमन्तरिक्षाणि रोचना दयावाभूमी पर्थिवींस्कम्भुरोजसा पर्क्षा इव महयन्तः सुरातयो देवास्तवन्ते मनुषाय सूरयः |||
verses.transliteration: svarṇaramantarikṣāṇi rocanā dyāvābhūmī pṛthivīṃskambhurojasā pṛkṣā iva mahayantaḥ surātayo devāstavante manuṣāya sūrayaḥ

translations.griffith: They with their might have stayed Heaven, Earth, and Prthivi, the Lord of Light, the firmament, -the lustrous spheres.  Even as fleet-foot steeds who make their masters glad, the princely Gods are praised, most bountiful to man.

verses.sanskrit: मित्राय शिक्ष वरुणाय दाशुषे या सम्राजा मनसा नप्रयुछतः ययोर्धाम धर्मणा रोचते बर्हद ययोरुभेरोदसी नाधसी वर्तौ |||
verses.transliteration: mitrāya śikṣa varuṇāya dāśuṣe yā samrājā manasā naprayuchataḥ yayordhāma dharmaṇā rocate bṛhad yayorubherodasī nādhasī vṛtau

translations.griffith: Bring gifts to Mitra and to Varuṇa who, Lords of all, in spirit never fail the worshipper,  Whose statute shines on high through everlasting Law, whose places of sure refuge are the heavens and earth.

verses.sanskrit: या गौर्वर्तनिं पर्येति निष्क्र्तं पयो दुहाना वरतनीरवारतः सा परब्रुवाणा वरुणाय दाशुषे देवेभ्योदाशद धविषा विवस्वते |||
verses.transliteration: yā ghaurvartaniṃ paryeti niṣkṛtaṃ payo duhānā vratanīravārataḥ sā prabruvāṇā varuṇāya dāśuṣe devebhyodāśad dhaviṣā vivasvate

translations.griffith: The cow who yielding milk goes her appointed way hither to us as leader of holy rites,  Speaking aloud to Varuṇa and the worshipper, shall with oblation serve Vivasvān and the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: दिवक्षसो अग्निजिह्वा रताव्र्ध रतस्य योनिं विम्र्शन्त आसते दयां सकभित्व्यप आ चक्रुरोजसा यज्ञं जनित्वीतन्वी नि माम्र्जुः |||
verses.transliteration: divakṣaso aghnijihvā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtasya yoniṃ vimṛśanta āsate dyāṃ skabhitvyapa ā cakrurojasā yajñaṃ janitvītanvī ni māmṛjuḥ

translations.griffith: The Gods whose tongue is Agni dwell in heaven, and sit, aiders of Law, reflecting, in the seat of Law.  They propped up heaven and then brought waters with their might, got sacrifice and in a body made it fair.

verses.sanskrit: परिक्षिता पितरा पूर्वजावरी रतस्य योना कषयतःसमोकसा दयावाप्र्थिवी वरुणाय सव्रते घर्तवत पयोमहिषाय पिन्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: parikṣitā pitarā pūrvajāvarī ṛtasya yonā kṣayataḥsamokasā dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇāya savrate ghṛtavat payomahiṣāya pinvataḥ

translations.griffith: Born in the oldest time, the Parents dwelling round are sharers of one mansion in the home of Law.  Bound by their common vow Dyaus, Prthivi stream forth the moisture rich in oil to Varuṇa the Steer.

verses.sanskrit: पर्जन्यावाता वर्षभा पुरीषिणेन्द्रवायू वरुणो मित्रोर्यमा देवानादित्यानदितिं हवामहे ये पार्थिवासोदिव्यासो अप्सु ये |||
verses.transliteration: parjanyāvātā vṛṣabhā purīṣiṇendravāyū varuṇo mitroaryamā devānādityānaditiṃ havāmahe ye pārthivāsodivyāso apsu ye

translations.griffith: Parjanya, Vāta, mighty, senders of the rain, Indra and Vāyu, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman:  We call on Aditi, Ādityas, and the Gods, those who are on the earth, in waters, and in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तवष्टारं वायुं रभवो य ओहते दैव्या होतारा उषसंस्वस्तये बर्हस्पतिं वर्त्रखादं सुमेधसमिन्द्रियंसोमं धनसा उ ईमहे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṣṭāraṃ vāyuṃ ṛbhavo ya ohate daivyā hotārā uṣasaṃsvastaye bṛhaspatiṃ vṛtrakhādaṃ sumedhasamindriyaṃsomaṃ dhanasā u īmahe

translations.griffith: Tvaṣṭar and Vāyu, those who count as Ṛbhus, both celestial Hotar-priests, and Dawn for happiness,  Winners of wealth, we call, and wise Bṛhaspati, destroyer of our foes, and Soma Indra's Friend.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्म गामश्वं जनयन्त ओषधीर्वनस्पतीन पर्थिवीम्पर्वतानपः सूर्यं दिवि रोहयन्तः सुदानव आर्याव्रता विस्र्जन्तो अधि कषमि |||
verses.transliteration: brahma ghāmaśvaṃ janayanta oṣadhīrvanaspatīn pṛthivīmparvatānapaḥ sūryaṃ divi rohayantaḥ sudānava āryāvratā visṛjanto adhi kṣami

translations.griffith: They generated prayer, the cow, the horse, the plants, the forest trees, the earth, the waters, and the hills.  These very bounteous Gods made the Sun mount to heaven, and spread the righteous laws of Āryas o’er the land.

verses.sanskrit: भुज्युमंहसः पिप्र्थो निरश्विना शयावं पुत्रंवध्रिमत्या अजिन्वतम कमद्युवं विमदायोहथुर्युवंविष्णाप्वं विश्वकायाव सर्जथः |||
verses.transliteration: bhujyumaṃhasaḥ pipṛtho niraśvinā śyāvaṃ putraṃvadhrimatyā ajinvatam kamadyuvaṃ vimadāyohathuryuvaṃviṣṇāpvaṃ viśvakāyāva sṛjathaḥ

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, ye delivered Bhujyu from distress, ye animated Śyāva, Vadhrmati's son.  To Vimada ye brought his consort Kamadyu, and gave his lost Viṣṇāpū back to Viśvaka.

verses.sanskrit: पावीरवी तन्यतुरेकपादजो दिवो धर्ता सिन्धुरापःसमुद्रियः विश्वे देवासः शर्णवन वचांसि मे सरस्वतीसह धीभिः पुरन्ध्या |||
verses.transliteration: pāvīravī tanyaturekapādajo divo dhartā sindhurāpaḥsamudriyaḥ viśve devāsaḥ śṛṇavan vacāṃsi me sarasvatīsaha dhībhiḥ purandhyā

translations.griffith: Thunder, the lightning's daughter, Aja-Ekapād, heaven's bearer, Sindhu, and the waters of the sea:  Hear all the Gods my words, Sarasvatī give ear together with Purandhi and with Holy Thoughts.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवाः सह धीभिः पुरन्ध्या मनोर्यजत्राम्र्ता रतज्ञाः रातिषाचो अभिषाचः सवर्विदः सवर्गिरो बरह्म सूक्तं जुषेरत |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devāḥ saha dhībhiḥ purandhyā manoryajatrāamṛtā ṛtajñāḥ rātiṣāco abhiṣācaḥ svarvidaḥ svarghiro brahma sūktaṃ juṣerata

translations.griffith: With Holy Thoughts and with Purandhi may all Gods, knowing the Law immortal, Manu's Holy Ones,  Boon-givers, favourers, finders of light, and Heaven, with gracious love accept my songs, my prayer, my hymn.

verses.sanskrit: देवान वसिष्ठो अम्र्तान ववन्दे ये विश्वा भुवनाभिप्रतस्थुः ते नो रासन्तामुरुगायमद्य यूयं पातस्वस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: devān vasiṣṭho amṛtān vavande ye viśvā bhuvanābhipratasthuḥ te no rāsantāmurughāyamadya yūyaṃ pātasvastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: Immortal Gods have I, Vasiṣṭha, lauded, Gods set on high above all other beings.  May they this day grant us wide space and freedom: ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: देवान हुवे बर्हच्छ्रवसः सवस्तये जयोतिष्क्र्तो अध्वरस्यप्रचेतसः ये वाव्र्धुः परतरं विश्ववेदसैन्द्रज्येष्ठासो अम्र्ता रताव्र्धः |||
verses.transliteration: devān huve bṛhacchravasaḥ svastaye jyotiṣkṛto adhvarasyapracetasaḥ ye vāvṛdhuḥ prataraṃ viśvavedasaindrajyeṣṭhāso amṛtā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: I CALL the Gods of lofty glory for our weal, the makers of the light, well-skilled in sacrifice;  Those who have waxen mightily, Masters of all wealth, Immortal, strengthening Law, the Gods whom Indra leads.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रप्रसूता वरुणप्रशिष्टा ये सूर्यस्य जयोतिषो भागमानशुः मरुद्गणे वर्जने मन्म धीमहि माघोने यज्ञंजनयन्त सूरयः |||
verses.transliteration: indraprasūtā varuṇapraśiṣṭā ye sūryasya jyotiṣo bhāghamānaśuḥ marudghaṇe vṛjane manma dhīmahi māghone yajñaṃjanayanta sūrayaḥ

translations.griffith: For the strong band of Maruts will we frame a hymn: the chiefs shall bring forth sacrifice for Indra's troop,  Who, sent by Indra and advised by Varuṇa, have gotten for themselves a share of Sūrya's light

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो वसुभिः परि पातु नो गयमादित्यैर्नो अदितः शर्मयछ्तु रुद्रो रुद्रेभिर्देवो मर्ळयाति नस्त्वष्टा नोग्नाभिः सुविताय जिन्वतु |||
verses.transliteration: indro vasubhiḥ pari pātu no ghayamādityairno aditḥ śarmayachtu rudro rudrebhirdevo mṛḷayāti nastvaṣṭā noghnābhiḥ suvitāya jinvatu

translations.griffith: May Indra with the Vasus keep our dwelling safe, and Aditi with Ādityas lend us sure defence.  May the God Rudra with the Rudras favour us, and Tvaṣṭar with the Dames further us to success.

verses.sanskrit: अदितिर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी रतं महदिन्द्राविष्णू मरुतःस्वर्ब्र्हत देवानादित्यानवसे हवामहे वसून रुद्रांसवितारं सुदंससम |||
