verses.transliteration: aditirdyāvāpṛthivī ṛtaṃ mahadindrāviṣṇū marutaḥsvarbṛhat devānādityānavase havāmahe vasūn rudrāṃsavitāraṃ sudaṃsasam

translations.griffith: Aditi, Heaven and Earth, the great eternal Law, Indra, Viṣṇu, the Maruts, and the lofty Sky.  We call upon Ādityas, on the Gods, for help, on Vasus, Rudras, Savitar of wondrous deeds.

verses.sanskrit: सरस्वान धीभिर्वरुणो धर्तव्रतः पूषा विष्णुर्महिमावायुरश्विना बरह्मक्र्तो अम्र्ता विश्ववेदसः शर्म नोयंसन तरिवरूथमंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: sarasvān dhībhirvaruṇo dhṛtavratḥ pūṣā viṣṇurmahimāvāyuraśvinā brahmakṛto amṛtā viśvavedasaḥ śarma noyaṃsan trivarūthamaṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: With Holy Thoughts Sarasvān, firm-lawed Varuṇa, great Vāyu, Pūṣan, Viṣṇu, and the Aśvins Twain,  Lords of all wealth, Immortal, furtherers of prayer, grant us a triply-guarding refuge from distress.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा यज्ञो वर्षणः सन्तु यज्ञिया वर्षणो देवाव्र्षणो हविष्क्र्तः वर्षणा दयावाप्र्थिवी रतावरीव्र्षा पर्जन्यो वर्षणो वर्षस्तुभः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā yajño vṛṣaṇaḥ santu yajñiyā vṛṣaṇo devāvṛṣaṇo haviṣkṛtaḥ vṛṣaṇā dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāvarīvṛṣā parjanyo vṛṣaṇo vṛṣastubhaḥ

translations.griffith: Strong be the sacrifice, strong be the Holy Ones, strong the preparers of oblation, strong the Gods.  Mighty be Heaven and Earth, true to eternal Law, strong be Parjanya, strong be they who laud the Strong.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा वर्षणा वाजसातये पुरुप्रशस्ता वर्षणा उपब्रुवे यावीजिरे वर्षणो देवयज्यया ता नः शर्मत्रिवरूथं वि यंसतः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīṣomā vṛṣaṇā vājasātaye purupraśastā vṛṣaṇā upabruve yāvījire vṛṣaṇo devayajyayā tā naḥ śarmatrivarūthaṃ vi yaṃsataḥ

translations.griffith: To win us strength I glorify the Mighty Twain, Agni and Soma, Mighty Ones whom many laud.  May these vouchsafe us shelter with a triple guard, these whom the strong have served in worship of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: धर्तव्रताः कषत्रिया यज्ञनिष्क्र्तो बर्हद्दिवा अध्वराणामभिश्रियः अग्निहोतार रतसापो अद्रुहो.अपो अस्र्जन्ननुव्र्त्रतूर्ये |||
verses.transliteration: dhṛtavratāḥ kṣatriyā yajñaniṣkṛto bṛhaddivā adhvarāṇāmabhiśriyaḥ aghnihotāra ṛtasāpo adruho.apo asṛjannanuvṛtratūrye

translations.griffith: Potent, with firm-fixt laws, arranging sacrifice, visiting solemn rites in splendour of the day,  Obeying Order, these whose priest is Agni, free from falsehood, poured the waters out when Vṛtra died.

verses.sanskrit: दयावाप्र्थिवी जनयन्नभि वरताप ओषधीर्वनिनानियज्ञिया अन्तरिक्षं सवरा पप्रुरूतये वशं देवासस्तन्वी नि माम्र्जुः |||
verses.transliteration: dyāvāpṛthivī janayannabhi vratāpa oṣadhīrvanināniyajñiyā antarikṣaṃ svarā paprurūtaye vaśaṃ devāsastanvī ni māmṛjuḥ

translations.griffith: The Holy Ones engendered, for their several laws, the heavens and earth, the waters, and the plants and trees.  They filled the firmament with heavenly light for help: the Gods embodied Wish and made it beautiful.

verses.sanskrit: धर्तारो दिव रभवः सुहस्ता वातापर्जन्या महिषस्यतन्यतोः आप ओषधीः पर तिरन्तु नो गिरो भगो रातिर्वाजिनो यन्तु मे हवम |||
verses.transliteration: dhartāro diva ṛbhavaḥ suhastā vātāparjanyā mahiṣasyatanyatoḥ āpa oṣadhīḥ pra tirantu no ghiro bhagho rātirvājino yantu me havam

translations.griffith: May they who bear up heaven, the Ṛbhus deft of hand, and Vāta and Parjanya of the thundering Bull,  The waters and the plants, promote the songs we sing: come Bhaga, Rati, and the Vaijns to my call.

verses.sanskrit: समुद्रः सिन्धू रजो अन्तरिक्षमज एकपात तनयित्नुरर्णवः अहिर्बुध्न्यः शर्णवद वचांसि मे विश्वे देवासौत सूरयो मम |||
verses.transliteration: samudraḥ sindhū rajo antarikṣamaja ekapāt tanayitnurarṇavaḥ ahirbudhnyaḥ śṛṇavad vacāṃsi me viśve devāsauta sūrayo mama

translations.griffith: Sindhu, the sea, the region, and the firmament, the thunder, and the ocean, Aja-Ekapād,  The Dragon of the Deep, shall listen to my words, and all the Deities and Princes shall give ear.

verses.sanskrit: सयाम वो मनवो देववीतये पराञ्चं नो यज्ञं पर णयतसाधुया आदित्या रुद्रा वसवः सुदानव इमा बरह्मशस्यमानानि जिन्वत |||
verses.transliteration: syāma vo manavo devavītaye prāñcaṃ no yajñaṃ pra ṇayatasādhuyā ādityā rudrā vasavaḥ sudānava imā brahmaśasyamānāni jinvata

translations.griffith: May we, be yours, we men, to entertain the Gods: further our sacrifice and give it full success.  Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus, givers of good gifts, quicken the holy hymns which we are singing now

verses.sanskrit: दैव्या होतारा परथमा पुरोहित रतस्य पन्थामन्वेमिसाधुया कषेत्रस्य पतिं परतिवेशमीमहे विश्वान देवानम्र्तानप्रयुछतः |||
verses.transliteration: daivyā hotārā prathamā purohita ṛtasya panthāmanvemisādhuyā kṣetrasya patiṃ prativeśamīmahe viśvān devānamṛtānaprayuchataḥ

translations.griffith: I follow with success upon the path of Law the two celestial Hotars, Priests of oldest time.  We pray to him who dwelleth near, Guard of the Field, to all Immortal Gods who never are remiss.

verses.sanskrit: वसिष्ठासः पित्र्वद वाचमक्रत देवानीळाना रषिवत्स्वस्तये परीता इव जञातयः काममेत्यास्मे देवासो.अवधूनुता वसु |||
verses.transliteration: vasiṣṭhāsaḥ pitṛvad vācamakrata devānīḷānā ṛṣivatsvastaye prītā iva jñātayaḥ kāmametyāsme devāso.avadhūnutā vasu

translations.griffith: Vasiṣṭha's sons have raised their voices, like their sire. Ṛṣi-like praying to the Gods for happiness.  Like friendly-minded kinsmen, come at our desire, O Gods, and shake down treasures on us from above.

verses.sanskrit: देवान वसिष्ठो अम्र्तान ववन्दे ... ||
verses.transliteration: devān vasiṣṭho amṛtān vavande ...

translations.griffith: Immortal Gods have I, Vasiṣṭha, lauded, Gods set on high above all other beings.  May they this day grant us wide space and freedom: ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: इमां धियं सप्तशीर्ष्णीं पिता न रतप्रजातां बर्हतीमविन्दत तुरीयं सविज्जनयद विश्वजन्यो.अयास्य उक्थमिन्द्राय शंसन |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ dhiyaṃ saptaśīrṣṇīṃ pitā na ṛtaprajātāṃ bṛhatīmavindat turīyaṃ svijjanayad viśvajanyo.ayāsya ukthamindrāya śaṃsan

translations.griffith: THIS holy hymn, sublime and sevenheaded, sprung from eternal Law, our sire discovered.  Ayasya, friend of all men, hath engendered the fourth hymn as he sang his laud to Indra.

verses.sanskrit: रतं शंसन्त रजु दीध्याना दिवस पुत्रासो असुरस्यवीराः विप्रं पदमङगिरसो दधाना यज्ञस्य धामप्रथमं मनन्त |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtaṃ śaṃsanta ṛju dīdhyānā divas putrāso asurasyavīrāḥ vipraṃ padamaṅghiraso dadhānā yajñasya dhāmaprathamaṃ mananta

translations.griffith: Thinking aright, praising eternal Order, the sons of Dyaus the Asura, those heroes,  Aṅgirases, holding the rank of sages, first honoured sacrifice's holy statute.

verses.sanskrit: हंसैरिव सखिभिर्वावदद्भिरश्मन्मयानि नहनाव्यस्यन बर्हस्पतिरभिकनिक्रदद गा उत परास्तौदुच्चविद्वानगायत |||
verses.transliteration: haṃsairiva sakhibhirvāvadadbhiraśmanmayāni nahanāvyasyan bṛhaspatirabhikanikradad ghā uta prāstauduccavidvānaghāyat

translations.griffith: Girt by his friends who cried with swanlike voices, bursting the stony barriers of the prison,  Bṛhaspati spake in thunder to the cattle, and uttered praise and song when he had found them.

verses.sanskrit: अवो दवाभ्यां पर एकया गा गुहा तिष्ठन्तीरन्र्तस्यसेतौ बर्हस्पतिस्तमसि जयोतिरिछन्नुदुस्रा आकर्विहि तिस्र आवः |||
verses.transliteration: avo dvābhyāṃ para ekayā ghā ghuhā tiṣṭhantīranṛtasyasetau bṛhaspatistamasi jyotirichannudusrā ākarvihi tisra āvaḥ

translations.griffith: Apart from one, away from two above him, he drave the kine that stood in bonds of falsehood.  Bṛhaspati, seeking light amid the darkness, drave forth the bright cows: three he made apparent.

verses.sanskrit: विभिद्या पुरं शयाथेमपाचीं निस्त्रीणि साकमुदधेरक्र्न्तत बर्हस्पतिरुषसं सूर्यं गामर्कंविवेद सतनयन्निव दयौः |||
verses.transliteration: vibhidyā puraṃ śayāthemapācīṃ nistrīṇi sākamudadherakṛntat bṛhaspatiruṣasaṃ sūryaṃ ghāmarkaṃviveda stanayanniva dyauḥ

translations.griffith: When he had cleft the lairs and western castle, he cut off three from him who held the waters.  Bṛhaspati discovered, while he thundered like Dyaus, the dawn, the Sun, the cow, the lightning.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो वलं रक्षितारं दुघानां करेणेव वि चकर्तारवेण सवेदाञ्जिभिराशिरमिछमानो.अरोदयत पणिमागा अमुष्णात |||
verses.transliteration: indro valaṃ rakṣitāraṃ dughānāṃ kareṇeva vi cakartāraveṇa svedāñjibhirāśiramichamāno.arodayat paṇimāghā amuṣṇāt

translations.griffith: As with a hand, so with his roaring Indra cleft Vala through, the guardian of the cattle.  Seeking the milk-draught with sweatshining comrades he stole the Paṇi's kine and left him weeping.

verses.sanskrit: स ईं सत्येभिः सखिभिः शुचद्भिर्गोधायसं विधनसैरदर्दः बरह्मणस पतिर्व्र्षभिर्वराहैर्घर्मस्वेदेभिर्द्रविणं वयानट |||
verses.transliteration: sa īṃ satyebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ śucadbhirghodhāyasaṃ vidhanasairadardaḥ brahmaṇas patirvṛṣabhirvarāhairgharmasvedebhirdraviṇaṃ vyānaṭ

translations.griffith: He with bright faithful Friends, winners of booty, hath rent the milker of the cows asunder.  Bṛhaspati with wild boars strong and mighty, sweating with heat, hath gained a rich possession.

verses.sanskrit: ते सत्येन मनसा गोपतिं गा इयानास इषणयन्तधीभिः बर्हस्पतिर्मिथोवद्यपेभिरुदुस्रिया अस्र्जतस्वयुग्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: te satyena manasā ghopatiṃ ghā iyānāsa iṣaṇayantadhībhiḥ bṛhaspatirmithoavadyapebhirudusriyā asṛjatasvayughbhiḥ

translations.griffith: They, longing for the kine, with faithful spirit incited with their hymns the Lord of cattle.  Bṛhaspati freed the radiant cows with comrades self-yoked, averting shame from one another.

verses.sanskrit: तं वर्धयन्तो मतिभिः शिवाभिः सिंअमिव नानदतंसधस्थे बर्हस्पतिं वर्षणं शूरसातौ भरे-भरे अनुमदेम जिष्णुम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vardhayanto matibhiḥ śivābhiḥ siṃamiva nānadataṃsadhasthe bṛhaspatiṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ śūrasātau bhare-bhare anumadema jiṣṇum

translations.griffith: In our assembly with auspicious praises exalting him who roareth like a lion,  Maywe, in every fight where heroes conquer, rejoice in strong Bṛhaspati the Victor.

verses.sanskrit: यदा वाजमसनद विश्वरूपमा दयामरुक्षदुत्तराणिसद्म बर्हस्पतिं वर्षणं वर्धयन्तो नाना सन्तोबिभ्रतो जयोतिरासा |||
verses.transliteration: yadā vājamasanad viśvarūpamā dyāmarukṣaduttarāṇisadma bṛhaspatiṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vardhayanto nānā santobibhrato jyotirāsā

translations.griffith: When he had won him every sort of booty and gone to heaven and its most lofty mansions,  Men praised Bṛhaspati the Mighty, bringing the light within their mouths from sundry places.

verses.sanskrit: सत्यामाशिषं कर्णुता वयोधै कीरिं चिद धयवथस्वेभिरेवैः पश्चा मर्धो अप भवन्तु विश्वास्तद्रोदसी शर्णुतं विश्वमिन्वे |||
verses.transliteration: satyāmāśiṣaṃ kṛṇutā vayodhai kīriṃ cid dhyavathasvebhirevaiḥ paścā mṛdho apa bhavantu viśvāstadrodasī śṛṇutaṃ viśvaminve

translations.griffith: Fulfil the prayer that begs for vital vigour: aid in your wonted manner even the humble.  Let all our foes be turned and driven backward. Hear this, O Heaven and Earth, ye All-producers.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो मह्ना महतो अर्णवस्य वि मूर्धानमभिनदर्बुदस्य अहन्नहिमरिणात सप्त सिन्धून देवैर्द्यावाप्र्थिवीप्रावतं नः |||
verses.transliteration: indro mahnā mahato arṇavasya vi mūrdhānamabhinadarbudasya ahannahimariṇāt sapta sindhūn devairdyāvāpṛthivīprāvataṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: Indra with mighty strength cleft asunder the head of Arbuda the watery monster,  Slain Ahi, and set free the Seven Rivers. O Heaven and Earth, with all the Gods protect us.

verses.sanskrit: उदप्रुतो न वयो रक्षमाणा वावदतो अभ्रियस्येव घोषाः गिरिभ्रजो नोर्मयो मदन्तो बर्हस्पतिमभ्यर्का अनावन |||
verses.transliteration: udapruto na vayo rakṣamāṇā vāvadato abhriyasyeva ghoṣāḥ ghiribhrajo normayo madanto bṛhaspatimabhyarkā anāvan

translations.griffith: LIKE birds who keep their watch, plashing in water, like the loud voices of the thundering rain-cloud,  Like merry streamlets bursting from the mountain, thus to Bṛhaspati our hymns have sounded.

verses.sanskrit: सं गोभिराङगिरसो नक्षमाणो भग इवेदर्यमणंनिनाय जने मित्रो न दम्पती अनक्ति बर्हस्पतेवाजयाशून्रिवाजौ |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ ghobhirāṅghiraso nakṣamāṇo bhagha ivedaryamaṇaṃnināya jane mitro na dampatī anakti bṛhaspatevājayāśūnrivājau

translations.griffith: The Son of Aṅgirases, meeting the cattle, as Bhaga, brought in Aryaman among us.  As Friend of men he decks the wife and husband: as for the race, Bṛhaspati, nerve our coursers.

verses.sanskrit: साध्वर्या अतिथिनीरिषिरा सपार्हाः सुवर्णानवद्यरूपाः बर्हस्पतिः पर्वते भयो वितूर्या निर्गाूपे यवमिव सथिविभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sādhvaryā atithinīriṣirā spārhāḥ suvarṇāanavadyarūpāḥ bṛhaspatiḥ parvate bhyo vitūryā nirghāūpe yavamiva sthivibhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati, having won them from the mountains, strewed down, like barley out of winnowing- baskets,  The vigorous, wandering cows who aid the pious, desired of all, of blameless form, well-coloured.

verses.sanskrit: आप्रुषायन मधुन रतस्य योनिमवक्षिपन्नर्क उल्कामिवद्योः बर्हस्पतिरुद्धरन्नश्मनो गा भूम्या उद्नेव वित्वचं बिभेद |||
verses.transliteration: āpruṣāyan madhuna ṛtasya yonimavakṣipannarka ulkāmivadyoḥ bṛhaspatiruddharannaśmano ghā bhūmyā udneva vitvacaṃ bibheda

translations.griffith: As the Sun dews with meath the seat of Order, and casts a flaming meteor down from heaven.  So from the rock Bṛhaspati forced the cattle, and cleft the earth's skin as it were with water.

verses.sanskrit: अप जयोतिषा तमो अन्तरिक्षादुद्नः शीपालमिव वाताजत बर्हस्पतिरनुम्र्श्या वलस्याभ्रमिव वात आ चक्रा गाः |||
verses.transliteration: apa jyotiṣā tamo antarikṣādudnaḥ śīpālamiva vātaājat bṛhaspatiranumṛśyā valasyābhramiva vāta ā cakraā ghāḥ

translations.griffith: Forth from mid air with light he dravc the darkness, as the gale blows a lily from the fiver.  Like the wind grasping at the cloud of Vala, Bṛhaspati gathered to himself the cattle,

verses.sanskrit: यदा वलस्य पीयतो जसुं भेद बर्हस्पतिरग्नितपोभिरर्कैः दद्भिर्न जिह्वा परिविष्टमाददाविर्निधीन्रक्र्णोदुस्रियाणाम |||
verses.transliteration: yadā valasya pīyato jasuṃ bhed bṛhaspatiraghnitapobhirarkaiḥ dadbhirna jihvā pariviṣṭamādadāvirnidhīnrakṛṇodusriyāṇām

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati, when he with fiery lightnings cleft through the weapon of reviling Vala,  Consumedḥim as tongues cat what teeth have compassed: he threw the prisons of the red cows open.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पतिरमत हि तयदासां नाम सवरीणां सदनेगुहा यत आण्डेव भित्त्वा शकुनस्य गर्भमुदुस्रियाःपर्वतस्य तमनाजत |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspatiramata hi tyadāsāṃ nāma svarīṇāṃ sadaneghuhā yat āṇḍeva bhittvā śakunasya gharbhamudusriyāḥparvatasya tmanājat

translations.griffith: That secret name borne by the lowing cattle within the cave Bṛhaspati discovered,  And drave, himself, the bright kine from the mountain, like a bird's young after the egg's disclosure.

verses.sanskrit: अश्नापिनद्धं मधु पर्यपश्यन मत्स्यं न दीन उदनिक्षियन्तम निष टज्जभार चमसं न वर्क्षाद्ब्र्हस्पतिर्विरवेणा विक्र्त्य |||
verses.transliteration: aśnāpinaddhaṃ madhu paryapaśyan matsyaṃ na dīna udanikṣiyantam niṣ ṭajjabhāra camasaṃ na vṛkṣādbṛhaspatirviraveṇā vikṛtya

translations.griffith: He looked around on rock-imprisoned sweetness as one who eyes a fish in scanty water.  Bṛhaspati, cleaving through with varied clamour, brought it forth like a bowl from out the timber.

verses.sanskrit: सोषामविन्दत स सवः सो अग्निं सो अर्केण वि बबाधेतमांसि बर्हस्पतिर्गोवपुषो वलस्य निर्मज्जानं नपर्वणो जभार |||
verses.transliteration: soṣāmavindat sa svaḥ so aghniṃ so arkeṇa vi babādhetamāṃsi bṛhaspatirghovapuṣo valasya nirmajjānaṃ naparvaṇo jabhāra

translations.griffith: He found the light of heaven, and fire, and Morning: with lucid rays he forced apart the darkness.  As from a joint, Bṛhaspati took the marrow of Vala as he gloried in his cattle.

verses.sanskrit: हिमेव पर्णा मुषिता वनानि बर्हस्पतिनाक्र्पयद वलो गाः अनानुक्र्त्यमपुनश्चकार यात सूर्यामासा मिथौच्चरातः |||
verses.transliteration: himeva parṇā muṣitā vanāni bṛhaspatinākṛpayad valo ghāḥ anānukṛtyamapunaścakāra yāt sūryāmāsā mithauccarātaḥ

translations.griffith: As trees for foliage robbed by winter, Vala mourned for the cows Bṛhaspati had taken.  He did a deed ne’er done, ne’er to be equalled, whereby the Sun and Moon ascend alternate.

verses.sanskrit: अभि शयावं न कर्शनेभिरश्वं नक्षत्रेभिः पितरोद्यामपिंशन रात्र्यां तमो अदधुर्ज्योतिरहन्ब्र्हस्पतिर्भिनदद्रिं विदद गाः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi śyāvaṃ na kṛśanebhiraśvaṃ nakṣatrebhiḥ pitarodyāmapiṃśan rātryāṃ tamo adadhurjyotirahanbṛhaspatirbhinadadriṃ vidad ghāḥ

translations.griffith: Like a dark steed adorned with pearl, the Fathers have decorated heaven With constellations.  They set the light in day, in night the darkness. Bṛhaspati cleft the rock and found the cattle.

verses.sanskrit: इदमकर्म नमो अभ्रियाय यः पूर्वीरन्वानोनवीति बर्हस्पतिः स हि गोभिः सो अश्वैः स वीरेभिः सन्र्भिर्नो वयो धात |||
verses.transliteration: idamakarma namo abhriyāya yaḥ pūrvīranvānonavīti bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi ghobhiḥ so aśvaiḥ sa vīrebhiḥ sanṛbhirno vayo dhāt

translations.griffith: This homage have we.offered to the Cloud God who thunders out to many in succession.  May this Bṛhaspati vouchsafe us fulness of life with kine and horses, men, and heroes.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रा अग्नेर्वध्र्यश्वस्य सन्द्र्शो वामी परणीतिःसुरणा उपेतयः यदीं सुमित्रा विशो अग्र इन्धतेघ्र्तेनाहुतो जरते दविद्युतत |||
verses.transliteration: bhadrā aghnervadhryaśvasya sandṛśo vāmī praṇītiḥsuraṇā upetayaḥ yadīṃ sumitrā viśo aghra indhateghṛtenāhuto jarate davidyutat

translations.griffith: Auspicious is the aspect of Vadhryasva's fire good is its guidance, pleasant are its visitings.  When first the people Of Sumitra kindle it, with butter poured thercon it crackles and shines bright.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तमग्नेर्वध्र्यश्वस्य वर्धनं घर्तमन्नं घर्तं वस्य मेदनम घर्तेनाहुत उर्विया वि पप्रथे सूर्य इवरोचते सर्पिरासुतिः |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtamaghnervadhryaśvasya vardhanaṃ ghṛtamannaṃ ghṛtaṃ vasya medanam ghṛtenāhuta urviyā vi paprathe sūrya ivarocate sarpirāsutiḥ

translations.griffith: Butter is that which makes Vadhryaiva's fire growstrong: the butter is its food, the butter makes it fat.  It spreads abroad when butter hath been offered it, and balmed with streams of butter shines forth like the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते मनुर्यदनीकं सुमित्रः समीधे अग्ने तदिदंनवीयः स रेवच्छोच स गिरो जुषस्व स वाजं दर्षिस इह शरवो धाः |||
verses.transliteration: yat te manuryadanīkaṃ sumitraḥ samīdhe aghne tadidaṃnavīyaḥ sa revacchoca sa ghiro juṣasva sa vājaṃ darṣisa iha śravo dhāḥ

translations.griffith: Still newest is this face of thine, O Agni, which Manu and Sumitra have enkindled.  So richly shine, accept our songs with favour, so give us strengthening food, so send us glory.

verses.sanskrit: यं तवा पूर्वमीळितो वध्र्यश्वः समीधे अग्ने स इदंजुषस्व स न सतिपा उत भवा तनूपा दात्रं रक्षस्वयदिदं ते अस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ tvā pūrvamīḷito vadhryaśvaḥ samīdhe aghne sa idaṃjuṣasva sa na stipā uta bhavā tanūpā dātraṃ rakṣasvayadidaṃ te asme

translations.griffith: Accept this offering, Agni, whom aforetime Vadhryasva, hath entreated and enkindled.  Guard well our homes and ople, guard our bodies, protect thy girt to us which thou hast granted.

verses.sanskrit: भवा दयुम्नी वाध्र्यश्वोत गोपा मा तवा तारीदभिमातिर्जनानाम शूर इव धर्ष्णुश्च्यवनः सुमित्रः पर नुवोचं वाध्र्यश्वस्य नाम |||
verses.transliteration: bhavā dyumnī vādhryaśvota ghopā mā tvā tārīdabhimātirjanānām śūra iva dhṛṣṇuścyavanaḥ sumitraḥ pra nuvocaṃ vādhryaśvasya nāma

translations.griffith: Be splendid, guard us Kinsman of Vadhryasva: let not the enmity of men o’ercome thee,  Like the bold hero Cyavāna, I Sumitra tell forth the title of Vadhryaiva's Kinsman.

verses.sanskrit: समज्र्या पर्वत्या वसूनि दासा वर्त्राण्यार्या जिगेथ शूर इव धर्ष्णुश्च्यवनो जनानां तवमग्ने पर्तनायून्रभि षयाः |||
verses.transliteration: samajryā parvatyā vasūni dāsā vṛtrāṇyāryā jighetha śūra iva dhṛṣṇuścyavano janānāṃ tvamaghne pṛtanāyūnrabhi ṣyāḥ

translations.griffith: All treasures hast thou won, of plains and mountains, and quelled the Dāsas' and Āryas' hatred.  Like the bold hero Cyavāna, O Agni, mayst thou subdue the men who long for battle.

verses.sanskrit: दीर्घतन्तुर्ब्र्हदुक्षायमग्निः सहस्रस्तरीः शतनीथर्भ्वा दयुमान दयुमत्सु नर्भिर्म्र्ज्यमानः सुमित्रेषु दीदयोदेवयत्सु |||
verses.transliteration: dīrghatanturbṛhadukṣāyamaghniḥ sahasrastarīḥ śatanīthaṛbhvā dyumān dyumatsu nṛbhirmṛjyamānaḥ sumitreṣu dīdayodevayatsu

translations.griffith: Deft Agni hath a lengthened thread, tall oxen, a thousand heifers, numberless devices.  Decked by the men, splendid among the splendid, shine brightly forth amid devout Sumitras.

verses.sanskrit: तवे धेनुः सुदुघा जातवेदो.असश्चतेव समना सबर्धुक तवं नर्भिर्दक्षिणावद्भिरग्ने सुमित्रेभिरिध्यसेदेवयद्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: tve dhenuḥ sudughā jātavedo.asaścateva samanā sabardhuk tvaṃ nṛbhirdakṣiṇāvadbhiraghne sumitrebhiridhyasedevayadbhiḥ

translations.griffith: Thine is the teeming cow, O Jātavedas, who pours at once her ceaseless flow, Sabardhuk,  Thou. art lit up by men enriched with guerdon, O Agni, by the pious-souled Sumitras.

verses.sanskrit: देवाश्चित ते अम्र्ता जातवेदो महिमानं वाध्र्यश्व पर वोचन यत सम्प्र्छं मानुषीर्विश आयन तवं नर्भिरजयस्त्वाव्र्धेभिः |||
verses.transliteration: devāścit te amṛtā jātavedo mahimānaṃ vādhryaśva pra vocan yat sampṛchaṃ mānuṣīrviśa āyan tvaṃ nṛbhirajayastvāvṛdhebhiḥ

translations.griffith: Even Immortal Gods, O Jātavedas, Vadhryasva's Kinsman, have declared thy grandeur.  When human tribes drew near with supplication thou conqueredst with men whom thou hadst strengthened.

verses.sanskrit: पितेव पुत्रमबिभरुपस्थे तवामग्ने वध्र्यश्वः सपर्यन्जुषाणो अस्य समिधं यविष्ठोत पूर्वानवनोर्व्राधतश्चित ||
verses.transliteration: piteva putramabibharupasthe tvāmaghne vadhryaśvaḥ saparyanjuṣāṇo asya samidhaṃ yaviṣṭhota pūrvānavanorvrādhataścit

translations.griffith: Like as a father bears his son, O Agni, Vadhryasva bare thee in his lap and served thee.  Thou, Youngest God, having enjoyed his fuel, didst vanquish those of old though they were mighty.

verses.sanskrit: शश्वदग्निर्वध्र्यश्वस्य शात्रून नर्भिर्जिगायसुतसोमवद्भिः समनं चिददहश्चित्रभानो.अवव्राधन्तमभिनद वर्धश्चित |||
verses.transliteration: śaśvadaghnirvadhryaśvasya śātrūn nṛbhirjighāyasutasomavadbhiḥ samanaṃ cidadahaścitrabhāno.avavrādhantamabhinad vṛdhaścit

translations.griffith: Vadhryasva's Agni evermore hath vanquished his foes with heroes who had pressed the Soma.  Lord of bright rays, thou burntest up the battle, subduing, as our help, e’en mighty foemen.

verses.sanskrit: अयमग्निर्वध्र्यश्वस्य वर्त्रहा सनकात परेद्धोनमसोपवाक्यः स नो अजामीन्रुत वा विजामीनभितिष्ठ शर्धतो वाध्र्यश्व |||
verses.transliteration: ayamaghnirvadhryaśvasya vṛtrahā sanakāt preddhonamasopavākyaḥ sa no ajāmīnruta vā vijāmīnabhitiṣṭha śardhato vādhryaśva

translations.griffith: This Agni of Vadhryasva, Vṛtra-slayer, lit from of old, must be invoked with homage.  As such assail our enemies, Vadhryasva, whether the foes be strangers or be kinsmen.

verses.sanskrit: इमां मे अग्ने समिधं जुषस्वेळस पदे परति हर्याघ्र्ताचीम वर्ष्मन पर्थिव्याः सुदिनत्वे अह्नामूर्ध्वोभव सुक्रतो देवयज्या |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ me aghne samidhaṃ juṣasveḷas pade prati haryāghṛtācīm varṣman pṛthivyāḥ sudinatve ahnāmūrdhvobhava sukrato devayajyā

translations.griffith: ENJOY, O Agni, this my Fuel, welcome the oil-filled ladle where we pour libation.  Rise up for worship of the Gods, wise Agni, on the earth's height, while days are bright with beauty.

verses.sanskrit: आ देवानामग्रयावेह यातु नराशंसो विश्वरूपेभिरश्वैः रतस्य पथा नमसा मियेधो देवेभ्यो देवतमःसुषूदत |||
verses.transliteration: ā devānāmaghrayāveha yātu narāśaṃso viśvarūpebhiraśvaiḥ ṛtasya pathā namasā miyedho devebhyo devatamaḥsuṣūdat

translations.griffith: May he who goes before the Gods come hither with steeds whose shapes are varied, Narasarhsa.  May he, most Godlike, speed our offered viands with homage God-ward on the path of Order.

verses.sanskrit: शश्वत्तममीळते दूत्याय हविष्मन्तो मनुष्यासो अग्निम वहिष्ठैरश्वैः सुव्र्ता रथेना देवान वक्षि निषदेह होता |||
verses.transliteration: śaśvattamamīḷate dūtyāya haviṣmanto manuṣyāso aghnim vahiṣṭhairaśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathenā devān vakṣi niṣadeha hotā

translations.griffith: Men with oblations laud most constant Agni, and pray him to perform an envoy's duty.  With lightly-rolling car and best draught-horses, bring the Gods hither and sit down as Hotar.

verses.sanskrit: वि परथतां देवजुष्टं तिरश्चा दीर्घं दराघ्मासुरभि भूत्वस्मे अहेळता मनसा देव बर्हिरिन्द्रज्येष्ठानुशतो यक्षि देवान |||
verses.transliteration: vi prathatāṃ devajuṣṭaṃ tiraścā dīrghaṃ drāghmāsurabhi bhūtvasme aheḷatā manasā deva barhirindrajyeṣṭhānuśato yakṣi devān

translations.griffith: May the delight of Gods spread out transversely: may it be with us long in length and fragrant.  O Holy Grass divine, with friendly spirit bring thou the willing Gods whose Chief is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो वा सानु सप्र्शता वरीयः पर्थिव्या वा मात्रया विश्रयध्वम उशतीर्द्वारो महिना महद्भिर्देवं रथंरथयुर्धारयध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: divo vā sānu spṛśatā varīyaḥ pṛthivyā vā mātrayā viśrayadhvam uśatīrdvāro mahinā mahadbhirdevaṃ rathaṃrathayurdhārayadhvam

translations.griffith: Touch ye the far-extending height of heaven or spring apart to suit the wide earth's measure.  Yearning, ye Doors, with those sublime in greatness, seize eagerly the heavenly Car that cometh.

verses.sanskrit: देवी दिवो दुहितरा सुशिल्पे उषासानक्ता सदतां नियोनौ आ वां देवास उशती उशन्त उरौ सीदन्तु सुभगेुपस्थे |||
verses.transliteration: devī divo duhitarā suśilpe uṣāsānaktā sadatāṃ niyonau ā vāṃ devāsa uśatī uśanta urau sīdantu subhagheupasthe

translations.griffith: Here in this shrine may Dawn and Night, the Daughters of Heaven, the skilful Goddesses, be seated.  In your wide lap, auspicious, willing Ladies may the Gods seat them with a willing spirit.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो गरावा बर्हदग्निः समिद्धः परिया धामान्यदितेरुपस्थे पुरोहिताव रत्विजा यज्ञे अस्मिन विदुष्टराद्रविणमा यजेथाम |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvo ghrāvā bṛhadaghniḥ samiddhaḥ priyā dhāmānyaditerupasthe purohitāv ṛtvijā yajñe asmin viduṣṭarādraviṇamā yajethām

translations.griffith: Up stands the stone, high burns the fire enkindled: Aditi's lap contains the Friendly Natures  Ye Two Chief Priests who serve at this our worship, may ye, more skilled, win for us rich possessions.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो देवीर्बर्हिरिदं वरीय आ सीदत चक्र्मा वःस्योनम मनुष्वद यज्ञं सुधिता हवींषीळा देवीघ्र्तपदी जुषन्त |||
verses.transliteration: tisro devīrbarhiridaṃ varīya ā sīdata cakṛmā vaḥsyonam manuṣvad yajñaṃ sudhitā havīṃṣīḷā devīghṛtapadī juṣanta

translations.griffith: On our wide grass, Three Goddesses be seated: for you have we prepared and made it pleasant.  May Iḷā, she whose foot drops oil, the Goddess, taste, man-like, sacrifice and well-set presents.

verses.sanskrit: देव तवष्टर्यद ध चारुत्वमानड यदङगिरसामभवः सचाभूः स देवानां पाथ उप पर विद्वानुशन यक्षि दरविणोदः सुरत्नः |||
verses.transliteration: deva tvaṣṭaryad dha cārutvamānaḍ yadaṅghirasāmabhavaḥ sacābhūḥ sa devānāṃ pātha upa pra vidvānuśan yakṣi draviṇodaḥ suratnaḥ

translations.griffith: Since thou, God Tvaṣṭar, hast made beauty perfect, since hou hast been the Aṅgirases' Companion,  Willing, most wealthy, Giver of possessions, grant us the Gods’ assembly, thou who knowest.

verses.sanskrit: वनस्पते रशनया नियूया देवानां पाथ उप वक्षिविद्वान सवदाति देवः कर्णवद धवींष्यवतान्द्यावाप्र्थिवी हवं मे |||
verses.transliteration: vanaspate raśanayā niyūyā devānāṃ pātha upa vakṣividvān svadāti devaḥ kṛṇavad dhavīṃṣyavatāndyāvāpṛthivī havaṃ me

translations.griffith: Well-knowing, binding with thy cord, bring hither, Lord of the Wood, the Deities' assembly.  The God prepare and season our oblations may Heaven and Earth be gracious to my calling.

verses.sanskrit: आग्ने वह वरुणमिष्टये न इन्द्रं दिवो मरुतोन्तरिक्षात सीदन्तु बर्हिर्विश्व आ यजत्राः सवाहादेवा अम्र्ता मादयन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: āghne vaha varuṇamiṣṭaye na indraṃ divo marutoantarikṣāt sīdantu barhirviśva ā yajatrāḥ svāhādevā amṛtā mādayantām

translations.griffith: Agni, bring hither Varuṇa to help us, Indra from heaven, from air's mid-realm the Maruts.  On sacred grass all Holy ones be seated and let the Immortal Gods rejoice in Svāhā.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पते परथमं वाचो अग्रं यत परैरत नामधेयन्दधानाः यदेषां शरेष्ठं यदरिप्रमासीत्प्रेणा तदेषां निहितं गुहाविः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate prathamaṃ vāco aghraṃ yat prairata nāmadheyandadhānāḥ yadeṣāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ yadaripramāsītpreṇā tadeṣāṃ nihitaṃ ghuhāviḥ

translations.griffith: WHEN-men, Bṛhaspati, giving names to objects, sent out Vāk's first and earliest utterances,  All that was excellent and spotless, treasured within them, was disclosed through their affection.

verses.sanskrit: सक्तुमिव-तित-उना पुनन्तो यत्र धीरा मनसा वाचमक्रत अत्रा सखायः सख्यानि जानते भद्रैषांलक्ष्मीर्निहिताधि वाचि |||
verses.transliteration: saktumiva-tita-unā punanto yatra dhīrā manasā vācamakrata atrā sakhāyaḥ sakhyāni jānate bhadraiṣāṃlakṣmīrnihitādhi vāci

translations.griffith: Where, like men cleansing corn-flour in a cribble, the wise in spirit have created language,  Friends see and recognize the marks of friendship: their speech retains the blessed sign imprinted.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञेन वाचः पदवीयमायन तामन्वविन्दन्न्र्षिषुप्रविष्टाम तामाभ्र्त्या वयदधुः पुरुत्रा तां सप्तरेभा अभि सं नवन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: yajñena vācaḥ padavīyamāyan tāmanvavindannṛṣiṣupraviṣṭām tāmābhṛtyā vyadadhuḥ purutrā tāṃ saptarebhā abhi saṃ navante

translations.griffith: With sacrifice the trace of Vāk they foIlowed, and found her harbouring within the Ṛṣis.  They brought her, dealt her forth in many places: seven singers make her tones resound in concert.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवः पश्यन न ददर्श वाचमुत तवः शर्ण्वन नश्र्णोत्येनाम उतो तवस्मै तन्वं वि सस्रे जायेव पत्यौशती सुवासाः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvaḥ paśyan na dadarśa vācamuta tvaḥ śṛṇvan naśṛṇotyenām uto tvasmai tanvaṃ vi sasre jāyeva patyauśatī suvāsāḥ

translations.griffith: One man hath ne’er seen Vāk, and yet he seeth: one man hath hearing but hath never heard her.  But to another hath she shown her beauty as a fond well-dressed woman to her husband.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवं सख्ये सथिरपीतमाहुर्नैनं हिन्वन्त्यपिवाजिनेषु अधेन्वा चरति माययैष वाचं शुश्रुवानफलामपुष्पाम |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvaṃ sakhye sthirapītamāhurnainaṃ hinvantyapivājineṣu adhenvā carati māyayaiṣa vācaṃ śuśruvānaphalāmapuṣpām

translations.griffith: One man they call a laggard, dull in friendship: they never urge him on to deeds of valour.  He wanders on in profitless illusion: the Voice he heard yields neither fruit,nor blossom.

verses.sanskrit: यस्तित्याज सचिविदं सखायं न तस्य वाच्यपि भागोस्ति यदीं शर्णोत्यलकं शर्णोति नहि परवेद सुक्र्तस्यपन्थाम |||
verses.transliteration: yastityāja sacividaṃ sakhāyaṃ na tasya vācyapi bhāghoasti yadīṃ śṛṇotyalakaṃ śṛṇoti nahi praveda sukṛtasyapanthām

translations.griffith: No part in Vāk hath he who hath abandoned his own dear friend who knows the truth of friendship.  Even if he hears her still in vain he listens: naught knows he of the path of righteous action.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षण्वन्तः कर्णवन्तः सखायो मनोजवेष्वसमाबभूवुः आदघ्नास उपकक्षास उ तवे हरदा इव सनात्वा उत्वे दद्र्श्रे |||
verses.transliteration: akṣaṇvantaḥ karṇavantaḥ sakhāyo manojaveṣvasamābabhūvuḥ ādaghnāsa upakakṣāsa u tve hradā iva snātvā utve dadṛśre

translations.griffith: Unequal in the quickness of their spirit are friends endowed alike with eyes and hearing.  Some look like tanks that reach the mouth or shoulder, others like pools of water fit to bathe in.

verses.sanskrit: हर्दा तष्टेषु मनसो जवेषु यद बराह्मणाः संयजन्तेसखायः अत्राह तवं वि जहुर्वेद्याभिरोहब्रह्माणो विचरन्त्यु तवे |||
verses.transliteration: hṛdā taṣṭeṣu manaso javeṣu yad brāhmaṇāḥ saṃyajantesakhāyaḥ atrāha tvaṃ vi jahurvedyābhirohabrahmāṇo vicarantyu tve

translations.griffith: When friendly Brahmans sacrifice together with mental impulse which the heart hath fashioned,  They leave one far behind through their attainments, and some who count as Brahmans wander elsewhere.

verses.sanskrit: इमे ये नार्वां न परश्चरन्ति न बराह्मणासो नसुतेकरासः त एते वाचमभिपद्य पापया सिरीस्तन्त्रं तन्वते अप्रजज्ञयः |||
verses.transliteration: ime ye nārvāṃ na paraścaranti na brāhmaṇāso nasutekarāsaḥ ta ete vācamabhipadya pāpayā sirīstantraṃ tanvate aprajajñayaḥ

translations.griffith: Those men who step not back and move not forward, nor Brahmans nor preparers of libations,  Having attained to Vāk in sinful fashion spin out their thread in ignorance like spinsters.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वे नन्दन्ति यशसागतेन सभासाहेन सख्या सखायः किल्बिषस्प्र्त पितुषणिर्ह्येषामरं हितो भवतिवाजिनाय |||
verses.transliteration: sarve nandanti yaśasāghatena sabhāsāhena sakhyā sakhāyaḥ kilbiṣaspṛt pituṣaṇirhyeṣāmaraṃ hito bhavativājināya

translations.griffith: All friends are joyful in the friend who cometh in triumph, having conquered in assembly.  He is their blame-averter, food-provider prepared is he and fit for deed of vigour.

verses.sanskrit: रचां तवः पोषमास्ते पुपुष्वान गायत्रं तवो गायतिशक्वरीषु बरह्मा तवो वदति जातविद्यां यज्ञस्यमात्रां वि मिमीत उ तवः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛcāṃ tvaḥ poṣamāste pupuṣvān ghāyatraṃ tvo ghāyatiśakvarīṣu brahmā tvo vadati jātavidyāṃ yajñasyamātrāṃ vi mimīta u tvaḥ

translations.griffith: One plies his constant task reciting verses. one sings the holy psalm in Sakvari measures.  One more, the Brahman, tells the lore of being, and one lays down the rules of sacrificing.

verses.sanskrit: देवानां नु वयं जाना पर वोचाम विपन्यया उक्थेषुशस्यमानेषु यः पश्यादुत्तरे युगे |||
verses.transliteration: devānāṃ nu vayaṃ jānā pra vocāma vipanyayā uktheṣuśasyamāneṣu yaḥ paśyāduttare yughe

translations.griffith: LET US with tuneful skill proclaim these generations of the Gods,  That one may see them when these hymns are chanted in a future age.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मणस पतिरेता सं कर्मार इवाधमत देवानाम्पूर्व्ये युगे.असतः सदजायत |||
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇas patiretā saṃ karmāra ivādhamat devānāmpūrvye yughe.asataḥ sadajāyata

translations.griffith: These Brahmaṇaspati produced with blast and smelting, like a Smith,  Existence, in an earlier age of Gods, from Non-existence sprang.

verses.sanskrit: देवानां युगे परथमे.असतः सदजायत तदाशा अन्वजायन्त तदुत्तानपदस परि |||
verses.transliteration: devānāṃ yughe prathame.asataḥ sadajāyata tadāśā anvajāyanta taduttānapadas pari

translations.griffith: Existence, in the earliest age of Gods, from Non-existence sprang.  Thereafter were the regions born. This sprang from the Productive Power.

verses.sanskrit: भूर्जज्ञ उत्तानपदो भुव आशा अजायन्त अदितेर्दक्षोजायत दक्षाद वदितिः परि |||
verses.transliteration: bhūrjajña uttānapado bhuva āśā ajāyanta aditerdakṣoajāyata dakṣād vaditiḥ pari

translations.griffith: Earth sprang from the Productive Power the regions from the earth were born.  Dakṣa was born of Aditi, and Aditi was Dakṣa's Child.

verses.sanskrit: अदितिर्ह्यजनिष्ट दक्ष या दुहिता तव तां देवान्वजायन्त भद्रा अम्र्तबन्धवः |||
verses.transliteration: aditirhyajaniṣṭa dakṣa yā duhitā tava tāṃ devāanvajāyanta bhadrā amṛtabandhavaḥ

translations.griffith: For Aditi, O Dakṣa, she who is thy Daughter, was brought forth.  After her were the blessed Gods born sharers of immortal life.

verses.sanskrit: यद देवा अदः सलिले सुसंरब्धा अतिष्ठत अत्रा वोन्र्त्यतामिव तीव्रो रेणुरपायत |||
verses.transliteration: yad devā adaḥ salile susaṃrabdhā atiṣṭhata atrā vonṛtyatāmiva tīvro reṇurapāyata

translations.griffith: When ye, O Gods, in yonder deep closeclasping one another stood,  Thence, as of dancers, from your feet a thickening cloud of dust arose.

verses.sanskrit: यद देवा यतयो यथा भुवनान्यपिन्वत अत्रा समुद्रा गूळमा सूर्यमजभर्तन |||
verses.transliteration: yad devā yatayo yathā bhuvanānyapinvata atrā samudraā ghūḷamā sūryamajabhartana

translations.griffith: When, O ye Gods, like Yatis, ye caused all existing things to grow,  Then ye brought Sūrya forward who was lying hidden in the sea.

verses.sanskrit: अष्टौ पुत्रासो अदितेर्ये जातास्तन्वस परि देवानुपप्रैत सप्तभिः परा मार्ताण्डमास्यत |||
verses.transliteration: aṣṭau putrāso aditerye jātāstanvas pari devānupaprait saptabhiḥ parā mārtāṇḍamāsyat

translations.griffith: Eight are the Sons of Adid who from her body sprang to life.  With seven she went to meet the Gods she cast Martanda far away.

verses.sanskrit: सप्तभिः पुत्रैरदितिरुप परैत पूर्व्यं युगम परजायै मर्त्यवे तवत पुनर्मार्ताण्डमाभरत |||
verses.transliteration: saptabhiḥ putrairaditirupa prait pūrvyaṃ yugham prajāyai mṛtyave tvat punarmārtāṇḍamābharat

translations.griffith: So with her Seven Sons Aditi went forth to meet the earlier age.  She brought Martanda thitherward to spring to life and die again.

verses.sanskrit: जनिष्था उग्रः सहसे तुराय मन्द्र ओजिष्ठोबहुलाभिमानः अवर्धन्निन्द्रं मरुतश्चिदत्र मातायद वीरं दधनद धनिष्ठा |||
verses.transliteration: janiṣthā ughraḥ sahase turāya mandra ojiṣṭhobahulābhimānaḥ avardhannindraṃ marutaścidatra mātāyad vīraṃ dadhanad dhaniṣṭhā

translations.griffith: THOU wast born mighty for victorious valour, exulting, strongest, full of pride and courage.  There, even there, the Maruts strengthened Indra when. his most rapid Mother stirred the Hero.

verses.sanskrit: दरुहो निषत्ता पर्शनी चिदेवैः पुरू शंसेन वाव्र्धुष्ट इन्द्रम अभीव्र्तेव ता महापदेन धवान्तात परपित्वादुदरन्त गर्भाः |||
verses.transliteration: druho niṣattā pṛśanī cidevaiḥ purū śaṃsena vāvṛdhuṣṭa indram abhīvṛteva tā mahāpadena dhvāntāt prapitvādudaranta gharbhāḥ

translations.griffith: There with fiend's ways e’en Pṛśni was seated: with much laudation they exalted Indra.  As if encompassed by the Mighty-footed, from darkness, near at hand, forth came the Children.

verses.sanskrit: रष्वा ते पादा पर यज्जिगास्यवर्धन वाजा उत ये चिदत्र तवमिन्द्र सालाव्र्कान सहस्रमासन दधिषे अश्विनावव्र्त्याः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣvā te pādā pra yajjighāsyavardhan vājā uta ye cidatra tvamindra sālāvṛkān sahasramāsan dadhiṣe aśvināvavṛtyāḥ

translations.griffith: High are thy feet when on thy way thou goest: the strength thou foundest here hath lent thee vigour.  Thousand hyenas in thy mouth thou holdest. O Indra, mayst thou turn the Aśvins hither.

verses.sanskrit: समना तूर्णिरुप यासि यज्ञमा नासत्या सख्यायवक्षि वसाव्यामिन्द्र धारयः सहस्राश्विना शूर ददतुर्मघानि |||
verses.transliteration: samanā tūrṇirupa yāsi yajñamā nāsatyā sakhyāyavakṣi vasāvyāmindra dhārayaḥ sahasrāśvinā śūra dadaturmaghāni

translations.griffith: Speeding at once to sacrifice thou comest for friendship thou art bringing both Nāsatyas.  Thou hadst a thousand treasures in possession. The Aśvins, O thou Hero, gave thee riches.

verses.sanskrit: मन्दमान रतादधि परजायै सखिभिरिन्द्र इषिरेभिरर्थम आभिर्हि माया उप दस्युमागान मिहः परतम्रा अवपत तमांसि |||
verses.transliteration: mandamāna ṛtādadhi prajāyai sakhibhirindra iṣirebhirartham ābhirhi māyā upa dasyumāghān mihaḥ pratamrā avapat tamāṃsi

translations.griffith: Glad, for the race that rests on holy Order, with friends who hasten to their goal, hath Indra  With these his magic powers assailed the Dasyu: he cast away the gloomy mists, the darkness.

verses.sanskrit: सनामाना चिद धवसयो नयस्मा अवाहन्निन्द्र उषसोयथानः रष्वैरगछः सखिभिर्निकामैः साकम्प्रतिष्ठा हर्द्या जघन्थ ||
verses.transliteration: sanāmānā cid dhvasayo nyasmā avāhannindra uṣasoyathānaḥ ṛṣvairaghachaḥ sakhibhirnikāmaiḥ sākampratiṣṭhā hṛdyā jaghantha

translations.griffith: Two of like name for him didst thou demolish, as Indra striking down the car of Uṣas.  With thy beloved lofty Friends thou camest, and with the assurance of thine heart thou slewest.

verses.sanskrit: तवं जघन्थ नमुचिं मखस्युं दासं कर्ण्वान रषयेविमायम तवं चकर्थ मनवे सयोनान पथो देवत्राञ्जसेवयानान |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ jaghantha namuciṃ makhasyuṃ dāsaṃ kṛṇvāna ṛṣayevimāyam tvaṃ cakartha manave syonān patho devatrāñjasevayānān

translations.griffith: War-loving Namuci thou smotest, robbing the Dāsa of his magic for the Ṛṣi.  For man thou madest ready pleasant pathways, paths leading as it were directly God-ward.

verses.sanskrit: तवमेतानि पप्रिषे वि नामेशान इन्द्र दधिषे गभस्तौ अनु तवा देवाः शवसा मदन्त्युपरिबुध्नान वनिनश्चकर्थ |||
verses.transliteration: tvametāni papriṣe vi nāmeśāna indra dadhiṣe ghabhastau anu tvā devāḥ śavasā madantyuparibudhnān vaninaścakartha

translations.griffith: These names of thine thou hast fulfilled completely: as Lord, thou boldest in thine arm, O Indra.  In thee, through thy great might, the Gods are joyful: the roots of trees hast thou directed upward.

verses.sanskrit: चक्रं यदस्याप्स्वा निषत्तमुतो तदस्मै मध्विच्चछद्यात पर्थिव्यामतिषितं यदूधः पयो गोष्वदधा ओषधीषु |||
verses.transliteration: cakraṃ yadasyāpsvā niṣattamuto tadasmai madhviccachadyāt pṛthivyāmatiṣitaṃ yadūdhaḥ payo ghoṣvadadhā oṣadhīṣu

translations.griffith: May the sweet Soma juices make him happy to cast his quoit that lies in depth of waters.  Thou from the udder which o’er earth is fastened hast poured the milk into the kine and herbage.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वादियायेति यद वदन्त्योजसो जातमुत मन्य एनम मन्योरियाय हर्म्येषु तस्थौ यतः परजज्ञ इन्द्रो अस्य वेद |||
verses.transliteration: aśvādiyāyeti yad vadantyojaso jātamuta manya enam manyoriyāya harmyeṣu tasthau yataḥ prajajña indro asya veda

translations.griffith: When others call him offspring of the Courser, my meaning is that Mighty Power produced him.  He came from Manyu and remained in houses: whence he hath sprung is known to Indra only.

verses.sanskrit: वयः सुपर्णा उप सेदुरिन्द्रं परियमेधा रषयोनाधमानाः अप धवान्तमूर्णुहि पूर्धि चक्षुर्मुमुग्ध्यस्मान निधयेव बद्धान |||
verses.transliteration: vayaḥ suparṇā upa sedurindraṃ priyamedhā ṛṣayonādhamānāḥ apa dhvāntamūrṇuhi pūrdhi cakṣurmumughdhyasmān nidhayeva baddhān

translations.griffith: Like birds of beauteous wing the Priyamedhas, Ṛṣis, imploring, have come nigh to Indra:  Dispel the darkness and fill full our vision deliver us as men whom snares entangle.

verses.sanskrit: वसूनां वा चर्क्र्ष इयक्षन धिया वा यज्ञैर्वारोदस्योः अर्वन्तो वा ये रयिमन्तः सातौ वनुं वा येसुश्रुणं सुश्रुतो धुः |||
verses.transliteration: vasūnāṃ vā carkṛṣa iyakṣan dhiyā vā yajñairvārodasyoḥ arvanto vā ye rayimantaḥ sātau vanuṃ vā yesuśruṇaṃ suśruto dhuḥ

translations.griffith: I AM prepared to laud with song or worship the Noble Ones who are in earth and heaven,  Or Coursers who have triumphed in, the contest, or those who famed, have won the prize with glory.

verses.sanskrit: हव एषामसुरो नक्षत दयां शरवस्यता मनसा निंसतक्षा चक्षाणा यत्र सुविताय देवा दयौर्न वारेभिःक्र्णवन्त सवैः |||
verses.transliteration: hava eṣāmasuro nakṣata dyāṃ śravasyatā manasā niṃsatakṣā cakṣāṇā yatra suvitāya devā dyaurna vārebhiḥkṛṇavanta svaiḥ

translations.griffith: Their call, the call of Gods, went up to heaven: they kissed the ground with glory-seeking spirit,  There where the Gods look on for happy fortune, and like the kindly heavens bestow their bounties.

verses.sanskrit: इयमेषामम्र्तानां गीः सर्वताता ये कर्पणन्त रत्नम धियं च यज्ञं च साधन्तस्ते नो धान्तु वसव्यमसामि |||
verses.transliteration: iyameṣāmamṛtānāṃ ghīḥ sarvatātā ye kṛpaṇanta ratnam dhiyaṃ ca yajñaṃ ca sādhantaste no dhāntu vasavyamasāmi

translations.griffith: This is the song of those Immortal Beings who long for treasures in their full perfection.  May these, completing prayers and sacrifices, bestow upon us wealth where naught is wanting.

verses.sanskrit: आ तत त इन्द्रायवः पनन्तभि य ऊर्वं गोमन्तन्तित्र्त्सान सक्र्त्स्वं ये पुरुपुत्रां महीं सहस्रधाराम्ब्र्हतीं दुदुक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: ā tat ta indrāyavaḥ panantabhi ya ūrvaṃ ghomantantitṛtsān sakṛtsvaṃ ye puruputrāṃ mahīṃ sahasradhārāmbṛhatīṃ dudukṣan

translations.griffith: Those living men extolled thy deed, O Indra, those who would fain burst through the stall of cattle,  Fain to milk her who bare but once, great, lofty, whose Sons are many and her streams past number.

verses.sanskrit: शचीव इन्द्रमवसे कर्णुध्वमनानतं दमयन्तं पर्तन्यून रभुक्षणं मघवानं सुव्र्क्तिं भर्ता यो वज्रं नर्यम्पुरुक्षुः |||
verses.transliteration: śacīva indramavase kṛṇudhvamanānataṃ damayantaṃ pṛtanyūn ṛbhukṣaṇaṃ maghavānaṃ suvṛktiṃ bhartā yo vajraṃ naryampurukṣuḥ

translations.griffith: Sacivan, win to your assistance Indra who never bends, who overcomes his foemen.  Ṛbhukṣan, Maghavan, the hymn's upholder, who, rich in food, bears man's kind friend, the thunder.

verses.sanskrit: यद वावान पुरुतमं पुराषाळ आ वर्त्रहेन्द्रो नामान्यप्राः अचेति परासहस पतिस्तुविष्मान यदीमुश्मसिकर्तवे करत तत |||
verses.transliteration: yad vāvāna purutamaṃ purāṣāḷ ā vṛtrahendro nāmānyaprāḥ aceti prāsahas patistuviṣmān yadīmuśmasikartave karat tat

translations.griffith: Since he who won of old anew hath triumphed, Indra hath earned his name of Vṛtra-slaycr.  He hath appeared, the mighty Lord of Conquest. What we would have him do let him accomplish.

verses.sanskrit: पर सु व आपो महिमानमुत्तमं कारुर्वोचाति सदनेविवस्वतः पर सप्त-सप्त तरेधा हि चक्रमुः परस्र्त्वरीणामति सिन्धुरोजसा |||
verses.transliteration: pra su va āpo mahimānamuttamaṃ kārurvocāti sadanevivasvataḥ pra sapta-sapta tredhā hi cakramuḥ prasṛtvarīṇāmati sindhurojasā

translations.griffith: THE singer, O ye Waters in Vivasvān's place, shall tell your grandeur forth that is beyond compare.  The Rivers have come forward triply, seven and seven. Sindhu in might surpasses all the streams that flow.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते.अरदद वरुणो यातवे पथः सिन्धो यद वाजानभ्यद्रवस्त्वम भूम्या अधि परवता यासि सानुना यदेषामग्रं जगतामिरज्यसि |||
verses.transliteration: pra te.aradad varuṇo yātave pathaḥ sindho yad vājānabhyadravastvam bhūmyā adhi pravatā yāsi sānunā yadeṣāmaghraṃ jaghatāmirajyasi

translations.griffith: Varuṇa cut the channels for thy forward course, O Sindhu, when thou rannest on to win the race.  Thou speedest o’er precipitous ridges of the earth, when thou art Lord and Leader of these moving floods.

verses.sanskrit: दिवि सवनो यतते भूम्योपर्यनन्तं शुष्ममुदियर्तिभानुना अभ्रादिव पर सतनयन्ति वर्ष्टयः सिन्धुर्यदेति वर्षभो न रोरुवत |||
verses.transliteration: divi svano yatate bhūmyoparyanantaṃ śuṣmamudiyartibhānunā abhrādiva pra stanayanti vṛṣṭayaḥ sindhuryadeti vṛṣabho na roruvat

translations.griffith: His roar is lifted up to heaven above the earth: he puts forth endless vigour with a flash of light.  Like floods of rain that fall in thunder from the cloud, so Sindhu rushes on bellowing like a bull.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा सिन्धो शिशुमिन न मातरो वाश्रा अर्षन्तिपयसेव धेनवः राजेव युध्वा नयसि तवमित सिचौ यदासामग्रं परवतामिनक्षसि |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā sindho śiśumin na mātaro vāśrā arṣantipayaseva dhenavaḥ rājeva yudhvā nayasi tvamit sicau yadāsāmaghraṃ pravatāminakṣasi

translations.griffith: Like mothers to their calves, like milch kine with their milk, so, Sindhu, unto thee the roaring rivers run.  Thou leadest as a warrior king thine army's wings what time thou comest in the van of these swift streams.

verses.sanskrit: इमं मे गङगे यमुने सरस्वति शुतुद्रि सतेमं सचता परुष्ण्या असिक्न्या मरुद्व्र्धे वितस्तयार्जीकीये शर्णुह्यासुषोमया |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ me ghaṅghe yamune sarasvati śutudri stemaṃ sacatā paruṣṇyā asiknyā marudvṛdhe vitastayārjīkīye śṛṇuhyāsuṣomayā

translations.griffith: Favour ye this my laud, O Gan!gā, Yamunā, O Sutudri, Paruṣṇī and Sarasvatī:  With Asikni, Vitasta, O Marudvrdha, O Ārjīkīya with Susoma hear my call.

verses.sanskrit: तर्ष्टामया परथमं यातवे सजूः ससर्त्वा रसयाश्वेत्या तया तवं सिन्धो कुभया गोमतीं करुमुम्मेहत्न्वा सरथं याभिरीयसे |||
verses.transliteration: tṛṣṭāmayā prathamaṃ yātave sajūḥ sasartvā rasayāśvetyā tyā tvaṃ sindho kubhayā ghomatīṃ krumummehatnvā sarathaṃ yābhirīyase

translations.griffith: First with Trstama thou art eager to flow forth, with Rasā, and Susartu, and with Svetya here,  With Kubha; and with these, Sindhu and Mehatnu, thou seekest in thy course Krumu and Gomati.

verses.sanskrit: रजीत्येनी रुशती महित्वा परि जरयांसि भरते रजांसि अदब्धा सिन्धुरपसामपस्तमाश्वा न चित्रावपुषीव दर्शता |||
verses.transliteration: ṛjītyenī ruśatī mahitvā pari jrayāṃsi bharate rajāṃsi adabdhā sindhurapasāmapastamāśvā na citrāvapuṣīva darśatā

translations.griffith: Flashing and whitely-gleaming in her mightiness, she moves along her ample volumes through the realms,  Most active of the active, Sindhu unrestrained, like to a dappled mare, beautiful, fair to see.

verses.sanskrit: सवश्वा सिन्धुः सुरथा सुवासा हिरण्ययी सुक्र्तावाजिनीवती ऊर्णावती युवतिः सीलमावत्युताधि वस्तेसुभगा मधुव्र्धम |||
verses.transliteration: svaśvā sindhuḥ surathā suvāsā hiraṇyayī sukṛtāvājinīvatī ūrṇāvatī yuvatiḥ sīlamāvatyutādhi vastesubhaghā madhuvṛdham

translations.griffith: Rich in good steeds is Sindhu, rich in cars and robes, rich in gold, nobly-fashioned, rich in ample wealth.  Blest Silamavati and young Urnavati invest themselves with raiment rich in store of sweets.

verses.sanskrit: सुखं रथं युयुजे सिधुरश्विनं तेन वाजं सनिषदस्मिन्नाजौ महान हयस्य महिमा पनस्यते.अदब्धस्यस्वयशसो विरप्शिनः |||
verses.transliteration: sukhaṃ rathaṃ yuyuje sidhuraśvinaṃ tena vājaṃ saniṣadasminnājau mahān hyasya mahimā panasyate.adabdhasyasvayaśaso virapśinaḥ

translations.griffith: Sindhu hath yoked her car, light-rolling, drawn by steeds, and with that car shall she win booty in this fight.  So have I praised its power, mighty and unrestrained, of independent glory, roaring as it runs.

verses.sanskrit: आ व रञ्जस ऊर्जां वयुष्टिष्विन्द्रं मरुतो रोदसीनक्तन उभे यथा नो अहनी सचाभुवा सदः-सदोवरिवस्यात उद्भिदा |||
verses.transliteration: ā va ṛñjasa ūrjāṃ vyuṣṭiṣvindraṃ maruto rodasīanaktana ubhe yathā no ahanī sacābhuvā sadaḥ-sadovarivasyāta udbhidā

translations.griffith: I GRASP at you when power and strength begin to dawn: bedew ye, Indra and the Maruts, Heaven and Earth,  That Day and Night, in every hall of sacrifice, may wait on us and bless us when they first spring forth.

verses.sanskrit: तदु शरेष्ठं सवनं सुनोतनातयो न हस्तयतो अद्रिःसोतरि विदद धयर्यो अभिभूति पौंस्यं महो राये चित्तरुते यदर्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: tadu śreṣṭhaṃ savanaṃ sunotanātyo na hastayato adriḥsotari vidad dhyaryo abhibhūti pauṃsyaṃ maho rāye cittarute yadarvataḥ

translations.griffith: Press the libation out, most excellent of all: the Pressing-stone is grasped like a hand-guided steed.  So let it win the valour that subdues the foe, and the fleet courser's might that speeds to ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit: तदिद धयस्य सवनं विवेरपो यथा पुरा मनवेगातुमश्रेत गोर्णसि तवाष्ट्रे अश्वनिर्णिजि परेमध्वरेष्वध्वरानशिश्रयुः |||
verses.transliteration: tadid dhyasya savanaṃ viverapo yathā purā manaveghātumaśret ghoarṇasi tvāṣṭre aśvanirṇiji premadhvareṣvadhvarānaśiśrayuḥ

translations.griffith: Juice that this Stone pours out removes defect of ours, as in old time it brought prosperity to man.  At sacrifices they established holy rites on Tvaṣṭar's milk-blent juice bright with the hue of steeds.

verses.sanskrit: अप हत रक्षसो भङगुरावत सकभायत निरतिंसेधतामतिम आ नो रयिं सर्ववीरं सुनोतन देवाव्यम्भरत शलोकमद्रयः |||
verses.transliteration: apa hata rakṣaso bhaṅghurāvata skabhāyata nirtiṃsedhatāmatim ā no rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ sunotana devāvyambharata ślokamadrayaḥ

translations.griffith: Drive ye the treacherous demons far away from us: keep Nirrti afar and banish Penury.  Pour riches forth for us with troops of hero sons, and bear ye up, O Stones, the song that visits Gods.

verses.sanskrit: दिवश्चिदा वो.अमवत्तरेभ्यो विभ्वना चिदाश्वपस्तरेभ्यः वायोश्चिद सोमरभस्तरेभ्यो.अग्नेश्चिदर्चपितुक्र्त्तरेभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: divaścidā vo.amavattarebhyo vibhvanā cidāśvapastarebhyaḥ vāyościda somarabhastarebhyo.aghneścidarcapitukṛttarebhyaḥ

translations.griffith: To you who are more mighty than the heavens themselves, who, finishing your task with more than Vibhvan's speed,  More rapidly than Vāyu seize the Soma juice, better than Agni give us food, to you I sing.

verses.sanskrit: भुरन्तु नो यशसः सोत्वन्धसो गरावाणो वाचा दिवितादिवित्मता नरो यत्र दुहते काम्यं मध्वाघोषयन्तोभितो मिथस्तुरः |||
verses.transliteration: bhurantu no yaśasaḥ sotvandhaso ghrāvāṇo vācā divitādivitmatā naro yatra duhate kāmyaṃ madhvāghoṣayantoabhito mithasturaḥ

translations.griffith: Stirred be the glorious Stones: let it press out the juice, the Stone with heavenly song that reaches up to heaven,  There where the men draw forth the meath for which they long, sending their voice around in rivalry of speed.

verses.sanskrit: सुन्वन्ति सोमं रथिरासो अद्रयो निरस्य रसं गविषोदुहन्ति ते दुहन्त्यूधरुपसेचनाय कं नरो हव्य नामर्जयन्त आसभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sunvanti somaṃ rathirāso adrayo nirasya rasaṃ ghaviṣoduhanti te duhantyūdharupasecanāya kaṃ naro havya nāmarjayanta āsabhiḥ

translations.griffith: The Stones press out the Soma, swift as car-borne men, and, eager for the spoil, drain forth the sap thereof  To fill the beaker, they exhaust the udder's store, as the men purify oblations with their lips.

verses.sanskrit: एते नरः सवपसो अभूतन य इन्द्राय सुनुथ सोममद्रयः वामं-वामं वो दिव्याय धाम्ने वसु-वसु वः पार्थिवयसुन्वते |||
verses.transliteration: ete naraḥ svapaso abhūtana ya indrāya sunutha somamadrayaḥ vāmaṃ-vāmaṃ vo divyāya dhāmne vasu-vasu vaḥ pārthivayasunvate

translations.griffith: Ye, present men, have been most skilful in your work, even ye, O Stones who pressed Soma for Indra's drink.  May all ye have of fair go to the Heavenly Race, and all your treasure to the earthly worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्रप्रुषो न वाचा परुषा वसु हविष्मन्तो न यज्ञाविजानुषः सुमारुतं न बरह्माणमर्हसे गणमस्तोष्येषां न शोभसे |||
verses.transliteration: abhrapruṣo na vācā pruṣā vasu haviṣmanto na yajñāvijānuṣaḥ sumārutaṃ na brahmāṇamarhase ghaṇamastoṣyeṣāṃ na śobhase

translations.griffith: As with their voice from cloud they sprinkle treasure so are the wise man's liberal sacrifices.  I praise their Company that merits worship as the good Martits' priest to pay them honour.

verses.sanskrit: शरिये मर्यासो अञ्जीन्रक्र्ण्वत सुमरुतं न पूर्विरतिक्षपः दिवस पुत्रास एता न येतिर आदित्यासस्ते अक्रन वाव्र्धुः |||
verses.transliteration: śriye maryāso añjīnrakṛṇvata sumarutaṃ na pūrviratikṣapaḥ divas putrāsa etā na yetira ādityāsaste akrana vāvṛdhuḥ

translations.griffith: The youths have wrought their ornaments for glory through many nights,—this noble band of Maruts.  Like stags the Sons of Dyatis have striven onward, the Sons of Aditi grown strong like pillars.

verses.sanskrit: पर ये दिवः पर्थिव्य न बर्हणा तमना रिरिच्रे अभ्रान्न सूर्यः पाजस्वन्तो न वीराः पनस्यवो रिशादसो नमर्या अभिद्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye divaḥ pṛthivya na barhaṇā tmanā riricre abhrānna sūryaḥ pājasvanto na vīrāḥ panasyavo riśādaso namaryā abhidyavaḥ

translations.griffith: They who extend beyond the earth and heaven, by their own mass, as from the cloud spreads Sūrya;  Like mighty Heroes covetous of glory, like heavenly gallants who destroy the wicked.

verses.sanskrit: युष्माकं बुध्ने अपां न यामनि विथुर्यति न महीश्रथर्यति विश्वप्सुर्यज्ञो अर्वागयं सु वःप्रयस्वन्तो न सत्राच आ गत |||
verses.transliteration: yuṣmākaṃ budhne apāṃ na yāmani vithuryati na mahīśratharyati viśvapsuryajño arvāghayaṃ su vaḥprayasvanto na satrāca ā ghata

translations.griffith: When ye come nigh, as in the depth of waters, the earth is loosened, as it were, and shaken.  This your all-feedin sacrifice approaches: come all united, fraught, as ’twere with viands.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं धूर्षु परयुजो न रश्मिभिर्ज्योतिष्मन्तो न भासाव्युष्टिषु शयेनासो न सवयशसो रिशादसः परवासोन परसितासः परिप्रुषः |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ dhūrṣu prayujo na raśmibhirjyotiṣmanto na bhāsāvyuṣṭiṣu śyenāso na svayaśaso riśādasaḥ pravāsona prasitāsaḥ paripruṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye are like horses fastened to the chariot poles, luminous with your beams, with splendour as at dawn;  Like self-bright falcons, punishers of wicked men, like hovering birds urged forward, scattering rain around.

verses.sanskrit: पर यद वहध्वे मरुतः पराकाद यूयं महःसंवरणस्य वस्वः विदानासो वसवो राध्यस्याराच्चिद्द्वेषः सनुतर्युयोत |||
verses.transliteration: pra yad vahadhve marutaḥ parākād yūyaṃ mahaḥsaṃvaraṇasya vasvaḥ vidānāso vasavo rādhyasyārācciddveṣaḥ sanutaryuyota

translations.griffith: When ye come forth, O Maruts, from the distance, from the great treasury of rich possessions,  Knowing, O Vasus, boons that should be granted, even from afar drive back the men who hate us.

verses.sanskrit: य उद्र्चि यज्ञे अध्वरेष्ठा मरुद्भ्यो न मानुषो ददाशत रेवत स वयो दधते सुवीरं स देवानामपि गोपीथेस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: ya udṛci yajñe adhvareṣṭhā marudbhyo na mānuṣo dadāśat revat sa vayo dadhate suvīraṃ sa devānāmapi ghopītheastu

translations.griffith: He who, engaged in the rite's final duty brings, as a man, oblation to the Maruts,  Wins him life's wealthy fulness, blest with heroes: he shall be present, too, where Gods drink Soma.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि यज्ञेषु यज्ञियास ऊमा आदित्येन नाम्नाशम्भविष्ठाः ते नो.अवन्तु रथतूर्मनीषां महश्चयामन्नध्वरे चकानाः |||
verses.transliteration: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsa ūmā ādityena nāmnāśambhaviṣṭhāḥ te no.avantu rathatūrmanīṣāṃ mahaścayāmannadhvare cakānāḥ

translations.griffith: For these are helps adored at sacrifices, bringing good fortune by their name Ādityas.  Speeding on cars let them protect our praises, delighting in our sacrifice and worship.

verses.sanskrit: विप्रासो न मन्मभिः सवाध्यो देवाव्यो न यज्ञैःस्वप्नसः राजानो न चित्राः सुसन्द्र्शः कषितीनां नमर्या अरेपसः |||
verses.transliteration: viprāso na manmabhiḥ svādhyo devāvyo na yajñaiḥsvapnasaḥ rājāno na citrāḥ susandṛśaḥ kṣitīnāṃ namaryā arepasaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye by your hymns are like high-thoughted singers, skilful, inviting Gods with sacrifices;  Fair to behold, like Kings, with bright adornment, like spotless gallants, leaders of the people:

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्न ये भाजसा रुक्मवक्षसो वातासो न सवयुजःसद्यूतयः परज्ञातारो न जयेष्ठाः सुनीतयःसुशर्माणो न सोमा रतं यते |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirna ye bhājasā rukmavakṣaso vātāso na svayujaḥsadyaūtayaḥ prajñātāro na jyeṣṭhāḥ sunītayaḥsuśarmāṇo na somā ṛtaṃ yate

translations.griffith: Like fire with flashing flame, breast-bound with chains of gold, like tempest-blasts, self-moving, swift to lend your aid;  As best of all foreknowers, excellent to guide, like Somas, good to guard the man who follows Law.

verses.sanskrit: वातासो न ये धुनयो जिगत्नवो.अग्नीनां न जिह्वाविरोकिणः वर्मण्वन्तो न योधाः शिमीवन्तः पितॄणांन शंसाः सुरातयः |||
verses.transliteration: vātāso na ye dhunayo jighatnavo.aghnīnāṃ na jihvāvirokiṇaḥ varmaṇvanto na yodhāḥ śimīvantaḥ pitṝṇāṃna śaṃsāḥ surātayaḥ

translations.griffith: Shakers of all, like gales of wind they travel, like tongues of burning fires in their effulgence.  Mighty are they as warriors clad in armour, and, like the Fathers' prayers, Most Bounteous Givers.

verses.sanskrit: रथानां न ये.अराः सनाभयो जिगीवांसो न शूराभिद्यवः वरेयवो न मर्या घर्तप्रुषो.अभिस्वर्तारोर्कं न सुष्टुभः |||
verses.transliteration: rathānāṃ na ye.arāḥ sanābhayo jighīvāṃso na śūrāabhidyavaḥ vareyavo na maryā ghṛtapruṣo.abhisvartāroarkaṃ na suṣṭubhaḥ

translations.griffith: Like spokes of car-wheels in one nave united, ever victorious like heavenly Heroes,  Shedding their precious balm like youthful suitors, they raise their voice and chant their psalm as singers.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वासो न ये जयेष्ठास आशवो दिधिषवो न रथ्यःसुदानवः आपो न निम्नैरुदभिर्जिगत्नवो विश्वरूपाङगिरसो न सामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvāso na ye jyeṣṭhāsa āśavo didhiṣavo na rathyaḥsudānavaḥ āpo na nimnairudabhirjighatnavo viśvarūpāaṅghiraso na sāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: They who are fleet to travel like the noblest steeds, long to obtain the prize like bounteous charioteers,  Like waters speeding on with their precipitous floods, like omniform Aṅgirases with Sāma-hymns.

verses.sanskrit: गरावाणो न सूरयः सिन्धुमातर आदर्दिरासो अद्रयो नविश्वहा शिशूला न करीळयः सुमातरो महाग्रामो नयामन्नुत तविषा |||
verses.transliteration: ghrāvāṇo na sūrayaḥ sindhumātara ādardirāso adrayo naviśvahā śiśūlā na krīḷayaḥ sumātaro mahāghrāmo nayāmannuta tviṣā

translations.griffith: Born from the stream, like press-stones are the Princes, for ever like the stones that crush in pieces;  Sons of a beauteous Dame, like playful children, like a great host upon the march with splendour.

verses.sanskrit: उषसां न केतवो.अध्वरश्रियः शुभंयवो नाञ्जिभिर्व्यश्वितन सिन्धवो न ययियो भराजद्र्ष्टयः परावतो नयोजनानि ममिरे |||
verses.transliteration: uṣasāṃ na ketavo.adhvaraśriyaḥ śubhaṃyavo nāñjibhirvyaśvitan sindhavo na yayiyo bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ parāvato nayojanāni mamire

translations.griffith: Like rays of Dawn, the visitors of sacrifice, they shine with ornaments as eager to be bright.  Like rivers hasting on, glittering with their spears, from far away they measure out the distances.

verses.sanskrit: सुभागान नो देवाः कर्णुता सुरत्नानस्मान सतोतॄन मरुतोवाव्र्धानाः अधि सतोत्रस्य सख्यस्य गात सनाद धि वोरत्नधेयानि सन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: subhāghān no devāḥ kṛṇutā suratnānasmān stotṝn marutovāvṛdhānāḥ adhi stotrasya sakhyasya ghāta sanād dhi voratnadheyāni santi

translations.griffith: Gods, send us happiness and make us wealthy, letting us singers prosper, O ye Maruts.  Bethink you of our praise and of our friendship: ye from of old have riches to vouchsafe us.

verses.sanskrit: अपश्यमस्य महतो महित्वममर्त्यस्य मर्त्यासु विक्षु नाना हनू विभ्र्ते सं भरेते असिन्वती बप्सती भूर्यत्तः |||
verses.transliteration: apaśyamasya mahato mahitvamamartyasya martyāsu vikṣu nānā hanū vibhṛte saṃ bharete asinvatī bapsatī bhūryattaḥ

translations.griffith: I HAVE beheld the might of this Great Being. Immortal in the midst of tribes of mortals.  His jaws now open and now shut together: much they devour, insatiately chewing.

verses.sanskrit: गुहा शिरो निहितं रधगक्षी असिन्वन्नत्ति जिह्वयावनानि अत्राण्यस्मै पड्भिः सं भरन्त्युत्तानहस्तानमसाधि विक्षु |||
verses.transliteration: ghuhā śiro nihitaṃ ṛdhaghakṣī asinvannatti jihvayāvanāni atrāṇyasmai paḍbhiḥ saṃ bharantyuttānahastānamasādhi vikṣu

translations.griffith: His eyes are turned away, his head is hidden: unsated with his tongue he eats the fuel.  With hands upraised, with reverence in the houses, for him they quickly bring his food together.

verses.sanskrit: पर मातुः परतरं गुह्यमिछन कुमारो न वीरुधःसर्पदुर्वीः ससं न पक्वमविदच्छुचन्तंरिरिह्वांसं रिप उपस्थे अन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: pra mātuḥ prataraṃ ghuhyamichan kumāro na vīrudhaḥsarpadurvīḥ sasaṃ na pakvamavidacchucantaṃririhvāṃsaṃ ripa upasthe antaḥ

translations.griffith: Seeking, as ’twere, his Mother's secret bosom, he, like a child, creeps on through wide-spread bushes.  One he finds glowing like hot food made ready, and kissing deep within the earth's recmes.

verses.sanskrit: तद वां रतं रोदसी पर बरवीमि जायमानो मातरा गर्भोत्ति नाहं देवस्य मर्त्यश्चिकेताग्निरङग विचेताः सप्रचेताः |||
verses.transliteration: tad vāṃ ṛtaṃ rodasī pra bravīmi jāyamāno mātarā gharbhoatti nāhaṃ devasya martyaściketāghniraṅgha vicetāḥ sapracetāḥ

translations.griffith: This holy Law I tell you, Earth and Heaven: the Infant at his birth dovours his Parents.  No knowledge of the God have I, a mortal. Yea, Agni knoweth best, for he hath wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: यो अस्मा अन्नं तर्ष्वादधात्याज्यैर्घ्र्तैर्जुहोतिपुष्यति तस्मै सहस्रमक्षभिर्वि चक्षे.अग्ने विश्वतःप्रत्यंं असि तवम |||
verses.transliteration: yo asmā annaṃ tṛṣvādadhātyājyairghṛtairjuhotipuṣyati tasmai sahasramakṣabhirvi cakṣe.aghne viśvataḥpratyaṃṃ asi tvam

translations.griffith: This man who quickly gives him food, who offers his gifts of oil and butter and supports him, -  Him with his thousand eyes he closely looks on: thou showest him thy face from all sides, Agni.

verses.sanskrit: किं देवेषु तयज एनश्चकर्थाग्ने पर्छामि नु तवामविद्वान अक्रीळन करीळन हरिरत्तवे.अदन वि पर्वशश्चकर्त गामिवासिः |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ deveṣu tyaja enaścakarthāghne pṛchāmi nu tvāmavidvān akrīḷan krīḷan harirattave.adan vi parvaśaścakarta ghāmivāsiḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, hast thou committed sin or treason among the Gods? In ignorance I ask thee.  Playing, not playing, he gold-hued and toothless, hath cut his food up as the knife a victim.

verses.sanskrit: विषूचो अश्वान युयुजे वनेजा रजीतिभी रशनाभिर्ग्र्भीतान चक्षदे मित्रो वसुभिः सुजातः समान्र्धेपर्वभिर्वाव्र्धानः |||
verses.transliteration: viṣūco aśvān yuyuje vanejā ṛjītibhī raśanābhirghṛbhītān cakṣade mitro vasubhiḥ sujātaḥ samānṛdheparvabhirvāvṛdhānaḥ

translations.griffith: He born in wood hath yoked his horses rushing in all directions, held with reins that glitter.  The well-born friend hath carved his food with Vasus: in all his limbs he hath increased and prospered.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निः सप्तिं वाजम्भरं ददात्यग्निर्वीरं शरुत्यंकर्मनिष्ठाम अग्नी रोदसी वि चरत समञ्जन्नग्निर्नारीं वीरकुक्षिं पुरन्धिम |||
verses.transliteration: aghniḥ saptiṃ vājambharaṃ dadātyaghnirvīraṃ śrutyaṃkarmaniṣṭhām aghnī rodasī vi carat samañjannaghnirnārīṃ vīrakukṣiṃ purandhim

translations.griffith: AGNI bestows the fleet prize-winning courser: Agni, the hero famed and firm in duty.  Agni pervades and decks the earth and heaven, and fills the fruitful dame who teems with heroes.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नेरप्नसः समिदस्तु भद्राग्निर्मही रोदसी आ विवेश अग्निरेकं चोदयत समत्स्वग्निर्व्र्त्राणि दयते पुरूणि |||
verses.transliteration: aghnerapnasaḥ samidastu bhadrāghnirmahī rodasī ā viveśa aghnirekaṃ codayat samatsvaghnirvṛtrāṇi dayate purūṇi

translations.griffith: Blest be the wood that feeds the active Agni: within the two great worlds hath Agni entered.  Agni impels a single man to battle, and with him rends in pieces many a foeman.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्ह तयं जरतः कर्णमावाग्निरद्भ्यो निरदहज्जरूथम अग्निरत्रिं घर्म उरुष्यदन्तरग्निर्न्र्मेधम्प्र जयास्र्जत सम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirha tyaṃ jarataḥ karṇamāvāghniradbhyo niradahajjarūtham aghniratriṃ gharma uruṣyadantaraghnirnṛmedhampra jayāsṛjat sam

translations.griffith: Agni rejoiced the car of him who praised lim, and from the waters burnt away jarutha.  Agni saved Atri in the fiery cavem, and made Nrmedha rich with troops of children.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्दाद दरविणं वीरपेशा अग्निरषिं यः सहस्रासनोति अग्निर्दिवि हव्यमा ततानाग्नेर्धामानिविभ्र्ता पुरुत्रा |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirdād draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā aghnirṣiṃ yaḥ sahasrāsanoti aghnirdivi havyamā tatānāghnerdhāmānivibhṛtā purutrā

translations.griffith: Agni hath granted wealth that decks the hero, and sent the sage who wins a thousand cattle.  Agni hath made oblations rise to heaven: to every place are Agni's laws extended.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निमुक्थैरषयो वि हवयन्ते.अग्निं नरो यामनिबाधितासः अग्निं वयो अन्तरिक्षे पतन्तो.अग्निः सहस्रापरि याति गोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnimukthairṣayo vi hvayante.aghniṃ naro yāmanibādhitāsaḥ aghniṃ vayo antarikṣe patanto.aghniḥ sahasrāpari yāti ghonām

translations.griffith: With songs of praise the Ṛṣis call on Agni; on Agni, heroes worsted in the foray.  Birds flying in the region call on Agni around a thousand cattle Agni wanders.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं विश ईळते मानुषीर्या अग्निं मनुषो नहुषो विजाताः अग्निर्गान्धर्वीं पथ्यां रतस्याग्नेर्गव्यूतिर्घ्र्त आ निषत्ता |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ viśa īḷate mānuṣīryā aghniṃ manuṣo nahuṣo vijātāḥ aghnirghāndharvīṃ pathyāṃ ṛtasyāghnerghavyūtirghṛta ā niṣattā

translations.griffith: Races of human birth pay Agni worship, men who have sprung from Nahus' line adore him.  Stablished in holy oil is Agni's pasture, on the Gandharva path of Law and Order.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नये बरह्म रभवस्ततक्षुरग्निं महामवोचामा सुव्र्क्तिम अग्ने पराव जरितारं यविष्ठाग्ने महि दरविणमायजस्व |||
verses.transliteration: aghnaye brahma ṛbhavastatakṣuraghniṃ mahāmavocāmā suvṛktim aghne prāva jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭhāghne mahi draviṇamāyajasva

translations.griffith: The Ṛbhus fabricated prayer for Agni, and we with mighty hymns have called on Agni.  Agni, Most Youthful God, protect the singer: win us by worship, Agni, great possessions.

verses.sanskrit: य इमा विश्वा भुवनानि जुह्वद रषिर्होता नयसीदत्पिता नः स आशिषा दरविणमिछमानः परथमछदवराना विवेश |||
verses.transliteration: ya imā viśvā bhuvanāni juhvad ṛṣirhotā nyasīdatpitā naḥ sa āśiṣā draviṇamichamānaḥ prathamachadavarānā viveśa

translations.griffith: HE who sate down as Hotar-priest, the Ṛṣi, our Father, offering up all things existing,—  He, seeking through his wish a great possession, came among men on earth as archetypal.

verses.sanskrit: किं सविदासीदधिष्ठनमारम्भणं कतमत सवित्कथासीत यतो भूमिं जनयन विश्वकर्म वि दयामौर्णोन महिना विश्वचक्षाः |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ svidāsīdadhiṣṭhanamārambhaṇaṃ katamat svitkathāsīt yato bhūmiṃ janayan viśvakarma vi dyāmaurṇon mahinā viśvacakṣāḥ

translations.griffith: What was the place whereon he took his station? What was it that supported him? How was it?  Whence Visvakarman, seeing all, producing the earth, with mighty power disclosed the heavens.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वतश्चक्षुरुत विश्वतोमुखो विश्वतोबाहुरुतविश्वतस्पात सं बाहुभ्यां धमति सं पतत्रैर्द्यावाभूमी जनयन देव एकः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvataścakṣuruta viśvatomukho viśvatobāhurutaviśvataspāt saṃ bāhubhyāṃ dhamati saṃ patatrairdyāvābhūmī janayan deva ekaḥ

translations.griffith: He who hath eyes on all sides round about him, a mouth on all sides, arms and feet on all sides,  He, the Sole God, producing earth and heaven, weldeth them, with his arms as wings, together.

verses.sanskrit: किं सविद वनं क उ स वर्क्ष आस यतो दयावाप्र्थिवीनिष्टतक्षुः मनीषिणो मनसा पर्छतेदु तद यदध्यतिष्ठद भुवनानि धारयन |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivīniṣṭatakṣuḥ manīṣiṇo manasā pṛchatedu tad yadadhyatiṣṭhad bhuvanāni dhārayan

translations.griffith: What was the tree, what wood in sooth produced it, from which they fashioned out the earth and heaven?  Ye thoughtful men inquire within your spirit whereon he stood when he established all things.

verses.sanskrit: या ते धामानि परमाणि यावमा या मध्यमाविश्वकर्मन्नुतेमा शिक्षा सखिभ्यो हविषि सवधावःस्वयं यजस्व तन्वं वर्धानः |||
verses.transliteration: yā te dhāmāni paramāṇi yāvamā yā madhyamāviśvakarmannutemā śikṣā sakhibhyo haviṣi svadhāvaḥsvayaṃ yajasva tanvaṃ vṛdhānaḥ

translations.griffith: Nine highest, lowest, sacrificial natures, and these thy mid-most here, O Visvakarman,  Teach thou thy friends at sacrifice, O Blessed, and come thyself, exalted, to our worship.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वकर्मन हविषा वाव्र्धानः सवयं यजस्व पर्थिवीमुत दयाम मुह्यन्त्वन्ये अभितो जनास इहास्माकं मघवासूरिरस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: viśvakarman haviṣā vāvṛdhānaḥ svayaṃ yajasva pṛthivīmuta dyām muhyantvanye abhito janāsa ihāsmākaṃ maghavāsūrirastu

translations.griffith: Bring thou thyself, exalted with oblation, O Visvakarman, Earth and Heaven to worship.  Let other men around us live in folly here let us have a rich and liberal patron.

verses.sanskrit: वाचस पतिं विश्वकर्माणमूतये मनोजुवं वाजे अद्याहुवेम स नो विश्वानि हवनानि जोषद विश्वशम्भूरवसेसाधुकर्मा |||
verses.transliteration: vācas patiṃ viśvakarmāṇamūtaye manojuvaṃ vāje adyāhuvema sa no viśvāni havanāni joṣad viśvaśambhūravasesādhukarmā

translations.griffith: Let us invoke to-day, to aid our labour, the Lord of Speech, the thought-swift Visvakarman.  May he hear kindly all our invocations who gives all bliss for aid, whose works are righteous.

verses.sanskrit: चक्षुषः पिता मनसा हि धीरो घर्तमेने अजनन्नन्नमाने यदेदन्ता अदद्र्हन्त पूर्व आदिद्द्यावाप्र्थिवी अप्रथेताम |||
verses.transliteration: cakṣuṣaḥ pitā manasā hi dhīro ghṛtamene ajanannannamāne yadedantā adadṛhanta pūrva ādiddyāvāpṛthivī aprathetām

translations.griffith: THE Father of the eye, the Wise in spirit, created both these worlds submerged in fatness.  Then when the eastern ends were firmly fastened, the heavens and the earth were far extended.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वकर्मा विमना आद विहाया धाता विधाता परमोतसन्द्र्क तेषामिष्टानि समिषा मदन्ति यत्रासप्तर्षीन पर एकमाहुः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvakarmā vimanā ād vihāyā dhātā vidhātā paramotasandṛk teṣāmiṣṭāni samiṣā madanti yatrāsaptaṛṣīn para ekamāhuḥ

translations.griffith: Mighty in mind and power is Visvakarman, Maker, Disposer, and most lofty Presence.  Their offerings joy in rich juice where they value One, only One, beyond the Seven Ṛṣis.

verses.sanskrit: यो नः पिता जनिता यो विधाता धामानि वेद भुवनानिविश्वा यो देवानां नामधा एक एव तं सम्प्रश्नम्भुवना यन्त्यन्या |||
verses.transliteration: yo naḥ pitā janitā yo vidhātā dhāmāni veda bhuvanāniviśvā yo devānāṃ nāmadhā eka eva taṃ sampraśnambhuvanā yantyanyā

translations.griffith: Father who made us, he who, as Disposer, knoweth all races and all things existing,  Even he alone, the Deities' narne-giver,him other beings seek for information.

verses.sanskrit: त आयजन्त दरविणं समस्मा रषयः पूर्वे जरितारो नभूना असूर्ते सूर्ते रजसि निषत्ते ये भूतानिसमक्र्ण्वन्निमानि |||
verses.transliteration: ta āyajanta draviṇaṃ samasmā ṛṣayaḥ pūrve jaritāro nabhūnā asūrte sūrte rajasi niṣatte ye bhūtānisamakṛṇvannimāni

translations.griffith: To him in sacrifice they offered treasures,—Ṛṣis of old, in numerous troops, as singers,  Who, in the distant, near, and lower region, made ready all these things that have existence.

verses.sanskrit: परो दिवा पर एना पर्थिव्या परो देवेभिरसुरैर्यदस्ति कं सविद गर्भं परथमं दध्र आपो यत्र देवाःसमपश्यन्त विश्वे |||
verses.transliteration: paro divā para enā pṛthivyā paro devebhirasurairyadasti kaṃ svid gharbhaṃ prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥsamapaśyanta viśve

translations.griffith: That which is earlier than this earth and heaven, before the Asuras and Gods had being,—  What was the germ primeval which the waters received where all the Gods were seen together?

verses.sanskrit: तमिद गर्भं परथमं दध्र आपो यत्र देवाःसमगछन्त विश्वे अजस्य नाभावध्येकमर्पितंयस्मिन विश्वानि भुवनानि तस्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: tamid gharbhaṃ prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥsamaghachanta viśve ajasya nābhāvadhyekamarpitaṃyasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ

translations.griffith: The waters, they received that germ primeval wherein the Gods were gathefed all together.  It rested set upon the Unborn's navel, that One wherein abide all things existing.

verses.sanskrit: न तं विदाथ य इमा जजानायद युष्माकमन्तरम्बभूव नीहारेण पराव्र्ता जल्प्या चासुत्र्प उक्थशासश्चरन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: na taṃ vidātha ya imā jajānāyad yuṣmākamantarambabhūva nīhāreṇa prāvṛtā jalpyā cāsutṛpa ukthaśāsaścaranti

translations.griffith: Ye will not find him who produced these creatures: another thing hath risen up among you.  Enwrapt in misty cloud, with lips that stammer, hymn-chanters wander and are discontented.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते मन्यो.अविधद वज्र सायक सह ओजः पुष्यति विश्वमानुषक साह्याम दासमार्यं तवया युजा सहस्क्र्तेनसहसा सहस्वता |||
verses.transliteration: yaste manyo.avidhad vajra sāyaka saha ojaḥ puṣyati viśvamānuṣak sāhyāma dāsamāryaṃ tvayā yujā sahaskṛtenasahasā sahasvatā

translations.griffith: HE who hath reverenced thee, Manyu, destructive bolt, breeds for himself forthwith all conquering energy.  Ārya and Dāsa will we conquer with thine aid, with thee the Conqueror, with conquest conquest-sped.

verses.sanskrit: मन्युरिन्द्रो मन्युरेवास देवो मन्युर्होता वरुणोजातवेदाः मन्युं विश ईळते मानुषीर्याः पाहि नोमन्यो तपसा सजोषाः |||
verses.transliteration: manyurindro manyurevāsa devo manyurhotā varuṇojātavedāḥ manyuṃ viśa īḷate mānuṣīryāḥ pāhi nomanyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Manyu was Indra, yea, the God, was Manyu, Manyu was Hotar, Varuṇa, Jātavedas.  The tribes of human lineage worship Manyu. Accordant with thy fervour, Manyu, guard us.

verses.sanskrit: अभीहि मन्यो तवसस्तवीयान तपसा युजा वि जहि शत्रून अमित्रहा वर्त्रहा दस्युहा च विश्वा वसून्या भरात्वं नः |||
verses.transliteration: abhīhi manyo tavasastavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhā ca viśvā vasūnyā bharātvaṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: Come hither, Manyu, mightier tham the mighty; chase, with thy fervour for ally, our foemen.  Slayer of foes, of Vṛtra, and of Dasyu, bring thou to us all kinds of wealth and treasure.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि मन्यो अभिभूत्योजाः सवयम्भूर्भामोभिमातिषाहः विश्वचर्षणिः सहुरिः सहावानस्मास्वोजः पर्तनासु धेहि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi manyo abhibhūtyojāḥ svayambhūrbhāmoabhimātiṣāhaḥ viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahāvānasmāsvojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi

translations.griffith: For thou art, Manyu, of surpassing vigour, fierce, queller of the foe, and self-existent,  Shared by all men, victorious, subduer: vouchsafe to us superior strengith in battles.

verses.sanskrit: अभागः सन्नप परेतो अस्मि तव करत्वा तविषस्यप्रचेतः तं तवा मन्यो अक्रतुर्जिहीळाहं सवा तनूर्बलदेयाय मेहि |||
verses.transliteration: abhāghaḥ sannapa pareto asmi tava kratvā taviṣasyapracetaḥ taṃ tvā manyo akraturjihīḷāhaṃ svā tanūrbaladeyāya mehi

translations.griffith: I have departed, still without a portion, wise God! according to thy will, the Mighty.  I, feeble man, was wroth thee, O Manyu I am myself; come thou to give me vigour.

verses.sanskrit: अयं ते अस्म्युप मेह्यर्वां परतीचीनः सहुरे विश्वधायः मन्यो वज्रिन्नभि मामा वव्र्त्स्व हनाव दस्यून्रुतबोध्यापेः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ te asmyupa mehyarvāṃ pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśvadhāyaḥ manyo vajrinnabhi māmā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūnrutabodhyāpeḥ

translations.griffith: Come hither. I am all thine own; advancing turn thou to me, Victorious, All-supporter!  Come to me, Manyu, Wielder of the Thunder: bethink thee of thy friend, and slay the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit: अभि परेहि दक्षिणतो भवा मे.अधा वर्त्राणि जङघनावभूरि जुहोमि ते धरुणं मध्वो अग्रमुभा उपांशुप्रथमा पिबाव |||
verses.transliteration: abhi prehi dakṣiṇato bhavā me.adhā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāvabhūri juhomi te dharuṇaṃ madhvo aghramubhā upāṃśuprathamā pibāva

translations.griffith: Approach, and on my right hand hold thy station: so shall we slay a multitude of foemen.  The best of meath I offer to support thee: may we be first to drink thereof in quiet.

verses.sanskrit: तवया मन्यो सरथमारुजन्तो हर्षमाणासो धर्षितामरुत्वः तिग्मेषव आयुधा संशिशाना अभि पर यन्तुनरो अग्निरूपाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā manyo sarathamārujanto harṣamāṇāso dhṛṣitāmarutvaḥ tighmeṣava āyudhā saṃśiśānā abhi pra yantunaro aghnirūpāḥ

translations.griffith: BORNE on with thee, O Manyu girt by Maruts, let our brave men, impetuous, bursting forward,  March on, like flames of fire in form, exulting, with pointed arrows, sharpening their weapons.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निरिव मन्यो तविषितः सहस्व सेनानीर्नः सहुरे हूतेधि हत्वाय शत्रून वि भजस्व वेद ओजो मिमानो वि मर्धोनुदस्व |||
verses.transliteration: aghniriva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senānīrnaḥ sahure hūtaedhi hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva veda ojo mimāno vi mṛdhonudasva

translations.griffith: Flashing like fire, be thou, O conquering Manyu, invoked, O Victor, as our army's leader.  Slay thou our foes, distribute their possessions: show forth thy vigour, scatter those who hate us.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्व मन्यो अभिमातिमस्मे रुजन मर्णन परम्र्णन परेहिशत्रून उग्रं ते पाजो नन्वा रुरुध्रे वशी वशंनयस एकज तवम |||
verses.transliteration: sahasva manyo abhimātimasme rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehiśatrūn ughraṃ te pājo nanvā rurudhre vaśī vaśaṃnayasa ekaja tvam

translations.griffith: O Manyu, overcome thou our assailant on! breaking, slaying, crushing down the foemen.  They have not hindered thine impetuous vigour: Mighty, Sole born! thou makest them thy subjects.

verses.sanskrit: एको बहूनामसि मन्यवीळितो विशं-विशं युधये संशिशाधि अक्र्त्तरुक तवया युजा वयं दयुमन्तं घोषंविजयाय कर्ण्महे |||
verses.transliteration: eko bahūnāmasi manyavīḷito viśaṃ-viśaṃ yudhaye saṃśiśādhi akṛttaruk tvayā yujā vayaṃ dyumantaṃ ghoṣaṃvijayāya kṛṇmahe

translations.griffith: Alone or many thou art worshipped, Manyu: sharpen the spirit of each clan for battle.  With thee to aid, O thou of perfect splendour, we will uplift the glorious shout for conquest.

verses.sanskrit: विजेषक्र्दिन्द्र इवानवब्रवो.अस्माकं मन्यो अधिपा भवेह परियं ते नाम सहुरे गर्णीमसि विद्मा तमुत्सं यताबभूथ |||
verses.transliteration: vijeṣakṛdindra ivānavabravo.asmākaṃ manyo adhipā bhaveha priyaṃ te nāma sahure ghṛṇīmasi vidmā tamutsaṃ yataābabhūtha

translations.griffith: Unyielding bringing victory like Indra, O Manyu, be thou here our Sovran Ruler.  To thy dear name, O Victor, we sing praises: we know the spring from which thou art come hither.
