verses.sanskrit: आभूत्या सहजा वज्र सायक सहो बिभर्ष्यभिभूतौत्तरम करत्वा नो मन्यो सह मेद्येधि महाधनस्य पुरुहूतसंस्र्जि |||
verses.transliteration: ābhūtyā sahajā vajra sāyaka saho bibharṣyabhibhūtauttaram kratvā no manyo saha medyedhi mahādhanasya puruhūtasaṃsṛji

translations.griffith: Twin-born with power, destructive bolt of thunder, the highest conquering might is thine, Subduer!  Be friendly to its in thy spirit, Manyu, O Much-invoked, in shock of mighty battle.

verses.sanskrit: संस्र्ष्टं धनमुभयं समाक्र्तमस्मभ्यं दत्तांवरुणश्च मन्युः भियं दधाना हर्दयेषु शत्रवःपराजितासो अप नि लयन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: saṃsṛṣṭaṃ dhanamubhayaṃ samākṛtamasmabhyaṃ dattāṃvaruṇaśca manyuḥ bhiyaṃ dadhānā hṛdayeṣu śatravaḥparājitāso apa ni layantām

translations.griffith: For spoil let Varuṇa and Manyu give us the wealth of both sides gathered and collected;  And let our enemies with stricken spirits, o’erwhelmed with terror, slink away defeated.

verses.sanskrit: सत्येनोत्तभिता भूमिः सूर्येणोत्तभिता दयौः रतेनादित्यास्तिष्ठन्ति दिवि सोमो अधि शरितः |||
verses.transliteration: satyenottabhitā bhūmiḥ sūryeṇottabhitā dyauḥ ṛtenādityāstiṣṭhanti divi somo adhi śritaḥ

translations.griffith: TRUTH is the base that bears the earth; by Sūrya are the heavens sustained.  By Law the Ādityas stand secure, and Soma holds his place in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सोमेनादित्या बलिनः सोमेन पर्थिवी मही अथोनक्षत्राणामेषामुपस्थे सोम आहितः |||
verses.transliteration: somenādityā balinaḥ somena pṛthivī mahī athonakṣatrāṇāmeṣāmupasthe soma āhitaḥ

translations.griffith: By Soma are the Ādityas strong, by Soma mighty is the earth.  Thus Soma in the midst of all these constellations hath his place.

verses.sanskrit: सोमं मन्यते पपिवन यत सम्पिंषन्त्योषधिम सोमं यम्ब्रह्माणो विदुर्न तस्याश्नाति कश्चन |||
verses.transliteration: somaṃ manyate papivan yat sampiṃṣantyoṣadhim somaṃ yambrahmāṇo vidurna tasyāśnāti kaścana

translations.griffith: One thinks, when they have brayed the plant, that he hath drunk the Soma's juice;  Of him whom Brahmans truly know as Soma no one ever tastes.

verses.sanskrit: आछद्विधानैर्गुपितो बार्हतैः सोम रक्षितः गरव्णामिच्छ्र्ण्वन तिष्ठसि न ते अश्नाति पार्थिवः |||
verses.transliteration: āchadvidhānairghupito bārhataiḥ soma rakṣitaḥ ghravṇāmicchṛṇvan tiṣṭhasi na te aśnāti pārthivaḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, secured by sheltering rules, guarded by hymns in Brhati,  Thou standest listening to the stones none tastes of thee who dwells on earth.

verses.sanskrit: यत तवा देव परपिबन्ति तत आ पयायसे पुनः वायुःसोमस्य रक्षिता समानां मास आक्र्तिः |||
verses.transliteration: yat tvā deva prapibanti tata ā pyāyase punaḥ vāyuḥsomasya rakṣitā samānāṃ māsa ākṛtiḥ

translations.griffith: When they begin to drink thee then, O God, thou swellest out again.  Vāyu is Soma's guardian God. The Moon is that which shapes the years.

verses.sanskrit: रैभ्यासीदनुदेयी नाराशंसि नयोचनी सूर्यायाभद्रमिद वासो गाथयैति परिष्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: raibhyāsīdanudeyī nārāśaṃsi nyocanī sūryāyābhadramid vāso ghāthayaiti pariṣkṛtam

translations.griffith: Raibhi was her dear bridal friend, and Narasamsi led her home.  Lovely was Sūrya's robe: she came to that which Gatha had adorned.

verses.sanskrit: चित्तिरा उपबर्हणं चक्षुरा अभ्यञ्जनम दयौर्भूमिःकोश आसीद यदयात सूर्या पतिम |||
verses.transliteration: cittirā upabarhaṇaṃ cakṣurā abhyañjanam dyaurbhūmiḥkośa āsīd yadayāt sūryā patim

translations.griffith: Thought was the pillow of her couch, sight was the unguent for her eyes:  Her treasury was earth and heaven.ẉhen Sūrya went unto her Lord.

verses.sanskrit: सतोमा आसन परतिधयः कुरिरं छन्द ओपशः सूर्यायाश्विना वराग्निरासीत पुरोगवः |||
verses.transliteration: stomā āsan pratidhayaḥ kuriraṃ chanda opaśaḥ sūryāyāaśvinā varāghnirāsīt puroghavaḥ

translations.griffith: Hymns were the cross-bars of the pole, Kurira-metre decked the car:  The bridesmen were the Aśvin Pair Agni was leader of the train.

verses.sanskrit: सोमो वधूयुरभवदश्विनास्तामुभा वरा सूर्यांयत पत्ये शंसन्तीं मनसा सविताददात |||
verses.transliteration: somo vadhūyurabhavadaśvināstāmubhā varā sūryāṃyat patye śaṃsantīṃ manasā savitādadāt

translations.griffith: Soma was he who wooed the maid: the groomsmen were both Aśvins, when  The Sun-God Savitar bestowed his willing Sūrya on her Lord.

verses.sanskrit: मनो अस्या अन आसीद दयौरासीदुत छदिः शुक्रावनड्वाहवास्तां यदयात सूर्या बर्हम |||
verses.transliteration: mano asyā ana āsīd dyaurāsīduta chadiḥ śukrāvanaḍvāhavāstāṃ yadayāt sūryā bṛham

translations.griffith: Her spirit was the bridal car; the covering thereof was heaven:  Bright were both Steers that drew it when Sūrya approached her husband's, home.

verses.sanskrit: रक्सामाभ्यामभिहितौ गावौ ते सामनावितः शरोत्रं तेचक्रे आस्तां दिवि पन्थाश्चराचारः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛksāmābhyāmabhihitau ghāvau te sāmanāvitaḥ śrotraṃ tecakre āstāṃ divi panthāścarācāraḥ

translations.griffith: Thy Steers were steady, kept in place by holy verse and Sāma-hymn:  All car were thy two chariot wheels: thy path was tremulous in the sky,

verses.sanskrit: शुची ते चक्रे यात्या वयानो अक्ष आहतः अनोमनस्मयं सूर्यारोहत परयति पतिम |||
verses.transliteration: śucī te cakre yātyā vyāno akṣa āhataḥ anomanasmayaṃ sūryārohat prayati patim

translations.griffith: Clean, as thou wentest, were thy wheels wind, was the axle fastened there.  Sūrya, proceeding to her Lord, mounted a spirit-fashioried car.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्याया वहतुः परागात सविता यमवास्र्जत अघासुहन्यन्ते गावो.अर्जुन्योः पर्युह्यते |||
verses.transliteration: sūryāyā vahatuḥ prāghāt savitā yamavāsṛjat aghāsuhanyante ghāvo.arjunyoḥ paryuhyate

translations.griffith: The bridal pomp of Sūrya, which Savitar started, moved along.  In Magha days are oxen slain, in Arjuris they wed the bride.

verses.sanskrit: यदश्विना पर्छमानावयातं तरिचक्रेण वहतुंसूर्यायाः विश्वे देवा अनु तद वामजानन पुत्रःपितरावव्र्णीत पूषा |||
verses.transliteration: yadaśvinā pṛchamānāvayātaṃ tricakreṇa vahatuṃsūryāyāḥ viśve devā anu tad vāmajānan putraḥpitarāvavṛṇīta pūṣā

translations.griffith: When on your three-wheeled chariot, O Aśvins, ye came as wooers unto Sūrya's bridal,  Then all the Gods agreed to your proposal Pūṣan as Son elected you as Fathers.

verses.sanskrit: यदयातं शुभस पती वरेयं सूर्यामुप कवैकंचक्रं वामासीत कव देष्ट्राय तस्थथुः |||
verses.transliteration: yadayātaṃ śubhas patī vareyaṃ sūryāmupa kvaikaṃcakraṃ vāmāsīt kva deṣṭrāya tasthathuḥ

translations.griffith: O ye Two Lords of lustre, then when ye to Sūrya's wooing came,  Where was one chariot wheel of yours? Where stood ye for die Sire's command?

verses.sanskrit: दवे ते चक्रे सूर्ये बरह्माण रतुथ विदुः अथैकंचक्रं यद गुहा तदद्धातय इद विदुः |||
verses.transliteration: dve te cakre sūrye brahmāṇa ṛtutha viduḥ athaikaṃcakraṃ yad ghuhā tadaddhātaya id viduḥ

translations.griffith: The Brahmans, by their seasons, know, O Sūrya, those two wheels of thine:  One kept concealed, those only who are skilled in highest truths have learned.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्यायै देवेभ्यो मित्राय वरुणाय च ये भूतस्यप्रचेतस इदं तेभ्यो.अकरं नमः |||
verses.transliteration: sūryāyai devebhyo mitrāya varuṇāya ca ye bhūtasyapracetasa idaṃ tebhyo.akaraṃ namaḥ

translations.griffith: To Sūrya and the Deities, to Mitra and to Varuṇa.  Who know aright the thing that is, this adoration have I paid.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वापरं चरतो माययैतौ शिशू करिळन्तौ परि यतोध्वरम विश्वान्यन्यो भुवनाभिचष्ट रतुन्रन्योविदधज्जायते पुनः |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvāparaṃ carato māyayaitau śiśū kriḷantau pari yatoadhvaram viśvānyanyo bhuvanābhicaṣṭa ṛtunranyovidadhajjāyate punaḥ

translations.griffith: By their own power these Twain in close succession move;  They go as playing children round the sacrifice.  One of the Pair beholdeth all existing things; the other ordereth seasons and is born again.

verses.sanskrit: नवो-नवो भवति जायमानो.अह्नां केतुरुषसामेत्यग्रम भागं देवेभ्यो वि दधात्यायन पर चन्द्रमास्तिरतेदीर्घमयुः |||
verses.transliteration: navo-navo bhavati jāyamāno.ahnāṃ keturuṣasāmetyaghram bhāghaṃ devebhyo vi dadhātyāyan pra candramāstiratedīrghamayuḥ

translations.griffith: He, born afresh, is new and new for ever ensign of days he goes before the Mornings  Coming, he orders f6r the Gods their portion. The Moon prolongs the days of our existence.

verses.sanskrit: सुकिंशुकं शल्मलिं विश्वरूपं हिरण्यवर्णं सुव्र्तंसुचक्रम आ रोह सूर्ये अम्र्तस्य लोकं सयोनं पत्ये वहतुंक्र्णुष्व |||
verses.transliteration: sukiṃśukaṃ śalmaliṃ viśvarūpaṃ hiraṇyavarṇaṃ suvṛtaṃsucakram ā roha sūrye amṛtasya lokaṃ syonaṃ patye vahatuṃkṛṇuṣva

translations.griffith: Mount this, all-shaped, gold-hued, with strong wheels, fashioned of Kimsuka and Salmali, light-rolling,  Bound for the world of life immortal, Sūrya: make for thy lord a happy bridal journey.

verses.sanskrit: उदीर्ष्वातः पतिवती हयेषा विश्वावसुं नमसागीर्भिरीळे अन्यामिछ पित्र्षदं वयक्तां स ते भागोजनुषा तस्य विद्धि |||
verses.transliteration: udīrṣvātaḥ pativatī hyeṣā viśvāvasuṃ namasāghīrbhirīḷe anyāmicha pitṛṣadaṃ vyaktāṃ sa te bhāghojanuṣā tasya viddhi

translations.griffith: Rise up from hence: this maiden hath a husband. I laud Visvavasu with hymns and homage.  Seek in her father's home another fair one, and find the portion from of old assigned thee.

verses.sanskrit: उदीर्ष्वातो विश्वावसो नमसेळा महे तवा अन्यामिछप्रफर्व्यं सं जायां पत्या सर्ज |||
verses.transliteration: udīrṣvāto viśvāvaso namaseḷā mahe tvā anyāmichaprapharvyaṃ saṃ jāyāṃ patyā sṛja

translations.griffith: Rise up from hence, Visvavasu: with reverence we worship thee.  Seek thou another willing maid, and with her husband leave the bride.

verses.sanskrit: अन्र्क्षरा रजवः सन्तु पन्था येभिः सखायो यन्ति नोवरेयम समर्यमा सं भगो नो निनीयात सं जस्पत्यंसुयममस्तु देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: anṛkṣarā ṛjavaḥ santu panthā yebhiḥ sakhāyo yanti novareyam samaryamā saṃ bhagho no ninīyāt saṃ jaspatyaṃsuyamamastu devāḥ

translations.griffith: Straight in direction be the path:s, and thornless, whereon our fellows travel to the wooing.  Let Aryaman and Bhaga lead us: perfect, O Gods, the union of the wife and husband.

verses.sanskrit: पर तवा मुञ्चामि वरुणस्य पाशाद येन तवाबध्नात सवितासुशेवः रतस्य योनौ सुक्र्तस्य लोके.अरिष्टां तवा सहपत्या दधामि |||
verses.transliteration: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśād yena tvābadhnāt savitāsuśevaḥ ṛtasya yonau sukṛtasya loke.ariṣṭāṃ tvā sahapatyā dadhāmi

translations.griffith: Now from the noose of Varuṇa I free thee, wherewith Most Blessed Savitar hath bound thee.  In Law's seat, to the world of virtuous action, I give thee up uninjured with thy consort.

verses.sanskrit: परेतो मुञ्चामि नामुतः सुबद्धाममुतस करम यथेयमिन्द्र मीढ्वः सुपुत्रा सुभगासति |||
verses.transliteration: preto muñcāmi nāmutaḥ subaddhāmamutas karam yatheyamindra mīḍhvaḥ suputrā subhaghāsati

translations.griffith: Hence, and not thence, I send these free. I make thee softly fettered there.  That, Bounteous Indra, she may live blest in her fortune and her sons.

verses.sanskrit: पूषा तवेतो नयतु हस्तग्र्ह्याश्विना तवा पर वहतांरथेन गर्हान गछ गर्हपत्नी यथासो वशिनी तवंविदथमा वदासि |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣā tveto nayatu hastaghṛhyāśvinā tvā pra vahatāṃrathena ghṛhān ghacha ghṛhapatnī yathāso vaśinī tvaṃvidathamā vadāsi

translations.griffith: Let Pūṣan take thy hand and hence conduct thee; may the two Aśvins on their car transport thee.  Go to the house to be the household's mistress and speak as lady ito thy gathered people.

verses.sanskrit: इह परियं परजया ते सं रध्यतामस्मिन गर्हे गार्हपत्यायजाग्र्हि एना पत्या तन्वं सं सर्जस्वाधा जिव्री विदथमा वदाथः |||
verses.transliteration: iha priyaṃ prajayā te saṃ ṛdhyatāmasmin ghṛhe ghārhapatyāyajāghṛhi enā patyā tanvaṃ saṃ sṛjasvādhā jivrī vidathamā vadāthaḥ

translations.griffith: Happy be thou and prosper witlh thy children here: be vigilant to rule thy household in this home.  Closely unite thy body with this; man, thy lord. So shall ye, full of years, address your company.

verses.sanskrit: नीललोहितं भवति कर्त्यासक्तिर्व्यज्यते एधन्ते अस्याज्ञातयः पतिर्बन्धेषु बध्यते |||
verses.transliteration: nīlalohitaṃ bhavati kṛtyāsaktirvyajyate edhante asyājñātayaḥ patirbandheṣu badhyate

translations.griffith: Her hue is blue and red: the fienod who clingeth close is driven off.  Well thrive the kinsmen of this bride the husband is bourid fast in bonds.

verses.sanskrit: परा देहि शामुल्यं बरह्मभ्यो वि भजा वसु कर्त्यैषापद्वती भूत्व्या जाया विशते पतिम |||
verses.transliteration: parā dehi śāmulyaṃ brahmabhyo vi bhajā vasu kṛtyaiṣāpadvatī bhūtvyā jāyā viśate patim

translations.griffith: Give thou the woollen robe away: deal treasure to the Brahman priests.  This female fiend hath got her feet, and as a wife attends her lord.

verses.sanskrit: अश्रीरा तनूर्भवति रुशती पापयामुया पतिर्यद्वध्वो वाससा सवमङगमभिधित्सते |||
verses.transliteration: aśrīrā tanūrbhavati ruśatī pāpayāmuyā patiryadvadhvo vāsasā svamaṅghamabhidhitsate

translations.griffith: Unlovely is his body when it glistens with this wicked fiend,  What time the husband wraps about his limbs the garment of his wife.

verses.sanskrit: ये वध्वश्चन्द्रं वहतुं यक्ष्मा यन्ति जनादनु पुनस्तान यज्ञिया देवा नयन्तु यत आगताः |||
verses.transliteration: ye vadhvaścandraṃ vahatuṃ yakṣmā yanti janādanu punastān yajñiyā devā nayantu yata āghatāḥ

translations.griffith: Consumptions, from her people, which follow the bride's resplendent train,—  These let the Holy Gods again bear to the place from which they came.

verses.sanskrit: मा विदन परिपन्थिनो य आसीदन्ति दम्पती सुगेभिर्दुर्गमतीतामप दरान्त्वरातयः |||
verses.transliteration: mā vidan paripanthino ya āsīdanti dampatī sughebhirdurghamatītāmapa drāntvarātayaḥ

translations.griffith: Let not the highway thieves who lie in ambush find the wedded pair.  By pleasant ways let them escape the danger, and let foes depart.

verses.sanskrit: सुमङगलीरियं वधूरिमां समेत पश्यत सौभाग्यमस्यै दत्त्वायाथास्तं वि परेतन |||
verses.transliteration: sumaṅghalīriyaṃ vadhūrimāṃ sameta paśyata saubhāghyamasyai dattvāyāthāstaṃ vi paretana

translations.griffith: Signs of good fortune mark the bride come all of you and look at her.  Wish her prosperity, and then return unto your homes again.

verses.sanskrit: तर्ष्टमेतत कटुकमेतदपाष्ठवद विषवन नैतदत्तवे सूर्यां यो बरह्मा विद्यात स इद वाधूयमर्हति |||
verses.transliteration: tṛṣṭametat kaṭukametadapāṣṭhavad viṣavan naitadattave sūryāṃ yo brahmā vidyāt sa id vādhūyamarhati

translations.griffith: Pungent is this, and bitter this, filled, as it were, with arrow-barbs, Empoisoned andṇot fit for use.  The Brahman who knows Sūrya well deserves the garment of the bride.

verses.sanskrit: आशसनं विशसनमथो अधिविकर्तनम सूर्यायः पश्यरूपाणि तानि बरह्मा तु शुन्धति |||
verses.transliteration: āśasanaṃ viśasanamatho adhivikartanam sūryāyaḥ paśyarūpāṇi tāni brahmā tu śundhati

translations.griffith: The fringe, the cloth that decks her head, and then the triply parted robe,—  Behold the hues which Sūrya wears these doth the Brahman purify.

verses.sanskrit: गर्भ्णामि ते सौभगत्वाय हस्तं मया पत्या जरदष्टिर्यथासः भगो अर्यमा सविता पुरन्धिर्मह्यं तवादुर्गार्हपत्याय देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛbhṇāmi te saubhaghatvāya hastaṃ mayā patyā jaradaṣṭiryathāsaḥ bhagho aryamā savitā purandhirmahyaṃ tvādurghārhapatyāya devāḥ

translations.griffith: I take thy hand in mine for happy fortune that thou mayst reach old age with me thy husband.  Gods, Aryaman, Bhaga, Savitar, Purandhi, have given thee to be my household's mistress.

verses.sanskrit: तां पूषञ्छिवतमामेरयस्व यस्यां बीजं मनुष्यावपन्ति या न ऊरू उशती विश्रयाते यस्यामुशन्तःप्रहराम शेपम |||
verses.transliteration: tāṃ pūṣañchivatamāmerayasva yasyāṃ bījaṃ manuṣyāvapanti yā na ūrū uśatī viśrayāte yasyāmuśantaḥpraharāma śepam

translations.griffith: O Pūṣan, send her on as most auspicious, her who shall be the sharer of my pleasures;  Her who shall twine her loving arms about me, and welcome all my love and mine embraces.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यमग्रे पर्यवहन सूर्यां वहतुना सह पुनःपतिभ्यो जायां दा अग्ने परजया सह |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyamaghre paryavahan sūryāṃ vahatunā saha punaḥpatibhyo jāyāṃ dā aghne prajayā saha

translations.griffith: For thee, with bridal train, they, first, escorted Sūrya to her home.  Give to the husband in return, Agni, the wife with progeny.

verses.sanskrit: पुनः पत्नीमग्निरदादायुषा सह वर्चसा दीर्घायुरस्या यः पतिर्जीवाति शरदः शतम |||
verses.transliteration: punaḥ patnīmaghniradādāyuṣā saha varcasā dīrghāyurasyā yaḥ patirjīvāti śaradaḥ śatam

translations.griffith: Agni hath given the bride again with splendour and with ample life.  Long lived be he who is her lord; a hundred autumns let him live.

verses.sanskrit: सोमः परथमो विविदे गन्धर्वो विविद उत्तरः तर्तीयोग्निष टे पतिस्तुरीयस्ते मनुष्यजाः |||
verses.transliteration: somaḥ prathamo vivide ghandharvo vivida uttaraḥ tṛtīyoaghniṣ ṭe patisturīyaste manuṣyajāḥ

translations.griffith: Soma obtained her first of all; next the Gandharva was her lord.  Agai was thy third husband: now one bornof woman is thy fourth.

verses.sanskrit: सोमो ददद गन्धर्वाय गन्धर्वो दददग्नये रयिं चपुत्रांश्चादादग्निर्मह्यमथो इमाम |||
verses.transliteration: somo dadad ghandharvāya ghandharvo dadadaghnaye rayiṃ caputrāṃścādādaghnirmahyamatho imām

translations.griffith: Soma to the Gandharva, and to Agni the Gandharva gave:  And Agni hath bestowed on me riches and sons and this my spouse.

verses.sanskrit: इहैव सतं मा वि यौष्टं विश्वमायुर्व्यश्नुतम कॄळन्तौ पुत्रैर्नप्त्र्भिर्मोदमानौ सवे गर्हे |||
verses.transliteration: ihaiva staṃ mā vi yauṣṭaṃ viśvamāyurvyaśnutam kṝḷantau putrairnaptṛbhirmodamānau sve ghṛhe

translations.griffith: Be ye not parted; dwell ye here reach the full time of human life.  With sons and grandsons sport and play, rejoicing in your own abode.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः परजां हनयतु परजापतिराजरसाय समनक्त्वर्यमा अदुर्मङगलीः पतिलोकमा विश शं नो भवद्विपदे शं चतुष्पदे |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ prajāṃ hanayatu prajāpatirājarasāya samanaktvaryamā adurmaṅghalīḥ patilokamā viśa śaṃ no bhavadvipade śaṃ catuṣpade

translations.griffith: So may Prajāpati bring children forth to us; may Aryaman adorn us till old age come nigh.  Not inauspicious enter thou thy husband's house: bring blessing to our bipeds and our quadrupeds.

verses.sanskrit: अघोरचक्षुरपतिघ्न्येधि शिवा पशुभ्यः सुमनाःसुवर्चाः वीरसूर्देवकामा सयोना शं नो भव दविपदेशं चतुष्पदे |||
verses.transliteration: aghoracakṣurapatighnyedhi śivā paśubhyaḥ sumanāḥsuvarcāḥ vīrasūrdevakāmā syonā śaṃ no bhava dvipadeśaṃ catuṣpade

translations.griffith: Not evil-eyed, no slayer of thy husband, bring weal to cattle, radiant, gentlehearted;  Loving the Gods, delightful, bearing heroes, bring blessing to our quadrupeds and bipeds.

verses.sanskrit: इमां तवमिन्द्र मीढ्वः सुपुत्रां सुभगां कर्णु दशास्यां पुत्राना धेहि पतिमेकादशं कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ tvamindra mīḍhvaḥ suputrāṃ subhaghāṃ kṛṇu daśāsyāṃ putrānā dhehi patimekādaśaṃ kṛdhi

translations.griffith: O Bounteous Indra, make this bride blest in her sons and fortunate.  Vouchsafe to her ten sons, and make her husband the eleventh man.

verses.sanskrit: सम्राज्ञी शवशुरे भव सम्राज्ञी शवश्र्वां भव ननान्दरि सम्राज्ञी भव सम्राज्ञी अधि देव्र्षु |||
verses.transliteration: samrājñī śvaśure bhava samrājñī śvaśrvāṃ bhava nanāndari samrājñī bhava samrājñī adhi devṛṣu

translations.griffith: Over thy husband's father and thy husband's mother bear full sway.  Over the sister of thy lord, over his brothers rule supreme.

verses.sanskrit: समञ्जन्तु विश्वे देवाः समापो हर्दयानि नौ सम्मातरिश्वा सं धाता समु देष्ट्री दधातु नौ |||
verses.transliteration: samañjantu viśve devāḥ samāpo hṛdayāni nau sammātariśvā saṃ dhātā samu deṣṭrī dadhātu nau

translations.griffith: So may the Universal Gods, so may the Waters join our hearts.  May Mātariśvan, Dhātar, and Destri together bind us close.

verses.sanskrit: वि हि सोतोरस्र्क्षत नेन्द्रं देवममंसत यत्रामदद्व्र्षाकपिरर्यः पुष्टेषु मत्सखा विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: vi hi sotorasṛkṣata nendraṃ devamamaṃsata yatrāmadadvṛṣākapiraryaḥ puṣṭeṣu matsakhā viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: MEN have abstained from pouring juice they count not Indra as a God.  Where at the votary's store my friend Vrsakapi hath drunk his fill. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: परा हीन्द्र धावसि वर्षाकपेरति वयथिः नो अह परविन्दस्यन्यत्र सोमपीतये विश्वस्मादिन्द्र उत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: parā hīndra dhāvasi vṛṣākaperati vyathiḥ no aha pravindasyanyatra somapītaye viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, heedless passest by the ill Vrsakapi hath wrought;  Yet nowhere else thou findest place wherein to drink the Soma juice. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: किमयं तवां वर्षाकपिश्चकार हरितो मर्गः यस्मािरस्यसीदु नवर्यो वा पुष्टिमद वसु विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: kimayaṃ tvāṃ vṛṣākapiścakāra harito mṛghaḥ yasmāirasyasīdu nvaryo vā puṣṭimad vasu viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: What hath he done to injure thee, this tawny beast Vrsakapi,  With whom thou art so angry now? What is the votary's foodful store? Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: यमिमं तवं वर्षाकपिं परियमिन्द्राभिरक्षसि शवा नवस्य जम्भिसअदपि कर्णे वरहयुर्विश्वस्मदिन्द्र उत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: yamimaṃ tvaṃ vṛṣākapiṃ priyamindrābhirakṣasi śvā nvasya jambhisadapi karṇe varahayurviśvasmadindra uttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Soon may the hound who hunts the boar seize him and bite him in the car,  O Indra, that Vrsakapi whom thou protectest as a friend, Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: परिया तष्टानि मे कपिर्व्यक्ता वयदूदुषत शिरो नवस्य राविषं न सुगं दुष्क्र्ते भुवं विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: priyā taṣṭāni me kapirvyaktā vyadūduṣat śiro nvasya rāviṣaṃ na sughaṃ duṣkṛte bhuvaṃ viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Kapi hath marred the beauteous things, all deftly wrought, that were my joy.  In pieces will I rend his head; the sinner's portion sball be woo. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: न मत सत्री सुभसत्तरा न सुयाशुतरा भुवत न मत्प्रतिच्यवीयसी न सक्थ्युद्यमीयसी विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: na mat strī subhasattarā na suyāśutarā bhuvat na matpraticyavīyasī na sakthyudyamīyasī viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: No Dame hath ampler charms than 1, or greater wealth of love's delights.  None with more ardour offers all her beauty to her lord's embrace. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: उवे अम्ब सुलाभिके यथेवाङग भविष्यति भसन मे अम्बसक्थि मे शिरो मे वीव हर्ष्यति विश्वस्मादिन्द्र उत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: uve amba sulābhike yathevāṅgha bhaviṣyati bhasan me ambasakthi me śiro me vīva hṛṣyati viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Mother whose love is quickly wibn, I say what verily will be.  My,breast, O Mother, and my head and both my hips seem quivering. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: किं सुबाहो सवङगुरे पर्थुष्टो पर्थुजाघने किं शूरपत्निनस्त्वमभ्यमीषि वर्षाकपिं विश्वस्मादिन्द्र उत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ subāho svaṅghure pṛthuṣṭo pṛthujāghane kiṃ śūrapatninastvamabhyamīṣi vṛṣākapiṃ viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Dame with the lovely hands and arms, with broad hair-plaits add ample hips,  Why, O thou Hero's wife, art thou angry with our Vrsakapi? Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: अवीरामिव मामयं शरारुरभि मन्यते उताहमस्मिवीरिणीन्द्रपत्नी मरुत्सखा विश्वस्मादिन्द्र उत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: avīrāmiva māmayaṃ śarārurabhi manyate utāhamasmivīriṇīndrapatnī marutsakhā viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ

translations.griffith: This noxious creature looks on me as one bereft of hero's love,  Yet Heroes for my sons have I, the Maruts’ Friend and Indra's Queen. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: संहोत्रं सम पुरा नारी समनं वाव गछति वेधार्तस्य वीरिणीन्द्रपत्नी महीयते विश्वस्मादिन्द्र उत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃhotraṃ sma purā nārī samanaṃ vāva ghachati vedhāṛtasya vīriṇīndrapatnī mahīyate viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ

translations.griffith: From olden time the matron goes to feast and general sacrifice.  Mother of Heroes, Indra's Queen, the rite's ordainer is extolled. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राणीमासु नारिषु सुभगामहमश्रवम नह्यस्यापरं चन जरसा मरते पतिर्विश्वस्मादिन्द्र उत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāṇīmāsu nāriṣu subhaghāmahamaśravam nahyasyāaparaṃ cana jarasā marate patirviśvasmādindra uttaraḥ

translations.griffith: So have I heard Indrāṇī called most fortunate among these Dames,  For never shall her Consort die in future time through length of days. Supreme is Indra overall.

verses.sanskrit: नाहमिन्द्राणि रारण सख्युर्व्र्षाकपेरते यस्येदमप्यं हविः परियं देवेषु गछति विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: nāhamindrāṇi rāraṇa sakhyurvṛṣākaperte yasyedamapyaṃ haviḥ priyaṃ deveṣu ghachati viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Never, Indralni, have I joyed without my friend Vrsakapi,  Whose welcome offering here, made pure with water, goeth to the Gods. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षाकपायि रेवति सूपुत्र आदु सुस्नुषे घसत त इन्द्रौक्षणः परियं काचित्करं हविर्विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣākapāyi revati sūputra ādu susnuṣe ghasat ta indraukṣaṇaḥ priyaṃ kācitkaraṃ havirviśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Wealthy Vrsakapayi, blest with sons and consorts of thy sons,  Indra will eat thy bulls, thy dear oblation that effecteth much. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: उक्ष्णो हि मे पञ्चदश साकं पचन्ति विंशतिम उताहमद्मि पीव इदुभा कुक्षी पर्णन्ति मे विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: ukṣṇo hi me pañcadaśa sākaṃ pacanti viṃśatim utāhamadmi pīva idubhā kukṣī pṛṇanti me viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Fifteen in number, then, for me a score of bullocks they prepare,  And I devour the fat thereof: they fill my belly full with food. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षभो न तिग्मश्र्ङगो.अन्तर्यूथेषु रोरुवत मन्थस्तैन्द्र शं हर्दे यं ते सुनोति भावयुर्विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣabho na tighmaśṛṅgho.antaryūtheṣu roruvat manthastaindra śaṃ hṛde yaṃ te sunoti bhāvayurviśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Like as a bull with pointed horn, loud bellowing amid the herds,  Sweet to thine heart, O Indra, is the brew which she who tends thee pours. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: न सेशे यस्य रम्बते.अन्तरा सक्थ्या कप्र्त सेदीशेयस्य रोमशं निषेदुषो विज्र्म्भते विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: na seśe yasya rambate.antarā sakthyā kapṛt sedīśeyasya romaśaṃ niṣeduṣo vijṛmbhate viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: He who is impotent, deserves no progeny, but he whose endowment can reach the depths of the womb.  Supreme Indra is above all.

verses.sanskrit: न सेशे यस्य रोमशं निषेदुषो विज्र्म्भते सेदीशेयस्य रम्बते.अन्तरा सक्थ्या कप्र्द विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: na seśe yasya romaśaṃ niṣeduṣo vijṛmbhate sedīśeyasya rambate.antarā sakthyā kapṛd viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: He who is impotent deserves no progeny, but he whose endowment can reach the depths of the womb.  Supreme Indra is above all!

verses.sanskrit: अयमिन्द्र वर्षाकपिः परस्वन्तं हतं विदत असिंसूनां नवं चरुमादेधस्यान आचितं विश्वस्मादिन्द्र उत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: ayamindra vṛṣākapiḥ parasvantaṃ hataṃ vidat asiṃsūnāṃ navaṃ carumādedhasyāna ācitaṃ viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra this Vrsakapi hath found a slain wild animal,  Dresser, and new-made pan, and knife, and wagon with a load of wood. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: अयमेमि विचाकशद विचिन्वन दासमार्यम पिबामिपाकसुत्वनो.अभि धीरमचाकशं विश्वस्मादिन्द्र उत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: ayamemi vicākaśad vicinvan dāsamāryam pibāmipākasutvano.abhi dhīramacākaśaṃ viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Distinguishing the Dāsa and the Ārya, viewing all, I go.  I look upon the wise, and drink the simple votary's Soma juice. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: धन्व च यत कर्न्तत्रं च कति सवित ता वि योजना नेदीयासो वर्षाकपे.अस्तमेहि गर्हानुप विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरह |||
verses.transliteration: dhanva ca yat kṛntatraṃ ca kati svit tā vi yojanā nedīyāso vṛṣākape.astamehi ghṛhānupa viśvasmādindrauttarah

translations.griffith: The desert plains and steep descents, how many leagues in length they spread!  Go to the nearest houses, go unto thine home, Vrsakapi. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: पुनरेहि वर्षाकपे सुविता कल्पयावहै य एषस्वप्ननंशनो.अस्तमेषि पथ पुनर्विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: punarehi vṛṣākape suvitā kalpayāvahai ya eṣasvapnanaṃśano.astameṣi patha punarviśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Turn thee again Vrsakapi: we twain will bring thee happiness.  Thou goest homeward on thy way along this path which leads to sleep. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: यदुदञ्चो वर्षाकपे गर्हमिन्द्राजगन्तन कव सय पुल्वघोम्र्गः कमगञ जनयोपनो विश्वस्मादिन्द्र उत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: yadudañco vṛṣākape ghṛhamindrājaghantana kva sya pulvaghomṛghaḥ kamaghañ janayopano viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ

translations.griffith: When, Indra and Vrsakapi, ye travelled upward to your home,  Where was that noisome beast, to whom went it, the beast that troubles man? Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit: पर्शुर्ह नाम मानवि साकं ससूव विंश तिम भद्रम्भल तयस्या अभूद यस्या उदरममयद विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः |||
verses.transliteration: parśurha nāma mānavi sākaṃ sasūva viṃśa tim bhadrambhala tyasyā abhūd yasyā udaramamayad viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ

translations.griffith: Daughter of Manu, Parsu bare a score of children at a birth.  Her portion verily was bliss although her burthen caused her grief.

verses.sanskrit: रक्षोहणं वाजिनमा जिघर्मि मित्रं परथिष्ठमुपयामि शर्म शिशानो अग्निः करतुभिः समिद्धः स नोदिवा स रिषः पातु नक्तम |||
verses.transliteration: rakṣohaṇaṃ vājinamā jigharmi mitraṃ prathiṣṭhamupayāmi śarma śiśāno aghniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa nodivā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam

translations.griffith: I BALM with oil the mighty Rakṣas-slayer; to the most famous Friend I come for shelter  Enkindled, sharpened by our rites, may Agni protect us in the day and night from evil.

verses.sanskrit: अयोदंष्ट्रो अर्चिषा यातुधानानुप सप्र्श जातवेदःसमिद्धः आ जिह्वया मुरदेवान रभस्व करव्यादो वर्क्त्व्यपि धत्स्वासन |||
verses.transliteration: ayodaṃṣṭro arciṣā yātudhānānupa spṛśa jātavedaḥsamiddhaḥ ā jihvayā muradevān rabhasva kravyādo vṛktvyapi dhatsvāsan

translations.griffith: O Jātavedas with the teeth of iron, enkindled with thy flame attack the demons.  Seize with thy longue the foolish gods' adorers: rend, put within thy mouth the raw-flesh caters.

verses.sanskrit: उभोभयाविन्नुप धेहि दंष्ट्रा हिंस्रः शिशानो.अवरम्परं च उतान्तरिक्षे परि याहि राजञ जम्भैः सन्धेह्यभि यातुधानान |||
verses.transliteration: ubhobhayāvinnupa dhehi daṃṣṭrā hiṃsraḥ śiśāno.avaramparaṃ ca utāntarikṣe pari yāhi rājañ jambhaiḥ sandhehyabhi yātudhānān

translations.griffith: Apply thy teeth, the upper and the lower, thou who hast both, enkindled and destroying.  Roam also in the air, O King, around us, and with thy jaws assail the wicked spirits.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञैरिषूः संनममानो अग्ने वाचा शल्यानशनिभिर्दिहानः ताभिर्विध्य हर्दये यातुधानान परतीचो बाहून्प्रति भंध्येषाम |||
verses.transliteration: yajñairiṣūḥ saṃnamamāno aghne vācā śalyānaśanibhirdihānaḥ tābhirvidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān pratīco bāhūnprati bhaṃdhyeṣām

translations.griffith: Bending thy shafts through sacrifices, Agni, whetting their points with song as if with whetstones,  Pierce to the heart therewith the Yātudhānas, and break their arms uplifed to attack thee.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तवचं यातुधानस्य भिन्धि हिंस्राशनिर्हरसाहन्त्वेनम पर पर्वाणि जातवेदः शर्णीहि करव्यात्क्रविष्णुर्वि चिनोतु वर्क्णम |||
verses.transliteration: aghne tvacaṃ yātudhānasya bhindhi hiṃsrāśanirharasāhantvenam pra parvāṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kravyātkraviṣṇurvi cinotu vṛkṇam

translations.griffith: Pierce through the Yātudhāna's skin, O Agni; let the destroying dart with fire consume him.  Rend his joints, Jātavedas, let the cater of flesh, flesh-seeking, track his mangled body.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रेदानीं पश्यसि जातवेदस्तिष्ठन्तमग्न उत वाचरन्तम यद वान्तरिक्षे पथिभिः पतन्तं तमस्ताविध्य शर्वा शिशानः |||
verses.transliteration: yatredānīṃ paśyasi jātavedastiṣṭhantamaghna uta vācarantam yad vāntarikṣe pathibhiḥ patantaṃ tamastāvidhya śarvā śiśānaḥ

translations.griffith: Where now thou seest Agni Jātavedas, one of these demons standing still or roaming,  Or flying on those paths in air's midregion, sharpen the shaft and as an archer pierce him.

verses.sanskrit: उतालब्धं सप्र्णुहि जातवेद आलेभानाद रष्टिभिर्यातुधानात अग्ने पूर्वो नि जहि शोशुचान आमादःक्ष्विङकास्तमदन्त्वेनीः |||
verses.transliteration: utālabdhaṃ spṛṇuhi jātaveda ālebhānād ṛṣṭibhiryātudhānāt aghne pūrvo ni jahi śośucāna āmādaḥkṣviṅkāstamadantvenīḥ

translations.griffith: Tear from the evil spirit, Jātavedas, what he hath seized and with his spears hath captured.  Blazing before him strike him down, O Agni; let spotted carrion-eating kites devour him.

verses.sanskrit: इह पर बरूहि यतमः सो अग्ने यो यातुधानो य इदंक्र्णोति तमा रभस्व समिधा यविष्ठ नर्चक्षसश्चक्षुषे रन्धयैनम |||
verses.transliteration: iha pra brūhi yatamaḥ so aghne yo yātudhāno ya idaṃkṛṇoti tamā rabhasva samidhā yaviṣṭha nṛcakṣasaścakṣuṣe randhayainam

translations.griffith: Here tell this forth, O Agni: whosoever is, he himself, or acteth as, a demon,  Him grasp, O thou Most Youthful, with thy fuel. to the Mati-seer's eye give him as booty.

verses.sanskrit: तीक्ष्णेनाग्ने चक्षुषा रक्ष यज्ञं पराञ्चं वसुभ्यःप्र णय परचेतः हिंस्रं रक्षांस्यभि शोशुचानम्मा तवा दभन यातुधाना नर्चक्षः |||
verses.transliteration: tīkṣṇenāghne cakṣuṣā rakṣa yajñaṃ prāñcaṃ vasubhyaḥpra ṇaya pracetaḥ hiṃsraṃ rakṣāṃsyabhi śośucānammā tvā dabhan yātudhānā nṛcakṣaḥ

translations.griffith: With keen glance guard the sacrifice, O Agni: thou Sage, conduct it onward to the Vasus.  Let not the fiends, O Man-beholder, harm thee burning against the Rākṣasas to slay them.

verses.sanskrit: नर्चक्षा रक्षः परि पश्य विक्षु तस्य तरीणि परतिश्र्णीह्यग्रा तस्याग्ने पर्ष्टीर्हरसा शर्णीहि तरेधामूलं यातुधानस्य वर्श्च |||
verses.transliteration: nṛcakṣā rakṣaḥ pari paśya vikṣu tasya trīṇi pratiśṛṇīhyaghrā tasyāghne pṛṣṭīrharasā śṛṇīhi tredhāmūlaṃ yātudhānasya vṛśca

translations.griffith: Look on the fiend mid men, as Man-beholder: rend thou his three extremities in pieces.  Demolish with thy flame his ribs, O Agni, the Yātudhāna's root destroy thou triply.

verses.sanskrit: तरिर्यातुधानः परसितिं त एत्व रतं यो अग्ने अन्र्तेन हन्ति तमर्चिषा सफूर्जयञ जातवेदः समक्षमेनं गर्णतेनि वरंधि |||
verses.transliteration: triryātudhānaḥ prasitiṃ ta etv ṛtaṃ yo aghne anṛtena hanti tamarciṣā sphūrjayañ jātavedaḥ samakṣamenaṃ ghṛṇateni vṛṃdhi

translations.griffith: Thrice, Agni, let thy noose surround the demon who with his falsehood injures Holy Order.  Loud roaring with thy flame, O Jātavedas, crush him and cast him down before the singer.

verses.sanskrit: तदग्ने चक्षुः परति धेहि रेभे शफारुजं येनपश्यसि यातुधानम अथर्ववज्ज्योतिषा दैव्येन सत्यन्धूर्वन्तमचितं नयोष |||
verses.transliteration: tadaghne cakṣuḥ prati dhehi rebhe śaphārujaṃ yenapaśyasi yātudhānam atharvavajjyotiṣā daivyena satyandhūrvantamacitaṃ nyoṣa

translations.griffith: Lead thou the worshipper that eye, O Agni, wherewith thou lookest on the hoof-armed demon.  With light celestial in Atharvan's manner burn up the foot who ruins truth with falsehood.

verses.sanskrit: यदग्ने अद्य मिथुना शपातो यद वाचस्त्र्ष्टं जनयन्तरेभाः मन्योर्मनसः शरव्या जायते या तया विध्यह्र्दये यातुधानान |||
verses.transliteration: yadaghne adya mithunā śapāto yad vācastṛṣṭaṃ janayantarebhāḥ manyormanasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhyahṛdaye yātudhānān

translations.griffith: Agni, what curse the pair this day have uttered, what heated word the worshippers have spoken,  Each arrowy taunt sped from the angry spirit,—pierce to the heart therewith the Yātudhānas.

verses.sanskrit: परा शर्णीहि तपसा यातुधानान पराग्ने रक्षो हरसाश्र्णीहि परार्चिषा मूरदेवाञ्छ्र्णीहि परासुत्र्पो अभिशोशुचानः |||
verses.transliteration: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parāghne rakṣo harasāśṛṇīhi parārciṣā mūradevāñchṛṇīhi parāsutṛpo abhiśośucānaḥ

translations.griffith: With fervent heat exterminate the demons; destroy the fiends with burning flame, O Agni.  Destroy with fire the foolish gods' adorers; blaze and destrepy the insatiable monsters.

verses.sanskrit: पराद्य देवा वर्जिनं शर्णन्तु परत्यगेनं शपथा यन्तुत्र्ष्टाः वाचास्तेनं शरव रछन्तु मर्मन विश्वस्यैतुप्रसितिं यातुधानः |||
verses.transliteration: parādya devā vṛjinaṃ śṛṇantu pratyaghenaṃ śapathā yantutṛṣṭāḥ vācāstenaṃ śarava ṛchantu marman viśvasyaituprasitiṃ yātudhānaḥ

translations.griffith: May Gods destroy this day the evil-doer may each hot curse of his return and blast him.  Let arrows pierce the liar in his vitals, and Visva's net enclose the Yātudhāna.

verses.sanskrit: यः पौरुषेयेण करविषा समङकते यो अश्वेयेन पशुनायातुधानः यो अघ्न्याया भरति कषीरमग्ने तेषांशीर्षाणि हरसापि वर्श्च |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ pauruṣeyeṇa kraviṣā samaṅkte yo aśveyena paśunāyātudhānaḥ yo aghnyāyā bharati kṣīramaghne teṣāṃśīrṣāṇi harasāpi vṛśca

translations.griffith: The fiend who smears himself with flesh of cattle, with flesh of horses and of human bodies,  Who steals the milch-cow's milk away, O Agni,—tear off the heads of such with fiery fury.

verses.sanskrit: संवत्सरीणं पय उस्रियायास्तस्य माशीद यातुधानोन्र्चक्षः पीयूषमग्ने यतमस्तित्र्प्सात तं परत्यञ्चमर्चिषा विध्य मर्मन |||
verses.transliteration: saṃvatsarīṇaṃ paya usriyāyāstasya māśīd yātudhānonṛcakṣaḥ pīyūṣamaghne yatamastitṛpsāt taṃ pratyañcamarciṣā vidhya marman

translations.griffith: The cow gives milk each year, O Man-regarder: let not the Yātudhāna ever taste it.  If one would glut him with the biesting, Agni, pierce with thy flame his vitals as he meets thee.

verses.sanskrit: विषं गवां यातुधानाः पिबन्त्वा वर्श्च्यन्तामदितयेदुरेवाः परैनान देवः सविता ददातु परा भागमोषधीनां जयन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: viṣaṃ ghavāṃ yātudhānāḥ pibantvā vṛścyantāmaditayedurevāḥ parainān devaḥ savitā dadātu parā bhāghamoṣadhīnāṃ jayantām

translations.griffith: Let the fiends drink the poison of the cattle; may Aditi cast off the evildoers.  May the God Savitar give them up to ruin, and be their share of plants and herbs denied them.

verses.sanskrit: सनादग्ने मर्णसि यातुधानान न तवा रक्षांसि पर्तनासुजिग्युः अनु दह सहमूरान करव्यादो मा ते हेत्या मुक्षतदैव्यायाः |||
verses.transliteration: sanādaghne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsujighyuḥ anu daha sahamūrān kravyādo mā te hetyā mukṣatadaivyāyāḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, from days of old thou slayest demons: never shall Rākṣasas in fight o’ercome thee.  Burn up the foolish ones, the flesh-devourers: let none of them escape thine heavenly arrow.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अग्ने अधरादुदक्तात तवं पश्चादुत रक्षापुरस्तात परति ते ते अजरासस्तपिष्ठा अघशंसंशोशुचतो दहन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne adharādudaktāt tvaṃ paścāduta rakṣāpurastāt prati te te ajarāsastapiṣṭhā aghaśaṃsaṃśośucato dahantu

translations.griffith: Guard us, O Agni, from above and under, protect us fl-om behind us and before us;  And may thy flames, most fierce and never wasting, glowing with fervent heat, consume the sinner.

verses.sanskrit: पश्चात पुरस्तादधरादुदक्तात कविः काव्येन परि पाहिराजन सखे सखायमजरो जरिम्णे.अग्ने मर्तानमर्त्यस्त्वं नः |||
verses.transliteration: paścāt purastādadharādudaktāt kaviḥ kāvyena pari pāhirājan sakhe sakhāyamajaro jarimṇe.aghne martānamartyastvaṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: From rear, from front, from under, from above us, O King, protect us as a Sage with wisdom.  Guard to old age thy friend, O Friend, Eternal: O Agni, as Immortal, guard us mortals.

verses.sanskrit: परि तवाग्ने पुरं वयं विप्रं सहस्य धीमहि धर्षद्वर्णं दिवे-दिवे हन्तारं भङगुरावताम |||
verses.transliteration: pari tvāghne puraṃ vayaṃ vipraṃ sahasya dhīmahi dhṛṣadvarṇaṃ dive-dive hantāraṃ bhaṅghurāvatām

translations.griffith: We set thee round us as a fort, victorious Agni, thee a Sage,  Of hero lineage, day by day, destroyer of our treacherous foes.

verses.sanskrit: विषेण भङगुरावतः परति षम रक्षसो दह अग्नेतिग्मेन शोचिषा तपुरग्राभिरषटिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: viṣeṇa bhaṅghurāvataḥ prati ṣma rakṣaso daha aghnetighmena śociṣā tapuraghrābhirṣṭibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Burn with thy poison turned against the treacherous brood of Rākṣasas,  O Agni, with thy sharpened glow, with lances armed with points of flame.

verses.sanskrit: परत्यग्ने मिथुन दह यातुधाना किमीदिना सं तवाशिशामि जाब्र्ह्यदब्धं विप्र मन्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: pratyaghne mithuna daha yātudhānā kimīdinā saṃ tvāśiśāmi jābṛhyadabdhaṃ vipra manmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Burn thou the paired Kimīdins, brun, Agni, the Yātudhāna pairs.  I sharpen thee, Infallible, with hymns. O Sage, be vigilant.

verses.sanskrit: परत्यग्ने हरसा हरः शर्णीहि विश्वतः परति यातुधानस्य रक्षसो बलं वि रुज वीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: pratyaghne harasā haraḥ śṛṇīhi viśvataḥ prati yātudhānasya rakṣaso balaṃ vi ruja vīryam

translations.griffith: Shoot forth, O Agni, with thy flame demolish them on every side.  Break thou the Yātudhāna's strength, the vigour of the Rākṣasa.

verses.sanskrit: हविष पान्तमजरं सवर्विदि दिविस्प्र्श्याहुतं जुष्टमग्नौ तस्य भर्मणे भुवनाय देवा धर्मणे कंस्वधया पप्रथन्त |||
verses.transliteration: haviṣ pāntamajaraṃ svarvidi divispṛśyāhutaṃ juṣṭamaghnau tasya bharmaṇe bhuvanāya devā dharmaṇe kaṃsvadhayā paprathanta

translations.griffith: DEAR, ageless sacrificial drink is offered in light-discovering, heaven-pervading Agni.  The Gods spread forth through his Celestial Nature, that he might bear the world up and sustain it.

verses.sanskrit: गीर्णं भुवनं तमसपगूळमाविः सवरभवज्जातेग्नौ तस्य देवाः पर्थिवि दयौरुतापो.अरणयन्नोषधीः सख्ये अस्य |||
verses.transliteration: ghīrṇaṃ bhuvanaṃ tamasapaghūḷamāviḥ svarabhavajjāteaghnau tasya devāḥ pṛthivi dyaurutāpo.araṇayannoṣadhīḥ sakhye asya

translations.griffith: The world was swallowed and concealed in darkness: Agni was born, and light became apparent.  The Deities, the broad earth, and the heavens, and plants, and waters gloried in his friendship.

verses.sanskrit: देवेभिर्न्विषितो यज्ञियेभिरग्निं सतोषाण्यजरम्ब्र्हन्तम यो भानुना पर्थिविं दयामुतेमामाततानरोदसी अन्तरिक्षम |||
verses.transliteration: devebhirnviṣito yajñiyebhiraghniṃ stoṣāṇyajarambṛhantam yo bhānunā pṛthiviṃ dyāmutemāmātatānarodasī antarikṣam

translations.griffith: Inspired by Gods who claim our adoration, I now will laud Eternal Lofty Agni,  Him who hath spread abroad the earth with lustre, this heaven, and both the worlds, and air's mid-region.

verses.sanskrit: यो होतासीत परथमो देवजुष्टो यं समञ्जन्नाज्येनाव्र्णानः स पतत्रीत्वरं सथ जगद यच्छ्वात्रमग्निरक्र्नोज्जातवेदः |||
verses.transliteration: yo hotāsīt prathamo devajuṣṭo yaṃ samañjannājyenāvṛṇānaḥ sa patatrītvaraṃ stha jaghad yacchvātramaghnirakṛnojjātavedaḥ

translations.griffith: Earliest Priest whom all the Gods accepted, and chose him, and anointed him with butter,  He swiftly made all things that fly, stand, travel, all that hath motion, Agni Jātavedas.

verses.sanskrit: यज्जतवेदो भुवनस्य मूर्धन्नतिष्ठो अग्ने सह रोचनेन तं तवहेम मतिभिर्गीर्भिरुक्थैः स यज्ञियो अभवोरोदसिप्राः |||
verses.transliteration: yajjatavedo bhuvanasya mūrdhannatiṣṭho aghne saha rocanena taṃ tvahema matibhirghīrbhirukthaiḥ sa yajñiyo abhavorodasiprāḥ

translations.griffith: Because thou, Agni, Jātavedas, stoodest at the world's head with thy refulgent splendour,  We sent thee forth with hymns and songs and praises: thou filledst heaven and earth, God meet for worship.

verses.sanskrit: मूर्धा भुवो भवति नक्तमग्निस्ततः सुर्यो जायतेप्रातरुद्यन मयामु तु यज्ञियानामेतमपो यत्तूर्णिश्चरति परजानन |||
verses.transliteration: mūrdhā bhuvo bhavati naktamaghnistataḥ suryo jāyateprātarudyan mayāmu tu yajñiyānāmetamapo yattūrṇiścarati prajānan

translations.griffith: Head of the world is Agni in the night-time; then, as the Sun, at morn springs up and rises.  Then to his task goes the prompt Priest foreknowing the wondrous power of Gods who must be honoured.

verses.sanskrit: दर्शेन्यो यो महिना समिद्धो.अरोचत दिवियोनिर्विभावा तस्मिन्नग्नौ सूक्तवाकेन देवा हविर्विश्व अजुहवुस्तनूपाः |||
verses.transliteration: dṛśenyo yo mahinā samiddho.arocata diviyonirvibhāvā tasminnaghnau sūktavākena devā havirviśva ajuhavustanūpāḥ

translations.griffith: Lovely is he who, kindled in his greatness, hath shone forth, seated in the heavens, refulgent.  With resonant hymns all Gods who guard our bodies have offered up oblation in this Agni.

verses.sanskrit: सूक्तवकं परथममादिदग्निमादिद धविरजनयन्तदेवाः स एषां यज्ञो अभवत तनूपस्तं दयौर्वेदतं परिथिवि तमापः |||
verses.transliteration: sūktavakaṃ prathamamādidaghnimādid dhavirajanayantadevāḥ sa eṣāṃ yajño abhavat tanūpastaṃ dyaurvedataṃ prithivi tamāpaḥ

translations.griffith: First the Gods brought the hymnal into being; then they engendered Agni, then oblation.  He was their sacrifice that guards our bodies: him the heavens know, the earth, the waters know him.

verses.sanskrit: यं देवासो अजनयन्ताग्निं यस्मिन्नाजुहवुर्भुवनानिविश्वा सो अर्चिषा पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमां रजूयमानोतपन महित्वा |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ devāso ajanayantāghniṃ yasminnājuhavurbhuvanāniviśvā so arciṣā pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāṃ ṛjūyamānoatapan mahitvā

translations.griffith: He, Agni, whom the Gods have generated, in whom they offered up all worlds and creatures,  He with his bright glow heated earth and heaven, urging himself right onward in his grandeur.

verses.sanskrit: सतोमेन हि दिवि देवासो अग्निमजीजनञ्छक्तिभीरोदसिप्राम तमू अक्र्ण्वन तरेधा भुवे कं स ओषधीःपचति विश्वरूपाः |||
verses.transliteration: stomena hi divi devāso aghnimajījanañchaktibhīrodasiprām tamū akṛṇvan tredhā bhuve kaṃ sa oṣadhīḥpacati viśvarūpāḥ

translations.griffith: Then by the laud the Gods engendered Agni in heaven, who fills both worlds through strength and vigour.  They made him to appear in threefold essence: he ripens plants of every form and nature.

verses.sanskrit: यदेदेनमदधुर्यज्ञियासो दिवि देवाः सूर्यमादितेयम यदा चरिष्णू मिथुनावभूतामादित परापश्यन्भुवनानि विश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: yadedenamadadhuryajñiyāso divi devāḥ sūryamāditeyam yadā cariṣṇū mithunāvabhūtāmādit prāpaśyanbhuvanāni viśvā

translations.griffith: What time the Gods, whose due is worship, set him as Sūrya, Son of Aditi, in heaven,  When the Pair, ever wandering, sprang to being, all creatures that existed looked upon them.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वस्मा अग्निं भुवनाय देवा वैश्वानरं केतुमह्नामक्र्ण्वन आ यस्ततानोषसो विभातीरपो ऊर्णोति तमोर्चिषा यन |||
verses.transliteration: viśvasmā aghniṃ bhuvanāya devā vaiśvānaraṃ ketumahnāmakṛṇvan ā yastatānoṣaso vibhātīrapo ūrṇoti tamoarciṣā yan

translations.griffith: For all the world of life the Gods made Agni Vaiśvānara to be the days' bright Banner,—  Him who hath spread abroad the radiant Mornings, and, coming with his light, unveils the darkness.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानरं कवयो यज्ञियासो.अग्निं देवा अजनयन्नजुर्यम नक्षत्रं परत्नममिनच्चरिष्णु यक्षस्याध्यक्षन्तविषं बर्हन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānaraṃ kavayo yajñiyāso.aghniṃ devā ajanayannajuryam nakṣatraṃ pratnamaminaccariṣṇu yakṣasyādhyakṣantaviṣaṃ bṛhantam

translations.griffith: The wise and holy Deities engendered Agni Vaiśvānara whom age ne’er touches.  The Ancient Star that wanders on for ever, lofty and. strong, Lord of the Living Being.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानरं विश्वहा दीदिवांसं मन्त्रैरग्निं कविमछा वदामः यो महिम्ना परिबभूवोर्वी उतावस्तादुतदेवः परस्तात |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānaraṃ viśvahā dīdivāṃsaṃ mantrairaghniṃ kavimachā vadāmaḥ yo mahimnā paribabhūvorvī utāvastādutadevaḥ parastāt

translations.griffith: We call upon the Sage with holy verses, Agni Vaiśvānara the ever-beaming,  Who hath surpassed both heaven and earth in greatness: he is a God below, a God above us.

verses.sanskrit: दवे सरुती अश्र्णवं पितॄणामहं देवानामुतमर्त्यानाम ताभ्यामिदं विश्वमेजत समेति यदन्तरापितरं मातरं च |||
verses.transliteration: dve srutī aśṛṇavaṃ pitṝṇāmahaṃ devānāmutamartyānām tābhyāmidaṃ viśvamejat sameti yadantarāpitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca

translations.griffith: I have heard mention of two several pathways, ways of the Fathers and of Gods and mortals.  On these two paths each moving creature travels, each thing between the Father and the Mother.

verses.sanskrit: दवे समीची बिभ्र्तश्चरन्तं शीर्षतो जातं मनसाविम्र्ष्टम स परत्यं विश्वा भुवनानि तस्थावप्रयुछन्तरणिर्भ्राजमानः |||
verses.transliteration: dve samīcī bibhṛtaścarantaṃ śīrṣato jātaṃ manasāvimṛṣṭam sa pratyaṃ viśvā bhuvanāni tasthāvaprayuchantaraṇirbhrājamānaḥ

translations.griffith: These two united paths bear him who journeys born from the head and pondered with the spirit  He stands directed to all things existing, hasting, unresting in his fiery splendour.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रा वदेते अवरः परश्च यज्ञन्योः कतरो नौ वि वेद आ शेकुरित सधमादं सखायो नक्षन्त यज्ञं कैदं वि वोचत |||
verses.transliteration: yatrā vadete avaraḥ paraśca yajñanyoḥ kataro nau vi veda ā śekurit sadhamādaṃ sakhāyo nakṣanta yajñaṃ kaidaṃ vi vocat

translations.griffith: Which of us twain knows where they speak together, upper and lower of the two rite-leaders?  Our friends have helped to gather our assembly. They came to sacrifice; who will announce it?

verses.sanskrit: कत्यग्नयः कति सूर्यासः कत्युषासः कत्यु सविदापः नोपस्पिजं वः पितरो वदामि पर्छामि वः कवयोविद्मने कम |||
verses.transliteration: katyaghnayaḥ kati sūryāsaḥ katyuṣāsaḥ katyu svidāpaḥ nopaspijaṃ vaḥ pitaro vadāmi pṛchāmi vaḥ kavayovidmane kam

translations.griffith: How many are the Fires and Suns in number? What is the number of the Dawns and Waters?  Not jestingly I speak to you, O Fathers. Sages, I ask you this for information.

verses.sanskrit: यावन्मात्रमुषसो न परतीकं सुपर्ण्यो वसतेमातरिश्वः तावद दधात्युप यज्ञमायन बराह्मणोहोतुरवरो निषीदन |||
verses.transliteration: yāvanmātramuṣaso na pratīkaṃ suparṇyo vasatemātariśvaḥ tāvad dadhātyupa yajñamāyan brāhmaṇohoturavaro niṣīdan

translations.griffith: As great as is the fair-winged Morning's presence to him who dwells beside us, Mātariśvan!  Is what the Brahman does when he approaches to sacrifice and sits below the Hotar.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं सतवा नर्तमं यस्य मह्ना विबबाधे रोचना वि जमोन्तान आ यः पप्रौ चर्षणीध्र्द वरोभिः परसिन्धुभ्यो रिरिचानो महित्वा |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ stavā nṛtamaṃ yasya mahnā vibabādhe rocanā vi jmoantān ā yaḥ paprau carṣaṇīdhṛd varobhiḥ prasindhubhyo riricāno mahitvā

translations.griffith: I WILL extol the most heroic Indra who with his might forced earth and sky asunder;  Who hath filled all with width as man's Upholder, surpassing floods and rivers in his greatness.

verses.sanskrit: स सूर्यः पर्युरू वरांस्येन्द्रो वव्र्त्याद रथ्येवचक्रा अतिष्ठन्तमपस्यं न सर्गं कर्ष्णा तमांसित्विष्या जघान |||
verses.transliteration: sa sūryaḥ paryurū varāṃsyendro vavṛtyād rathyevacakrā atiṣṭhantamapasyaṃ na sarghaṃ kṛṣṇā tamāṃsitviṣyā jaghāna

translations.griffith: Sūrya is he: throughout the wide expanses shall Indra turn him, swift as car-wheels, hither,  Like a stream resting not but ever active he hath destroyed, with light, the black-hued darkness.

verses.sanskrit: समानमस्मा अनपाव्र्दर्च कष्मया दिवो असमं बरह्मनव्यम वि यः पर्ष्ठेव जनिमान्यर्य इन्द्रश्चिकाय नसखायमीषे |||
verses.transliteration: samānamasmā anapāvṛdarca kṣmayā divo asamaṃ brahmanavyam vi yaḥ pṛṣṭheva janimānyarya indraścikāya nasakhāyamīṣe

translations.griffith: To him I sing a holy prayer, incessant new, matchless, common to the earth and heaven,  Who marks, as they were backs, all living creatures: ne’er doth he fail a friend, the noble Indra.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय गिरो अनिशितसर्गा अपः परेरयं सगरस्य बुध्नात यो अक्षेणेव चक्रिया शचीभिर्विष्वक तस्तम्भप्र्थिवीमुत दयाम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya ghiro aniśitasarghā apaḥ prerayaṃ sagharasya budhnāt yo akṣeṇeva cakriyā śacībhirviṣvak tastambhapṛthivīmuta dyām

translations.griffith: I will send forth my songs in flow unceasing, like water from the ocean's depth, to Indra.  Who to his car on both its sides securely hath fixed the earth and heaven as with an axle.

verses.sanskrit: आपान्तमन्युस्त्र्पलप्रभर्मा धुनिः शिमीवाञ्छरुमान्र्जीषी सोमो विश्वान्यतसा वनानि नार्वागिन्द्रम्प्रतिमानानि देभुः |||
verses.transliteration: āpāntamanyustṛpalaprabharmā dhuniḥ śimīvāñcharumānṛjīṣī somo viśvānyatasā vanāni nārvāghindrampratimānāni debhuḥ

translations.griffith: Rousing with draughts, the Shaker, rushing onward, impetuous, very strong, armed as with arrows  Is Soma; forest trees and all the bushes deceive not Indra with their offered likeness.

verses.sanskrit: न यस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी न धन्व नान्तरिक्षं नाद्रयःसोमो अक्षाः यदस्य मन्युरधिनीयमानः सर्णाति वीळुरुजति सथिराणि |||
verses.transliteration: na yasya dyāvāpṛthivī na dhanva nāntarikṣaṃ nādrayaḥsomo akṣāḥ yadasya manyuradhinīyamānaḥ sṛṇāti vīḷurujati sthirāṇi

translations.griffith: Soma hath flowed to him whom naught can equal, the earth, the heavens, the firmament, the mountains,—  When heightened in his ire his indignation shatters the firm and breaks the strong in pieces.

verses.sanskrit: जघान वर्त्रं सवधितिर्वनेव रुरोज पुरो अरदन नसिन्धून बिभेद गिरिं नवमिन न कुम्भमा गा इन्द्रोक्र्णुत सवयुग्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: jaghāna vṛtraṃ svadhitirvaneva ruroja puro aradan nasindhūn bibheda ghiriṃ navamin na kumbhamā ghā indroakṛṇuta svayughbhiḥ

translations.griffith: As an axe fells the tree so be slew Vṛtra, brake down the strongholds and dug out the rivers.  He cleft the mountain like a new-made pitcher. Indra brought forth the kine with his Companions.

verses.sanskrit: तवं ह तयद रणया इन्द्र धीरो.असिर्न पर्व वर्जिनाश्र्णासि पर ये मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम युजं न जनामिनन्ति मित्रम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ ha tyad ṛṇayā indra dhīro.asirna parva vṛjināśṛṇāsi pra ye mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma yujaṃ na janāminanti mitram

translations.griffith: Wise art thou, Punisher of guilt, O Indra. The sword lops limbs, thou smitest down the sinner,  The men who injure, as it were a comrade, the lofty Law of Varuṇa and Mitra.

verses.sanskrit: पर ये मित्रं परार्यमणं दुरेवाः पर संगिरः परवरुणं मिनन्ति नयमित्रेषु वधमिन्द्र तुम्रं वर्षन्व्र्षाणमरुषं शिशीहि |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye mitraṃ prāryamaṇaṃ durevāḥ pra saṃghiraḥ pravaruṇaṃ minanti nyamitreṣu vadhamindra tumraṃ vṛṣanvṛṣāṇamaruṣaṃ śiśīhi

translations.griffith: Men who lead evil lives, who break agreements, and injure Varuṇa, Aryaman and Mitra,—  Against these foes, O Mighty Indra, sharpen, as furious death, thy Bull of fiery colour.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो दिव इन्द्र ईशे पर्थिव्या इन्द्रो अपामिन्द्र इत्पर्वतानाम इन्द्रो वर्धामिन्द्र इन मेधिराणामिन्द्रःक्षेमे योगे हव्य इन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: indro diva indra īśe pṛthivyā indro apāmindra itparvatānām indro vṛdhāmindra in medhirāṇāmindraḥkṣeme yoghe havya indraḥ

translations.griffith: Indra is Sovran Lord of Earth and Heaven, Indra is Lord of waters and of mountains.  Indra is Lord of prosperers and sages Indra must be invoked in rest and effort.

verses.sanskrit: पराक्तुभ्य इन्द्रः पर वर्धो अहभ्यः परान्तरिक्षात परसमुद्रस्य धासेः पर वातस्य परथसः पर जमो अन्तात्प्र सिन्धुभ्यो रिरिचे पर कषितिभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: prāktubhya indraḥ pra vṛdho ahabhyaḥ prāntarikṣāt prasamudrasya dhāseḥ pra vātasya prathasaḥ pra jmo antātpra sindhubhyo ririce pra kṣitibhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Vaster than days and nights, Giver of increase, vaster than firmament and flood of ocean,  Vaster than bounds of earth and wind's extension, vaster than rivers and our lands is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: पर शोशुचत्या उषसो न केतुरसिन्वा ते वर्ततामिन्द्रहेतिः अश्मेव विध्य दिव आ सर्जानस्तपिष्ठेन हेषसाद्रोघमित्रान |||
verses.transliteration: pra śośucatyā uṣaso na keturasinvā te vartatāmindrahetiḥ aśmeva vidhya diva ā sṛjānastapiṣṭhena heṣasādroghamitrān

translations.griffith: Forward, as herald of refulgent Morning, let thine insatiate arrow fly, O Indra.  And pierce, as ’twere a stone launched forth from heaven, with hottest blaze the men who love deception.

verses.sanskrit: अन्वह मासा अन्विद वनान्यन्वोषधीरनु पर्वतासः अन्विन्द्रं रोदसी वावशाने अन्वापो अजिहतजायमानम |||
verses.transliteration: anvaha māsā anvid vanānyanvoṣadhīranu parvatāsaḥ anvindraṃ rodasī vāvaśāne anvāpo ajihatajāyamānam

translations.griffith: Him, verily, the moons, the mountains followed, the tall trees followed and the plants and herbage.  Yearning with love both Worlds approached, the Waters waited on Indra when he first had being.

verses.sanskrit: कर्हि सवित सा त इन्द्र चेत्यासदघस्य यद भिनदो रक्षेषत मित्रक्रुवो यच्छसने न गावः पर्थिव्या आप्र्गमुया शयन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: karhi svit sā ta indra cetyāsadaghasya yad bhinado rakṣaeṣat mitrakruvo yacchasane na ghāvaḥ pṛthivyā āpṛghamuyā śayante

translations.griffith: Where was the vengeful dart when thou, O Indra, clavest the demon ever beat on outrage?  When fiends lay there upon the ground extended like cattle in the place of immolation?

verses.sanskrit: शत्रूयन्तो अभि ये नस्ततस्रे महि वराधन्त ओगणासैन्द्र अन्धेनामित्रास्तमसा सचन्तां सुज्योतिषो अक्तवस्तानभि षयुः |||
verses.transliteration: śatrūyanto abhi ye nastatasre mahi vrādhanta oghaṇāsaindra andhenāmitrāstamasā sacantāṃ sujyotiṣo aktavastānabhi ṣyuḥ

translations.griffith: Those who are set in enmity against us, the Ogaṇas, O Indra, waxen mighty,—  Let blinding darkness follow those our foemen, while these shall have bright shining nights to light them.

verses.sanskrit: पुरूणि हि तवा सवना जनानां बरह्माणि मन्दन गर्णताम्र्षीणाम इमामाघोषन्नवसा सहूतिं तिरो विश्वानर्चतो याह्यर्वां |||
verses.transliteration: purūṇi hi tvā savanā janānāṃ brahmāṇi mandan ghṛṇatāmṛṣīṇām imāmāghoṣannavasā sahūtiṃ tiro viśvānarcato yāhyarvāṃ

translations.griffith: May plentiful libations of the people, and singing Ṛṣis’ holy prayers rejoice thee.  Hearing with love this common invocation, come unto us, pass by all those who praise thee.

verses.sanskrit: एवा ते वयमिन्द्र भुञ्जतीनां विद्याम सुमतीनांनवानाम विद्याम वस्तोरवसा गर्णन्तो विश्वामित्रा उतत इन्द्र नूनम |||
verses.transliteration: evā te vayamindra bhuñjatīnāṃ vidyāma sumatīnāṃnavānām vidyāma vastoravasā ghṛṇanto viśvāmitrā utata indra nūnam

translations.griffith: O Indra, thus may we be made partakers of thy new favours that shall bring us profit.  Singing with love, may we the Viśvāmitras win daylight even now through thee, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: शुनं हुवेम मघवानं ... ||
verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema maghavānaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,  The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रशीर्षा पुरुषः सहस्राक्षः सहस्रपात सभूमिं विश्वतो वर्त्वात्यतिष्ठद दशाङगुलम |||
verses.transliteration: sahasraśīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasrākṣaḥ sahasrapāt sabhūmiṃ viśvato vṛtvātyatiṣṭhad daśāṅghulam

translations.griffith: A THOUSAND heads hath Puruṣa, a thousand eyes, a thousand feet.  On every side pervading earth he fills a space ten fingers wide.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुष एवेदं सर्वं यद भूतं यच्च भव्यम उताम्र्तत्वस्येशानो यदन्नेनातिरोहति |||
verses.transliteration: puruṣa evedaṃ sarvaṃ yad bhūtaṃ yacca bhavyam utāmṛtatvasyeśāno yadannenātirohati

translations.griffith: This Puruṣa is all that yet hath been and all that is to be;  The Lord of Immortality which waxes greater still by food.

verses.sanskrit: एतावानस्य महिमातो जयायांश्च पूरुषः पादो.अस्यविश्वा भूतानि तरिपादस्याम्र्तं दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: etāvānasya mahimāto jyāyāṃśca pūruṣaḥ pādo.asyaviśvā bhūtāni tripādasyāmṛtaṃ divi

translations.griffith: So mighty is his greatness; yea, greater than this is Puruṣa.  All creatures are one-fourth of him, three-fourths eternal life in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तरिपादूर्ध्व उदैत पुरुषः पादो.अस्येहाभवत पुनः ततो विष्वं वयक्रामत साशनानशने अभि |||
verses.transliteration: tripādūrdhva udait puruṣaḥ pādo.asyehābhavat punaḥ tato viṣvaṃ vyakrāmat sāśanānaśane abhi

translations.griffith: With three-fourths Puruṣa went up: one-fourth of him again was here.  Thence he strode out to every side over what cats not and what cats.

verses.sanskrit: तस्माद विराळ अजायत विराजो अधि पूरुषः स जातोत्यरिच्यत पश्चाद भूमिमथो पुरः |||
verses.transliteration: tasmād virāḷ ajāyata virājo adhi pūruṣaḥ sa jātoatyaricyata paścād bhūmimatho puraḥ

translations.griffith: From him Virāj was born; again Puruṣa from Virāj was born.  As soon as he was born he spread eastward and westward o’er the earth.

verses.sanskrit: यत पुरुषेण हविषा देवा यज्ञमतन्वत वसन्तोस्यासीदाज्यं गरीष्म इध्मः शरद धविः |||
verses.transliteration: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā devā yajñamatanvata vasantoasyāsīdājyaṃ ghrīṣma idhmaḥ śarad dhaviḥ

translations.griffith: When Gods prepared the sacrifice with Puruṣa as their offering,  Its oil was spring, the holy gift was autumn; summer was the wood.

verses.sanskrit: तं यज्ञं बर्हिषि परौक्षन पुरुषं जातमग्रतः तेन देवा अयजन्त साध्या रषयश्च ये |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ yajñaṃ barhiṣi praukṣan puruṣaṃ jātamaghrataḥ tena devā ayajanta sādhyā ṛṣayaśca ye

translations.griffith: They balmed as victim on the grass Puruṣa born in earliest time.  With him the Deities and all Sādhyas and Ṛṣis sacrificed.

verses.sanskrit: तस्माद यज्ञात सर्वहुतः सम्भ्र्तं पर्षदाज्यम पशून्तांश्चक्रे वायव्यानारण्यान गराम्याश्च ये |||
verses.transliteration: tasmād yajñāt sarvahutaḥ sambhṛtaṃ pṛṣadājyam paśūntāṃścakre vāyavyānāraṇyān ghrāmyāśca ye

translations.griffith: From that great general sacrifice the dripping fat was gathered up.  He formed the creatures of-the air, and animals both wild and tame.

verses.sanskrit: तस्माद यज्ञात सर्वहुत रचः सामानि जज्ञिरे छन्दांसिजज्ञिरे तस्माद यजुस्तस्मादजायत |||
verses.transliteration: tasmād yajñāt sarvahuta ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire chandāṃsijajñire tasmād yajustasmādajāyata

translations.griffith: From that great general sacrifice Ṛcas and Sāma-hymns were born:  Therefrom were spells and charms produced; the Yajus had its birth from it.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मादश्वा अजायन्त ये के चोभयादतः गावो हजज्ञिरे तस्मात तस्माज्जाता अजावयः |||
verses.transliteration: tasmādaśvā ajāyanta ye ke cobhayādataḥ ghāvo hajajñire tasmāt tasmājjātā ajāvayaḥ

translations.griffith: From it were horses born, from it all cattle with two rows of teeth:  From it were generated kine, from it the goats and sheep were born.

verses.sanskrit: यत पुरुषं वयदधुः कतिधा वयकल्पयन मुखं किमस्य कौ बाहू का ऊरू पादा उच्येते |||
verses.transliteration: yat puruṣaṃ vyadadhuḥ katidhā vyakalpayan mukhaṃ kimasya kau bāhū kā ūrū pādā ucyete

translations.griffith: When they divided Puruṣa how many portions did they make?  What do they call his mouth, his arms? What do they call his thighs and feet?

verses.sanskrit: बराह्मणो.अस्य मुखमासीद बाहू राजन्यः कर्तः ऊरूतदस्य यद वैश्यः पद्भ्यां शूद्रो अजायत |||
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇo.asya mukhamāsīd bāhū rājanyaḥ kṛtaḥ ūrūtadasya yad vaiśyaḥ padbhyāṃ śūdro ajāyata

translations.griffith: The Brahman was his mouth, of both his arms was the Rājanya made.  His thighs became the Vaiśya, from his feet the Śūdra was produced.

verses.sanskrit: चन्द्रमा मनसो जातश्चक्षोः सूर्यो अजायत मुखादिन्द्रश्चाग्निश्च पराणाद वायुरजायत |||
verses.transliteration: candramā manaso jātaścakṣoḥ sūryo ajāyata mukhādindraścāghniśca prāṇād vāyurajāyata

translations.griffith: The Moon was gendered from his mind, and from his eye the Sun had birth;  Indra and Agni from his mouth were born, and Vāyu from his breath.

verses.sanskrit: नाभ्या आसीदन्तरिक्षं शीर्ष्णो दयौः समवर्तत पद्भ्यां भूमिर्दिशः शरोत्रात तथा लोकानकल्पयन |||
verses.transliteration: nābhyā āsīdantarikṣaṃ śīrṣṇo dyauḥ samavartata padbhyāṃ bhūmirdiśaḥ śrotrāt tathā lokānakalpayan

translations.griffith: Forth from his navel came mid-air the sky was fashioned from his head  Earth from his feet, and from his car the regions. Thus they formed the worlds.

verses.sanskrit: सप्तास्यासन परिधयस्त्रिः सप्त समिधः कर्ताः देवायद यज्ञं तन्वाना अबध्नन पुरुषं पशुम |||
verses.transliteration: saptāsyāsan paridhayastriḥ sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ devāyad yajñaṃ tanvānā abadhnan puruṣaṃ paśum

translations.griffith: Seven fencing-sticks had he, thrice seven layers of fuel were prepared,  When the Gods, offering sacrifice, bound, as their victim, Puruṣa.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञेन यज्ञमयजन्त देवास्तानि धर्माणि परथमान्यासन ते ह नाकं महिमानः सचन्त यत्र पूर्वे साध्याःसन्ति देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: yajñena yajñamayajanta devāstāni dharmāṇi prathamānyāsan te ha nākaṃ mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥsanti devāḥ

translations.griffith: Gods, sacrificing, sacrificed the victim these were the earliest holy ordinances.  The Mighty Ones attained the height of heaven, there where the Sādhyas, Gods of old, are dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: सं जाग्र्वद्भिर्जरमाण इध्यते दमे दमूना इषयन्निळस पदे विश्वस्य होता हविषो वरेण्यो विभुर्विभावासुषखा सखीयते |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ jāghṛvadbhirjaramāṇa idhyate dame damūnā iṣayanniḷas pade viśvasya hotā haviṣo vareṇyo vibhurvibhāvāsuṣakhā sakhīyate

translations.griffith: BRISK, at the place of Iḷā, hymned by men who wake, our own familiar Friend is kindled in the house;  Hotar of all oblation, worthy of our choice, Lord, beaming, trusty friend to one who loveth him.

verses.sanskrit: स दर्शतश्रीरतिथिर्ग्र्हे-गर्हे वने-वने शिश्रियेतक्ववीरिव जनं-जनं जन्यो नाति मन्यते विश आक्षेति विश्यो विशं विशम |||
verses.transliteration: sa darśataśrīratithirghṛhe-ghṛhe vane-vane śiśriyetakvavīriva janaṃ-janaṃ janyo nāti manyate viśa ākṣeti viśyo viśaṃ viśam

translations.griffith: He, excellent in glory, guest in every house, finds like a swift-winged bird a home in every tree.  Benevolent to men, he scorns no living man: Friend to the tribes of men he dwells with every tribe.

verses.sanskrit: सुदक्षो दक्षैः करतुनासि सुक्रतुरग्ने कविः काव्येनासिविश्ववित वसुर्वसूनां कषयसि तवमेक इद दयावा चयानि पर्थिवी च पुष्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: sudakṣo dakṣaiḥ kratunāsi sukraturaghne kaviḥ kāvyenāsiviśvavit vasurvasūnāṃ kṣayasi tvameka id dyāvā cayāni pṛthivī ca puṣyataḥ

translations.griffith: Most sage with insight, passing skilful with thy powers art thou, O Agni, wise with wisdom, knowing all.  As Vasu, thou alone art Lord of all good things, of all the treasures that the heavens and earth produce.

verses.sanskrit: परजानन्नग्ने तव योनिं रत्वियमिळायास पदे घर्तवन्तमासदः आ ते चिकित्र उषसामिवेतयो.अरेपसः सूर्यस्येवरश्मयः |||
verses.transliteration: prajānannaghne tava yoniṃ ṛtviyamiḷāyās pade ghṛtavantamāsadaḥ ā te cikitra uṣasāmivetayo.arepasaḥ sūryasyevaraśmayaḥ

translations.griffith: Foreknowing well, O Agni, thou in Iḷā's place hast occupied thy regular station balmed with oil.  Marked are thy comings like the comings of the Dawns, the rays of him who shineth spotless as the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: तव शरियो वर्ष्यस्येव विद्युतश्चित्राश्चिकित्र उषसांन केतवः यदोषधीरभिस्र्ष्टो वनानि च परिस्वयं चिनुषे अन्नमास्ये |||
verses.transliteration: tava śriyo varṣyasyeva vidyutaścitrāścikitra uṣasāṃna ketavaḥ yadoṣadhīrabhisṛṣṭo vanāni ca parisvayaṃ cinuṣe annamāsye

translations.griffith: Thy glories are, as lightnings from the rainy cloud, marked, many-hued, like heralds of the Dawns’ approach,  When, loosed to wander over plants and forest trees, thou crammest by thyself thy food into thy mouth.

verses.sanskrit: तमोषधीर्दधिरे गर्भं रत्वियं तमापो अग्निंजनयन्त मातरः तमित समानं वनिनश्च वीरुधोऽनतर्वतीश्च सुवते च विश्वहा |||
verses.transliteration: tamoṣadhīrdadhire gharbhaṃ ṛtviyaṃ tamāpo aghniṃjanayanta mātaraḥ tamit samānaṃ vaninaśca vīrudho'ntarvatīśca suvate ca viśvahā

translations.griffith: Him, duly coming as their germ, have plants received: this Agni have maternal Waters brought to life.  So in like manner do the forest trees and plants bear him within them and produce him evermore.

verses.sanskrit: वातोपधूत इषितो वशाननु तर्षु यदन्ना वेविषद्वितिष्ठसे आ ते यतन्ते रथ्यो यथा पर्थक छर्धांस्यग्ने अजराणि धक्षतः |||
verses.transliteration: vātopadhūta iṣito vaśānanu tṛṣu yadannā veviṣadvitiṣṭhase ā te yatante rathyo yathā pṛthak chardhāṃsyaghne ajarāṇi dhakṣataḥ

translations.griffith: When, sped and urged by wind, thou spreadest thee abroad, swift piercing through thy food according to thy will,  Thy never-ceasing blazes, longing to consume, like men on chariots, Agni, strive on every side.

verses.sanskrit: मेधाकारं विदथस्य परसाधनमग्निं होतारम्परिभूतमं मतिम तमिदर्भे हविष्या समानमित्तमिन महे वर्णते नान्यं तवत |||
verses.transliteration: medhākāraṃ vidathasya prasādhanamaghniṃ hotāramparibhūtamaṃ matim tamidarbhe haviṣyā samānamittamin mahe vṛṇate nānyaṃ tvat

translations.griffith: Agni, the Hotar-priest who fills the assembly full, Waker of knowledge, chief Controller of the thought,—  Him, yea, none other than thyself, doth man elect at sacrificial offerings great and small alike.

verses.sanskrit: तवामिदत्र वर्णते तवायवो होतारमग्ने विदथेषुवेधसः यद देवयन्तो दधति परयाण्सि ते हविष्मन्तोमनवो वर्क्तबर्हिषः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmidatra vṛṇate tvāyavo hotāramaghne vidatheṣuvedhasaḥ yad devayanto dadhati prayāṇsi te haviṣmantomanavo vṛktabarhiṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Here, Agni, the arrangers, those attached to thee, elect thee as their Priest in sacred gatherings,  When men with strewn clipt grass and sacrificial gifts offer thee entertainment, piously inclined.

verses.sanskrit: तवाग्ने होत्रं तव पोत्रं रत्वियं तव नेष्ट्रं तवमग्निद रतायतः तव परशास्त्रं तवमध्वरीयसि बरह्माचासि गर्हपतिश्च नो दमे |||
verses.transliteration: tavāghne hotraṃ tava potraṃ ṛtviyaṃ tava neṣṭraṃ tvamaghnid ṛtāyataḥ tava praśāstraṃ tvamadhvarīyasi brahmācāsi ghṛhapatiśca no dame

translations.griffith: Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man.  Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.

verses.sanskrit: यस्तुभ्यमग्ने अम्र्ताय मर्त्यः समिधा दाशदुत वाहविष्क्र्ति तस्य होता भवसि यासि दूत्यमुप बरूषेयजस्यध्वरीयसि |||
verses.transliteration: yastubhyamaghne amṛtāya martyaḥ samidhā dāśaduta vāhaviṣkṛti tasya hotā bhavasi yāsi dūtyamupa brūṣeyajasyadhvarīyasi

translations.griffith: When mortal man presents to thee Immortal God, Agni, his fuel or his sacrificial gift,  Then thou art his Adhvaryu, Hotar, messenger, callest the Gods and orderest the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: इमा अस्मै मतयो वाचो अस्मदान रचो गिरः सुष्टुतयःसमग्मत वसूयवो वसवे जातवेदसे वर्द्धासु चिद वर्धनोयासु चाकनत |||
verses.transliteration: imā asmai matayo vāco asmadān ṛco ghiraḥ suṣṭutayaḥsamaghmata vasūyavo vasave jātavedase vṛddhāsu cid vardhanoyāsu cākanat

translations.griffith: From us these hymns in concert have gone forth to him, these. holy words, these Ṛcas, songs and eulogies,  Eager for wealth, to Jātavedas fain for wealth: when they have waxen strong they please their Strengthener.

verses.sanskrit: इमां परत्नाय सुष्टुतिं नवीयसीं वोचेयमस्मा उशतेश्र्णोतु नः भूया अन्तरा हर्द्यस्य निस्प्र्शे जायेवपत्य उशती सुवासाः |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ pratnāya suṣṭutiṃ navīyasīṃ voceyamasmā uśateśṛṇotu naḥ bhūyā antarā hṛdyasya nispṛśe jāyevapatya uśatī suvāsāḥ

translations.griffith: This newest eulogy will I speak forth to him, the Ancient One who loves it. May he hear our voice.  May it come near his heart and make it stir with love, as a fond well-dressed matron clings about her lord.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मिन्नश्वास रषभास उक्षणो वशा मेषावस्र्ष्टास आहुताः कीलालपे सोमप्र्ष्ठाय वेधसेह्र्दा मतिं जनये चारुमग्नये |||
verses.transliteration: yasminnaśvāsa ṛṣabhāsa ukṣaṇo vaśā meṣāavasṛṣṭāsa āhutāḥ kīlālape somapṛṣṭhāya vedhasehṛdā matiṃ janaye cārumaghnaye

translations.griffith: He in whom horses, bulls, oxen, and barren cows, and rams, when duly set apart, are offered up,—  To Agni, Soma-sprinkled, drinker of sweet juice, Disposer, with my heart I bring a fair hymn forth.

verses.sanskrit: अहाव्यग्ने हविरास्ये ते सरुचीव घर्तं चम्वीव सोमः वाजसनिं रयिमस्मे सुवीरं परशस्तं धेहि यशसम्ब्र्हन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: ahāvyaghne havirāsye te srucīva ghṛtaṃ camvīva somaḥ vājasaniṃ rayimasme suvīraṃ praśastaṃ dhehi yaśasambṛhantam

translations.griffith: Into thy mouth is poured the offering, Agni, as Soma into cup, oil into ladle.  Vouchsafe us wealth. strength-winning, blest with heroes, wealth lofty, praised by men, and full of splendour.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञस्य वो रथ्यं विश्पतिं विशां होतारमक्तोरतिथिं विभावसुम शोचञ्छुष्कासु हरिणीषु जर्भुरद्व्र्षा केतुर्यजतो दयामशायत |||
verses.transliteration: yajñasya vo rathyaṃ viśpatiṃ viśāṃ hotāramaktoratithiṃ vibhāvasum śocañchuṣkāsu hariṇīṣu jarbhuradvṛṣā keturyajato dyāmaśāyata

translations.griffith: I PRAISE your Charioteer of sacrifice, the Lord of men, Priest of the tribes, refulgent, Guest of night.  Blazing amid dry plants, snatching amid the green, the Strong, the Holy Herald hath attained to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इममञ्जस्पामुभये अक्र्ण्वत धर्माणमग्निं विदथस्यसाधनम अक्तुं न यह्वमुषसः पुरोहितं तनूनपातमरुषस्य निंसते |||
verses.transliteration: imamañjaspāmubhaye akṛṇvata dharmāṇamaghniṃ vidathasyasādhanam aktuṃ na yahvamuṣasaḥ purohitaṃ tanūnapātamaruṣasya niṃsate

translations.griffith: Him, Agni, Gods and men have made their chief support, who drinks the fatness and completes the sacrifice.  With kisses they caress the Grandson of the Red, like the swift ray of light, the Household Priest of Dawn.

verses.sanskrit: बळ अस्य नीथा वि पणेश्च मन्महे वया अस्य परहुताासुरत्तवे यदा घोरासो अम्र्तत्वमाशतादिज्जनस्यदैव्यस्य चर्किरन |||
verses.transliteration: baḷ asya nīthā vi paṇeśca manmahe vayā asya prahutāāsurattave yadā ghorāso amṛtatvamāśatādijjanasyadaivyasya carkiran

translations.griffith: Yea, we discriminate his and the niggard's ways: his branches evermore are sent forth to consume.  When his terrific flames have reached the Immortal's world, then men remember and extol the Heavenly Folk.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य हि परसितिर्द्यौरुरु वयचो नमो मह्यरमतिःपनीयसी इन्द्रो मित्रो वरुणः सं चिकित्रिरे.अथो भगःसविता पूतदक्षसः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya hi prasitirdyaururu vyaco namo mahyaramatiḥpanīyasī indro mitro varuṇaḥ saṃ cikitrire.atho bhaghaḥsavitā pūtadakṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: For then the net of Law, Dyaus, and the wide expanse, Earth, Worship, and Devotion meet for highest praise,  Varuṇa, Indra, Mitra were of one accord, and Savitar and Bhaga, Lords of holy might.

verses.sanskrit: पर रुद्रेण ययिना यन्ति सिन्धवस्तिरो महीमरमतिन्दधन्विरे येभिः परिज्मा परियन्नुरु जरयो वि रोरुवज्जठरे विश्वमुक्षते |||
verses.transliteration: pra rudreṇa yayinā yanti sindhavastiro mahīmaramatindadhanvire yebhiḥ parijmā pariyannuru jrayo vi roruvajjaṭhare viśvamukṣate

translations.griffith: Onward, with ever-roaming Rudra, speed the floods: over Aramati the Mighty have they run.  With them Parijman, moving round his vast domain, loud bellowing, bedews all things that are within.

verses.sanskrit: कराणा रुद्रा मरुतो विश्वक्र्ष्टयो दिवः शयेनासोसुरस्य नीळयः तेभिश्चष्टे वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमेन्द्रोदेवेभिरर्वशेभिरर्वशः |||
verses.transliteration: krāṇā rudrā maruto viśvakṛṣṭayo divaḥ śyenāsoasurasya nīḷayaḥ tebhiścaṣṭe varuṇo mitro aryamendrodevebhirarvaśebhirarvaśaḥ

translations.griffith: Straightway the Rudras, Maruts visiting all men, Falcons of Dyaus, home-dwellers with the Asura,—  Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman look on with these, and the swift-moving Indra with swift-moving Gods.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रे भुजं शशमानास आशत सूरो दर्शीके वर्षणश्च पौंस्ये पर ये नवस्यार्हणा ततक्षिरे युजं वज्रंन्र्षदनेषु कारवः |||
verses.transliteration: indre bhujaṃ śaśamānāsa āśata sūro dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaśca pauṃsye pra ye nvasyārhaṇā tatakṣire yujaṃ vajraṃnṛṣadaneṣu kāravaḥ

translations.griffith: With Indra have they found enjoyment, they who toil, in the light's beauty, in the very Strong One's strength;  The singers who in men's assemblies forged for him, according to his due, his friend the thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit: सूरश्चिदा हरितो अस्य रीरमदिन्द्रादा कश्चिद भयतेतवीयसः भीमस्य वर्ष्णो जठरादभिश्वसो दिवे-दिवेसहुरि सतन्नबाधितः |||
verses.transliteration: sūraścidā harito asya rīramadindrādā kaścid bhayatetavīyasaḥ bhīmasya vṛṣṇo jaṭharādabhiśvaso dive-divesahuri stannabādhitaḥ

translations.griffith: Even the Sun's Bay Coursers hath lie held in check: each one fears Indra as the mightiest of all.  Unhindered, from the air's vault thunders day by day the loud triumphant breathing of the fearful Bull.

verses.sanskrit: सतोमं वो अद्य रुद्राय शिक्वसे कषयद्वीराय नमसादिदिष्टन येभिः शिवः सववानेवयावभिर्दिवःसिषक्ति सवयशा निकामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: stomaṃ vo adya rudrāya śikvase kṣayadvīrāya namasādidiṣṭana yebhiḥ śivaḥ svavānevayāvabhirdivaḥsiṣakti svayaśā nikāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: With humble adoration show this day your song of praise to mighty Rudra, Ruler of the brave:  With whom, the Eager Ones, going their ordered course, he comes from heaven Self-bright, auspicious, strong to guard.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि परजाया अभरन्त वि शरवो बर्हस्पतिर्व्र्षभःसोमजामयः यज्ञैरथर्वा परथमो वि धारयद देवादक्षैर्भ्र्गवः सं चिकित्रिरे |||
verses.transliteration: te hi prajāyā abharanta vi śravo bṛhaspatirvṛṣabhaḥsomajāmayaḥ yajñairatharvā prathamo vi dhārayad devādakṣairbhṛghavaḥ saṃ cikitrire

translations.griffith: For these have spread abroad the fame of human kind, the Bull Bṛhaspati and Soma's brotherhood.  Atharvan first by sacrifices made men sure: through skill the Bhṛgus were esteemed of all as Gods.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूरिरेतसा नराशंसश्चतुरङगोयमो.अदितिः देवस्त्वष्टा दरविणोदा रभुक्षणः पररोदसी मरुतो विष्णुरर्हिरे |||
verses.transliteration: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūriretasā narāśaṃsaścaturaṅghoyamo.aditiḥ devastvaṣṭā draviṇodā ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ prarodasī maruto viṣṇurarhire

translations.griffith: For these, the Earth and Heaven with their abundant seed, four-bodied Narāśaṁsa, Yama, Aditi,  God Tvaṣṭar Wealth-bestower, the Ṛbhukṣaṇas, Rodasī, Maruts, Viṣṇu, claim and merit praise.

verses.sanskrit: उत सय न उशिजामुर्विया कविरहिः शर्णोतु बुध्न्योहवीमनि सूर्यामासा विचरन्ता दिविक्षिता धियाशमीनहुषी अस्य बोधतम |||
verses.transliteration: uta sya na uśijāmurviyā kavirahiḥ śṛṇotu budhnyohavīmani sūryāmāsā vicarantā divikṣitā dhiyāśamīnahuṣī asya bodhatam

translations.griffith: And may he too give car, the Sage, from far away, the Dragon of the Deep, to this our yearning call.  Ye Sun and Moon who dwell in heaven and move in turn, and with your thought, O Earth and Sky, observe this well.

verses.sanskrit: पर नः पूषा चरथं विश्वदेव्यो.अपां नपादवतुवायुरिष्टये आत्मानं वस्यो अभि वातमर्चत तदश्विना सुहवा यामनि शरुतम |||
verses.transliteration: pra naḥ pūṣā carathaṃ viśvadevyo.apāṃ napādavatuvāyuriṣṭaye ātmānaṃ vasyo abhi vātamarcata tadaśvinā suhavā yāmani śrutam

translations.griffith: Dear to all Gods, may Pūṣan guard the ways we go, the Waters’ child and Vāyu help us to success.  Sing lauds for your great bliss to Wind, the breath of all: ye Aśvins prompt to hear, hear this upon your way.

verses.sanskrit: विशामासामभयानामधिक्षितं गीर्भिरु सवयशसंग्र्णीमसि गनाभिर्विश्वाभिरदितिमनर्वणमक्तोर्युवानं नर्मणा अधा पतिम |||
verses.transliteration: viśāmāsāmabhayānāmadhikṣitaṃ ghīrbhiru svayaśasaṃghṛṇīmasi ghnābhirviśvābhiraditimanarvaṇamaktoryuvānaṃ nṛmaṇā adhā patim

translations.griffith: With hymns of praise we sing him who is throned as Lord over these fearless tribes, the Self-resplendent One.  We praise Night's youthful Lord benevolent to men, the foeless One, the free, with all celestial Dames.

verses.sanskrit: रेभदत्र जनुषा पूर्वो अङगिरा गरावाण ऊर्ध्वा अभिचक्षुरध्वरम येभिर्विहाया अभवद विचक्षणःपाथः सुमेकं सवधितिर्वनन्वति |||
verses.transliteration: rebhadatra januṣā pūrvo aṅghirā ghrāvāṇa ūrdhvā abhicakṣuradhvaram yebhirvihāyā abhavad vicakṣaṇaḥpāthaḥ sumekaṃ svadhitirvananvati

translations.griffith: By reason of his birth here Aṅgiras first sang: the pressing-stones upraised beheld the sacrifice-  The stones through which the Sage became exceeding vast, and the sharp axe obtains in fight the beauteous place.

verses.sanskrit: महि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूतमुर्वी नारी यह्वी न रोदसीसदं नः तेभिर्नः पातं सह्यस एभिर्नः पातंशूषणि |||
