verses.transliteration: mahi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūtamurvī nārī yahvī na rodasīsadaṃ naḥ tebhirnaḥ pātaṃ sahyasa ebhirnaḥ pātaṃśūṣaṇi

translations.griffith: MIGHTY are ye, and far-extended, Heaven and Earth: both Worlds are evermore to us like two young Dames.  Guard us thereby from stronger foe; guard us hereby to give us strength.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञे-यज्ञे स मर्त्यो देवान सपर्यति यः सुम्नैर्दीर्घश्रुत्तम आविवासत्येनान |||
verses.transliteration: yajñe-yajñe sa martyo devān saparyati yaḥ sumnairdīrghaśruttama āvivāsatyenān

translations.griffith: In each succeeding sacrifice that mortal honoureth the Gods,  He who, most widely known and famed for happiness, inviteth them.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वेषामिरज्यवो देवानां वार्महः विश्वे हिविश्वमहसो विश्वे यज्ञेषु यज्ञियाः |||
verses.transliteration: viśveṣāmirajyavo devānāṃ vārmahaḥ viśve hiviśvamahaso viśve yajñeṣu yajñiyāḥ

translations.griffith: Ye who are Rulers over all, great is your sovran power as Gods.  Ye all possess all majesty: all must be served in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: ते घा राजानो अम्र्तस्य मन्द्रा अर्यमा मित्रो वरुणःपरिज्मा कद रुद्रो नर्णां सतुतो मरुतः पूषणो भगः |||
verses.transliteration: te ghā rājāno amṛtasya mandrā aryamā mitro varuṇaḥparijmā kad rudro nṛṇāṃ stuto marutaḥ pūṣaṇo bhaghaḥ

translations.griffith: These are the joyous Kings of Immortality, Parijman, Mitra, Aryaman, and Varuṇa.  What else is Rudra, praised of men? the Maruts, Bhaga, Pūṣaṇa?

verses.sanskrit: उत नो नक्तमपां वर्षण्वसू सूर्यामासा सदनायसधन्या सचा यत साद्येषामहिर्बुध्नेषु बुध्न्यः |||
verses.transliteration: uta no naktamapāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū sūryāmāsā sadanāyasadhanyā sacā yat sādyeṣāmahirbudhneṣu budhnyaḥ

translations.griffith: Come also to our dwelling, Lords of ample wealth, common partakers of our waters, Sun and Moon,  When the great Dragon of the Deep hath settled down upon their floors.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो देवावश्विना शुभस पती धामभिर्मित्रावरुणाुरुष्यताम महः स राय एषते.अति धन्वेव दुरिता |||
verses.transliteration: uta no devāvaśvinā śubhas patī dhāmabhirmitrāvaruṇāuruṣyatām mahaḥ sa rāya eṣate.ati dhanveva duritā

translations.griffith: And let the Aśvins, Lords of splendour, set us free,—both Gods, and, with their Laws, Mitra and Varuṇa.  Through woes, as over desert lands, he speeds to ample opulence.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो रुद्रा चिन मर्ळतामश्विना विश्वे देवासो रथस्पतिर्भगः रभुर्वाज रभुक्षणः परिज्मा विश्ववेदसः |||
verses.transliteration: uta no rudrā cin mṛḷatāmaśvinā viśve devāso rathaspatirbhaghaḥ ṛbhurvāja ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ parijmā viśvavedasaḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, let the Aśvins Twain he gracious unto us, even Rudras, and all Gods, Bhaga, Rathaspati;  Parijman, Ṛbhu, Vāja, O Lords of all wealth Ṛbhukṣaṇas.

verses.sanskrit: रभुरभुक्षा रभुर्विधतो मद आ ते हरी जूजुवानस्यवाजिना दुष्टरं यस्य साम चिद रधग यज्ञो नमानुषः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhurbhukṣā ṛbhurvidhato mada ā te harī jūjuvānasyavājinā duṣṭaraṃ yasya sāma cid ṛdhagh yajño namānuṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Prompt is Ṛbhukṣan, prompt the worshipper's strong drink: may thy fleet Bay Steeds, thine who speedest on, approach.  Not mans but God's is sacrifice whose psalm is unassailable.

verses.sanskrit: कर्धी नो अह्रयो देव सवितः स च सतुषे मघोनाम सहो नैन्द्रो वह्निभिर्न्येषां चर्षणीनां चक्रं रश्मिं नयोयुवे |||
verses.transliteration: kṛdhī no ahrayo deva savitaḥ sa ca stuṣe maghonām saho naindro vahnibhirnyeṣāṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ cakraṃ raśmiṃ nayoyuve

translations.griffith: O God Savitar, harmed by none, lauded, give us a place among wealthy princes.  With his Car-steeds at once 'hath our Indra guided the reins and the car of these men.

verses.sanskrit: ऐषु दयावाप्र्थिवी धातं महदस्मे वीरेषु विश्वचर्षणिश्रवः पर्क्षं वाजस्य सातये पर्क्षं रायोततुर्वणे |||
verses.transliteration: aiṣu dyāvāpṛthivī dhātaṃ mahadasme vīreṣu viśvacarṣaṇiśravaḥ pṛkṣaṃ vājasya sātaye pṛkṣaṃ rāyotaturvaṇe

translations.griffith: To these men present here, O Heaven and Earth, to us grant lofty fame extending over all mankind.  Give us a steed to win us strength, a steed with wealth for victory.

verses.sanskrit: एतं शंसमिन्द्रास्मयुष टवं कूचित सन्तं सहसावन्नभिष्टये सदा पाह्यभिष्टये मेदतां वेदता वसो |||
verses.transliteration: etaṃ śaṃsamindrāsmayuṣ ṭvaṃ kūcit santaṃ sahasāvannabhiṣṭaye sadā pāhyabhiṣṭaye medatāṃ vedatā vaso

translations.griffith: This speaker, Indra—for thou art our Friend—wherever he may be, guard thou, Victor! for help, ever for help  Thy wisdom, Vasu! prosper him.

verses.sanskrit: एतं मे सतोमं तना न सूर्ये दयुतद्यामानं वाव्र्धन्तन्र्णाम संवननं नाश्व्यं तष्टेवानपच्युतम |||
verses.transliteration: etaṃ me stomaṃ tanā na sūrye dyutadyāmānaṃ vāvṛdhantanṛṇām saṃvananaṃ nāśvyaṃ taṣṭevānapacyutam

translations.griffith: So have they strengthened this mine hymn which seems to take its bright path to the Sun, and reconciles the men:  Thus forms a carpenter the yoke of horses, not to be displaced.

verses.sanskrit: वावर्त येषां राया युक्तैषां हिरण्ययी नेमधितान पौंस्या वर्थेव विष्टान्ता |||
verses.transliteration: vāvarta yeṣāṃ rāyā yuktaiṣāṃ hiraṇyayī nemadhitāna pauṃsyā vṛtheva viṣṭāntā

translations.griffith: Whose chariot-seat hath come again laden with wealth and bright with gold,  Lightly, with piercing ends, as ’twere two ranks of heroes ranged for fight.

verses.sanskrit: पर तद दुःशीमे पर्थवाने वेने पर रामे वोचमसुरेमघवत्सु ये युक्त्वाय पञ्च शतास्मयु पथा विश्राव्येषाम |||
verses.transliteration: pra tad duḥśīme pṛthavāne vene pra rāme vocamasuremaghavatsu ye yuktvāya pañca śatāsmayu pathā viśrāvyeṣām

translations.griffith: This to Duḥśīma Pṛthavāna have I sung, to Vena, Rama, to the nobles, and the King.  They yoked five hundred, and their love of us was famed upon their way.

verses.sanskrit: अधीन नवत्र सप्ततिं च सप्त च सद्यो दिदिष्ट तान्वःसद्यो दिदिष्ट पार्थ्यः सद्यो दिदिष्ट मायवः |||
verses.transliteration: adhīn nvatra saptatiṃ ca sapta ca sadyo didiṣṭa tānvaḥsadyo didiṣṭa pārthyaḥ sadyo didiṣṭa māyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Besides, they showed us seven-and-seventy horses here.  Tānva at once displayed his gift, Pārthya at once displayed his gift; and straightway Māyava showed his.

verses.sanskrit: परैते वदन्तु पर वयं वदाम गरावभ्यो वाचं वदतावदद्भ्यः यदद्रयः पर्वताः साकमाशवः शलोकंघोषं भरथेन्द्राय सोमिनः |||
verses.transliteration: praite vadantu pra vayaṃ vadāma ghrāvabhyo vācaṃ vadatāvadadbhyaḥ yadadrayaḥ parvatāḥ sākamāśavaḥ ślokaṃghoṣaṃ bharathendrāya sominaḥ

translations.griffith: LET these speak loudly forth; let us speak out aloud: to the loud speaking Pressing-stones address the speech;  When, rich with Soma juice, Stones of the mountain, ye, united, swift to Indra bring the sound of praise.

verses.sanskrit: एते वदन्ति शतवत सहस्रवदभि करन्दन्ति हरितेभिरासभिः विष्ट्वी गरावाणः सुक्र्तः सुक्र्त्यया होतुश्चित पूर्वे हविरद्यमाशत |||
verses.transliteration: ete vadanti śatavat sahasravadabhi krandanti haritebhirāsabhiḥ viṣṭvī ghrāvāṇaḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā hotuścit pūrve haviradyamāśata

translations.griffith: They speak out like a hundred, like a thousand men: they cry aloud to us with their green-tinted mouths,  While, pious Stones, they ply their task with piety, and, even before the Hotar, taste the offered food.

verses.sanskrit: एते वदन्त्यविदन्नना मधु नयूङखयन्ते अधि पक्वामिषि वर्क्षस्य शाखामरुणस्य बप्सतस्ते सूभर्वाव्र्षभाः परेमराविषुः |||
verses.transliteration: ete vadantyavidannanā madhu nyūṅkhayante adhi pakvaāmiṣi vṛkṣasya śākhāmaruṇasya bapsataste sūbharvāvṛṣabhāḥ premarāviṣuḥ

translations.griffith: Loudly they speak, for they have found the savoury meath: they make a humming sound over the meat prepared.  As they devour the branch of the Red-coloured Tree, these, the well-pastured Bulls, have uttered bellowings.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हद वदन्ति मदिरेण मन्दिनेन्द्रं करोशन्तो.अविदन्ननामधु संरभ्या धीराः सवस्र्भिरनर्तिषुराघोषयन्तः पर्थिवीमुपब्दिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhad vadanti madireṇa mandinendraṃ krośanto.avidannanāmadhu saṃrabhyā dhīrāḥ svasṛbhiranartiṣurāghoṣayantaḥ pṛthivīmupabdibhiḥ

translations.griffith: They cry aloud, with strong exhilarating drink, calling on Indra now, for they have found the meath.  Bold, with the sisters they have danced, embraced by them, making the earth reecho with their ringing sound.

verses.sanskrit: सुपर्णा वाचमक्रतोप दयव्याखरे कर्ष्णा इषिरानर्तिषुः नयं नि यन्त्युपरस्य निष्क्र्तं पुरू रेतोदधिरे सूर्यश्वितः |||
verses.transliteration: suparṇā vācamakratopa dyavyākhare kṛṣṇā iṣirāanartiṣuḥ nyaṃ ni yantyuparasya niṣkṛtaṃ purū retodadhire sūryaśvitaḥ

translations.griffith: The Eagles have sent forth their cry aloft in heaven; in the sky's vault the dark impetuous ones have danced.  Then downward to the nether stone's fixt place they sink, and, splendid as the Sun, effuse their copious stream.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रा इव परवहन्तः समायमुः साकं युक्ता वर्षणोबिभ्रतो धुरः यच्छ्वसन्तो जग्रसाना अराविषुःश्र्ण्व एषां परोथथो अर्वतामिव |||
verses.transliteration: ughrā iva pravahantaḥ samāyamuḥ sākaṃ yuktā vṛṣaṇobibhrato dhuraḥ yacchvasanto jaghrasānā arāviṣuḥśṛṇva eṣāṃ prothatho arvatāmiva

translations.griffith: Like strong ones drawing, they have put forth all their strength: the Bulls, harnessed together, bear the chariot-poles.  When they have bellowed, panting, swallowing their food, the sound of their loud snorting is like that of steeds.

verses.sanskrit: दशावनिभ्यो दशकक्ष्येभ्यो दशयोक्त्रेभ्यो दशयोजनेभ्यः दशाभीशुभ्यो अर्चताजरेभ्यो दश धुरो दश युक्तावहद्भ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: daśāvanibhyo daśakakṣyebhyo daśayoktrebhyo daśayojanebhyaḥ daśābhīśubhyo arcatājarebhyo daśa dhuro daśa yuktāvahadbhyaḥ

translations.griffith: To these who have ten workers and a tenfold girth, to these who have ten yoke-straps and ten binding thongs,  To these who bear ten reins, the eternal, sing ye praise, to these who bear ten car-poles, ten when they are yoked.

verses.sanskrit: ते अद्रयो दशयन्त्रास आशवस्तेषामाधानं पर्येतिहर्यतम त ऊ सुतस्य सोम्यस्यान्धसो.अंशोः पीयूषम्प्रथमस्य भेजिरे |||
verses.transliteration: te adrayo daśayantrāsa āśavasteṣāmādhānaṃ paryetiharyatam ta ū sutasya somyasyāndhaso.aṃśoḥ pīyūṣamprathamasya bhejire

translations.griffith: These Stones with ten conductors, rapid in their course, with lovely revolution travel round and round.  They have been first to drink the flowing Soma juice, first to enjoy the milky fluid of the stalk.

verses.sanskrit: ते सोमादो हरी इन्द्रस्य निंसते.अंशुं दुहन्तो अध्यासतेगवि तेभिर्दुग्धं पपिवान सोम्यं मध्विन्द्रो वर्धतेप्रथते वर्षायते |||
verses.transliteration: te somādo harī indrasya niṃsate.aṃśuṃ duhanto adhyāsateghavi tebhirdughdhaṃ papivān somyaṃ madhvindro vardhateprathate vṛṣāyate

translations.griffith: These Soma-eaters kiss Indra's Bay-coloured Steeds: draining. the stalk they sit upon the ox's hide.  Indra, when he hath drunk Soma-meath drawn by them, waxes in strength, is famed, is mighty as a Bull.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा वो अंशुर्न किला रिषाथनेलावन्तः सदमित्स्थनाशिताः रैवत्येव महसा चारव सथन यस्यग्रावाणो अजुषध्वमध्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā vo aṃśurna kilā riṣāthanelāvantaḥ sadamitsthanāśitāḥ raivatyeva mahasā cārava sthana yasyaghrāvāṇo ajuṣadhvamadhvaram

translations.griffith: Strong is your stalk; ye, verily, never shall be harmed; ye have refreshment, ye are ever satisfied.  Fair are ye, as it were, through splendour of his wealth, his in whose sacrifice, O Stones, ye find delight.

verses.sanskrit: तर्दिला अत्र्दिलासो अद्रयो.अश्रमणा अश्र्थिता अम्र्त्यवः अनातुरा अजरा सथामविष्णवः सुपीवसो अत्र्षितात्र्ष्णजः |||
verses.transliteration: tṛdilā atṛdilāso adrayo.aśramaṇā aśṛthitā amṛtyavaḥ anāturā ajarā sthāmaviṣṇavaḥ supīvaso atṛṣitāatṛṣṇajaḥ

translations.griffith: Bored deep, but not pierced through with holes, are ye, O Stones, not loosened, never weary, and exempt from death,  Eternal, undiseased, moving in sundry ways, unthirsting, full of fatness, void of all desire.

verses.sanskrit: धरुवा एव वः पितरो युगे-युगे कषेमकामासः सदसो नयुञ्जते अजुर्यासो हरिषाचो हरिद्रव आ दयां रवेणप्र्थिवीमशुश्रवुः |||
verses.transliteration: dhruvā eva vaḥ pitaro yughe-yughe kṣemakāmāsaḥ sadaso nayuñjate ajuryāso hariṣāco haridrava ā dyāṃ raveṇapṛthivīmaśuśravuḥ

translations.griffith: Your fathers, verily, stand firm from age to age: they, loving rest, are not dissevered from their seat.  Untouched by time, ne’er lacking green plants and green trees, they with their voice have caused the heavens and earth to hear.

verses.sanskrit: तदिद वदन्त्यद्रयो विमोचने यामन्नञ्जस्पा इव घेदुपब्दिभिः वपन्तो बीजमिव धान्याक्र्तः पर्ञ्चन्तिसोमं न मिनन्ति बप्सतः |||
verses.transliteration: tadid vadantyadrayo vimocane yāmannañjaspā iva ghedupabdibhiḥ vapanto bījamiva dhānyākṛtaḥ pṛñcantisomaṃ na minanti bapsataḥ

translations.griffith: This, this the Stones proclaim, what time they are disjoined, and when with ringing sounds they move and drink the balm.  Like tillers of the ground when they are sowing seed, they mix the Soma, nor, devouring, minish it.

verses.sanskrit: सुते अध्वरे अधि वाचमक्रता करीळयो न मातरन्तुदन्तः वि षू मुञ्चा सुषुवुषो मनीषां वि वर्तन्तामद्रयश्चायमानाः |||
verses.transliteration: sute adhvare adhi vācamakratā krīḷayo na mātarantudantaḥ vi ṣū muñcā suṣuvuṣo manīṣāṃ vi vartantāmadrayaścāyamānāḥ

translations.griffith: They have raised high their voice for juice, for sacrifice, striking the Mother earth as though they danced thereon.  So loose thou too his thought who hath effused the sap, and let the Stones which we are honouring be disjoined.

verses.sanskrit: हये जाये मनसा तिष्ठ घोरे वचांसि मिश्राक्र्णवावहै नु न नौ मन्त्रा अनुदितास एते मयस करन्परतरे चनाहन |||
verses.transliteration: haye jāye manasā tiṣṭha ghore vacāṃsi miśrākṛṇavāvahai nu na nau mantrā anuditāsa ete mayas karanparatare canāhan

translations.griffith: Ho there, my consort! Stay, thou fierce-souled lady, and let us reason for a while together.  Such thoughts as these of ours, while yet unspoken in days gone by have never brought us comfort.

verses.sanskrit: किमेता वाचा कर्णवा तवाहं पराक्रमिषमुषसामग्रियेव पुरूरवः पुनरस्तं परेहि दुरापना वातैवाहमस्मि |||
verses.transliteration: kimetā vācā kṛṇavā tavāhaṃ prākramiṣamuṣasāmaghriyeva purūravaḥ punarastaṃ parehi durāpanā vātaivāhamasmi

translations.griffith: What am I now to do with this thy saying? I have gone from thee like the first of Mornings.  Purūravas, return thou to thy dwelling: I, like the wind, am difficult to capture.

verses.sanskrit: इषुर्न शरिय इषुधेरसना गोषाः शतसा न रंहिः अवीरे करतौ वि दविद्युतन नोरा न मायुं चितयन्तधुनयः |||
verses.transliteration: iṣurna śriya iṣudherasanā ghoṣāḥ śatasā na raṃhiḥ avīre kratau vi davidyutan norā na māyuṃ citayantadhunayaḥ

translations.griffith: Like a shaft sent for glory from the quiver, or swift-steed winning cattle winning hundreds.  The lightning seemed to flash, as cowards planned it. The minstrels bleated like a lamb in trouble.

verses.sanskrit: सा वसु दधती शवशुराय वय उषो यदि वष्ट्यन्तिग्र्हात अस्तं ननक्षे यस्मिञ्चाकन दिवा नक्तंश्नथिता वैतसेन |||
verses.transliteration: sā vasu dadhatī śvaśurāya vaya uṣo yadi vaṣṭyantighṛhāt astaṃ nanakṣe yasmiñcākan divā naktaṃśnathitā vaitasena

translations.griffith: Giving her husband's father life and riches, from the near dwelling, when her lover craved her,  She sought the home wherein she found her pleasure, accepting day and night her lord's embraces.

verses.sanskrit: तरिः सम माह्नः शनथयो वैतसेनोत सम मे.अव्यत्यैप्र्णासि पुरूरवो.अनु ते केतमायं राजा मे वीर तन्वस्तदासीः |||
verses.transliteration: triḥ sma māhnaḥ śnathayo vaitasenota sma me.avyatyaipṛṇāsi purūravo.anu te ketamāyaṃ rājā me vīra tanvastadāsīḥ

translations.griffith: Thrice in the day didst thou embrace thy consort, though coldly she received thy fond caresses.  To thy desires, Purūravas, I yielded: so wast thou king, O hero, of my body.

verses.sanskrit: या सुजूर्णिः शरेणिः सुम्नापिर्ह्रदेचक्षुर्न गरन्थिनीचरण्युः ता अञ्जयो.अरुणयो न सस्रुः शरिये गावो नधेनवो.अनवन्त |||
verses.transliteration: yā sujūrṇiḥ śreṇiḥ sumnaāpirhradecakṣurna ghranthinīcaraṇyuḥ tā añjayo.aruṇayo na sasruḥ śriye ghāvo nadhenavo.anavanta

translations.griffith: The maids Sujirni, Sreni, Sumne-api, Charanyu, Granthini, and Hradecaksus,—  These like red kine have hastened forth, the bright ones, and like milch-cows have lowed in emulation.

verses.sanskrit: समस्मिञ जायमान आसत गना उतेमवर्धन नद्यःस्वगूर्ताः महे यत तवा पुरूरवो रणायावर्धयन्दस्युहत्याय देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: samasmiñ jāyamāna āsata ghnā utemavardhan nadyaḥsvaghūrtāḥ mahe yat tvā purūravo raṇāyāvardhayandasyuhatyāya devāḥ

translations.griffith: While he was born the Dames sate down together, the Rivers with free kindness gave him nurture;  And then, Purūravas, the Gods increased thee for mighty battle, to destroy the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit: सचा यदासु जहतीष्वत्कममानुषीषु मानुषो निषेवे अप सम मत तरसन्ती न भुज्युस्ता अत्रसन रथस्प्र्शोनाश्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: sacā yadāsu jahatīṣvatkamamānuṣīṣu mānuṣo niṣeve apa sma mat tarasantī na bhujyustā atrasan rathaspṛśonāśvāḥ

translations.griffith: When I, a mortal, wooed to mine embraces these heavenly nymphs who laid aside their raiment,  Like a scared snake they fled from me in terror, like chariot horses when the car has touched them.

verses.sanskrit: यदासु मर्तो अम्र्तासु निस्प्र्क सं कषोणीभिः करतुभिर्नप्र्ङकते ता आतयो न तन्वः शुम्भत सवा अश्वासो नक्रीळयो दन्दशानाः |||
verses.transliteration: yadāsu marto amṛtāsu nispṛk saṃ kṣoṇībhiḥ kratubhirnapṛṅkte tā ātayo na tanvaḥ śumbhata svā aśvāso nakrīḷayo dandaśānāḥ

translations.griffith: When, loving these Immortal Ones, the mortal hath converse with the nymphs as they allow him.  Like swans they show the beauty of their bodies, like horses in their play they bite and nibble.

verses.sanskrit: विद्युन न या पतन्ती दविद्योद भरन्ती मे अप्या काम्यानि जनिष्टो अपो नर्यः सुजातः परोर्वशी तिरत दीर्घमायुः |||
verses.transliteration: vidyun na yā patantī davidyod bharantī me apyā kāmyāni janiṣṭo apo naryaḥ sujātaḥ prorvaśī tirata dīrghamāyuḥ

translations.griffith: She who flashed brilliant as the falling lightning brought me delicious presents from the waters.  Now from the flood be born a strong young hero May Uruvasi prolong her life for ever

verses.sanskrit: जज्ञिष इत्था गोपीथ्याय हि दधाथ तत पुरूरवो मोजः अशासं तवा विदुषी सस्मिन्नहन न म आश्र्णोःकिमभुग वदासि |||
verses.transliteration: jajñiṣa itthā ghopīthyāya hi dadhātha tat purūravo maojaḥ aśāsaṃ tvā viduṣī sasminnahan na ma āśṛṇoḥkimabhugh vadāsi

translations.griffith: Thy birth hath made me drink from earthly milch-kine: this power, Purūravas, hast thou vouchsafed me.  I knew, and, warned thee, on that day. Thou wouldst not hear me. What sayest thou, when naught avails thee?

verses.sanskrit: कदा सूनुः पितरं जात इछाच्चक्रन नाश्रु वर्तयद्विजानन को दम्पती समनसा वि यूयोदध यदग्निःश्वशुरेषु दीदयत |||
verses.transliteration: kadā sūnuḥ pitaraṃ jāta ichāccakran nāśru vartayadvijānan ko dampatī samanasā vi yūyodadha yadaghniḥśvaśureṣu dīdayat

translations.griffith: When will the son be born and seek his father? Mourner-like, will he weep when first he knows him?  Who shall divide the accordant wife and husband, while fire is shining with thy consort's parents?

verses.sanskrit: परति बरवाणि वर्तयते अश्रु चक्रन न करन्ददाध्येशिवायै पर तत ते हिनवा यत ते अस्मे परेह्यस्तं नहिमूर मापः |||
verses.transliteration: prati bravāṇi vartayate aśru cakran na krandadādhyeśivāyai pra tat te hinavā yat te asme parehyastaṃ nahimūra māpaḥ

translations.griffith: I will console him when his tears are falling: he shall not weep and cry for care that blesses.  That which is thine, between us, will I send thee. Go home again, thou fool;ṭhou hast not won me.

verses.sanskrit: सुदेवो अद्य परपतेदनाव्र्त परावतं परमां गन्तवा उ अधा शयीत निरतेरुपस्थे.अधैनं वर्का रभसासोद्युः |||
verses.transliteration: sudevo adya prapatedanāvṛt parāvataṃ paramāṃ ghantavā u adhā śayīta nirterupasthe.adhainaṃ vṛkā rabhasāsoadyuḥ

translations.griffith: Thy lover shall flee forth this day for ever, to seek, without return, the farthest distance.  Then let his bed be in Destruction's bosom, and there let fierce rapacious wolves devour him.

verses.sanskrit: पुरूरवो मा मर्था मा पर पप्तो मा तवा वर्कासो अशिवास उक्षन न वै सत्रैणानि सख्यानि सन्ति सालाव्र्काणांह्र्दयान्येता |||
verses.transliteration: purūravo mā mṛthā mā pra papto mā tvā vṛkāso aśivāsa ukṣan na vai straiṇāni sakhyāni santi sālāvṛkāṇāṃhṛdayānyetā

translations.griffith: Nay, do not die, Purūravas, nor vanish: let not the evil-omened wolves devour thee.  With women there can be no lasting friendship: hearts of hyenas are the hearts of women.

verses.sanskrit: यद विरूपाचरं मर्त्येष्ववसं रात्रीः शरदश्चतस्रः घर्तस्य सतोकं सक्र्दह्न आश्नां तादेवेदन्तात्र्पाणा चरामि |||
verses.transliteration: yad virūpācaraṃ martyeṣvavasaṃ rātrīḥ śaradaścatasraḥ ghṛtasya stokaṃ sakṛdahna āśnāṃ tādevedantātṛpāṇā carāmi

translations.griffith: When amid men in altered shape I sojourned, and through four autumns spent the nights among them,  I tasted once a day a drop of butter; and even now with that am I am contented.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तरिक्षप्रां रजसो विमानीमुप शिक्षाम्युर्वशींवसिष्ठः उप तवा रातिः सुक्र्तस्य तिष्ठान नि वर्तस्वह्र्दयं तप्यते मे |||
verses.transliteration: antarikṣaprāṃ rajaso vimānīmupa śikṣāmyurvaśīṃvasiṣṭhaḥ upa tvā rātiḥ sukṛtasya tiṣṭhān ni vartasvahṛdayaṃ tapyate me

translations.griffith: I, her best love, call Urvasi to meet me, her who fills air and measures out the region.  Let the gift brought by piety approach thee. Turn thou to me again: my heart is troubled.

verses.sanskrit: इति तवा देवा इम आहुरैळ यथेमेतद भवसिम्र्त्युबन्धुः परजा ते देवान हविषा यजाति सवर्ग उ तवमपि मादयासे |||
verses.transliteration: iti tvā devā ima āhuraiḷa yathemetad bhavasimṛtyubandhuḥ prajā te devān haviṣā yajāti svargha u tvamapi mādayāse

translations.griffith: Thus speak these Gods to thee, O son of Iḷā: As death hath verily got thee for his subject,  Thy sons shall serve the Gods with their oblation, and thou, moreover, shalt rejoice in Svarga.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते महे विदथे शंसिषं हरी पर ते वन्वे वनुषोहर्यतं मदम घर्तं न यो हरिभिश्चारु सेचत आ तवाविशन्तु हरिवर्पसं गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣaṃ harī pra te vanve vanuṣoharyataṃ madam ghṛtaṃ na yo haribhiścāru secata ā tvāviśantu harivarpasaṃ ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: In the great synod will I laud thy two Bay Steeds: I prize the sweet strong drink of thee the Warrior-God,  His who pours lovely oil as ’twere with yellow drops. Let my songs enter thee whose form hath golden tints.

verses.sanskrit: हरिं हि योनिमभि ये समस्वरन हिन्वन्तो हरी दिव्यंयथा सदः आ यं पर्णन्ति हरिभिर्न धेनव इन्द्रायशूषं हरिवन्तमर्चत |||
verses.transliteration: hariṃ hi yonimabhi ye samasvaran hinvanto harī divyaṃyathā sadaḥ ā yaṃ pṛṇanti haribhirna dhenava indrāyaśūṣaṃ harivantamarcata

translations.griffith: Ye who in concert sing unto the goldhued place, like Bay Steeds driving onward to the heavenly seat,  For Indra laud ye strength allied with Tawny Steeds, laud him whom cows content as ’twere with yellow drops.

verses.sanskrit: सो अस्य वज्रो हरितो य आयसो हरिर्निकामो हरिरागभस्त्योः दयुम्नी सुशिप्रो हरिमन्युसायक इन्द्रे नि रूपाहरिता मिमिक्षिरे |||
verses.transliteration: so asya vajro harito ya āyaso harirnikāmo harirāghabhastyoḥ dyumnī suśipro harimanyusāyaka indre ni rūpāharitā mimikṣire

translations.griffith: His is that thunderbolt, of iron, goldenhued, gold-coloured, very dear, and yellow in his arms;  Bright with strong teeth, destroying with its tawny rage. In Indra are set fast all forms of golden hue.

verses.sanskrit: दिवि न केतुरधि धायि हर्यतो विव्यचद वज्रो हरितो नरंह्या तुददहिं हरिशिप्रो य आयसः सहस्रशोकाभवद धरिम्भरः |||
verses.transliteration: divi na keturadhi dhāyi haryato vivyacad vajro harito naraṃhyā tudadahiṃ hariśipro ya āyasaḥ sahasraśokāabhavad dharimbharaḥ

translations.griffith: As if a lovely ray were laid upon the sky, the golden thunderbolt spread out as in a race.  That iron bolt with yellow jaw smote Ahi down. A thousand flames had he who bore the tawny-hued.

verses.sanskrit: तवं-तवमहर्यथा उपस्तुतः पूर्वेभिरिन्द्र हरिकेशयज्वभिः तवं हर्यसि तव विश्वमुक्थ्यमसामि राधोहरिजात हर्यतम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ-tvamaharyathā upastutaḥ pūrvebhirindra harikeśayajvabhiḥ tvaṃ haryasi tava viśvamukthyamasāmi rādhoharijāta haryatam

translations.griffith: Thou, thou, when praised by men who sacrificed of old. hadst pleasure in their lauds, O Indra golden-haired.  All that befits thy song of praise thou welcornest, the perfect pleasant gift, O Golden-hued from birth.

verses.sanskrit: ता वज्रिणं मन्दिनं सतोम्यं मद इन्द्रं रथे वहतोहर्यता हरी पुरूण्यस्मै सवनानि हर्यत इन्द्रायसोमा हरयो दधन्विरे |||
verses.transliteration: tā vajriṇaṃ mandinaṃ stomyaṃ mada indraṃ rathe vahatoharyatā harī purūṇyasmai savanāni haryata indrāyasomā harayo dadhanvire

translations.griffith: These two dear Bays bring hither Indra on his car, Thunder-armed, joyous, meet for laud, to drink his fill.  Many libations flow for him who loveth them: to Indra have the gold-hued Soma juices run.

verses.sanskrit: अरं कामाय हरयो दधन्विरे सथिराय हिन्वन हरयो हरीतुरा अर्वद्भिर्यो हरिभिर्जोषमीयते सो अस्य कामंहरिवन्तमानशे |||
verses.transliteration: araṃ kāmāya harayo dadhanvire sthirāya hinvan harayo harīturā arvadbhiryo haribhirjoṣamīyate so asya kāmaṃharivantamānaśe

translations.griffith: Tle gold-hued drops have flowed to gratify his wish: the yellow dro s have urged the swift Bays to the Strong.  He who speeds on with Bay Steeds even as he lists hath satisfied his longing for the golden drops.

verses.sanskrit: हरिश्मशारुर्हरिकेश आयसस्तुरस्पेये यो हरिपावर्धत अर्वद्भिर्यो हरिभिर्वाजिनीवसुरति विश्वादुरिता पारिषद धरी |||
verses.transliteration: hariśmaśārurharikeśa āyasasturaspeye yo haripāavardhata arvadbhiryo haribhirvājinīvasurati viśvāduritā pāriṣad dharī

translations.griffith: At the swift draught the Soma-drinker waxed in might, the Iron One with yellow beard and yellow hair.  He, Lord of Tawny Coursers, Lord of fleet-foot Mares, will bear his Bay Steeds safely over all distress.

verses.sanskrit: सरुवेव यस्य हरिणी विपेततुः शिप्रे वाजाय हरिणीदविध्वतः पर यत कर्ते चमसे मर्म्र्जद धरी पीत्वामदस्य हयतस्याधसः |||
verses.transliteration: sruveva yasya hariṇī vipetatuḥ śipre vājāya hariṇīdavidhvataḥ pra yat kṛte camase marmṛjad dharī pītvāmadasya hayatasyādhasaḥ

translations.griffith: His yellow-coloured jaws, like ladles move apart, what time, for strength, he makes the yellow-tinted stir,  When, while the bowl stands there, he grooms his Tawny Steeds, when he hath drunk strong drink, the sweet juice that he loves.

verses.sanskrit: उत सम सद्म हर्यतस्य पस्त्योरत्यो न वाजं हरिवानचिक्रदत मही चिद धि धिषणाहर्यदोजसा बर्हद वयोदधिषे हर्यतश्चिदा |||
verses.transliteration: uta sma sadma haryatasya pastyoratyo na vājaṃ harivānacikradat mahī cid dhi dhiṣaṇāharyadojasā bṛhad vayodadhiṣe haryataścidā

translations.griffith: Yea, to the Dear One's seat in homes of heaven and earth the Bay Steeds' Lord hath whinnied like a horse for food.  Then the great wish hath seized upon him mightily, and the Beloved One hath gained high power of life,

verses.sanskrit: आ रोदसी हर्यमाणो महित्वा नव्यं-नव्यं हर्यसि मन्मनु परियम पर पस्त्यमसुर हर्यतं गोराविष्क्र्धि हरयेसूर्याय |||
verses.transliteration: ā rodasī haryamāṇo mahitvā navyaṃ-navyaṃ haryasi manmanu priyam pra pastyamasura haryataṃ ghorāviṣkṛdhi harayesūryāya

translations.griffith: Thou, comprehending with thy might the earth and heaven, acceptest the dear hymn for ever new and new.  O Asura, disclose thou and make visible the Cow's beloved home to the bright golden Sun.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा हर्यन्तं परयुजो जनानां रथे वहन्तु हरिशिप्रमिन्द्र पिबा यथा परतिभ्र्तस्य मध्वो हर्यन यज्ञंसधमादे दशोणिम |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā haryantaṃ prayujo janānāṃ rathe vahantu hariśipramindra pibā yathā pratibhṛtasya madhvo haryan yajñaṃsadhamāde daśoṇim

translations.griffith: O Indra, let the eager wishes of the folk bring thee, delightful, golden-visored, on thy car,  That, pleased with sacrifice wherein ten fingers toil, thou mayest, at the feast, drink of our offered meath.

verses.sanskrit: अपाः पूर्वेषां हरिवः सुतानामथो इदं सवनंकेवलं ते ममद्धि सोमं मधुमन्तमिन्द्र सत्रा वर्षञ्जठर आ वर्षस्व |||
verses.transliteration: apāḥ pūrveṣāṃ harivaḥ sutānāmatho idaṃ savanaṃkevalaṃ te mamaddhi somaṃ madhumantamindra satrā vṛṣañjaṭhara ā vṛṣasva

translations.griffith: Juices aforetime, Lord of Bays, thou drankest; and thine especially is this libation.  Gladden thee, Indra, with the meath-rich Soma: pour it down ever, Mighty One! within thee.

verses.sanskrit: या ओषधीः पूर्वा जाता देवेभ्यस्त्रियुगं पुरा मनैनु बभ्रूणामहं शतं धामानि सप्त च |||
verses.transliteration: yā oṣadhīḥ pūrvā jātā devebhyastriyughaṃ purā manainu babhrūṇāmahaṃ śataṃ dhāmāni sapta ca

translations.griffith: HERBS that sprang up in time of old, three ages earlier than the Gods,—  Of these, whose hue is brown, will I declare the hundred powers and seven.

verses.sanskrit: शतं वो अम्ब धामानि सहस्रमुत वो रुहः अधाशतक्रत्वो यूयमिमं मे अगदं कर्त |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ vo amba dhāmāni sahasramuta vo ruhaḥ adhāśatakratvo yūyamimaṃ me aghadaṃ kṛta

translations.griffith: Ye, Mothers, have a hundred homes, yea, and a thousand are your growths.  Do ye who have a thousand powers free this my patient from disease.

verses.sanskrit: ओषधीः परति मोदध्वं पुष्पवतीः परसूवरीः अश्वािव सजित्वरीर्वीरुधः पारयिष्ण्वः |||
verses.transliteration: oṣadhīḥ prati modadhvaṃ puṣpavatīḥ prasūvarīḥ aśvāiva sajitvarīrvīrudhaḥ pārayiṣṇvaḥ

translations.griffith: Be glad and joyful in the Plants, both blossoming and bearing fruit,  Plants that will lead us to success like mares who conquer in the race.

verses.sanskrit: ओषधीरिति मातरस्तद वो देवीरुप बरुवे सनेयमश्वंगां वास आत्मानं तव पूरुष |||
verses.transliteration: oṣadhīriti mātarastad vo devīrupa bruve saneyamaśvaṃghāṃ vāsa ātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa

translations.griffith: Plants, by this name I speak to you, Mothers, to you the Goddesses:  Steed, cow, and garment may I win, win back thy very self, O man.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वत्थे वो निषदनं पर्णे वो वसतिष कर्ता गोभाज इत्किलासथ यत सनवथ पूरुषम |||
verses.transliteration: aśvatthe vo niṣadanaṃ parṇe vo vasatiṣ kṛtā ghobhāja itkilāsatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam

translations.griffith: The Holy Fig tree is your home, your mansion is the Parna tree:  Winners of cattle shali ye be if ye regain for me this man.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रौषधीः समग्मत राजानः समिताविव विप्रः सौच्यते भिषग रक्षोहामीवचातनः |||
verses.transliteration: yatrauṣadhīḥ samaghmata rājānaḥ samitāviva vipraḥ saucyate bhiṣagh rakṣohāmīvacātanaḥ

translations.griffith: He who hath store of Herbs at hand like Kings amid a crowd of men,—  Physician is that sage's name, fiend-slayer, chaser of disease.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वावतीं सोमावतीमूर्जयन्तीमुदोजसम आवित्सिसर्वा ओषधीरस्मा अरिष्टतातये |||
verses.transliteration: aśvāvatīṃ somāvatīmūrjayantīmudojasam āvitsisarvā oṣadhīrasmā ariṣṭatātaye

translations.griffith: Herbs rich in Soma, rich in steeds, in nourishments, in strengthening power,—  All these have I provided here, that this man may be whole again.

verses.sanskrit: उच्छुष्मा ओषधीनां गावो गोष्ठादिवेरते धनंसनिष्यन्तीनामात्मानं तव पूरुष |||
verses.transliteration: ucchuṣmā oṣadhīnāṃ ghāvo ghoṣṭhādiverate dhanaṃsaniṣyantīnāmātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa

translations.griffith: The healing virtues of the Plants stream forth like cattle from the stall,—  Plants that shall win me store of wealth, and save thy vital breath, O man.

verses.sanskrit: इष्क्र्तिर्नाम वो माताथो यूयं सथ निष्क्र्तीः सीराःपतत्र्णी सथन यदामयति निष कर्थ |||
verses.transliteration: iṣkṛtirnāma vo mātātho yūyaṃ stha niṣkṛtīḥ sīrāḥpatatṛṇī sthana yadāmayati niṣ kṛtha

translations.griffith: Reliever is your mother's name, and hence Restorers are ye called.  Rivers are ye with wings that fly: keep far whatever brings disease.

verses.sanskrit: अति विश्वाः परिष्ठा सतेन इव वरजमक्रमुः ओषधीःप्राचुच्यवुर्यत किं च तन्वो रपः |||
verses.transliteration: ati viśvāḥ pariṣṭhā stena iva vrajamakramuḥ oṣadhīḥprācucyavuryat kiṃ ca tanvo rapaḥ

translations.griffith: Over all fences have they passed, as steals a thief into the fold.  The Plants have driven from the frame whatever malady was there.

verses.sanskrit: यदिमा वाजयन्नहमोषधीर्हस्त आदधे आत्मायक्ष्मस्य नश्यति पुरा जीवग्र्भो यथा |||
verses.transliteration: yadimā vājayannahamoṣadhīrhasta ādadhe ātmāyakṣmasya naśyati purā jīvaghṛbho yathā

translations.griffith: When, bringing back the vanished strength, I hold these herbs within my hand,  The spirit of disease departs ere he can seize upon the life.

verses.sanskrit: यस्यौषधीः परसर्पथाङगम-अञ्गं परुष-परुः ततोयक्ष्मं वि बाधध्व उग्रो मध्यमशीरिव |||
verses.transliteration: yasyauṣadhīḥ prasarpathāṅgham-añghaṃ paruṣ-paruḥ tatoyakṣmaṃ vi bādhadhva ughro madhyamaśīriva

translations.griffith: He through whose frame, O Plants, ye creep member by member, joint by joint,—  From him ye drive away disease like some strong arbiter of strife.

verses.sanskrit: साकं यक्ष्म पर पत चाषेण किकिदीविना साकंवातस्य धराज्या साकं नश्य निहाकया |||
verses.transliteration: sākaṃ yakṣma pra pata cāṣeṇa kikidīvinā sākaṃvātasya dhrājyā sākaṃ naśya nihākayā

translations.griffith: Fly, Spirit of Disease, begone, with the blue jay and kingfisher.  Fly with the wind's impetuousspeed, vanish together with the storm.

verses.sanskrit: अन्या वो अन्यामवत्वन्यान्यस्या उपावत ताः सर्वाःसंविदाना इदं मे परावता वचः |||
verses.transliteration: anyā vo anyāmavatvanyānyasyā upāvata tāḥ sarvāḥsaṃvidānā idaṃ me prāvatā vacaḥ

translations.griffith: Help every one the other, lend assistance each of you to each,  All of you be accordant, give furtherance to this speech of mine.

verses.sanskrit: याः फलिनीर्या अफला अपुष्पा याश्च पुष्पिणीः बर्हस्पतिप्रसूतास्ता नो मुञ्चन्त्वंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: yāḥ phalinīryā aphalā apuṣpā yāśca puṣpiṇīḥ bṛhaspatiprasūtāstā no muñcantvaṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Let fruitful Plants, and fruitless, those that blossom, and the blossomless,  Urged onward by Bṛhaspati, release us from our pain and grief;

verses.sanskrit: मुञ्चन्तु मा शपथ्यादथो वरुण्यादुत अथो यमस्यपड्बीशात सर्वस्माद देवकिल्बिषात |||
verses.transliteration: muñcantu mā śapathyādatho varuṇyāduta atho yamasyapaḍbīśāt sarvasmād devakilbiṣāt

translations.griffith: Release me from the curse's plague and woe that comes from Varuṇa;  Free me from Yama's fetter, from sin and offence against the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अवपतन्तीरवदन दिव ओषधयस परि यं जीवमश्नवामहै न स रिष्याति पूरुषः |||
verses.transliteration: avapatantīravadan diva oṣadhayas pari yaṃ jīvamaśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ

translations.griffith: What time, descending from the sky, the Plants flew earthward, thus they spake:  No evil shall befall the man whom while he liveth we pervade,

verses.sanskrit: या ओषधीः सोमराज्ञीर्बह्वीः शतविचक्षणाः तासां तवमस्युत्तमारं कामाय शं हर्दे |||
verses.transliteration: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīrbahvīḥ śatavicakṣaṇāḥ tāsāṃ tvamasyuttamāraṃ kāmāya śaṃ hṛde

translations.griffith: Of all the many Plants whose King is, Soma, Plants of hundred forms,  Thou art the Plant most excellent, prompt to the wish, sweet to the heart.

verses.sanskrit: या ओषधीः सोमराज्ञीर्विष्ठिताः पर्थिवीमनु बर्हस्पतिप्रसूता अस्यै सं दत्त वीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīrviṣṭhitāḥ pṛthivīmanu bṛhaspatiprasūtā asyai saṃ datta vīryam

translations.griffith: O all ye various Herbs whose King is Soma, that o’erspread the earth,  Urged onward by Bṛhaspati, combine your virtue in this Plant.

verses.sanskrit: मा वो रिषत खनिता यस्मै चाहं खनामि वः दविपच्चतुष्पदस्माकं सर्वमस्त्वनातुरम |||
verses.transliteration: mā vo riṣat khanitā yasmai cāhaṃ khanāmi vaḥ dvipaccatuṣpadasmākaṃ sarvamastvanāturam

translations.griffith: Unharmed be he who digs you up, unharmed the man for whom I dig:  And let no malady attack biped or quadruped of ours.

verses.sanskrit: याश्चेदमुपश्र्ण्वन्ति याश्च दूरं परागताः सर्वाः संगत्य वीरुधो.अस्यै सं दत्त वीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yāścedamupaśṛṇvanti yāśca dūraṃ parāghatāḥ sarvāḥ saṃghatya vīrudho.asyai saṃ datta vīryam

translations.griffith: All Plants that hear this speech, and those that have departed far away,  Come all assembled and confer your healing power upon this Herb.

verses.sanskrit: ओषधयः सं वदन्ते सोमेन सह राज्ञा यस्मै कर्णोतिब्राह्मणस्तं राजन पारयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: oṣadhayaḥ saṃ vadante somena saha rājñā yasmai kṛṇotibrāhmaṇastaṃ rājan pārayāmasi

translations.griffith: With Soma as their Sovran Lord the Plants hold colloquy and say:  O King, we save from death the man whose cure a Brahman undertakes.

verses.sanskrit: तवमुत्तमास्योषधे तव वर्क्षा उपस्तयः उपस्तिरस्तुसो.अस्माकं यो अस्मानभिदासति |||
verses.transliteration: tvamuttamāsyoṣadhe tava vṛkṣā upastayaḥ upastirastuso.asmākaṃ yo asmānabhidāsati

translations.griffith: Most excellent of all art thou, O Plant thy vassals are the trees.  Let him be subject to our power, the man who seeks to injure us.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पते परति मे देवतामिहि मित्रो वा यद वरुणो वासिपूषा आदित्यैर्वा यद वसुभिर्मरुत्वान स पर्जन्यंशन्तनवे वर्षाय |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate prati me devatāmihi mitro vā yad varuṇo vāsipūṣā ādityairvā yad vasubhirmarutvān sa parjanyaṃśantanave vṛṣāya

translations.griffith: COME, be thou Mitra, Varuṇa, or Pūṣan, come, O Bṛhaspati, to mine oblation:  With Maruts, Vasus, or Ādityas, make thou Parjanya pour for Santanu his rain-drops.

verses.sanskrit: आ देवो दूतो अजिरश्चिकित्वान तवद देवापे अभि मामगछत परतीचीनः परति मामा वव्र्त्स्व दधामि ते दयुमतींवाचमासन |||
verses.transliteration: ā devo dūto ajiraścikitvān tvad devāpe abhi māmaghachat pratīcīnaḥ prati māmā vavṛtsva dadhāmi te dyumatīṃvācamāsan

translations.griffith: The God, intelligent, the speedy envoy whom thou hast sent hath come to me, Devapi:  Address thyself to me and turn thee hither within thy lips will I put brilliant language.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे धेहि दयुमतीं वाचमासन बर्हस्पते अनमीवामिषिराम यया वर्ष्टिं शन्तनवे वनाव दिवो दरप्सोमधुमाना विवेश |||
verses.transliteration: asme dhehi dyumatīṃ vācamāsan bṛhaspate anamīvāmiṣirām yayā vṛṣṭiṃ śantanave vanāva divo drapsomadhumānā viveśa

translations.griffith: Within my mouth, Bṛhaspati, deposit speech lucid, vigorous, and free from weakness,  Thereby to win for Santanu the rain-fall. The meath-rich drop from heaven hath passed within it.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो दरप्सा मधुमन्तो विशन्त्विन्द्र देह्यधिरथंसहस्रम नि षीद होत्रं रतुथा यजस्व देवान देवापेहविषा सपर्य |||
verses.transliteration: ā no drapsā madhumanto viśantvindra dehyadhirathaṃsahasram ni ṣīda hotraṃ ṛtuthā yajasva devān devāpehaviṣā saparya

translations.griffith: Let the sweet drops descend on us, O Indra: give us enough to lade a thousand wagons.  Sit to thy Hotar task; pay worship duly, and serve the Gods, Devapi, with oblation.

verses.sanskrit: आर्ष्टिषेणो होत्रं रषिर्निषीदन देवापिर्देवसुमतिंचिकित्वान स उत्तरस्मादधरं समुद्रमपो दिव्या अस्र्जद्वर्ष्या अभि |||
verses.transliteration: ārṣṭiṣeṇo hotraṃ ṛṣirniṣīdan devāpirdevasumatiṃcikitvān sa uttarasmādadharaṃ samudramapo divyā asṛjadvarṣyā abhi

translations.griffith: Knowing the God's good-will, Devapi, Ṛṣi, the son of Rstisena, sate as Hotar.  He hath brought down from heaven's most lofty summit the ocean of the rain, celestial waters.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मिन समुद्रे अध्युत्तरस्मिन्नापो देवेभिर्निव्र्ता अतिष्ठन ता अद्रवन्नार्ष्टिषेणेन सर्ष्टा देवापिना परेषिताम्र्क्षिणीषु |||
verses.transliteration: asmin samudre adhyuttarasminnāpo devebhirnivṛtā atiṣṭhan tā adravannārṣṭiṣeṇena sṛṣṭā devāpinā preṣitāmṛkṣiṇīṣu

translations.griffith: Gathered together in that highest ocean, the waters stood by deities obstructed.  They burried down set free by Arstisena, in gaping clefts, urged onward by Devapi.

verses.sanskrit: यद देवापिः शन्तनवे पुरोहितो होत्राय वर्तः कर्पयन्नदीधेत देवश्रुतं वर्ष्टिवनिं रराणो बर्हस्पतिर्वाचमस्मा अयछत |||
verses.transliteration: yad devāpiḥ śantanave purohito hotrāya vṛtaḥ kṛpayannadīdhet devaśrutaṃ vṛṣṭivaniṃ rarāṇo bṛhaspatirvācamasmā ayachat

translations.griffith: When as chief priest for Santanu, Devapi, chosen for Hotar's duty, prayed beseeching,  Graciously pleased Bṛhaspati vouchsafed him a voice that reached the Gods and won the waters.

verses.sanskrit: यं तवा देवापिः शुशुचानो अग्न आर्ष्टिषेणो मनुष्यःसमीधे विश्वेभिर्देवैरनुमद्यमानः पर पर्जन्यमीरया वर्ष्टिमन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ tvā devāpiḥ śuśucāno aghna ārṣṭiṣeṇo manuṣyaḥsamīdhe viśvebhirdevairanumadyamānaḥ pra parjanyamīrayā vṛṣṭimantam

translations.griffith: O Agni whom Devapi Arstisena, the mortal man, hath kindled in his glory,  Joying in him with all the Gods together, urge on the sender of the rain, Parjanya.

verses.sanskrit: तवां पूर्व रषयो गीर्भिरायन तवामध्वरेषु पुरुहूतविश्वे सहस्राण्यधिरथान्यस्मे आ नो यज्ञंरोहिदश्वोप याहि |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ pūrva ṛṣayo ghīrbhirāyan tvāmadhvareṣu puruhūtaviśve sahasrāṇyadhirathānyasme ā no yajñaṃrohidaśvopa yāhi

translations.griffith: All ancient Ṛṣis with their songs approached thee, even thee, O Much-invoked, at sacrifices.  We have provided wagon-loads in thousands: come to the solemn rite, Lord of Red Horses.

verses.sanskrit: एतान्यग्ने नवतिर्नव तवे आहुतान्यधिरथा सहस्र तेभिर्वर्धस्व तन्वः शूर पूर्वीर्दिवो नो वर्ष्टिमिषितोरिरीहि |||
verses.transliteration: etānyaghne navatirnava tve āhutānyadhirathā sahasra tebhirvardhasva tanvaḥ śūra pūrvīrdivo no vṛṣṭimiṣitorirīhi

translations.griffith: The wagon-loads, the nine-and-ninety thousand, these have been offered up to thee, O Agni.  Hero, with these increase thy many bodies, and, stimulated, send us rain from heaven.

verses.sanskrit: एतान्यग्ने नवतिं सहस्रा सं पर यछ वर्ष्ण इन्द्रायभागम विद्वान पथ रतुशो देवयानानप्यौलानं दिविदेवेषु धेहि |||
verses.transliteration: etānyaghne navatiṃ sahasrā saṃ pra yacha vṛṣṇa indrāyabhāgham vidvān patha ṛtuśo devayānānapyaulānaṃ divideveṣu dhehi

translations.griffith: Give thou these ninety thousand loads, O Agni, to Indra, to the Bull, to be his portion.  Knowing the paths which Deities duly travel, set mid the Gods in heaven Aulana also.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने बाधस्व वि मर्धो वि दुर्गहापामीवामपरक्षांसि सेध अस्मात समुद्राद बर्हतो दिवो नो.अपाम्भूमानमुप नः सर्जेह |||
verses.transliteration: aghne bādhasva vi mṛdho vi durghahāpāmīvāmaparakṣāṃsi sedha asmāt samudrād bṛhato divo no.apāmbhūmānamupa naḥ sṛjeha

translations.griffith: O Agni, drive afar our foes, our troubles chase malady away and wicked demons.  From this air-ocean, from the lofty heavens, send down on us a mighty flood of waters.

verses.sanskrit: कं नश्चित्रमिषण्यसि चिकित्वान पर्थुग्मानं वाश्रंवाव्र्धध्यै कत तस्य दातु शवसो वयुष्टौ तक्षद्वज्रं वर्त्रतुरमपिन्वत |||
verses.transliteration: kaṃ naścitramiṣaṇyasi cikitvān pṛthughmānaṃ vāśraṃvāvṛdhadhyai kat tasya dātu śavaso vyuṣṭau takṣadvajraṃ vṛtraturamapinvat

translations.griffith: WHAT Splendid One, Loud-voiced, Farstriding, dost thou, well knowing, urge us to exalt with praises?  What give we him? When his might dawned, he fashioned the Vṛtra-slaying bolt, and sent us waters.

verses.sanskrit: स हि दयुता विद्युता वेति साम पर्थुं योनिमसुरत्वाससाद स सनीळेभिः परसहानो अस्य भरातुर्न रतेसप्तथस्य मायाः |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi dyutā vidyutā veti sāma pṛthuṃ yonimasuratvāsasāda sa sanīḷebhiḥ prasahāno asya bhrāturna ṛtesaptathasya māyāḥ

translations.griffith: He goes to end his work with lightning flashes: wide is the seat his Asura glory gives him.  With his Companions, not without his Brother, he quells Saptatha's magic devices.

verses.sanskrit: स वाजं यातापदुष्पदा यन सवर्षाता परि षदत्सनिष्यन अनर्वा यच्छतदुरस्य वेदो घनञ्छिश्नदेवानभि वर्पसा भूत |||
verses.transliteration: sa vājaṃ yātāpaduṣpadā yan svarṣātā pari ṣadatsaniṣyan anarvā yacchatadurasya vedo ghnañchiśnadevānabhi varpasā bhūt

translations.griffith: On most auspicious path he goes to battle he toiled to win heaven's light, full fain to gain it;  He seized the hundred-gated castle's treasure by craft, unchecked, and slew the lustful demons.

verses.sanskrit: स यह्व्यो.अवनीर्गोष्वर्वा जुहोति परधन्यासु सस्रिः अपादो यत्र युज्यासो.अरथा दरोण्यश्वास ईरते घर्तंवाः |||
verses.transliteration: sa yahvyo.avanīrghoṣvarvā juhoti pradhanyāsu sasriḥ apādo yatra yujyāso.arathā droṇyaśvāsa īrate ghṛtaṃvāḥ

translations.griffith: Fighting for kine, the prize of war, and I roaming among the berd be brings the young streams hither,  Where, footless, joined, without a car to bear them, with jars for steeds, they pour their flood like butter.

verses.sanskrit: स रुद्रेभिरशस्तवार रभ्वा हित्वी गयमारेवद्यागात वम्रस्य मन्ये मिथुना विवव्री अन्नमभीत्यारोदयन्मुषायन |||
verses.transliteration: sa rudrebhiraśastavāra ṛbhvā hitvī ghayamāreavadyaāghāt vamrasya manye mithunā vivavrī annamabhītyārodayanmuṣāyan

translations.griffith: Bold, unsolicited for wealth, with Rudras he came, the Blameless, having left his dwelling,  Came, seized the food of Vamra and his consort, and left the couple weeping and unsheltered.

verses.sanskrit: स इद दासं तुवीरवं पतिर्दन षळक्षन्त्रिशीर्षाणं दमन्यत अस्य तरितो नवोजसा वर्धानो विपावराहमयोग्रया हन |||
verses.transliteration: sa id dāsaṃ tuvīravaṃ patirdan ṣaḷakṣantriśīrṣāṇaṃ damanyat asya trito nvojasā vṛdhāno vipāvarāhamayoaghrayā han

translations.griffith: Lord of the dwelling, he subdued the demon who roared aloud, six-eyed and triple-headed.  Tṛta, made stronger by the might he lent him, struck down the boar with shaft whose point was iron.

verses.sanskrit: स दरुह्वणे मनुष ऊर्ध्वसान आ साविषदर्शसानायशरुम स नर्तमो नहुषो.अस्मत सुजातः पुरो.अभिनदर्हन्दस्युहत्ये |||
verses.transliteration: sa druhvaṇe manuṣa ūrdhvasāna ā sāviṣadarśasānāyaśarum sa nṛtamo nahuṣo.asmat sujātaḥ puro.abhinadarhandasyuhatye

translations.griffith: He raised himself on high and shot his arrow against the guileful and oppressive foeman.  Strong, glorious, manliest, for us he shattered the forts of Nabus when he slew the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit: सो अभ्रियो न यवस उदन्यन कषयाय गातुं विदन नो अस्मे उप यत सीददिन्दुं शरीरैः शयेनो.अयोपाष्टिर्हन्तिदस्यून |||
verses.transliteration: so abhriyo na yavasa udanyan kṣayāya ghātuṃ vidan no asme upa yat sīdadinduṃ śarīraiḥ śyeno.ayopāṣṭirhantidasyūn

translations.griffith: He, like a cloud that rains upon the pasture, hath found for us the way to dwell in safety.  When the Hawk comes in body to the Soma, armed with his iron claws he slays the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit: स वराधतः शवसानेभिरस्य कुत्साय शुष्णं कर्पणेपरादात अयं कविमनयच्छस्यमानमत्कं वो अस्यसनितोत नर्णाम |||
verses.transliteration: sa vrādhataḥ śavasānebhirasya kutsāya śuṣṇaṃ kṛpaṇeparādāt ayaṃ kavimanayacchasyamānamatkaṃ vo asyasanitota nṛṇām

translations.griffith: He with his potent Friends gave up the mighty, gave gusnia up to Kutsa for affliction.  He led the lauded Kavi, he delivered Atka as prey to him and to his heroes.

verses.sanskrit: अयं दशस्यन नर्येभिरस्य दस्मो देवेभिर्वरुणो नमायी अयं कनीन रतुपा अवेद्यमिमीताररुं यश्चतुष्पात |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ daśasyan naryebhirasya dasmo devebhirvaruṇo namāyī ayaṃ kanīna ṛtupā avedyamimītāraruṃ yaścatuṣpāt

translations.griffith: He, with his Gods who love mankind, the Wondrous, giving like Varuṇa who works with magic,  Was known, yet young as guardian of the seasons; and he quelled Araru, four-footed dernon.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य सतोमेभिरौशिज रजिश्वा वरजं दरयद वर्षभेणपिप्रोः सुत्वा यद यजतो दीदयद गीः पुर इयानो अभिवर्पसा भूत |||
verses.transliteration: asya stomebhirauśija ṛjiśvā vrajaṃ darayad vṛṣabheṇapiproḥ sutvā yad yajato dīdayad ghīḥ pura iyāno abhivarpasā bhūt

translations.griffith: Through lauds of him hath Auśija Ṛjiśvan burst, with the Mighty's aid, the stall of Pipru.  When the saint pressed the juice and shone as singer, he seized the forts and with his craft subdued them.

verses.sanskrit: एवा महो असुर वक्षथाय वम्रकः पड्भिरुप सर्पदिन्द्रम स इयानः करति सवस्तिमस्मा इषमूर्जंसुक्षितिं विश्वमाभाः |||
verses.transliteration: evā maho asura vakṣathāya vamrakaḥ paḍbhirupa sarpadindram sa iyānaḥ karati svastimasmā iṣamūrjaṃsukṣitiṃ viśvamābhāḥ

translations.griffith: So, swiftly Asura, for exaltation, hath the great Vamraka come nigh to Indra.  He will, when supplicated, bring him blessing: he hath brought all, food, strength, a happy dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र दर्ह्य मघवन तवावदिद भुज इह सतुतः सुतपाबोधि नो वर्धे देवेभिर्नः सविता परावतु शरुतमासर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: indra dṛhya maghavan tvāvadid bhuja iha stutaḥ sutapābodhi no vṛdhe devebhirnaḥ savitā prāvatu śrutamāsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Be, like thyself, O Indra, strong for our delight: here lauded, aid us, Maghavan, drinker of the juice.  Savitar with the Gods protect us: hear ye Twain. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit: भराय सु भरत भागं रत्वियं पर वायवे शुचिपेक्रन्ददिष्टये गौरस्य यः पयसः पीतिमानश आसर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: bharāya su bharata bhāghaṃ ṛtviyaṃ pra vāyave śucipekrandadiṣṭaye ghaurasya yaḥ payasaḥ pītimānaśa āsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Bring swift, for offering, the snare that suits the time, to the pure-drinker Vāyu, roaring as he goes,  To him who hath approached the draught of shining milk. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो देवः सविता साविषद वय रजूयते यजमानायसुन्वते यथा देवान परतिभूषेम पाकवदा सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: ā no devaḥ savitā sāviṣad vaya ṛjūyate yajamānāyasunvate yathā devān pratibhūṣema pākavadā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: May Savitar the God send us full life, to each who sacrifices, lives aright and pours the juice  That we with simple hearts may wait upon the Gods. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो अस्मे सुमना अस्तु विश्वहा राजा सोमः सुवितस्याध्येतु नः यथा-यथा मित्रधितानि सन्दधुरा सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: indro asme sumanā astu viśvahā rājā somaḥ suvitasyādhyetu naḥ yathā-yathā mitradhitāni sandadhurā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: May Indra evermore be gracious unto us, and may King Soma meditate our happiness,  Even as men secure the comfort of a friend. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र उक्थेन शवसा परुर्दधे बर्हस्पते परतरीतास्यायुषः यज्ञो मनुः परमतिर्नः पिता हि कमासर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: indra ukthena śavasā parurdadhe bṛhaspate pratarītāsyāyuṣaḥ yajño manuḥ pramatirnaḥ pitā hi kamāsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Indra hath given the body with its song and strength: Bṛhaspati, thou art the lengthener of life.  The sacrifice is Manu, Providence, our Sire. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य नु सुक्र्तं दैव्यं सहो.अग्निर्ग्र्हे जरितामेधिरः कविः यज्ञश्च भूद विदथे चारुरन्तम आसर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya nu sukṛtaṃ daivyaṃ saho.aghnirghṛhe jaritāmedhiraḥ kaviḥ yajñaśca bhūd vidathe cārurantama āsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Indra possesseth might celestial nobly formed: the singer in the house is Agni, prudent Sage.  He is the sacrifice in synod, fair, most near. We ask for freedom and complete felicity,

verses.sanskrit: न वो गुहा चक्र्म भूरि दुष्क्र्तं नाविष्ट्यं वसवोदेवहेळनम माकिर्नो देवा अन्र्तस्य वर्पस आ सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: na vo ghuhā cakṛma bhūri duṣkṛtaṃ nāviṣṭyaṃ vasavodevaheḷanam mākirno devā anṛtasya varpasa ā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Not often have we sinned against you secretly, nor, Vasus, have we openly provoked the Gods.  Not one of its, ye Gods, hath worn an alien shape. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit: अपामीवां सविता साविषन नयग वरीय इदप सेधन्त्वद्रयः गरावा यत्र मधुषुदुच्यते बर्हदासर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: apāmīvāṃ savitā sāviṣan nyagh varīya idapa sedhantvadrayaḥ ghrāvā yatra madhuṣuducyate bṛhadāsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: May Savitar remove from us our malady, and may the Mountains keep it far away from where  The press-stone as it sheds the meath rings loudly forth. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो गरावा वसवो.अस्तु सोतरि विश्वा दवेषांसि सनुतर्युयोत स नो देवः सविता पायुरीड्य आ सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvo ghrāvā vasavo.astu sotari viśvā dveṣāṃsi sanutaryuyota sa no devaḥ savitā pāyurīḍya ā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Ye Vasus, let the stone, the presser stand erect: avert all enmities and keep them far remote.  Our guard to be adored is Savitar this God. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्जं गावो यवसे पीवो अत्तन रतस्य याः सदने कोशेङगध्वे तनूरेव तन्वो अस्तु भेषजमा सर्वतातिंदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: ūrjaṃ ghāvo yavase pīvo attana ṛtasya yāḥ sadane kośeaṅghdhve tanūreva tanvo astu bheṣajamā sarvatātiṃaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Eat strength and fatness in the pasture, kine, who are balmed at the reservoir and at the seat of Law.  So let your body be our body's medicine. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit: करतुप्रावा जरिता शश्वतामव इन्द्र इद भद्राप्रमतिः सुतावताम पूर्णमूधर्दिव्यं यस्य सिक्तया सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: kratuprāvā jaritā śaśvatāmava indra id bhadrāpramatiḥ sutāvatām pūrṇamūdhardivyaṃ yasya siktayaā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: The singer fills the spirit: all mens, love hath he. Indra takes kindly care of those who pour the juice.  For his libation is the heavenly udder full. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit: चित्रस्ते भानुः करतुप्रा अभिष्टिः सन्ति सप्र्धोजरणिप्रा अध्र्ष्टाः रजिष्ठया रज्या पश्व आ गोस्तूतूर्षत्य पर्यग्रं दुवस्युः |||
verses.transliteration: citraste bhānuḥ kratuprā abhiṣṭiḥ santi spṛdhojaraṇiprā adhṛṣṭāḥ rajiṣṭhayā rajyā paśva ā ghostūtūrṣaty paryaghraṃ duvasyuḥ

translations.griffith: Wondrous thy spirit-filling light, triumpliant; thy hosts save from decay and are resistless.  The pious votary by straightest pathway speeds to possess the best of all the cattle.

verses.sanskrit: उद बुध्यध्वं समनसः सखायः समग्निमिन्ध्वं बहवःसनीळाः दधिक्रामग्निमुषसं च देवीमिन्द्रावतोऽवसे नि हवये वः |||
verses.transliteration: ud budhyadhvaṃ samanasaḥ sakhāyaḥ samaghnimindhvaṃ bahavaḥsanīḷāḥ dadhikrāmaghnimuṣasaṃ ca devīmindrāvato'vase ni hvaye vaḥ

translations.griffith: WAKE with one mind, my friends, and kindle Agni, ye who are many and who dwell together.  Agni and Dadhikrās and Dawn the Goddess, you, Gods with Indra, I call down to help us.

verses.sanskrit: मन्द्रा कर्णुध्वं धिय आ तनुध्वं नावमरित्रपरणींक्र्णुध्वम इष्क्र्णुध्वमायुधारं कर्णुध्वं पराञ्चंयज्ञं पर णयता सखायः |||
verses.transliteration: mandrā kṛṇudhvaṃ dhiya ā tanudhvaṃ nāvamaritraparaṇīṃkṛṇudhvam iṣkṛṇudhvamāyudhāraṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ prāñcaṃyajñaṃ pra ṇayatā sakhāyaḥ

translations.griffith: Make pleasant hymns, spin out your songs and praises: build ye a ship equipped with oars for transport.  Prepare the implements, make all things ready, and let the sacrifice, my friends, go forward.

verses.sanskrit: युनक्त सीरा वि युगा तनुध्वं कर्ते योनौ वपतेह बीजम गिरा च शरुष्टिः शभरा असन नो नेदीय इत सर्ण्यःपक्वमेयात |||
verses.transliteration: yunakta sīrā vi yughā tanudhvaṃ kṛte yonau vapateha bījam ghirā ca śruṣṭiḥ śabharā asan no nedīya it sṛṇyaḥpakvameyāt

translations.griffith: Lay on the yokes, and fasten well the traces: formed is the furrow, sow the seed within it.  Through song may we find bearing fraught with plenty: near to the ripened grain approach the sickle.

verses.sanskrit: सीरा युञ्जन्ति कवयो युगा वि तन्वते पर्थक धीरादेवेषु सुम्नया |||
verses.transliteration: sīrā yuñjanti kavayo yughā vi tanvate pṛthak dhīrādeveṣu sumnayā

translations.griffith: Wise, through desire of bliss from Gods, the skilful bind the traces fast, And lay the yokes on either side.

verses.sanskrit: निराहावान कर्णोतन सं वरत्रा दधातन सिञ्चामहावतमुद्रिणं वयं सुषेकमनुपक्षितम |||
verses.transliteration: nirāhāvān kṛṇotana saṃ varatrā dadhātana siñcāmahāavatamudriṇaṃ vayaṃ suṣekamanupakṣitam

translations.griffith: Arrange the buckets in their place securely fasten on the straps.  We will pour forth the well that hath a copious stream, fair-flowing well that never fails.

verses.sanskrit: इष्क्र्ताहावमवतं सुवरत्रं सुषेचनम उद्रिणं सिञ्चेक्षितम |||
verses.transliteration: iṣkṛtāhāvamavataṃ suvaratraṃ suṣecanam udriṇaṃ siñceakṣitam

translations.griffith: I pour the water from the well with pails prepared and goodly straps,  Unfailing, full, with plenteous stream.

verses.sanskrit: परीणीताश्वान हितं जयाथ सवस्तिवाहं रथमित्क्र्णुध्वम दरोणाहावमवतमश्मचक्रमंसत्रकोशंसिञ्चता नर्पाणम |||
verses.transliteration: prīṇītāśvān hitaṃ jayātha svastivāhaṃ rathamitkṛṇudhvam droṇāhāvamavatamaśmacakramaṃsatrakośaṃsiñcatā nṛpāṇam

translations.griffith: Refresh the horses, win the prize before you: equip a chariot fraught with happy fortune.  Pour forth the well with stone wheel, wooden buckets, the drink of heroes, with the trough for armour.

verses.sanskrit: वरजं कर्णुध्वं स हि वो नर्पाणो वर्म सीव्यध्वं बहुलाप्र्थूनि पुरः कर्णुध्वमायसीरध्र्ष्टा मा वः सुस्रोच्चमसो दरंहता तम |||
verses.transliteration: vrajaṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ sa hi vo nṛpāṇo varma sīvyadhvaṃ bahulāpṛthūni puraḥ kṛṇudhvamāyasīradhṛṣṭā mā vaḥ susroccamaso dṛṃhatā tam

translations.griffith: Prepare the cow-stall, for there drink your heroes: stitch ye the coats of armour, wide and many.  Make iron forts, secure from all assailants let not your pitcher leak: stay it securely.

verses.sanskrit: आ वो धियं यज्ञियां वर्त ऊतये देवा देवीं यजतांयज्ञियामिह सा नो दुहीयद यवसेव गत्वी सहस्रधारापयसा मही गौः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vo dhiyaṃ yajñiyāṃ varta ūtaye devā devīṃ yajatāṃyajñiyāmiha sā no duhīyad yavaseva ghatvī sahasradhārāpayasā mahī ghauḥ

translations.griffith: Hither, for help, I turn the holy heavenly mind of you the Holy Gods, that longs for sacrifice.  May it pour milk for us, even as a stately cow who, having sought the pasture, yields a thousand streams.

verses.sanskrit: आ तू षिञ्च हरिमीं दरोरुपस्थे वाशीभिस्तक्षताश्मन्मयीभिः परि षवजध्वं दश कक्ष्याभिरुभे धुरौ परति वह्निं युनक्त |||
verses.transliteration: ā tū ṣiñca harimīṃ drorupasthe vāśībhistakṣatāśmanmayībhiḥ pari ṣvajadhvaṃ daśa kakṣyābhirubhe dhurau prati vahniṃ yunakta

translations.griffith: Pour golden juice within the wooden vessel: with stone-made axes fashion ye and form it.  Embrace and compass it with tenfold girdle, and to both chariot-poles attach the car-horse.

verses.sanskrit: उभे धुरौ वह्निरापिब्दमानो.अन्तर्योनेव चरति दविजानिः वनस्पतिं वन आस्थापयध्वं नि षू दधिध्वमखनन्त उत्सम |||
verses.transliteration: ubhe dhurau vahnirāpibdamāno.antaryoneva carati dvijāniḥ vanaspatiṃ vana āsthāpayadhvaṃ ni ṣū dadhidhvamakhananta utsam

translations.griffith: Between both poles the car-horse goes pressed closely, as in his dwelling moves the doubly-wedded.  Lay in the wood the Soviran of the Forest, and sink the well although ye do not dig it.

verses.sanskrit: कप्र्न नरः कप्र्थमुद दधातन चोदयत खुदतवाजसातये निष्टिग्र्यः पुत्रमा चयावयोतय इन्द्रंसबाध इह सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: kapṛn naraḥ kapṛthamud dadhātana codayata khudatavājasātaye niṣṭighryaḥ putramā cyāvayotaya indraṃsabādha iha somapītaye

translations.griffith: Indra is he, O men, who gives us happiness: sport, urge the giver of delight to win us strength  Bring quickly down, O priests, hither to give us aid, to drink the Soma, Indra Son of Nistigri.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते रथं मिथूक्र्तमिन्द्रो.अवतु धर्ष्णुया अस्मिन्नाजौ पुरुहूत शरवाय्ये धनभक्षेषु नो.अव |||
verses.transliteration: pra te rathaṃ mithūkṛtamindro.avatu dhṛṣṇuyā asminnājau puruhūta śravāyye dhanabhakṣeṣu no.ava

translations.griffith: FOR thee may Indra boldly speed the car that works on either side.  Favour us, Much-invoked! in this most glorious fight against the raiders of our wealth.

verses.sanskrit: उत सम वातो वहति वासो.अस्या अधिरथं यदजयत सहस्रम रथीरभून मुद्गलानी गविष्टौ भरे कर्तं वयचेदिन्द्रसेना |||
verses.transliteration: ut sma vāto vahati vāso.asyā adhirathaṃ yadajayat sahasram rathīrabhūn mudghalānī ghaviṣṭau bhare kṛtaṃ vyacedindrasenā

translations.griffith: Loose in the wind the woman's robe was streaming what time she won a car-load worth a thousand.  The charioteer in fight was Mudgalani: she Indra's dart, heaped up the prize of battle.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तर्यछ जिघांसतो वज्रमिन्द्राभिदासतः दासस्यवा मघवन्नार्यस्य वा सनुतर्यवया वधम |||
verses.transliteration: antaryacha jighāṃsato vajramindrābhidāsataḥ dāsasyavā maghavannāryasya vā sanutaryavayā vadham

translations.griffith: O Indra, cast thy bolt among assailants who would slaughter us:  The weapon both of Dāsa and of Ārya foe keep far away, O Maghavan.

verses.sanskrit: उद्नो हरदमपिबज्जर्ह्र्षाणः कूटं सम तरंहदभिमातिमेति पर मुष्कभारः शरव इछमानो.अजिरम्बाहू अभरत सिषासन |||
verses.transliteration: udno hradamapibajjarhṛṣāṇaḥ kūṭaṃ sma tṛṃhadabhimātimeti pra muṣkabhāraḥ śrava ichamāno.ajirambāhū abharat siṣāsan

translations.griffith: The bull in joy had drunk a lake of water. His shattering horn encountered an opponent.  Swiftly, in vigorous strength, eager for glory, he stretched his forefeet, fain to win and triumph.

verses.sanskrit: नयक्रन्दयन्नुपयन्त एनममेहयन वर्षभं मध्य आजेः तेन सूभर्वं शतवत सहस्रं गवां मुद्गलः परधनेजिगाय |||
verses.transliteration: nyakrandayannupayanta enamamehayan vṛṣabhaṃ madhya ājeḥ tena sūbharvaṃ śatavat sahasraṃ ghavāṃ mudghalaḥ pradhanejighāya

translations.griffith: They came anear the bull; they made him thunder, made him pour rain down ere the fight was ended.  And Mudgala thereby won in the contest well-pastured kine in hundreds and in thousands.

verses.sanskrit: ककर्दवे वर्षभो युक्त आसीदवावचीत सारथिरस्य केशी दुधेर्युक्तस्य दरवतः सहानस रछन्ति षमा निष्पदोमुद्गलानीम |||
verses.transliteration: kakardave vṛṣabho yukta āsīdavāvacīt sārathirasya keśī dudheryuktasya dravataḥ sahānasa ṛchanti ṣmā niṣpadomudghalānīm

translations.griffith: In hope of victory that bull was harnessed: Kesi the driver urged him on with shouting.  As he ran swiftly with the car behind him his lifted heels pressed close on Mudgalani.

verses.sanskrit: उत परधिमुदहन्नस्य विद्वानुपायुनग वंसगमत्रशिक्षन इन्द्र उदावत पतिमघ्न्यानामरंहतपद्याभिः ककुद्मान |||
verses.transliteration: uta pradhimudahannasya vidvānupāyunagh vaṃsaghamatraśikṣan indra udāvat patimaghnyānāmaraṃhatapadyābhiḥ kakudmān

translations.griffith: Deftly for him he stretched the car-pole forward, guided the bull thereto and firmly yoked him.  Indra vouchsafed the lord of cows his favour: with mighty steps the buffalo ran onward.

verses.sanskrit: शुनमष्त्राव्यचरत कपर्दी वरत्रायां दार्वानह्यमानः नर्म्णानि कर्ण्वन बहवे जनाय गाःपस्पशानस्तविषीरधत्त |||
verses.transliteration: śunamaṣtrāvyacarat kapardī varatrāyāṃ dārvānahyamānaḥ nṛmṇāni kṛṇvan bahave janāya ghāḥpaspaśānastaviṣīradhatta

translations.griffith: Touched by the goad the shaggy beast went nobly, bound to the pole by the yoke's thong of leather.  Performing deeds of might for many people, he, looking on the cows, gained strength and vigour.

verses.sanskrit: इमं तं पश्य वर्षभस्य युञ्जं काष्ठाया मध्येद्रुघणं शयानम येन जिगाय शतवत सहस्रं गवाम्मुद्गलः पर्तनाज्येषु |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ taṃ paśya vṛṣabhasya yuñjaṃ kāṣṭhāyā madhyedrughaṇaṃ śayānam yena jighāya śatavat sahasraṃ ghavāmmudghalaḥ pṛtanājyeṣu

translations.griffith: Here look upon this mace, this bull's companion, now lying midway on the field of battle.  Therewith hath Mudgala in ordered contest won for cattle for himself, a hundred thousand.

verses.sanskrit: आरे अघा को नवित्था ददर्श यं युञ्जन्ति तं वास्थापयन्ति नास्मै तर्णं नोदकमा भरन्त्युत्तरो धुरोवहति परदेदिशत |||
verses.transliteration: āre aghā ko nvitthā dadarśa yaṃ yuñjanti taṃ vāsthāpayanti nāsmai tṛṇaṃ nodakamā bharantyuttaro dhurovahati pradediśat

translations.griffith: Far is the evil: who hath here beheld it? Hither they bring the bull whom they are yoking..  To this they give not either food or water. Reaching beyond the pole it gives directions.

verses.sanskrit: परिव्र्क्तेव पतिविद्यमानट पीप्याना कूचक्रेणेव सिञ्चन एषैष्या चिद रथ्या जयेम सुमङगलं सिनवदस्तु सातम |||
verses.transliteration: parivṛkteva patividyamānaṭ pīpyānā kūcakreṇeva siñcan eṣaiṣyā cid rathyā jayema sumaṅghalaṃ sinavadastu sātam

translations.griffith: Like one forsaken, she hath found a husband, and teemed as if her breast were full and flowing.  With swiftly-racing chariot may we conquer, and rich and blessed be our gains in battle.

verses.sanskrit: तवं विश्वस्य जगतश्चक्षुरिन्द्रासि चक्षुषः वर्षायदाजिं वर्षणा सिषाससि चोदयन वध्रिणा युजा |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ viśvasya jaghataścakṣurindrāsi cakṣuṣaḥ vṛṣāyadājiṃ vṛṣaṇā siṣāsasi codayan vadhriṇā yujā

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, art the mark whereon the eyes of all life rest, when thou,  A Bull who drivest with thy bull, wilt win the race together with thy weakling friend.

verses.sanskrit: आशुः शिशानो वर्षभो न भीमो घनाघनः कषोभणश्चर्षणीनाम संक्रन्दनो.अनिमिष एकवीरः शतं सेनाजयत साकमिन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: āśuḥ śiśāno vṛṣabho na bhīmo ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaścarṣaṇīnām saṃkrandano.animiṣa ekavīraḥ śataṃ senāajayat sākamindraḥ

translations.griffith: SWIFT, rapidly striking, like a bull who sharpens his horns, terrific, stirring up the people,  With eyes that close not, bellowing, Sole Hero, Indra. subdued at once a hundred armies.

verses.sanskrit: संक्रन्दनेनानिमिषेण जिष्णुना युत्कारेण दुश्च्यवनेनध्र्ष्णुना तदिन्द्रेण जयत तत सहध्वं युधो नरैषुहस्तेन वर्ष्णा |||
verses.transliteration: saṃkrandanenānimiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā yutkāreṇa duścyavanenadhṛṣṇunā tadindreṇa jayata tat sahadhvaṃ yudho naraiṣuhastena vṛṣṇā

translations.griffith: With him loud-roaring, ever watchful, Victor, bold, hard to overthrow, Rouser of battle,  Indra. the Strong, whose hand bears arrows, conquer, ye warriors, now, now vanquish in the combat.

verses.sanskrit: स इषुहस्तैः स निषङगिभिर्वशी संस्रष्टा स युधैन्द्रो गणेन संस्र्ष्टजित सोमपा बाहुशर्ध्युग्रधन्वाप्रतिहिताभिरस्ता |||
verses.transliteration: sa iṣuhastaiḥ sa niṣaṅghibhirvaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudhaindro ghaṇena saṃsṛṣṭajit somapā bāhuśardhyughradhanvāpratihitābhirastā

translations.griffith: He rules with those who carry shafts and quivers, Indra who with his band rings hosts together,  Foe-conquering, strong of arm, the Soma-drinker, with mighty bow, shooting with well-laid arrows.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पते परि दीया रथेन रक्षोहामित्रानपबाधमानः परभञ्जन सेनाः परम्र्णो युधा जयन्नस्माकमेध्यविता रथानाम |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate pari dīyā rathena rakṣohāmitrānapabādhamānaḥ prabhañjan senāḥ pramṛṇo yudhā jayannasmākamedhyavitā rathānām

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati, fly with thy chariot hither, slayer of demons, driving off our foemen.  Be thou protector of our cars, destroyer, victor in battle, breaker-up of armies.

verses.sanskrit: बलविज्ञाय सथविरः परवीरः सहस्वान वाजी सहमानौग्रः अभिवीरो अभिसत्वा सहोजा जैत्रमिन्द्र रथमातिष्ठ गोवित |||
verses.transliteration: balavijñāya sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaughraḥ abhivīro abhisatvā sahojā jaitramindra rathamātiṣṭha ghovit

translations.griffith: Conspicuous by thy strength, firm, foremost fighter, mighty and fierce, victorious, all-subduing,  The Son of Conquest, passing men and heroes, kine-winner, mount thy conquering car, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: गोत्रभिदं गोविदं वज्रबाहुं जयन्तमज्म परम्र्णन्तमोजसा इमं सजाता अनु वीरयध्वमिन्द्रं सखायो अनुसं रभध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: ghotrabhidaṃ ghovidaṃ vajrabāhuṃ jayantamajma pramṛṇantamojasā imaṃ sajātā anu vīrayadhvamindraṃ sakhāyo anusaṃ rabhadhvam

translations.griffith: Cleaver of stalls, kine-winner, armed with thunder, who quells an army and with might destroys it.-  Follow him, brothers! quit yourselves like heroes, and like this Indra show your zeal and courage.

verses.sanskrit: अभि गोत्राणि सहसा गाहमानो.अदयो वीरः शतमन्युरिन्द्रः दुश्च्यवनः पर्तनाषाळ अयुध्यो.अस्माकं सेनावतु पर युत्सु |||
verses.transliteration: abhi ghotrāṇi sahasā ghāhamāno.adayo vīraḥ śatamanyurindraḥ duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāḷ ayudhyo.asmākaṃ senāavatu pra yutsu

translations.griffith: Piercing the cow-stalls with surpassing vigour, Indra, the pitiless Hero, wild with anger,  Victor in fight, unshaken and resistless,may he protect our armies in our battles.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र आसां नेता बर्हस्पतिर्दक्षिणा यज्ञः पुर एतुसोमः देवसेनानामभिभञ्जतीनां जयन्तीनां मरुतोयन्त्वग्रम |||
verses.transliteration: indra āsāṃ netā bṛhaspatirdakṣiṇā yajñaḥ pura etusomaḥ devasenānāmabhibhañjatīnāṃ jayantīnāṃ marutoyantvaghram

translations.griffith: Indra guide these: Bṛhaspati precede them, the guerdon, and the sacrifice, and Soma;  And let the banded Maruts march in forefront of heavenly hosts that conquer and demolish.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य वर्ष्णो वरुणस्य राज्ञ आदित्यानां मरुतांशर्ध उग्रम महामनसां भुवनच्यवानां घोषोदेवानां जयतामुदस्थात |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya vṛṣṇo varuṇasya rājña ādityānāṃ marutāṃśardha ughram mahāmanasāṃ bhuvanacyavānāṃ ghoṣodevānāṃ jayatāmudasthāt

translations.griffith: Ours be the potent host of mighty Indra, King Varuṇa, and Maruts, and Ādityas.  Uplifted is the shout of Gods who conquer high-minded Gods who cause the worlds to tremble.

verses.sanskrit: उद धर्षय मघवन्नायुधान्युत सत्वनां मामकानाम्मनांसि उद वर्त्रहन वाजिनां वाजिनान्युद रथानांजयतां यन्तु घोषाः |||
verses.transliteration: ud dharṣaya maghavannāyudhānyut satvanāṃ māmakānāmmanāṃsi ud vṛtrahan vājināṃ vājinānyud rathānāṃjayatāṃ yantu ghoṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Bristle thou up, O Maghavan, our weapons: excite the spirits of my warring heroes.  Urge on the strong steeds' might, O Vṛtra-slayer, and let the din of conquering cars go upward.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकमिन्द्रः सम्र्तेषु धवजेष्वस्माकं या इषवस्ताजयन्तु अस्माकं वीरा उत्तरे भवन्त्वस्मानु देवा अवताहवेषु |||
verses.transliteration: asmākamindraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣvasmākaṃ yā iṣavastājayantu asmākaṃ vīrā uttare bhavantvasmānu devā avatāhaveṣu

translations.griffith: May Indra aid us when our flags are gathered: victorious be the arrows of our army.  May our brave men of war prevail in battle. Ye Gods, protect us in the shout of onset.

verses.sanskrit: अमीषां चित्तं परतिलोभयन्ती गर्हाणाङगान्यप्वे परेहि अभि परेहि निर्दह हर्त्सु शोकैरन्धेनामित्रास्तमसासचन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: amīṣāṃ cittaṃ pratilobhayantī ghṛhāṇāṅghānyapve parehi abhi prehi nirdaha hṛtsu śokairandhenāmitrāstamasāsacantām

translations.griffith: Bewildering the senses of our foemen, seize thou their bodies and depart, O Apva.  Attack them, set their hearts on fire and burn them: so let our foes abide in utter darkness.

verses.sanskrit: परेता जयता नर इन्द्रो वः शर्म यछतु उग्रा वः सन्तुबाहवो.अनाध्र्ष्या यथासथ |||
verses.transliteration: pretā jayatā nara indro vaḥ śarma yachatu ughrā vaḥ santubāhavo.anādhṛṣyā yathāsatha

translations.griffith: Advance, O heroes, win the day. May Indra be your sure defence.  Exceeding mighty be your arms, that none may wound or injure you.

verses.sanskrit: असावि सोमः पुरुहूत तुभ्यं हरिभ्यां यज्ञमुप याहितूयम तुभ्यं गिरो विप्रवीरा इयाना दधन्विर इन्द्रपिबा सुतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: asāvi somaḥ puruhūta tubhyaṃ haribhyāṃ yajñamupa yāhitūyam tubhyaṃ ghiro vipravīrā iyānā dadhanvira indrapibā sutasya

translations.griffith: Soma hath flowed for thee, Invoked of mat Speed to our sacrifice with both thy Coursers.  To thee have streameld the songs or mighty singers, imploring, Indra, drink of our libation.

verses.sanskrit: अप्सु धूतस्य हरिवः पिबेह नर्भिः सुतस्य जठरम्प्र्णस्व मिमिक्षुर्यमद्रय इन्द्र तुभ्यं तेभिर्वर्धस्वमदमुक्थवाहः |||
verses.transliteration: apsu dhūtasya harivaḥ pibeha nṛbhiḥ sutasya jaṭharampṛṇasva mimikṣuryamadraya indra tubhyaṃ tebhirvardhasvamadamukthavāhaḥ

translations.griffith: Drink of the juice which men have washed in waters, and fill thee full, O Lord of Tawny Horses.  O Indra, hearer of the laud, with Soma which stones have mixed for thee enhance thy rapture.

verses.sanskrit: परोग्रां पीतिं वर्ष्ण इयर्मि सत्यां परयै सुतस्यहर्यश्व तुभ्यम इन्द्र धेनाभिरिह मादयस्व धीभिर्विश्वाभिः शच्या गर्णानः |||
verses.transliteration: proghrāṃ pītiṃ vṛṣṇa iyarmi satyāṃ prayai sutasyaharyaśva tubhyam indra dhenābhiriha mādayasva dhībhirviśvābhiḥ śacyā ghṛṇānaḥ

translations.griffith: To make thee start, a strong true draught I offer to thee, the Bull, O thou whom Bay Steeds carry.  Here take delight, O Indra, in our voices while thou art hymned with power and all our spirit.

verses.sanskrit: ऊती शचीवस्तव वीर्येण वयो दधाना उशिज रतज्ञाः परजावदिन्द्र मनुषो दुरोणे तस्थुर्ग्र्णन्तःसधमाद्यासः |||
verses.transliteration: ūtī śacīvastava vīryeṇa vayo dadhānā uśija ṛtajñāḥ prajāvadindra manuṣo duroṇe tasthurghṛṇantaḥsadhamādyāsaḥ

translations.griffith: O Mighty Indra, through thine aid, thy prowess, obtaining life, zealous, and skilled in Order,  Men in the house who share the sacred banquet stand singing praise that brings them store of children.

verses.sanskrit: परणीतिभिष टे हर्यश्व सुष्टोः सुषुम्नस्य पुरुरुचोजनासः मंहिष्ठामूतिं वितिरे दधाना सतोतारैन्द्र तव सून्र्ताभिः |||
verses.transliteration: praṇītibhiṣ ṭe haryaśva suṣṭoḥ suṣumnasya pururucojanāsaḥ maṃhiṣṭhāmūtiṃ vitire dadhānā stotāraindra tava sūnṛtābhiḥ

translations.griffith: Through thy directions, Lord of Tawny Coursers, thine who art firm, splendid, and blest, the people  Obtain most liberal aid for their salvation, and praise thee, Indra, through thine excellencies.

verses.sanskrit: उप बरह्माणि हरिवो हरिभ्यां सोमस्य याहि पीतये सुतस्य इन्द्र तवा यज्ञः कषममाणमानड दाश्वानस्यध्वरस्य परकेतः |||
verses.transliteration: upa brahmāṇi harivo haribhyāṃ somasya yāhi pītaye sutasya indra tvā yajñaḥ kṣamamāṇamānaḍ dāśvānasyadhvarasya praketaḥ

translations.griffith: Lord of the Bays, come with thy two Bay Horses, come to our prayers, to drink the juice of Soma.  To thee comes sacrifice which thou acceptest: thou, skilled in holy rites, art he who giveth.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रवाजमभिमातिषाहं सुतेरणं मघवानं सुव्र्क्तिम उप भूषन्ति गिरो अप्रतीतमिन्द्रं नमस्या जरितुःपनन्त |||
verses.transliteration: sahasravājamabhimātiṣāhaṃ suteraṇaṃ maghavānaṃ suvṛktim upa bhūṣanti ghiro apratītamindraṃ namasyā jarituḥpananta

translations.griffith: Him of a thousand powers, subduing foemen, Maghavan praised with hymns and pleased with Soma,—  Even him our songs approach, resistless Indra: the adorations of the singer laud him.

verses.sanskrit: सप्तापो देवीः सुरणा अम्र्क्ता याभिः सिन्धुमतर इन्द्रपूर्भित नवतिं सरोत्या नव च सरवन्तीर्देवेभ्यो गातुम्मनुषे च विन्दः |||
verses.transliteration: saptāpo devīḥ suraṇā amṛktā yābhiḥ sindhumatara indrapūrbhit navatiṃ srotyā nava ca sravantīrdevebhyo ghātummanuṣe ca vindaḥ

translations.griffith: The way to bliss for Gods and man thou foundest, Indra, seven lovely floods, divine, untroubled,  Wherewith thou, rending forts, didst move the ocean, and nine-and-ninety flowing streams of water.

verses.sanskrit: अपो महीरभिशस्तेरमुञ्चो.अजागरास्वधि देव एकः इन्द्र यास्त्वं वर्त्रतूर्ये चकर्थ ताभिर्विश्वायुस्तन्वं पुपुष्याः |||
verses.transliteration: apo mahīrabhiśasteramuñco.ajāgharāsvadhi deva ekaḥ indra yāstvaṃ vṛtratūrye cakartha tābhirviśvāyustanvaṃ pupuṣyāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou from the curse didst free the mighty Waters, and as their only God didst watch and guard them.  O Indra, cherish evermore thy body with those which thou hast won in quelling Vṛtra.

verses.sanskrit: वीरेण्यः करतुरिन्द्रः सुशस्तिरुतापि धेना पुरुहूतमीट्टे आर्दयद वर्त्रमक्र्णोदु लोकं ससाहे शक्रःप्र्तना अभिष्टिः |||
verses.transliteration: vīreṇyaḥ kraturindraḥ suśastirutāpi dhenā puruhūtamīṭṭe ārdayad vṛtramakṛṇodu lokaṃ sasāhe śakraḥpṛtanā abhiṣṭiḥ

translations.griffith: Heroic power and noble praise is Indra yea, the song worships him invoked of many.  Vṛtra he quelled, and gave men room and freedom: gakra, victorious, hath conquered armies.

verses.sanskrit: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रं ... ||
verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema maghavānamindraṃ ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghayan, auspicious Indra. best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered,  The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: कदा वसो सतोत्रं हर्यत आव शमशा रुधद वाः दीर्घं सुतं वाताप्याय |||
verses.transliteration: kadā vaso stotraṃ haryata āva śmaśā rudhad vāḥ dīrghaṃ sutaṃ vātāpyāya

translations.griffith: WHEN, Vasu, wilt thou love the laud? Now let the channel bring the stream.  The juice is ready to ferment.

verses.sanskrit: हरी यस्य सुयुजा विव्रता वेरर्वन्तानु शेपा उभारजी न केशिना पतिर्दन |||
verses.transliteration: harī yasya suyujā vivratā verarvantānu śepā ubhārajī na keśinā patirdan

translations.griffith: He whose two Bay Steeds harnessed well, swerving, pursue the Bird's tail-plumes,  With Rowing manes, like heaven and earth, he is the Lord with power to give.

verses.sanskrit: अप योरिन्द्रः पापज आ मर्तो न शश्रमाणो बिभीवान शुभे यद युयुजे तविषीवान |||
verses.transliteration: apa yorindraḥ pāpaja ā marto na śaśramāṇo bibhīvān śubhe yad yuyuje taviṣīvān

translations.griffith: Bereft of skill is Indra, if, like some outwearied man he fears  The sinner, when the Mighty hath prepared himself for victory.

verses.sanskrit: सचायोरिन्द्रश्चर्क्र्ष आनुपानसः सपर्यन नदयोर्विव्रतयोः शूर इन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: sacāyorindraścarkṛṣa ānupānasaḥ saparyan nadayorvivratayoḥ śūra indraḥ

translations.griffith: Indra with these drives round, until he meets with one to worship him:  Indra is Master of the pair who snort and swerve upon their way.

verses.sanskrit: अधि यस्तस्थौ केशवन्ता वयचस्वन्ता न पुष्ट्यै वनोति शिप्राभ्यां शिप्रिणीवान |||
verses.transliteration: adhi yastasthau keśavantā vyacasvantā na puṣṭyai vanoti śiprābhyāṃ śipriṇīvān

translations.griffith: Borne onward by the long-maned Steeds who stretch themselves as ’twere for food,  The God who wears the helm defends them with his jaws.

verses.sanskrit: परास्तौद रष्वौजा रष्वेभिस्ततक्ष शूरः शवसा रभुर्न करतुभिर्मातरिश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: prāstaud ṛṣvaujā ṛṣvebhistatakṣa śūraḥ śavasā ṛbhurna kratubhirmātariśvā

translations.griffith: The Mighty sang with Lofty Ones: the Hero fashioned with his strength,  Like skilful Mātariśvan with his power and might,

verses.sanskrit: वज्रं यश्चक्रे सुहनाय दस्यवे हिरीमशो हिरीमान अरुतहनुरद्भुतं न रजः |||
verses.transliteration: vajraṃ yaścakre suhanāya dasyave hirīmaśo hirīmān arutahanuradbhutaṃ na rajaḥ

translations.griffith: The bolt, which pierced at once the vitals of the Dasyu easy to be slain,  With jaw uninjured like the wondrous firmament.

verses.sanskrit: अव नो वर्जिना शिशीह्य रचा वनेमान्र्चः नाब्रह्मा यज्ञर्धग जोषति तवे |||
verses.transliteration: ava no vṛjinā śiśīhy ṛcā vanemānṛcaḥ nābrahmā yajñaṛdhagh joṣati tve

translations.griffith: Grind off our sins: with song will we conquer the men who sing no hymns:  Not easily art thou pleased with prayerless sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वा यत ते तरेतिनी भूद यज्ञस्य धूर्षु सद्मन सजूर्नावं सवयशसं सचायोः |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvā yat te tretinī bhūd yajñasya dhūrṣu sadman sajūrnāvaṃ svayaśasaṃ sacāyoḥ

translations.griffith: When threefold flame burns high for thee, to rest on poles of sacrifice,  Thou with the living joyest in the self-bright Ship.

verses.sanskrit: शरिये ते पर्श्निरुपसेचनी भूच्छ्रिये दर्विररेपाः यया सवे पात्रे सिञ्चस उत |||
verses.transliteration: śriye te pṛśnirupasecanī bhūcchriye darvirarepāḥ yayā sve pātre siñcasa ut

translations.griffith: Thy glory was the speckled cup, thy glory was the flawless scoop.  Wherewith thou pourest into thy receptacle.

verses.sanskrit: शतं वा यदसुर्य परति तवा सुमित्र इत्थास्तौद दुर्मित्रैत्थास्तौ आवो यद दस्युहत्ये कुत्सपुत्रं परावो यद्दस्युहत्ये कुत्सवत्सम |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ vā yadasurya prati tvā sumitra itthāstaud durmitraitthāstau āvo yad dasyuhatye kutsaputraṃ prāvo yaddasyuhatye kutsavatsam
