translations.griffith: As hundreds, O Immortal God, have sung to thee, so hath Sumitra, yea, Durmitra praised thee here,  What time thou holpest Kutsa's son, when Dasyus fell, yea, holpest Kutsa's darling when the Dasyus died.

verses.sanskrit: उभा उ नूनं तदिदर्थयेथे वि तन्वाथे धियोवश्त्रापसेव सध्रीचीना यातवे परेमजीगः सुदिनेवप्र्क्ष आ तंसयेथे |||
verses.transliteration: ubhā u nūnaṃ tadidarthayethe vi tanvāthe dhiyovaśtrāpaseva sadhrīcīnā yātave premajīghaḥ sudinevapṛkṣa ā taṃsayethe

translations.griffith: THIS very thing ye Twain hold as your object: ye weave your songs as skilful men weave garments.  That ye may come united have I waked you: ye spread out food like days of lovely weather.

verses.sanskrit: उष्टारेव फर्वरेषु शरयेथे परायोगेव शवात्र्या शासुरेथः दूतेव हि षठो यशसा जनेषु माप सथातम्महिषेवापानात |||
verses.transliteration: uṣṭāreva pharvareṣu śrayethe prāyogheva śvātryā śāsurethaḥ dūteva hi ṣṭho yaśasā janeṣu māpa sthātammahiṣevāpānāt

translations.griffith: Like two plough-bulls ye move along in traces, and seek like eager guests your bidder's banquet.  Ye are like glorious envoys mid the people: like bulls, approach the place where ye are watered.

verses.sanskrit: साकंयुजा शकुनस्येव पक्षा पश्वेव चित्रा यजुरागमिष्टम अग्निरिव देवयोर्दीदिवांसा परिज्मानेवयजथः पुरुत्रा |||
verses.transliteration: sākaṃyujā śakunasyeva pakṣā paśveva citrā yajurāghamiṣṭam aghniriva devayordīdivāṃsā parijmānevayajathaḥ purutrā

translations.griffith: Like the two pinions of a bird, connected, like two choice animals, ye have sought our worship.  Bright as the fire the votary hath kindled, ye sacrifice in many a spot as roamers.

verses.sanskrit: आपी वो अस्मे पितरेव पुत्रोग्रेव रुचा नर्पतीव तुर्यै इर्येव पुष्ट्यै किरणेव भुज्यै शरुष्टीवानेव हवमागमिष्टम |||
verses.transliteration: āpī vo asme pitareva putroghreva rucā nṛpatīva turyai iryeva puṣṭyai kiraṇeva bhujyai śruṣṭīvāneva havamāghamiṣṭam

translations.griffith: Ye are our kinsmen, like two sons, two fathers, strong in your splendour and like kings for conquest;  Like rays for our enjoyment, Lords to feed us, ye, like quick bearers, have obeyed our calling.

verses.sanskrit: वंसगेव पूषर्या शिम्बाता मित्रेव रता शतराशातपन्ता वाजेवोच्चा वयसा घर्म्येष्ठा मेषेवेषासपर्या पुरीषा |||
verses.transliteration: vaṃsagheva pūṣaryā śimbātā mitreva ṛtā śatarāśātapantā vājevoccā vayasā gharmyeṣṭhā meṣeveṣāsaparyā purīṣā

translations.griffith: You are like two pleasantly moving well-fed (hills) like Mitra and Varuṇa, the two bestowers of felicity, veracious, possessors of infinite wealth, happy, like two horses plump with fodder, abiding in the firmament, like two rams (are you) to be nourished with sacrificial food, to be cherished (with oblations).

verses.sanskrit: सर्ण्येव जर्भरी तुर्फरीतू नैतोशेव तुर्फरीपर्फरीका उदन्यजेव जेमना मदेरू ता मे जराय्वजरम्मरायु |||
verses.transliteration: sṛṇyeva jarbharī turpharītū naitośeva turpharīparpharīkā udanyajeva jemanā maderū tā me jarāyvajarammarāyu

translations.griffith: You are like two mad elephants bending their forequarters and smiting the foe, like the two sons of Nitosa destroying (foes), and cherishing (friends); you are bright as two water-born (jewels), do you, who are victorious, (render) my decaying mortal body free from decay.

verses.sanskrit: पज्रेव चर्चरं जारं मरायु कषद्मेवार्थेषु तर्तरीथौग्रा रभू नापत खरमज्रा खरज्रुर्वायुर्न पर्फरत्क्षयद रयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: pajreva carcaraṃ jāraṃ marāyu kṣadmevārtheṣu tartarīthaughrā ṛbhū nāpat kharamajrā kharajrurvāyurna parpharatkṣayad rayīṇām

translations.griffith: Fierce (Aśvins), like two powerful (heroes), you enable this moving, perishable mortal (frame) to cross over to the objects (of its destination) as over water; extremely strong, like the Ṛbhus, your chariot, attained its destination swift as the wind, it pervaded (everywhere), it dispensed riches.

verses.sanskrit: घर्मेव मधु जठरे सनेरू भगेविता तुर्फरीफारिवारम पतरेव चचरा चन्द्रनिर्णिं मनर्ङगामनन्या न जग्मी |||
verses.transliteration: gharmeva madhu jaṭhare sanerū bhaghevitā turpharīphārivāram patareva cacarā candranirṇiṃ manaṛṅghāmananyā na jaghmī

translations.griffith: With your bellies full of the Soma, like two saucepans, preservers of wealth, destroyers of enemies. (you are) armed with hatchets, moving like two flying (birds) with forms like the moon, attaining success through the mind, like two laudable beings, (you are) approaching (the sacrifice).

verses.sanskrit: बर्हन्तेव गम्भरेषु परतिष्ठां पादेव गाधं तरतेविदाथः कर्णेव शासुरनु हि समराथो.अंशेव नोभजतं चित्रमप्नः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhanteva ghambhareṣu pratiṣṭhāṃ pādeva ghādhaṃ taratevidāthaḥ karṇeva śāsuranu hi smarātho.aṃśeva nobhajataṃ citramapnaḥ

translations.griffith: Like giants, ye will find firm ground to stand on in depths, like feet for one who fords a shallow.  Like cars ye will attend to him who orders: ye Two enjoy our wondrous work as sharers.

verses.sanskrit: आरङगरेव मध्वेरयेथे सारघेव गवि नीचीनबारे कीनारेव सवेदमासिष्विदाना कषामेवोर्जा सूयवसात्सचेथे |||
verses.transliteration: āraṅghareva madhverayethe sāragheva ghavi nīcīnabāre kīnāreva svedamāsiṣvidānā kṣāmevorjā sūyavasātsacethe

translations.griffith: Like toiling bees ye bring to us your honey, as bees into the hide that opens downward.

verses.sanskrit: रध्याम सतोमं सनुयाम वाजमा नो मन्त्रं सरथेहोपयातम यशो न पक्वं मधु गोष्वन्तरा भूतांशोश्विनोः काममप्राः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛdhyāma stomaṃ sanuyāma vājamā no mantraṃ sarathehopayātam yaśo na pakvaṃ madhu ghoṣvantarā bhūtāṃśoaśvinoḥ kāmamaprāḥ

translations.griffith: May we increase the laud and gain us vigour: come to our song, ye whom one chariot carries.  Filled be our kine with ripened meath like glory: Bhutamsa hath fulfilled the Aśvins' longing.

verses.sanskrit: आविरभून महि माघोनमेषां विश्वं जीवं तमसो निरमोचि महि जयोतिः पित्र्भिर्दत्तमागादुरुः पन्थादक्षिणाया अदर्शि |||
verses.transliteration: āvirabhūn mahi māghonameṣāṃ viśvaṃ jīvaṃ tamaso niramoci mahi jyotiḥ pitṛbhirdattamāghāduruḥ panthādakṣiṇāyā adarśi

translations.griffith: THESE men's great bounty hath been manifested, and the whole world of life set free from darkness.  Great light hath come, vouchsafed us by the Fathers: apparent is the spacious path of Guerdon.

verses.sanskrit: उच्चा दिवि दक्षिणावन्तो अस्थुर्ये अश्वदाः सह तेसूर्येण हिरण्यदा अम्र्तत्वं भजन्ते वासोदाः सोम परतिरन्त आयुः |||
verses.transliteration: uccā divi dakṣiṇāvanto asthurye aśvadāḥ saha tesūryeṇa hiraṇyadā amṛtatvaṃ bhajante vāsodāḥ soma pratiranta āyuḥ

translations.griffith: High up in heaven abide the Guerdon-givers: they who give steeds dwell with the Sun for ever.  They who give gold are blest with life eternal. they who give robes prolong their lives, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit: दैवी पूर्तिर्दक्षिणा देवयज्या न कवारिभ्यो नहि तेप्र्णन्ति अथा नरः परयतदक्षिणासो.अवद्यभियाबहवः पर्णन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: daivī pūrtirdakṣiṇā devayajyā na kavāribhyo nahi tepṛṇanti athā naraḥ prayatadakṣiṇāso.avadyabhiyābahavaḥ pṛṇanti

translations.griffith: Not from the niggards-for they give not fireely-comes Meed at sacrifice, Gods’ satisfaction:  Yea, many men with hands stretched out with Guerdon present their gifts because they dread dishonour.

verses.sanskrit: शतधारं वायुमर्कं सवर्विदं नर्चक्षसस्ते अभिचक्षते हविः ये पर्णन्ति पर च यछन्ति संगमे तेदक्षिणां दुहते सप्तमातरम |||
verses.transliteration: śatadhāraṃ vāyumarkaṃ svarvidaṃ nṛcakṣasaste abhicakṣate haviḥ ye pṛṇanti pra ca yachanti saṃghame tedakṣiṇāṃ duhate saptamātaram

translations.griffith: These who observe mankind regard oblation as streamy Vāyu and light-finding Arka.  They satisfy and give their gifts in synod, and pour in streams the seven-mothered Guerdon.

verses.sanskrit: दक्षिणावान परथमो हूत एति दक्षिणावान गरामणीरग्रमेति तमेव मन्ये नर्पतिं जनानां यः परथमोदक्षिणामाविवाय |||
verses.transliteration: dakṣiṇāvān prathamo hūta eti dakṣiṇāvān ghrāmaṇīraghrameti tameva manye nṛpatiṃ janānāṃ yaḥ prathamodakṣiṇāmāvivāya

translations.griffith: He who brings Guerdon comes as first invited: chief of the hamlet comes the Guerdon-bearer.  Him I account the ruler of the people who was the first to introduce the Guerdon.

verses.sanskrit: तमेव रषिं तमु बरह्माणमाहुर्यज्ञन्यं सामगामुक्थशासम स शुक्रस्य तन्वो वेद तिस्रो यः परथमोदक्षिणया रराध |||
verses.transliteration: tameva ṛṣiṃ tamu brahmāṇamāhuryajñanyaṃ sāmaghāmukthaśāsam sa śukrasya tanvo veda tisro yaḥ prathamodakṣiṇayā rarādha

translations.griffith: They call him Ṛṣi, Brahman, Sāma-chanter, reciter of the laud, leader of worship.  The brightly-shining God's three forms he knoweth who first bestowed the sacrificial Guerdon.

verses.sanskrit: दक्षिणाश्वं दक्षिणा गां ददाति दक्षिणा चन्द्रमुत यद धिरण्यम दक्षिणान्नं वनुते यो न आत्मादक्षिणां वर्म कर्णुते विजानन |||
verses.transliteration: dakṣiṇāśvaṃ dakṣiṇā ghāṃ dadāti dakṣiṇā candramuta yad dhiraṇyam dakṣiṇānnaṃ vanute yo na ātmādakṣiṇāṃ varma kṛṇute vijānan

translations.griffith: Guerdon bestows the horse, bestows the bullock, Guerdon bestows, moreover, gold that Rsisters.  Guerdon gives food which is our life and spirit. He who is wise takes Guerdon for his armour.

verses.sanskrit: न भोजा मम्रुर्न नयर्थमीयुर्न रिष्यन्ति न वयथन्ते हभोजाः इदं यद विश्वं भुवनं सवश्चैतत सर्वन्दक्षिणैभ्यो ददाति |||
verses.transliteration: na bhojā mamrurna nyarthamīyurna riṣyanti na vyathante habhojāḥ idaṃ yad viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ svaścaitat sarvandakṣiṇaibhyo dadāti

translations.griffith: The liberal die not, never are they ruined: the liberal suffer neither harm nor trouble.  The light of heaven, the universe about us,—all this doth sacrificial Guerdon give them.

verses.sanskrit: भोजा जिग्युः सुरभिं योनिमग्रे भोजा जिग्युर्वध्वं यासुवासाः भोजा जिग्युरन्तःपेयं सुराया भोजा जिग्युर्ये अहूताः परयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: bhojā jighyuḥ surabhiṃ yonimaghre bhojā jighyurvadhvaṃ yāsuvāsāḥ bhojā jighyurantaḥpeyaṃ surāyā bhojā jighyurye ahūtāḥ prayanti

translations.griffith: First have the liberal gained a fragrant dwelling, and got themselves a bride in fair apparel.  The liberal have obtained their draught of liquor, and conquered those who, unprovoked, assailed them.

verses.sanskrit: भोजायाश्वं सं मर्जन्त्याशुं भोजायास्ते कन्याशुम्भमाना भोजस्येदं पुष्करिणीव वेश्म परिष्क्र्तन्देवमानेव चित्रम |||
verses.transliteration: bhojāyāśvaṃ saṃ mṛjantyāśuṃ bhojāyāste kanyāśumbhamānā bhojasyedaṃ puṣkariṇīva veśma pariṣkṛtandevamāneva citram

translations.griffith: They deck the fleet steed for the bounteous giver: the maid adorns herself and waits to meet him.  His home is like a lake with lotus blossoms, like the Gods’ palaces adorned and splendid.

verses.sanskrit: भोजमश्वाः सुष्ठुवाहो वहन्ति सुव्र्द रथो वर्ततेदक्षिणायाः भोजं देवासो.अवता भरेषु भोजःशत्रून समनीकेषु जेता |||
verses.transliteration: bhojamaśvāḥ suṣṭhuvāho vahanti suvṛd ratho vartatedakṣiṇāyāḥ bhojaṃ devāso.avatā bhareṣu bhojaḥśatrūn samanīkeṣu jetā

translations.griffith: Steeds good at draught convey the liberal giver, and lightly rolling moves the car of Guerdon.  Assist, ye Gods, the liberal man in battles: the liberal giver conquers foes in combat.

verses.sanskrit: किमिछन्ती सरमा परेदमानड दूरे हयध्वा जगुरिःपराचैः कास्मेहितिः का परितक्म्यासीत कथं रसायातरः पयांसि |||
verses.transliteration: kimichantī saramā predamānaḍ dūre hyadhvā jaghuriḥparācaiḥ kāsmehitiḥ kā paritakmyāsīt kathaṃ rasāyāataraḥ payāṃsi

translations.griffith: WHAT wish of Saramā hath brought her hither? The path leads far away to distant places.  What charge hast thou for us? Where turns thy journey? How hast thou made thy way o’er Rasā's waters.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य दूतीरिषिता चरामि मह इछन्ती पणयो निधीन्वः अतिष्कदो भियसा तन न आवत तथा रसाया अतरम्पयांसि |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya dūtīriṣitā carāmi maha ichantī paṇayo nidhīnvaḥ atiṣkado bhiyasā tan na āvat tathā rasāyā atarampayāṃsi

translations.griffith: I come appointed messenger of Indra, seeking your ample stores of wealth, O Paṇis.  This hath preserved me from the fear of crossing: thus have I made my way o’er Rasā's waters.

verses.sanskrit: कीद्रंं इन्द्रः सरमे का दर्शीका यस्येदं दूतीरसरः पराकात आ च गछान मित्रमेना दधामाथागवां गोपतिर्नो भवाति |||
verses.transliteration: kīdṛṃṃ indraḥ sarame kā dṛśīkā yasyedaṃ dūtīrasaraḥ parākāt ā ca ghachān mitramenā dadhāmāthāghavāṃ ghopatirno bhavāti

translations.griffith: What is that Indra like, what is his aspect whose envoy, Saramā, from afar thou comest?  Let him approach, and we will show him friendship: he shall be made the herdsman of our cattle.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं तं वेद दभ्यं दभत स यस्येदं दूतीरसरं पराकात न तं गूहन्ति सरवतो गभीरा हतािन्द्रेण पणयः शयध्वे |||
verses.transliteration: nāhaṃ taṃ veda dabhyaṃ dabhat sa yasyedaṃ dūtīrasaraṃ parākāt na taṃ ghūhanti sravato ghabhīrā hatāindreṇa paṇayaḥ śayadhve

translations.griffith: I know him safe from harm: but he can punish who sent me hither from afar as envoy.  Him rivers flowing with deep waters bide not. Low will ye be, O Paṇis, slain by Indra.

verses.sanskrit: इमा गावः सरमे या ऐछः परि दिवो अन्तान सुभगेपतन्ती कस्त एना अव सर्जादयुध्व्युतास्माकमायुधासन्ति तिग्मा |||
verses.transliteration: imā ghāvaḥ sarame yā aichaḥ pari divo antān subhaghepatantī kasta enā ava sṛjādayudhvyutāsmākamāyudhāsanti tighmā

translations.griffith: These are the kine which, Saramā, thou seekest, flying, O Blest One, to the ends of heaven.  Who will loose these for thee without a battle? Yea, and sharp-pointed are our warlike weapons.

verses.sanskrit: असेन्या वः पणयो वचांस्यनिषव्यास्तन्वः सन्तु पापीः अध्र्ष्टो व एतवा अस्तु पन्था बर्हस्पतिर्व उभया नम्र्ळात |||
verses.transliteration: asenyā vaḥ paṇayo vacāṃsyaniṣavyāstanvaḥ santu pāpīḥ adhṛṣṭo va etavā astu panthā bṛhaspatirva ubhayā namṛḷāt

translations.griffith: Even if your wicked bodies, O ye Paṇis, were arrow-proof, your words are weak for wounding;  And were the path to you as yet unmastered, Bṛhaspati in neither case will spare you.

verses.sanskrit: अयं निधिः सरमे अद्रिबुध्नो गोभिरश्वेभिर्वसुभिर्न्य्र्ष्टः रक्षन्ति तं पणयो ये सुगोपा रेकु पदमलकमा जगन्थ |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ nidhiḥ sarame adribudhno ghobhiraśvebhirvasubhirnyṛṣṭaḥ rakṣanti taṃ paṇayo ye sughopā reku padamalakamā jaghantha

translations.griffith: Paved with the rock is this our treasure-chamber; filled full of precious things, of kine, and horses.  These Paṇis who are watchful keepers guard it. In vain hast thou approached this lonely station.

verses.sanskrit: एह गमन्न्र्षयः सोमशिता अयास्यो अङगिरसो नवग्वाः त एतमूर्वं वि भजन्त गोनामथैतद वचः पणयोवमन्नित |||
verses.transliteration: eha ghamannṛṣayaḥ somaśitā ayāsyo aṅghiraso navaghvāḥ ta etamūrvaṃ vi bhajanta ghonāmathaitad vacaḥ paṇayovamannit

translations.griffith: Ṛṣis will come inspirited with Soma, Aṅgirases unwearied, and Navagvas.  This stall of cattle will they part among them: then will the Paṇis wish these words unspoken.

verses.sanskrit: एवा च तवं सरम आजगन्थ परबाधिता सहसा दैव्येन सवसारं तवा कर्णवै मा पुनर्गा अप ते गवां सुभगेभजाम |||
verses.transliteration: evā ca tvaṃ sarama ājaghantha prabādhitā sahasā daivyena svasāraṃ tvā kṛṇavai mā punarghā apa te ghavāṃ subhaghebhajāma

translations.griffith: Even thus, O Saramā, hast thou come hither, forced by celestial might to make the journey.  Turn thee not back, for thou shalt be our sister: O Blest One, we will give thee of the cattle.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं वेद भरात्र्त्वं नो सवस्र्त्वमिन्द्रो विदुरङगिरसश्च घोराः गोकामा मे अछदयन यदायमपात इत पणयोवरीयः |||
verses.transliteration: nāhaṃ veda bhrātṛtvaṃ no svasṛtvamindro viduraṅghirasaśca ghorāḥ ghokāmā me achadayan yadāyamapāta ita paṇayovarīyaḥ

translations.griffith: Brotherhood, sisterhood, I know not either: the dread Aṅgirases and Indra know them.  They seemed to long for kine when I departed. Hence, into distance, be ye gone, O Paṇis.

verses.sanskrit: दूरमित पणयो वरीय उद गावो यन्तु मिनतीरतेन बर्हस्पतिर्या अविन्दन निगूळाः सोमो गरावाण रषयश्च विप्राः |||
verses.transliteration: dūramita paṇayo varīya ud ghāvo yantu minatīrtena bṛhaspatiryā avindan nighūḷāḥ somo ghrāvāṇa ṛṣayaśca viprāḥ

translations.griffith: Hence, far away, ye Paṇis! Let the cattle lowing come forth as holy Law commandeth,  Kine which Bṛhaspati, and Soma, Ṛṣis, sages, and pressing-stones have found when hidden.

verses.sanskrit: ते.अवदन परथमा बरह्मकिल्बिषे.अकूपारः सलिलोमातरिश्वा वीळुहरास्तप उग्रो मयोभूरापो देवीःप्रथमजा रतेन |||
verses.transliteration: te.avadan prathamā brahmakilbiṣe.akūpāraḥ salilomātariśvā vīḷuharāstapa ughro mayobhūrāpo devīḥprathamajā ṛtena

translations.griffith: THESE first, the boundless Sea, and Mātariśvan, fierce-glowing Fire, the Strong, the Bliss-bestower.  And heavenly Floods, first-born by holy Order, exclaimed against the outrage on a Brahman.

verses.sanskrit: सोमो राजा परथमो बरह्मजायां पुनः परायछदह्र्णीयमानः अन्वर्तिता वरुणो मित्र आसीदग्निर्होताहस्तग्र्ह्या निनाय |||
verses.transliteration: somo rājā prathamo brahmajāyāṃ punaḥ prāyachadahṛṇīyamānaḥ anvartitā varuṇo mitra āsīdaghnirhotāhastaghṛhyā nināya

translations.griffith: King Soma first of all, without reluctance, made restitution of the Brahman's consort.  Mitra and Varuṇa were the inviters: Agni as Hota; took her hand and led her.

verses.sanskrit: हस्तेनैव गराह्य आधिरस्या बरह्मजायेयमिति चेदवोचन न दूताय परह्ये तस्थ एषा तथा राष्ट्रं गुपितंक्षत्रियस्य |||
verses.transliteration: hastenaiva ghrāhya ādhirasyā brahmajāyeyamiti cedavocan na dūtāya prahye tastha eṣā tathā rāṣṭraṃ ghupitaṃkṣatriyasya

translations.griffith: The man, her pledge, must by her hand be taken when they have cried, She is a Brahman's consort.  She stayed not for a herald to conduct her: thus is the kingdom of a ruler guarded.

verses.sanskrit: देवा एतस्यामवदन्त पूर्वे सप्तर्षयस्तपसे ये निषेदुः भीमा जाया बराह्मणस्योपनीता दुर्धां दधातिपरमे वयोमन |||
verses.transliteration: devā etasyāmavadanta pūrve saptaṛṣayastapase ye niṣeduḥ bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasyopanītā durdhāṃ dadhātiparame vyoman

translations.griffith: Thus spake of her those Gods of old, Seven Ṛṣis who sate them down to their austere devotion:  Dire is a Brahman's wife led home by others: in the supremest heaven she plants confusion.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मचारी चरति वेविषद विषः स देवानां भवत्येकमङगम तेन जायामन्वविन्दद बर्हस्पतिः सोमेन नीतांजुह्वं न देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: brahmacārī carati veviṣad viṣaḥ sa devānāṃ bhavatyekamaṅgham tena jāyāmanvavindad bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītāṃjuhvaṃ na devāḥ

translations.griffith: The Brahmacari goes engaged in duty: he is a member of the Gods’ own body.  Through him Bṛhaspati obtained his consort, as the Gods gained the ladle brought by Soma.

verses.sanskrit: पुनर्वै देवा अददुः पुनर्मनुष्या उत राजानःसत्यं कर्ण्वाना बरह्मजायां पुनर्ददुः |||
verses.transliteration: punarvai devā adaduḥ punarmanuṣyā uta rājānaḥsatyaṃ kṛṇvānā brahmajāyāṃ punardaduḥ

translations.griffith: So then the Gods restored her, so men gave the woman back again.  The Kings who kept their promises restored the Brahman's wedded wife,

verses.sanskrit: पुनर्दाय बरह्मजायां कर्त्वी देवैर्निकिल्बिषम ऊर्जम्प्र्थिव्या भक्त्वायोरुगायमुपासते |||
verses.transliteration: punardāya brahmajāyāṃ kṛtvī devairnikilbiṣam ūrjampṛthivyā bhaktvāyorughāyamupāsate

translations.griffith: Having restored the Brahman's wife, and freed them, with Gods’ aid, from sin,  They shared the fulness of the earth, and won themselves extended sway.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धो अद्य मनुषो दुरोणे देवो देवान यजसि जातवेदः आ च वह मित्रमहश्चिकित्वान तवं दूतः कविरसिप्रचेताः |||
verses.transliteration: samiddho adya manuṣo duroṇe devo devān yajasi jātavedaḥ ā ca vaha mitramahaścikitvān tvaṃ dūtaḥ kavirasipracetāḥ

translations.griffith: THOU in the house of man this day enkindled worshippest Gods as God, O Jātavedas.  Observant, bright as Mitra, bring them hither: thou art a sapient and foreknowing envoy.

verses.sanskrit: तनूनपात पथ रतस्य यानान मध्वा समञ्जन सवदयासुजिह्व मन्मानि धीभिरुत यज्ञं रन्धन देवत्रा चक्र्णुह्यध्वरं नः |||
verses.transliteration: tanūnapāt patha ṛtasya yānān madhvā samañjan svadayāsujihva manmāni dhībhiruta yajñaṃ ṛndhan devatrā cakṛṇuhyadhvaraṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: Tanūnapāt, fair-tongued, with sweet meath balming the paths and waysof Order, make them pleasant.  Convey our sacrifice to heaven, exalting with holy thoughts ourhymns of praise and worship.

verses.sanskrit: आजुह्वान ईड्यो वन्द्यश्चा याह्यग्ने वसुभिः सजोषाः तवं देवानामसि यह्व होता स एनान यक्षीषितो यजीयान |||
verses.transliteration: ājuhvāna īḍyo vandyaścā yāhyaghne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ tvaṃ devānāmasi yahva hotā sa enān yakṣīṣito yajīyān

translations.griffith: Invoked, deserving prayer and adoration, O Agni, come accordant with the Vasus.  Thou art, O Youthful Lord, the Gods’ Invoker, so, best of Sacrificers, bring them quickly.

verses.sanskrit: पराचीनं बर्हिः परदिशा पर्थिव्या वस्तोरस्या वर्ज्यतेग्रे अह्नाम वयु परथते वितरं वरीयो देवेभ्यो अदितयेस्योनम |||
verses.transliteration: prācīnaṃ barhiḥ pradiśā pṛthivyā vastorasyā vṛjyateaghre ahnām vyu prathate vitaraṃ varīyo devebhyo aditayesyonam

translations.griffith: By rule the Sacred Grass is scattered eastward, a robe to clothe this earth when dawns are breaking.  Widely it spreads around and far-extended, fair for the Gods and bringing peace and freedom.

verses.sanskrit: वयचस्वतीरुर्विया वि शरयन्तां पतिभ्यो न जनयःशुम्भमानाः देवीर्द्वारो बर्हतीर्विश्वमिन्वा देवेभ्योभवत सुप्रायणाः |||
verses.transliteration: vyacasvatīrurviyā vi śrayantāṃ patibhyo na janayaḥśumbhamānāḥ devīrdvāro bṛhatīrviśvaminvā devebhyobhavata suprāyaṇāḥ

translations.griffith: Let the expansive Doors be widely opened, like wives who deck their beauty for their husbands.  Lofty, celestial, all-impelling Portals, admit the Gods and give them easy entrance.

verses.sanskrit: आ सुष्वयन्ती यजते उपाके उषासानक्ता सदतां नियोनौ दिव्ये योषणे बर्हती सुरुक्मे अधि शरियंशुक्रपिशं दधाने |||
verses.transliteration: ā suṣvayantī yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā sadatāṃ niyonau divye yoṣaṇe bṛhatī surukme adhi śriyaṃśukrapiśaṃ dadhāne

translations.griffith: Pouring sweet dews let holy Night and Morning, each close to each, he seated at their station,  Lofty, celestial Dames with gold to deck them. assuming all their fair and radiant beauty.

verses.sanskrit: दैव्या होतारा परथमा सुवाचा मिमाना यज्ञं मनुषोयजध्यै परचोदयन्ता विदथेषु कारू पराचीनं जयोतिःप्रदिशा दिशन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: daivyā hotārā prathamā suvācā mimānā yajñaṃ manuṣoyajadhyai pracodayantā vidatheṣu kārū prācīnaṃ jyotiḥpradiśā diśantā

translations.griffith: Come the two first celestial sweet-voiced Hotars, arranging sacrifice for man to worship  As singers who inspire us in assemblies, showing the eastward light with their direction.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो यज्ञं भारती तूयमेत्विळा मनुष्वदिहचेतयन्ती तिस्रो देवीर्बर्हिरेदं सयोनं सरस्वतीस्वपसः सदन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: ā no yajñaṃ bhāratī tūyametviḷā manuṣvadihacetayantī tisro devīrbarhiredaṃ syonaṃ sarasvatīsvapasaḥ sadantu

translations.griffith: Let Bhāratī come quickly to our worship, and Iḷā showing like a human being.  So let Sarasvatī and both her fellows, deft Goddesses, on this fair grass be seated.

verses.sanskrit: य इमे दयावाप्र्थिवी जनित्री रूपैरपिंशद भुवनानिविश्वा तमद्य होतरिषितो यजीयान देवं तवष्टारमिह यक्षि विद्वान |||
verses.transliteration: ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī janitrī rūpairapiṃśad bhuvanāniviśvā tamadya hotariṣito yajīyān devaṃ tvaṣṭāramiha yakṣi vidvān

translations.griffith: Hotar more skilled in sacrifice, bring hither with speed to-day God Tvaṣṭar, thou who knowest.  Even him who formed these two, the Earth and Heaven the Parents, with their forms, and every creature.

verses.sanskrit: उपावस्र्ज तमन्या समञ्जन देवानां पाथ रतुथाहवींषि वनस्पतिः शमिता देवो अग्निः सवदन्तु हव्यम्मधुना घर्तेन |||
verses.transliteration: upāvasṛja tmanyā samañjan devānāṃ pātha ṛtuthāhavīṃṣi vanaspatiḥ śamitā devo aghniḥ svadantu havyammadhunā ghṛtena

translations.griffith: Send to our offerings which thyself thou balmest the Companies of Gods in ordered season.  Agni, Vanaspati the Immolator sweeten our offered gift with meath and butter.

verses.sanskrit: सद्यो जातो वयमिमीत यज्ञमग्निर्देवानामभवत्पुरोगाः अस्य होतुः परदिश्य रतस्य वाचि सवाहाक्र्तंहविरदन्तु देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: sadyo jāto vyamimīta yajñamaghnirdevānāmabhavatpuroghāḥ asya hotuḥ pradiśy ṛtasya vāci svāhākṛtaṃhaviradantu devāḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, as soon as he was born, made ready the sacrifice, and was the Gods’ preceder.  May the Gods cat our offering consecrated according to this true Priest's voice and guidance.

verses.sanskrit: मनीषिणः पर भरध्वं मनीषां यथा-यथा मतयःसन्ति नर्णाम इन्द्रं सत्यैरेरयामा कर्तेभिः स हिवीरो गिर्वणस्युर्विदानः |||
verses.transliteration: manīṣiṇaḥ pra bharadhvaṃ manīṣāṃ yathā-yathā matayaḥsanti nṛṇām indraṃ satyairerayāmā kṛtebhiḥ sa hivīro ghirvaṇasyurvidānaḥ

translations.griffith: BRING forth your sacred song ye prudent singers, even as are the thoughts of human beings.  Let us draw Indra with true deeds anear us: he loves our songs, the Hero, and is potent.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य हि सदसो धीतिरद्यौत सं गार्ष्टेयो वर्षभोगोभिरानट उदतिष्ठत तविषेणा रवेण महान्ति चित्सं विव्याचा रजांसि |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya hi sadaso dhītiradyaut saṃ ghārṣṭeyo vṛṣabhoghobhirānaṭ udatiṣṭhat taviṣeṇā raveṇa mahānti citsaṃ vivyācā rajāṃsi

translations.griffith: The hymn shone brightly from the seat of worship: to the kine came the Bull, the Heifer's Offipring  With mighty bellowing hath he arisen, and hath pervaded even the spacious regions.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः किल शरुत्या अस्य वेद स हि जिष्णुः पथिक्र्त्सूर्याय आन मेनां कर्ण्वन्नच्युतो भुवद गोः पतिर्दिवः सनजा अप्रतीतः |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ kila śrutyā asya veda sa hi jiṣṇuḥ pathikṛtsūryāya ān menāṃ kṛṇvannacyuto bhuvad ghoḥ patirdivaḥ sanajā apratītaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra knows, verily, how to hear our singing, for he, victorious, made a path for Sūrya.  He made the Cow, and be became the Sovran of Heaven, primeval, matchless, and unshaken.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो मह्ना महतो अर्णवस्य वरतामिनादङगिरोभिर्ग्र्णानः पुरूणि चिन नि तताना रजांसि दाधार योधरुणं सत्यताता |||
verses.transliteration: indro mahnā mahato arṇavasya vratāminādaṅghirobhirghṛṇānaḥ purūṇi cin ni tatānā rajāṃsi dādhāra yodharuṇaṃ satyatātā

translations.griffith: Praised by Aṅgirases, Indra demolished with might the works of the great watery monster  Full many regions, too, hath he pervaded, and by his truth supported earth's foundation.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो दिवः परतिमानं पर्थिव्या विश्वा वेद सवना हन्तिशुष्णम महीं चिद दयामातनोत सूर्येण चास्कम्भ चित्कम्भनेन सकभीयान |||
verses.transliteration: indro divaḥ pratimānaṃ pṛthivyā viśvā veda savanā hantiśuṣṇam mahīṃ cid dyāmātanot sūryeṇa cāskambha citkambhanena skabhīyān

translations.griffith: The counterpart of heaven and earth is Indra: he knoweth all libations, slayeth Śuṣṇa.  The vast sky with the Sun hath he extended, and, best otpillars, stayed it with a pillar.

verses.sanskrit: वज्रेण हि वर्त्रहा वर्त्रमस्तरदेवस्य शूशुवानस्यमायाः वि धर्ष्णो अत्र धर्षता जघन्थाथाभवोमघवन बाह्वोजाः |||
verses.transliteration: vajreṇa hi vṛtrahā vṛtramastaradevasya śūśuvānasyamāyāḥ vi dhṛṣṇo atra dhṛṣatā jaghanthāthābhavomaghavan bāhvojāḥ

translations.griffith: The Vṛtra-slaver with his bolt felled Vṛtra: the magic of the godless, waxen mighty,  Here hast thou, Bold Assailant, boldly conquered. Yea, then thine arms, O Maghavan, were potent.

verses.sanskrit: सचन्त यदुषसः सूर्येण चित्रामस्य केतवो रामविन्दन आ यन नक्षत्रं दद्र्शे दिवो न पुनर्यतो नकिरद्धा नु वेद |||
verses.transliteration: sacanta yaduṣasaḥ sūryeṇa citrāmasya ketavo rāmavindan ā yan nakṣatraṃ dadṛśe divo na punaryato nakiraddhā nu veda

translations.griffith: When the Dawns come attendant upon Sūrya their rays discover wealth of divers colours.  The Star of heaven is seen as ’twere approaching: none knoweth aught of it as it departeth.

verses.sanskrit: दूरं किल परथमा जग्मुरासामिन्द्रस्य याः परसवेसस्रुरापः कव सविदग्रं कव बुध्न आसामापोमध्यं कव वो नूनमन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: dūraṃ kila prathamā jaghmurāsāmindrasya yāḥ prasavesasrurāpaḥ kva svidaghraṃ kva budhna āsāmāpomadhyaṃ kva vo nūnamantaḥ

translations.griffith: Far have they gone, the first of all these waters, the waters that flowed forth when Indra sent them.  Where is their spring, and where is their foundation? Where now, ye Waters, is your inmost centre?

verses.sanskrit: सर्जः सिन्धून्रहिना जग्रसानानादिदेताः पर विविज्रेजवेन मुमुक्षमाणा उत या मुमुच्रे.अधेदेता नरमन्ते नितिक्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: sṛjaḥ sindhūnrahinā jaghrasānānādidetāḥ pra vivijrejavena mumukṣamāṇā uta yā mumucre.adhedetā naramante nitiktāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou didst free rivers swallowed by the Dragon; and rapidly they set themselves in motion,  Those that were loosed and those that longed for freedom. Excited now to speed they run unresting.

verses.sanskrit: सध्रीचीः सिन्धुमुशतीरिवायन सनाज्जार आरितःपूर्भिदासाम अस्तमा ते पार्थिवा वसून्यस्मे जग्मुःसून्र्ता इन्द्र पूर्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: sadhrīcīḥ sindhumuśatīrivāyan sanājjāra āritaḥpūrbhidāsām astamā te pārthivā vasūnyasme jaghmuḥsūnṛtā indra pūrvīḥ

translations.griffith: Yearning together they have sped to Sindhu: the Fort-destroyer, praised, of old, hath loved them.  Indra, may thy terrestrial treasures reach us, and our full songs of joy approach thy dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र पिब परतिकामं सुतस्य परातःसावस्तव हिपूर्वपीतिः हर्षस्व हन्तवे शूर शत्रूनुक्थेभिष टेवीर्या पर बरवाम |||
verses.transliteration: indra piba pratikāmaṃ sutasya prātaḥsāvastava hipūrvapītiḥ harṣasva hantave śūra śatrūnukthebhiṣ ṭevīryā pra bravāma

translations.griffith: DRINK of the juice, O Indra, at thy plea. sure, for thy first draught is early morn's libation.  Rejoice, that thou mayst slay our foes, O Hero, and we with lauds will tell thy mighty exploits.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते रथो मनसो जवीयानेन्द्र तेन सोमपेयाय याहि तूयमा ते हरयः पर दरवन्तु येभिर्यासि वर्षभिर्मन्दमानः |||
verses.transliteration: yaste ratho manaso javīyānendra tena somapeyāya yāhi tūyamā te harayaḥ pra dravantu yebhiryāsi vṛṣabhirmandamānaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou hast a car more swift than thought, O Indra; thercon come hither, come to drink the Soma.  Let thy Bay Steeds, thy Stallions, hasten hither, with whom thou cornest nigh and art delighted.

verses.sanskrit: हरित्वता वर्चसा सूर्यस्य शरेष्ठै रूपैस्तन्वंस्पर्शयस्व अस्माभिरिन्द्र सखिभिर्हुवानः सध्रीचीनोमादयस्वा निषद्य |||
verses.transliteration: haritvatā varcasā sūryasya śreṣṭhai rūpaistanvaṃsparśayasva asmābhirindra sakhibhirhuvānaḥ sadhrīcīnomādayasvā niṣadya

translations.griffith: Deck out thy body with the fairest colours, with golden splendour of the Sun adorn it.  O Indra, turn thee hitherward invited by us thy friends; be seated and be joyful.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य तयत ते महिमानं मदेष्विमे मही रोदसीनाविविक्ताम तदोक आ हरिभिरिन्द्र युक्तैः परियेभिर्याहि परियमन्नमछ |||
verses.transliteration: yasya tyat te mahimānaṃ madeṣvime mahī rodasīnāviviktām tadoka ā haribhirindra yuktaiḥ priyebhiryāhi priyamannamacha

translations.griffith: O thou whose grandeur in thy festive transports not even these two great worlds have comprehended.  Come, Indra, with thy dear Bay Horses harnessed, come to our dwelling and the food thou lovest.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य शश्वत पपिवानिन्द्र शत्रूननानुक्र्त्या रण्याचकर्थ स ते पुरन्धिं तविषीमियर्ति स ते मदायसुत इन्द्र सोमः |||
verses.transliteration: yasya śaśvat papivānindra śatrūnanānukṛtyā raṇyācakartha sa te purandhiṃ taviṣīmiyarti sa te madāyasuta indra somaḥ

translations.griffith: Pressed for thy joyous banquet is the Soma, Soma whereof thou, Indra, ever drinking,  Hast waged unequalled battles with thy foemen, which prompts the mighty flow of thine abundance.

verses.sanskrit: इदं ते पात्रं सनवित्तमिन्द्र पिबा सोममेना शतक्रतो पूर्ण आहावो मदिरस्य मध्वो यं विश्व इदभिहर्यन्तिदेवाः |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ te pātraṃ sanavittamindra pibā somamenā śatakrato pūrṇa āhāvo madirasya madhvo yaṃ viśva idabhiharyantidevāḥ

translations.griffith: Found from of old is this thy cup, O Indra: Śatakratu, drink therefrom the Soma.  Filled is the beaker with the meath that gladdens, the beaker which all Deities delight in.

verses.sanskrit: वि हि तवामिन्द्र पुरुधा जनासो हितप्रयसो वर्षभह्वयन्ते अस्माकं ते मधुमत्तमानीमा भुवन सवना तेषुहर्य |||
verses.transliteration: vi hi tvāmindra purudhā janāso hitaprayaso vṛṣabhahvayante asmākaṃ te madhumattamānīmā bhuvan savanā teṣuharya

translations.griffith: From many a side with proffered entertainment the folk are calling thee, O Mighty Indra.  These our libations shall for thee be richest in sweet meath: dvink thereof and find them pleasant.

verses.sanskrit: पर त इन्द्र पूर्व्याणि पर नूनं वीर्या वोचं परथमाक्र्तानि सतीनमन्युरश्रथायो अद्रिं सुवेदनामक्र्णोर्ब्रह्मणे गाम |||
verses.transliteration: pra ta indra pūrvyāṇi pra nūnaṃ vīryā vocaṃ prathamākṛtāni satīnamanyuraśrathāyo adriṃ suvedanāmakṛṇorbrahmaṇe ghām

translations.griffith: I will declare thy deeds of old, O Indra, the mighty acts which thou hast first accomplished.  In genuine wrath thou loosenedst the mountain so that the Brahman easily found the cattle.

verses.sanskrit: नि षु सीद गणपते गणेषु तवामाहुर्विप्रतमंकवीनाम न रते तवत करियते किं चनारे महामर्कंमघवञ्चित्रमर्च |||
verses.transliteration: ni ṣu sīda ghaṇapate ghaṇeṣu tvāmāhurvipratamaṃkavīnām na ṛte tvat kriyate kiṃ canāre mahāmarkaṃmaghavañcitramarca

translations.griffith: Lord of the hosts, amid our bands be seated: they call thee greatest Sage among the sages.  Nothing is done, even far away, without thee: great, wondrous, Maghavan, is the hymn I sing thee.

verses.sanskrit: अभिख्या नो मघवन नाधमानान सखे बोधि वसुपतेसखीनाम रणं कर्धि रणक्र्त सत्यशुष्माभक्ते चिदाभजा राये अस्मान |||
verses.transliteration: abhikhyā no maghavan nādhamānān sakhe bodhi vasupatesakhīnām raṇaṃ kṛdhi raṇakṛt satyaśuṣmābhakte cidābhajā rāye asmān

translations.griffith: Aim of our eyes be thou, for we implore thee, O Maghavan, Friend of friends and Lord of treasures.  Fight, Warrior strong in truth, fight thou the battle: give us our share of undivided riches.

verses.sanskrit: तमस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी सचेतसा विश्वेभिर्देवैरनुशुष्ममावताम यदैत कर्ण्वानो महिमानमिन्द्रियम्पीत्वी सोमस्य करतुमानवर्धत |||
verses.transliteration: tamasya dyāvāpṛthivī sacetasā viśvebhirdevairanuśuṣmamāvatām yadait kṛṇvāno mahimānamindriyampītvī somasya kratumānavardhata

translations.griffith: THE Heavens and the Earth accordant with all Gods encouraged graciously that vigorous might of his.  When he came showing forth his majesty and power, he drank of Soma juice and waxed exceeding strong.

verses.sanskrit: तमस्य विष्णुर्महिमानमोजसांशुं दधन्वान मधुनोवि रप्शते देवेभिरिन्द्रो मघवा सयावभिर्व्र्त्रंजघन्वानभवद वरेण्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tamasya viṣṇurmahimānamojasāṃśuṃ dadhanvān madhunovi rapśate devebhirindro maghavā sayāvabhirvṛtraṃjaghanvānabhavad vareṇyaḥ

translations.griffith: This majesty of his Viṣṇu extols and lauds, making the stalCthat gives the meath flow forth with inight.  When Indra Maghavan with those who followed him had smitten Vṛtra he deserved the choice of Gods.

verses.sanskrit: वर्त्रेण यदहिना बिभ्रदायुधा समस्थिथा युधयेशंसमाविदे विश्वे ते अत्र मरुतः सह तमनावर्धन्नुग्र महिमानमिन्द्रियम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛtreṇa yadahinā bibhradāyudhā samasthithā yudhayeśaṃsamāvide viśve te atra marutaḥ saha tmanāvardhannughra mahimānamindriyam

translations.griffith: When, bearing warlike weapons, fain to win thee praise, thou mettest Vṛtra, yea, the Dragon, for the fight,  Then all the Maruts who were gathered with dice there extolled, O Mighty One, thy powerful majesty.

verses.sanskrit: जज्ञान एव वयबाधत सप्र्धः परापश्यद वीरो अभिपौंस्यं रणम अव्र्श्चदद्रिमव सस्यदः सर्जदस्तभ्नान नाकं सवपस्यया पर्थुम |||
verses.transliteration: jajñāna eva vyabādhata spṛdhaḥ prāpaśyad vīro abhipauṃsyaṃ raṇam avṛścadadrimava sasyadaḥ sṛjadastabhnān nākaṃ svapasyayā pṛthum

translations.griffith: Soon as he sprang to life he forced asun. der hosts: forward the Hero looked to manly deed and war.  He cleft the rock, he let concurrent streams flow forth, and with his skilful art stablished the heavens' wide vault.

verses.sanskrit: आदिन्द्रः सत्रा तविषीरपत्यत वरीयो दयावाप्र्थिवीबाधत अवाभरद धर्षितो वज्रमायसं शेवं मित्रायवरुणाय दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: ādindraḥ satrā taviṣīrapatyata varīyo dyāvāpṛthivīabādhata avābharad dhṛṣito vajramāyasaṃ śevaṃ mitrāyavaruṇāya dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Indra hath evermore possessed surpassing power: he forced, far from each other, heaven and earth apart.  He hurled impetuous down his iron thunderbolt, a joy to Varuṇa's and Mitra's worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्यात्र तविषीभ्यो विरप्शिन रघायतो अरंहयन्तमन्यवे वर्त्रं यदुग्रो वयव्र्श्चदोजसापो बिभ्रतन्तमसा परीव्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: indrasyātra taviṣībhyo virapśina ṛghāyato araṃhayantamanyave vṛtraṃ yadughro vyavṛścadojasāpo bibhratantamasā parīvṛtam

translations.griffith: Then to the mighty powers of Indra, to his wrath, his the fierce Stormer, loud of voice, they came with speed;  What time the Potent One rent Vṛtra with his strength, who held the waters back, whom darkness compassed round.

verses.sanskrit: या वीर्याणि परथमानि कर्त्वा महित्वेभिर्यतमानौसमीयतुः धवान्तं तमो.अव दध्वसे हत इन्द्रो मह्नापूर्वहूतावपत्यत |||
verses.transliteration: yā vīryāṇi prathamāni kartvā mahitvebhiryatamānausamīyatuḥ dhvāntaṃ tamo.ava dadhvase hata indro mahnāpūrvahūtāvapatyata

translations.griffith: Even in the first of those heroic acts which they who strove together came with might to execute,  Deep darkness fell upon the slain, and Indra won by victory the right of being first invoked.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवासो अध वर्ष्ण्यानि ते.अवर्धयन सोमवत्यावचस्यया रद्धं वर्त्रमहिमिन्द्रस्य हन्मनाग्निर्नजम्भैस्त्र्ष्वन्नमावयत |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devāso adha vṛṣṇyāni te.avardhayan somavatyāvacasyayā raddhaṃ vṛtramahimindrasya hanmanāghnirnajambhaistṛṣvannamāvayat

translations.griffith: Then all the Gods extolled, with eloquence inspired by draughts of Soma juice, thy deeds of manly might.  As Agni eats the dry food with his tcetlv, he ate Vṛtra, the Dragon, maimed by Indra's deadly dart.

verses.sanskrit: भूरि दक्षेभिर्वचनेभिरकवभिः सख्येभिः सख्यानिप्र वोचत इन्द्रो धुनिं च चुमुरिं च दम्भयञ्छ्रद्धामनस्या शर्णुते दभीतये |||
verses.transliteration: bhūri dakṣebhirvacanebhirkvabhiḥ sakhyebhiḥ sakhyānipra vocata indro dhuniṃ ca cumuriṃ ca dambhayañchraddhāmanasyā śṛṇute dabhītaye

translations.griffith: Proclaim his many friendships, met with friendship, made with singers, with the skilful and the eloquent.  Indra, when he subdues Dhuni and Cumuri, lists to Dabhīti for his faithful spirit's sake.

verses.sanskrit: तवं पुरूण्या भरा सवश्व्या येभिर्मंसै निवचनानिशंसन सुगेभिर्विश्वा दुरिता तरेम विदो षु ण उर्वियागाधमद्य |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ purūṇyā bharā svaśvyā yebhirmaṃsai nivacanāniśaṃsan sughebhirviśvā duritā tarema vido ṣu ṇa urviyāghādhamadya

translations.griffith: Give riches manifold with noble horses, to be remembered while my songs address thee.  May we by easy paths pass all our troubles: find us this day a ford wide and extensive.

verses.sanskrit: घर्मा समन्ता तरिव्र्तं वयापतुस्तयोर्जुष्टिम्मातरिश्वा जगाम दिवस पयो दिधिषाणा अवेषन विदुर्देवाः सहसामानमर्कम |||
verses.transliteration: gharmā samantā trivṛtaṃ vyāpatustayorjuṣṭimmātariśvā jaghāma divas payo didhiṣāṇā aveṣan vidurdevāḥ sahasāmānamarkam

translations.griffith: Two perfect springs of heat pervade the Threefold, and come for their delight is Mātariśvan.  Craving the milk of heaven the Gods are present: well do they know the praisesong and the Sāman.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो देष्ट्राय निरतीरुपासते दीर्घश्रुतो वि हिजानन्ति वह्नयः तासां नि चिक्युः कवयो निदानम्परेषु या गुह्येषु वरतेषु |||
verses.transliteration: tisro deṣṭrāya nirtīrupāsate dīrghaśruto vi hijānanti vahnayaḥ tāsāṃ ni cikyuḥ kavayo nidānampareṣu yā ghuhyeṣu vrateṣu

translations.griffith: The priests beard far away, as they are ordered, serve the three Nirrtis, for well they know them.  Sages have traced the cause that first produced them, dwelling in distant and mysterious chambers.

verses.sanskrit: चतुष्कपर्दा युवतिः सुपेशा घर्तप्रतीका वयुनानि वस्ते तस्यां सुपर्णा वर्षणा नि षेदतुर्यत्र देवा दधिरेभागधेयम |||
verses.transliteration: catuṣkapardā yuvatiḥ supeśā ghṛtapratīkā vayunāni vaste tasyāṃ suparṇā vṛṣaṇā ni ṣedaturyatra devā dadhirebhāghadheyam

translations.griffith: The Youthful One, well-shaped, with four locks braided, brightened with oil, puts on the ordinances.  Two Birds of mighty power are seated near her, there where the Deities receive their portion.

verses.sanskrit: एकः सुपर्णः स समुद्रमा विवेष स इदं विश्वम्भुवनं वि चष्टे तं पाकेन मनसापश्यमन्तितस्तम्माता रेळि स उ रेळि मातरम |||
verses.transliteration: ekaḥ suparṇaḥ sa samudramā viveṣa sa idaṃ viśvambhuvanaṃ vi caṣṭe taṃ pākena manasāpaśyamantitastammātā reḷi sa u reḷi mātaram

translations.griffith: One of these Birds hath passed into the sea of air: thence he looks round and views this universal world.  With simple heart I have beheld him from anear: his Mother kisses him and he returns her kiss.

verses.sanskrit: सुपर्णं विप्राः कवयो वचोभिरेकं सन्तं बहुधाकल्पयन्ति छन्दांसि च दधतो अध्वरेषु गरहान सोमस्यमिमते दवादश |||
verses.transliteration: suparṇaṃ viprāḥ kavayo vacobhirekaṃ santaṃ bahudhākalpayanti chandāṃsi ca dadhato adhvareṣu ghrahān somasyamimate dvādaśa

translations.griffith: Him with fair wings though only One in nature, wise singers shape, with songs, in many figures.  While they at sacrifices fix the metres, they measure out twelve chalices of Soma.

verses.sanskrit: षट्त्रिंशांश्च चतुरः कल्पयन्तश्छन्दांसि चदधत आद्वादशम यज्ञं विमाय कवयो मनीषर्क्सामाभ्यां पर रथं वर्तयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ṣaṭtriṃśāṃśca caturaḥ kalpayantaśchandāṃsi cadadhata ādvādaśam yajñaṃ vimāya kavayo manīṣaṛksāmābhyāṃ pra rathaṃ vartayanti

translations.griffith: While they arrange the four and six-and-thirty, and duly order, up to twelve, the measures,  Having disposed the sacrifice thoughtful sages send the Car forward with the Rc and Sāman.

verses.sanskrit: चतुर्दशान्ये महिमानो अस्य तं धीरा वाचा पर णयन्तिसप्त आप्नानं तीर्थं क इह पर वोचद येन पथाप्रपिबन्ते सुतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: caturdaśānye mahimāno asya taṃ dhīrā vācā pra ṇayantisapta āpnānaṃ tīrthaṃ ka iha pra vocad yena pathāprapibante sutasya

translations.griffith: The Chariot's majesties are fourteen others: seven sages lead it onward with their Voices.  Who will declare to us the ford Apnana, the path whereby they drink first draughts of Soma?

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रधा पञ्चदशान्युक्था यावद दयावाप्र्थिवीतावदित तत सहस्रधा महिमानः सहस्रं यावद्ब्रह्म विष्ठितं तावती वाक |||
verses.transliteration: sahasradhā pañcadaśānyukthā yāvad dyāvāpṛthivītāvadit tat sahasradhā mahimānaḥ sahasraṃ yāvadbrahma viṣṭhitaṃ tāvatī vāk

translations.griffith: The fifteen lauds are in a thousand places that is as vast as heaven and earth in measure.  A thousand spots contain the mighty thousand. Vāk spreadeth forth as far as Prayer extendeth.

verses.sanskrit: कश्छन्दसां योगमा वेद धीरः को धिष्ण्यां परतिवाचं पपाद कं रत्विजामष्टमं शूरमाहुर्हरीिन्द्रस्य नि चिकाय कः सवित |||
verses.transliteration: kaśchandasāṃ yoghamā veda dhīraḥ ko dhiṣṇyāṃ prativācaṃ papāda kaṃ ṛtvijāmaṣṭamaṃ śūramāhurharīindrasya ni cikāya kaḥ svit

translations.griffith: What sage hath learned the metres' application? Who hath gained Vāk, the spirit's aim and object?  Which ministering priest is called eighth Hero? Who then hath tracked the two Bay Steeds of Indra?

verses.sanskrit: भूम्या अन्तं पर्येके चरन्ति रथस्य धूर्षु युक्तासोस्थुः शरमस्य दायं वि भजन्त्येभ्यो यदा यमो भवतिहर्म्ये हितः |||
verses.transliteration: bhūmyā antaṃ paryeke caranti rathasya dhūrṣu yuktāsoasthuḥ śramasya dāyaṃ vi bhajantyebhyo yadā yamo bhavatiharmye hitaḥ

translations.griffith: Yoked to his chariot-pole there stood the Coursers: they only travel round earth's farthest limits.  These, when their driver in his home is settled, receive the allotted meed of their exertion.

verses.sanskrit: चित्र इच्छिशोस्तरुणस्य वक्षथो न यो मातरावप्येतिधातवे अनूधा यदि जीजनदधा च नु ववक्ष सद्योमहि दूत्यं चरन |||
verses.transliteration: citra icchiśostaruṇasya vakṣatho na yo mātarāvapyetidhātave anūdhā yadi jījanadadhā ca nu vavakṣa sadyomahi dūtyaṃ caran

translations.griffith: VERILY wondrous is the tender Youngling's growth who never draweth nigh to drink his Mothers' milk.  As soon as she who hath no udder bore him, he, faring on his great errand, suddenly grew strong.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्ह नाम धायि दन्नपस्तमः सं यो वना युवतेभस्मना दता अभिप्रमुरा जुह्वा सवध्वर इनो नप्रोथमानो यवसे वर्षा |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirha nāma dhāyi dannapastamaḥ saṃ yo vanā yuvatebhasmanā datā abhipramurā juhvā svadhvara ino naprothamāno yavase vṛṣā

translations.griffith: Then Agni was his name, most active to bestow, gathering up the trees with his consuming tooth;  Skilled in fair sacrifice, armed with destroying tongue, impetuous as a bull that snorteth in the mead.

verses.sanskrit: तं वो विं न दरुषदं देवमन्धस इन्दुं परोथन्तम्प्रवपन्तमर्णवम आसा वह्निं न शोचिषा विरप्शिनम्महिव्रतं न सरजन्तमध्वनः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vo viṃ na druṣadaṃ devamandhasa induṃ prothantampravapantamarṇavam āsā vahniṃ na śociṣā virapśinammahivrataṃ na sarajantamadhvanaḥ

translations.griffith: Praise him, yourGod who, bird-like, rests upon a tree, scattering drops of juice and pouring forth his flood,  Speaking aloud with flame as with his lips a priest, and broadening his paths like one of high command.

verses.sanskrit: वि यस्य ते जरयसानस्याजर धक्षोर्न वाताः परि सन्त्यच्युताः आ रण्वासो युयुधयो न सत्वनं तरितंनशन्त पर शिषन्त इष्टये |||
verses.transliteration: vi yasya te jrayasānasyājara dhakṣorna vātāḥ pari santyacyutāḥ ā raṇvāso yuyudhayo na satvanaṃ tritaṃnaśanta pra śiṣanta iṣṭaye

translations.griffith: Thou Everlasting, whom, far-striding fain to burn, the winds, uninterrupted, never overcome,  They have approached, as warriors eager for the fight, heroic Trita, guiding him to gain his wish.

verses.sanskrit: स इदग्निः कन्व्वतमः कण्वसखार्यः परस्यान्तरस्यतरुषः अग्निः पातु गर्णतो अग्निः सूरीनग्निर्ददातुतेषामवो नः |||
verses.transliteration: sa idaghniḥ kanvvatamaḥ kaṇvasakhāryaḥ parasyāntarasyataruṣaḥ aghniḥ pātu ghṛṇato aghniḥ sūrīnaghnirdadātuteṣāmavo naḥ

translations.griffith: This Agni is the best of Kaṇvas, Kaṇvas' Friend, Conqueror of the foe whether afar or near.  May Agni guard the singers, guard the princes well: may Agni grant to us our princes' gracious help.

verses.sanskrit: वाजिन्तमाय सह्यसे सुपित्र्य तर्षु चयवानो अनु जातवेदसे अनुद्रे चिद यो धर्षता वरं सते महिन्तमाय धन्वनेदविष्यते |||
verses.transliteration: vājintamāya sahyase supitrya tṛṣu cyavāno anu jātavedase anudre cid yo dhṛṣatā varaṃ sate mahintamāya dhanvanedaviṣyate

translations.griffith: Do thou, Supitrya, swiftly following, make thyself the lord of Jātavedas, mightiest of all,  Who surely gives a boon even in thirsty land most powerful, prepared to aid us in the wilds.

verses.sanskrit: एवाग्निर्मर्तैः सह सूरिभिर्वसु षटवे सहसः सूनरोन्र्भिः मित्रासो न ये सुधिता रतायवो दयावो न दयुम्नैरभि सन्ति मानुषान |||
verses.transliteration: evāghnirmartaiḥ saha sūribhirvasu ṣṭave sahasaḥ sūnaronṛbhiḥ mitrāso na ye sudhitā ṛtāyavo dyāvo na dyumnairabhi santi mānuṣān

translations.griffith: Thus noble Agni with princes and mortal men is lauded, excellent for conquering strength with chiefs,  Men who are well-disposed as friends and true to Law, even as the heavens in majesty surpass mankind.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्जो नपात सहसावन्निति तवोपस्तुतस्य वन्दते वर्षा वाक तवां सतोषाम तवया सुवीरा दराघीय आयुः परतरन्दधानाः |||
verses.transliteration: ūrjo napāt sahasāvanniti tvopastutasya vandate vṛṣā vāk tvāṃ stoṣāma tvayā suvīrā drāghīya āyuḥ pratarandadhānāḥ

translations.griffith: O Son of Strength, Victorious, with this title Upastuta's most potent voice reveres thee.  Blest with brave sons by thee we will extol thee, and lengthen out the days of our existence.

verses.sanskrit: इति तवाग्ने वर्ष्टिहव्यस्य पुत्रा उपस्तुतास रषयो.अवोचन तांश्च पाहि गर्णतश्च सूरीन वषड वषळ इत्यूर्ध्वासो अनक्षन नमो नम इत्यूर्ध्वासो अनक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: iti tvāghne vṛṣṭihavyasya putrā upastutāsa ṛṣayo.avocan tāṃśca pāhi ghṛṇataśca sūrīn vaṣaḍ vaṣaḷ ityūrdhvāso anakṣan namo nama ityūrdhvāso anakṣan

translations.griffith: Thus, Agni, have the sons of Vrstihavya, the Ṛṣis, the Upastutas invoked thee.  Protect them, guard the singers and the princes. With Vaṣaṭ! have they come, with hands uplifted, with their uplifted hands and cries of Glory!

verses.sanskrit: पिबा सोमं महत इन्द्रियाय पिबा वर्त्राय हन्तवेशविष्ठ पिब राये शवसे हूयमानः पिब मध्वस्त्र्पदिन्द्रा वर्षस्व |||
verses.transliteration: pibā somaṃ mahata indriyāya pibā vṛtrāya hantaveśaviṣṭha piba rāye śavase hūyamānaḥ piba madhvastṛpadindrā vṛṣasva

translations.griffith: DRINK Soma juice for mighty power and vigour, drink, Strongest One, that thou mayst smite down Vṛtra.  Drink thou, invoked, for strength, and riches: drink thou thy fill of meath and pour it down, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य पिब कषुमतः परस्थितस्येन्द्र सोमस्य वरमासुतश्य सवस्तिदा मनसा मादयस्वार्वाचीनो रेवतेसौभगाय |||
verses.transliteration: asya piba kṣumataḥ prasthitasyendra somasya varamāsutaśya svastidā manasā mādayasvārvācīno revatesaubhaghāya

translations.griffith: Drink of the foodful juice stirred into motion, drink what thou choosest of the flowing Soma.  Giver of weal, be joyful in thy spirit, and turn thee hitherward to bless and prosper.

verses.sanskrit: ममत्तु तवा दिव्यः सोम इन्द्र ममत्तु यः सूयतेपार्थिवेषु ममत्तु येन वरिवश्चकर्थ ममत्तु येननिरिणासि शत्रून |||
verses.transliteration: mamattu tvā divyaḥ soma indra mamattu yaḥ sūyatepārthiveṣu mamattu yena varivaścakartha mamattu yenaniriṇāsi śatrūn

translations.griffith: Let heavenly Soma gladden thee, O Indra, let that effused among mankind delight thee.  Rejoice in that whereby thou gavest freedom, and that whereby thou conquerest thy foemen.

verses.sanskrit: आ दविबर्हा अमिनो यात्विन्द्रो वर्षा हरिभ्यां परिषिक्तमन्धः गव्या सुतस्य परभ्र्तस्य मध्वः सत्रा खेदामरुशहा वर्षस्व |||
verses.transliteration: ā dvibarhā amino yātvindro vṛṣā haribhyāṃ pariṣiktamandhaḥ ghavyā sutasya prabhṛtasya madhvaḥ satrā khedāmaruśahā vṛṣasva

translations.griffith: Let Indra come, impetuous, doubly mighty, to the poured juice, the Bull, with two Bay Coursers.  With juices pressed in milk, with meath presented, glut evermore thy bolt, O Foe-destroyer.

verses.sanskrit: नि तिग्मानि भराशयन भराश्यान्यव सथिरा तनुहियातुजूनाम उग्राय ते सहो बलं ददामि परतीत्याशत्रून विगदेषु वर्श्च |||
verses.transliteration: ni tighmāni bhrāśayan bhrāśyānyava sthirā tanuhiyātujūnām ughrāya te saho balaṃ dadāmi pratītyāśatrūn vighadeṣu vṛśca

translations.griffith: Dash down, outffaming their sharp flaming weapons, the strong-holds of the men urged on by demons.  I give thee, Mighty One, great strength and conquest: go, meet thy foes and rend them in the battle.

verses.sanskrit: वयर्य इन्द्र तनुहि शरवांस्योज सथिरेव धन्वनोऽभिमातीः अस्मद्र्यग वाव्र्धानः सहोभिरनिभ्र्ष्टस्तन्वं वाव्र्धस्व |||
verses.transliteration: vyarya indra tanuhi śravāṃsyoja sthireva dhanvano'bhimātīḥ asmadryagh vāvṛdhānaḥ sahobhiranibhṛṣṭastanvaṃ vāvṛdhasva

translations.griffith: Extend afar the votary's fame and glory, as the firm archer's strength drives off the foeman.  Ranged on our side, grown strong in might that conquers, never defeated, still increase thy body.

verses.sanskrit: इदं हविर्मघवन तुभ्यं रातं परति सम्राळ अह्र्णानोग्र्भाय तुभ्यं सुतो मघवन तुभ्यं पक्वो.अद्धीन्द्र पिबच परस्थितस्य |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ havirmaghavan tubhyaṃ rātaṃ prati samrāḷ ahṛṇānoghṛbhāya tubhyaṃ suto maghavan tubhyaṃ pakvo.addhīndra pibaca prasthitasya

translations.griffith: To thee have we presented this oblation: accept it, Sovran Ruler, free from anger.  Juice, Maghavan, for thee is pressed and ripened: eat, Indra, drink of that which stirs to meet thee.

verses.sanskrit: अद्धीदिन्द्र परस्थितेमा हवींषि चनो दधिष्व पचतोतसोमम परयस्वन्तः परति हर्यामसि तवा सत्याः सन्तुयजमानस्य कामाः |||
verses.transliteration: addhīdindra prasthitemā havīṃṣi cano dadhiṣva pacatotasomam prayasvantaḥ prati haryāmasi tvā satyāḥ santuyajamānasya kāmāḥ

translations.griffith: Eat, Indra, these oblations which approach thee: be pleased with food made ready and with Soma.  With entertainment we receive thee friendly: effectual be the sacrificer's wishes.

verses.sanskrit: परेन्द्राग्निभ्यां सुवचस्यामियर्मि सिन्धाविव परेरयंनावमर्कैः अया इव परि चरन्ति देवा ये अस्मभ्यन्धनदा उद्भिदश्च |||
verses.transliteration: prendrāghnibhyāṃ suvacasyāmiyarmi sindhāviva prerayaṃnāvamarkaiḥ ayā iva pari caranti devā ye asmabhyandhanadā udbhidaśca

translations.griffith: I send sweet speech to Indra and to Agni: with hymns I speed it like a boat through waters.  Even thus, the Gods seem moving round about me, the fountains and bestowers of our riches.

verses.sanskrit: न वा उ देवाः कषुधमिद वधं ददुरुताशितमुपगछन्ति मर्त्यवः उतो रयिः पर्णतो नोप दस्यत्युताप्र्णन्मर्डितारं न विन्दते |||
verses.transliteration: na vā u devāḥ kṣudhamid vadhaṃ dadurutāśitamupaghachanti mṛtyavaḥ uto rayiḥ pṛṇato nopa dasyatyutāpṛṇanmarḍitāraṃ na vindate

translations.griffith: THE Gods have not ordained hunger to be our death: even to the well-fed man comes death in varied shape.  The riches of the liberal never waste away, while he who will not give finds none to comfort him.

verses.sanskrit: य आध्राय चकमानाय पित्वो.अन्नवान सन्रफितायोपजग्मुषे सथिरं मनः कर्णुते सेवते पुरोतोचित स मर्डितारं न विन्दते |||
verses.transliteration: ya ādhrāya cakamānāya pitvo.annavān sanraphitāyopajaghmuṣe sthiraṃ manaḥ kṛṇute sevate purotocit sa marḍitāraṃ na vindate

translations.griffith: The man with food in store who, when the needy comes in miserable case begging for bread to eat,  Hardens his heart against him-even when of old he did him service-finds not one to comfort him.

verses.sanskrit: स इद भोजो यो गर्हवे ददात्यन्नकामाय चरते कर्शाय अरमस्मै भवति यामहूता उतापरीषु कर्णुते सखायम |||
verses.transliteration: sa id bhojo yo ghṛhave dadātyannakāmāya carate kṛśāya aramasmai bhavati yāmahūtā utāparīṣu kṛṇute sakhāyam

translations.griffith: Bounteous is he who gives unto the beggar who comes to him in want of food and feeble.  Success attends him in the shout of battle. He makes a friend of him in future troubles.

verses.sanskrit: न स सखा यो न ददाति सख्ये सचाभुवे सचमानायपित्वः अपास्मात परेयान न तदोको अस्ति पर्णन्तमन्यमरणं चिदिचःेत |||
verses.transliteration: na sa sakhā yo na dadāti sakhye sacābhuve sacamānāyapitvaḥ apāsmāt preyān na tadoko asti pṛṇantamanyamaraṇaṃ cidicḥet

translations.griffith: No friend is he who to his friend and comrade who comes imploring food, will offer nothing.  Let him depart-no home is that to rest in-, and rather seek a stranger to support him.

verses.sanskrit: पर्णीयादिन नाधमानाय तव्यान दराघीयांसमनुपश्येत पन्थाम ओ हि वर्तन्ते रथ्येव चक्रान्यम-अन्यमुप तिष्ठन्त रायः |||
verses.transliteration: pṛṇīyādin nādhamānāya tavyān drāghīyāṃsamanupaśyeta panthām o hi vartante rathyeva cakrānyam-anyamupa tiṣṭhanta rāyaḥ

translations.griffith: Let the rich satisfy the poor implorer, and bend his eye upon a longer pathway.  Riches come now to one, now to another, and like the wheels of cars are ever rolling.

verses.sanskrit: मोघमन्नं विन्दते अप्रचेताः सत्यं बरवीमि वध इत सतस्य नार्यमणं पुष्यति नो सखायं केवलाघो भवतिकेवलादी |||
verses.transliteration: moghamannaṃ vindate apracetāḥ satyaṃ bravīmi vadha it satasya nāryamaṇaṃ puṣyati no sakhāyaṃ kevalāgho bhavatikevalādī

translations.griffith: The foolish man wins food with fruitless labour: that food -I speak the truth- shall be his ruin.  He feeds no trusty friend, no man to love him. All guilt is he who eats with no partaker.

verses.sanskrit: कर्षन्नित फाल आशितं कर्णोति यन्नध्वानमप वर्ङकतेचरित्रैः वदन बरह्मावदतो वनीयान पर्णन्नापिरप्र्णन्तमभि षयात |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṣannit phāla āśitaṃ kṛṇoti yannadhvānamapa vṛṅktecaritraiḥ vadan brahmāvadato vanīyān pṛṇannāpirapṛṇantamabhi ṣyāt

translations.griffith: The ploughshare ploughing makes the food that feeds us, and with its feet cuts through the path it follows.  Better the speaking than the silent Brahman: the liberal friend outyalues him who gives not.

verses.sanskrit: एकपाद भूयो दविपदो वि चक्रमे दविपात तरिपादमभ्येतिपश्चात चतुष्पादेति दविपदामभिस्वरे सम्पश्यन्पङकतीरुपतिष्ठमानः |||
verses.transliteration: ekapād bhūyo dvipado vi cakrame dvipāt tripādamabhyetipaścāt catuṣpādeti dvipadāmabhisvare sampaśyanpaṅktīrupatiṣṭhamānaḥ

translations.griffith: He with one foot hath far outrun the biped, and the two-footed catches the three-footed.  Four-footed creatures come when bipeds call them, and stand and look where five are met together.

verses.sanskrit: समौ चिद धस्तौ न समं विविष्टः सम्मातरा चिन नसमं दुहाते यमयोश्चिन न समा वीर्याणि जञाती चित्सन्तौ न समं पर्णीतः |||
verses.transliteration: samau cid dhastau na samaṃ viviṣṭaḥ sammātarā cin nasamaṃ duhāte yamayościn na samā vīryāṇi jñātī citsantau na samaṃ pṛṇītaḥ

translations.griffith: The hands are both alike: their labour differs. The yield of sister milch-kine is unequal.  Twins even diffier in their strength and vigour: two, even kinsmen, differ in their bounty.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने हंसि नयत्रिणं दीद्यन मर्त्येष्वा सवे कषयेशुचिव्रत |||
verses.transliteration: aghne haṃsi nyatriṇaṃ dīdyan martyeṣvā sve kṣayeśucivrata

translations.griffith: AGNI, refulgent among men thou slayest the devouring fiend,  Bright Ruler in thine own abode.

verses.sanskrit: उत तिष्ठसि सवाहुतो घर्तानि परति मोदसे यत तवा सरुचःसमस्थिरन |||
verses.transliteration: ut tiṣṭhasi svāhuto ghṛtāni prati modase yat tvā srucaḥsamasthiran

translations.griffith: Thou springest up when worshipped well the drops of butter are thy joy  When ladies are brought near to thee.

verses.sanskrit: स आहुतो वि रोचते.अग्निरीळेन्यो गिरा सरुचा परतीकमज्यते |||
verses.transliteration: sa āhuto vi rocate.aghnirīḷenyo ghirā srucā pratīkamajyate

translations.griffith: Honoured with gifts he shines afar, Agni adorable with song:  The dripping ladle balms his face.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तेनाग्निः समज्यते मधुप्रतीक आहुतः रोचमानोविभावसुः |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtenāghniḥ samajyate madhupratīka āhutaḥ rocamānovibhāvasuḥ

translations.griffith: Agni with honey in his mouth, honoured with gifts, is balmed with oil,  Refulgent in his wealth of light.

verses.sanskrit: जरमाणः समिध्यसे देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहन तं तवा हवन्तमर्त्याः |||
verses.transliteration: jaramāṇaḥ samidhyase devebhyo havyavāhana taṃ tvā havantamartyāḥ

translations.griffith: Praised by our hymns thou kindlest thee, Oblation-bearer, for the Gods  As such do mortals call on thee.

verses.sanskrit: तं मर्ता अमर्त्यं घर्तेनाग्निं सपर्यत अदाभ्यंग्र्हपतिम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ martā amartyaṃ ghṛtenāghniṃ saparyata adābhyaṃghṛhapatim

translations.griffith: To that Immortal Agni pay worship with oil, ye mortal men,—  Lord of the house, whom none deceives.

verses.sanskrit: अदाभ्येन शोचिषाग्ने रक्षस्त्वं दह गोपा रतस्यदीदिहि |||
verses.transliteration: adābhyena śociṣāghne rakṣastvaṃ daha ghopā ṛtasyadīdihi

translations.griffith: O Agni, burn the Rākṣasas with thine unconquerable flame  Shine guardian of Eternal Law.

verses.sanskrit: स तवमग्ने परतीकेन परत्योष यातुधान्यः उरुक्षयेषुदीद्यत |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvamaghne pratīkena pratyoṣa yātudhānyaḥ urukṣayeṣudīdyat

translations.griffith: So, Agni, with thy glowing face burn fierce against the female fiends,  Shining among Uruksayas.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा गीर्भिरुरुक्षया हव्यवाहं समीधिरे यजिष्ठं मानुषे जने |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā ghīrbhirurukṣayā havyavāhaṃ samīdhire yajiṣṭhaṃ mānuṣe jane

translations.griffith: Uruksayas have kindled thee, Oblation-bearer, thee, with hymns.  Best Worshipper among mankind.

verses.sanskrit: इति वा इति मे मनो गामश्वं सनुयामिति कुवित्सोमस्यापामिति |||
verses.transliteration: iti vā iti me mano ghāmaśvaṃ sanuyāmiti kuvitsomasyāpāmiti

translations.griffith: THIS, even this was my resolve, to win a cow, to win a steed:  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: पर वाता इव दोधत उन मा पीता अयंसत कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: pra vātā iva dodhata un mā pītā ayaṃsata kuvit ...

translations.griffith: Like violent gusts of wind the draughts that I have drunk have lifted me  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: उन मा पीता अयंसत रथमश्वा इवाशवः कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: un mā pītā ayaṃsata rathamaśvā ivāśavaḥ kuvit ...

translations.griffith: The draughts I drank have borne me up, as fleet-foot horses draw a car:  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: उप मा मतिरस्थित वाश्रा पुत्रमिव परियम कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: upa mā matirasthita vāśrā putramiva priyam kuvit ...

translations.griffith: The hymn hath reached me, like a cow who lows to meet her darling calf:  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: अहं तष्टेव वन्धुरं पर्यचामि हर्दा मतिम कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ taṣṭeva vandhuraṃ paryacāmi hṛdā matim kuvit ...

translations.griffith: As a wright bends a chariot-seat so round my heart I bend the hymn:  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: नहि मे अक्षिपच्चनाछान्त्सुः पञ्च कर्ष्टयः कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: nahi me akṣipaccanāchāntsuḥ pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ kuvit ...

translations.griffith: Not as a mote within the eye count the Five Tribes of men with me:  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: नहि मे रोदसी उभे अन्यं पक्षं चन परति कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: nahi me rodasī ubhe anyaṃ pakṣaṃ cana prati kuvit ...

translations.griffith: The heavens and earth themselves have not grown equal to one half of me  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: अभि दयां महिना भुवमभीमां पर्थिवीं महीम कुवित... |||
verses.transliteration: abhi dyāṃ mahinā bhuvamabhīmāṃ pṛthivīṃ mahīm kuvit...

translations.griffith: I in my grandeur have surpassed the heavens and all this spacious earth  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: हन्ताहं पर्थिवीमिमां नि दधानीह वेह वा कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: hantāhaṃ pṛthivīmimāṃ ni dadhānīha veha vā kuvit ...

translations.griffith: Aha! this spacious earth will I deposit either here or there  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: ओषमित पर्थिवीमहं जङघनानीह वेह वा कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: oṣamit pṛthivīmahaṃ jaṅghanānīha veha vā kuvit ...

translations.griffith: In one short moment will I smite the earth in fury here or there:  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: दिवि मे अन्यः पक्षो.अधो अन्यमचीक्र्षम कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: divi me anyaḥ pakṣo.adho anyamacīkṛṣam kuvit ...

translations.griffith: One of my flanks is in the sky; I let the other trail below:  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: अहमस्मि महामहो.अभिनभ्यमुदीषितः कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: ahamasmi mahāmaho.abhinabhyamudīṣitaḥ kuvit ...

translations.griffith: 1, greatest of the Mighty Ones, am lifted to the firmament:  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: गर्हो याम्यरंक्र्तो देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहनः कुवित ... |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛho yāmyaraṃkṛto devebhyo havyavāhanaḥ kuvit ...

translations.griffith: I seek the worshipper's abode; oblation-bearer to the Gods:  Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit: तदिदास भुवनेषु जयेष्ठं यतो जज्ञ उग्रस्त्वेषन्र्म्णः सद्यो जज्ञानो नि रिणाति शत्रूननु यंविश्वे मदन्त्यूमाः |||
verses.transliteration: tadidāsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭhaṃ yato jajña ughrastveṣanṛmṇaḥ sadyo jajñāno ni riṇāti śatrūnanu yaṃviśve madantyūmāḥ

translations.griffith: IN all the worlds That was the Best and Highest whence sprang the Mighty Gods, of splendid valour.  As soon as born he overcomes his foemen, be in whom all who lend him aid are joyful.

verses.sanskrit: वाव्र्धानः शवसा भूर्योजाः शत्रुर्दासाय भियसन्दधाति अव्यनच्च वयनच्च सस्नि सं ते नवन्त परभ्र्तामदेषु |||
verses.transliteration: vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūryojāḥ śatrurdāsāya bhiyasandadhāti avyanacca vyanacca sasni saṃ te navanta prabhṛtāmadeṣu

translations.griffith: Grown mighty in his strength, with ample vigour, he as a foe strikes fear into the Dāsa,  Eager to win the breathing and the breathless. All sang thy praise at banquet and oblation.

verses.sanskrit: तवे करतुमपि वर्ञ्जन्ति विश्वे दविर्यदेते तरिर्भवन्त्यूमाः सवादोः सवादीयः सवादुना सर्जा समदः सुमधु मधुनाभि योधीः |||
verses.transliteration: tve kratumapi vṛñjanti viśve dviryadete trirbhavantyūmāḥ svādoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛjā samadaḥ sumadhu madhunābhi yodhīḥ

translations.griffith: All concentrate on thee their mental vigour, what time these, twice or thrice, are thine assistants.  Blend what is sweeter than the sweet with sweetness: win. quickly with our meath that meath in battle.

verses.sanskrit: इति चिद धि तवा धना जयन्तं मदे-मदे अनुमदन्ति विप्राः ओजीयो धर्ष्णो सथिरमा तनुष्व मा तवा दभन्यातुधाना दुरेवाः |||
verses.transliteration: iti cid dhi tvā dhanā jayantaṃ made-made anumadanti viprāḥ ojīyo dhṛṣṇo sthiramā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhanyātudhānā durevāḥ

translations.griffith: Therefore in thee too, thou who winnest riches, at every banquet are the sages joyful.  With mightier power, Bold God, extend thy firmness: let not malignant Yātudhānas harm thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवया वयं शाशद्महे रणेषु परपश्यन्तो युधेन्यानिभूरि चोदयामि त आयुधा वचोभिः सं ते शिशामिब्रह्मणा वयांसि |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyanto yudhenyānibhūri codayāmi ta āyudhā vacobhiḥ saṃ te śiśāmibrahmaṇā vayāṃsi

translations.griffith: Proudly we put our trust in thee in battles, when we behold great wealth the prize of combat.  I with my words impel thy weapons onward, and sharpen with my prayer thy vital vigour.

verses.sanskrit: सतुषेय्यं पुरुवर्पसं रभ्वमिनतममाप्त्यमाप्त्यानाम आ दर्षते शवसा सप्त दानून पर साक्षते परतिमानानिभूरि |||
verses.transliteration: stuṣeyyaṃ puruvarpasaṃ ṛbhvaminatamamāptyamāptyānām ā darṣate śavasā sapta dānūn pra sākṣate pratimānānibhūri

translations.griffith: Worthy of praises, many-shaped, most skilful, most energetic, Āptya of the Aptyas:  He with his might destroys the seven Danus, subduing many who were deemed his equals.

verses.sanskrit: नि तद दधिषे.अवरं परं च यस्मिन्नाविथावसा दुरोणे आ मातरा सथापयसे जिगत्नू अत इनोषि कर्वरा पुरूणि |||
verses.transliteration: ni tad dadhiṣe.avaraṃ paraṃ ca yasminnāvithāvasā duroṇe ā mātarā sthāpayase jighatnū ata inoṣi karvarā purūṇi

translations.griffith: Thou in that house which thy protection guardeth bestowest wealth, the higher and the lower.  Thou stablishest the two much-wandering Mothers, and bringest many deeds to their completion.

verses.sanskrit: इमा बरह्म बर्हद्दिवो विवक्तीन्द्राय शूषमग्रियःस्वर्षाः महो गोत्रस्य कषयति सवराजो दुरश्च विश्वाव्र्णोदप सवाः |||
verses.transliteration: imā brahma bṛhaddivo vivaktīndrāya śūṣamaghriyaḥsvarṣāḥ maho ghotrasya kṣayati svarājo duraśca viśvāavṛṇodapa svāḥ

translations.griffith: Brhaddiva, the foremost of light-winners, repeats these holy prayers, this strength of Indra.  He rules the great self-luminous fold of cattle, and all the doors of light hath he thrown open.

verses.sanskrit: एवा महान बर्हद्दिवो अथर्वावोचत सवां तन्वमिन्द्रमेव सवसारो मातरिभ्वरीररिप्रा हिन्वन्ति च शवसावर्धयन्ति च |||
verses.transliteration: evā mahān bṛhaddivo atharvāvocat svāṃ tanvamindrameva svasāro mātaribhvarīrariprā hinvanti ca śavasāvardhayanti ca

translations.griffith: Thus hath Brhaddiva, the great Atharvan, spoken to Indra as himself in person.  The spotless Sisters, they who are his Mothers, with power exalt him and impel him onward.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यगर्भः समवर्तताग्रे भूतस्य जातः पतिरेकासीत स दाधार पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमां कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyagharbhaḥ samavartatāghre bhūtasya jātaḥ patirekaāsīt sa dādhāra pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāṃ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema

translations.griffith: IN the beginning rose Hiranyagarbha, born Only Lord of all created beings.  He fixed and holdeth up this earth and heaven. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit: य आत्मदा बलदा यस्य विश्व उपासते परशिषं यस्यदेवाः यस्य छायाम्र्तं यस्य मर्त्युः कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम |||
verses.transliteration: ya ātmadā baladā yasya viśva upāsate praśiṣaṃ yasyadevāḥ yasya chāyāmṛtaṃ yasya mṛtyuḥ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema

translations.griffith: Giver of vital breath, of power and vigour, he whose commandments all the Gods acknowledge -.  The Lord of death, whose shade is life immortal. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit: यः पराणतो निमिषतो महित्वैक इद राजा जगतो बभूव य ईशे अस्य दविपदश्चतुष्पदः कस्मै देवाय हविषाविधेम |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ prāṇato nimiṣato mahitvaika id rājā jaghato babhūva ya īśe asya dvipadaścatuṣpadaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣāvidhema

translations.griffith: Who by his grandeur hath become Sole Ruler of all the moving world that breathes and slumbers;  He who is Loord of men and Lord of cattle. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit: यस्येमे हिमवन्तो महित्वा यस्य समुद्रं रसया सहाहुः यस्येमाः परदिशो यस्य बाहू कस्मै देवाय हविषाविधेम |||
verses.transliteration: yasyeme himavanto mahitvā yasya samudraṃ rasayā sahāhuḥ yasyemāḥ pradiśo yasya bāhū kasmai devāya haviṣāvidhema

translations.griffith: His, through his might, are these snow-covered mountains, and men call sea and Rasā his possession:  His arms are these, his are these heavenly regions. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit: येन दयौरुग्रा पर्थिवी च दर्ळ्हा येन सव सतभितं येननाकः यो अन्तरिक्षे रजसो विमानः कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम |||
verses.transliteration: yena dyaurughrā pṛthivī ca dṛḷhā yena sva stabhitaṃ yenanākaḥ yo antarikṣe rajaso vimānaḥ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema

translations.griffith: By him the heavens are strong and earth is stedfast, by him light's realm and sky-vault are supported:  By him the regions in mid-air were measured. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit: यं करन्दसी अवसा तस्तभाने अभ्यैक्षेतां मनसारेजमाने यत्राधि सूर उदितो विभाति कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ krandasī avasā tastabhāne abhyaikṣetāṃ manasārejamāne yatrādhi sūra udito vibhāti kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema

translations.griffith: To him, supported by his help, two armies embattled look while trembling in their spirit,  When over them the risen Sun is shining. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit: आपो ह यद बर्हतीर्विश्वमायन गर्भं दधानाजनयन्तीरग्निम ततो देवानां समवर्ततासुरेकःकस्मै देवाय हविषा विधेम |||
verses.transliteration: āpo ha yad bṛhatīrviśvamāyan gharbhaṃ dadhānājanayantīraghnim tato devānāṃ samavartatāsurekaḥkasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema

translations.griffith: What time the mighty waters came, containing the universal germ, producing Agni,  Thence sprang the Gods’ one spirit into being. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit: यश्चिदापो महिना पर्यपश्यद दक्षं दधानाजनयन्तीर्यज्ञम यो देवेष्वधि देव एक आसीत कस्मैदेवाय हविषा विधेम |||
verses.transliteration: yaścidāpo mahinā paryapaśyad dakṣaṃ dadhānājanayantīryajñam yo deveṣvadhi deva eka āsīt kasmaidevāya haviṣā vidhema

translations.griffith: He in his might surveyed the floods containing productive force and generating Worship.  He is the God of gods, and none beside him. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit: मा नो हिंसीज्जनिता यः पर्थिव्या यो वा दिवंसत्यधर्मा जजान यश्चापश्चन्द्रा बर्हतीर्जजानकस्मै देवाय हविषा विधेम |||
verses.transliteration: mā no hiṃsījjanitā yaḥ pṛthivyā yo vā divaṃsatyadharmā jajāna yaścāpaścandrā bṛhatīrjajānakasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema

translations.griffith: Neer may he harm us who is earth's Begetter, nor he whose laws are sure, the heavens' Creator,  He who brought forth the great and lucid waters. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit: परजापते न तवदेतान्यन्यो विश्वा जातानि परि ताबभूव यत्कामास्ते जुहुमस्तन नो अस्तु वयं सयाम पतयोरयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: prajāpate na tvadetānyanyo viśvā jātāni pari tābabhūva yatkāmāste juhumastan no astu vayaṃ syāma patayorayīṇām

translations.griffith: Prajāpati! thou only comprehendest all these created things, and none beside thee.  Grant us our hearts' desire when we invoke thee: may we have store of riches in possession.

verses.sanskrit: वसुं न चित्रमहसं गर्णीषे वामं शेवमतिथिमद्विषेण्यम स रासते शुरुधो विश्वधायसो.अग्निर्होताग्र्हपतिः सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: vasuṃ na citramahasaṃ ghṛṇīṣe vāmaṃ śevamatithimadviṣeṇyam sa rāsate śurudho viśvadhāyaso.aghnirhotāghṛhapatiḥ suvīryam

translations.griffith: I PRAISE the God of wondrous might like Indra, the lovely pleasant Guest whom all must welcome.  May Agni, Priest and Master of the household, give hero strength and all-sustaining riches.

verses.sanskrit: जुषाणो अग्ने परति हर्य मे वचो विश्वानि विद्वान वयुनानिसुक्रतो घर्तनिर्णिग बरह्मणे गातुमेरय तव देवाजनयन्ननु वरतम |||
verses.transliteration: juṣāṇo aghne prati harya me vaco viśvāni vidvān vayunānisukrato ghṛtanirṇigh brahmaṇe ghātumeraya tava devāajanayannanu vratam

translations.griffith: O Agni, graciously accept this song of mine, thou passing-wise who knowest every ordinance.  Enwrapped in holy oil further the course of prayer: the Gods bestow according to thy holy law.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त धामानि परियन्नमर्त्यो दाशद दाशुषे सुक्र्तेमामहस्व सुवीरेण रयिणाग्ने सवाभुवा यस्त आनट्समिधा तं जुषस्व |||
verses.transliteration: sapta dhāmāni pariyannamartyo dāśad dāśuṣe sukṛtemāmahasva suvīreṇa rayiṇāghne svābhuvā yasta ānaṭsamidhā taṃ juṣasva

translations.griffith: Immortal, wandering round the seven stations, give, a liberal Giver, to the pious worshipper,  Wealth, Agni, with brave sons and ready for his use: welcome the man who comes with fuel unto thee.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञस्य केतुं परथमं पुरोहितं हविष्मन्त ईळते सप्तवाजिनम शर्ण्वन्तमग्निं घर्तप्र्ष्ठमुक्षणम्प्र्णन्तं देवं पर्णते सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yajñasya ketuṃ prathamaṃ purohitaṃ haviṣmanta īḷate saptavājinam śṛṇvantamaghniṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭhamukṣaṇampṛṇantaṃ devaṃ pṛṇate suvīryam

translations.griffith: The seven who bring oblations worship thee, the Strong, the first, the Great Chief Priest, Ensign of sacrifice,  The oil-anointed Bull, Agni who hears, who sends as God full hero strength to him who freely gives.

verses.sanskrit: टवं दूतः परथमो वरेण्यः स हूयमानो अम्र्तायमत्स्व तवां मर्जयन मरुतो दाशुषो गर्हे तवां सतोमेभिर्भ्र्गवो वि रुरुचुः |||
verses.transliteration: ṭvaṃ dūtaḥ prathamo vareṇyaḥ sa hūyamāno amṛtāyamatsva tvāṃ marjayan maruto dāśuṣo ghṛhe tvāṃ stomebhirbhṛghavo vi rurucuḥ

translations.griffith: First messenger art thou, meet for election: drink thou thy fill invited to the Anirta,  The Maruts in the votary's house adorned thee; with lauds the Bhṛgus gave thee light and glory.

verses.sanskrit: इषं दुहन सुदुघां विश्वधायसं यज्ञप्रियेयजमानाय सुक्रतो अग्ने घर्तस्नुस्त्रिरतानि दीद्यद्वर्तिर्यज्ञं परियन सुक्रतूयसे |||
verses.transliteration: iṣaṃ duhan sudughāṃ viśvadhāyasaṃ yajñapriyeyajamānāya sukrato aghne ghṛtasnustrirtāni dīdyadvartiryajñaṃ pariyan sukratūyase

translations.griffith: Milking the teeming Cow for all-sustaining food. O Wise One, for the worship-loving worshipper,  Thou, Agni, dropping oil, thrice lighting works of Law, showest thy wisdom circling home and sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तवामिदस्या उषसो वयुष्टिषु दूतं कर्ण्वाना अयजन्तमानुषाः तवां देवा महयाय्याय वाव्र्धुराज्यमग्नेनिम्र्जन्तो अध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmidasyā uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu dūtaṃ kṛṇvānā ayajantamānuṣāḥ tvāṃ devā mahayāyyāya vāvṛdhurājyamaghnenimṛjanto adhvare

translations.griffith: They who at flushing of this dawn appointed thee their messenger, these men have paid thee reverence.  Gods strengthened thee for work that must be glorified, Agni, while they made butter pure for sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: नि तवा वसिष्ठा अह्वन्त वाजिनं गर्णन्तो अग्ने विदथेषुवेधसः रायस पोषं यजमानेषु धारय यूयं पातस्वस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: ni tvā vasiṣṭhā ahvanta vājinaṃ ghṛṇanto aghne vidatheṣuvedhasaḥ rāyas poṣaṃ yajamāneṣu dhāraya yūyaṃ pātasvastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: Arrangers in our synods, Agni, while they sang Vasisistha s sons have called thee down, the Potent One.  Maintain the growth of wealth with men who sacrifice. Ye Gods, preserve us with your blessings evermore.

verses.sanskrit: अयं वेनश्चोदयत पर्श्निगर्भा जयोतिर्जरायू रजसोविमाने इममपां संगमे सूर्यस्य शिशुं न विप्रामतिभी रिहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ venaścodayat pṛśnigharbhā jyotirjarāyū rajasovimāne imamapāṃ saṃghame sūryasya śiśuṃ na viprāmatibhī rihanti

translations.griffith: SEE, Vena, born in light, hath driven hither, on chariot of the air, the Calves of Pṛśni.  Singers with hymns caress him as an infant there where the waters and the sunlight mingle.

verses.sanskrit: समुद्रादूर्मिमुदियर्ति वेनो नभोजाः पर्ष्ठंहर्यतस्य दर्शि रतस्य सानावधि विष्टपि भराट्समानं योनिमभ्यनूषत वराः |||
verses.transliteration: samudrādūrmimudiyarti veno nabhojāḥ pṛṣṭhaṃharyatasya darśi ṛtasya sānāvadhi viṣṭapi bhrāṭsamānaṃ yonimabhyanūṣata vrāḥ

translations.griffith: Vena draws up his wave from out the ocean. mist-born, the fair one's back is made apparent,  Brightly he shone aloft on Order's summit: the hosts sang glory to their common birthplace.

verses.sanskrit: समानं पूर्वीरभि वावशानास्तिष्ठन वत्सस्यमातरः सनीळाः रतस्य सानावधि चक्रमाणारिहन्ति मध्वो अम्र्तस्य वाणीः |||
verses.transliteration: samānaṃ pūrvīrabhi vāvaśānāstiṣṭhan vatsasyamātaraḥ sanīḷāḥ ṛtasya sānāvadhi cakramāṇārihanti madhvo amṛtasya vāṇīḥ

translations.griffith: Full many, lowing to their joint-possession, dwelling together stood the Darling's Mothers.  Ascending to the lofty height of Order, the bands of singers 'sip the sweets of Amṛta.

verses.sanskrit: जानन्तो रूपमक्र्पन्त विप्रा मर्गस्य घोषं महिषस्य हिग्मन रतेन यन्तो अधि सिन्धुमस्थुर्विदद गन्धर्वोम्र्तानि नाम |||
verses.transliteration: jānanto rūpamakṛpanta viprā mṛghasya ghoṣaṃ mahiṣasya highman ṛtena yanto adhi sindhumasthurvidad ghandharvoamṛtāni nāma

translations.griffith: Knowing his form, the sages yearned to meet him: they have come nigh to hear the wild Bull's bellow.  Performing sacrifice they reached the river: for the Gandharva found the immortal waters.

verses.sanskrit: अप्सरा जारमुपसिष्मियाणा योषा बिभर्ति परमे वयोमन चरत परियस्य योनिषु परियः सन सीदत पक्षे हिरण्ययेस वेनः |||
verses.transliteration: apsarā jāramupasiṣmiyāṇā yoṣā bibharti parame vyoman carat priyasya yoniṣu priyaḥ san sīdat pakṣe hiraṇyayesa venaḥ

translations.griffith: The Apsaras, the Lady, sweetly smiling, supports her Lover in sublimest heaven.  In his Friend's dwelling as a Friend he wanders: he, Vena, rests him on his golden pinion.

verses.sanskrit: नाके सुपर्णमुप यत पतन्तं हर्दा वेनन्तो अभ्यचक्षतत्वा हिरण्यपक्षं वरुणस्य दूतं यमस्य योनौशकुनं भुरण्युम |||
verses.transliteration: nāke suparṇamupa yat patantaṃ hṛdā venanto abhyacakṣatatvā hiraṇyapakṣaṃ varuṇasya dūtaṃ yamasya yonauśakunaṃ bhuraṇyum

translations.griffith: They gaze on thee with longing in their spirit, as on a strong-winged bird that mounteth sky-ward;  On thee with wings of gold, Varuṇa's envoy, the Bird that hasteneth to the home of Yama.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो गन्धर्वो अधि नाके अस्थात परत्यं चित्रा बिभ्रदस्यायुधानि वसानो अत्कं सुरभिं दर्शे कं सवर्णनाम जनत परियाणि |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvo ghandharvo adhi nāke asthāt pratyaṃ citrā bibhradasyāyudhāni vasāno atkaṃ surabhiṃ dṛśe kaṃ svarṇanāma janata priyāṇi

translations.griffith: Erect, to heaven hath the Gandharva mounted, pointing at us his many-coloured weapons;  Clad in sweet raiment beautiful to look on, for he, as light, produceth forms that please us.

verses.sanskrit: दरप्सः समुद्रमभि यज्जिगाति पश्यन गर्ध्रस्य चक्षसाविधर्मन भानुः शुक्रेण शोचिषा चकानस्त्र्तीये चक्रेरजसि परियाणि |||
verses.transliteration: drapsaḥ samudramabhi yajjighāti paśyan ghṛdhrasya cakṣasāvidharman bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā cakānastṛtīye cakrerajasi priyāṇi
