translations.griffith: When as a spark he cometh near the ocean, still looking with a vulture's eye to heaven,  His lustre, joying in its own bright splendour, maketh dear glories in the lowest region.

verses.sanskrit: इमं नो अग्न उप यज्ञमेहि पञ्चयामं तरिव्र्तंसप्ततन्तुम असो हव्यवाळ उत नः पुरोगा जयोगेवदीर्घं तम आशयिष्ठाः |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ no aghna upa yajñamehi pañcayāmaṃ trivṛtaṃsaptatantum aso havyavāḷ uta naḥ puroghā jyoghevadīrghaṃ tama āśayiṣṭhāḥ

translations.griffith: COME to this sacrifice of ours, O Agni, threefold, with seven threads and five divisions.  Be our oblation-bearer and preceder: thou hast lain long enough in during darkness.

verses.sanskrit: अदेवाद देवः परचता गुहा यन परपश्यमानो अम्र्तत्वमेमि शिवं यत सन्तमशिवो जहामि सवात सख्यादरणींनाभिमेमि |||
verses.transliteration: adevād devaḥ pracatā ghuhā yan prapaśyamāno amṛtatvamemi śivaṃ yat santamaśivo jahāmi svāt sakhyādaraṇīṃnābhimemi

translations.griffith: I come a God foreseeing from the godless to immortality by secret pathways,  While I, ungracious one, desert the gracious, leave mine own friends and seek the kin of strangers.

verses.sanskrit: पश्यन्नन्यस्या अतिथिं वयाया रतस्य धाम वि मिमेपुरूणि शंसामि पित्रे असुराय शेवमयज्ञियाद्यज्ञियं भागमेमि |||
verses.transliteration: paśyannanyasyā atithiṃ vayāyā ṛtasya dhāma vi mimepurūṇi śaṃsāmi pitre asurāya śevamayajñiyādyajñiyaṃ bhāghamemi

translations.griffith: 1, looking to the guest of other lineage, have founded many a rule of Law and Order.  I bid farewell to the Great God, the Father, and, for neglect, obtain my share of worship.

verses.sanskrit: बह्वीः समा अकरमन्तरस्मिन्निन्द्रं वर्णानः पितरंजहामि अग्निः सोमो वरुणस्ते चयवन्ते पर्यावर्द्राष्ट्रं तदवाम्यायन |||
verses.transliteration: bahvīḥ samā akaramantarasminnindraṃ vṛṇānaḥ pitaraṃjahāmi aghniḥ somo varuṇaste cyavante paryāvardrāṣṭraṃ tadavāmyāyan

translations.griffith: I tarried many a year within this altar: I leave the Father, for my choice is Indra.  Away pass Agni, Varuṇa and Soma. Rule ever changes: this I come to favour.

verses.sanskrit: निर्माया उ तये असुरा अभूवन तवं च मा वरुण कामयासे रतेन राजन्नन्र्तं विविञ्चन मम राष्ट्रस्याधिपत्यमेहि |||
verses.transliteration: nirmāyā u tye asurā abhūvan tvaṃ ca mā varuṇa kāmayāse ṛtena rājannanṛtaṃ viviñcan mama rāṣṭrasyādhipatyamehi

translations.griffith: These Asuras have lost their powers of magic. But thou, O Varuṇa, if thou dost love me,  O King, discerning truth and right from falsehood, come and be Lord and Ruler of my kingdom.

verses.sanskrit: इदं सवरिदमिदास वाममयं परकाश उर्वन्तरिक्षम हनाव वर्त्रं निरेहि सोम हविष टवा सन्तं हविषायजाम |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ svaridamidāsa vāmamayaṃ prakāśa urvantarikṣam hanāva vṛtraṃ nirehi soma haviṣ ṭvā santaṃ haviṣāyajāma

translations.griffith: Here is the light of heaven, here allis lovely; here there is radiance, here is air's wide region.  Let us two slaughter Vṛtra. Forth, O Soma! Thou art oblation: we therewith will serve thee.

verses.sanskrit: कविः कवित्वा दिवि रूपमासजदप्रभूती वरुणो निरपः सर्जत कषेमं कर्ण्वाना जनयो न सिन्धवश ता अस्यवर्णं शुचयो भरिभ्रति |||
verses.transliteration: kaviḥ kavitvā divi rūpamāsajadaprabhūtī varuṇo nirapaḥ sṛjat kṣemaṃ kṛṇvānā janayo na sindhavaś tā asyavarṇaṃ śucayo bharibhrati

translations.griffith: The Sage hath fixed his form by wisdom in the heavens: Varuṇa with no violence let the waters flow.  Like women-folk, the floods that bring prosperity have eau lit his hue and colour as they gleamed and shone.

verses.sanskrit: ता अस्य जयेष्ठमिन्द्रियं सचन्ते ता ईमा कषेतिस्वधया मदन्तीः ता इं विशो न राजानं वर्णानाबीभत्सुवो अप वर्त्रादतिष्ठन |||
verses.transliteration: tā asya jyeṣṭhamindriyaṃ sacante tā īmā kṣetisvadhayā madantīḥ tā iṃ viśo na rājānaṃ vṛṇānābībhatsuvo apa vṛtrādatiṣṭhan

translations.griffith: These wait upon his loftiest power and vigour: he dwells in these who triumph in their Godhead;  And they, like people who elect their ruler, have in abhorrence turned away from Vṛtra.

verses.sanskrit: बीभत्सूनां सयुजं हंसमाहुरपां दिव्यानांसख्ये चरन्तम अनुष्टुभमनु चर्चूर्यमाणमिन्द्रं निचिक्युः कवयो मनीषा |||
verses.transliteration: bībhatsūnāṃ sayujaṃ haṃsamāhurapāṃ divyānāṃsakhye carantam anuṣṭubhamanu carcūryamāṇamindraṃ nicikyuḥ kavayo manīṣā

translations.griffith: They call him Swan, the abhorrent floods' Companion, moving in friendship with celestial Waters.  The poets in their thought have looked on Indra swiftly approaching when Anustup calls him.

verses.sanskrit: अहं रुद्रेभिर्वसुभिश्चराम्यहमादित्यैरुतविश्वदेवैः अहं मित्रावरुणोभा बिभर्म्यहमिन्द्राग्नीहमश्विनोभा |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ rudrebhirvasubhiścarāmyahamādityairutaviśvadevaiḥ ahaṃ mitrāvaruṇobhā bibharmyahamindrāghnīahamaśvinobhā

translations.griffith: I TRAVEL with the Rudras and the Vasus, with the Ādityas and All-Gods I wander.  I hold aloft both Varuṇa and Mitra, Indra and Agni, and the Pair of Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सोममाहनसं बिभर्म्यहं तवष्टारमुतपूषणं भगम अहं दधामि दरविणं हविष्मतेसुप्राव्ये यजमानाय सुन्वते |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ somamāhanasaṃ bibharmyahaṃ tvaṣṭāramutapūṣaṇaṃ bhagham ahaṃ dadhāmi draviṇaṃ haviṣmatesuprāvye yajamānāya sunvate

translations.griffith: I cherish and sustain high-swelling Soma, and Tvaṣṭar I support, Pūṣan, and Bhaga.  I load with wealth the zealous sdcrificer who pours the juice and offers his oblation

verses.sanskrit: अहं राष्ट्री संगमनी वसूनां चिकितुषी परथमायज्ञियानाम तां मा देवा वयदधुः पुरुत्राभूरिस्थात्रां भूर्यावेशयन्तीम |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ rāṣṭrī saṃghamanī vasūnāṃ cikituṣī prathamāyajñiyānām tāṃ mā devā vyadadhuḥ purutrābhūristhātrāṃ bhūryāveśayantīm

translations.griffith: I am the Queen, the gatherer-up of treasures, most thoughtful, first of those who merit worship.  Thus Gods have stablished me in many places with many homes to enter and abide in.

verses.sanskrit: मया सो अन्नमत्ति यो विपश्यति यः पराणिति य ईंश्र्णोत्युक्तम अमन्तवो मां त उप कषियन्ति शरुधिश्रुत शरद्धिवं ते वदामि |||
verses.transliteration: mayā so annamatti yo vipaśyati yaḥ prāṇiti ya īṃśṛṇotyuktam amantavo māṃ ta upa kṣiyanti śrudhiśruta śraddhivaṃ te vadāmi

translations.griffith: Through me alone all eat the food that feeds them,—each man who sees, brewhes, hears the word outspoken  They know it not, but yet they dwell beside me. Hear, one and all, the truth as I declare it.

verses.sanskrit: अहमेव सवयमिदं वदामि जुष्टं देवेभिरुतमानुषेभिः यं कामये तं-तमुग्रं कर्णोमि तम्ब्रह्माणं तं रषिं तं सुमेधाम |||
verses.transliteration: ahameva svayamidaṃ vadāmi juṣṭaṃ devebhirutamānuṣebhiḥ yaṃ kāmaye taṃ-tamughraṃ kṛṇomi tambrahmāṇaṃ taṃ ṛṣiṃ taṃ sumedhām

translations.griffith: 1, verily, myself announce and utter the word that Gods and men alike shall welcome.  I make the man I love exceeding mighty, make him a sage, a Ṛṣi, and a Brahman.

verses.sanskrit: अहं रुद्राय धनुरा तनोमि बरह्मद्विषे शरवे हन्तवाु अहं जनाय समदं कर्णोम्यहं दयावाप्र्थिवी आविवेश |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ rudrāya dhanurā tanomi brahmadviṣe śarave hantavāu ahaṃ janāya samadaṃ kṛṇomyahaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī āviveśa

translations.griffith: I bend the bow for Rudra that his arrow may strike and slay the hater of devotion.  I rouse and order battle for the people, and I have penetrated Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सुवे पितरमस्य मूर्धन मम योनिरप्स्वन्तः समुद्रे ततो वि तिष्ठे भुवनानु विश्वोतामूं दयांवर्ष्मणोप सप्र्शामि |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ suve pitaramasya mūrdhan mama yonirapsvantaḥ samudre tato vi tiṣṭhe bhuvanānu viśvotāmūṃ dyāṃvarṣmaṇopa spṛśāmi

translations.griffith: On the world's summit I bring forth the Father: my home is in the waters, in the ocean.  Thence I extend o’er all existing creatures, and touch even yonder heaven with my forehead.

verses.sanskrit: अहमेव वात इव पर वाम्यारभमाणा भुवनानि विश्वा परो दिवा पर एना पर्थिव्यैतावती महिना सं बभूव |||
verses.transliteration: ahameva vāta iva pra vāmyārabhamāṇā bhuvanāni viśvā paro divā para enā pṛthivyaitāvatī mahinā saṃ babhūva

translations.griffith: I breathe a strong breath like the wind and tempest, the while I hold together all existence.  Beyond this wide earth and beyond the heavens I have become so mighty in my grandeur.

verses.sanskrit: न तमंहो न दुरितं देवासो अष्ट मर्त्यम सजोषसोयमर्यमा मित्रो नयन्ति वरुणो अति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: na tamaṃho na duritaṃ devāso aṣṭa martyam sajoṣasoyamaryamā mitro nayanti varuṇo ati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: No peril, no severe distress, ye Gods, affects the mortal man,  Whom Aryaman and Mitra lead, and Varima, of one accord, beyond his foes.

verses.sanskrit: तद धि वयं वर्णीमहे वरुण मित्रार्यमन येना निरंहसो यूयं पाथ नेथा च मर्त्यमति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: tad dhi vayaṃ vṛṇīmahe varuṇa mitrāryaman yenā niraṃhaso yūyaṃ pātha nethā ca martyamati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: This very thing do we desire, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,  Whereby ye guhrd the mortal man from sore distress, and lead him safe beyond his foes.

verses.sanskrit: ते नूनं नो.अयमूतये वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा नयिष्था उनो नेषणि पर्षिष्ठा उ नः पर्षण्यति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: te nūnaṃ no.ayamūtaye varuṇo mitro aryamā nayiṣthā uno neṣaṇi parṣiṣṭhā u naḥ parṣaṇyati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: These are, each one, our present helps, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman.  Best leaders, best deliverers to lead us on and bear as safe beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं विश्वं परि पाथ वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा युष्माकंशर्मणि परिये सयाम सुप्रणीतयो.अति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ viśvaṃ pari pātha varuṇo mitro aryamā yuṣmākaṃśarmaṇi priye syāma supraṇītayo.ati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye compass round and guard each man, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman:  In your dear keeping may we be, ye who are excellent as guides beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्यासो अति सरिधो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा उग्रं मरुद्भीरुद्रं हुवेमेन्द्रमग्निं सवस्तये.अति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: ādityāso ati sridho varuṇo mitro aryamā ughraṃ marudbhīrudraṃ huvemendramaghniṃ svastaye.ati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Ādityas are beyond all foes,—Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman:  Strong Rudra with the Marut host, Indra, Agni let us call for weal beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit: नेतार ऊ षु णस्तिरो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा अति विश्वानिदुरिता राजानश्चर्षणीनामति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: netāra ū ṣu ṇastiro varuṇo mitro aryamā ati viśvāniduritā rājānaścarṣaṇīnāmati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: These lead us safely over all, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,  These who are Kings of living men, over all troubles far away beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit: शुनमस्मभ्यमूतये वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा शर्म यछन्तुसप्रथ आदित्यासो यदीमहे अति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: śunamasmabhyamūtaye varuṇo mitro aryamā śarma yachantusapratha ādityāso yadīmahe ati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: May they give bliss to aid us well, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman:  May the Ādityas, when we pray, grant us wide shelter and defence beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit: यथा ह तयद वसवो गौर्यं चित पदि षिताममुञ्चतायजत्राः एवो षवस्मन मुञ्चता वयंहः पर तार्यग्नेप्रतरं न आयुः |||
verses.transliteration: yathā ha tyad vasavo ghauryaṃ cit padi ṣitāmamuñcatāyajatrāḥ evo ṣvasman muñcatā vyaṃhaḥ pra tāryaghneprataraṃ na āyuḥ

translations.griffith: As in this place, O Holy Ones, ye Vasus freed even the Gaud when her feet were fettered.  So free us now from trouble and affliction: and let our life be lengthened still, O Api.

verses.sanskrit: रात्री वयख्यदायती पुरुत्रा देव्यक्षभिः विश्वाधि शरियो.अधित |||
verses.transliteration: rātrī vyakhyadāyatī purutrā devyakṣabhiḥ viśvāadhi śriyo.adhita

translations.griffith: WITH all her eyes the Goddess Night looks forth approaching many a spot:  She hath put all her glories on.

verses.sanskrit: ओर्वप्रा अमर्त्या निवतो देव्युद्वतः जयोतिषा बाधतेतमः |||
verses.transliteration: orvaprā amartyā nivato devyudvataḥ jyotiṣā bādhatetamaḥ

translations.griffith: Immortal. she hath filled the waste, the Goddess hath filled height and depth:  She conquers darkness with her light.

verses.sanskrit: निरु सवसारमस्क्र्तोषसं देव्यायती अपेदु हासतेतमः |||
verses.transliteration: niru svasāramaskṛtoṣasaṃ devyāyatī apedu hāsatetamaḥ

translations.griffith: The Goddess as she comes hath set the Dawn her Sister in her place:  And then the darkness vanishes.

verses.sanskrit: सा नो अद्य यस्या वयं नि ते यामन्न्नविक्ष्महि वर्क्षेन वसतिं वयः |||
verses.transliteration: sā no adya yasyā vayaṃ ni te yāmannnavikṣmahi vṛkṣena vasatiṃ vayaḥ

translations.griffith: So favour us this night, O thou whose pathways we have visited  As birds their nest upon the tree.

verses.sanskrit: नि गरामासो अविक्षत नि पद्वन्तो नि पक्षिणः निश्येनासश्चिदर्थिनः |||
verses.transliteration: ni ghrāmāso avikṣata ni padvanto ni pakṣiṇaḥ niśyenāsaścidarthinaḥ

translations.griffith: The villagers have sought their homes, and all that walks and all that flies,  Even the falcons fain for prey.

verses.sanskrit: यावया वर्क्यं वर्कं यवय सतेनमूर्म्ये अथा नःसुतरा भव |||
verses.transliteration: yāvayā vṛkyaṃ vṛkaṃ yavaya stenamūrmye athā naḥsutarā bhava

translations.griffith: Keep off the she-wolf and the wolf, O Urmya, keep the thief away;  Easy be thou for us to pass.

verses.sanskrit: उप मा पेपिशत तमः कर्ष्णं वयक्तमस्थित उष रणेवयातय |||
verses.transliteration: upa mā pepiśat tamaḥ kṛṣṇaṃ vyaktamasthita uṣa ṛṇevayātaya

translations.griffith: Clearly hath she come nigh to me who decks the dark with richest hues:  O Morning, cancel it like debts.

verses.sanskrit: उप ते गा इवाकरं वर्णीष्व दुहितर्दिवः रात्रि सतोमंन जिग्युषे |||
verses.transliteration: upa te ghā ivākaraṃ vṛṇīṣva duhitardivaḥ rātri stomaṃna jighyuṣe

translations.griffith: These have I brought to thee like kine. O Night, thou Child of Heaven, accept  This laud as for a conqueror.

verses.sanskrit: ममाग्ने वर्चो विहवेष्वस्तु वयं तवेन्धानास्तन्वम्पुषेम मह्यं नमन्तां परदिशश्चतस्रस्त्वयाध्यक्षेणप्र्तना जयेम |||
verses.transliteration: mamāghne varco vihaveṣvastu vayaṃ tvendhānāstanvampuṣema mahyaṃ namantāṃ pradiśaścatasrastvayādhyakṣeṇapṛtanā jayema

translations.griffith: LET me win glory, Agni, in our battles: enkindling thee, may we support our bodies.  May the four regions bend and bow before me: with thee for guardian may we win in combat.

verses.sanskrit: मम देवा विहवे सन्तु सर्व इन्द्रवन्तो मरुतो विष्णुरग्निः ममान्तरिक्षमुरुलोकमस्तु मह्यं वातः पवतांकामे अस्मिन |||
verses.transliteration: mama devā vihave santu sarva indravanto maruto viṣṇuraghniḥ mamāntarikṣamurulokamastu mahyaṃ vātaḥ pavatāṃkāme asmin

translations.griffith: May all the Gods be on my side in battle, the Maruts led by Indra, Viṣṇu, Agni.  Mine be the middle air's extended region, and may the wind blow favouring these my wishes.

verses.sanskrit: मयि देवा दरविणमा यजन्तां मय्याशीरस्तु मयिदेवहूतिः दैव्या होतारो वनुषन्त पूर्वे.अरिष्टाःस्याम तन्वा सुवीराः |||
verses.transliteration: mayi devā draviṇamā yajantāṃ mayyāśīrastu mayidevahūtiḥ daivyā hotāro vanuṣanta pūrve.ariṣṭāḥsyāma tanvā suvīrāḥ

translations.griffith: May the Gods grant me riches; may the blessing and invocation of the Gods assist me.  Foremost in fight be the divine Invokers: may we, unwounded, have brave heroes round us.

verses.sanskrit: मह्यं यजन्तु मम यानि हव्याकूतिः सत्या मनसो मे अस्तु एनो मा नि गां कतमच्चनाहं विश्वे देवासो अधिवोचता नः |||
verses.transliteration: mahyaṃ yajantu mama yāni havyākūtiḥ satyā manaso me astu eno mā ni ghāṃ katamaccanāhaṃ viśve devāso adhivocatā naḥ

translations.griffith: For me let them present all mine oblations, and let my mind's intention be accomplished.  May I he guiltless of the least transgression: and, all ye Gods, do ye combine to bless us.

verses.sanskrit: देवीः षळ उर्वीरुरु नः कर्णोत विश्वे देवास इहवीरयध्वम मा हास्महि परजया मा तनूभिर्मा रधामद्विषते सोम राजन |||
verses.transliteration: devīḥ ṣaḷ urvīruru naḥ kṛṇota viśve devāsa ihavīrayadhvam mā hāsmahi prajayā mā tanūbhirmā radhāmadviṣate soma rājan

translations.griffith: Ye six divine Expanses, grant us freedom: here, all ye Gods, acquit yourselves like heroes.  Let us not lose our children or our bodies: let us not benefit the foe, King Soma!

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने मन्युं परतिनुदन परेषामदब्धो गोपाः परि पाहि नस्त्वम परत्यञ्चो यन्तु निगुतः पुनस्ते.अमैषां चित्तम्प्रबुधां वि नेशत |||
verses.transliteration: aghne manyuṃ pratinudan pareṣāmadabdho ghopāḥ pari pāhi nastvam pratyañco yantu nighutaḥ punaste.amaiṣāṃ cittamprabudhāṃ vi neśat

translations.griffith: Baffling the wrath of our opponents, Agni, guard us as our infallible Protector.  Let these thy foes turn back and seek their houses, and let their thought who watch at home be ruined.

verses.sanskrit: धाता धातॄणां भुवनस्य यस पतिर्देवं तरातारमभिमातिषाहम इमं यज्ञमश्विनोभा बर्हस्पतिर्देवाः पान्तु यजमानं नयर्थात |||
verses.transliteration: dhātā dhātṝṇāṃ bhuvanasya yas patirdevaṃ trātāramabhimātiṣāham imaṃ yajñamaśvinobhā bṛhaspatirdevāḥ pāntu yajamānaṃ nyarthāt

translations.griffith: Lord of the world, Creator of creators the saviour God who overcomes the foeman.  May Gods, Bṛhaspati, both Aśvins shelter from ill this sacrifice and sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit: उरुव्यचा नो महिषः शर्म यंसदस्मिन हवे पुरुहूतःपुरुक्षुः स नः परजायै हर्यश्व मर्ळयेन्द्र मा नोरीरिषो मा परा दाः |||
verses.transliteration: uruvyacā no mahiṣaḥ śarma yaṃsadasmin have puruhūtaḥpurukṣuḥ sa naḥ prajāyai haryaśva mṛḷayendra mā norīriṣo mā parā dāḥ

translations.griffith: Foodful, and much-invoked, at this our calling may the great Bull vouchsafe us wide protection.  Lord of Bay Coursers, Indra, blew our children: harm us not, give us not as prey to others.

verses.sanskrit: ये नः सपत्ना अप ते भवन्त्विन्द्राग्निभ्यामव बाधामहेतान वसवो रुद्रा आदित्या उपरिस्प्र्शं मोग्रं चेत्तारमधिराजमक्रन |||
verses.transliteration: ye naḥ sapatnā apa te bhavantvindrāghnibhyāmava bādhāmahetān vasavo rudrā ādityā uparispṛśaṃ moghraṃ cettāramadhirājamakran

translations.griffith: Let those who are our foemen stay. afar from us: with Indra and with Agni we will drive them off.  Vasus, Ādityas, Rudras have exalted me, made me far-reaching, mighty, thinker, sovran lord.

verses.sanskrit: नासदासीन नो सदासीत तदानीं नासीद रजो नो वयोमापरो यत किमावरीवः कुह कस्य शर्मन्नम्भः किमासीद गहनं गभीरम |||
verses.transliteration: nāsadāsīn no sadāsīt tadānīṃ nāsīd rajo no vyomāparo yat kimāvarīvaḥ kuha kasya śarmannambhaḥ kimāsīd ghahanaṃ ghabhīram

translations.griffith: THEN was not non-existent nor existent: there was no realm of air, no sky beyond it.  What covered in, and where? and what gave shelter? Was water there, unfathomed depth of water?

verses.sanskrit: न मर्त्युरासीदम्र्तं न तर्हि न रात्र्या अह्न आसीत्प्रकेतः आनीदवातं सवधया तदेकं तस्माद्धान्यन न परः किं चनास |||
verses.transliteration: na mṛtyurāsīdamṛtaṃ na tarhi na rātryā ahna āsītpraketaḥ ānīdavātaṃ svadhayā tadekaṃ tasmāddhānyan na paraḥ kiṃ canāsa

translations.griffith: Death was not then, nor was there aught immortal: no sign was there, the day's and night's divider.  That One Thing, breathless, breathed by its own nature: apart from it was nothing whatsoever.

verses.sanskrit: तम आसीत तमसा गूळमग्रे.अप्रकेतं सलिलं सर्वमािदम तुछ्येनाभ्वपिहितं यदासीत तपसस्तन्महिनाजायतैकम |||
verses.transliteration: tama āsīt tamasā ghūḷamaghre.apraketaṃ salilaṃ sarvamāidam tuchyenābhvapihitaṃ yadāsīt tapasastanmahinājāyataikam

translations.griffith: Darkness there was: at first concealed in darkness this All was indiscriminated chaos.  All that existed then was void and form less: by the great power of Warmth was born that Unit.

verses.sanskrit: कामस्तदग्रे समवर्तताधि मनसो रेतः परथमं यदासीत सतो बन्धुमसति निरविन्दन हर्दि परतीष्याकवयो मनीषा |||
verses.transliteration: kāmastadaghre samavartatādhi manaso retaḥ prathamaṃ yadāsīt sato bandhumasati niravindan hṛdi pratīṣyākavayo manīṣā

translations.griffith: Thereafter rose Desire in the beginning, Desire, the primal seed and germ of Spirit.  Sages who searched with their heart's thought discovered the existent's kinship in the non-existent.

verses.sanskrit: तिरश्चीनो विततो रश्मिरेषामधः सविदासी.अ.अ.अत रेतोधाासन महिमान आसन सवधा अवस्तात परयतिः परस्तात |||
verses.transliteration: tiraścīno vitato raśmireṣāmadhaḥ svidāsī.a.a.at retodhāāsan mahimāna āsan svadhā avastāt prayatiḥ parastāt

translations.griffith: Transversely was their severing line extended: what was above it then, and what below it?  There were begetters, there were mighty forces, free action here and energy up yonder

verses.sanskrit: को अद्धा वेद क इह पर वोचत कुत आजाता कुत इयंविस्र्ष्टिः अर्वाग देवा अस्य विसर्जनेनाथा को वेद यताबभूव |||
verses.transliteration: ko addhā veda ka iha pra vocat kuta ājātā kuta iyaṃvisṛṣṭiḥ arvāgh devā asya visarjanenāthā ko veda yataābabhūva

translations.griffith: Who verily knows and who can here declare it, whence it was born and whence comes this creation?  The Gods are later than this world's production. Who knows then whence it first came into being?

verses.sanskrit: इयं विस्र्ष्टिर्यत आबभूव यदि वा दधे यदि वा न यो अस्याध्यक्षः परमे वयोमन सो अङग वेद यदि वा नवेद |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ visṛṣṭiryata ābabhūva yadi vā dadhe yadi vā na yo asyādhyakṣaḥ parame vyoman so aṅgha veda yadi vā naveda

translations.griffith: He, the first origin of this creation, whether he formed it all or did not form it,  Whose eye controls this world in highest heaven, he verily knows it, or perhaps he knows not.

verses.sanskrit: यो यज्ञो विश्वतस्तन्तुभिस्तत एकशतं देवकर्मेभिरायतः इमे वयन्ति पितरो य आययुः पर वयाप वयेत्यासते तते |||
verses.transliteration: yo yajño viśvatastantubhistata ekaśataṃ devakarmebhirāyataḥ ime vayanti pitaro ya āyayuḥ pra vayāpa vayetyāsate tate

translations.griffith: THE sacrifice drawn out with threads on every side, stretched by a hundred sacred ministers and one,—  This do these Fathers weave who hitherward are come: they sit beside the warp and cry, Weave forth, weave back.

verses.sanskrit: पुमानेनं तनुत उत कर्णत्ति पुमान वि तत्ने अधि नाकेस्मिन इमे मयूखा उप सेदुरू सदः सामानि चक्रुस्तसराण्योतवे |||
verses.transliteration: pumānenaṃ tanuta ut kṛṇatti pumān vi tatne adhi nākeasmin ime mayūkhā upa sedurū sadaḥ sāmāni cakrustasarāṇyotave

translations.griffith: The Man extends it and the Man unbinds it: even to this vault of heaven hath he outspun, it.  These pegs are fastened to the seat of worship: they made the Sāma-hymns their weaving shuttles.

verses.sanskrit: कासीत परमा परतिमा किं निदानमाज्यं किमासीत्परिधिः क आसीत छन्दः किमासीत परौगं किमुक्थंयद देवा देवमयजन्त विश्वे |||
verses.transliteration: kāsīt pramā pratimā kiṃ nidānamājyaṃ kimāsītparidhiḥ ka āsīt chandaḥ kimāsīt praughaṃ kimukthaṃyad devā devamayajanta viśve

translations.griffith: What were the rule, the order and the model? What were the wooden fender and the butter?  What were the hymn, the chant, the recitation, when to the God all Deities paid worship?

verses.sanskrit: अग्नेर्गायत्र्यभवत सयुग्वोष्णिहया सविता सं बभूव अनुष्टुभा सोम उक्थैर्महस्वान बर्हस्पतेर्ब्र्हती वाचमावत |||
verses.transliteration: aghnerghāyatryabhavat sayughvoṣṇihayā savitā saṃ babhūva anuṣṭubhā soma ukthairmahasvān bṛhaspaterbṛhatī vācamāvat

translations.griffith: Closely was Gāyatrī conjoined with Agni, and closely Savitar combined with Usnih.  Brilliant with Ukthas, Soma joined Anustup: Bṛhaspati's voice by Brhati was aided.

verses.sanskrit: विराण मित्रावरुणयोरभिश्रीरिन्द्रस्य तरिष्टुब इहभागो अह्नः विश्वान देवाञ जगत्या विवेश तेनचाक्ळिप्र रषयो मनुष्याः |||
verses.transliteration: virāṇ mitrāvaruṇayorabhiśrīrindrasya triṣṭub ihabhāgho ahnaḥ viśvān devāñ jaghatyā viveśa tenacākḷipra ṛṣayo manuṣyāḥ

translations.griffith: Virāj adhered to Varuṇa and Mitra: here Triṣṭup day by day was Indra's portion.  Jagatī entered all the Gods together: so by this knowledge men were raised to Ṛṣis.

verses.sanskrit: चाक्ळिप्रे तेन रषयो मनुष्या यज्ञे जाते पितरो नःपुराणे पश्यन मन्ये मनसा चक्षसा तान य इमंयज्ञमयजन्त पूर्वे |||
verses.transliteration: cākḷipre tena ṛṣayo manuṣyā yajñe jāte pitaro naḥpurāṇe paśyan manye manasā cakṣasā tān ya imaṃyajñamayajanta pūrve

translations.griffith: So by this knowledge men were raised to Ṛṣis, when ancient sacrifice sprang up, our Fathers.  With the mind's eye I think that I behold them who first performed this sacrificial worship.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्तोमाः सहछन्दस आव्र्तः सहप्रमा रषयः सप्तदैव्याः पूर्वेषां पन्थामनुद्र्श्य धीरा अन्वालेभिरेरथ्यो न रश्मीन |||
verses.transliteration: sahastomāḥ sahachandasa āvṛtaḥ sahapramā ṛṣayaḥ saptadaivyāḥ pūrveṣāṃ panthāmanudṛśya dhīrā anvālebhirerathyo na raśmīn

translations.griffith: They who were versed in ritual and metre, in hymns and rules, were the Seven Godlike Ṛṣis.  Viewing the path of those of old, the sages have taken up the reins like chariot-drivers.

verses.sanskrit: अप पराच इन्द्र विश्वानमित्रानपापाचो अभिभूते नुदस्व अपोदीचो अप शूराधराच उरौ यथा तव शर्मन्मदेम |||
verses.transliteration: apa prāca indra viśvānamitrānapāpāco abhibhūte nudasva apodīco apa śūrādharāca urau yathā tava śarmanmadema

translations.griffith: DRIVE all our enemies away, O Indra, the western, mighty Conqueror, and the eastern.  Hero, drive off our northern foes and southern, that we in thy wide shelter may be joyful.

verses.sanskrit: कुविदङग यवमन्तो यवं चिद यथा दान्त्यनुपूर्वंवियूय इहेहैषां कर्णुहि भोजनानि ये बर्हिषोनमोव्र्क्तिं न जग्मुः |||
verses.transliteration: kuvidaṅgha yavamanto yavaṃ cid yathā dāntyanupūrvaṃviyūya ihehaiṣāṃ kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣonamovṛktiṃ na jaghmuḥ

translations.griffith: What then? As men whose fields are full of barley reap the ripe corn removing it in order,  So bring the food of those men, bring it hither, who went not to prepare the grass for worship.

verses.sanskrit: नहि सथूर्य रतुथा यातमस्ति नोत शरवो विविदेसंगमेषु गव्यन्त इन्द्रं सख्याय विप्रा अश्वायन्तोव्र्षणं वाजयन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: nahi sthūry ṛtuthā yātamasti nota śravo vividesaṃghameṣu ghavyanta indraṃ sakhyāya viprā aśvāyantovṛṣaṇaṃ vājayantaḥ

translations.griffith: Men come not with one horse at sacred seasons; thus they obtain no honour in assemblies.  Sages desiring herds of kine and horses strengthen the mighty Indra for his friendship.

verses.sanskrit: युवं सुराममश्विना नमुचावासुरे सचा विपिपानाशुभस पती इन्द्रं कर्मस्वावतम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ surāmamaśvinā namucāvāsure sacā vipipānāśubhas patī indraṃ karmasvāvatam

translations.griffith: Ye, Aśvins, Lords of Splendour, drank full draughts of grateful Soma juice,  And aided Indra in his work with Namuci of Asura birth.

verses.sanskrit: पुत्रमिव पितरावश्विनोभेन्द्रावथुः काव्यैर्दंसनाभिः यत सुरामं वयपिबः शचीभिः सरस्वतीत्वा मघवन्नभिष्णक |||
verses.transliteration: putramiva pitarāvaśvinobhendrāvathuḥ kāvyairdaṃsanābhiḥ yat surāmaṃ vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatītvā maghavannabhiṣṇak

translations.griffith: As parents aid a son, both Aśvins, Indra, aided thee with their wondrous Powers and wisdom.  When thou, with might. hadst drunk the draught that gladdens, Sarasvatī, O Maghavan, refreshed thee.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः सुत्रामा सववानवोभिः सुम्र्ळीको भवतुविश्ववेदाः बाधतां दवेषो अभयं कर्णोतु सुवीर्यस्यपतयः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ sutrāmā svavānavobhiḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatuviśvavedāḥ bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ kṛṇotu suvīryasyapatayaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: Indra is strong to save, rich in assistance may he, possessing all, be kind and gracious.  May he disperse our foes and give us safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigou r.

verses.sanskrit: तस्य वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियस्यापि भद्रे सौमनसे सयाम स सुत्रामा सववानिन्द्रो अस्मे आराच्चिद दवेषः सनुतर्युयोतु |||
verses.transliteration: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma sa sutrāmā svavānindro asme ārāccid dveṣaḥ sanutaryuyotu

translations.griffith: May we enjoy his favour, his the Holy may we enjoy his blessed loving kindness.  May this rich Indra, as our good Protector, drive off and keep afar all those who hate us.

verses.sanskrit: ईजानमिद दयौर्गूर्तावसुरीजानं भूमिरभिप्रभूषणि ईजानं देवावश्विनावभि सुम्नैरवर्धताम |||
verses.transliteration: ījānamid dyaurghūrtāvasurījānaṃ bhūmirabhiprabhūṣaṇi ījānaṃ devāvaśvināvabhi sumnairavardhatām

translations.griffith: MAY Dyaus the Lord of lauded wealth, and Earth stand by the man who offers sacrifice,  And may the Aśvins, both the Gods, strengthen the worshipper with bliss.

verses.sanskrit: ता वां मित्रावरुणा धारयत्क्षिती सुषुम्नेषितत्वतायजामसि युवोः कराणाय सख्यैरभि षयाम रक्षसः |||
verses.transliteration: tā vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā dhārayatkṣitī suṣumneṣitatvatāyajāmasi yuvoḥ krāṇāya sakhyairabhi ṣyāma rakṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: As such we honour you, Mitra and Varuṇa, with hasty zeal, most blest, you who sustain the folk.  So may we, through your friendship for the worshipper, subdue the fiends.

verses.sanskrit: अधा चिन नु यद दिधिषामहे वामभि परियं रेक्णःपत्यमानाः दद्वान वा यत पुष्यति रेक्णः सं वारन्नकिरस्य मघानि |||
verses.transliteration: adhā cin nu yad didhiṣāmahe vāmabhi priyaṃ rekṇaḥpatyamānāḥ dadvān vā yat puṣyati rekṇaḥ saṃ vārannakirasya maghāni

translations.griffith: And when we seek to win your love and friendship, weẉho have precious wealth in our possession,  Or when the worshipper augments his riches let not his treasures be shut up

verses.sanskrit: असावन्यो असुर सूयत दयौस्त्वं विश्वेषां वरुणासिराजा मूर्धा रथस्य चाकन नैतावतैनसान्तकध्रुक |||
verses.transliteration: asāvanyo asura sūyata dyaustvaṃ viśveṣāṃ varuṇāsirājā mūrdhā rathasya cākan naitāvatainasāntakadhruk

translations.griffith: That other, Asura! too was born of Heaven. thou art, O Varuṇa, the King of all men.  The chariot's Lord was well content, forbearing to anger Death by sin so great.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मिन सवेतच्छकपूत एनो हिते मित्रे निगतान हन्ति वीरान अवोर्वा यद धात तनूष्ववः परियासु यज्ञियास्वर्वा |||
verses.transliteration: asmin svetacchakapūta eno hite mitre nighatān hanti vīrān avorvā yad dhāt tanūṣvavaḥ priyāsu yajñiyāsvarvā

translations.griffith: This sin hath Sakaputa here committed. Heroes who fled to their dear friend he slayeth,  When the Steed bringeth down your grace and favour in bodies dear and worshipful.

verses.sanskrit: युवोर्हि मातादितिर्विचेतसा दयौर्न भूमिः पयसापुपूतनि अव परिया दिदिष्टन सूरो निनिक्त रश्मिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvorhi mātāditirvicetasā dyaurna bhūmiḥ payasāpupūtani ava priyā didiṣṭana sūro ninikta raśmibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Your Mother Aditi, ye wise, was purified with water even as earth is purified from heaven.  Show love and kindness here below: wash her in rays of heavenly light.

verses.sanskrit: युवं हयप्नराजावसीदतं तिष्ठद रथं नधूर्षदं वनर्षदम ता नः कणूकयन्तीर्न्र्मेधस्तत्रे अंहसः सुमेधस्तत्रे अंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ hyapnarājāvasīdataṃ tiṣṭhad rathaṃ nadhūrṣadaṃ vanarṣadam tā naḥ kaṇūkayantīrnṛmedhastatre aṃhasaḥ sumedhastatre aṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye Twain have seated you as Lords of Wealth, as one who mounts a car to him who sits upon the pole, upon the wood.  These our disheartened tribes Nrmedhas saved from woe, Sumedhas saved from Woe.

verses.sanskrit: परो षवस्मै पुरोरथमिन्द्राय शूषमर्चत अभीके चिदुलोकक्र्त संगे समत्सु वर्त्रहास्माकं बोधि चोदितानभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु |||
verses.transliteration: pro ṣvasmai purorathamindrāya śūṣamarcata abhīke cidulokakṛt saṃghe samatsu vṛtrahāsmākaṃ bodhi coditānabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu

translations.griffith: SING strength to Indra that shall set his chariot in the foremost place.  Giver of room in closest fight, slayer of foes in shock of war, be thou our great encourager. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सिन्धून्रवास्र्जो.अधराचो अहन्नहिम अशत्रुरिन्द्रजज्ञिषे विश्वं पुष्यसि वार्यं तं तवा परि षवजामहेनभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ sindhūnravāsṛjo.adharāco ahannahim aśatrurindrajajñiṣe viśvaṃ puṣyasi vāryaṃ taṃ tvā pari ṣvajāmahenabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu

translations.griffith: Thou didst destroy the Dragon: thou sentest the rivers down to earth.  Foeless, O Indra, wast thou born. Thou tendest well each choicest thing. Therefore we draw us close to thee. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.

verses.sanskrit: वि षु विश्वा अरातयो.अर्यो नशन्त नो धियः अस्तासिशत्रवे वधं यो न इन्द्र जिघांसति या ते रातिर्ददिर्वसु नभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु |||
verses.transliteration: vi ṣu viśvā arātayo.aryo naśanta no dhiyaḥ astāsiśatrave vadhaṃ yo na indra jighāṃsati yā te rātirdadirvasu nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu

translations.griffith: Destroyed be all malignities and all our enemy's designs.  Thy bolt thou castest, at the foe, O Indra, who would srnite us dead: thy liberal bounty gives us wealth.

verses.sanskrit: यो न इन्द्राभितो जनो वर्कायुरादिदेशति अधस्पदं तमीं कर्धि विबाधो असि सासहिर्नभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाकाधि धन्वसु |||
verses.transliteration: yo na indrābhito jano vṛkāyurādideśati adhaspadaṃ tamīṃ kṛdhi vibādho asi sāsahirnabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākāadhi dhanvasu

translations.griffith: The robber people round about, Indra, who watch and aim at us,—  Trample them down beneath thy foot; a conquering scatterer art thou.

verses.sanskrit: यो न इन्द्राभिदासति सनाभिर्यश्च निष्ट्यः अव तस्यबलं तिर महीव दयौरध तमना नभन्तामन्यकेषांज्याका अधि धन्वसु |||
verses.transliteration: yo na indrābhidāsati sanābhiryaśca niṣṭyaḥ ava tasyabalaṃ tira mahīva dyauradha tmanā nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃjyākā adhi dhanvasu

translations.griffith: Whoso assails us, Indra, be the man a stranger or akin,  Bring down, thyself, his strength although it be as vast as are the heavens.

verses.sanskrit: वयमिन्द्र तवायवः सखित्वमा रभामहे रतस्य नःपथा नयाति विश्वानि दुरिता नभन्तामन्यकेषांज्याका अधि धन्वसु |||
verses.transliteration: vayamindra tvāyavaḥ sakhitvamā rabhāmahe ṛtasya naḥpathā nayāti viśvāni duritā nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃjyākā adhi dhanvasu

translations.griffith: Close to thy friendship do we cling, O Indra, and depend, or, thee.  Lead us beyond all pain and grief along the path of holy Law.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं सु तवमिन्द्र तां शिक्ष या दोहते परति वरंजरित्रे अछिद्रोध्नी पीपयद यथा नः सहस्रधारापयसा मही गौः |||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ su tvamindra tāṃ śikṣa yā dohate prati varaṃjaritre achidrodhnī pīpayad yathā naḥ sahasradhārāpayasā mahī ghauḥ

translations.griffith: Do thou bestow upon us her, O Indra, who yields according to the singer's longing,  That the great Cow may, with exhaustless udder, pouring a thousand streams, give milk to feed us.

verses.sanskrit: उभे यदिन्द्र रोदसी आपप्राथोषा इव महान्तं तवामहीनां सम्राजं चर्षणीनां देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद्भद्रा जनित्र्यजीजनत |||
verses.transliteration: ubhe yadindra rodasī āpaprāthoṣā iva mahāntaṃ tvāmahīnāṃ samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ devī janitryajījanadbhadrā janitryajījanat

translations.griffith: As, like the Morning, thou hast filled, O Indra, both the earth and heaven.  So as the Mighty One, great King of all the mighty world of men, the Goddess Mother brought thee forth, the Blessed Mother gave thee life.

verses.sanskrit: अव सम दुर्हणायतो मर्तस्य तनुहि सथिरम अधस्पदं तमीं कर्धि यो अस्मानादिदेशति देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद भद्राजनित्र्यजीजनत |||
verses.transliteration: ava sma durhaṇāyato martasya tanuhi sthiram adhaspadaṃ tamīṃ kṛdhi yo asmānādideśati devī janitryajījanad bhadrājanitryajījanat

translations.griffith: Relax that mortal's stubborn strength whose heart is bent on wickedness.  Trample him down beneath thy feet who watches for and aims at us. The Goddess Mother brought thee forth, the Blessed Mother gave thee life.

verses.sanskrit: अव तया बर्हतीरिषो विश्वश्चन्द्रा अमित्रहन शचीभिःशक्र धूनुहीन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिर्देवी जनित्र्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ava tyā bṛhatīriṣo viśvaścandrā amitrahan śacībhiḥśakra dhūnuhīndra viśvābhirūtibhirdevī janitry ...

translations.griffith: Shake down, O Slayer of the foe, those great all splendid enemies.  With all thy powers, O Śakra, all thine helps, O Indra, shake them down:

verses.sanskrit: अव यत तवं शतक्रतविन्द्र विश्वानि धूनुषे रयिंन सुन्वते सचा सहस्रिणीभिरूतिभिर्देवी जनित्र्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ava yat tvaṃ śatakratavindra viśvāni dhūnuṣe rayiṃna sunvate sacā sahasriṇībhirūtibhirdevī janitry ...

translations.griffith: As thou, O Śatakratu, thou, O Indrv, shakest all things down  As wealth for him who sheds the juice, with thine assistance thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit: अव सवेदा इवाभितो विष्वक पतन्तु दिद्यवः दूर्वाया इवतन्तवो वयस्मदेतु दुर्मतिर्देवी जनीत्र्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ava svedā ivābhito viṣvak patantu didyavaḥ dūrvāyā ivatantavo vyasmadetu durmatirdevī janītry ...

translations.griffith: Around, on every side like drops of sweat let lightning-flashes fall.  Let all malevolence pass away from us like threads of Darva grass.

verses.sanskrit: दीर्घं हयङकुशं यथा शक्तिं बिभर्षि मन्तुमः पूर्वेण मघवन पदाजो वयां यथा यमो देवी जनित्र्य... |||
verses.transliteration: dīrghaṃ hyaṅkuśaṃ yathā śaktiṃ bibharṣi mantumaḥ pūrveṇa maghavan padājo vayāṃ yathā yamo devī janitry...

translations.griffith: Thou bearest in thine hand a lance like a long hook, great Counsellor!  As with his foremost foot a goat, draw down the branch, O Maghavan.

verses.sanskrit: नकिर्देवा मिनीमसि नकिरा योपयामसि मन्त्रश्रुत्यंचरामसि पक्षेभिरपिकक्षेभिरत्राभि सं रभामहे |||
verses.transliteration: nakirdevā minīmasi nakirā yopayāmasi mantraśrutyaṃcarāmasi pakṣebhirapikakṣebhiratrābhi saṃ rabhāmahe

translations.griffith: Never, O Gods, do we offend, nor are we ever obstinate: we walk as holy texts command.  Closely we clasp and cling to you, cling to your sides, beneath your arms.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मिन वर्क्षे सुपलाशे देवैः सम्पिबते यमः अत्रा नोविश्पतिः पिता पुराणाननु वेनति |||
verses.transliteration: yasmin vṛkṣe supalāśe devaiḥ sampibate yamaḥ atrā noviśpatiḥ pitā purāṇānanu venati

translations.griffith: IN the Tree clothed with goodly leaves where Yama drinketh with the Gods,  The Father, Master of the house, tendeth with love our ancient Sires.

verses.sanskrit: पुराणाननुवेनन्तं चरन्तं पापयामुया असूयन्नभ्यचाक्षं तस्मा अस्प्र्हयं पुनः |||
verses.transliteration: purāṇānanuvenantaṃ carantaṃ pāpayāmuyā asūyannabhyacākṣaṃ tasmā aspṛhayaṃ punaḥ

translations.griffith: I looked reluctantly on him who cherishes those men of old,  On him who treads that evil path, and then I yearned for this again.

verses.sanskrit: यं कुमार नवं रथमचक्रं मनसाक्र्णोः एकेषंविश्वतः पराञ्चमपश्यन्नधि तिष्ठसि |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ kumāra navaṃ rathamacakraṃ manasākṛṇoḥ ekeṣaṃviśvataḥ prāñcamapaśyannadhi tiṣṭhasi

translations.griffith: Thou mountest, though thou dost not see, O Child, the new and wheel-less car  Which thou hast fashioned mentally, onepoled but turning every way.

verses.sanskrit: यं कुमार परावर्तयो रथं विप्रेभ्यस परि तंसामानु परावर्तत समितो नाव्याहितम |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ kumāra prāvartayo rathaṃ viprebhyas pari taṃsāmānu prāvartata samito nāvyāhitam

translations.griffith: The car which thou hast made to roll hitherward from the Sages, Child!  This hath the Sāman followed close, hence, laid together on a ship.

verses.sanskrit: कः कुमारमजनयद रथं को निरवर्तयत कः सवित तदद्य नो बरूयादनुदेयी यथाभवत |||
verses.transliteration: kaḥ kumāramajanayad rathaṃ ko niravartayat kaḥ svit tadadya no brūyādanudeyī yathābhavat

translations.griffith: Who was the father of the child? Who made the chariot roll away?  Who will this day declare to us how the funeral gift was made?

verses.sanskrit: यथाभवदनुदेयी ततो अग्रमजायत पुरस्ताद बुध्नाततः पश्चान निरयणं कर्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yathābhavadanudeyī tato aghramajāyata purastād budhnaātataḥ paścān nirayaṇaṃ kṛtam

translations.griffith: When the funeral gift was placed, straightway the point of flame appeared.  A depth extended in the front: a passage out was made behind.

verses.sanskrit: इदं यमस्य सादनं देवमानं यदुच्यते इयमस्यधम्यते नाळीरयं गीर्भिः परिष्क्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ yamasya sādanaṃ devamānaṃ yaducyate iyamasyadhamyate nāḷīrayaṃ ghīrbhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: Here is the seat where Yama dwells, that which is called the Home of Gods:  Here minstrels blow the flute for him here he is glorified with songs.

verses.sanskrit: केश्यग्निं केशी विषं केशी बिभर्ति रोदसी केशीविश्वं सवर्द्र्शे केशीदं जयोतिरुच्यते |||
verses.transliteration: keśyaghniṃ keśī viṣaṃ keśī bibharti rodasī keśīviśvaṃ svardṛśe keśīdaṃ jyotirucyate

translations.griffith: HE with the long loose locks supports Agni, and moisture, heaven, and earth:  He is all sky to look upon: he with long hair is called this light.

verses.sanskrit: मुनयो वातरशनाः पिशङगा वसते मला वातस्यानुध्राजिं यन्ति यद देवासो अविक्षत |||
verses.transliteration: munayo vātaraśanāḥ piśaṅghā vasate malā vātasyānudhrājiṃ yanti yad devāso avikṣata

translations.griffith: The Munis, girdled with the wind, wear garments soiled of yellow hue.  They, following the wind's swift course go where the Gods have gone before.

verses.sanskrit: उन्मदिता मौनेयन वाताना तस्थिमा वयम शरीरेदस्माकं यूयं मर्तासो अभि पश्यथ |||
verses.transliteration: unmaditā mauneyana vātānā tasthimā vayam śarīredasmākaṃ yūyaṃ martāso abhi paśyatha

translations.griffith: Transported with our Munihood we have pressed on into the winds:  You therefore, mortal men. behold our natural bodies and no more.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तरिक्षेण पतति विश्वा रूपावचाकशत मुनिर्देवस्य-देवस्य सौक्र्त्याय सखा हितः |||
verses.transliteration: antarikṣeṇa patati viśvā rūpāvacākaśat munirdevasya-devasya saukṛtyāya sakhā hitaḥ

translations.griffith: The Muni, made associate in the holy work of every God,  Looking upon all varied forms flies through the region of the air.

verses.sanskrit: वातस्याश्वो वायोः सखाथो देवेषितो मुनिः उभौसमुद्रावा कषेति यश्च पूर्व उतापरः |||
verses.transliteration: vātasyāśvo vāyoḥ sakhātho deveṣito muniḥ ubhausamudrāvā kṣeti yaśca pūrva utāparaḥ

translations.griffith: The Steed of Vāta, Vāyu's friend, the Muni, by the Gods impelled,  In both the oceans hath his home, in eastern and in western sea.

verses.sanskrit: अप्सरसां गन्धर्वाणां मर्गाणां चरणे चरन केशीकेतस्य विद्वान सखा सवादुर्मदिन्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: apsarasāṃ ghandharvāṇāṃ mṛghāṇāṃ caraṇe caran keśīketasya vidvān sakhā svādurmadintamaḥ

translations.griffith: Treading the path of sylvan beasts, Gandharvas, and Apsarases,  He with long locks, who knows the wish, is a sweet most delightful friend

verses.sanskrit: वायुरस्मा उपामन्थत पिनष्टि समा कुनन्नमा केशीविषस्य पात्रेण यद रुद्रेणापिबत सह |||
verses.transliteration: vāyurasmā upāmanthat pinaṣṭi smā kunannamā keśīviṣasya pātreṇa yad rudreṇāpibat saha

translations.griffith: Vāyu hath churned for him: for him he poundeth things most hard to bend,  When he with long loose locks hath drunk, with Rudra, water from the cup.

verses.sanskrit: उत देवा अवहितं देवा उन नयथा पुनः उतागश्चक्रुषं देवा देवा जीवयथा पुनः |||
verses.transliteration: uta devā avahitaṃ devā un nayathā punaḥ utāghaścakruṣaṃ devā devā jīvayathā punaḥ

translations.griffith: YE Gods, raise up once more the man whom ye have humbled and brought low.  O Gods, restore to life again the man who hatb committed sin.

verses.sanskrit: दवाविमौ वातौ वात आ सिन्धोरा परावतः दक्षन्ते अन्य आ वातु परान्यो वातु यद रपः |||
verses.transliteration: dvāvimau vātau vāta ā sindhorā parāvataḥ dakṣante anya ā vātu parānyo vātu yad rapaḥ

translations.griffith: Two several winds are blowing here, from Sindhu, from a distant land.  May one breathe energy to thee, the other blow disease away.

verses.sanskrit: आ वात वाहि भेषजं वि वात वाहि यद रपः तवं हिविश्वभेषजो देवानां दूत ईयसे |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāta vāhi bheṣajaṃ vi vāta vāhi yad rapaḥ tvaṃ hiviśvabheṣajo devānāṃ dūta īyase

translations.griffith: Hither, O Wind, blow healing balm, blow all disease away, thou Wind;  For thou who hast all medicine comest as envoy of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवागमं शन्तातिभिरथो अरिष्टतातिभिः दक्षन्ते भद्रमाभार्षं परा यक्ष्मं सुवामि ते |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvāghamaṃ śantātibhiratho ariṣṭatātibhiḥ dakṣante bhadramābhārṣaṃ parā yakṣmaṃ suvāmi te

translations.griffith: I am come nigh to thee with balms to give thee rest and keep thee safe.  I bring thee blessed strength, I drive thy weakening malady away.

verses.sanskrit: तरायन्तामिह देवास्त्रायतां मरुतां गणः तरायन्तां विश्वा भूतानि यथायमरपा असत |||
verses.transliteration: trāyantāmiha devāstrāyatāṃ marutāṃ ghaṇaḥ trāyantāṃ viśvā bhūtāni yathāyamarapā asat

translations.griffith: Here let the Gods deliver him, the Maruts’ band deliver him:  All things that be deliver him that he be freed from his disease.

verses.sanskrit: आप इद वा उ भेषजीरापो अमीवचातनीः आपःसर्वस्य भेषजीस्तास्ते कर्ण्वन्तु भेषजम |||
verses.transliteration: āpa id vā u bheṣajīrāpo amīvacātanīḥ āpaḥsarvasya bheṣajīstāste kṛṇvantu bheṣajam

translations.griffith: The Waters have their healing power, the Waters drive disease away.  The Waters have a balm for all: let them make medicine for thee.

verses.sanskrit: हस्ताभ्यां दशशाखा भयां जिह्वा वाचः पुरोगवी अनामयित्नुभ्यां तवा तभ्यां तवोप सप्र्शामसि |||
verses.transliteration: hastābhyāṃ daśaśākhā bhyāṃ jihvā vācaḥ puroghavī anāmayitnubhyāṃ tvā tabhyāṃ tvopa spṛśāmasi

translations.griffith: The tongue that leads the voice precedes. Then with our ten-fold branching hands,  With these two chasers of disease we stroke thee with a gentle touch.

verses.sanskrit: तव तय इन्द्र सख्येषु वह्नय रतं मन्वाना वयदर्दिरुर्वलम यत्रा दशस्यन्नुषसो रिणन्नपः कुत्सायमन्मन्नह्यश्च दंसयः |||
verses.transliteration: tava tya indra sakhyeṣu vahnaya ṛtaṃ manvānā vyadardirurvalam yatrā daśasyannuṣaso riṇannapaḥ kutsāyamanmannahyaśca daṃsayaḥ

translations.griffith: ALLIED with thee in friendship, Indra, these, thy priests, remembering Holy Law, rent Vṛtra limb from limb,  When they bestowed the Dawns and let the waters flow, and when thou didst chastise dragons at Kutsa's call.

verses.sanskrit: अवास्र्जः परस्वः शवञ्चयो गिरिनुदाज उस्रा अपिबोमधु परियम अवर्धयो वनिनो अस्य दंससा शुशोचसूर्य रतजातया गिरा |||
verses.transliteration: avāsṛjaḥ prasvaḥ śvañcayo ghirinudāja usrā apibomadhu priyam avardhayo vanino asya daṃsasā śuśocasūrya ṛtajātayā ghirā

translations.griffith: Thou sentest forth productive powers, clavest the hills, thou dravest forth the kine, thou drankest pleasant meath.  Thou gavest increase through this Tree's surpassing might. The Sun shone by the hymn that sprang from Holy Law.

verses.sanskrit: वि सूर्यो मध्ये अमुचद रथं दिवो विदद दासय परतिमानमार्यः दर्ळानि पिप्रोरसुरस्य मायिन इन्द्रो वयास्यच्चक्र्वान रजिश्वना |||
verses.transliteration: vi sūryo madhye amucad rathaṃ divo vidad dāsaya pratimānamāryaḥ dṛḷāni piprorasurasya māyina indro vyāsyaccakṛvān ṛjiśvanā

translations.griffith: In the mid-way of heaven the Sun unyoked his car: the Ārya found a match to meet his Dam foe.  Associate with Ṛjiśvan Indra overthrew the solid forts of Pipru, conjuring Asura.

verses.sanskrit: अनाध्र्ष्टानि धर्षितो वयास्यन निधीन्रदेवानम्र्णदयास्यः मासेव सूर्यो वसु पुर्यमा ददे गर्णानःशत्रून्रश्र्णाद विरुक्मता |||
verses.transliteration: anādhṛṣṭāni dhṛṣito vyāsyan nidhīnradevānamṛṇadayāsyaḥ māseva sūryo vasu puryamā dade ghṛṇānaḥśatrūnraśṛṇād virukmatā

translations.griffith: He boldly cast down forts which none had e’er assailed: unwearied he destroycd the godless treasure-stores.  Like Sun and Moon he took the stronghold's wealth away, and, praised in song, demolished foes with flashing dart.

verses.sanskrit: अयुद्धसेनो विभ्वा विभिन्दता दाशद वर्त्रहा तुज्यानि तेजते इन्द्रस्य वज्रादबिभेदभिश्नथः पराक्रामच्छुन्ध्युरजहदुष अनः |||
verses.transliteration: ayuddhaseno vibhvā vibhindatā dāśad vṛtrahā tujyāni tejate indrasya vajrādabibhedabhiśnathaḥ prākrāmacchundhyurajahaduṣa anaḥ

translations.griffith: Armed with resistless weapons, with vast power to cleave, the Vṛtra-slayer whets his darts and deals fordi wounds.  Bright Uṣas was afraid of Indra's slaughtering bolt: she went upon her way and left her chariot there.

verses.sanskrit: एता तया ते शरुत्यानि केवला यदेक एकमक्र्णोरयज्ञम मासां विधानमदधा अधि दयवि तवया विभिन्नम्भरति परधिं पिता |||
verses.transliteration: etā tyā te śrutyāni kevalā yadeka ekamakṛṇorayajñam māsāṃ vidhānamadadhā adhi dyavi tvayā vibhinnambharati pradhiṃ pitā

translations.griffith: These are thy famous exploits, only thine, when thou alone hast left the other reft of sacrifice.  Thou in the heavens hast set the ordering of the Moons: the Father bears the felly portioned out by thee.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्यरश्मिर्हरिकेशः पुरस्तात सविता जयोतिरुदयानजस्रम तस्य पूषा परसवे याति विद्वान सम्पश्यन्विश्वा भुवनानि गोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: sūryaraśmirharikeśaḥ purastāt savitā jyotirudayānajasram tasya pūṣā prasave yāti vidvān sampaśyanviśvā bhuvanāni ghopāḥ

translations.griffith: SAVITAR, golden-haired, hath lifted eastward, bright With the sunbeams, his eternal lustre;  He in whose energy wise Pūṣan marches, surveying all existence like a herdsman.

verses.sanskrit: नर्चक्षा एष दिवो मध्य आस्त आपप्रिवान रोदसीन्तरिक्षम स विश्वाचीरभि चष्टे घर्ताचीरन्तरापूर्वमपरं च केतुम |||
verses.transliteration: nṛcakṣā eṣa divo madhya āsta āpaprivān rodasīantarikṣam sa viśvācīrabhi caṣṭe ghṛtācīrantarāpūrvamaparaṃ ca ketum

translations.griffith: Beholding men he sits amid the heaven filling the two world-halves and air's wide region.  He looks upon the rich far-spreading pastures between the eastern and the western limit.

verses.sanskrit: रायो बुध्नः संगमनो वसूनां विश्वा रूपाभि चष्टेशचीभिः देव इव सविता सत्यधर्मेन्द्रो न तस्थौसमरे धनानाम |||
verses.transliteration: rāyo budhnaḥ saṃghamano vasūnāṃ viśvā rūpābhi caṣṭeśacībhiḥ deva iva savitā satyadharmendro na tasthausamare dhanānām

translations.griffith: He, root of wealth, the gatherer-up of treasures, looks with his might on every form and figure.  Savitar, like a Godẉhose Law is constant, stands in the battle for the spoil like Indra.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वावसुं सोम गन्धर्वमापो दद्र्शुषीस्तद रतेना वयायन तदन्ववैदिन्द्रो रारहाण आसां परि सुर्यस्यपरिधिन्रपश्यत |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāvasuṃ soma ghandharvamāpo dadṛśuṣīstad ṛtenā vyāyan tadanvavaidindro rārahāṇa āsāṃ pari suryasyaparidhinrapaśyat

translations.griffith: Waters from sacrifice came to the Gandharva Visvavasu, O Soma, when they saw him.  Indra, approaching quickly, marked their going, and looked around upon the Sun's enclosures.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वावसुरभि तन नो गर्णातु दिव्यो गन्धर्वो रजसोविमानः यद वा घा सत्यमुत यन न विद्म धियोहिन्वानो धिय इन नो अव्याः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāvasurabhi tan no ghṛṇātu divyo ghandharvo rajasovimānaḥ yad vā ghā satyamuta yan na vidma dhiyohinvāno dhiya in no avyāḥ

translations.griffith: This song Visvavasu shall sing us, meter of air's mid-realm celestial Gandharva,  That we may know aright both truth and falsehood: may he inspire our thoughts and help our praises.

verses.sanskrit: सस्निमविन्दच्चरणे नदीनामपाव्र्णोद दुरो अश्मव्रजानाम परासां गन्धर्वो अम्र्तानि वोचदिन्द्रो दक्षं परि जानादहीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: sasnimavindaccaraṇe nadīnāmapāvṛṇod duro aśmavrajānām prāsāṃ ghandharvo amṛtāni vocadindro dakṣaṃ pari jānādahīnām

translations.griffith: In the floods' track he found the bootyseeker: the rocky cow-pen's doors he threw wide open.  These, the Gandharva told him, Rowed with Amṛta. Indra knew well the puissancc of the dragons.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तव शरवो वयो महि भराजन्ते अर्चयो विभावसो बर्हद्भानो शवसा वाजमुक्थ्यं दधासि दाशुषे कवे |||
verses.transliteration: aghne tava śravo vayo mahi bhrājante arcayo vibhāvaso bṛhadbhāno śavasā vājamukthyaṃ dadhāsi dāśuṣe kave

translations.griffith: AGNI, life-power and fame are thine: thy fires blaze mightily, thou rich in wealth of beams!  Sage, passing bright, thou givest to the worshipper, with strength, the food that merits laud.

verses.sanskrit: पावकवर्चाः शुक्रवर्चा अनूनवर्चा उदियर्षि भानुना पुत्रो मातरा विचरन्नुपावसि पर्णक्षि रोदसी उभे |||
verses.transliteration: pāvakavarcāḥ śukravarcā anūnavarcā udiyarṣi bhānunā putro mātarā vicarannupāvasi pṛṇakṣi rodasī ubhe

translations.griffith: With brilliant, purifying sheen, with perfect sheen thou liftest up thyself in light.  Thou, visiting both thy Mothers, aidest them as Son: thou joinest close the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्जो नपाज्जातवेदः सुशस्तिभिर्मन्दस्व धीतिभिर्हितः तवे इषः सं दधुर्भूरिवर्पसश्चित्रोतयो वामजाताः |||
verses.transliteration: ūrjo napājjātavedaḥ suśastibhirmandasva dhītibhirhitaḥ tve iṣaḥ saṃ dadhurbhūrivarpasaścitrotayo vāmajātāḥ

translations.griffith: O Jātavedas, Son of Strength, rejoice ihyself, gracious, in our fair hymns and songs.  In thee are treasured various forms of strengthening food, born nobly and of wondrous help.

verses.sanskrit: इरज्यन्नग्ने परथयस्व जन्तुभिरस्मे रायो अमर्त्य सदर्शतस्य वपुषो वि राजसि पर्णक्षि सानसिं करतुम |||
verses.transliteration: irajyannaghne prathayasva jantubhirasme rāyo amartya sadarśatasya vapuṣo vi rājasi pṛṇakṣi sānasiṃ kratum

translations.griffith: Agni, spread forth, as Ruler, over living things: give wealth to us, Immortal God.  Thou shinest out from beauty fair to look upon: thou leadest us to conquering power.

verses.sanskrit: इष्कर्तारमध्वरस्य परचेतसं कषयन्तं राधसो महः रातिं वामस्य सुभगां महीमिषं दधासि सानसिंरयिम |||
verses.transliteration: iṣkartāramadhvarasya pracetasaṃ kṣayantaṃ rādhaso mahaḥ rātiṃ vāmasya subhaghāṃ mahīmiṣaṃ dadhāsi sānasiṃrayim

translations.griffith: To him, the wise, who orders sacrifice, who hath great riches un der his control,  Thou givest blest award of good, and plenteous food, givest him wealth that conquers all.

verses.sanskrit: रतावानं महिषं विश्वदर्शतमग्निं सुम्नाय दधिरेपुरो जनाः शरुत्कर्णं सप्रथस्तमं तवा गिरा दैव्यम्मानुषा युगा |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtāvānaṃ mahiṣaṃ viśvadarśatamaghniṃ sumnāya dadhirepuro janāḥ śrutkarṇaṃ saprathastamaṃ tvā ghirā daivyammānuṣā yughā

translations.griffith: The men have set before them them for their welfare Agni, strong, visible to all, the Holy.  Thee, Godlike One, with ears to hear, most famous, men's generations magnify with praise-songs.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने अछा वदेह नः परत्यं नः सुमना भव पर नोयछ विशस पते धनदा असि नस्त्वम |||
verses.transliteration: aghne achā vadeha naḥ pratyaṃ naḥ sumanā bhava pra noyacha viśas pate dhanadā asi nastvam

translations.griffith: TURN hither, Agni, speak to us: come to us with a gracious mind.  Enrich us, Master of the house: thou art the Giver of our wealth.

verses.sanskrit: पर नो यछत्वर्यमा पर भगः पर बर्हस्पतिः परदेवाः परोत सून्र्ता रायो देवी ददातु नः |||
verses.transliteration: pra no yachatvaryamā pra bhaghaḥ pra bṛhaspatiḥ pradevāḥ prota sūnṛtā rāyo devī dadātu naḥ

translations.griffith: Let Aryarnan vouchsafe us wealth, and Bhaga, and Bṛhaspati.  Let the Gods give their gifts, and let Sūnṛtā, Goddess, grant us wealth.

verses.sanskrit: सोमं राजानमवसे.अग्निं गीर्भिर्हवामहे आदित्यान्विष्णुं सूर्यं बरह्माणं च बर्हस्पतिम |||
verses.transliteration: somaṃ rājānamavase.aghniṃ ghīrbhirhavāmahe ādityānviṣṇuṃ sūryaṃ brahmāṇaṃ ca bṛhaspatim

translations.griffith: We call King Soma to our aid, and Agni with our songs and hymns,  Ādityas, Viṣṇu, Sūrya, and the Brahman Priest Bṛhaspati.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रवायू बर्हस्पतिं सुहवेह हवामहे यथा नः सर्वैज्जनः संगत्यां सुमना असत |||
verses.transliteration: indravāyū bṛhaspatiṃ suhaveha havāmahe yathā naḥ sarvaijjanaḥ saṃghatyāṃ sumanā asat

translations.griffith: Indra, Vāyu, Bṛhaspati, Gods swift to listen, we invoke,  That in the synod all the folk may be benevolent to us.

verses.sanskrit: अर्यमणं बर्हस्पतिमिन्द्रं दानाय चोदय वातंविष्णुं सरस्वतीं सवितारं च वाजिनम |||
verses.transliteration: aryamaṇaṃ bṛhaspatimindraṃ dānāya codaya vātaṃviṣṇuṃ sarasvatīṃ savitāraṃ ca vājinam

translations.griffith: Urge Aryaman to send us gifts, and Indra, and Bṛhaspati,  Vāta, Viṣṇu, Sarasvatī and the Strong Courser Savitar.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अग्ने अग्निभिर्ब्रह्म यज्ञं च वर्धय तवं नोदेवतातये रायो दानाय चोदय |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne aghnibhirbrahma yajñaṃ ca vardhaya tvaṃ nodevatātaye rāyo dānāya codaya

translations.griffith: Do thou, O Agni, with thy fires strengthen our prayer and sacrifice:  Urge givers to bestow their wealth to aid our service of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अयमग्ने जरिता तवे अभूदपि सहसः सूनो नह्यन्यदस्त्याप्यम भद्रं हि शर्म तरिवरूथमस्ति त आरेहिंसानामप दिद्युमा कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: ayamaghne jaritā tve abhūdapi sahasaḥ sūno nahyanyadastyāpyam bhadraṃ hi śarma trivarūthamasti ta ārehiṃsānāmapa didyumā kṛdhi

translations.griffith: WITH thee, O Agni, was this singer of the laud: he hath no other kinship, O thou Son of Strength.  Thou givest blessed shelter with a triple guard. Keep the destructive lightning far away from us.

verses.sanskrit: परवत ते अग्ने जनिमा पितूयतः साचीव विश्वा भुवना नय्र्ञ्जसे पर सप्तयः पर सनिषन्त नो धियः पुरश्चरन्तिपशुपा इव तमना |||
verses.transliteration: pravat te aghne janimā pitūyataḥ sācīva viśvā bhuvanā nyṛñjase pra saptayaḥ pra saniṣanta no dhiyaḥ puraścarantipaśupā iva tmanā

translations.griffith: Thy birth who seekest food is in the falling flood, Agni: as Comrade thou winnest all living things.  Our coursers and our songs shall be victorious: they of themselves advance like one who guards the herd.

verses.sanskrit: उत वा उ परि वर्णक्षि बप्सद बहोरग्न उलपस्य सवधावः उत खिल्या उर्वराणां भवन्ति मा ते हेतिं तविषींचुक्रुधाम |||
verses.transliteration: uta vā u pari vṛṇakṣi bapsad bahoraghna ulapasya svadhāvaḥ uta khilyā urvarāṇāṃ bhavanti mā te hetiṃ taviṣīṃcukrudhāma

translations.griffith: And thou, O Agni, thou of Godlike nature, sparest the stones, while caring up the brushwood.  Then are thy tracks like deserts in the corn-lands. Let us not stir to wrath thy mighty arrow.

verses.sanskrit: यदुद्वतो निवतो यासि बप्सत पर्थगेषि परगर्धिनीवसेना यदा ते वातो अनुवाति शोचिर्वप्तेव शमश्रु वपसिप्र भूम |||
verses.transliteration: yadudvato nivato yāsi bapsat pṛthagheṣi praghardhinīvasenā yadā te vāto anuvāti śocirvapteva śmaśru vapasipra bhūma

translations.griffith: O'er hills through vales devouring as thou goest, thou partest like an army fain for booty  As when a barber shaves a beard, thou shavest earth when the wind blows on thy flame and fans it.

verses.sanskrit: परत्यस्य शरेणयो दद्र्श्र एकं नियानं बहवो रथासः बाहू यदग्ने अनुमर्म्र्जानो नयंं उत्तानामन्वेषिभूमिम |||
verses.transliteration: pratyasya śreṇayo dadṛśra ekaṃ niyānaṃ bahavo rathāsaḥ bāhū yadaghne anumarmṛjāno nyaṃṃ uttānāmanveṣibhūmim

translations.griffith: Apparent are his lines as he approaches the course is single, but the cars are many,  When, Agni, thou, making thine arms resplendent, advancest o’er the land spread out beneath thee.

verses.sanskrit: उत ते शुष्मा जिहतामुत ते अर्चिरुत ते अग्ने शशमानस्यवाजाः उच्छ्वञ्चस्व नि नम वर्धमान आ तवाद्य विश्वेवसवः सदन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: ut te śuṣmā jihatāmut te arcirut te aghne śaśamānasyavājāḥ ucchvañcasva ni nama vardhamāna ā tvādya viśvevasavaḥ sadantu

translations.griffith: Now let thy strength, thy burning flames fly upward, thine energies, O Agni, as thou toilest.  Gape widely, bend thee, waxing in thy vigour: let all the Vasus sit this day beside thee.

verses.sanskrit: अपामिदं नययनं समुद्रस्य निवेशनम अन्यंक्र्णुष्वेतः पन्थां तेन याहि वशाननु |||
verses.transliteration: apāmidaṃ nyayanaṃ samudrasya niveśanam anyaṃkṛṇuṣvetaḥ panthāṃ tena yāhi vaśānanu

translations.griffith: This is the waters' reservoir, the great abode of gathered streams.  Take thou another path than this, and as thou listest walk thereon.

verses.sanskrit: आयने ते परायणे दूर्वा रोहन्तु पुष्पिणिः हरदाश्चपुण्डरीकाणि समुद्रस्य गर्हा इमे |||
verses.transliteration: āyane te parāyaṇe dūrvā rohantu puṣpiṇiḥ hradāścapuṇḍarīkāṇi samudrasya ghṛhā ime

translations.griffith: On thy way hitherward and hence let flowery Durva grass spring up  Let there be lakes with lotus blooms. These are the mansions of the flood.

verses.sanskrit: तयं चिदत्रिं रतजुरमर्थमश्वं न यातवे कक्षिवन्तं यदी पुना रथं न कर्णुथो नवम |||
verses.transliteration: tyaṃ cidatriṃ ṛtajuramarthamaśvaṃ na yātave kakṣivantaṃ yadī punā rathaṃ na kṛṇutho navam

translations.griffith: YE made that Atri, worn with eld, free as a horse to win the goal.  When ye restored to youth and strength Kakṣīvān like a car renewed,

verses.sanskrit: तयं चिदश्वं न वाजिनमरेणवो यमत्नत दर्ळंग्रन्थिं न वि षयतमत्रिं यविष्ठमा रजः |||
verses.transliteration: tyaṃ cidaśvaṃ na vājinamareṇavo yamatnata dṛḷaṃghranthiṃ na vi ṣyatamatriṃ yaviṣṭhamā rajaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye freed that Atri like a horse, and brought him newly-born to earth.  Ye loosed him like a firm-tied knot which Gods unsoiled by dust had bound.

verses.sanskrit: नरा दंसिष्ठवत्रये शुभ्रा सिषासतं धियः अथा हि वां दिवो नरा पुन सतोमो न विशसे |||
verses.transliteration: narā daṃsiṣṭhavatraye śubhrā siṣāsataṃ dhiyaḥ athā hi vāṃ divo narā puna stomo na viśase

translations.griffith: Heroes who showed most wondrous power to Atri, strive to win fair songs;  For then, O Heroes of the sky, your hymn of praise shall cease no more.

verses.sanskrit: चिते तद वां सुराधसा रातिः सुमतिरश्विना आ यन्नः सदने पर्थौ समने पर्षथो नरा |||
verses.transliteration: cite tad vāṃ surādhasā rātiḥ sumatiraśvinā ā yannaḥ sadane pṛthau samane parṣatho narā

translations.griffith: This claims your notice, Bounteous Gods! - oblation, Aśvins! and our love,  That ye, O Heroes, in the fight may bring us safe to ample room.

verses.sanskrit: युवं भुज्युं समुद्र आ रजसः पार ईङखितम यातमछा पतत्रिभिर्नासत्या सातये कर्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ bhujyuṃ samudra ā rajasaḥ pāra īṅkhitam yātamachā patatribhirnāsatyā sātaye kṛtam

translations.griffith: Ye Twain to Bhujyu tossed about in ocean at the region's end,  Nāsatyas, with your winged sterds came nigh, and gave him strength to win.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां सुम्नैः शम्यू इव मंहिष्ठा विश्ववेदसा समस्मे भूषतं नरोत्सं न पिप्युषीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ sumnaiḥ śamyū iva maṃhiṣṭhā viśvavedasā samasme bhūṣataṃ narotsaṃ na pipyuṣīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Come with your joys, most liberal Gods, Lords of all treasures, bringing weal.  Like fresh full waters to a well, so, Heroes come and be with us.

verses.sanskrit: अयं हि ते अमर्त्य इन्दुरत्यो न पत्यते दक्षो विश्वायुर्वेधसे |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ hi te amartya induratyo na patyate dakṣo viśvāyurvedhase

translations.griffith: THIS deathless Indu, like a steed, strong and of full vitality,  Belongs to thee, the Orderer.

verses.sanskrit: अयमस्मासु काव्य रभुर्वज्रो दास्वते अयं बिभर्त्यूर्ध्वक्र्शनं मदं रभुर्न कर्त्व्यं मदम |||
verses.transliteration: ayamasmāsu kāvya ṛbhurvajro dāsvate ayaṃ bibhartyūrdhvakṛśanaṃ madaṃ ṛbhurna kṛtvyaṃ madam

translations.griffith: Here, by us, for the worshipper, is the wise bolt that works with skill.  It brings the bubbling beverage as a dexterous man brings the effectual strong drink.

verses.sanskrit: घर्षुः शयेनाय कर्त्वन आसु सवासु वंसगः अव दीधेदहीशुवः |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛṣuḥ śyenāya kṛtvana āsu svāsu vaṃsaghaḥ ava dīdhedahīśuvaḥ

translations.griffith: Impetuous Ahīśuva, a bull among cows of his,  looked down upon the restless Hawk.

verses.sanskrit: यं सुपर्णः परावतः शयेनस्य पुत्र आभरत शतचक्रं यो.अह्यो वर्तनिः |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ suparṇaḥ parāvataḥ śyenasya putra ābharat śatacakraṃ yo.ahyo vartaniḥ

translations.griffith: That the strong-pinioned Bird hath brought, Child of the Falcon, from afar,  What moves upon a hundred wheels along the female Dragon's path.

verses.sanskrit: यं ते शयेनश्चारुमव्र्कं पदाभरदरुणं मानमन्धसः एना वयो वि तार्यायुर्जीवस एना जागारबन्धुता |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ te śyenaścārumavṛkaṃ padābharadaruṇaṃ mānamandhasaḥ enā vayo vi tāryāyurjīvasa enā jāghārabandhutā

translations.griffith: Which, fair, unrobbed, the Falcon brought thee in his foot, the red-hued dwelling of the juice;  Through this came vital power which lengthens out our days, and kinship through its help awoke.

verses.sanskrit: एवा तदिन्द्र इन्दुना देवेषु चिद धारयाते महि तयजः करत्वा वयो वि तार्यायुः सुक्रतो करत्वायमस्मदासुतः |||
verses.transliteration: evā tadindra indunā deveṣu cid dhārayāte mahi tyajaḥ kratvā vayo vi tāryāyuḥ sukrato kratvāyamasmadāsutaḥ

translations.griffith: So Indra is by lndu's power; e’en among Gods will it repel great treachery.  Wisdom, Most Sapient One, brings force that lengthens life. May wisdom bring the juice to us.

verses.sanskrit: इमां खनाम्योषधिं वीरुधं बलवत्तमाम ययासपत्नीं बाधते यया संविन्दते पतिम |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ khanāmyoṣadhiṃ vīrudhaṃ balavattamām yayāsapatnīṃ bādhate yayā saṃvindate patim

translations.griffith: FROM out the earth I dig this plant, a herb of most effectual power,  Wherewith one quells the rival wife and gains the husband for oneself.

verses.sanskrit: उत्तानपर्णे सुभगे देवजूते सहस्वति सपत्नीं मे पराधम पतिं मे केवलं कुरु |||
verses.transliteration: uttānaparṇe subhaghe devajūte sahasvati sapatnīṃ me parādhama patiṃ me kevalaṃ kuru

translations.griffith: Auspicious, with expanded leaves, sent by the Gods, victorious plant,  Blow thou the rival wife away, and make my husband only mine.

verses.sanskrit: उत्तराहमुत्तर उत्तरेदुत्तराभ्यः अथा सपत्नी याममाधरा साधराभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: uttarāhamuttara uttareduttarābhyaḥ athā sapatnī yāmamādharā sādharābhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Stronger am 1, O Stronger One, yea, mightier than the mightier;  And she who is my rival wife is lower than the lowest dames.

verses.sanskrit: नह्यस्या नाम गर्भ्णामि नो अस्मिन रमते जने परामेवपरावतं सपत्नीं गमयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: nahyasyā nāma ghṛbhṇāmi no asmin ramate jane parāmevaparāvataṃ sapatnīṃ ghamayāmasi

translations.griffith: Her very name I utter not: she takes no pleasure in this man.  Far into distance most remote drive we the rival wife away.

verses.sanskrit: अहमस्मि सहमानाथ तवमसि सासहिः उभे सहस्वतीभूत्वी सपत्नीं मे सहावहै |||
verses.transliteration: ahamasmi sahamānātha tvamasi sāsahiḥ ubhe sahasvatībhūtvī sapatnīṃ me sahāvahai

translations.griffith: I am the conqueror, and thou, thou also act victorious:  As victory attends us both we will subdue my fellow-wife.

verses.sanskrit: उप ते.अधां सहमानामभि तवाधां सहीयसा मामनुप्र ते मनो वत्सं गौरिव धावतु पथा वारिव धावतु |||
verses.transliteration: upa te.adhāṃ sahamānāmabhi tvādhāṃ sahīyasā māmanupra te mano vatsaṃ ghauriva dhāvatu pathā vāriva dhāvatu

translations.griffith: I have gained thee for vanquisher, have grasped thee with a stronger spell.  As a cow hastens to her calf, so let thy spirit speed te me, hasten like water on its way.

verses.sanskrit: अरण्यान्यरण्यान्यसौ या परेव नश्यसि कथाग्रामं न पर्छसि न तवा भीरिव विन्दती.अ.अ.अन |||
verses.transliteration: araṇyānyaraṇyānyasau yā preva naśyasi kathāghrāmaṃ na pṛchasi na tvā bhīriva vindatī.a.a.an

translations.griffith: GODDESS of wild and forest who seemest to vanish from the sight.  How is it that thou seekest not the village? Art thou not afraid?

verses.sanskrit: वर्षारवाय वदते यदुपावति चिच्चिकः आघाटिभिरिवधावयन्नरण्यानिर्महीयते |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣāravāya vadate yadupāvati ciccikaḥ āghāṭibhirivadhāvayannaraṇyānirmahīyate

translations.griffith: What time the grasshopper replies and swells the shrill cicala's voice,  Seeming to sound with tinkling bells, the Lady of the Wood exults.

verses.sanskrit: उत गाव इवादन्त्युत वेश्मेव दर्श्यते उतो अरण्यानिःसायं शकटीरिव सर्जति |||
verses.transliteration: uta ghāva ivādantyuta veśmeva dṛśyate uto araṇyāniḥsāyaṃ śakaṭīriva sarjati

translations.griffith: And, yonder, cattle seem to graze, what seems a dwelling-place appears:  Or else at eve the Lady of the Forest seems to free the wains.

verses.sanskrit: गामङगैष आ हवयति दार्वङगैषो अपावधीत वसन्नरण्यान्यां सायमक्रुक्षदिति मन्यते |||
verses.transliteration: ghāmaṅghaiṣa ā hvayati dārvaṅghaiṣo apāvadhīt vasannaraṇyānyāṃ sāyamakrukṣaditi manyate

translations.griffith: Here one is calling to his cow, another there hath felled a tree:  At eve the dweller in the wood fancies that somebody hath screamed.

verses.sanskrit: न वा अरण्यानिर्हन्त्यन्यश्चेन नाभिगछति सवादोःफलस्य जग्ध्वाय यथाकामं नि पद्यते |||
verses.transliteration: na vā araṇyānirhantyanyaścen nābhighachati svādoḥphalasya jaghdhvāya yathākāmaṃ ni padyate

translations.griffith: The Goddess never slays, unless some murderous enemy approach.  Man eats of savoury fruit and then takes, even as he wills, his rest.

verses.sanskrit: आञ्जनगन्धिं सुरभिं बह्वन्नामक्र्षीवलाम पराहम्म्र्गाणां मातरमरण्यानिमशंसिषम |||
verses.transliteration: āñjanaghandhiṃ surabhiṃ bahvannāmakṛṣīvalām prāhammṛghāṇāṃ mātaramaraṇyānimaśaṃsiṣam

translations.griffith: Now have I praised the Forest Queen, sweet-scented, redolent of balm,  The Mother of all sylvan things, who tills not but hath stores of food.

verses.sanskrit: शरत ते दधामि परथमाय मन्यवे.अहन यद वर्त्रं नर्यंविवेरपः उभे यत तवा भवतो रोदसी अनु रेजतेशुष्मात पर्थिवी चिदद्रिवः |||
verses.transliteration: śrat te dadhāmi prathamāya manyave.ahan yad vṛtraṃ naryaṃviverapaḥ ubhe yat tvā bhavato rodasī anu rejateśuṣmāt pṛthivī cidadrivaḥ

translations.griffith: I TRUST in thy first wrathful deed, O Indra, when thou slewest Vṛtra and didst work to profit man;  What time the two world-halves fell short of thee in might, and the earth trembled at thy force, O Thunder-anned.

verses.sanskrit: तवं मायाभिरनवद्य मायिनं शरवस्यता मनसा वर्त्रमर्दयः तवमिन नरो वर्णते गविष्टिषु तवां विश्वासुहव्यास्विष्टिषु |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ māyābhiranavadya māyinaṃ śravasyatā manasā vṛtramardayaḥ tvamin naro vṛṇate ghaviṣṭiṣu tvāṃ viśvāsuhavyāsviṣṭiṣu

translations.griffith: Thou with thy magic powers didst rend the conjurer Vṛtra, O Blameless One, with heart that longed for fame.  Heroes elect thee when they battle for the prey, thee in all sacrifices worthy of renown.

verses.sanskrit: ऐषु चाकन्धि पुरुहूत सूरिषु वर्धासो ये मघवन्नानशुर्मघम अर्चन्ति तोके तनये परिष्टिषु मेधसाता वाजिनमह्रये धने |||
verses.transliteration: aiṣu cākandhi puruhūta sūriṣu vṛdhāso ye maghavannānaśurmagham arcanti toke tanaye pariṣṭiṣu medhasātā vājinamahraye dhane

translations.griffith: God Much-invoked, take pleasure in these princes here, who, thine exalters, Maghavan, have come to wealth.  In synods, when the rite succeeds, they hymn the Strong for sons and progeny and riches undisturbed.

verses.sanskrit: स इन नु रायः सुभ्र्तस्य चाकनन मदं यो अस्य रंह्यंचिकेतति तवाव्र्धो मघवन दाश्वध्वरो मक्षू स वाजम्भरते धना नर्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa in nu rāyaḥ subhṛtasya cākanan madaṃ yo asya raṃhyaṃciketati tvāvṛdho maghavan dāśvadhvaro makṣū sa vājambharate dhanā nṛbhiḥ

translations.griffith: That man shall find delight in well-protected wealth whose care provides for him the quick-sought joyous draught.  Bringing oblations, strengthened Maghavan, by thee, he swiftly wins the spoil with heroes in the fight.

verses.sanskrit: तवं शर्धाय महिना गर्णान उरु कर्धि मघवञ्छग्धिरायः तवं नो मित्रो वरुणो न मायी पित्वो न दस्मदयसे विभक्ता |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ śardhāya mahinā ghṛṇāna uru kṛdhi maghavañchaghdhirāyaḥ tvaṃ no mitro varuṇo na māyī pitvo na dasmadayase vibhaktā

translations.griffith: Now for our band, O Maghavan, when lauded, make ample room with might, and grant us riches.  Magician thou, our Varuṇa and Mitra, deal food to us, O Wondrous, as Dispenser.

verses.sanskrit: सुष्वाणास इन्द्र सतुमसि तवा ससवांसश्च तुविन्र्म्णवाजम आ नो भर सुवितं यस्य चाकन तमना तनासनुयाम तवोताः |||
verses.transliteration: suṣvāṇāsa indra stumasi tvā sasavāṃsaśca tuvinṛmṇavājam ā no bhara suvitaṃ yasya cākan tmanā tanāsanuyāma tvotāḥ

translations.griffith: WHEN we have pressed the juice we laud thee, Indra, and when, Most Valorous we have won the booty.  Bring us prosperity, as each desires it under thine own protection may we conquer.

verses.sanskrit: रष्वस्त्वमिन्द्र शूर जातो दासीर्विशः सूर्येणसह्याः गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळमप्सु बिभ्र्मसिप्रस्रवणे न सोमम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣvastvamindra śūra jāto dāsīrviśaḥ sūryeṇasahyāḥ ghuhā hitaṃ ghuhyaṃ ghūḷamapsu bibhṛmasiprasravaṇe na somam

translations.griffith: Sublime from birth, mayst thou O Indra, Hero, with Sūrya overcome the Dāsa races.  As by a fountain's side, we bring the Soma that lay concealed, close-hidden in the waters.

verses.sanskrit: अर्यो वा गिरो अभ्यर्च विद्वान रषीणां विप्रः सुमतिंचकानः ते सयाम ये रणयन्त सोमैरेनोत तुभ्यंरथोळ भक्षैः |||
verses.transliteration: aryo vā ghiro abhyarca vidvān ṛṣīṇāṃ vipraḥ sumatiṃcakānaḥ te syāma ye raṇayanta somairenota tubhyaṃrathoḷa bhakṣaiḥ

translations.griffith: Answer the votary's hymns, for these thou knowest, craving the Ṛṣis’ prayer, thyself a Singer  May we be they who take delight in Somas: these with sweet food for thee, O Chariot-rider.

verses.sanskrit: इमा बरह्मेन्द्र तुभ्यं शंसि दा नर्भ्यो नर्णां शूरशवः तेभिर्भव सक्रतुर्येषु चाकन्नुत तरायस्वग्र्णत उत सतीन |||
verses.transliteration: imā brahmendra tubhyaṃ śaṃsi dā nṛbhyo nṛṇāṃ śūraśavaḥ tebhirbhava sakraturyeṣu cākannuta trāyasvaghṛṇata uta stīn

translations.griffith: These holy prayers, O Indra, have I sung thee: grant to the men the strength of men, thou Hero.  Be of one mind with those in whom thou joyest: keep thou the singers safe and their companions.

verses.sanskrit: शरुधी हवमिन्द्र शूर पर्थ्या उत सतवसे वेन्यस्यार्कैः आ यस्ते योनिं घर्तवन्तमस्वारूर्मिर्न निम्नैर्द्रवयन्त वक्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: śrudhī havamindra śūra pṛthyā uta stavase venyasyārkaiḥ ā yaste yoniṃ ghṛtavantamasvārūrmirna nimnairdravayanta vakvāḥ

translations.griffith: Listen to Pṛthi's call, heroic Indra, and be thou lauded by the hymns of Venya,  Him who hath sung thee to thine oil-rich dwelling, whose rolling songs have sped thee like a torrent.

verses.sanskrit: सविता यन्त्रैः पर्थिवीमरम्णादस्कम्भने सविता दयामद्रंहत अश्वमिवाधुक्षद धुनिमन्तरिक्षमतूर्तेबद्धं सविता समुद्रम |||
verses.transliteration: savitā yantraiḥ pṛthivīmaramṇādaskambhane savitā dyāmadṛṃhat aśvamivādhukṣad dhunimantarikṣamatūrtebaddhaṃ savitā samudram

translations.griffith: SAVITAR fixed the earth with bands to bind it, and made heaven stedfast where no prop supported.  Savitar milked, as ’twere a restless courser, air, sea bound fast to what no foot had trodden.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रा समुद्र सकभितो वयौनदपां नपात सविता तस्यवेद अतो भूरत आ उत्थितं रजो.अतो दयावाप्र्थिवीप्रथेताम |||
verses.transliteration: yatrā samudra skabhito vyaunadapāṃ napāt savitā tasyaveda ato bhūrata ā utthitaṃ rajo.ato dyāvāpṛthivīaprathetām

translations.griffith: Well knoweth Savitar, O Child of Waters, where ocean, firmly fixt, o’erflowed its limit.  Thence sprang the world, from that uprose the region: thence heaven spread out and the wide earth expanded.

verses.sanskrit: पश्चेदमन्यदभवद यजत्रममर्त्यस्य भुवनस्य भूना सुपर्णो अङग सवितुर्गरुत्मान पूर्वो जातः स उ अस्यानुधर्म |||
verses.transliteration: paścedamanyadabhavad yajatramamartyasya bhuvanasya bhūnā suparṇo aṅgha saviturgharutmān pūrvo jātaḥ sa u asyānudharma

translations.griffith: Then, with a full crowd of Immortal Beings, this other realm came later, high and holy.  First, verily, Savitar's strong-pinioned Eagle was born: and he obeys his law for ever.

verses.sanskrit: गाव इव गरामं यूयुधिरिवाश्वान वाश्रेव वत्संसुमना दुहाना पतिरिव जायामभि नो नयेतु धर्तादिवः सविता विश्ववारः |||
verses.transliteration: ghāva iva ghrāmaṃ yūyudhirivāśvān vāśreva vatsaṃsumanā duhānā patiriva jāyāmabhi no nyetu dhartādivaḥ savitā viśvavāraḥ

translations.griffith: As warriors to their steeds, kine to their village, as fond milk giving cows approach their youngling,  As man to wife, let Savitar come downward to us, heaven's bearer, Lord of every blessing.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यस्तूपः सवितर्यथा तवाङगिरसो जुह्वे वाजे अस्मिन एवा तवार्चन्नवसे वन्दमानः सोमस्येवाण्शुं परतिजागराहम |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyastūpaḥ savitaryathā tvāṅghiraso juhve vāje asmin evā tvārcannavase vandamānaḥ somasyevāṇśuṃ pratijāgharāham

translations.griffith: Like the Aṅgirasa Hiranvastupa, I call thee, Savitar, to this achievement:  So worshipping and lauding thee for favour I watch for thee as for the stalk of Soma.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धश्चित समिध्यसे देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहन आदित्यैरुद्रैर्वसुभिर्न आ गहि मर्ळीकाय न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: samiddhaścit samidhyase devebhyo havyavāhana ādityairudrairvasubhirna ā ghahi mṛḷīkāya na ā ghahi

translations.griffith: THOU, bearer of oblations, though kindled, art kindled for the Gods.  With the Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus, come to us: to show us favour come to us.

verses.sanskrit: इमं यज्ञमिदं वचो जुजुषाण उपागहि मर्तासस्त्वासमिधान हवामहे मर्ळीकाय हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ yajñamidaṃ vaco jujuṣāṇa upāghahi martāsastvāsamidhāna havāmahe mṛḷīkāya havāmahe

translations.griffith: Come hither and accept with joy this sacrifice and hymn of ours.  O kindled God, we mortals are invoking thee, calling on thee to show us grace.

verses.sanskrit: तवामु जातवेदसं विश्ववारं गर्णे धिया अग्ने देवाना वह नः परियव्रतान मर्ळीकाय परियव्रतान |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmu jātavedasaṃ viśvavāraṃ ghṛṇe dhiyā aghne devānā vaha naḥ priyavratān mṛḷīkāya priyavratān

translations.griffith: I laud thee Jātavedas, thee Lord of all blessings, with my song.  Agni, bring hitherward the Gods whose Laws we love, whose laws we love, to show us grace.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्देवो देवानामभवत पुरोहितो.अग्निं मनुष्या रषयःसमीधिरे अग्निं महो धनसातावहं हुवे मर्ळीकन्धनसातये |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirdevo devānāmabhavat purohito.aghniṃ manuṣyā ṛṣayaḥsamīdhire aghniṃ maho dhanasātāvahaṃ huve mṛḷīkandhanasātaye

translations.griffith: Agni the God was made the great High-Priest of Gods, Ṛṣis have kindled Agni, men of mortal mould.  Agni I invocate for winning ample wealth. kindly disposed for winning wealth.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निरत्रिं भरद्वाजं गविष्ठिरं परावन नः कण्वन्त्रसदस्युमाहवे अग्निं वसिष्ठो हवते पुरोहितोम्र्ळीकाय पुरोहितः |||
verses.transliteration: aghniratriṃ bharadvājaṃ ghaviṣṭhiraṃ prāvan naḥ kaṇvantrasadasyumāhave aghniṃ vasiṣṭho havate purohitomṛḷīkāya purohitaḥ

translations.griffith: Atri and Bharadvāja and Gavisthira, Kaṇva and Trasadasyu, in our fight he helped.  On Agni calls Vasiṣṭha, even the household priest, the household priest to win his grace.

verses.sanskrit: शरद्धयाग्निः समिध्यते शरद्धय हुयते हविः शरद्धां भगस्य मूर्धनि वचसा वेदयमसि |||
verses.transliteration: śraddhayāghniḥ samidhyate śraddhaya huyate haviḥ śraddhāṃ bhaghasya mūrdhani vacasā vedayamasi

translations.griffith: By Faith is Agni kindled, through Faith is oblation offered up.  We celebrate with praises Faith upon the height of happiness.

verses.sanskrit: परियं शरद्धे ददतः परियं शरद्द्ते दिदासतः परियम्भोजेषु यज्वस्विदं म उदितं कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: priyaṃ śraddhe dadataḥ priyaṃ śraddte didāsataḥ priyambhojeṣu yajvasvidaṃ ma uditaṃ kṛdhi

translations.griffith: Bless thou the man who gives, O Faith; Faith, bless the man who fain would give.  Bless thou the liberal worshippers: bless thou the word that I have said.

verses.sanskrit: यथा देव असुरेषु शरद्धामुग्रेषु चक्रिरे एवम्भोजेषु यज्वस्वस्माकमुदितं कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: yathā deva asureṣu śraddhāmughreṣu cakrire evambhojeṣu yajvasvasmākamuditaṃ kṛdhi

translations.griffith: Even as the Deities maintained Faith in the mighty Asuras,  So make this uttered wish of mine true for the liberal worshippers.

verses.sanskrit: शरद्धां देवा यजमाना वायुगोपा उपासते शरद्धांह्र्दय्ययाकूत्या शरद्धया विन्दते वसु |||
verses.transliteration: śraddhāṃ devā yajamānā vāyughopā upāsate śraddhāṃhṛdayyayākūtyā śraddhayā vindate vasu

translations.griffith: Guarded by Vāyu, Gods and men who sacrifice draw near to Faith.  Man winneth Faith by yearnings of the heart, and opulence by Faith.

verses.sanskrit: शरद्धां परातै हवामहे शरद्धां मध्यन्दिनं परि शरद्धां सूर्यस्य निम्रुचि शरद्धे शरद धापयेह नः |||
verses.transliteration: śraddhāṃ prātai havāmahe śraddhāṃ madhyandinaṃ pari śraddhāṃ sūryasya nimruci śraddhe śrad dhāpayeha naḥ

translations.griffith: Faith in the early morning, Faith at noonday will we invocate,  Faith at the setting of the Sun. O Faith, endow us with belief.

verses.sanskrit: शास इत्था महानस्यमित्रखादो अद्भुतः न यस्यहन्यते सखा न जीयते कदा चन |||
verses.transliteration: śāsa itthā mahānasyamitrakhādo adbhutaḥ na yasyahanyate sakhā na jīyate kadā cana
