translations.griffith: A MIGHTY Governor art thou, Wondrous, Destroyer of the foe,  Whose friend is never done to death, and never, never overcome.

verses.sanskrit: सवस्तिद विशस पतिर्व्र्त्रहा विम्र्धो वशी वर्षेन्द्रःपुर एतु नः सोमप अभयंकरः |||
verses.transliteration: svastida viśas patirvṛtrahā vimṛdho vaśī vṛṣendraḥpura etu naḥ somapa abhayaṃkaraḥ

translations.griffith: Lord of the clan, who brings us bliss, Strong, Warrior, Slayer of the fiend,  May India, Soma-drinker, go before us, Bull who gives us peace.

verses.sanskrit: वि रक्षो वि मर्धो जहि वि वर्त्रस्य हनू रुज वि मन्युमिन्द्र वर्त्रहन्नमित्रस्याभिदसतः |||
verses.transliteration: vi rakṣo vi mṛdho jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja vi manyumindra vṛtrahannamitrasyābhidasataḥ

translations.griffith: Drive Rākṣasas and foes away, break thou in pieces Vṛtra'sjaws:  O Vṛtra-slaying Indra, quell the foeman's wrath who threatens us.

verses.sanskrit: वि न इन्द्र मर्धो जहि नीचा यछ पर्तन्यतः यो अस्मानभिदासत्यधरं गमया तमः |||
verses.transliteration: vi na indra mṛdho jahi nīcā yacha pṛtanyataḥ yo asmānabhidāsatyadharaṃ ghamayā tamaḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra, beat our foes away, humble the men who challenge us:  Send down to nether darkness him who seeks to do us injury.

verses.sanskrit: अपेन्द्र दविषतो मनो.अप जिज्यासतो वधम वि मन्योःशर्म यछ वरीयो यवया वधम |||
verses.transliteration: apendra dviṣato mano.apa jijyāsato vadham vi manyoḥśarma yacha varīyo yavayā vadham

translations.griffith: Baffle the foeman's plan, ward off his weapon who would conquer us.  Give shelter from his furious wrath, and keep his murdering dart afar.

verses.sanskrit: ईङखयन्तीरपस्युव इन्द्रं जातमुपासते भेजानसःसुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: īṅkhayantīrapasyuva indraṃ jātamupāsate bhejānasaḥsuvīryam

translations.griffith: SWAYING about, the Active Ones came nigh to Indra at his birth,  And shared his great heroic might.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिन्द्र बलादधि सहसो जात ओजसः तवं वर्षन्व्र्षेदसि |||
verses.transliteration: tvamindra balādadhi sahaso jāta ojasaḥ tvaṃ vṛṣanvṛṣedasi

translations.griffith: Based upon strength and victory and power, O Indra is thy birth:  Thou, Mighty One, art strong indeed.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिन्द्रासि वर्त्रहा वयन्तरिक्षमतिरः उद दयामस्तभ्ना ओजसा |||
verses.transliteration: tvamindrāsi vṛtrahā vyantarikṣamatiraḥ ud dyāmastabhnā ojasā

translations.griffith: Thou art the Vṛtra-slayer, thou, Indra, hast spread the firmament:  Thou hast with might upheld the heavens.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिन्द्र सजोषसमर्कं बिभर्षि बाह्वोः वज्रंशिशान ओजसा |||
verses.transliteration: tvamindra sajoṣasamarkaṃ bibharṣi bāhvoḥ vajraṃśiśāna ojasā

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, bearest in thine arms the lightning that accords with thee,  Whetting thy thunderbolt with might.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिन्द्राभिभूरसि विश्वा जातान्योजसा स विश्वाभुव आभवः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamindrābhibhūrasi viśvā jātānyojasā sa viśvābhuva ābhavaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, art preeminent over all creatures in thy might:  Thou hast pervaded every place.

verses.sanskrit: सोम एकेभ्यः पवते घर्तमेक उपासते येभ्यो मधुप्रधावति तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात |||
verses.transliteration: soma ekebhyaḥ pavate ghṛtameka upāsate yebhyo madhupradhāvati tāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt

translations.griffith: FOR some is Soma purified, some sit by sacrificial oil:  To those for whom the meath flows forth, even to those let him depart.

verses.sanskrit: तपसा ये अनाध्र्ष्यास्तपसा ये सवर्ययुः तपो येचक्रिरे महस्तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात |||
verses.transliteration: tapasā ye anādhṛṣyāstapasā ye svaryayuḥ tapo yecakrire mahastāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt

translations.griffith: Invincible through Fervour, those whom Fervour hath advanced to heaven,  Who showed great Fervour in their lives, -even to those let him depart.

verses.sanskrit: ये युध्यन्ते परधनेषु शूरासो ये तनूत्यजः ये वासहस्रदक्षिणास्तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात |||
verses.transliteration: ye yudhyante pradhaneṣu śūrāso ye tanūtyajaḥ ye vāsahasradakṣiṇāstāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt

translations.griffith: The heroes who contend in war and boldly cast their lives away,  Or who give guerdon thousandfold, -even to those let him depart.

verses.sanskrit: ये चित पूर्व रतसाप रतावान रताव्र्धः पितॄन तपस्वतोयम तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात |||
verses.transliteration: ye cit pūrva ṛtasāpa ṛtāvāna ṛtāvṛdhaḥ pitṝn tapasvatoyama tāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt

translations.griffith: Yea, the first followers of Law, Law's pure and holy strengtheners,  The Fathers, Yama! Fervour-moved,even to those let him depart.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रणीथाः कवयो ये गोपायन्ति सूर्यम रषीन्तपस्वतो यम तपोजानपि गछतात |||
verses.transliteration: sahasraṇīthāḥ kavayo ye ghopāyanti sūryam ṛṣīntapasvato yama tapojānapi ghachatāt

translations.griffith: Skilled in a thousand ways and means, the sages who protect the Sun,  The Ṛṣis, Yama! Fervour-moved,—even to those let him depart.

verses.sanskrit: अरायि काणे विकटे गिरिं गछ सदान्वे शिरिम्बिठस्यसत्वभिस्तेभिष टवा चातयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: arāyi kāṇe vikaṭe ghiriṃ ghacha sadānve śirimbiṭhasyasatvabhistebhiṣ ṭvā cātayāmasi

translations.griffith: ARAYI, one-eyed limping hag, fly, ever-screeching, to the hill.  We frighten thee away with these, the heroes of Sirimbitha.

verses.sanskrit: चत्तो इतश्चत्तामुतः सर्वा भरूणान्यारुषी अराय्यं बरह्मणस पते तीक्ष्णश्र्ण्गोद्र्षन्निहि |||
verses.transliteration: catto itaścattāmutaḥ sarvā bhrūṇānyāruṣī arāyyaṃ brahmaṇas pate tīkṣṇaśṛṇghodṛṣannihi

translations.griffith: Scared from this place and that is she, destroyer of each germ unborn.  Go, sharp-horned Brāhmaṇaspti and drive Arayi far away.

verses.sanskrit: अदो यद दारु पलवते सिन्धोः पारे अपूरुषम तदारभस्व दुर्हणो तेन गछ परस्तरम |||
verses.transliteration: ado yad dāru plavate sindhoḥ pāre apūruṣam tadārabhasva durhaṇo tena ghacha parastaram

translations.griffith: Yon log that floats without a man to guide it on the river's edge,—  Seize it, thou thing with hideous jaws, and go thou far away thereon.

verses.sanskrit: यद ध पराचीरजगन्तोरो मण्डूरधाणिकीः हतािन्द्रस्य शत्रवः सर्वे बुद्बुदयाशवः |||
verses.transliteration: yad dha prācīrajaghantoro maṇḍūradhāṇikīḥ hatāindrasya śatravaḥ sarve budbudayāśavaḥ

translations.griffith: When, foul with secret stain and spot, ye hastened onward to the breast,  All Indra's enemies were slain and passed away like froth and foam.

verses.sanskrit: परीमे गामनेषत पर्यग्निमह्र्षत देवेष्वक्रतश्रवः क इमाना दधर्षति |||
verses.transliteration: parīme ghāmaneṣata paryaghnimahṛṣata deveṣvakrataśravaḥ ka imānā dadharṣati

translations.griffith: These men have led about the cow, have duly carried Agni round,  And raised their glory tg the Gods. Who will attack them with success?

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं हिन्वन्तु नो धियः सप्तिमाशुमिवाजिषु तेन जेष्मधनं-धनम |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ hinvantu no dhiyaḥ saptimāśumivājiṣu tena jeṣmadhanaṃ-dhanam

translations.griffith: LET songs of ours speed Agni forth like a fleet courser in the race,  And we will win each prize through him.

verses.sanskrit: यया गा आकरामहे सेनयाग्ने तवोत्या तां नो हिन्वमघत्तये |||
verses.transliteration: yayā ghā ākarāmahe senayāghne tavotyā tāṃ no hinvamaghattaye

translations.griffith: Agni the dart whereby we gain kine for ourselves with help from thee,—  That send us for the gain of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: आग्ने सथूरं रयिं भर पर्थुं गोमन्तमश्विनम अंधिखं वर्तया पणिम |||
verses.transliteration: āghne sthūraṃ rayiṃ bhara pṛthuṃ ghomantamaśvinam aṃdhikhaṃ vartayā paṇim

translations.griffith: O Agni, bring us wealth secure, vast wealth in horses and in kine:  Oil thou the socket, turn the wheel.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने नक्षत्रमजरमा सूर्यं रोहयो दिवि दधज्ज्योतिर्जनेभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne nakṣatramajaramā sūryaṃ rohayo divi dadhajjyotirjanebhyaḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, thou hast made the Sun, Eternal Star, to mount the sky,  Bestowing light on living men.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने केतुर्विशामसि परेष्ठः शरेष्ठ उपस्थसत बोधा सतोत्रे वयो दधत |||
verses.transliteration: aghne keturviśāmasi preṣṭhaḥ śreṣṭha upasthasat bodhā stotre vayo dadhat

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, art the people's light, best, dearest, seated in thy shrine:  Watch for the singer, give him life.

verses.sanskrit: इमा नु कं भुवना सीषधामेन्द्रश्च विश्वे च देवाः ||
verses.transliteration: imā nu kaṃ bhuvanā sīṣadhāmendraśca viśve ca devāḥ

translations.griffith: WE will, with Indra and all Gods to aid us, bring these existing worlds into subjection.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञं च नस्तन्वं च परजां चादित्यैरिन्द्रः सहचीक्ळिपाति ||
verses.transliteration: yajñaṃ ca nastanvaṃ ca prajāṃ cādityairindraḥ sahacīkḷipāti

translations.griffith: Our sacrifice, our bodies, and our offspr. let Indra form together with Ādityas.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्यैरिन्द्रः सगणो मरुद्भिरस्माकं भूत्ववितातनूनाम ||
verses.transliteration: ādityairindraḥ saghaṇo marudbhirasmākaṃ bhūtvavitātanūnām

translations.griffith: With the Ādityas, with the band of Maruts, may Indra be Protector of our bodies.

verses.sanskrit: हत्वाय देवा असुरान यदायन देवा देवत्वमभिरक्षमाणाः ||
verses.transliteration: hatvāya devā asurān yadāyan devā devatvamabhirakṣamāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: As when the Gods came, after they had slaughtered the Asuras, keeping safe their Godlike nature,

verses.sanskrit: परत्यञ्चमर्कमनयञ्छचीभिरादित सवधामिषिराम्पर्यपश्यन ||
verses.transliteration: pratyañcamarkamanayañchacībhirādit svadhāmiṣirāmparyapaśyan

translations.griffith: Brought the Sun hitherward with mighty powers, and looked about them on their vigorous Godhead.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्यो नो दिवस पातु वातो अन्तरिक्षात अग्निर्नःपार्थिवेभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sūryo no divas pātu vāto antarikṣāt aghnirnaḥpārthivebhyaḥ

translations.griffith: MAY Sūrya guard us out of heaven, and Vāta from the firmament,  And Agni from terrestrial spots.

verses.sanskrit: जोषा सवितर्यस्य ते हरः शतं सवानर्हति पाहिनो दिद्युतः पतन्त्याः |||
verses.transliteration: joṣā savitaryasya te haraḥ śataṃ savānarhati pāhino didyutaḥ patantyāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou Savitar whose flame deserves hundred libations, be thou pleased:  From failing lightning keep us safe.

verses.sanskrit: चक्षुर्नो देवः सविता चक्षुर्न उत पर्वतः चक्षुर्धाता दधातु नः |||
verses.transliteration: cakṣurno devaḥ savitā cakṣurna uta parvataḥ cakṣurdhātā dadhātu naḥ

translations.griffith: May Savitar the God, and may Parvata also give us sight;  May the Creator give us sight.

verses.sanskrit: चक्षुर्नो धेहि चक्षुषे चक्षुर्विख्यै तनूभ्यः संचेदं वि च पश्येम |||
verses.transliteration: cakṣurno dhehi cakṣuṣe cakṣurvikhyai tanūbhyaḥ saṃcedaṃ vi ca paśyema

translations.griffith: Give sight unto our eye, give thou our bodies sight that they may see:  May we survey, discern this world.

verses.sanskrit: सुसन्द्र्शं तवा वयं परति पश्येम सूर्य वि पश्येमन्र्चक्षसः |||
verses.transliteration: susandṛśaṃ tvā vayaṃ prati paśyema sūrya vi paśyemanṛcakṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: Thus, Sūrya, may we look on thee, on thee most lovely to behold,  See clearly with the eyes of men.

verses.sanskrit: उदसौ सूर्यो अगादुदयं मामको भगः अहं तद्विद्वला पतिमभ्यसाक्षि विषासहिः |||
verses.transliteration: udasau sūryo aghādudayaṃ māmako bhaghaḥ ahaṃ tadvidvalā patimabhyasākṣi viṣāsahiḥ

translations.griffith: YON Sun hath mounted up, and this my happy fate hate mounted high.  I knowing this, as conqueror have won my husband for mine own.

verses.sanskrit: अहं केतुरहं मूर्धाहमुग्रा विवाचनी ममेदनुक्रतुं पतिः सेहानाया उपाचरेत |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ keturahaṃ mūrdhāhamughrā vivācanī mamedanukratuṃ patiḥ sehānāyā upācaret

translations.griffith: I am the banner and the head, a mighty arbitress am I:  I am victorious, and my Lord shall be submissive to my will.

verses.sanskrit: मम पुत्राः शत्रुहणो.अथो मे दुहिता विराट उताहमस्मि संजया पत्यौ मे शलोक उत्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: mama putrāḥ śatruhaṇo.atho me duhitā virāṭ utāhamasmi saṃjayā patyau me śloka uttamaḥ

translations.griffith: My Sons are slayers of the foe, my Daughter is a ruling Queen:  I am victorious: o’er my Lord my song of triumph is supreme.

verses.sanskrit: येनेन्द्रो हविषा कर्त्व्यभवद दयुम्न्युत्तमः इदं तदक्रि देवा असपत्ना किलाभुवम |||
verses.transliteration: yenendro haviṣā kṛtvyabhavad dyumnyuttamaḥ idaṃ tadakri devā asapatnā kilābhuvam

translations.griffith: Oblation, that which Indra gave and thus grew glorious and most high,—  This have I offered, O ye Gods, and rid me of each rival wife.

verses.sanskrit: असपत्ना सपत्नघ्नी जयन्त्यभिभूवरी आव्र्क्षमन्यासां वर्चो राधो अस्थेयसामिव |||
verses.transliteration: asapatnā sapatnaghnī jayantyabhibhūvarī āvṛkṣamanyāsāṃ varco rādho astheyasāmiva

translations.griffith: Destroyer of the rival wife, Sole Spouse, victorious, conqueror,  The others' glory have I seized as ’twere the wealth of weaker Dames.

verses.sanskrit: समजैषमिमा अहं सपत्नीरभिभूवरी यथाहमस्य वीरस्य विराजानि जनस्य च |||
verses.transliteration: samajaiṣamimā ahaṃ sapatnīrabhibhūvarī yathāhamasya vīrasya virājāni janasya ca

translations.griffith: I have subdued as conqueror these rivals, these my fellow-wives,  That I may hold imperial sway over this Hero and the folk.

verses.sanskrit: तीव्रस्याभिवयसो अस्य पाहि सर्वरथा वि हरी इह मुञ्च इन्द्र मा तवा यजमानासो अन्ये नि रीरमन तुभ्यमिमेसुतासः |||
verses.transliteration: tīvrasyābhivayaso asya pāhi sarvarathā vi harī iha muñca indra mā tvā yajamānāso anye ni rīraman tubhyamimesutāsaḥ

translations.griffith: TASTE this strong draught enriched with offered viands: with all thy chariot here unyoke thy Coursers.  Let not those other sacrificers stay thee, Indra: these juices shed for thee are ready.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं सुतास्तुभ्यमु सोत्वासस्त्वां गिरः शवात्र्याा हवयन्ति इन्द्रेदमद्य सवनं जुषाणो विश्वस्यविद्वानिह पाहि सोमम |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ sutāstubhyamu sotvāsastvāṃ ghiraḥ śvātryāā hvayanti indredamadya savanaṃ juṣāṇo viśvasyavidvāniha pāhi somam

translations.griffith: Thine is the juice effused, thine are the juices yet to be pressed: our resonant songs invite thee.  O Indra, pleased to-day with this libation, come, thou who knowest all and drink the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: य उशता मनसा सोममस्मै सर्वह्र्दा देवकामः सुनोति न गा इन्द्रस्तस्य परा ददाति परशस्तमिच्चारुमस्मैक्र्णोति |||
verses.transliteration: ya uśatā manasā somamasmai sarvahṛdā devakāmaḥ sunoti na ghā indrastasya parā dadāti praśastamiccārumasmaikṛṇoti

translations.griffith: Whoso, devoted to the God, effuses Soma for him with yearning heart and spirit,—  Never doth Indra give away his cattle: for him he makes the lovely Soma famous.

verses.sanskrit: अनुस्पष्टो भवत्येषो अस्य यो अस्मै रेवान न सुनोति सोमम निररत्नौ मघवा तं दधाति बरह्मद्विषो हन्त्यनानुदिष्टः |||
verses.transliteration: anuspaṣṭo bhavatyeṣo asya yo asmai revān na sunoti somam niraratnau maghavā taṃ dadhāti brahmadviṣo hantyanānudiṣṭaḥ

translations.griffith: He looks with Ioving favour on the mortal who, like a rich man, pours for him the Soma.  Maghavan in his bended arm supports him: he slays, unasked, the men who hate devotion.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वायन्तो गव्यन्तो वाजयन्तो हवामहे तवोपगन्तवा उ आभूषन्तस्ते सुमतौ नवायां वयमिन्द्र तवा शुनंहुवेम |||
verses.transliteration: aśvāyanto ghavyanto vājayanto havāmahe tvopaghantavā u ābhūṣantaste sumatau navāyāṃ vayamindra tvā śunaṃhuvema

translations.griffith: We call on thee to come to us, desirous of goods and spoil, of cattle, and of horses.  For thy new love and favour are we present: let us invoke thee, Indra, as our welfare.

verses.sanskrit: मुञ्चामि तवा हविषा जीवनाय कमज्ञातयक्ष्मादुतराजयक्ष्मात गराहिर्जग्राह यदि वैतदेनं तस्यािन्द्राग्नी पर मुमुक्तमेनम |||
verses.transliteration: muñcāmi tvā haviṣā jīvanāya kamajñātayakṣmādutarājayakṣmāt ghrāhirjaghrāha yadi vaitadenaṃ tasyāindrāghnī pra mumuktamenam

translations.griffith: FOR life I set thee free by this oblation from the unknown decline and from Consumption;  Or, if the grasping demon have possessed him, free him from her, O Indra, thou and Agni.

verses.sanskrit: यदि कषितायुर्यदि वा परेतो यदि मर्त्योरन्तिकं नीतेव तमा हरामि निरतेरुपस्थादस्पार्षमेनंशतशारदाय |||
verses.transliteration: yadi kṣitāyuryadi vā pareto yadi mṛtyorantikaṃ nītaeva tamā harāmi nirterupasthādaspārṣamenaṃśataśāradāya

translations.griffith: Be his days ended, be he now departed, be he brought very near to death already,  Out of Destruction's lap again I bring him, save him for life to last a hundred autumns.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्राक्षेण शतशारदेन शतायुषा हविषाहार्षमेनम शतं यथेमं शरदो नयातीन्द्रो विश्वस्यदुरितस्य पारम |||
verses.transliteration: sahasrākṣeṇa śataśāradena śatāyuṣā haviṣāhārṣamenam śataṃ yathemaṃ śarado nayātīndro viśvasyaduritasya pāram

translations.griffith: With hundred-eyed oblation, hundred-autumned, bringing a hundred lives, have I restored him,  That Indra for a hundred years may lead him safe to the farther shore of all misfortune.

verses.sanskrit: शतं जीव शरदो वर्धमानः शतं हेमन्ताञ्छतमुवसन्तान शतमिन्द्राग्नी सविता बर्हस्पतिः शतायुषाहविषेमं पुनर्दुः |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ jīva śarado vardhamānaḥ śataṃ hemantāñchatamuvasantān śatamindrāghnī savitā bṛhaspatiḥ śatāyuṣāhaviṣemaṃ punarduḥ

translations.griffith: Live, waxing in thy strength, a hundred autumns, live through a hundred springs, a hundred winters.  Through hundred-lived oblation Indra, Agni, Bṛhaspati, Savitar yield him for a hundred!

verses.sanskrit: आहार्षं तवाविदं तवा पुनरागाः पुनर्नव सर्वाङगसर्वं ते चक्षुः सर्वमायुश्च ते.अविदम |||
verses.transliteration: āhārṣaṃ tvāvidaṃ tvā punarāghāḥ punarnava sarvāṅghasarvaṃ te cakṣuḥ sarvamāyuśca te.avidam

translations.griffith: So have I found and rescued thee thou hast returned with youth renewed.  Whole in thy members! I have found thy sight and all thy life for thee.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मणाग्निः संविदानो रक्षोहा बाधतामितः अमीवायस्ते गर्भं दुर्णामा योनिमाशये |||
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇāghniḥ saṃvidāno rakṣohā bādhatāmitaḥ amīvāyaste gharbhaṃ durṇāmā yonimāśaye

translations.griffith: MAY Agni, yielding to our prayer, the Rakṣas-slayer, drive away  The malady of evil name that hath beset thy labouring womb.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते गर्भममीवा दुर्णामा योनिमाशये अग्निष टम्ब्रह्मणा सह निष करव्यादमनीनशत |||
verses.transliteration: yaste gharbhamamīvā durṇāmā yonimāśaye aghniṣ ṭambrahmaṇā saha niṣ kravyādamanīnaśat

translations.griffith: Agni, concurring in the prayer, drive off the eater of the flesh,  The malady of evil name that hath attacked thy babe and womb.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते हन्ति पतयन्तं निषत्स्नुं यः सरीस्र्पम जातंयस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: yaste hanti patayantaṃ niṣatsnuṃ yaḥ sarīsṛpam jātaṃyaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi

translations.griffith: That which destroys the sinking germ, the settled, moving embryo,  That which will kill the babe at birth,—even this will we drive far away.

verses.sanskrit: यस्त ऊरू विहरत्यन्तरा दम्पती शये योनिं योन्तरारेळि तमितो नाशयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: yasta ūrū viharatyantarā dampatī śaye yoniṃ yoantarāreḷi tamito nāśayāmasi

translations.griffith: That which divides thy legs that it may lie between the married pair,  That penetrates and licks thy side,—even this will we exterminate.

verses.sanskrit: यस्त्वा भराता पतिर्भूत्वा जारो भूत्वा निपद्यते परजां यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: yastvā bhrātā patirbhūtvā jāro bhūtvā nipadyate prajāṃ yaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi

translations.griffith: What rests by thee in borrowed form of brother, lover, or of lord,  And would destroy thy Progeny,—even this will we exterminate.

verses.sanskrit: यस्त्वा सवप्नेन तमसा मोहयित्वा निपद्यते परजां यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: yastvā svapnena tamasā mohayitvā nipadyate prajāṃ yaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi

translations.griffith: That which through sleep or darkness hath deceived thee and lies down by thee,  And will destroy thy progeny,—even this will we exterminate.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षीभ्यां ते नासिकाभ्यां कर्णाभ्यां छुबुकादधि यक्ष्मं शीर्षण्यं मस्तिष्काज्जिह्वाया वि वर्हामि ते |||
verses.transliteration: akṣībhyāṃ te nāsikābhyāṃ karṇābhyāṃ chubukādadhi yakṣmaṃ śīrṣaṇyaṃ mastiṣkājjihvāyā vi vṛhāmi te

translations.griffith: FROM both thy nostrils, from thine eyes, from both thine ears and from thy chin,  Forth from thy head and brain and tongue I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit: गरीवाभ्यस्त उष्णिहाभ्यः कीकसाभ्यो अनूक्यात यक्ष्मं दोषण्यमंसाभ्यां बाहुभ्यां वि वर्हामि ते |||
verses.transliteration: ghrīvābhyasta uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyo anūkyāt yakṣmaṃ doṣaṇyamaṃsābhyāṃ bāhubhyāṃ vi vṛhāmi te

translations.griffith: From the neck-tendons and the neck, from the breast-bones and from the spine,  From shoulders, upper, lower arms, I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit: आन्त्रेभ्यस्ते गुदाभ्यो वनिष्ठोर्ह्र्दयादधि यक्ष्मम्मतस्नाभ्यां यक्नः पलाशिभ्यो वि वर्हामि ते |||
verses.transliteration: āntrebhyaste ghudābhyo vaniṣṭhorhṛdayādadhi yakṣmammatasnābhyāṃ yaknaḥ plāśibhyo vi vṛhāmi te

translations.griffith: From viscera and all within, forth from the rectum, from the heart,  From kidneys, liver, and from spleen, I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit: ऊरुभ्यां ते अष्ठीवद्भ्यां पार्ष्णिभ्यां परपदाभ्याम यक्ष्मं शरोणिभ्यां भासदाद भंससो वि वर्हामि ते |||
verses.transliteration: ūrubhyāṃ te aṣṭhīvadbhyāṃ pārṣṇibhyāṃ prapadābhyām yakṣmaṃ śroṇibhyāṃ bhāsadād bhaṃsaso vi vṛhāmi te

translations.griffith: From thighs, from knee-caps, and from heels, and from the forepart of the feet,  From hips from stomach, and from groin I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit: मेहनाद वनंकरणाल लोमभ्यस्ते नखेभ्यः यक्ष्मंसर्वस्मादात्मनस्तमिदं वि वर्हामि ते |||
verses.transliteration: mehanād vanaṃkaraṇāl lomabhyaste nakhebhyaḥ yakṣmaṃsarvasmādātmanastamidaṃ vi vṛhāmi te

translations.griffith: From what is voided from within, and from thy hair, and from they nails,  From all thyself from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit: अङगाद-अङगाल लोम्नो-लोम्नो जातं पर्वणि-पर्वणि यक्ष्मंसर्वस्मादात्मनस्तमिदं वि वर्हामि ते |||
verses.transliteration: aṅghād-aṅghāl lomno-lomno jātaṃ parvaṇi-parvaṇi yakṣmaṃsarvasmādātmanastamidaṃ vi vṛhāmi te

translations.griffith: From every member, every hair, disease that comes in every joint,  From all thyself, from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit: अपेहि मनसस पते.अप कराम परश्चर परो निरतया आचक्ष्व बहुधा जीवतो मनः |||
verses.transliteration: apehi manasas pate.apa krāma paraścara paro nirtyā ācakṣva bahudhā jīvato manaḥ

translations.griffith: AVAUNT, thou Master of the mind Depart, and vanish far away.  Look on Destruction far from hence. The live man's mind is manifold.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रं वै वरं वर्णते भद्रं युञ्जन्ति दक्षिणम भद्रं वैवस्वते चक्षुर्बहुत्रा जीवतो मनः |||
verses.transliteration: bhadraṃ vai varaṃ vṛṇate bhadraṃ yuñjanti dakṣiṇam bhadraṃ vaivasvate cakṣurbahutrā jīvato manaḥ

translations.griffith: A happy boon do men elect, a mighty blessing they obtain.  Bliss with Vaivasvata they see. The live man's mind seeks many a place.

verses.sanskrit: यदाशसा निःशसाभिशसोपारिम जाग्रतो यत सवपन्तः अग्निर्विश्वान्यप दुष्क्र्तान्यजुष्टान्यारे अस्मद्दधातु |||
verses.transliteration: yadāśasā niḥśasābhiśasopārima jāghrato yat svapantaḥ aghnirviśvānyapa duṣkṛtānyajuṣṭānyāre asmaddadhātu

translations.griffith: If by address, by blame, by imprecation we have committed sin, awake or sleeping,  All hateful acts of ours, all evil doings may Agni bear away to distant places.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र बरह्मणस पते.अभिद्रोहं चरामसि परचेता नाङगिरसो दविषतां पात्यंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra brahmaṇas pate.abhidrohaṃ carāmasi pracetā naāṅghiraso dviṣatāṃ pātyaṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: When, Indra, Brahmaṇaspati, our deeds are wrongful and unjust,  May provident Aṅgirasa prevent our foes from troubling, us.

verses.sanskrit: अजैष्माद्यासनाम चाभूमानागसो वयम जाग्रत्स्वप्नःसंकल्पः पापो यं दविष्मस्तं स रछतु यो नो दवेष्टितं रछतु |||
verses.transliteration: ajaiṣmādyāsanāma cābhūmānāghaso vayam jāghratsvapnaḥsaṃkalpaḥ pāpo yaṃ dviṣmastaṃ sa ṛchatu yo no dveṣṭitaṃ ṛchatu

translations.griffith: We have prevailed this day and won: we are made free from sin and guilt.  Ill thoughts, that visit us awake or sleeping, seize the man we hate, yea, seize the man who hateth us.

verses.sanskrit: देवाः कपोत इषितो यदिछन दूतो निरतया इदमाजगाम तस्मा अर्चाम कर्णवाम निष्क्र्तिं शं नो अस्तु दविपदेशं चतुष्पदे |||
verses.transliteration: devāḥ kapota iṣito yadichan dūto nirtyā idamājaghāma tasmā arcāma kṛṇavāma niṣkṛtiṃ śaṃ no astu dvipadeśaṃ catuṣpade

translations.griffith: GODS, whatsoe’er the Dove came hither seeking, sent to us as the envoy of Destruction,  For that let us sing hymns and make atonement. Well be it with our quadrupeds and bipeds.

verses.sanskrit: शिवः कपोत इषितो नो अस्त्वनागा देवाः शकुनो गर्हेषु अग्निर्हि विप्रो जुषतां हविर्नः परि हेतिः पक्षिणी नोव्र्णक्तु |||
verses.transliteration: śivaḥ kapota iṣito no astvanāghā devāḥ śakuno ghṛheṣu aghnirhi vipro juṣatāṃ havirnaḥ pari hetiḥ pakṣiṇī novṛṇaktu

translations.griffith: Auspicious be the Dove that hath been sent us, a harmless bird, ye Gods, within our dwelling.  May Agni, Sage, be pleased with our oblation, and may the Missile borne on wings avoid us.

verses.sanskrit: हेतिः पक्षिणी न दभात्यस्मानाष्ट्र्यां पदं कर्णुतेग्निधाने शं नो गोभ्यश्च पुरुषेभ्यश्चास्तु मा नोहिंसीदिह देवाः कपोतः |||
verses.transliteration: hetiḥ pakṣiṇī na dabhātyasmānāṣṭryāṃ padaṃ kṛṇuteaghnidhāne śaṃ no ghobhyaśca puruṣebhyaścāstu mā nohiṃsīdiha devāḥ kapotaḥ

translations.griffith: Let not the Arrow that hath wings distract us: beside the fire-place, on the hearth it settles.  May, it bring welfare to our men and cattle: here let the Dove, ye Gods, forbear to harm us.

verses.sanskrit: यदुलूको वदति मोघमेतद यत कपोतः पदमग्नौक्र्णोति यस्य दूतः परहित एष एतत तस्मै यमाय नमोस्तु मरित्यवे |||
verses.transliteration: yadulūko vadati moghametad yat kapotaḥ padamaghnaukṛṇoti yasya dūtaḥ prahita eṣa etat tasmai yamāya namoastu mrityave

translations.griffith: The screeching of the owl is ineffective and when beside the fire the Dove hath settled,  To him who sent it hither as an envoy, to him be reverence paid, to Death, to Yama.

verses.sanskrit: रचा कपोतं नुदत परणोदमिषं मदन्तः परि गांनयध्वम संयोपयन्तो दुरितानि विश्वा हित्वा न ऊर्जं परपतात पतिष्थः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛcā kapotaṃ nudata praṇodamiṣaṃ madantaḥ pari ghāṃnayadhvam saṃyopayanto duritāni viśvā hitvā na ūrjaṃ prapatāt patiṣthaḥ

translations.griffith: Drive forth the Dove, chase it with holy verses: rejoicing, bring ye hither food and cattle,  Barring the way against all grief and trouble. Let the swift bird fly forth and leave us vigour.

verses.sanskrit: रषभं मा समानानां सपत्नानां विषासहिम हन्तारंशत्रूणां कर्धि विराजं गोपतिं गवाम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣabhaṃ mā samānānāṃ sapatnānāṃ viṣāsahim hantāraṃśatrūṇāṃ kṛdhi virājaṃ ghopatiṃ ghavām

translations.griffith: MAKE me a bull among my peers, make me my rivals, conqueror:  Make me the slayer of my foes, a sovran ruler, lord of kine

verses.sanskrit: अहमस्मि सपत्नहेन्द्र इवारिष्टो अक्षतः अधः सपत्नामे पदोरिमे सर्वे अभिष्ठिताः |||
verses.transliteration: ahamasmi sapatnahendra ivāriṣṭo akṣataḥ adhaḥ sapatnāme padorime sarve abhiṣṭhitāḥ

translations.griffith: I am my rivals’ slayer, like Indra unwounded and unhurt,  And all these enemies of mine are vanquished and beneath my feet.

verses.sanskrit: अत्रैव वो.अपि नह्याम्युभे आर्त्नी इव जयया वाचस पतेनि षेधेमान यथा मदधरं वदान |||
verses.transliteration: atraiva vo.api nahyāmyubhe ārtnī iva jyayā vācas pateni ṣedhemān yathā madadharaṃ vadān

translations.griffith: Here, verily, I bind you fast, as the two bow-ends with the string.  Press down these men, O Lord of Speech, that they may humbly speak to me.

verses.sanskrit: अभिभूरहमागमं विश्वकर्मेण धाम्ना आ वश्चित्तमा वो वरतमा वो.अहं समितिं ददे |||
verses.transliteration: abhibhūrahamāghamaṃ viśvakarmeṇa dhāmnā ā vaścittamā vo vratamā vo.ahaṃ samitiṃ dade

translations.griffith: Hither I came as conqueror with mighty all-effecting power,  And I have mastered all your thought, your synod, and your holy work.

verses.sanskrit: योगक्षेमं व आदायाहं भूयासमुत्तम आ वो मूर्धानमक्रमीम अधस्पदान म उद वदत मण्डूका इवोदकान्मण्डूका उदकादिव |||
verses.transliteration: yoghakṣemaṃ va ādāyāhaṃ bhūyāsamuttama ā vo mūrdhānamakramīm adhaspadān ma ud vadata maṇḍūkā ivodakānmaṇḍūkā udakādiva

translations.griffith: May I be highest, having gained your strength in war, your skill in peace  my feet have trodden on your heads.  Speak to me from beneath my feet, as frogs from out the water croak, as frogs from out the water croak.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्येदमिन्द्र परि षिच्यते मधु तवं सुतस्य कलशस्यराजसि तवं रयिं पुरुवीरामु नस कर्धि तवं तपःपरितप्याजयः सवः |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyedamindra pari ṣicyate madhu tvaṃ sutasya kalaśasyarājasi tvaṃ rayiṃ puruvīrāmu nas kṛdhi tvaṃ tapaḥparitapyājayaḥ svaḥ

translations.griffith: THIS pleasant meath, O Indra, is effused for thee: thou art the ruling Lord of beaker and of juice.  Bestow upon us wealth with many hero sons: thou, having glowed with Fervour, wonnest heavenly light.

verses.sanskrit: सवर्जितं महि मन्दानमन्धसो हवामहे परि शक्रंसुतानुप इमं नो यज्ञमिह बोध्या गहि सप्र्धोजयन्तं मघवानमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: svarjitaṃ mahi mandānamandhaso havāmahe pari śakraṃsutānupa imaṃ no yajñamiha bodhyā ghahi spṛdhojayantaṃ maghavānamīmahe

translations.griffith: Let us call Śakra to libations here effused, winner of light who joyeth in the potent juice.  Mark well this sacrifice of ours and come to us: we pray to Maghavan the Vanquisher of hosts.

verses.sanskrit: सोमस्य राज्ञो वरुणस्य धर्मणि बर्हस्पतेरनुमत्या उशर्मणि तवाहमद्य मघवन्नुपस्तुतौ धातर्विधातः कलशानभक्षयम |||
verses.transliteration: somasya rājño varuṇasya dharmaṇi bṛhaspateranumatyā uśarmaṇi tavāhamadya maghavannupastutau dhātarvidhātaḥ kalaśānabhakṣayam

translations.griffith: By royal Soma's and by Varuṇa's decree, under Bṛhaspati's and Anumati's guard,  This day by thine authority, O Maghavan, Maker, Disposer thou! have I enjoyed the jars.

verses.sanskrit: परसूतो भक्षमकरं चरावपि सतोमं चेमं परथमःसूरिरुन मर्जे सुते सातेन यद्यागमं वां परतिविश्वामित्रजमदग्नी दमे |||
verses.transliteration: prasūto bhakṣamakaraṃ carāvapi stomaṃ cemaṃ prathamaḥsūrirun mṛje sute sātena yadyāghamaṃ vāṃ prativiśvāmitrajamadaghnī dame

translations.griffith: 1, too, urged on, have had my portion, in the bowl, and as first Prince I drew forth this my hymn of praise,  When with the prize I came unto the flowing juice, O Viśvāmitra, Jamadagni, to your home.

verses.sanskrit: वातस्य नु महिमानं रथस्य रुजन्नेति सतनयन्नस्यघोषः दिविस्प्र्ग यात्यरुणानि कर्ण्वन्नुतो एति पर्थिव्यारेणुमस्यन |||
verses.transliteration: vātasya nu mahimānaṃ rathasya rujanneti stanayannasyaghoṣaḥ divispṛgh yātyaruṇāni kṛṇvannuto eti pṛthivyāreṇumasyan

translations.griffith: O THE Wind's chariot, O its power and glory! Crashing it goes and hath a voice of thunder.  It makes the regions red and touches heaven, and as it moves the dust of earth is scattered.

verses.sanskrit: सं परेरते अनु वातस्य विष्ठा ऐनं गछन्ति समनं नयोषाः ताभिः सयुक सरथं देव ईयते.अस्य विश्वस्यभुवनस्य राजा |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ prerate anu vātasy viṣṭhā ainaṃ ghachanti samanaṃ nayoṣāḥ tābhiḥ sayuk sarathaṃ deva īyate.asya viśvasyabhuvanasya rājā

translations.griffith: Along the traces of the Wind they hurry, they come to him as dames to an assembly.  Borne on his car with these for his attendants, the God speeds forth, the universe's Monarch.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तरिक्षे पथिभिरीयमानो न नि विशते कतमच्चनाहः अपां सखा परथमजा रतावा कव सविज्जातः कुत आबभूव |||
verses.transliteration: antarikṣe pathibhirīyamāno na ni viśate katamaccanāhaḥ apāṃ sakhā prathamajā ṛtāvā kva svijjātaḥ kuta ābabhūva

translations.griffith: Travelling on the paths of air's mid-region, no single day doth he take rest or slumber.  Holy and earliest-born, Friend of the waters, where did he spring and from what region came he?

verses.sanskrit: आत्मा देवानां भुवनस्य गर्भो यथावशं चरति देवेषः घोषा इदस्य शर्ण्विरे न रूपं तस्मै वातायहविषा विधेम |||
verses.transliteration: ātmā devānāṃ bhuvanasya gharbho yathāvaśaṃ carati devaeṣaḥ ghoṣā idasya śṛṇvire na rūpaṃ tasmai vātāyahaviṣā vidhema

translations.griffith: Germ of the world, the Deities’ vital spirit, this God moves ever as his will inclines him.  His voice is heard, his shape is ever viewless. Let us adore this Wind with our oblation.

verses.sanskrit: मयोभूर्वातो अभि वातूस्रा ऊर्जस्वतीरोषधीरारिशन्ताम पीवस्वतीर्जीवधन्याः पिबन्त्ववसाय पद्वतेरुद्र मर्ळ |||
verses.transliteration: mayobhūrvāto abhi vātūsrā ūrjasvatīroṣadhīrāriśantām pīvasvatīrjīvadhanyāḥ pibantvavasāya padvaterudra mṛḷa

translations.griffith: MAY the wind blow upon our Cows with healing: may they eat herbage full of vigorous juices.  May they drink waters rich in life and fatness: to food that moves on feet be gracious, Rudra.

verses.sanskrit: याः सरूपा विरूपा एकरूपा यासामग्निरिष्ट्यानामानि वेद या अङगिरसस्तपसेह चक्रुस्ताभ्यःपर्जन्य महि शर्म यछ |||
verses.transliteration: yāḥ sarūpā virūpā ekarūpā yāsāmaghniriṣṭyānāmāni veda yā aṅghirasastapaseha cakrustābhyaḥparjanya mahi śarma yacha

translations.griffith: Like-coloured, various-hued, or single-coloured, whose names through sacrifice are known to Agni,  Whom the Aṅgirases produced by Fervour,—vouchsafe to these, Parjanya, great protection.

verses.sanskrit: या देवेषु तन्वमैरयन्त यासां सोमो विश्वा रूपाणिवेद ता अस्मभ्यं पयसा पिन्वमानाः परजावतीरिन्द्रगोष्ठे रिरीहि |||
verses.transliteration: yā deveṣu tanvamairayanta yāsāṃ somo viśvā rūpāṇiveda tā asmabhyaṃ payasā pinvamānāḥ prajāvatīrindraghoṣṭhe rirīhi

translations.griffith: Those who have offered to the Gods their bodies, whose varied forms are all well known to Soma,—  Those grant us in our cattle-pen, O Indra, with their full streams of milk and plenteous offspring.

verses.sanskrit: परजापतिर्मह्यमेता रराणो विश्वैर्देवैः पित्र्भिःसंविदानः शिवाः सतीरुप नो गोष्ठमाकस्तासांवयं परजया सं सदेम |||
verses.transliteration: prajāpatirmahyametā rarāṇo viśvairdevaiḥ pitṛbhiḥsaṃvidānaḥ śivāḥ satīrupa no ghoṣṭhamākastāsāṃvayaṃ prajayā saṃ sadema

translations.griffith: Prajāpati, bestowing these upon me, one-minded with all Gods and with the Fathers,  Hath to our cow-pen brought auspicious cattle: so may we own the offspring they will bear us.

verses.sanskrit: विभ्राड बर्हत पिबतु सोम्यं मध्वायुर्दधद यज्ञपतावविह्रुतम वातजूतो यो अभिरक्षति तमना परजाः पुपोषपुरुधा वि राजति |||
verses.transliteration: vibhrāḍ bṛhat pibatu somyaṃ madhvāyurdadhad yajñapatāvavihrutam vātajūto yo abhirakṣati tmanā prajāḥ pupoṣapurudhā vi rājati

translations.griffith: MAY the Bright God drink glorious Soma-mingled meath, giving the sacrifice's lord uninjured life;  He who, wind-urged, in person guards our offspring well, hath nourished them with food and shines o’er many a land.

verses.sanskrit: विभ्राड बर्हत सुभ्र्तं वाजसातमं धर्मन दिवो धरुणेसत्यमर्पितम अमित्रहा वर्त्रहा दस्युहन्तमं जयोतिर्जज्ञेसुरहा सपत्नहा |||
verses.transliteration: vibhrāḍ bṛhat subhṛtaṃ vājasātamaṃ dharman divo dharuṇesatyamarpitam amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhantamaṃ jyotirjajñeasurahā sapatnahā

translations.griffith: Radiant, as high Truth, cherished, best at winning strength, Truth based upon the statute that supports the heavens,  He rose, a light, that kills Vṛtras and enemies, best slayer of the Dasyus, Asuras, and foes.

verses.sanskrit: इदं शरेष्ठं जयोतिषां जयोतिरुत्तमं विश्वजिद्धनजिदुच्यते बर्हत विश्वभ्राड भराजो महि सूर्यो दर्शौरु पप्रथे सह ओजो अच्युतम |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotiruttamaṃ viśvajiddhanajiducyate bṛhat viśvabhrāḍ bhrājo mahi sūryo dṛśauru paprathe saha ojo acyutam

translations.griffith: This light, the best of lights, supreme, all-conquering, winner of riches, is exalted with high laud.  All-lighting, radiant, mighty as the Sun to see, he spreadeth wide unfailing victory and strength.

verses.sanskrit: विभ्राजञ जयोतिषा सवरगछो रोचनं दिवः येनेमाविश्वा भुवनान्याभ्र्ता विश्वकर्मणा विश्वदेव्यावता |||
verses.transliteration: vibhrājañ jyotiṣā svaraghacho rocanaṃ divaḥ yenemāviśvā bhuvanānyābhṛtā viśvakarmaṇā viśvadevyāvatā

translations.griffith: Beaming forth splendour with thy light, thou hast attained heaven's lustrous realm.  By thee were brought together all existing things, possessor of all Godhead, All-effecting God.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तयमिटतो रथमिन्द्र परावः सुतावतः अश्र्णोः सोमिनो हवम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tyamiṭato rathamindra prāvaḥ sutāvataḥ aśṛṇoḥ somino havam

translations.griffith: FOR Iṭa's sake who pressed the juice, thou, Indra, didst protect his car,  And hear the Soma-giver's call.

verses.sanskrit: तवं मखस्य दोधतः शिरो.अव तवचो भरः अगछःसोमिनो गर्हम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ makhasya dodhataḥ śiro.ava tvaco bharaḥ aghachaḥsomino ghṛham

translations.griffith: Thou from his skin hast borne the head of the swift-moving combatant,  And sought the Soma-pourer's home.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तयमिन्द्र मर्त्यमास्त्रबुध्नाय वेन्यम मुहुःश्रथ्ना मनस्यवे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tyamindra martyamāstrabudhnāya venyam muhuḥśrathnā manasyave

translations.griffith: Venya, that mortal man, hast thou, for Āstrabudhna the devout,  O Indra, many a time set free.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तयमिन्द्र सूर्यं पश्चा सन्तं पुरस कर्धि देवानां चित तिरो वशम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tyamindra sūryaṃ paścā santaṃ puras kṛdhi devānāṃ cit tiro vaśam

translations.griffith: Bring, Indra, to the east again that Sun who now is in the west,  Even against the will of Gods.

verses.sanskrit: आ याहि वनसा सह गावः सचन्त वर्तनिं यदूधभिः ||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhi vanasā saha ghāvaḥ sacanta vartaniṃ yadūdhabhiḥ

translations.griffith: WITH all thy beauty come: the kine approaching with full udders follow on thy path.

verses.sanskrit: आ याहि वस्व्या धिया मंहिष्ठो जारयन्मखःसुदानुभिः ||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhi vasvyā dhiyā maṃhiṣṭho jārayanmakhaḥsudānubhiḥ

translations.griffith: Come with kind thoughts, most liberal, rousing the warrior's hymn of praise, with bounteous ones,

verses.sanskrit: पितुभ्र्तो न तन्तुमित सुदानवः परति दध्मो यजामसि ||
verses.transliteration: pitubhṛto na tantumit sudānavaḥ prati dadhmo yajāmasi

translations.griffith: As nourishers we tie the thread, and, liberal with our bounty, offer sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: उषा अप सवसुस्तमः सं वर्तयति वर्तनिं सुजातता ||
verses.transliteration: uṣā apa svasustamaḥ saṃ vartayati vartaniṃ sujātatā

translations.griffith: Dawn drives away her Sister's gloom, and, through her excellence, makes her retrace her path.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवाहार्षमन्तरेधि धरुवस्तिष्ठाविचाचलिः विशस्त्वा सर्वा वाञ्छन्तु मा तवद राष्ट्रमधि भरशत |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvāhārṣamantaredhi dhruvastiṣṭhāvicācaliḥ viśastvā sarvā vāñchantu mā tvad rāṣṭramadhi bhraśat

translations.griffith: BE with us; I have chosen thee: stand stedfast and immovable.  Let all the people wish for thee let not thy kingship fall away.

verses.sanskrit: इहैवैधि माप चयोष्ठाः पर्वत इवाविचाचलिः इन्द्रैवेह धरुवस्तिष्ठेह राष्ट्रमु धारय |||
verses.transliteration: ihaivaidhi māpa cyoṣṭhāḥ parvata ivāvicācaliḥ indraiveha dhruvastiṣṭheha rāṣṭramu dhāraya

translations.griffith: Be even here; fall not away be like a mountain unremoved.  Stand stedfast here like Indra's self, and hold the kingship in the grasp.

verses.sanskrit: इममिन्द्रो अदीधरद धरुवं धरुवेण हविषा तस्मै सोमोधि बरवत तस्मा उ बरह्मणस पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: imamindro adīdharad dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣā tasmai somoadhi bravat tasmā u brahmaṇas patiḥ

translations.griffith: This man hath Indra stablished, made secure by strong oblation's power.  May Soma speak a benison, and Brahmaṇaspati, on him.

verses.sanskrit: धरुवा दयौर्ध्रुवा पर्थिवी धरुवासः पर्वता इमे धरुवं विश्वमिदं जगद धरुवो राजा विशामयम |||
verses.transliteration: dhruvā dyaurdhruvā pṛthivī dhruvāsaḥ parvatā ime dhruvaṃ viśvamidaṃ jaghad dhruvo rājā viśāmayam

translations.griffith: Firm is the sky and firm the earth, and stedfast also are these hills.  Stedfast is all this living world, and stedfast is this King of men.

verses.sanskrit: धरुवं ते राजा वरुणो धरुवं देवो बर्हस्पतिः धरुवं त इन्द्रश्चाग्निश्च राष्ट्रं धारयतां धरुवम |||
verses.transliteration: dhruvaṃ te rājā varuṇo dhruvaṃ devo bṛhaspatiḥ dhruvaṃ ta indraścāghniśca rāṣṭraṃ dhārayatāṃ dhruvam

translations.griffith: Stedfast, may Varuṇa the King, stedfast, the God Bṛhaspati,  Stedfast, may Indra, stedfast too, may Agni keep thy stedfast reign.

verses.sanskrit: धरुवं धरुवेण हविषाभि सोमं मर्शामसि अथो तैन्द्रः केवलीर्विशो बलिह्र्तस करत |||
verses.transliteration: dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣābhi somaṃ mṛśāmasi atho taindraḥ kevalīrviśo balihṛtas karat

translations.griffith: On constant Soma let us think with constant sacrificial gift  And then may Indra make the clans bring tribute unto thee alone.

verses.sanskrit: अभीवर्तेन हविषा येनेन्द्रो अभिवाव्र्ते तेनास्मान्ब्रह्मणस पते.अभि राष्ट्राय वर्तय |||
verses.transliteration: abhīvartena haviṣā yenendro abhivāvṛte tenāsmānbrahmaṇas pate.abhi rāṣṭrāya vartaya

translations.griffith: WITH offering for success in fight whence Indra was victorious.  With this, O Brahmaṇaspati, let us attain to royal sway.

verses.sanskrit: अभिव्र्त्य सपत्नानभि या नो अरातयः अभि पर्तन्यन्तन्तिष्ठाभि यो न इरस्यति |||
verses.transliteration: abhivṛtya sapatnānabhi yā no arātayaḥ abhi pṛtanyantantiṣṭhābhi yo na irasyati

translations.griffith: Subduing those who rival us, subduing all malignities,  Withstand the man who menaces, withstand the man who angers us.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा देवः सविताभि सोमो अवीव्र्तत अभि तवा विश्वाभूतान्यभीवर्तो यथाससि |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā devaḥ savitābhi somo avīvṛtat abhi tvā viśvābhūtānyabhīvarto yathāsasi

translations.griffith: Soma and Savitar the God have made thee a victorious King  All elements have aided thee, to make thee general conqueror.

verses.sanskrit: येनेन्द्रो हविषा कर्त्व्यभवद दयुम्न्युत्तमः इदं तदक्रि देवा असपत्नः किलाभुवम |||
verses.transliteration: yenendro haviṣā kṛtvyabhavad dyumnyuttamaḥ idaṃ tadakri devā asapatnaḥ kilābhuvam

translations.griffith: Oblation, that which Indra. gave and thus grew glorious and most high,—  This have I offered, Gods! and hence now, verily, am rivalless.

verses.sanskrit: असपत्नः सपत्नहाभिराष्ट्रो विषासहिः यथाहमेषां भूतानां विराजानि जनस्य च |||
verses.transliteration: asapatnaḥ sapatnahābhirāṣṭro viṣāsahiḥ yathāhameṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ virājāni janasya ca

translations.griffith: Slayer of rivals, rivalless, victorious, with royal sway,  Over these beings may I rule, may I be Sovran of the folk.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो गरावाणः सविता देवः सुवतु धर्मणा धूर्षुयुज्यध्वं सुनुत |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo ghrāvāṇaḥ savitā devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā dhūrṣuyujyadhvaṃ sunuta

translations.griffith: MAY Savitar the God, O Stones, stir you according to the Law:  Be harnessed to the shafts, and press.

verses.sanskrit: गरावाणो अप दुछुनामप सेधत दुर्मतिम उस्राः कर्तनभेषजम |||
verses.transliteration: ghrāvāṇo apa duchunāmapa sedhata durmatim usrāḥ kartanabheṣajam

translations.griffith: Stones, drive calamity away, drive ye away malevolence:  Make ye the Cows our medicine.

verses.sanskrit: गरावाण उपरेष्वा महीयन्ते सजोषसः वर्ष्णेदधतो वर्ष्ण्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ghrāvāṇa upareṣvā mahīyante sajoṣasaḥ vṛṣṇedadhato vṛṣṇyam

translations.griffith: Of one accord the upper Stones, giving the Bull his bull-like strength,  Look down with pride on those below.

verses.sanskrit: गरावाणः सविता नु वो देवः सुवतु धर्मणा यजमानाय सुन्वते |||
verses.transliteration: ghrāvāṇaḥ savitā nu vo devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā yajamānāya sunvate

translations.griffith: May Savitar the God, O Stones, stir you as Law commands for him  Who sacrifices, pouring juice.

verses.sanskrit: पर सूनव रभूणां बर्हन नवन्त वर्जना कषामा येविश्वधायसो.अश्नन धेनुं न मातरम |||
verses.transliteration: pra sūnava ṛbhūṇāṃ bṛhan navanta vṛjanā kṣāmā yeviśvadhāyaso.aśnan dhenuṃ na mātaram

translations.griffith: WITH hymns of praise their sons have told aloud the Ṛbhus' mighty deeds.  Who, all-supporting, have enjoyed the earth as, twere a mother cow.

verses.sanskrit: पर देवं देव्या धिया भरता जातवेदसम हव्या नोवक्षदानुषक |||
verses.transliteration: pra devaṃ devyā dhiyā bharatā jātavedasam havyā novakṣadānuṣak

translations.griffith: Bring forth the God with song divine, being Jātavedas hitherward,  To bear our gifts at once to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अयमु षय पर देवयुर्होता यज्ञाय नीयते रथो नयोरभीव्र्तो घर्णीवाञ्चेतति तमना |||
verses.transliteration: ayamu ṣya pra devayurhotā yajñāya nīyate ratho nayorabhīvṛto ghṛṇīvāñcetati tmanā

translations.griffith: He here, a God-devoted Priest, led forward comes to sacrifice.  Like a car covered for the road, he, glowing, knows, himself, the way.

verses.sanskrit: अयमग्निरुरुष्यत्यम्र्तादिव जन्मनः सहसश्चिद्सहीयान देवो जीवातवे कर्तः |||
verses.transliteration: ayamaghniruruṣyatyamṛtādiva janmanaḥ sahasaścidsahīyān devo jīvātave kṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: This Agni rescues from distress, as ’twere from the Immortal Race,  A God yet mightier than strength, a God who hath been made for life.

verses.sanskrit: पतंगमक्तमसुरस्य मायया हर्दा पश्यन्ति मनसाविपश्चितः समुद्रे अन्तः कवयो वि चक्षते मरीचीनाम्पदमिछन्ति वेधसः |||
verses.transliteration: pataṃghamaktamasurasya māyayā hṛdā paśyanti manasāvipaścitaḥ samudre antaḥ kavayo vi cakṣate marīcīnāmpadamichanti vedhasaḥ

translations.griffith: THE sapient with their spirit and their mind behold the Bird adorned with all an Asura's magic might.  Sages observe him in the ocean's inmost depth: the wise disposers seek the station of his rays.

verses.sanskrit: पतंगो वाचं मनसा बिभर्ति तां गन्धर्वो.अवदद गर्भेन्तः तां दयोतमानां सवर्यं मनीषां रतस्य पदेकवयो नि पान्ति |||
verses.transliteration: pataṃgho vācaṃ manasā bibharti tāṃ ghandharvo.avadad gharbheantaḥ tāṃ dyotamānāṃ svaryaṃ manīṣāṃ ṛtasya padekavayo ni pānti

translations.griffith: The flying Bird bears Speech within his spirit: erst the Gandharva in the womb pronounced it:  And at the seat of sacrifice the sages cherish this radiant, heavenly-bright invention.

verses.sanskrit: अपश्यं गोपामनिपद्यमानमा च परा च पथिभिश्चरन्तम स सध्रीचीः स विषूचीर्वसान आ वरीवर्तिभुवनेष्वन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: apaśyaṃ ghopāmanipadyamānamā ca parā ca pathibhiścarantam sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīrvasāna ā varīvartibhuvaneṣvantaḥ

translations.griffith: I saw the Herdsman, him who never resteth, approaching and departing on his pathways.  He, clothed in gathered and diffusive splendour, within the worlds continually travels.

verses.sanskrit: तयमू षु वाजिनं देवजूतं सहावानं तरुतारंरथानाम अरिष्टनेमिं पर्तनाजमाशुं सवस्तयेतार्क्ष्यमिहा हुवेम |||
verses.transliteration: tyamū ṣu vājinaṃ devajūtaṃ sahāvānaṃ tarutāraṃrathānām ariṣṭanemiṃ pṛtanājamāśuṃ svastayetārkṣyamihā huvema

translations.griffith: THIS very mighty one whom Gods commission, the Conqueror of cars, ever triumphant,  Swift, fleet to battle, with uninjured fellies, even Tārkṣya for our weal will we call hither.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्येव रातिमाजोहुवानाः सवस्तये नावमिवा रुहेम उर्वी न पर्थ्वी बहुले गभीरे मा वामेतौ मा परेतौरिषाम |||
verses.transliteration: indrasyeva rātimājohuvānāḥ svastaye nāvamivā ruhema urvī na pṛthvī bahule ghabhīre mā vāmetau mā paretauriṣāma

translations.griffith: As though we offered up our gifts to Indra, may we ascend. him as a ship. for safety.  Like the two wide worlds, broad, deep far-extended, may we be safe both when he comes and leaves you.

verses.sanskrit: सद्यश्चिद यः शवसा पञ्च कर्ष्टीः सूर्य इवज्योतिषापस्ततान सहस्रसाः शतसा अस्य रंहिर्नस्मा वरन्ते युवतिं न शर्याम |||
verses.transliteration: sadyaścid yaḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūrya ivajyotiṣāpastatāna sahasrasāḥ śatasā asya raṃhirnasmā varante yuvatiṃ na śaryām

translations.griffith: He who with might the Five Lands hath pervaded, like Sūrya with his lustre, and the waters—  His strength wins hundreds, thousands none avert it, as the young maid repelleth not her lover.

verses.sanskrit: उत तिष्ठताव पश्यतेन्द्रस्य भागं रत्वियम यदि शरातोजुहोतन यद्यश्रातो ममत्तन |||
verses.transliteration: ut tiṣṭhatāva paśyatendrasya bhāghaṃ ṛtviyam yadi śrātojuhotana yadyaśrāto mamattana

translations.griffith: Now lift ye up yourselves and look on Indra's seasonable share.  If it be ready, offer it; unready, ye have been remise.

verses.sanskrit: शरातं हविरो षविन्द्र पर याहि जगाम सूरो अध्वनोविमध्यम परि तवासते निधिभिः सखायः कुलपा नव्राजपतिं चरन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: śrātaṃ haviro ṣvindra pra yāhi jaghāma sūro adhvanovimadhyam pari tvāsate nidhibhiḥ sakhāyaḥ kulapā navrājapatiṃ carantam

translations.griffith: Oblation is prepared: come to us, Indra; the Sun hath travelled over half his journey.  Friends with their stores are sitting round thee waiting like lords of clans for the tribe's wandering chieftain.

verses.sanskrit: शरातं मन्य ऊधनि शरातमग्नौ सुश्रातं मन्ये तद्र्तं नवीयः माध्यन्दिनस्य सवनस्य दध्नः पिबेन्द्रवज्रिन पुरुक्र्ज्जुषाणः |||
verses.transliteration: śrātaṃ manya ūdhani śrātamaghnau suśrātaṃ manye tadṛtaṃ navīyaḥ mādhyandinasya savanasya dadhnaḥ pibendravajrin purukṛjjuṣāṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Dressed in the udder and on fire, I fancy; well-dressed, I fancy, is this recent present.  Drink, Indra, of the curd of noon's libation with favour, Thunderer, thou whose deeds are mighty.

verses.sanskrit: पर ससाहिषे पुरुहूत शत्रूञ जयेष्ठस्ते शुष्म इहरातिरस्तु इन्द्रा भर दक्षिणेना वसूनि पतिःसिन्धूनामसि रेवतीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: pra sasāhiṣe puruhūta śatrūñ jyeṣṭhaste śuṣma iharātirastu indrā bhara dakṣiṇenā vasūni patiḥsindhūnāmasi revatīnām

translations.griffith: O MUCH-INVOKED, thou hast subdued thy foemen: thy might is loftiest; here display thy bounty.  In thy right hand, O Indra, bring us treasures: thou art the Lord of rivers filled with riches.

verses.sanskrit: मर्गो न भीमः कुचरो गिरिष्ठाः परावत आ जगन्थापरस्याः सर्कं संशाय पविमिन्द्र तिग्मं वि शत्रून्ताळि वि मर्धो नुदस्व |||
verses.transliteration: mṛgho na bhīmaḥ kucaro ghiriṣṭhāḥ parāvata ā jaghanthāparasyāḥ sṛkaṃ saṃśāya pavimindra tighmaṃ vi śatrūntāḷi vi mṛdho nudasva

translations.griffith: Like a dread wild beast roaming on the mountain thou hast approached us from the farthest distance.  Whetting thy bold and thy sharp blade, O Indra, crush thou the foe and scatter those who hate us.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र कषत्रमभि वाममोजो.अजायथा वर्षभचर्षणीनाम अपानुदो जनममित्रयन्तमुरुं देवेभ्योक्र्णोरु लोकम |||
verses.transliteration: indra kṣatramabhi vāmamojo.ajāyathā vṛṣabhacarṣaṇīnām apānudo janamamitrayantamuruṃ devebhyoakṛṇoru lokam

translations.griffith: Thou, mighty Indra, sprangest into being as strength for lovely lordship o’er the people.  Thou drovest off the folk who were unfriendly, and to the Gods thou gavest room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit: परथश्च यस्य सप्रथश्च नमानुष्टुभस्य हविषोहविर्यत धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णो रथन्तरमा जभारा वसिष्ठः |||
verses.transliteration: prathaśca yasya saprathaśca namānuṣṭubhasya haviṣohaviryat dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇo rathantaramā jabhārā vasiṣṭhaḥ

translations.griffith: VASIṢṬHA mastered the Rathantara, took it from radiant Dhātar, Savitar, and Viṣṇu,  Oblation, portion of fourfold oblation, known by the names of Saprathas and Prathas.

verses.sanskrit: अविन्दन ते अतिहितं यदासीद यज्ञस्य धाम परमंगुहा यत धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णोर्भरद्वाजो बर्हदा चक्रे अग्नेः |||
verses.transliteration: avindan te atihitaṃ yadāsīd yajñasya dhāma paramaṃghuhā yat dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇorbharadvājo bṛhadā cakre aghneḥ

translations.griffith: These sages found what lay remote and hidden, the sacrifice's loftiest secret essence.  From radiant Dhātar, Savitar, and Viṣṇu, from Agni, Bharadvāja brought the Brhat.

verses.sanskrit: ते.अविन्दन मनसा दीध्याना यजु षकन्नं परथमन्देवयानम धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णोरासूर्यादभरन घर्ममेते |||
verses.transliteration: te.avindan manasā dīdhyānā yaju ṣkannaṃ prathamandevayānam dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇorāsūryādabharan gharmamete

translations.griffith: They found with mental eyes the earliest Yajus, a pathway to the Gods, that had descended.  From radiant Dhātar, Savitar, and Viṣṇu, from Sūrya did these sages bring the Gharma.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पतिर्नयतु दुर्गहा तिरः पुनर्नेषदघशंसायमन्म कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद्यजमानाय शं योः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspatirnayatu durghahā tiraḥ punarneṣadaghaśaṃsāyamanma kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karadyajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ

translations.griffith: BṚHASPATI lead us safely over troubles and turn his evil thought against the sinner;  Repel the curse, and drive away ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort!

verses.sanskrit: नराशंसो नो.अवतु परयाजे शं नो अस्त्वनुयाजो हवेषु कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद यजमानायशं योः |||
verses.transliteration: narāśaṃso no.avatu prayāje śaṃ no astvanuyājo haveṣu kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karad yajamānāyaśaṃ yoḥ

translations.griffith: May Narāśaṁsa aid us at Prayāja: blest be our Anuyāja at invokings.  May he repel the curse, and chase ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.

verses.sanskrit: तपुर्मूर्धा तपतु रक्षसो ये बरह्मद्विषः शरवेहन्तवा उ कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद्यजमानाय शं योः |||
verses.transliteration: tapurmūrdhā tapatu rakṣaso ye brahmadviṣaḥ śaravehantavā u kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karadyajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ

translations.griffith: May he whose head is flaming burn the demons, haters of prayer, so that the arrow slay them.  May he repel the curse and chase ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.

verses.sanskrit: अपश्यं तवा मनसा चेकितानं तपसो जातं तपसोविभूतम इह परजामिह रयिं रराणः पर जायस्वप्रजया पुत्रकाम |||
verses.transliteration: apaśyaṃ tvā manasā cekitānaṃ tapaso jātaṃ tapasovibhūtam iha prajāmiha rayiṃ rarāṇaḥ pra jāyasvaprajayā putrakāma

translations.griffith: I SAW thee meditating in thy spirit what sprang from Fervour and hath thence developed.  Bestowing offspring here, bestowing riches, spread in thine offspring, thou who cravest children.

verses.sanskrit: अपश्यं तवा मनसा दीध्यानां सवायां तनू रत्व्येनाधमानाम उप मामुच्चा युवतिर्बभूयाः पर जायस्वप्रजया पुत्रकामे |||
verses.transliteration: apaśyaṃ tvā manasā dīdhyānāṃ svāyāṃ tanū ṛtvyenādhamānām upa māmuccā yuvatirbabhūyāḥ pra jāyasvaprajayā putrakāme

translations.griffith: I saw thee pondering in thine heart, and praying that in due time thy body might be fruitful.  Come as a youthful woman, rise to meet me: spread in thine offspring, thou who cravest children.

verses.sanskrit: अहं गर्भमदधामोषधीष्वहं विश्वेषु भुवनेष्वन्तः अहं परजा अजनयं पर्थिव्यामहं जनिभ्यो अपरीषुपुत्रान ||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ gharbhamadadhāmoṣadhīṣvahaṃ viśveṣu bhuvaneṣvantaḥ ahaṃ prajā ajanayaṃ pṛthivyāmahaṃ janibhyo aparīṣuputrān

translations.griffith: In plants and herbs, in all existent beings I have deposited the germ of increase.  All progeny on earth have I engendered, and sons in women who will be hereafter.

verses.sanskrit: विष्णुर्योनिं कल्पयतु तवष्टा रूपाणि पिंशतु आसिञ्चतु परजापतिर्धाता गर्भं दधातु ते |||
verses.transliteration: viṣṇuryoniṃ kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu āsiñcatu prajāpatirdhātā gharbhaṃ dadhātu te

translations.griffith: MAY Viṣṇu form and mould the womb, may Tvaṣṭar duly shape the forms,  Prajāpati infuse the stream, and Dhātar lay the germ for thee.

verses.sanskrit: गर्भं धेहि सिनीवालि गर्भं धेहि सरस्वति गर्भं तेश्विनौ देवावा धत्तां पुष्करस्रजा |||
verses.transliteration: gharbhaṃ dhehi sinīvāli gharbhaṃ dhehi sarasvati gharbhaṃ teaśvinau devāvā dhattāṃ puṣkarasrajā

translations.griffith: O Sinīvālī, set the germ, set thou the germ, Sarasvatī:  May the Twain Gods bestow the germ, the Aśvins crowned with lotuses.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्ययी अरणी यं निर्मन्थतो अश्विना तं तेगर्भं हवामहे दशमे मासि सूतवे |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyayī araṇī yaṃ nirmanthato aśvinā taṃ tegharbhaṃ havāmahe daśame māsi sūtave

translations.griffith: That which the Aśvins Twain rub forth with the attrition-sticks of gold,—  That germ of thine we invocate, that in the tenth month thou mayst bear.

verses.sanskrit: महि तरीणामवो.अस्तु दयुक्षं मित्रस्यार्यम्णः दुराधर्षं वरुणस्य |||
verses.transliteration: mahi trīṇāmavo.astu dyukṣaṃ mitrasyāryamṇaḥ durādharṣaṃ varuṇasya

translations.griffith: GREAT, unassailable must he the heavenly favour of Three Gods,  Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman.

verses.sanskrit: नहि तेषाममा चन नाध्वसु वारणेषु ईशे रिपुरघशंसः |||
verses.transliteration: nahi teṣāmamā cana nādhvasu vāraṇeṣu īśe ripuraghaśaṃsaḥ

translations.griffith: O'er these, neither at home nor yet abroad or pathways that are Strange,  The evil-minded foe hath power

verses.sanskrit: यस्मै पुत्रासो अदितेः पर जीवसे मर्त्याय जयोतिर्यछन्त्यजस्रम |||
verses.transliteration: yasmai putrāso aditeḥ pra jīvase martyāya jyotiryachantyajasram

translations.griffith: Nor over him,. the man on whom the Sons of Aditi bestow Eternal light that he may live.

verses.sanskrit: वात आ वातु भेषजं शम्भु मयोभु नो हर्दे पर णायूंषि तारिषत |||
verses.transliteration: vāta ā vātu bheṣajaṃ śambhu mayobhu no hṛde pra ṇaāyūṃṣi tāriṣat

translations.griffith: FILLING our hearts with health and joy, may Vāta breathe his balm on us  May he prolong our days of life.

verses.sanskrit: उत वात पितासि न उत भरातोत नः सखा स नोजीवातवे कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: uta vāta pitāsi na uta bhrātota naḥ sakhā sa nojīvātave kṛdhi

translations.griffith: Thou art our Father, Vāta, yea, thou art a Brother and a friend,  So give us strength that we may live.

verses.sanskrit: यददो वात ते गर्हे.अम्र्तस्य निधिर्हितः ततो नो देहिजीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: yadado vāta te ghṛhe.amṛtasya nidhirhitaḥ tato no dehijīvase

translations.griffith: The store of Amṛta laid away yonder, O Vāta, in thine home,—  Give us thereof that we may live.

verses.sanskrit: पराग्नये वाचमीरय वर्षभाय कषितीनाम स नःपर्षदति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: prāghnaye vācamīraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: To Agni send I forth my song, to him the Bull of all the folk:  So may he bear us past our foes.

verses.sanskrit: यः परस्याः परावतस्तिरो धन्वातिरोचते स नःपर्षदति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvatastiro dhanvātirocate sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Who from the distance far away shines brilliantly across the wastes:  So may he bear us past our foes.

verses.sanskrit: यो रक्षांसि निजूर्वति वर्षा शुक्रेण शोचिषा स नःपर्षदति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: yo rakṣāṃsi nijūrvati vṛṣā śukreṇa śociṣā sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: The Bull with brightly-gleaming flame who utterly consumes the fiends  So may he bear us past our foes.

verses.sanskrit: यो विश्वाभि विपश्यति भुवना सं च पश्यति स नःपर्षदति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: yo viśvābhi vipaśyati bhuvanā saṃ ca paśyati sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Who looks on all existing things and comprehends them with his view:  So may he bear us past our foes.

verses.sanskrit: यो अस्य पारे रजसः शुक्रो अग्निरजायत स नः पर्षदति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: yo asya pāre rajasaḥ śukro aghnirajāyata sa naḥ parṣadati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Resplendent Agni, who was born in farthest region of the air:  So may he bear us past our foes.

verses.sanskrit: पर नूनं जातवेदसमश्वं हिनोत वाजिनम इदं नोबर्हिरासदे |||
verses.transliteration: pra nūnaṃ jātavedasamaśvaṃ hinota vājinam idaṃ nobarhirāsade

translations.griffith: Now send ye Jātavedas forth, send hitherward the vigorous Steed  To seat him on our sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य पर जातवेदसो विप्रवीरस्य मीळुषः महीमियर्मिसुष्टुतिम |||
verses.transliteration: asya pra jātavedaso vipravīrasya mīḷuṣaḥ mahīmiyarmisuṣṭutim

translations.griffith: I raise the lofty eulogy of Jātavedas, raining boons,  With sages for his hero band.

verses.sanskrit: या रुचो जातवेदसो देवत्रा हव्यवाहनीः ताभिर्नोयज्ञमिन्वतु |||
verses.transliteration: yā ruco jātavedaso devatrā havyavāhanīḥ tābhirnoyajñaminvatu

translations.griffith: With flames of Jātavedas which carry oblation to the Gods,  May he promote our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: आयं गौः पर्श्निरक्रमीदसदन मातरं पुरः पितरं च परयन सवः |||
verses.transliteration: āyaṃ ghauḥ pṛśnirakramīdasadan mātaraṃ puraḥ pitaraṃ ca prayan svaḥ

translations.griffith: THIS spotted Bull hath come, and sat before the Mother in the east,  Advancing to his Father heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तश्चरति रोचनास्य पराणादपानती वयख्यन्महिषो दिवम |||
verses.transliteration: antaścarati rocanāsya prāṇādapānatī vyakhyanmahiṣo divam

translations.griffith: Expiring when he draws his breath, she moves along the lucid spheres:  The Bull shines out through all the sky.

verses.sanskrit: तरिंशद धाम वि राजति वाक पतंगाय धीयते परतिवस्तोरह दयुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: triṃśad dhāma vi rājati vāk pataṃghāya dhīyate prativastoraha dyubhiḥ

translations.griffith: Song is bestowed upon the Bird: it rules supreme through thirty realms  Throughout the days at break of morn.

verses.sanskrit: रतं च सत्यं चाभीद्धात तपसो.अध्यजायत ततोरात्र्यजायत ततः समुद्रो अर्णवः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtaṃ ca satyaṃ cābhīddhāt tapaso.adhyajāyata tatorātryajāyata tataḥ samudro arṇavaḥ

translations.griffith: FROM Fervour kindled to its height Eternal Law and Truth were born:  Thence was the Night produced, and thence the billowy flood of sea arose.

verses.sanskrit: समुद्रादर्णवादधि संवत्सरो अजायत अहोरात्राणिविदधद विश्वस्य मिषतो वशी |||
verses.transliteration: samudrādarṇavādadhi saṃvatsaro ajāyata ahorātrāṇividadhad viśvasya miṣato vaśī

translations.griffith: From that same billowy flood of sea the Year was afterwards produced,  Ordainer of the days nights, Lord over all who close the eye.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ धाता यथापूर्वमकल्पयत दिवं चप्र्थिवीं चान्तरिक्षमथो सवः |||
verses.transliteration: sūryācandramasau dhātā yathāpūrvamakalpayat divaṃ capṛthivīṃ cāntarikṣamatho svaḥ

translations.griffith: Dhātar, the great Creator, then formed in due order Sun and Moon.  He formed in order Heaven and Earth, the regions of the air, and light.

verses.sanskrit: सं-समिद युवसे वर्षन्नग्ने विश्वान्यर्य आ इळस पदेसमिध्यसे स नो वसून्या भर |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ-samid yuvase vṛṣannaghne viśvānyarya ā iḷas padesamidhyase sa no vasūnyā bhara

translations.griffith: THOU, mighty Agni, gatherest up all that is precious for thy friend.  Bring us all treasures as thou art enkindled in libation's place

verses.sanskrit: सं गछध्वं सं वदध्वं सं वो मनांसि जानताम देवा भागं यथा पूर्वे संजानाना उपासते |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ ghachadhvaṃ saṃ vadadhvaṃ saṃ vo manāṃsi jānatām devā bhāghaṃ yathā pūrve saṃjānānā upāsate

translations.griffith: Assemble, speak together: let your minds be all of one accord,  As ancient Gods unanimous sit down to their appointed share.

verses.sanskrit: समानो मन्त्रः समितिः समानी समानं मनः सह चित्तमेषाम समानं मन्त्रमभि मण्त्रये वः समानेन वोहविषा जुहोमि |||
verses.transliteration: samāno mantraḥ samitiḥ samānī samānaṃ manaḥ saha cittameṣām samānaṃ mantramabhi maṇtraye vaḥ samānena vohaviṣā juhomi

translations.griffith: The place is common, common the assembly, common the mind, so be their thought united.  A common purpose do I lay before you, and worship with your general oblation.

verses.sanskrit: समानी व आकूतिः समाना हर्दयानि वः समानमस्तु वोमनो यथा वः सुसहासति |||
verses.transliteration: samānī va ākūtiḥ samānā hṛdayāni vaḥ samānamastu vomano yathā vaḥ susahāsati

translations.griffith: One and the same be your resolve, and be your minds of one accord.  United be the thoughts of all that all may happily agree.
